Commentary: Nehra to Mandeep, FOUR, first boundary for Mandeep and RCB. Full and on the pads, needed to be put away and Mandeep did just that, picked it up and dispatched it over mid-wicket, couple of bounces and into the fence

Nehra to Mandeep, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries to end the first over. Again, Nehra is a tad short in his length, Mandeep had the width to cut and he didn't try to hit it hard, just placed it behind point and Bhuvi at third man gave up the chase pretty quickly

Henriques to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, hit straight back at Henriques and he was late to get his hand up. Once more the off-cutter which almost fooled Jadhav, who shimmied down and checked his drive, middled it alright to beat the mid-off fielder
Nehra to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, another full toss, it's Jadhav this time and he picks his spot into the deep mid-wicket fence. Not great bowling from Nehra. He's missing the yorker by quite a bit

Nehra to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, four more. Jadhav starting to really find his timing now and he's looking dangerous. This is smart batting rather than just throwing his bat at everything. He knows that fine leg is up and so he waits for the back of a length delivery to come to him before pulling it over the fielder. Nehra under pressure
Rashid Khan to Head, FOUR, goes down and smashes the full toss over the deep mid-wicket ropes. Some nerves maybe from the Afghanistan leggie and Head pounced all over them with a mighty slog-sweep
Cutting to Watson, FOUR, plants his foot down and absolutely drills the ball wide of a diving extra-cover. Overpitched from Cutting, Watson blasts him away
Nehra to Gayle, FOUR, Nehra goes back to the shorter length, Gayle seems a tad comfortable with that, hops on one leg and uses Nehra's pace to guide it past the diving short fine leg fielder

Nehra to Mandeep, FOUR, might have been the slower one and Mandeep picked the bones out of that one. He cleared his front leg to give him more options and then slots the loft over mid-on, one bounce and over the rope

Bhuvneshwar to Mandeep, FOUR, Mandeep is playing the perfect foil to Gayle. Warner already worried. Full on middle and leg, whipped through mid-wicket and mid-on. Hit uppishly but placed it expertly in the gap

Cutting to Gayle, FOUR, not convincing, but Gayle will take that. A very good over from Cutting. Just misses the length this ball, goes full and that allows Gayle to get underneath and hoick it over mid-wicket. Not off the middle but enough to clear the fielder

Rashid Khan to Mandeep, FOUR, Rashid throws it up once more and this time Mandeep threads the crowded off-side field. Overpitched and Mandeep went full-throttle on the drive, raced to the sweeper fence

Rashid Khan to Head, FOUR, lots of flighted and lands as a half volley, Head gets a good stride forward and drives it past Henriques at extra cover, the timing was superb as long-off had no chance of cutting that off

Rashid Khan to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, ordinary delivery from Rashid and Jadhav is all over it. The young man is shaking his head while taking his cap from the umpire. Half tracker which sat up nicely for Jadhav, who pulls it between deep mid-wicket and long-on

Henriques to Head, FOUR, Head does the most of the full length delivery, stays deep in the crease and opens himself up to free his arms, smashes it straight down the ground and even a quick Warner could not reach that from long-on

Tymal Mills to Warner, FOUR, lovely shot, sublime timing on that one from Warner, it wasn't anything more than a back-foot punch. This was a back of a length delivery outside off, he got on top of the bounce and placed it in the gap past point
Aniket Choudhary to Warner, FOUR, smashed, width on offer from Choudhary, Warner gets forward and thumps it over mid-off, couple of bounces and over the ropes

Binny to Dhawan, FOUR, oh boy. He's toying around with the bowling out here. Binny looks to go wide outside off with the shortened length as well. But Dhawan in all his confidence walks across, crouches and half-pulls, half-sweeps it past the reach of the man at 45-degrees behind square

Aravind to Yuvraj, FOUR, here's the pick up. Vintage Yuvraj. Helped by an allying half volley on the pads at gentle pace and all he does with it is lovingly lofts his flick. All the timing and a bounce into the mid-wicket fence

Aniket Choudhary to Yuvraj, FOUR, streaky. But the runs keeps leaking. Does it really matter how. Wide, half way down the track and Yuvraj anticipates the ball to fizz up in flat batting it across. There's barely any climb, and all he gets is the inside edge to impart the direction in guiding it just past the sticks

Aniket Choudhary to Yuvraj, FOUR, and it keeps getting better. Rocks back, stands tall, waits for the short drag down to sit up and swats in his swivel. All the crunch in the timing to reintroduce it back into the fence

Watson to Yuvraj, FOUR, back to the usual. Is this a surprise anymore. This time the skipper decides to test him with a short one, one that neither has the pace nor the bounce. And obliged with a swat. As flat as you'd want

Aravind to Henriques, FOUR, on the charge. And the slap. The combo bags yet another fence hunter. Walks down, intercepts the length and gets on top of the bounce of this back of a length delivery in flaying it in front of square

Tymal Mills to Yuvraj, FOUR, head on. The battle continues. With Mills keen on cramping him up with the short pepper gets it barely up to the ribs. Just when he spots the bat going flat and the face pointing upwards in hooking it away. Behind square it flies

Aniket Choudhary to Yuvraj, FOUR, a salute in celebration. Takes the bat to his head in holding it up to his team mates inside. Covers all his sticks with a shuffle and after getting bored of the wides throws the kitchen sink at it and slaps it over point. #HisFastestIPLFifty

Tymal Mills to Yuvraj, FOUR, full, down leg. Nothing right with that. Certainly not if fine leg is inside. Certainly not if that man is Chris Gayle. All Yuvraj has to do is get the bat down in giving it some tickle. And places it wide and into the ropes

Aniket Choudhary to Henriques, FOUR, eventful first over from Choudhary, a wicket and 16 runs. Another freebie to end his over, short and wide outside off, Henriques was all over it as he cracked it square past point, beats the inner ring and rolls away to the fence
Aravind to Henriques, FOUR, too short from Aravind, can't bowl those at his pace. Henriques swivels across, rolls his wrists and pulls it behind square on the on-side for a boundary
Watson to Dhawan, FOUR, gentle loosener from Watson, short and on Dhawan's hips, he swivels across, uses the pace on the ball and helps it behind square on the on-side for a boundary

Watson to Dhawan, FOUR, lovely shot, Dhawan is getting into his groove now. Comes down the track, doesn't get close to the ball, that allows him to free his arms and drill it back past the umpire, no need to run for those

Watson to Dhawan, FOUR, juicy full-toss and Dhawan has put it away, turning out to be an expensive start from Watson. Dhawan leans into the shot and finds the gap wide of mid-off, no need to run for those

Watson to Dhawan, FOUR, make that four fours of the over, banged in short and on the stumps, Dhawan swivels across, rolls his wrists and pulls it behind square on the on-side. Watson was expensive in the final of IPL 2016, he has started badly here once again
Dinda to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, thank you Dinda says Parthiv Patel as he clips a leg-side dross fine to claim his first boundary
Chahar to Buttler, FOUR, length ball outside off and Buttler is away. Swats it across the line and gets it wide of mid-on
Chahar to Buttler, FOUR, shuffles across and flicks a ball from middle stump, easily done. With fine leg inside the ring that was always asking for trouble, Buttler obliged
Zampa to Nitish Rana, FOUR, Zampa not getting the googly right. Again down leg and this time Rana gets a bit of bat/glove on that. The ball races away fine beating the short fine fielder

Tahir to Pollard, FOUR, Pollard welcomes him with a thumping drive. Bit of air and Pollard plants his front foot forward, smashed it straight back over the bowler's head. Didn't bother to run, he knew he had middled it

Zampa to Pollard, FOUR, Pollard goes downtown once more and gets the desired result. Zampa goes fuller with the tossed up delivery and Pollard drills it straight back at Zampa, who is slow to get down and stop it

Dinda to Pollard, FOUR, unlucky and Dinda have been synonyms today. Full and outside off, Pollard throws everything he's got at that and the outside edge flies away fine and Dinda just stands there in his teapot position

Dinda to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, four more. Already 22 off the over. A game-changing over this. Fifty up for Dinda. Full and wide outside off, Pandya throws the kitchen sink at that and the outside edge flies wide of Dhoni
Dinda to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, sat up on a perfect length to be smashed, Parthiv Patel rocks back and nails the pull over mid-wicket. Take four!
Dinda to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, this pitch is a belter, 180 is a must. Half-volley outside off, Parthiv Patel stands tall and slams it straight of mid-off who dives in vain
Tahir to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, floated full on leg-stump, Parthiv Patel sits up and brooms it away with sheer disdain, rocketed away behind square

Chahar to Buttler, FOUR, gives himself a lot of room as he skates down the pitch, pierces the gap between extra cover and mid-off to perfection. Fast hands, full flow of the willow. Jos-outrageously-talented-Buttler

Southee to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, edged and four, streaky but Mayank will take those. There wasn't a first slip, Buttler dived to his left from second, but can't get to the ball. On a good length and holding its line outside off, Agarwal just hung his bat at that, the edge bisected the keeper and second slip to perfection

Hardik Pandya to Rahane, FOUR, he's peirced the gap to perfection, just a tiny gap between the fielder at point and cover-point and Rahane found it. Played with an open face, allowed the ball to come onto him and gets it in the gap past point

Hardik Pandya to Rahane, FOUR, edged and four, on a good length and in that channel outside off, drew Rahane into the drive, he went with hard hands and gets a thick edge past the lone slip, rolls away to the fence in a hurry

Hardik Pandya to Rahane, FOUR, lovely shot, on a good length and well outside off, Rahane gets a big stride forward and lifts it over the head of the man at mid-off, couple of bounces and over the ropes

Bumrah to Stokes, FOUR, heaves the pull away over mid-wicket. He was quickly in position for that. Short of length from Bumrah and the ball just sits up. Stokes drags it from outside off with a lot of muscle
McClenaghan to Smith, FOUR, plants his back foot at least a couple of feet outside off, rocks back, and mows the pull through square leg. The footwork had Smith written all over it
McClenaghan to Smith, FOUR, that will run away. McClenaghan strays in line and bowls it on leg-stump. Smith simply had to glance it away past the fielder at short fine leg. Neat wrists
Pollard to Smith, FOUR, oh poor ball. A short of length delivery which sits up around the waist and Smith drags it away past short fine leg. Big decision to get Pollard in here

Southee to Stokes, FOUR, he's absolutely crashed this through extra-cover. A full, wide ball with mid-off up. Not sure what the thinking is. Whatever it is, the execution of it is way off target. Misses the yorker by a long way and Stokes pummels the drive

Hardik Pandya to Stokes, FOUR, rare error in the field from Pollard. It would actually be harsh in calling that an error for most fielders, but this is Pollard we're talking about. A mistimed slog from Stokes. However, he still places it to the left of long-on where Pollard sprints and dives across trying to flick the ball in, but fails to get a hand
Bumrah to Smith, FOUR, how good is he! Susses out the plan from Bumrah based on the line he's been bowling in this over so far, waits on the ball and just slices it past short third man

McClenaghan to Smith, FOUR, that's been dragged all the way to the wide long-on fence. Pure despair for McClenaghan. He's bowled this so wide of off and to see the ball being swatted into the on-side is downright demoralizing
Bumrah to Dhoni, FOUR, there we go. Dhoni isn't to be denied for too long. A bit shorter than the previous couple of deliveries, and Dhoni pulls it away to the fine leg boundary. One bounce and over

Southee to Rahane, FOUR, cracking shot, on a good length and just outside off, Rahane leans forward on the drive, seemed to have checked his shot at the lst moment. It went in the air and past Southee, beat mid-off's sprawling dive to his right and rolls away to the fence

McClenaghan to Smith, FOUR, clubbed, made a great noise as the bat connected with the ball. Length delivery outside off, Smith shuffles across and heaves it over wide mid-wicket, one bounce and over the ropes

McClenaghan to Rahane, FOUR, lovely, this is exquisite cricket from Rahane, back of a length and well outside off, he waits on it, opens the face of the bat and steers it to the left of wide slip, beats the man getting across from the deep
Krunal Pandya to Smith, FOUR, cracking shot, short and wide from Krunal, Smith doesn't need a second invitation, hangs back and cuts it square on the off-side, beats the fielder in the deep with ease

Hardik Pandya to Rahane, FOUR, fifty for Rahane. This was banged in short by Hardik, Rahane took his eyes off the ball, still went through with the pull, almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes. Hardik looks amused, that ball didn't deserve a boundary

Boult to Roy, FOUR, cracking shot, Roy is off and running in his IPL career. On a good length and just outside off, he leans forward, presents the full face of the bat and drives it back past the non-striker, no need to run for those

Boult to Roy, FOUR, nicely played by Roy, width on offer from Boult. He leans into the shot, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and steers it behind square on the on-side, gets it past backward point and into the fence
Chawla to Roy, FOUR, lovely, the reverse sweep in full flow from Roy, gets down low and gets it into the gap behind square on the off-side. It was picked up from the middle-stump line as well

Boult to Raina, FOUR, a well-controlled pull shot from Raina. Boult did not get height on the short of length delivery, just above the waist and Raina got on top of that nicely, rolled his wrists and struck it behind square, beating deep square leg with ease

Narine to Karthik, FOUR, Pandey tried his best, but the ball still found a way to reach the fence. Width offered outside off, Karthik maintains a low base and drills it in front of square, Pandey runs across from sweeper cover, dives and flicks it in but the ball backspins and touches the rope

Narine to Karthik, FOUR, for the umpteenth time today Narine has landed it on a shortish length, sat up nicely for Karthik, who cut it away fiercely square of the wicket. Timed it superbly as it beat the sweeper cover comfortably

Boult to Raina, FOUR, it is all going Raina's way. He might walk on water today if he wants and get away with it. A well-directed yorker, Raina brings his bat down and squirts it off the inside edge to the fine leg fence. Not far away from the leg-pole

Boult to Karthik, FOUR, Boult misses the yorker and Karthik is in no mood to let him off, doesn't bother to get his front leg in line with the delivery, just goes through the line and smacks it straight down the ground

Woakes to Karthik, FOUR, Karthik is playing a blinder here. Woakes goes short and outside off, it was the off-speed delivery and Karthik spotted it early, carves it up and over backward point. No need to run for those

Woakes to Raina, FOUR, 16 runs off the over and not the best of outings for Woakes on IPL debut. He finishes with 3-0-35-0. Once more the slower delivery is on the shortish length, Raina waits and cuts it behind square, splitting backward point and short third man to perfection

Boult to Karthik, FOUR, off-pace delivery and once more Karthik read it early, he waited in his crease and stayed leg-side of the ball, lofts it handsomely over the extra cover fielder. All timing there from the Tamil Nadu man

Boult to Karthik, FOUR, Karthik does a ABD. The reverse sccop. Full delivery and close to the yorker length, Karthik switches his stances and sends it over the short third man fielder, almost went the distance

Narine to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, that's a shocker from Kuldeep and he concedes four runs. This was dropped short and wide of off, McCullum backed away and cut it straight to backward point. Kuldeep dived over the ball and ends up conceding a boundary

Boult to Raina, FOUR, Raina finishes off in style. Very full and outside off, Raina crouches low, opens the bat face and drives it square on the off-side, the field was up and that was played beautifully
Narine to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, cracking shot, poor ball from Narine, drops this one short and wide of off, McCullum makes room and cracks it over cover, couple of bounces and over the ropes
Narine to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, Narine has been too short today, drags his length down once again. McCullum rocks back and pulls him past the square leg umpire

Woakes to Raina, FOUR, nicely played! Fraction fuller and on the stumps, Raina leans forward, presents the full face of the bat and punches it back at the bowler. Woakes got a hand onto it, but it still beats mid-off to the fence

Woakes to Raina, FOUR, this is excellent cricket from Raina, made room as he came down the track. Woakes spotted it and followed him - Raina is good enough to tuck it past square leg, the man in the deep is very square and has no chance
Kuldeep Yadav to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, Kuldeep can't afford to drop short on this pitch. McCullum rocks back and pulls it through mid-wicket, bisects the two men in the deep to a nicety
Woakes to Raina, FOUR, that ruins the over for Woakes, leg-stump half-volley, all Raina had to do was get some bat on that. Once he did - fine-leg, who was inside the ring had no chance

P Kumar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, just goes through with a wild slog across the line, no timing whatsoever. All power. To Lynn's delight, it went in the gap behind the square leg umpire. First boundary for KKR
D Kulkarni to Gambhir, FOUR, stand and deliver! Half-volley in the slot, Gambhir won't miss out, watches the ball closely and dismisses it out of his sight

Gony to Gambhir, FOUR, both of them have just played themselves in such good form here. Full ball outside off, Gambhir clears his front leg and crashes it inside-out to send it to the wide long-off fence. Superb hand-eye co-ordination
Gony to Gambhir, FOUR, really ordinary bowling. It's a gentle short of length delivery on off-stump, the ball sits up for Gambhir who bludgeons it through mid-wicket

Gony to Gambhir, FOUR, awful from Gony. He bangs it in very short but the speedometer just shows 128kph. The ball was actually on its way down when Gambhir slashed it over backward point. GL being clobbered out there

Shadab Jakati to Gambhir, FOUR, down the track in a flash, right to the pitch of the ball, and driven so beautifully over the covers. The trick in the shot was that he delayed the charge and came out only when the ball was released

D Kulkarni to Chris Lynn, FOUR, short of length, probably an off-cutter, Lynn mows the ball in front of long-leg who comes running forward for the catch. But the ball drops well short and then bounces over him
Gony to Gambhir, FOUR, that's spanked! The open stance helps him figure the line and length quickly, uses all his might to smash it straight down the ground

Gony to Chris Lynn, FOUR, Chris Lynn and his golf hits I tellya. This isn't off the middle, but that bottom hand power and the baseball swing takes it the distance, just one bounce and over the long-on ropes
Shivil to Gambhir, FOUR, rank long hop, Gambhir says thank you. Short, down leg, Gambhir swivels and nails the pull behind square
Shivil to Chris Lynn, FOUR, too much width gestures Raina as soon as he saw the ball flying over backward point. Tad short and Lynn pounced on the width on offer, slices the cut and gets four
D Kulkarni to Gambhir, FOUR, 50-partnership. Clears his front leg and goes bam over mid-on. Right out of the screws

Shivil to Gambhir, FOUR, Shivil Koushik isn't learning. Keeps landing it short and gets smacked. Gambhir rocks onto his back foot and all he needed to do was get it over the fielder, did it with sheer ease
Shivil to Gambhir, byes, FOUR, keeps low and nutmegs DK, Gambhir didn't pick it, neither did the keeper, runs are runs
Shivil to Gambhir, FOUR, sits on one knee and chips the slog-sweep over mid-wicket, excellent batting this from GG
Shivil to Gambhir, FOUR, outside edge and four! Opens the bat face to steer, the edge flies to the right of Kulkarni who dives belatdely
Shivil to Gambhir, FOUR, make that 20 off the over. Gambhir has raced off to 40 in no-time. A real dart on the pads, Gambhir milks it off his pads. Easy peasy
Dwayne Smith to Chris Lynn, FOUR, stands tall in the crease and flat-bats a shortish delivery straight down the ground
Shivil to Chris Lynn, FOUR, Shivil Koushik's night keeps getting worse. Fires it short and wide, Lynn gets a feather of an edge on the attempted cut, the edge runs past DK's gloves

Dinda to Amla, FOUR, edged and four! Streaky way to get off the mark, but Amla won't mind. Seam-up delivery that shapes away a tad, Amla chases it with a slash and gets a fat outside edge. The ball flies between slip and short third man. First boundary of the innings
Christian to Vohra, FOUR, shot! Uses the width outside off and bounce and elevates it over backward point to collect his first boundary
R Bhatia to Maxwell, FOUR, backs away and then the sledge hammer does the rest. Just like a warrior, wields his weapon to axe the ball past the man at cover
Stokes to Maxwell, FOUR, PHHUUUUFFFFF! Such power. He bulldozes that one through the off-side and the man at cover had no chance as there was a lot of room on it
Stokes to Miller, FOUR, short ball and the swivelled pull. Picks up the length quickly and pivots on his back foot to send it speeding towards the backward square region for a four
Christian to Amla, FOUR, 13 off the over after bowling a brilliant first ball. Length ball down leg, Amla gets inside the line and flicks it well past the short fine leg fielder. Easy runs
Christian to Saha, FOUR, nicely done! Shortish delivery outside off, Saha hops, gets on top of the bounce and forces it wide of point. The ball races away into the fence
Stokes to Saha, FOUR, Saha has come out with a positive intent and that is paying dividends. Finds the gap beautifully on his cover drive. No need to run for shots like that
Stokes to Saha, FOUR, four more! Safest shot to play is hit it down the ground. Sees the length on a fuller side and lofts it down the ground, left of the bowler and right of mid-on. Safe shot

Tahir to Axar, FOUR, sloppy from Rajat Bhatia at short fine! He was put off by the appeal for lbw from the keeper and Tahir. It was the slider which was very full. Axar just about brings his bat down and gets a bit of wood on it. Bhatia over-runs to his left and allows the ball to go past him

Stoinis to Stokes, FOUR, imparts his powers of guiding the edge where he wants. Is happy to stay away from the line, giving his long levers some breathing space and just slashes at a slanter. An obvious outside edge and an even more obvious empty cordon for some free runs here

T Natarajan to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, pure timing. And grace. With a sink down on a knee, Tiwary decides to free his arms at a wide overpitched delivery outside off in the form of a slice. Such is the meat on this that he doesn't even bother keeping it down. Almost all the way

Axar to Stokes, FOUR, gets a long hop. A rank one. And all he has to do is decide where to deposit this one. Decides mid-wicket it is again to take the brunt. Ensures that he doesn't get up early and once again puts his spinning back foot to use in whisking it into the fence

Stoinis to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, they're turning it on. Tiwary joins the act now. Is mighty helped by a horror line always drifting down leg. Has to ensure that he gets some wood on it and he does it with aplomb. Gets enough to muscle it heave behind square and beat the lone man perched out there

Mohit Sharma to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, a real drag down. The Mohit slower back hander but half way down the ground. All the time for the adjustment and Tiwary does it in executing his crouched pull. Axar did get a hand in his stretch at the fence, the power imparted was enough to burst through a wall though

Sandeep Sharma to Christian, FOUR, oh dear. Spots Christian running inside and fires one way down leg. Christian with his stalking eyes always on the ball gets his bat out on the horizontal swiping mode and scoops it away

Sandeep Sharma to Christian, FOUR, more of the same. The ploy here from Sandeep refuses to change and Christian too refuses to stand up on his feet against this length. Does all he can to get under the ball and keeps his bat on the scoop. This time right over the keeper
Mohit Sharma to Rahane, FOUR, opens the face of the blade on impact and runs it down to third man for a four. Cheeky from Rahane as used the pace of the bowler and knew his angles to perfection
Sandeep Sharma to Smith, FOUR, gets the room to free his arms and creams the ball away into the covers. No one moved as the ball sped away into the off-side

Sandeep Sharma to Smith, FOUR, creates room by going leg-sidish, got the room to expand his arms and then threads the ball away between cover and extra cover for back-to-back fours. Innovation and Smith go hand in hand

T Natarajan to Smith, FOUR, shot of the day? Shot of the tourney so far? Pardon the exaggeration but that was serene from the skipper. That was a slower delivery and the batsman just leant his weight forward on it with a straight face of the bat touching the ball. The man at mid-on and at long-off dived over the ball to allow a deserving four to the skipper

Stanlake to Billings, FOUR, loose delivery. It's drifting onto the pads and all Billings has to do is help it on its way. RCB can ill afford these errors, especially when they're defending a sub-par score

Stanlake to Samson, FOUR, that's quite the blooper from Mills at third man. He might have taken his eyes off and the ball sneaks through him and over the ropes. Nice little glide from Samson, shouldn't have been anything more than a single

I Abdulla to Pant, FOUR, yeah, Abdulla is in a fix here. He doesn't want to be bowling in Abdulla's arc, but there is no one out in the deep to protect the cut either. He ends up straying wide of off and Pant slaps it through point

Tymal Mills to Pant, FOUR, Pant keeps stroking them beautifully at the other end. He clearly holds the fate of his team now. It's a full ball on off and Pant has timed the pants of it as he flicks it through mid-wicket. The placement is brilliant too

Watson to Pat Cummins, FOUR, Watson has erred big-time with the leg-cutter and Cummins gets him away. It's well down the leg-side and Cummins whips it over short fine leg for four. It was so close to clearing the boundary

Stanlake to Tare, FOUR, picked away into the leg-side again. Stanlake searching for swing, pitching it right up, but the ball goes on with the angle and ends up on the pads. He has to adjust his line. Too many freebies

Stanlake to Tare, FOUR, oh well, put the mockers on him there. But again, as soon as he tries to pitch the ball up expecting it to swing, he ends up on the pads. Whipped away gloriously from Tare over square leg

I Abdulla to Tare, FOUR, that's flown between keeper and slip. Gayle, standing at slip, didn't even have time to react. It was too close to cut. Tare made some room and slashed at it off the stumps. Lucky to get away. Not just get away, he's gotten four
Tymal Mills to Nair, FOUR, climbs from a back of a length, finds the outside edge pretty high up on the bat and runs away to the third man boundary. Nair was driving on the up there. Highly ambitious

Tymal Mills to Pant, FOUR, short of length into the body, Pant swivels across on the back foot and helps the pull behind square. He's placed it in the gap perfectly. Fine leg and deep square leg have no chance. Pant taking Mills on

Zaheer to Watson, FOUR, cracking shot, nice way to get going, that should give Watson plenty of confidence, length delivery on his pads, he prods across and clips it in front of square on the on-side, beats the infield and rolls away to the fence

Zaheer to Watson, FOUR, Watson is at his best in the opening slot and he has started well for RCB. On a good length and well outside off, he leans forward, plays with an open face and drives it on the up, beats cover and rolls away to the fence

Chris Morris to Watson, FOUR, Cummins makes a mess of a simple stop and concedes a boundary. On a good length and holding its line outside off, Watson went for the big drive, gets a thick edge over backward point. Cummins did all the running, slid and stopped the ball, but it hit his legs and rolled onto the ropes
Chris Morris to Gayle, FOUR, creamed, low full-toss from Morris, Gayle waits on it, leans forward and punches it in front of square on the off-side, beats cover-point and rolls away to the fence

Pat Cummins to Binny, FOUR, much needed boundary for RCB, on a good length and angling back into the right-hander, he uses the pace on the bat, opens up slightly and shovels it wide of mid-wicket. Mishra put in the dive - but in vain
Mishra to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, pushed through flatter and wider of off, Kedar makes room and flat-bats the slap - beats Mishra and races away to the fence in a jiffy

Mishra to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, cracking shot, tossed up on the stumps, Kedar shimmies down the track, gets close to the ball and lifts it back over the bowler's head, almost went all the way, one bounce and over the ropes

Brathwaite to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, cracking shot, that's Kedar's own version of MSD's helicopter shot. This was full and on the stumps, Kedar was deep inside the crease as he whipped it wide of mid-wicket, no chance for the man running across from long-on

Zaheer to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, mistimed shots are finding the gaps now, this was short and on the stumps, Kedar was late on the pull, gets a top-edge - the fielder at square leg was inside the ring and Kedar has managed to get it over his head
Brathwaite to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, smashed, length delivery on the stumps, Kedar backs away and thumps it back over the bowler's head, one bounce and over the ropes

Pat Cummins to Watson, FOUR, lovely, just a hint of width outside off, Watson made it look bad by arching back slightly, frees his arms and sends the cut scorching behind square on the off-side, beats third man - running to his right
Chris Morris to Mandeep, FOUR, that ruins the over for Morris, another full-toss, but this time on Mandeep's pads, he gets inside the line and helps it on its way. Nice way to get going

Pat Cummins to Mandeep, FOUR, cracking shot, back of a length and well outside off, Mandeep rides with the bounce and punches it in front of square on the off-side, beats cover and rolls away to the fence

Pat Cummins to Mandeep, FOUR, lovely, this is even better, on a good length and just outside off, Singh presses forward, drives it on the up and splits the gap between cover and mid-off. Good early signs for Mandeep

Bhuvneshwar to Roy, FOUR, cracking shot, that should release some pressure off Roy, comes down the track, flat-bats the short of a length delivery and lifts it back over Bhuvneshwar's head, a few bounces and over the ropes
Bhuvneshwar to Roy, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Roy, makes room to a length delivery on the stumps and swipes it over the infield, clears cover-point and rolls away to the fence

Cutting to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, wow. That sped off the bat. Smith breaks the shackles, stands tall and extends his hands into fierce punch, right off the middle and pistols away to the fence beating the sweeper cover fielder

Rashid Khan to Karthik, FOUR, edged and four! Would've been swallowed by the first slip fielder, if there was ever one. Lovely flight from Rashid, drew Karthik forward and takes the outside edge which runs away through the invisible first slip region
Henriques to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, short ball and punished. Smith picks it up early and nails the pull in front of square

Henriques to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, two fours in a row for Smith. This was a poor ball from Henriques, drifts one on the pads, all Smith had to do was to get some wood on it, which he did and it races away to the fine leg fence

Cutting to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, that's an awful ball from Cutting. Offers width, by bowling it well outside off, Smith goes deep in his crease and carves it over point. 50-run stand comes up between the two
Bipul Sharma to Roy, FOUR, lovely shot, fraction too short from Bipul , Roy is quick to rock back and pulls it through mid-wicket, no need to run for those
Bipul Sharma to Roy, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries once again from Roy, comes down the track, covered for the spin and lifts it over the head of mid-on, a couple of bounces and over the ropes
Nehra to Roy, FOUR, lovely shot, banged in short and on the stumps, it sat up to be smacked, Roy makes room and pulls it over mid-wicket, one bounce and over the ropes
Nehra to Karthik, FOUR, cracking shot, a floaty half-volley from Nehra, Karthik leans forward, closes the face of the bat and drives it back past the non-striker, no chance for the man at mid-off

Bhuvneshwar to Roy, FOUR, cracking shot, that should release some pressure off Roy, comes down the track, flat-bats the short of a length delivery and lifts it back over Bhuvneshwar's head, a few bounces and over the ropes
Bhuvneshwar to Roy, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Roy, makes room to a length delivery on the stumps and swipes it over the infield, clears cover-point and rolls away to the fence

Cutting to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, wow. That sped off the bat. Smith breaks the shackles, stands tall and extends his hands into fierce punch, right off the middle and pistols away to the fence beating the sweeper cover fielder

Rashid Khan to Karthik, FOUR, edged and four! Would've been swallowed by the first slip fielder, if there was ever one. Lovely flight from Rashid, drew Karthik forward and takes the outside edge which runs away through the invisible first slip region
Henriques to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, short ball and punished. Smith picks it up early and nails the pull in front of square

Henriques to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, two fours in a row for Smith. This was a poor ball from Henriques, drifts one on the pads, all Smith had to do was to get some wood on it, which he did and it races away to the fine leg fence

Cutting to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, that's an awful ball from Cutting. Offers width, by bowling it well outside off, Smith goes deep in his crease and carves it over point. 50-run stand comes up between the two
Bipul Sharma to Roy, FOUR, lovely shot, fraction too short from Bipul , Roy is quick to rock back and pulls it through mid-wicket, no need to run for those
Bipul Sharma to Roy, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries once again from Roy, comes down the track, covered for the spin and lifts it over the head of mid-on, a couple of bounces and over the ropes
Nehra to Roy, FOUR, lovely shot, banged in short and on the stumps, it sat up to be smacked, Roy makes room and pulls it over mid-wicket, one bounce and over the ropes
Nehra to Karthik, FOUR, cracking shot, a floaty half-volley from Nehra, Karthik leans forward, closes the face of the bat and drives it back past the non-striker, no chance for the man at mid-off
Malinga to Chris Lynn, FOUR, errs in length and pays the price. Lynn is too good to not miss out on these. Takes a giant step forward, uses all his power to muscle it down the ground
McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, FOUR, poor ball. Short and down leg, too easy for Lynn. Swivels across and helps it on its way past the man at 45

Krunal Pandya to M Pandey, FOUR, another edge. Pandey is living a struggle here in reading the amounts of turn. Not quite the control but ultimately manages to get some wood on it in directing the edge through the keeper
Harbhajan to M Pandey, FOUR, so deft. The cheek these days. Shapes up for the cut, or so we assumed but at the very last moment opens the bat upwards in a dab past the outstretched Parthiv leg
Harbhajan to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, just the hint of width. Enough for Yadav to sniff a boundary out of it. Throws the kitchen sink at it with a crack through the off-side

Harbhajan to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, the width is back. And so is the allied length that starts off from half way down. A wristy chop quite off the outside half of the bat. Hurries away through third man

Bumrah to M Pandey, FOUR, and now he toys around further. Bumrah responds with a length delivery outside off and Pandey after threatening to muscle another one out, stays composed and guides it behind point

McClenaghan to M Pandey, no ball, FOUR, he oversteps and then bowls it in the arc as well. More of the sunken bat swings in intercepting the two men at the leg-side fence. Pandey with help here from the bowler giving KKR the final catapult. Free hit coming up
McClenaghan to M Pandey, FOUR, a full toss now. Nothing coming out right here. Tailing away and Pandey is more than glad to use the width in just tickling it past the keeper
McClenaghan to Gambhir, FOUR, offers some width to Gambhir, who will not miss out on these. Reaches out and bullies it with serene timing through cover
Bumrah to Gambhir, FOUR, yes he can! Bumrah is not learning, doles out a friendly full toss on off, Gambhir opens the bat face and slices it behind point

Bumrah to Gambhir, FOUR, two in a row for Gambhir. This was streaky but the KKR captain won't mind. Pitched up full outside off, Gambhir went hard on the drive, gets an outside edge that races away to the third man fence. The fielder was squarer and had no chance

Krunal Pandya to Uthappa, FOUR, this was quite intentional from Robbie. Plants his front foot forward, looking to defend. The ball came in with the angle, takes the outer half of his willow and runs away to the third man fence

McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, FOUR, oh boy! McClenaghan has been Lynn-ed here. If there is ever a term like that. Just stands still, unleashes a strong bottom-hand to slap it through extra cover. Bulleted away to the fence

Boult to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, poor delivery from Boult to follow-up. Short, wide and Parthiv is right on top of it, cracks the cut behind square and third man was only picking it up from the rope. MI are off and running
Boult to Buttler, FOUR, inswinger which is slightly off target and Buttler puts it away with ease. Full and swinging into the pads, flicked through mid-wicket to open his account. Not a muscle moved
Rajpoot to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, this time Krunal is in position much quicker, the line is different too - more around off and middle - and he's able to muscle the pull away through mid-wicket

Rajpoot to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, consecutive fours to finish the over. MI desperately need some momentum here. I think Rajpoot is getting a bit carried away. Bowls it full on the pads and Krunal whips him over mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Nitish Rana, FOUR, a little bit of air from Kuldeep, Rana quickly bends his knees and swipes it to the wide long-on boundary. The length was a bit too full from Kuldeep there

Woakes to Pollard, FOUR, Woakes bowls short first up to surprise him, but Pollard is quickly into position. He's able to swivel outside the line of the ball which is on leg-stump and helps the pull to the fine leg boundary. It's rocketed through
Woakes to Nitish Rana, FOUR, moves away from the line of the short of length off-cutter, creates some room and flays it away over extra-cover. Rana keeping Mumbai afloat
Woakes to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, that's been absolutely spanked through extra-cover. The ball has left a vapour trail. Short and wide from Woakes, Pandya smokes it while backing away
Boult to Nitish Rana, FOUR, brilliant timing! Low full toss wide of off, Rana reaches out and slices it past backward point. It skimmed off the bat

Rajpoot to Nitish Rana, FOUR, full toss again and this time he lofts it over extra-cover. Although the timing isn't quite there, he just had to clear the fielder in the circle. No chance for the fielder running across from sweeper cover. It's fifty for Rana too. The crowd going bonkers

Boult to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, that is probably the blunder which will cost KKR the match. It shouldn't have been any more than a single. A low full toss which Hardik can't find any elevation with. He smacks it down to long-on, where Surya attacks the ball nicely but he misfields and the ball sneaks through
Boult to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, full on the pads, and Hardik has done it! He whips it away past a diving Rajpoot at the fine leg boundary before running down and cutting a pose for the camera

Boult to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, a shot that should make him feel better. Boult errs in his length slight and that is enough for Parthiv to punish him, driven beautifully wide of mid-off and the ball raced away to the fence
Narine to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, rank long hop to start Narine's spell, Parthiv picked the bones out of the pull shot, rocks back and nails it wide of the mid-wicket fielder. No need to run for those

Kuldeep Yadav to Nitish Rana, FOUR, a freebie from Kuldeep to welcome Rana. Googly which is short and down leg, Rana went for the big pull and under edge it fine. The man in the deep was square and had no chance

Stanlake to Amla, FOUR, Amla is off and running. Stanlake loses his radar and sprays it on the pads, Amla will not miss out on those. Just nonchalantly whips it past square leg. The ball raced away to the fence at MACH 3

I Abdulla to Amla, FOUR, fabulous shot from Amla. Don't offer him width, not even half a foot. If you give him half a foot, he will take it into a mile. Just extends his hands and lifts it effortlessly over extra cover

Watson to Amla, FOUR, it's down the leg side and Amla tickles it away for four! The man at fine leg had no chance. A fine fifty from the South African. This knock has ensured that KXIP are chasing this down without much of a problem
Watson to Maxwell, FOUR, plenty of width on offer and Maxwell takes full toll of it, stands tall in his crease and smacks the leather over extra cover. Take four!
Negi to Maxwell, FOUR, that's fodder! Maxi wants to finish it off ASAP. Uses the strong bottom hand to whip it in the air over mid-wicket, one bounce and over the ropes

Watson to Vohra, FOUR, in the airrr and just over a leaping Negi. Vohra would've had his heart in his mouth for a moment. A short of length delivery outside off, there was width on offer so Vohra went after for a rasping cut. Didn't bother to keep it down but luckily for him it flies over the point fielder
Watson to Vohra, FOUR, almost.. Watson overcorrects his length, bowls fuller this time. Vohra flexes his arms and lifts it over mid-off. Just clears the fielders and runs away to the fence

Watson to Vohra, FOUR, third boundary of the over. Watson is not learning. This was much straighter, he is looking for some swing which is non existent at the moment. Full on the pads, Vohra gets inside the line and tickles it away to the fine leg fence. The fielder was inside the ring and Watson shouldn't have bowled it there

Stanlake to Amla, FOUR, threads the gap this time. Pure class from Amla. Stands still and lets his hands do the talking. Punches a back of a length delivery crisply through cover-point, beats the packed off-side field

Tymal Mills to Vohra, FOUR, wow. Elegance written all over it. Shot of the day so far. Mills bowls a half-volley on the stumps, Vohra leans forward, presents a full bat face and drives it smoothly down the ground, beats mid-on

Tymal Mills to Maxwell, FOUR, you cannot keep Maxwell quiet for long. He gets into business, full at 146kph, Maxwell clears his front leg and bludgeons it back over the bowler's head. Brutal from Maxi!

Sandeep Sharma to de Villiers, FOUR, that was a poor piece of fielding from the man at third man. So de Villiers is off the mark straightaway in this IPL. Sandeep Sharma bowled a decent length ball outside off stump, just shaped away from the right-hander, de Villiers guided that with an angled bat past point and eventually managed to get a boundary

Mohit Sharma to Binny, FOUR, goes inside-out and cannons the ball over cover for a boundary. That was a full ball outside off and the batsman thwacks the ball over the fielder to get another boundary. Even Binny joins in the act

Sandeep Sharma to de Villiers, FOUR, FIFTY for the combo! This man can do anything and everything with the willow. The pied piper of RCB treated the bowler as if he hails from Hamelin. That was full outside off and the batsman just steered the ball over the man at point

Mohit Sharma to Vishnu Vinod, FOUR, in the airrrrrr and just over the leaping Maxwell at mid-on. Vinod is known for his audacious stroke-play. He won't mind playing his shots in any situation. Shortish delivery from Mohit Sharma, Vinod smacks that from the crease, didn't get hold of it, more a sort of a pull shot it was, the ball just evaded the Punjab skipper

Aaron to de Villiers, FOUR, Aaron missed the yorker by a yard or so and that was just what de Villiers wanted with the line being middle and leg. He waited for the ball to come and flicked it past the diving mid-wicket fielder

T Natarajan to Mandeep, FOUR, and he gets lucky with an outside edge that runs away for four! No one at slip and third man can't cut that off. Natarajan bowled full and outside off stump, Mandeep reached out to meet the ball, the ball escaped off the edge

Chahar to Samson, FOUR, classy stuff from Samson. Nothing much wrong with the delivery. Good length ball around off, Samson allowed it to do its bit before opening the bat face and directing it past the backward point fielder. Used the pace on the ball and timed it beautifully

Chahar to Samson, FOUR, consecutive boundaries for Samson. That should calm the nerves. Overpitched and Chahar is punished, Samson strides forward and creams the square drive through the packed off-side field. No need to run for that
Zampa to Pant, FOUR, tosses it up slow on middle and leg. Overpitched as well. Pant waits for the ball and drills it down the track. No chance for the long-on fielder
Stokes to Samson, FOUR, nice looking shot! Short ball, Samson has ample time to move across and pull it behind square on the leg-side. Well wide of the fine leg fielder. One bounce over the rope
Dinda to Samson, FOUR, highest score in this season! Cheeky from Samson! Low full toss outside off, Samson picks it and laps it well wide of short fine and the ball dribbles away into the fence
Zampa to Chris Morris, FOUR, that's one helluva way to open your account! Leg-break outside off, Morris lofts it inside-out and gets off the mark with a boundary

Zampa to Chris Morris, FOUR, the gamble hasn't paid off. A wicket was scalped, but the overall result - 22 runs off the 19th over. Flipper outside off, Morris crouches and lifts it inside out. No chance for long-off
Stokes to Chris Morris, FOUR, that's a gross delivery! Short of a good length delivery with no pace behind it. Morris moves across and helps it away well wide of short fine. Runs away into the fence

Stokes to Chris Morris, FOUR, that's a brilliant stroke! Stokes can't believe that. He didn't do much wrong there. It was bowled in the blockhole wide of off and Morris opens his bat face and drills the squeeze wide of point

Dinda to Samson, FOUR, Samson has come out firing. Picked the length early on the short of length delivery, got his front leg up and nailed the pull in front of square. That came smack bang off the middle

Dinda to Samson, FOUR, fourth boundary in five balls for Samson. The start is getting better for DD. Dinda overcompensates and goes full outside off, Samson is up for it and cracks the drive past the diving cover-point fielder. Sped away to the fence

Dinda to Billings, FOUR, third boundary of the over and Dinda leaking runs here. Short and wide outside off, Billings throws the kitchen sink at that and the ball flies off the outside edge, over Faf at slip and into the third man fence
Chahar to Samson, FOUR, excellent batting. On a length and just outside off, Samson goes up and over cover, once he got it through the infield the result was going to be in his favour

Stokes to Samson, FOUR, Stokes too meted out with the same treatment. Good length ball outside off, Samson leans into the drive and places it square. It is a crowded off-side field and he's threaded that to perfection
Chahar to Billings, FOUR, not a boundary ball but that's T20. Back of length around off, Billings crouches a bit and swats it away wide of mid-on, not off the middle but he had enough wood on that

Chahar to Billings, FOUR, last over of the powerplay and Billings has decided to cash in. Advances and gets cramped for room, swings with all his might and drags it off the inner part of the bat to the left of short fine, Dinda can only escort the ball to the fence

Chahar to Billings, FOUR, poor delivery this and Chahar is made to pay. Sprays it down leg and that is easy pickings for any batsman, Billings stays inside the line and whips it fine. No chance for Dinda this time around

Nadeem to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, first boundary of the innings. Sweetly timed by Agarwal. Saw the ball dropped on a shortish length, pivoted back and flayed it through cover. This is a mickey-mouse outfield and it zooms away to the fence
Mishra to Zampa, FOUR, lovely shot, Mishra tosses one wider of off, Zampa gets a big stride forward and drills it through extra-cover, beats the man getting across to his left from long-off
Zaheer to Dinda, FOUR, Dinda wants to have some fun, length delivery outside off, he gets forward and thumps it over extra-cover for a boundary

Chris Morris to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, wow. Delicate stuff from Agarwal. Opens the bat face to this length ball and runs it towards third man, Sanju had to cover some ground, sprinted to his left but couldn't stop the ball from reaching the ropes
Zaheer to du Plessis, FOUR, fabulous shot from du Plessis. Sets up a solid base and caresses it past long-off
Chris Morris to Tripathi, FOUR, what a way to get off the mark in IPL for Tripathi. Leans across to a full ball and blasts it through extra cover

Chris Morris to Tripathi, FOUR, edged and four. Morris is not happy. Throws a wild stare at the batsman. On a length and just outside off, Tripathi went hard at it, gets an outside edge that races away to the third man fence

Bhuvneshwar to Buttler, FOUR, slightly straighter from Bhuvneshwar and the batsman clips the ball away between mid-wicket and mid-on for a four. Hardly touched it and the ball sped away after he shuffled a tad across his sticks

Nehra to Buttler, FOUR, looks to defend and the ball trims the inside edge to run past the sticks. Cruel it is for the bowlers. The ball lifted up after landing on a length forcing the batsman to jab at it but the ball clipped the inner edge to run past the timbers and the keeper for a four

Nehra to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, serene! The format might demand slam bang wham. But a back foot cover drive with a lean into the shot and hitting it on top of the bounce is welcomed all day long. He trampled back to stroke it off the back foot
Nehra to Nitish Rana, FOUR, he's sprayed it around a bit today, has Nehra. Short and wide and gives away the boundary to finish the over. Slashed over backward point by Rana
Nehra to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, 10 off 2 balls. Nehra continues to be expensive. Strays just a touch in line, bowls it on middle and leg, and Krunal Pandya glances it away past short fine leg
Cutting to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, very wide outside off and Krunal Pandya somehow reaches out and then generates enough power to carve it over extra-cover. He's in a hurry now

Cutting to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, off the top-edge or the glove, the ball lobs over Naman Ojha and runs away to the boundary. Krunal Pandya was rushed on the pull on this occasion. The line from Cutting cramped him up too. But he still gets the boundary

Bhuvneshwar to Nitish Rana, FOUR, lofted over mid-off! He picks the slower ball, the length was pretty full outside off and Rana's focus is purely on timing. Doesn't go very hard at it. Brilliant batting

Nehra to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, repeats the gait of the previous ball and gets an outside edge to run it down towards third man. He got wood on it and got it fine after just using the pace of the bowler. 15 off the over!

Bhuvneshwar to Buttler, FOUR, errs in length, which is short, errs in line, which is wide. Enough said. The batsman cashes into the blank cheque of a delivery with the flay of the arms and stroked it beautifully through the heavily manned off-side

Nehra to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, nicely done as he wristily whips the ball in the air over the man at mid-on. A few bounces and into the fence. A length ball it was and the batsman did it with nonchalance

Nehra to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, targets the mid-riff with another short delivery but the pint-sized dynamite is onto it in a flash! The short arm jab on the pull and the ball screeches away into the backward square region on the on-side for a four

Mustafizur to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, that was a chocolate brownie of a delivery and the batsman puts the icing on it with the help of an eyes-scream of a shot. Cut away easily past the man at point making the man at third man look like a statue
Mustafizur to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, the ramp now! He is pulling out all the tricks from his hat. Short ball bumped in well outside off and the batsman helped it on his way towards third man
Mustafizur to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, poor delivery on the pads and third in a row as the batsman clips the ball away over the man at short fine leg
Deepak Hooda to Nitish Rana, FOUR, attempted slog sweep, is not really well timed but is well placed to send it away into the vacant backward square region for a much needed four
McClenaghan to Deepak Hooda, FOUR, don't worry about that! Healthy width on offer, Hooda throws the kitchen sink and gets his christmas gift
Krunal Pandya to Dhawan, FOUR, right in the sweeping zone for SD. He gets inside the line and thrashes it away behind square
Harbhajan to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan's getting better with each passing delivery, he steps out, takes Harbhajan on and lofts him inside-out over extra cover

McClenaghan to Cutting, FOUR, no fuss from Cutting! Arrives and gets a boundary, with utmost ease. A friendly full toss outside off, Cutting shows the full face of the bat, McClenaghan's pace takes care of the rest. Raced past mid-off

Hardik Pandya to Yuvraj, FOUR, a fielding blip from Buttler and that's a boundary. Yuvi knew what was coming with the field set, stayed on the back foot and unveiled the cut with a glitter of left-hander's elegance. Jos runs to his right from cover and dives, the ball slids through his fingers to add agony to a grumpy-looking Rohit Sharma
Malinga to Cutting, FOUR, the gangly Cutting makes his intentions clear. He wants to have a piece of slinga Malinga. Waits deep inside the crease and bludgeons a full ball back over the bowler's head
Malinga to Cutting, FOUR, that's a wood chopper! Takes on a full half-volley and slices the whacky-drive over a leaping exra cover. Bhajji was the fielder and he may have got a fingertip on that
Bumrah to Cutting, FOUR, slower ball alright, but serves too much of width. Ends up as a full toss, Cutting chips it over extra cover, easy peasy
Harbhajan to Warner, FOUR, lovely shot, poor ball from Harbhajan, dropped it short and wide of off, Warner backed away, plays with the turn and cuts it over cover, one bounce and over the ropes

Harbhajan to Warner, FOUR, this is even better. This was not all that short but Warner made room for himself, stayed back and went inside out over cover, almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes

Malinga to Warner, FOUR, nicely played by Warner, it was the slower ball from Malinga, rolled his fingers across the seam. Warner watched it all along, played with an open face and guides it in the gap behind square on the off-side, beats backward point and rolls away to the fence

Malinga to Warner, FOUR, poor ball from Malinga, too straight and on Warner's pads, he allows it to come onto it, closes the face of the bat and glances it fine, beats the keeper and rolls away to the fence

Bumrah to Warner, FOUR, cracking shot, width on offer from Bumrah, Warner waits on it, gets on top of the bounce, uses Bumrah's pace and steers it to the right of backward point. No chance for the fielder running across to his left from third man

McClenaghan to Dhawan, FOUR, streaky and four, on a good length and on the stumps, Dhawan heaves across the line, gets a thick inside edge past square leg. The pace of this outfield is so good that it rolls away to the fence

McClenaghan to Dhawan, FOUR, cracking shot, on a good length and just outside off, Dhawan does a little shimmy, gets close to the ball and drills it wide of mid-off. No need to run for those. 15 from the over

McClenaghan to Warner, FOUR, that's a bad fumble from Rana and he has cost his team two runs. Full and on his pads, flicked away behind square on the on-side. Rana did the hard yards, got to the ball and slips it through his hands

McClenaghan to Warner, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries and it has turned out to be another expensive over from McClenaghan. He got too predictable with the slower ones, Warner was waiting for it, cuts it hard and beats the fielder at point to his left

Hardik Pandya to Dhawan, FOUR, inside edge and four, on a good length and holding its line outside off, Dhawan walked across on the swipe, gets a thick inside edge - past the off-stump and past the diving Parthiv. A hat-trick of boundaries for SRH
Sandeep Sharma to Narine, FOUR, slapped, short of a length and shaping away from outside off, Narine plays with the angle and carves it behind square on the off-side, one bounce and over the ropes

Ishant to Gambhir, FOUR, cracking shot, width on offer from Ishant, Gambhir gets on top of the bounce and cuts it in front of square on the off-side, beats the man in the ring and rolls away to the fence

Ishant to Gambhir, FOUR, edged and four, a third slip would have gobbled it up. Short of a good length and angling across Gambhir, opened him up as he looked to defend, the edge flew past the diving Maxwell at second slip, third man can't get across - despite the dive

Mohit Sharma to Gambhir, FOUR, off-pace delivery and Gambhir spotted it early. The length was short and with his open stance, it was always going to be trouble for Mohit, punched off the back foot in front of square and Axar at sweeper gave up the chase very soon

Axar to Gambhir, FOUR, what was Ishant doing? Gambhir backed away to the leg-side, Axar followed him with a short and quick delivery, Gambhir adjusted and ramped it fine. Ishant at short third man stood like a statue

Axar to M Pandey, FOUR, top shot! Just a caress and off she went racing to the boundary cushion. Axar tosses it up outside off and draws Pandey into the drive, the Karnataka batsman drives it handsomely through extra cover and beat a quick David Miller at sweeper cover

Mohit Sharma to M Pandey, FOUR, slower short ball and Pandey had all the time in the world to dismiss it from his presence, delays the pull and sends it along the turf behind square, well wide of the deep square leg fielder

Sandeep Sharma to Gambhir, FOUR, that's bread and butter for Gambhir. Short, wide and he cracks it away. Went back in his crease and unleashed the cut shot behind square, beating backward point and third man quite comfortably

Sandeep Sharma to Gambhir, FOUR, cracking shot, hint of width outside off, the length was on the shorter side as well, Gambhir gets on top of the bounce and cuts it in front of square on the off-side, beats the fielder at point and rolls away to the fence

Sandeep Sharma to Gambhir, FOUR, this is turning out to be an excellent start from KKR. Sandeep overcompensates and bowls one full and wide of off, Gambhir shimmies down the track, gets down on one knee and drills it past extra-cover

Ishant to Gambhir, FOUR, poor ball from Ishant, short and wide of off, Gambhir gets on top of the bounce and cracks it behind square on the off-side. Beats backward point to his right and the man getting across in the deep
Maxwell to Gambhir, FOUR, this is a super quick outfield, flatter and on Gambhir's pads, nudged away behind square on the on-side. Two men gave chase, but the ball kept going away from their reach
Maxwell to Narine, FOUR, lovely shot, pushed through flatter and quicker, Narine shuffles down the track, makes room as he did so and drives it wide of mid-off, no need to run for those
Maxwell to Narine, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Narine, Maxwell drags his length back, drops it short and on Narine's pads, pulled away over square leg for another boundary

Maxwell to Gambhir, FOUR, 18 runs from the over, poor ball from Maxwell, fired it flatter and on Gambhir's pads, he goes back and clips it past square leg. The man in the ring was pretty square, gives the chase, but it's in vain

Aaron to Narine, FOUR, cracking shot, awful start from Aaron, fine leg was inside the ring and he looks to bounce out Narine. There's not much bounce on this one, Narine swivels across and helps it over short fine-leg, one bounce and over the ropes

Mohit Sharma to Gambhir, FOUR, the short-ball attack isn't working and KXIP aren't learning either. Banged in short and down the leg-side, Gambhir gets inside the line, swivels across and pulls it behind square on the on-side for a boundary

Axar to Uthappa, FOUR, deft touch from Uthappa, Axar dropped one short and wide of off, Uthappa makes room, waits on it, uses the pace on the ball and dabs it late, beats Sandeep at short third man and rolls away to the fence

Stoinis to Uthappa, FOUR, that's easy pickings for Uthappa, he's looking in good form tonight. Short and on the stumps, he gets inside the line and helps it on its way, one bounce and over the fence at backward square leg
Axar to Uthappa, FOUR, poor ball from Axar, dropped it short and wide of off, Uthappa makes room and cuts it behind square on the off-side. Miller was caught wrong-footed and has no chance to recover

Boult to Amla, FOUR, shoddy from Piyush Chawla, running around from fine leg. He's too stiff while bending and the ball slips underneath him. Swinging in on middle and leg, Amla clips it behind square leg and it shouldn't have been more than a couple
Boult to Amla, FOUR, the swing from Boult takes him on the pads once more, Amla stays in the crease and whips a glance down to the fine leg boundary. Brisk start from the Kings XI
U Yadav to Saha, FOUR, flashed and flashed hard. Umesh provides width for Saha, he throws his bat and ekes out a thick outside edge that flies past first slip
de Grandhomme to Miller, FOUR, this is a bit streaky but Miller won't mind. Bangs it short, Miller went for the pull, gets a top-edge that flies over the keeper

Boult to Saha, FOUR, that is an awful effort from Narine. Makes a royal mess of this one. Boult wears a cheeky smile on his face. It was a short ball outside off, Saha gets a top-edge as he tried to elevate it over third man. The ball lobs in the air and drops in front of Narine at third man, he fails to get his body behind the line of the ball and lets it go through making him look absolute silly
U Yadav to Miller, FOUR, attempted yorker gone wrong for Umesh. Ends up offering a high full toss on off, Miller gets hit high on the willow but he manages it skew it past mid-off
Boult to Mohit Sharma, FOUR, he's timed that well. Gets on top of the bounce, opens the bat face nicely and steers it past point. No chance for the third man fielder

Boult to Vohra, FOUR, ravishing cover drive from Vohra. This looks a belter of a pitch. This is no half-volley, but the ball is coming on so beautifully that Vohra just leans across and caresses it on the up. Awesome timing
Boult to Vohra, FOUR, third boundary today that Boult has conceded off the pads. Just straying a touch with the swing. Curling in on leg, Vohra shuffles across and just tickles it through
Woakes to Amla, FOUR, deliberately goes up and over point. Ordinary delivery. Short of length with width on offer, Amla opens his wrists up as he slashes it away to lift it over the infield

Woakes to Vohra, FOUR, the boundaries keep coming as the bowlers keep erring in line. Full ball on the pads, fine leg is inside the ring, so Vohra effortlessly whips it over him and into the fence. KXIP off to a flying start
Woakes to Vohra, FOUR, that's a risky shot but Vohra backs himself to ramp a short of length delivery into the third man boundary. He got it fine enough of the fielder. One bounce and over the ropes
Chawla to Stoinis, FOUR, only slightly short, the ball slides in on leg, and Stoinis is quick to go back in the crease. He effortlessly whips a pull over square leg and beats long leg to his left

Woakes to Maxwell, FOUR, picked off his hips for six, is it? No, one bounce. So stylishly done. Loose from Woakes again, he bowls back of a length and bowls leg-stump. Maxwell languidly swivels outside the line and helps it on its way. Lovely wrists
Woakes to Amla, FOUR, short of length into the body, Amla wallops a pull through backward square leg. That's rocketed to the fence. Really poor from Woakes. He's been consistently short so far
Chawla to Maxwell, FOUR, four more. Flatter outside off but it's full again, and Maxwell smokes a flat-batted drive wide of long-off
Chawla to Maxwell, FOUR, Chawla under serious pressure. This is scintillating batting. He goes wide of off again, and is carted over extra-cover again. An unabridged swing of the bat

Tymal Mills to Pollard, FOUR, in the blockhole, the ball chirps the toe-end of the bat and bisects the gap between the keeper and the slip fielder to race away to the fence. That was really full and was just outside off to force the batsman to jam his bat down on that
Binny to Pollard, FOUR, length ball outside off and the batsman flogs the ball away with the meaty bottom-hand coming into play. The gap between long-on and deep mid-wicket was easily pierced

Tymal Mills to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, fifty for the combo! He waited on that slower delivery and then dismissed it out of his sight with disdain. Got the room as well to free his arms and then got the ball speeding between cover and mid-off for a four

Tymal Mills to Pollard, FOUR, full ball targetting the sticks and the batsman got enough wood on it to clip it away. The man from deep square who was Binny came running in to make the save but despite getting a hand on it, couldn't bend down enough to stop that. Second four of the over

Aravind to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, poor from Mills! That was dabbed away with soft hands and the fielder at short third man does the London Bridge and dives over it to open the floodgates for RCB. The momentum has again changed hands

Tymal Mills to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, short ball, pulled away and no man in the deep mid-wicket region allows the ball to race away into the fence. Chahal from deep square ran across and the ball sandwiches between him and the ground to ensure that he is in some pain. Hope he is OK as he has a grimacing expression on his face
Tymal Mills to Nitish Rana, FOUR, Rana is the man in form. Poor ball from Mills, slides one down leg, Rana gets across and whips it crisply behind square. No chance for the fine leg fielder

Krunal Pandya to de Villiers, byes, FOUR, byes signalled! The ball kept terribly low as de Villiers backed away to thwack it. The ball rolled down to beat the keeper through his legs and run away into the fence. Bumrah giving it a chase comes up with a comical effort - tried to flick it back and ended up lobbing the ball outside the boundary edge
Bumrah to Kohli, FOUR, cheeky from the skipper as he opens the face of the blade and runs it past the diving keeper for a four
Krunal Pandya to Kohli, FOUR, looks to slog sweep, the ball chalks the outer thin edge and runs past the keeper for a four. Lucky and streaky
Southee to Kohli, FOUR, awful start this has been for Southee. Overbakes and bangs it short, sits up nicely for Kohli, who skips back and muscles the pull in front of square on the on-side

Southee to Kohli, FOUR, two fours in a row. "He is looking ominous here," says Ravi Shaz on air. This was a half-volley on fifth stump line, Kohli brings those quicksilver wrists of his into play. Just gets inside the line and whips it past mid-on. Goes to the fence like a 'famous bullet phrase' to the fence

Harbhajan to Gayle, FOUR, the chat has worked. Virat offered some advice to Gayle and next ball the big man slaps one to the fence. A quicker delivery outside off, Gayle goes back and flays the cut, through point. Zooms away to the fence.
McClenaghan to Gayle, FOUR, stand and deliver stuff from Gayle. Just flexes his arms and times the pants off this length ball. Races away through cover and no need to run for those
Harbhajan to Kohli, FOUR, buffet ball, as Geoff Boycott would say. Short and offers enough width, Kohli skips back and knives with a solid punch, the timing was brutal and it beats extra cover

Ankit Sharma to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, that's a thick inside edge is what it is. Smith just plants his foot down looking to loft it down the ground without being anywhere close to the pitch. It slides in, spoons up off the edge and beats square leg before running away
Ankit Sharma to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, now Ankit fires it short and Smith goes back to punch it through the covers. What a blistering start for GL! 16 off the over
Rahul Chahar to Finch, FOUR, paddle-scoops a leg-drifter to the fine leg fence, good placement
Stokes to Raina, FOUR, first poor delivery from Stokes. Half-volley outside off, Raina lofts him inside-out over extra cover. Smith running in from long-off gave up a little too early

Stokes to Raina, FOUR, that's timed to perfection! Save your legs. It rose just enough from a fullish length, Raina shows the full face of the bat as he spanks it through cover. No chance for the man in the deep
Tahir to Finch, FOUR, plenty of flight on that one and Finch takes full toll of it. Watches it closely and nails the drive wide of extra cover
Tahir to Raina, FOUR, Raina is having a ball out there. Middling almost everything. On one knee, gets underneath a flighted delivery and loft-drives Tahir over extra cover
Tahir to Raina, FOUR, on the pads, Raina says thank you and brooms him away into the deep backward square fence. 13 off the over

Lockie Ferguson to Finch, FOUR, a night to forget for Imran Tahir as he puts one down. Pick-up flick shot from Finch, Tahir at fine leg was late to anticipate as he tries to reach the ball with a lackadaisical dive, through his fingers

Lockie Ferguson to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, bludgeoned! A short of length delivery outside off which Smith smokes through mid-wicket. To hit that well in front of square against someone like Ferguson, especially after having to fetch it from wide of off, it's a special shot
SN Thakur to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, you don't bowl short to this guy, not unless you're express. Such fast hands as he dispatches a pull through mid-wicket. The man in the deep is too square

Lockie Ferguson to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, 147kph on that length ball and Smith uses all of it to slice the ball over backward point. Or maybe I'm giving him too much credit and it's just a thick outside edge. In either case, he went hard and the ball flew
Lockie Ferguson to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, a proper half-volley at the stumps, beautifully whipped away wide of mid-on. Excellent wrists from Smith. GL off to a flier

Tahir to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, lunges out at the ball and lofts it over mid-off. Interesting that he's gone after Tahir first ball. The ball was full enough to execute the shot and he took his opportunity
Tahir to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, now McCullum skips out of the crease, takes it on the full and drills it through extra-cover. Back to back boundaries
Rahul Chahar to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, too close to cut, but Smith has played it well! Picked the length early, rocked back and slapped it from around off-stump backwards of point
Rahul Chahar to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, that's pleading to be pummeled. Short and slides down, Smith with a brazen-looking pull shot puts it away into the vacant mid-wicket area
Tahir to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, kneels down and sweeps Tahir between long-on and deep mid-wicket. Gee! This is some exhibition
Tahir to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, a repeat of the previous delivery. This time though he had to fetch it from well outside off and beats Stokes's dive to his right at long-on
Tahir to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, full floater on middle and leg, Smith drills it to the right of a diving Imran Tahir. Long-on can't get there

P Kumar to Smith, FOUR, class written all over it. Tells us what kind of form Smith is in. Ball is darting around and he just presents the full face of the bat and drives it straight past the bowler, the timing and placement was exquisite from the skipper

Basil Thampi to Tripathi, FOUR, Tripathi is off the mark with a fine shot. Thampi wanted to start with a yorker, misses it by a good distance, the full toss is thumped down the ground, past the diving mid-on fielder
Raina to Stokes, FOUR, edged and four. Stokes won't mind that. Quicker and the ball straightens a touch, Stokes goes hard on the drive and the outside edge runs away fine. A welcome boundary for RPS
Dwayne Smith to Stokes, FOUR, hit-me delivery from Smith. Short and down leg, Stokes swivels and helps it over the short fine leg fielder. He's keeping the scoreboard moving swiftly
Shadab Jakati to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, that's a half-tracker wide of off. Tiwary fetches it and shovels it wide of long-on. Jakati under pressure straightaway after an ordinary first over

Jadeja to Ankit Sharma, FOUR, nicely done. He's played this so late and so delicately, using all the pace that Jadeja has to offer. Darted in on a back of a length just outside off, Ankit leans back and dabs it fine of short third man
Basil Thampi to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, brilliant timing. The ball races away past point. Back of a length outside off, Tiwary eases onto the back foot and punches it firmly. Good start to the over
Jadeja to Ankit Sharma, FOUR, this time Jadeja can do nothing about it. Full in the slot, Ankit drills it straight down the ground and beats long-on to the right

Basil Thampi to Smith, FOUR, wow! Does this man have wrists? Even the sub-continent players will be proud of this shot. Full delivery around off, Smith with his slight shuffle brings those wrists into play as he flicks it over mid-wicket. Couple of bounces and into the fence

P Kumar to Tripathi, FOUR, lovely shot! Nothing too fancy from Tripathi. Waited for the ball to do its bit - move away and used the width on offer to his advantage, carved it past the diving cover-point fielder and it raced across the turf

Shadab Jakati to Smith, FOUR, greets Jakati with a whippy flick. Flatter and just outside off, Smith brings his bat down at an angle and whips it past mid-on. No chance for the deep mid-wicket fielder

P Kumar to Tripathi, FOUR, the 50-run partnership is up. Rahane's wicket seems a long time ago. Pitched up and right in the slot, Tripathi has no half measures in his armoury, lofts it over the infield on the off-side and collects four more

P Kumar to Smith, FOUR.. and it is usual business from Smith at the other end. Sees the delivery in his arc and lofts it straight back over the bowler's head. Once again the full face of the bat was the key to the shot

P Kumar to Smith, FOUR, poor bowling this from PK. Searches for the yorker, low full toss down leg, Smith just helps it along the way, flicked behind square and there's no one in the deep to stop that. Expensive over from PK, 25 off it and RPS are off to a flier

Jadeja to Smith, FOUR, errs in line and Smith is too good a player to miss out. Drifts onto the pads, Smith stays on leg-stump and glances it fine. PK at short fine dives just to please the captain, the ball had gone past him
Nehra to Narine, FOUR, stands tall in his crease and rockets the flat-bat smack back over the bowler, wasn't in complete control, but it had enough power to go all the way

Rashid Khan to Uthappa, FOUR, too much of a risk. But when the luck flows for you, you'd better be milking it. And Uthappa does it with aplomb. Sinks and without quite picking the wrong 'un slogs it hard and high. Through the hands of a diving Dhawan at the mid-wicket fence

Nehra to Uthappa, FOUR, leans forward, takes on the short pepper head-on and mows it across the line. Not the timing but once again the placement in finding the gap to bounce it into the cow corner fence

Nehra to Uthappa, FOUR, now he's back to his caresses. More like the Uthappa we know. Moves away, exposes his stumps and Nehra tries his best to evade the reach with a wide yorker. Gets under it and shows the full bat face in lofting it over extra cover
Nehra to M Pandey, FOUR, make it 14 off the over. A length angler with the width pounced on by a backing away Pandey as he imparts all the timing in spanking his punch through the covers.

Rashid Khan to Uthappa, FOUR, irritating runs these. Uthappa's edges are back to deal. Rashid gets some extra bounce on his top-spinner but all that comes in handy with Uthappa looking to sit and slog. The top-edge runs past the keeper

Cutting to M Pandey, FOUR, goes full pace. Only to watch the edge bag a boundary against his name. On the back of a length and outside off as well tempting Pandey to go after it. He flashes hard and the outside tickle takes it through the cordon where no one is

Bipul Sharma to Y Pathan, FOUR, a tossed up invite. And Pathan cannot refuse. With a massive stride in getting right up to the pitch of the delivery, he nails the broom. Whistles away in front of square

Cutting to M Pandey, FOUR, cheeky now. Cutting persists with his yorkers. gets it right too this time. And wide as well to prevent the earlier misery. Pandey however has his bat ramped up with a crouch and guides it using all the pace on offer. Wide of backward point

Nehra to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, misses the blockhole. Just the shot Yadav needed to help himself to his first runs. A low full toss on the pads and whipped away with those enviable wrists. The deep square boundary takes the impact
Nehra to Gambhir, FOUR, plenty of room on offer and Gambhir has nailed the cover-drive to perfection, pierced the gap between cover and extra-cover
Cutting to Uthappa, FOUR, drifting into the pads, Uthappa shuffles a fraction before helping it to the fine leg fence. Easy!
Cutting to Gambhir, FOUR, stands deep inside his crease and exerts all his power on the punchy-drive, gets it past a diving mid-off to his right

Boult to Dhawan, FOUR, width on offer outside off. Dhawan chases it with a slash and gets a fat outside edge. The ball flies past the slip fielder and races away past the ropes. Hits the laptop in the SRH dugout. Probably, the one that of the statsman
