Woakes to Henriques, FOUR, delicacy from Henriques! It was a off-cutter which sat up on the pitch, he uses the width and sends it open-bat faced into the vacant third man region
Woakes to Yuvraj, FOUR, stands tall on his back foot and delivers a perfect pull does Yuvi, picked the right spot to place it too. No-one at deep mid-wicket, one bounce and over the ropes
U Yadav to Yuvraj, FOUR, effortlessly done. Short and down leg, he half-swivels and puts it over short fine with a twirl of his wrists
U Yadav to Deepak Hooda, FOUR, backs away to manufacture the desired room, cuts the length ball in the gap behind point. Smart cricket
Woakes to Cutting, FOUR, Cutting likes the short stuff, he likes pace too. No wonder he's from Brisbane. Rocks a touch back and then smashes the pull through mid-wicket, raced away...
Boult to Bipul Sharma, FOUR, takes his eyes off and pulls a short ball. Top-edge flies over the keeper's head, all these runs count
Boult to Bipul Sharma, FOUR, full and angled in, Bipul stays leg-side of the delivery and biffs it straight, long-on and long-off can't cut it off. Too good
U Yadav to Dhawan, FOUR, stand and deliver. Dhawan stays in his crease, sees the shortish ball come to him and lifts it over mid-on. He stood there and admired his shot

U Yadav to Dhawan, FOUR, not off the middle , but Dhawan won't mind. A length ball on middle and leg, Dhawan moves across and swishes it away. Finds the gap on the on-side and the ball races away into the mid-wicket fence
Boult to Dhawan, FOUR, that's not the greatest of deliveries from Boult! Short ball that sits up nicely for Dhawan to pull it firmly behind square on the on-side

Boult to Warner, FOUR, first boundary for Warner! That was a good ball from Boult. He bowled a sharp bouncer attacking the head of the batsman. Warner, who almost took his eye off it, wasn't afraid to go with his hook shot. Came right off the middle of the middle in the end. One bounce into the fence

Boult to Warner, FOUR, four more! Boult pitches it up this time. Warner presses forward and checks his drive. The ball falls wide and short of GG at covers and the ball rolls into the extra cover fence
Narine to Warner, FOUR, easy to put away. Drifting down leg, all Warner had to do was get a tickle, which he did. No chance for the man at 45 to stop that
Kuldeep Yadav to Warner, FOUR, shot! Typical Warner! Reverses his stance and wallops the sweep over backward point. With both the deep fielders on the on-side, that's an excellent shot
Kuldeep Yadav to Henriques, FOUR, tossed up delivery outside off, not much of spin there and Henriques latches onto it. He smacks the cut behind square on the off-side. The sweeper can't get there

Sandeep Sharma to Samson, FOUR, no, no. Wrong line Sandeep, searches for that banana swing. In the process, sprays it on the pads, the fine leg was inside the ring and easy put away for Samson. Just nurdles it past the man at 45
Sandeep Sharma to Samson, FOUR, candyfloss. Cracking shot from Samson. Leans forward and caresses it through the packed off-side field. Eventful start for DD

Mohit Sharma to Billings, FOUR, not where he exactly intended but he will earn a boundary. Billings gets off the mark with a boundary. Mohit bangs it short, Billings was committed to the pull, was hustled by pace, manages to get it off the higher part of his bat and skews it over mid-on
Mohit Sharma to Billings, FOUR, make that two in a row. Mohit goes shorter again, Billings is bred on English soil. Too easy for him, pulls it wide of mid-on. No need to run for those

Mohit Sharma to Billings, FOUR, with mid-wicket inside the ring, the pull is a safe shot. That is if you get it right. Billings was almost cramped for room, but got the pull high on the bat and placed it to the left of mid-wicket. No chance for long-on to cut it off

Axar to Billings, FOUR, Axar almost deceived his man. Saw the batsman advance and pushed it wider, Billings reached out and lofted it inside out, not off the meat of the bat but had enough to collect a boundary

Maxwell to Pant, FOUR, long-off had around 10 yards to cover and he couldn't get there. That is the power of Pant. Races down the wicket and gets to the pitch of the ball, lofts it hard and over extra cover, one bounce and into the fence

Cariappa to Pant, FOUR, wow! Width offered and Pant is all over it. There was a deep cover fielder and he beat him to his right. Short as well and Pant slaps it in front of square, raced away to the fence

Cariappa to Pant, FOUR, even the mishits are going to the fence, thanks to some sloppy work by Morgan. Short and turning away, Pant pulls and the bottom hand comes off the handle, the ball goes to wide long-on, where Morgan allows it to escape

Aaron to Chris Morris, FOUR, lovely! No fancy shots from Morris. He uses Aaron's extra pace to his advantage, stays leg-side of the short of length delivery, opens the bat face and directs it behind square on the off-side, split backward point and short third man expertly

Aaron to Corey Anderson, FOUR, Anderson reminding everyone that he has the second fastest ODI hundred. The extra delivery costing Aaron four runs. Length delivery right in the slot, Anderson slams it straight down the ground. Almost knocked the umpire off

Sandeep Sharma to Corey Anderson, FOUR, round the wicket and dishes in a full toss, the idea was to nail the yorker, missed and Anderson slices it over the infield on the off-side. The fielder was at deep cover and even though the ball plugged in the outfield, he couldn't get there

Sandeep Sharma to Pat Cummins, FOUR, handy runs these for DD. Not a bad delivery by any means. The wide yorker outside off, Cummins crouches low, opens the bat face and steers it past the diving backward point fielder

Sandeep Sharma to Pat Cummins, FOUR, yorker followed by a slow short of length delivery, Cummins was waiting for that, he stayed on the back foot and pulled it in front of square, bisected deep mid-wicket and long-on to perfection

Sandeep Sharma to Corey Anderson, FOUR, switches to round the wicket for Anderson, misses the yorker by a few inches, Anderson smashes the low full toss straight down the ground. No chance for long-on or long-off

Sandeep Sharma to Billings, FOUR, you don't often see a batsman play sweep shot to a fast bowler. Let's call this Billings special. Buries on one knee and sweeps it fiercely behind square. Races away to the fence in a jiffy
Aaron to Billings, FOUR, wow. That was hammered ferociously. Billings charges down the track and smacks it down the ground
Aaron to Billings, FOUR, Billings is teeing off like a golfer. Uses his feet again, stays a bit leg sidish this time. Fetches the heave from off and directs it through mid-wicket

Aaron to Billings, FOUR, three in a row. Problems aplenty for Aaron. Just not getting his line right. Slants it on the pads, fine leg was inside the ring and Billings will put it away seven days a week and twenty four hours a day. Flicks it past short fine

Aaron to Billings, FOUR, streaky but he won't mind. Aaron sees the batsman back away and hurls it full outside off, Billings throws his bat and gets a thickish outside edge that flies through the vacant slip region

Cariappa to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, top shot from Iyer. Sees the leg-break early, lunges across, opens the bat face and steers it past point. The fielder in the deep gets across and puts in a dive but in vain
Aaron to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, easy-peasy for Iyer. Vrooming down leg, Iyer gets inside the line and tickles it fine

Aaron to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, brilliant placement from Iyer. Bisects two men in the deep to perfection. Showing a piece of geometry that would put Euclid to shame. Aaron strays it on the pads again, Iyer gets right behind it and clips it behind square

Corey Anderson to Miller, FOUR, his first boundary today and it's come off a thick inside edge past short fine. Anderson bowls this in the blockhole just outside off, Miller jams down on it and squirts it away past leg-stump
Zaheer to Axar, FOUR, short and wide, Patel slashes and slashes hard. The edge flies away through to the third man boundary

Zaheer to Mohit Sharma, FOUR, he's unwittingly sliced that over short third man. A knuckle ball outside off, Mohit throws his hands at it, the bat-face opens on impact and the ball beautifully lobs over the infield. A bit of a helicopter from Mohit too

Zaheer to Amla, FOUR, in the air and that's the first boundary of the innings! The knuckle ball on a shortish length, Amla walks down the track and pulls it over mid-wicket. There is no one in the deep and the ball races away
Zaheer to Amla, FOUR, shot! Perhaps, a safe shot. Stands tall, waits for the ball to come to him and launches this short of a good length delivery over mid-off. One bounce and into the fence
Nadeem to Saha, FOUR, flat and slightly short, Saha backs away and carves it over point. Two fielders chase, but can't chase it down

Nadeem to Amla, FOUR, beautiful shot! See the ball, hit the ball, is the mantra. A round-armish delivery from Nadeem, Amla who has taken leg-stump guard, has enough room to free his arms. Strokes it over and wide of mid-off to collect his third boundary

Chris Morris to Amla, FOUR, wow! Elegant. Amla shuffles across a long way and flicks this full ball around off very fine. No chance for the man at short fine leg. The ball reached the fence in a hurry
Pat Cummins to Eoin Morgan, FOUR, shot! Shortish ball that sits up nicely for Morgan to thwack the pull from outside off. Found the gap between mid-on and mid-wicket and the result was a boundary

Pat Cummins to Eoin Morgan, FOUR, a boundary for KXIP after 24 balls. Morgan clears the front leg and spears a full ball through extra-cover. Mid-off was up in the ring and he just had to find the gap
Pat Cummins to Eoin Morgan, FOUR, Morgan again. This time it's short and wide and Morgan slaps it hard through point. It beats the diving fielder inside the ring as well as the one at the boundary

Malinga to Raina, FOUR, and Raina takes full toll of the free-hit. Bends his back knee and crunches the cover drive wide of the diving extra cover fielder. Once it cleared him, there was none stopping that

Malinga to Raina, no ball, FOUR, Malinga oversteps and bowls a length ball on middle and leg. Raina shuffles across and tucks it very fine. The short fine leg fielder is pretty fine as well. Free-hit coming up

Malinga to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, McCullum has had the wood over Malinga in this innings. Continues to collect runs off the Sri Lankan. Full and down leg, McCullum tickles it very fine. No chance for Bumrah in the deep

Bumrah to Karthik, no ball, FOUR, poor from Bumrah. First, he oversteps and the yorker is way outside off, Karthik stays low and drives it square on the off-side. No chance for the sweeper this time around

Bumrah to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, Bumrah has not get his radar right on his yorkers. A low full toss down leg, Kishan is almost down on his knee and swipes it behind square. McClenaghan at fine leg had no chance to cut that off

Bumrah to Karthik, FOUR, this is an ordinary over from Bumrah. 19 runs off it and he like Malinga has been expensive today. Full toss on the pads, Karthik says thank you very much and flicks it behind square leg. The man was up inside the ring and the ball was well away from him

Bumrah to Roy, FOUR, low full toss and Roy thumps it down the ground. Goes deep and leg-side to free his arms, with mid-off in the ring, he just had to place it wide of him, which he does and collects four

McClenaghan to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, short ball and McCullum latches onto it! No pace behind that delivery to trouble. He waits this slower delivery to come to him and pulls it away wide of the man at 45

Bumrah to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, trademark McCullum shot! Dances down to a fast bowler and thwacks this length ball down the ground. No chance for the bowler and the ball reaches the fence in a hurry
Harbhajan to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, another flighted delivery, not much of turn and McCullum brooms it away through mid-wicket. The man in the deep couldn't get there
Krunal Pandya to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, ends the over with a poor ball. Darts it short, McCullum rockets back and pulls it fiercely through the mid-wicket region
Harbhajan to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, one bounce into the fence! Gets down on one leg and middles the slog sweep. Found the gap between long-on and deep mid-wicket to perfection

P Kumar to Nitish Rana, FOUR, top shot to get off the mark! Of course, he was helped by Praveen. Drifting down leg, Rana dances down and flicks it over short fine and the ball bullets away into the fence
Basil Thampi to Nitish Rana, FOUR, stand and deliver! No need to run for shots like that. Length ball that sits up nicely for Rana stand tall and drill it wide of the bowler. No chance for mid-on

Munaf Patel to Rohit, FOUR, that should get him going. First boundary for Rohit this edition. Short and wide delivery, Rohit hangs back and relies on placing the ball, cuts it between backward point and short third man

Munaf Patel to Rohit, FOUR, Munaf is not a happy man. Short and wide outside off, Rohit cuts it over backward point, where the fielder did not make any effort to catch the ball. He might have lost it in the background. Jadeja was the fielder and he simply stood his ground

Dwayne Smith to Pollard, FOUR, goes back to the shortish length and takes the pace off as well, Pollard pulls and is a touch early into the shot, the bottom hand comes off but the ball is in the gap, wide of deep mid-wicket and four more

Andrew Tye to Pollard, FOUR, a pick up shot and that has almost gone the distance. Angled in on off and middle, Pollard flicks it away powerfully. Roy like McCullum was straight at long-on, he can only pick the ball up from the boundary rope

Andrew Tye to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, streaky, but MI won't mind. The knuckle ball on a fuller length, Hardik had the width to free his arms, throws everything he's got and squirts it off the outside edge behind point, right between backward point and short third man

P Kumar to Rohit, FOUR, that must surely do it. Praveen looks befuddled. He comes round the wicket and bowls a low full toss on the stumps, Rohit moves across, crouches low, almost on one knee and paddles it fine. With the fielder inside the ring, that was a smart shot

Munaf Patel to Buttler, FOUR, much needed boundary for MI! Length ball on middle and leg, Buttler moves across and flicks it effortlessly backward of square on the on-side and collects his first boundary
Munaf Patel to Nitish Rana, FOUR, wow! That went like a bullet into the fence. Short and wide outside off, Rana jumps and flashes it hard. The ball flies through the point region and races away
Jadeja to Nitish Rana, FOUR, what a way to get to yout fifty! Second half-century this season. He cuts the shortish ball outside off and pierces the gap between backward point and short third man

SN Thakur to Kohli, FOUR, he's checked this shot down the ground but it still races away off the middle. Back of a length and wide of off, Kohli thinks about a cut but changes his mind midway and just jabs it back. The ball was in the air but Thakur can't get down quick enough because it absolutely raced away

Stokes to Binny, FOUR, pace on the ball from Stokes and he's been put away. That's not how Thakur and Unadkat were bowling. It skids on nicely from a back of a length for Binny and he flays it through backward point

Stokes to Watson, FOUR, it took 39 balls for RCB to get a boundary. And now they've got two in three. Slower ball banged into the pitch outside off, this time Watson gets stuck into it and slashes it into the extra-cover boundary
Christian to Binny, FOUR, normal pace short ball, Binny swings into a pull and it takes a thick top-edge to fly over the wicketkeeper. RCB just about stay in it
SN Thakur to de Villiers, FOUR, what a start from AB! He smokes this off the back foot past backward point. Short and wide from Thakur, and a player of AB's class won't miss out

SN Thakur to Kohli, FOUR, the edge just eludes a flying Stokes at backward point. Nice and full from Thakur, drawing Kohli across into a drive. The ball holds its line slightly to take a thick outside edge. Such a good effort from Stokes. Can't get a hand though

SN Thakur to Kohli, FOUR, Kohli walks at Thakur who bowls a slower ball on middle and leg. That's Kohli's bread and butter shot. A beautiful wristy flick through mid-wicket fetches him another boundary
Badree to Rahane, FOUR, a full toss. First up. Dictates terms right away does Rahane with a lean forward in whipping it through the on-side. Quite a warm up this
Badree to Smith, FOUR, decides to take matters into the leg-side. Reaches out to the pitch of the delivery and forces it with a dragging slog bisecting the men guarding cow corner
Aravind to Smith, FOUR, a wasted delivery. Well down leg and all Smith has to do with these is get some wood. And he gets a whole chunk on it. Flicks it away off his pads

Watson to Smith, FOUR, a real sitter. Quite a nothing delivery this from Watson. Neither full nor short enough. Gives Smith all the time to open himself up and spot the area to place this angry pull of his. Decides it would be cow corner to take the brunt

Watson to Dhoni, FOUR, the edges spoil the over. The scrambled leg-cutter this from Watto with a hint of width as well. Dhoni gets his drive around 90-degrees finer than he had planned. Off the outside edge and through the vacant cordon

Watson to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, a juicy full toss, with generous width dished out as well. Smoked off the middle of the bat sinking onto the front knee as well making it one for the cameras. Pune need a lot more of these

Watson to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, pitched up. Right in the slot to be spanked. And Tiwary doesn't disappoint. Once again leans onto his front knee and just swings his bat through the line. A lot straighter this time

Watson to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, some runs scrapped here. In style rather. Those wrists employed in executing the lofted drive over extra cover. Finding the gap to perfection. Watson for some reason doesn't believe in not dishing out half volleys at this stage of the game

Milne to Tripathi, FOUR, right off the screws. A charge down the track in perpendiculars moving down and away in the same motion. All the breathing space for his arms in slicing it with all the power through the covers
Milne to Tripathi, leg byes, FOUR, down leg. And dealt with a nurdle off the thighs. Going past the glance and runs away into the long leg ropes

Milne to Rahane, FOUR, whoa. Take that for timing. All of it employed here on duty tonight. Leans onto the front leg and shows the full bat face in spanking a lofted drive over the bowler's head. Holds the pose to make it all the more elegant
Milne to Rahane, FOUR, make that 17 off the over. After the polite timing, Rahane gets out his violent streak now. Crashes the cut ferociously. Square like a tracer
Aravind to Tripathi, FOUR, width now. Nothing going Bangalore's way. The length isn't either. A friendly sit up and smashed away with a flaying cut. Reintroduced into the fence

Watson to Rahane, FOUR, deft. Delicate. Cheeky. The wide slip tactic not quite making much sense now. With Rahane using his surgical precision in bisecting the man out there and the keeper with his delayed steer

Watson to Rahane, FOUR, they're racing through. Brings up the half-ton stand as well. Watto decides to get defensive with a wide dart. Not quite the case with Rahane already stooping low and reaching out in drilling it behind point

Badree to Tripathi, FOUR, bursts through the hands. Badree's. Was a polite drill down this squeezing out the fuller one from Tripathi as he smashes it back. The bowler, slow to get low has a boundary against his name

Badree to Dhoni, FOUR, threatens to come down. Charge down in fact. All he does in the process is fool Badree into thinking the same and fire one wide. Adjusts and reaches out in slapping it behind point. A confidence boosting boundary
Badree to Dhoni, FOUR, the punches are out. A wide, short combo this and dealt with a certain degree of aplomb. Shows the leather the full face of the blade and crashes it through backward point
Coulter-Nile to Samson, FOUR, wow! What a shot to get off the mark. Length ball right in the slot for Samson to swing his bat. Stands tall and lofts the on-drive
Coulter-Nile to Samson, FOUR, four more! Samson isn't afraid to play his strokes. Sees the width outside off and throws the kitchen sink. Gets it well wide of backward point. No chance for third man

Woakes to Samson, FOUR, that's timing and placement! "That's class," calls Sunny G on air. Just a hint of width outside off on this back of a length dlivery and Samson just taps it on the off-side. Pierces the gap between backward point and cover-point. The quick outfield does the rest

de Grandhomme to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, beautiful shot. With mid-off up inside the circle, de Grandhomme pitches it up outside off. Iyer spots it and caresses the drive. It was uppish, but in the gap. 12 runs off the tenth over

Kuldeep Yadav to Nair, FOUR, placed to perfection. Flighted on middle, Nair sinks down to one knee and sweeps, not quite off the middle, but got it in the gap at deep square leg. The fielder tries to flick the ball in play, but in vain
U Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, that ruins the over. Like Nair, Iyer also moved to leg, but he kept his options open and didn't committ to one shot, waited for the short ball and cut it behind point
U Yadav to Pant, FOUR, short and outside off, Pant cuts up and over backward point. Used the pace of Umesh and never thought about keeping it down the ground, one bounce and into the fence

U Yadav to Pant, FOUR, geez! He hits them hard. 26 runs off the over and Umesh has taken a pasting. From 1/27 he ends with 1/53. Very full and outside off, Pant drills the drive past the diving extra cover fielder. The ball rocketed to the fence

Narine to Chris Morris, FOUR, you need confidence to play that shot, especially against Narine. The off-break turning in, Morris reverse sweeps it over backward point. Not off the middle, but once it cleared the infield it was going to be four
Woakes to Chris Morris, FOUR, short delivery on middle and leg, that is easy pickings for a South African, Morris swivels and pulls it towards long leg. Bounced just before the ad cushions
Woakes to Chris Morris, FOUR, streaky but DD won't mind. The slower delivery but had the space for Morris to throw the kitchen sink, the outside edge flies fine and down to the third man fence

U Yadav to Billings, FOUR, starts with a leg-stump half-volley and gets the treatment it deserves. Billings leans forward and whips it through mid-wicket and the ball bullets away. No need to run for shots like that

U Yadav to Samson, FOUR, wow! He strokes and stands still on the crease, posing for the photographs. Length ball just outside off, Samson presses forward and caresses the cover drive. Finds the gap superbly

U Yadav to Samson, FOUR, four more! This time he uses the pace and bounce to good effect. 141kph short ball outside off, Samson opens his bat face at the last instant and runs it wide of the keeper. Third man gave it a chase, but in vain

U Yadav to Samson, FOUR, exquisite. He's seeing the cricket ball like a football. All timing. He is not trying to hit the leather hard. Pitched up delivery, Samson leans onto it and drives it between mid-off and extra cover. Umesh Yadav leaks 17 runs off his opening over
Kuldeep Yadav to Billings, FOUR, starts with a full toss on leg. Easy-peasy for Billings. He clips it in front of square on the on-side

Coulter-Nile to Samson, FOUR, cheeky, delicate and effective. Uses the slightest of width on this short ball outside off and sends it wide of the keeper by opening his bat face. It was an off-pace delivery as well. He waited for the ball till the last moment before making contact

Woakes to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, that's harsh on the bowler. That didn't deserve to go to the boundary. It was banged in short and Woakes bent his back there. Iyer is surprised by the pace and bounce on that delivery. He jumps and just sticks his bat out hoping that it doesn't hit him. The ball flies past the keeper off his shoulder and dribbles away into the third man fence. The umpire thinks it came off the bat and gives four runs

de Grandhomme to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, welcome to Delhi says Iyer. Shortish and wide outside off, Iyer treks back and fiercely cuts it behind square on the off-side. Gets it well out of the reach of backward point
Pat Cummins to Gambhir, FOUR, that's a gift and Gambhir accepts it gleefully. Half-volley on off-stump, Gambhir takes it from there and flicks it fiercely past mid-on. Rockets away to the fence
Pat Cummins to Gambhir, FOUR, too full and too easy. Wafted full outside off, Gambhir leans forward, presents a nice high elbow and creams it past mid-off
Pat Cummins to Uthappa, FOUR, Uthappa gets off the mark with a boundary. Pivots back to this short ball and nails the pull in front of square on the on-side
Shami to M Pandey, FOUR, this is intentional stuff from Pandey. Waits in his crease till the last instant, opens the bat face and runs it through the vacant slip region

Zaheer to M Pandey, FOUR, 15 off the over and Zaheer isn't happy. Probably with himself. After serving all those full tosses, he drifts one down leg. Pandey moves across and gets a faint tickle. No chance for Pant who put in a desperate dive. The ball dribbles away into the fence
Chris Morris to Y Pathan, FOUR, this is a gift and Pathan collects it with both hands. Full toss down leg, Pathan gets enough wood on his wild bat-swing and gets it very fine

Chris Morris to M Pandey, FOUR, cheeky shot! Full and on off, Pandey opens his bat face at the last instant and steers it between the keeper and short third man. 10 runs off the wicket, in spite of Pathan's wicket

Chris Morris to Y Pathan, FOUR, elegance written all over it. So flowy and effortless from Pathan. Like a liquid. A fuller length delivery in the slot, Pathan stands motionless and lifts it straight over the bowler's head. Holds the pose for the cameras after playing the shot
Zaheer to Y Pathan, FOUR, that's a stinker and gets punished. Shortens his length but sprays it on leg-stump line. Pathan rolls his wrists and directs it past the man at 45

Pat Cummins to Y Pathan, FOUR, wow. That's a ripper from Cummins. Came out of nowwhere. Bangs it short, rears up viciously. Pathan is startled by the bounce, went for a pull and gets a top-edge onto his helmet. Flies over the keeper's head for a one bounce boundary
Pat Cummins to Y Pathan, FOUR, no half measures this time. Rocks back and butchers it over mid-on. Couple of bounces and into the fence
Pat Cummins to M Pandey, FOUR, the short ball isn't working for Cummins. Pandey backs away and unleashes the pull in front of square on the on-side

Mishra to Y Pathan, FOUR, didn't get it where he intended but still earns himself a boundary. Mishra drops it shorter again, Pathan went for a muscular blow across the line, the ball takes the top-half of the blade and loops over Mishra's head. Races away to the fence

Bhuvneshwar to Maxwell, FOUR, four first ball for Maxwell who has promoted himself to No. 3. Full on leg-stump, the ball is ducking in sharply and Maxwell just about gets some bat on it to help it along while yanking his leg away

Barinder to Vohra, FOUR, lots of width from Sran and Vohra lashes him over cover-point. He had no intentions of keeping it along the ground, which is the way to go when you're going hard at it. Even if an edge is found, it will fly

Barinder to Maxwell, FOUR, right up under Maxwell's bat and he punches it fiercely over mid-on. A full ball on leg-stump, Maxwell opens his stance up, gets his front leg out of the way and times it nicely
Nabi to Vohra, FOUR, too many deliveries on the shorter side in this over and Vohra finally gets hold of one. He rocks back and pulls it away wide of long-on
Nabi to Vohra, FOUR, almost an action replay of the previous shot. An ordinary over from Nabi to complete what has been a fine spell. Short again, Vohra belts it in the same place on the field

Barinder to Vohra, FOUR, what an over this is turning out to be! 18 already with 2 balls to go. He errs in line with this slower ball, gets it full on middle and leg and Vohra whips it wide of deep mid-wicket. The ball sneaks through the fielder as he slides across. Warner isn't happy

Rashid Khan to Vohra, FOUR, the bowler is under pressure too here. Even someone as confident as Rashid. He drops it short, allows Vohra to rock back and he belts it over square leg. Bounces just inside the ropes
Rashid Khan to Vohra, FOUR, massive over. 21 off it. Rashid errs down leg, sits up for Vohra on the hips and he whips it away past short fine leg. He beats deep backward square too

Bhuvneshwar to Vohra, FOUR, Vohra keeps going. He's batting on another planet out there. The timing off his bat, magnificent. This is a full toss in all fairness, Vohra is deep in the crease, he uses the pace and slices it away through point

Rashid Khan to Vohra, FOUR, spots the googly out of the hand and lofts it over mid-off. The line was a bit too wide of off which was a giveaway too. A good forward stride from Vohra before hitting through the line

Rashid Khan to Vohra, FOUR, he's nailed that extra-cover drive too. Rashid under the pump for the first time this season. A little shimmy down the pitch to get close to the pitch and drills it with the turn

Cariappa to Naman Ojha, FOUR, sinks on the sweep. Barely gets himself in control of it. The stride doesn't even get close enough to the pitch of the delivery as he top-edges it in the end. Has a boundary to his name with the man charging in from fine leg sacrificing some runs in the quest of looking to take the catch
Cariappa to Warner, FOUR, the usual trick. But conventional this time. Sweeps with all his muscle and his big bat has it in it to almost take it all the way over

Axar to Naman Ojha, FOUR, the line-looser. Ends up with a freebie going down leg and all he does it get some of his swat on it to take it past the keeper. That's all he had to do. A graceful acceptance
Sandeep Sharma to Warner, FOUR, cheeky. Deft too in equal proportion. Moves away, manufactures room and opens his bat face ever so late in guiding it very fine

Ishant to Warner, FOUR, a juicy full toss. Had to be dispatched. It sure was. But almost laterally opposite to where he was looking for. Tries punching it through the covers, gets it a lot more of the edge than he would have liked and gets it through the cordon. The half-ton of the stand comes up

Mohit Sharma to Warner, FOUR, the loss of radar. Five consecutive half-centuries for Warner against Punjab. Has to be the most difficult one. Certainly the slowest. Gets there with a tuck off his hips in ensuring that it is fine enough for fine leg to cut it off

Axar to Deepak Hooda, FOUR, clears the front leg, adopts the line and then reintroduces the ball into the fence. After quite some time. Much needed this for the crowd to find their lost voice back. Sinks and lofts the drive through the line

Mohit Sharma to Warner, FOUR, moves all around in his crease. Then sits. And turns right handed. Mohit meanwhile fires in a low full toss. Only to watch it be slogged through the tiny gap in the cover fortress
Mohit Sharma to Warner, FOUR, a hang on the front foot and keeps his mace flat as he forearms a smash back past the bowler. So typically Warner

Sandeep Sharma to Dhawan, FOUR, just the ideal sitting up length. Bangs it in but the pitch just doesn't allow the ball to do anything cheeky. Right in the slot and swatted away flat batted through backward square
Cariappa to Warner, FOUR, nails the reverse. Switches grips, turns around, sits down and creams the broom behind square. A whistler this

Milne to Jadeja, FOUR, what's those feet for? Stays put, just lumbers up and uses the width on this short ball to slice the cut uppishly through backward point. Placed it delicately behind the fielder

Watson to Jadeja, FOUR, the line was quite similar again. Angled across tight on off-stump but Jadeja goes for the pull this time. Was prepared on the back foot and swatted it away round the corner, with a deliciously awkward swivel

Aravind to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, Kohli drops a tough chance here, now, now, he better not hurt his shoulder here. That right one is still sore, we all know. Miscues to deep mid-wicket, Virat Kohli hops back to take it, jumps just in time but tips the ball through. Umpires check if it has touched the ropes as VK looks to recover the ball, and he had
Aravind to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, he has to hit them out now. Sees the width and slashes it through backward point.

Aravind to Raina, FOUR, he's turning it on. Makes it 19 off the over courtesy a walk down and a clip off his legs. Another loss in the radar here from Aravind darting it down leg. Raina's ain't complaining though. Just strolls and piles on the misery with a wristy airy flick in front of square

Chahal to Raina, FOUR, the slogs continue. This time off Raina's bat. Walks himself into the line, sees the defensive trajectory on the pads and just whips it off an angled blade. A bounce into the fence behind square
Negi to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, a nothing length this. Too short. Sitting up nicely on the bat. And plundered back into the mid-wicket fence with a flat batted opened up pull

Milne to Finch, FOUR, a real sitter. Tries the surprise slower one dishing this one out at 117kph and just a tickle off the bottom of Finch's wood on the pull is enough to take it into the gap behind square and past the reach of the man running across
Milne to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, a full toss now. With all the men inside the circle at mid-off, even a miscue catching the toe-end of the bat in the extravagant drive means a boundary

Milne to Finch, FOUR, the leakage goes up to 17. Milne keeps digging it short, the pitch doesn't get it up and Finch keeps raking in the boundaries. Is as usual away on the charge, and the bat transforms into a sword as he stabs it in the air. Over point and guess where it goes

D Kulkarni to Kohli, FOUR, was that intentional from Kohli? I don't think so. Where's the slip. In that nagging line outside off where Kohli is susceptible early in his innings. Kohli looks to dab it towards third man and gets an outside edge that flies past the diving keeper

Basil Thampi to Kohli, FOUR, 143kph sharp bouncer that hurries onto the batsman. Kohli persists with his pull shot and gets a top edge that goes over the short fine leg fielder's head. Unfair for the bowler

D Kulkarni to Gayle, FOUR, streaky but Gayle won't mind one bit. Throws his bat at this off-pace delivery, gets a thickish outside edge that flies past a diving short third man. Ishan Kishan was the fielder who dived to his right but to no avail
D Kulkarni to Gayle, FOUR, Gayle is putting on a show here. Shows finesse this time, opens the bat face to this off-cutter outside off and steers it past point. Races away to the fence

Jadeja to Kohli, FOUR, abandons the niceties of 1s and 2s and unfurls his strong bottom hand here. Leans forward, extends his hands and cracks the drive through extra cover. Fielder in the deep gave a chase but in vain. Sublime!

Andrew Tye to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, how cheeky from Jadhav? Sees the full ball outside off, waits in his crease and lets his hands take over. Opens his bat face and dinks it in the pocket between short third man and point

Basil Thampi to Head, FOUR, too predictable. The slower ones, I meant. This was on shortish length outside off, Head deals it with alacrity, fetches the pull from outside off and nails it in front of square
Basil Thampi to Head, FOUR, Head is cutting loose here. Gets under this full ball outside off and thumps it over extra cover
Andrew Tye to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, 10 off first two. fabulous shot. Sets up a solid base, extends his arms and lifts it over extra cover
Andrew Tye to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, drops it short and pays the price. Jadhav takes a step forward, takes on this short ball and short-arm pulls it over square leg. One bounce and over the fence
Jadeja to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, 200-up for RCB. Magnificent shot from Jadhav. Engineers room by backing away to leg and lifts it over cover-point. The ball has enough legs to reach the fence
Jadeja to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, goes the round-armish way but dishes out it outside off, Jadhav lunges across and lofts it over cover. Sort of played a short-arm jab there
D Kulkarni to Kohli, FOUR, shot! This should amplify his confidence. Steps out of his crease and swishes it away through mid-wicket
D Kulkarni to Kohli, FOUR, four more! You don't bowl to this guy on his pads. He will keep punishing you. A wristy clip through square leg. Off the middle of the bat and the ball races away
D Kulkarni to Kohli, FOUR, all timing! A gentle push-drive down the ground. Gets it between the bowler and the mid-off fielder. No chance for either of them

Jadeja to Gayle, FOUR, fired in quick outside off, lots of width on offer. Gayle treks back and punishes it with a punch. The mid-off fielder dived and got a hand to it. But the power off Gayle's bat ensured it crossed the rope
Jadeja to Gayle, FOUR, now he finds the gap. Similar delivery, Gayle thumps it between the bowler and Kohli. The ball bullets away
Jadeja to Gayle, FOUR, four more. Jadeja darts it outside off, Gayle crouches low and bludgeons it over extra cover. No chance for the men in the deep

Andrew Tye to Kohli, FOUR, RCB are going well here. Kohli talked about intent after their loss against RPS. He and Gayle are showing it. Bouncer, Kohli walks across and pulls it very fine. The fine leg fielder was very fine and he had no chance there

Siraj to Billings, FOUR, leading edge for four. The ball just eluded Yuvraj's reach at backward point as he dived to his left. There was just enough nibble for Siraj as Billings closed his bat-face too early. But he timed the edge wonderfully, if that's a thing

Siraj to Billings, FOUR, oh spanked! Pressure on the debutant straightaway. Two fours out of two. He goes short this time and Billings absolutely slaughters him on the front foot. Rockets away through mid-wicket
Siraj to Billings, FOUR, whipped away. Poor ball on leg-stump and Billings times his flick beautifully through mid-wicket. It was hit uppishly but he found the gap pretty well
Henriques to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, 138ks, Iyer thanks him for the pace. Bowled short and in the zone to be ramping it away with an open bat face, times it ever so sweetly does Shreyas Iyer

Siraj to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, exposes all his stumps as he backs away, standing far outside leg-stump. Siraj follows him but doesn't bowl it as close as he would have liked, Iyer cashes on the width and flays it away over point for a once-bounce four
Henriques to Mathews, FOUR, saw the field and preempted the scoopy flick over short fine, got good connection and posted it in the gap. Deep backward square can't get there

Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, innovative and effective from Iyer. Crouches as he stands outside leg-stump, Bhuvi does well to follow him, but Iyer uses the pace to slice the cut over short third man. Just that subtle adjustment of the bat face...
S Kaul to Mathews, FOUR, right in the crash-bang-wallop zone, Mathews clears his front leg and takes him for a tour over mid-wicket. Once bounce and over the ropes
S Kaul to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, full toss on the pads, Iyer helps it away to the left of fine leg. Dhawan tried his best running a few yards across the boundary triangles, but that was timed too well

Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, brilliant from Iyer. That shot has been nipped out from Kohli's locker. Stands deep inside the crease and just opens the bat face to send the yorker between backward point and short third man

Bhuvneshwar to Nair, FOUR, back of a length delivery outside off, Nair firmly punches it through point. Lovely balance at the crease there. Didn't try to do something fancy. Just a proper cricket shot
Bhuvneshwar to Nair, FOUR, oh lovely shot. What hand-eye coordination! His feet didn't move a great deal as he creamed the length ball on the up through cover-point

Siraj to Nair, FOUR, squeezes it through the ring. Full and wide ball, Nair plants his foot across and unfurls a drive through the covers. It didn't look like he get all of the timing, but on this outfield it's enough
Siraj to Nair, FOUR, top-edged over short fine leg. Unlucky Siraj. He's rushed Nair on the pull again and he's not in any control whatsoever
Rashid Khan to Samson, FOUR, drifts it in on leg, it's half-edged, half-deliberate. Samson played slightly outside the line expecting the ball to turn a bit too more but it skids on

Rashid Khan to Nair, FOUR, that's a shot which can eliminate the hassle of picking the turn. As soon as Rashid drifts it close to the stumps, Nair is down on the crease for the sweep and he slaps this nicely through mid-wicket

Henriques to Samson, FOUR, that will run away. Slightly straight from Henriques and Samson has picked him away so easily. The faintest of tickles to get it past the wicketkeeper. He's looking good again

Yuvraj to Samson, FOUR, what an interesting choice of bowler at this stage. Yuvraj for the first time in this tournament, and he's been spanked off the first ball. Short outside off, Samson slaps him hard through point

Jayant Yadav to Dhawan, FOUR, swings hard and gets a boundary. Poor delivery as well from Yadav. A short ball, Dhawan slightly crouches and swishes it through mid-wicket. There is no protection there and Dhawan is away

Pat Cummins to Williamson, FOUR, up and over Cummins. Quicker the delivery and Williamson is so much more comfortable. Low full toss outside off, Williamson walks across and tonks it over the bowler. No chance for long-on or long-off

Mishra to Dhawan, FOUR, rubbish from Mishra and Dhawan deals with it. Darted full and down leg, Dhawan crouches low and helps it along the way past short fine. 100-run stand comes up with that boundary

Zaheer to Williamson, FOUR, buckle up folks this is going to be some contest. Zak with his funky fields and Williamson trying to bisect them. Full and on off, almost a yorker length, Williamson moves across and whips it over backward square. The fielder was inside the ring and he was nowhere near the ball

Mathews to Williamson, FOUR, this is batting of the highest order. The cross-seamer on a fuller length outside off, Williamson takes a step across and lofts it inside out through extra cover. Iyer at sweeper had no chance. The placement was equisite

Mathews to Williamson, FOUR, Williamson has certainly enjoyed batting against Mathews. Slower short ball, Williamson makes room and slaps the pull in front of square, bisecting deep mid-wicket and long-on
Chris Morris to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan takes over the mantle. Short of a length delivery, Dhawan swivels and pulls it over the leaping backward square fielder. Just about eluded Mathews there

Chris Morris to Dhawan, FOUR, streaky and Dhawan won't mind. Morris looks down in frustration. Deceived Dhawan with a slower delivery and the opener just threw his hands at that, the outside edge evades the outstretched left hand of Pant
Zaheer to Henriques, FOUR, charges down and even though Zaheer digs it in short, Henriques pulls with a full pivot of the front leg, split deep mid-wicket and deep square leg to perfection
Zaheer to Henriques, FOUR, Zaheer wanted the yorker, but instead offers a full delivery, Henriques lofts it straight back down the ground, no chance for the man at long-off to cut that off

Chris Morris to Williamson, FOUR, class written all over that shot. Seam-up delivery from a short of length. Width on offer as well. Williamson waits for the ball on the back foot and cuts it behind backward point. No chance for third man

Chris Morris to Dhawan, FOUR, Morris is trying too much here. Bangs it in short and offers ample width outside off for Dhawan to free his arms. Dhawan jumps and elevates it over point. It came right off the middle of the bat

Pat Cummins to Dhawan, FOUR, shot! That was bowled at 143kph. Short of a good length delivery outside off, Dhawan gets on top of it and caresses it between mid-off and extra cover. No need to run for shots like that

Pat Cummins to Dhawan, FOUR, Cummins comes round the wicket and bangs it in short. Dhawan slightly moves across and goes with his pull shot. He wasn't under control, but got enough wood on it to send it wide of the keeper. The boundary also brings up the 50-run stand

Zaheer to Williamson, FOUR, cheeky and effective! Williamson anticipated where Zaheer would bowl and moved across the crease well before the ball was released. Uses the pace on this delivery and laps it over short fine leg. A couple of bounces into the fence

Hardik Pandya to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, and Marsh is off the mark with a boundary. Poor delivery from Pandya, maybe he was trying to bowl the inswinger from just outside off stump but lost control and delivered a ball that was short and wide, easy cut shot through cover-point

McClenaghan to Amla, FOUR, was that another chance? Looked like Nitish Rana got a fingertip to it and would be called a dropped chance. Fullish and angled across outside off stump, Amla squre-drives on the rise, the man at backward point moved to his left and tried to reverse-cup the ball but couldn't hold on
Malinga to Amla, FOUR, slower ball, Amla shows his class. Shuffles forward and towards the delivery and opens the bat face to slice it behind point. Pure timing

Malinga to Amla, FOUR, just a mere extension of the punch. Played it with leaden-feet and timed it to perfection, waited for the full ball to dip and graced it with touch of elegance. Back over the bowler's head for a one-bounce four
Krunal Pandya to Amla, FOUR, cuts and cuts well does Hashim Amla. Stays deep inside the crease and rotates his wrists through a fierce cut, beating a diving backward point to his right
Bumrah to Maxwell, FOUR, pacy bouncer and Maxwell isn't holding back this time. Wields his willow through a fiery pull and top-edges it over the keeper's head

Bumrah to Maxwell, FOUR, that's brutalized behind square on the off-side. That bouncer might have just woken him up. Clears his front leg, waits for the length ball to arrive and smashes it with the amount of power only MAXI can generate. Those Popeye arms..woof!

McClenaghan to Maxwell, FOUR, emergency, emergency! The bowlers are being thrashed, someone send an ambulance. Maxi is putting up a clinic. This is some batting. McClenaghan bowls it straight, marmalized wide of long-on
McClenaghan to Maxwell, no ball, FOUR, front foot no-ball and bang! Maxwell whups a full toss with over a leaping backward point
Malinga to Amla, FOUR, bludgeoned straight down the ground, don't bother looking back Mr Slinga-Malinga
Malinga to Amla, FOUR, full toss on leg-stump, Amla helps it on its way with a flick of his wrists. So easily done. 50 runs from the last 2 overs

McClenaghan to Amla, FOUR, room on offer and Amla uses it to great effect. Carves the short ball over point giving no chance for sweeper cover to cut it off. Amla on fire, just 17 away from the triple treat

Bumrah to Amla, FOUR, across his stumps and way she goes into the fine leg fence. Sweetly timed, Bumrah has no clue. Amla walked a long way across and helped the full delivery with a real tap of the bat. Flew!

Hardik Pandya to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, that's an excellent shot from Marsh. Shortish and rising high, Marsh stood tall and cut it away over point, didn't bother to keep the ball down and it raced to the fence in no time

Hardik Pandya to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, this time he cuts along the ground, the length wasn't all that shorter compared to the previous ball, Marsh timed that shot sweetly as well and pierced the gap between cover-point and cover

Harbhajan to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, that's asking for trouble. Short and way outside off stump, the arm-ball gone wrong, maybe the newish ball slipped out of his hands, Marsh had to reach out and he cut that fiercely past point

McClenaghan to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, the slower ball doesn't stick on the surface and sits up nicely for Marsh to thrash that away for four with a pull shot. Hit with some power and the man in the deep had no chance

Ishant to Buttler, FOUR, steers the ball through point for four. Good length ball outside off, Buttler's feet don't move a lot as he opens the bat-face and guides the ball in the gap. The timing stands out again

Ishant to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, stand and admire! That's a scorching drive. Wow. That's not a half-volley, not even close. But Parthiv still manages to blaze it away on the up. He hit that uppishly but found the gap

Ishant to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, a low full toss. Ishant well and truly on his way to some unwanted bowling figures tonight. Pandya meanwhile just about clears his front leg and slices it past a tired extra cover at the fence. Spare a thought

Ishant to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, and again. Ishant has 58 against his name. A full delivery hoping to veer into the blockhole and Pandya digs it out with the bat gaining all the momentum to be imparted with a smash past the bowler. Long-off doesn't even want to take the effort in chasing this. Futile I tell you

Sandeep Sharma to Buttler, FOUR, with the keeper up, Buttler doesn't give the charge. What he does is back away to make room and laces a drive off the stumps through extra-cover. Sandeep had overpitched there and gets drilled to the boundary

Ishant to Buttler, FOUR, oh dear, is Miller okay? That burst through his hands and hit him on the head. Luckily, it looks like just a glancing blow. The good length ball was hit ferociously by Buttler and it flew towards extra-cover. Would have taken some catching but Miller would normally back himself
Ishant to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, wrong lines from Ishant, and Parthiv will pick him away from there all day everday. Fullish on the pads, he's been flicked away behind square
Mohit Sharma to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, there's no stopping the boundaries. Mohit bangs it in first ball and he's been ramped over the keeper's head. What a start for Mumbai. They're absolutely flying

Mohit Sharma to Buttler, FOUR, picks the slower ball and thumps it through extra-cover. Carnage in Indore. It was a back of length off-cutter and somehow Buttler managed to infuse enough power on the drive off the back foot
Mohit Sharma to Buttler, FOUR, drifts into the pads, and with fine leg up, that's asking for punishment. Buttler duly puts him away to the boundary. Good wristwork

Mohit Sharma to Buttler, FOUR, 17 off the first over from Mohit. I think Maxwell will have to turn to spin. His pacers are disappearing. Slower ball outside off, it's full and in the slot, and Buttler nails him through extra-cover again
Stoinis to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, that's a sizzler! He's absolutely scythed that through point. A little bit of width from Stoinis, Parthiv adds to it by making some room and slashes it away

Stoinis to Buttler, FOUR, sliced in the air, the bat turned on impact there. But Buttler will still get four. He can't do much wrong tonight. Backs away a touch to what was probably a slower ball and is able to place it wide of long-off, the ball turning away from the fielder further after bouncing

Shakib to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, McCullum is underway! Shakib fires it in full on middle, McCullum drills it down the ground. The umpire has to duck under it to evade that. The ball races away into the fence
Shakib to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, offers bit of width outside off and McCullum latches onto it. Treks back in his crease and fiercely cuts through covers. Good start for GL
Narine to Finch, FOUR, shot! Trademark Finch shot. Seam-up delivery wide of off, Finch manufactures more room by backing away. Lifts it inside-out over the cover region
Narine to Raina, FOUR, gets into a picturesque position as he loft-drives Narine over extra cover. On one knee mind you, sweetly timed and in the gap as well
Narine to Raina, FOUR, is quick to jummp onto the back foot, gets inside the line of the flatter delivery and thumps it with a clean swing of the willow. A boundary behind square on the leg-side

Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, FOUR, deft! Raina camps deep inside the crease and steers the ball with softest of touches as he opens the bat face at the right moment. Needed a dive from Narine at short third man, he is just lazing around
Kuldeep Yadav to Dwayne Smith, FOUR. No sighters. Walk in and get a boundary. As simple as that. Slog-sweeps from outside off and boy! The ball flies away
Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, FOUR, just a slice of inside edge and through. It skids straight on and nicks the edge before racing past the leg-stump. Tough for Robbie to pick
U Yadav to Raina, FOUR, there's the width which Raina has been eyeing. It's on the shorter side too, and Raina is able to lash it away past backward point. Beats third man to the boundary
Coulter-Nile to Raina, FOUR, length ball outside off, Raina moves leg-side and slaps it straight back past the bowler. Mid-off was up inside the ring, and Raina is able to slot it to his left

Coulter-Nile to Raina, FOUR, he's winning it for his team. Makes some room and nearly slices this overpitched delivery from off-stump. The placement is spot on, so is the timing as he nails this past backward point

Coulter-Nile to Jadeja, FOUR, Jadeja seals it with a boundary! Short from Coulter-Nile, enough width for Jadeja to slap it past backward point. Superb chase from the Gujarat Lions to hopefully provide a boost to their turbulent campaign
Narine to Finch, FOUR, 16 off the over. Short, seam-up delivery outside off, cracking cut well in front of square on the off-side
Shakib to Finch, FOUR, wow! He has muscled it. With mid-on inside the cirlce, that's a safe shot. Backs away a tad and tonks this fullish delivery over mid-on
Shakib to Finch, FOUR, this is brilliant batting from the Victorian. Sees it in his slot and lifts it handsomely over mid-on

Coulter-Nile to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, that came right off the middle of the bat. Angling in short of length delivery, McCullum jogs down and leg-side-ish to cut it behind a diving backward point. No chance whatsoever for third man

Coulter-Nile to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, 16 off the fourth over. Superb adjustment. Seeing McCullum jogging down, Coulter-Nile darts it outside off, McCullum spots it slices it backward of point. One bounce into the fence
Shakib to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, shot! McCullum moves leg-side and Shakib follows him and darts it in. McCullum crouches low and smacks it with a sweep through backward square leg
Woakes to Raina, FOUR, room on offer and Raina makes the most of it. Adjusted well as he rose high to flay it past a diving backward point

Woakes to Raina, FOUR, quintessential Suresh Raina inside-out loft over extra cover. Anyone surprised? He does this so often and that too off the first ball of the over. Makes room and goes bang off the middle

P Kumar to Narine, FOUR, that's Daren Sammy alike from Sunil Narine. The former is very good with his whip without moving his feet much and Narine has emulated him. The line is straight on the stumps from PK, Narine stands and flicks stylishly over backward square leg and beats the man at fine leg

P Kumar to Narine, FOUR, now that's some response from Narine. He knows that the outswinger is troubling him, steps down the pitch and forces the bowler to drop it short, which will not allow the ball to swing, and then he goes back over the bowler's head for a boundary

P Kumar to Narine, FOUR, he's doing it nicely, Sunil Narine! Just what Gambhir and Co. wanted with the promotion. PK bowls short of length and just outside off stump, Narine waits for the ball to come and hits through the line over mid-on

Faulkner to Narine, FOUR, Faulkner sports an "Ooohhhh," with a wry smile on his face. This wasn't a bad delivery. Full and swinging away outside off stump, Narine drives without moving his feet, sends it to the right of mid-off and it races away
Faulkner to Narine, FOUR, that's edged and no one at slip. Faulkner delivers one outside off stump, Narine goes hard at it and gets a thick edge that escapes past the keeper

Faulkner to Narine, FOUR, off the back foot and over mid-off. This is great exhibition of batting from the West Indian. Short of a length just outside off stump, Narine lofts nicely from the middle of the bat and collects his sixth boundary

D Kulkarni to Uthappa, FOUR, deft, delicate and effective. The off-cutter outside off, Uthappa waited for the ball to arrive, cut it late and pierced short third man and backward point to perfection. He couldn't have played that better

Faulkner to Uthappa, FOUR, the idea was to steer it to third man, but Uthappa got it finer than he would have liked. Slower delivery angled across the batsman, Uthappa gets an edge that eludes Karthik to his right. Should he have gone for the catch? Tough one to call

Faulkner to M Pandey, FOUR, that was just a nudge and the lightning fast Kolkata outfield does the rest. Short of length and on the batsman's hips, Pandey backed away and twirled his wrists to place it wide of short fine leg, once in the gap it was a boundary
Jadeja to Uthappa, FOUR, uses the pace of Jadeja and collects a boundary. Pushed through just outside off, Uthappa waits and steers it fine. Once past the 30-yard circle, there's no stopping that

Jadeja to Uthappa, FOUR, fifty for Uthappa. Second for him this season. Gets there with a cheeky little scoop. Expects Jadeja to target the stumps, shuffles across and gets low, then laps it over Karthik to bring up the milestone

Basil Thampi to Uthappa, FOUR, that might be the commentators curse. Thampi missed the yorker by a few yards, low full toss on middle, Uthappa flicks it to the fine leg fence. The fast outfield on display again

Basil Thampi to Uthappa, FOUR, the ball hits the turf and zips off. McCullum had a few yards to cover and he couldn't get there. Very full and just outside off, Uthappa lofts it wide of long-off, one bounce four

P Kumar to Y Pathan, FOUR, top shot! PK missed his yorker by a couple of inches and that was enough for Pathan, he opened the bat face on the loft and placed it wide of long-off. The opening of the bat was important to get the placement right

P Kumar to Y Pathan, FOUR, last two balls ruins the over for PK. It was turning out to be a good over until then. Full toss on middle and leg, Pathan whips it square and there's no protection in the deep, 12 off the over
Basil Thampi to M Pandey, FOUR, full toss and Pandey cashes in. He stands deep in the crease and slices the drive square on the off-side, sweeper had no chance of cutting that off

Faulkner to Narine, FOUR, he's only dealing in boundaries. Faulkner tried the change of pace to fox the batsman, but it went too full and landed right in the slot for Narine to drive, credit to Narine for delaying the shot to get the timing right and hit it well wide of the man at long-off

Basil Thampi to Narine, FOUR, this is almost predictable. Basil Thampi has the pace to trouble Narine, so one could see the bouncer coming. Narine was already backing away before the bowler delivered the ball and easily managed to pull it over mid-on

Basil Thampi to Narine, FOUR, the idea was right from Basil Thampi - to opt for a fuller one as follow up for the bumper - the execution was poor. It's a full toss and Narine slices the drive over cover-point

D Kulkarni to Uthappa, FOUR, that's a gift from Kulkarni. Short of a length delivery down the leg-side, Uthappa flicks, the outfield is fast, the ball races through backward square leg and fine leg had no chance
D Kulkarni to Gambhir, FOUR, that's too wide and Gambhir is a very good off-side player. Reaches out to meet the ball, was on a fuller length, creamed through cover from the middle of the bat
Raina to Uthappa, FOUR, very straight, Uthappa kneels down and pulls it along the ground through square leg, no protection in the deep. Looked like the ball came off the inside half of the bat

Dwayne Smith to Gambhir, 4 runs, oh dear, Jadeja misses the stumps and it's gone for four overthrows. A direct-hit would have seen Gambhir walk back though. It looked very interesting when he chose the striker's end, despite Uthappa being halfway down the pitch. Should have been a dot ball, but it's four runs now. Gambhir tapped this to point and thought about a run, took a couple of steps out of the crease, his partner was charging towards the other end, but Gambhir sent him back. All well in the end for KKR
Siraj to Dhoni, FOUR, he's helicopter-slashed it through backward point. Not a great delivery. It's short and wide from Siraj, just the kind of ball Dhoni needs to break his shackles

S Kaul to Stokes, FOUR, carves it beautifully over extra-cover. Kaul slanted it away outside off and Stokes used the angle to his advantage. It looked like he got it close to the bottom of the bat but it still flies away

Bhuvneshwar to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, questions are bound to be raised over Tiwary's batting position. To my mind at least, he's been in stunning form of late. Such brilliant timing as he whips a full ball from outside off through mid-wicket. RPS needed that finish to what had been a quiet over
Siraj to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, walks across towards off and effortlessly picks it away over backward square leg. Brilliantly timed yet again. Fine leg was up inside the ring and Tiwary picked his spot

Siraj to Dhoni, FOUR, he's getting into his stride now. An upper-cut over backward point for four. Siraj goes short outside off, it's not a very safe delivery with third man up. It's not a safe delivery at all. Dhoni keeps his shape, doesn't go very hard and just glides it over the fielder

Bhuvneshwar to Dhoni, FOUR, gets it between his own legs and gets it for four. So unfortunate for Bhuvneshwar. It's a cracking delivery this. Almost a yorker at the stumps, Dhoni tries to whip it away but nutmegs himself off a thick inside edge and splits square leg and short fine
Bhuvneshwar to Dhoni, FOUR, full and very wide outside off, Dhoni reaches out and slices it over backward point. Dhoni is turning the tables now

S Kaul to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, that's been dropped right at the edge of the boundary. A swirling swipe from Tiwary, the ball gets caught up in the wind and presents the opportunity to Rashid at deep mid-wicket. The ropes would have been on his mind all the time as he's treading a thin line. And he spills the catch

Bhuvneshwar to Tripathi, FOUR, Tripathi breaks the shackles! Runs down the track, looked like he lost his shape on the shot, ends up slapping it through extra-cover, beats the infield and rolls away to the fence

Bhuvneshwar to Tripathi, FOUR, edged and four, perfect length from Bhuvneshwar, fraction fuller and a hint of shape away from off, brought Tripathi forward into the defensive push, he nibbled at that, gets a thick edge and the ball races away past the keeper and into the fence
S Kaul to Dhoni, FOUR, MS Dhoni is back! He's back to what he does best. Kaul misses his mark, bowls it full in the slot and Dhoni spears him through extra-cover for the boundary
Bipul Sharma to Tripathi, FOUR, tossed up outside leg, Tripathi was looking to play the sweep, gets a fat top-edge, fine leg was inside the ring and the ball lobs him, into the fence

Bipul Sharma to Smith, FOUR, lovely shot, Smith comes down the track, gets to the ball on the half-volley and lifts it back over the bowler's head, almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes

Siraj to Tripathi, FOUR, this is even better, length delivery outside off, Tripathi comes down the track, makes room as he did so and cracks it square on the off-side, hit on the up and in the gap past point
S Kaul to Tripathi, FOUR, .. and he repeats the dose .. once again on the up after shimmying down the track, hits it in the air and in the gap between cover and mid-off, no need to run for those
Rashid Khan to Tripathi, FOUR, lovely shot, tad too short from Rashid, allows Tripathi to rock back and pull it wide of mid-wicket, no need to run for those

Unadkat to Dhawan, FOUR, down the track to ram the ball down the ground. He didn't quite get to the pitch of it as Unadkat saw him coming, but went through the line regardless. Beats mid-on comfortably

Stokes to Williamson, FOUR, cracking shot, expensive over from Stokes, short and on the stumps, Williamson swivels across, rolls his wrists and bisects the two men in the deep on the on-side, rolls away to the fence in a hurry
SN Thakur to Henriques, FOUR, too short from Thakur, can't bowl that length with his pace. Henriques is quick to rock back and clears mid-wicket with the pull, a few bounces and over the ropes
SN Thakur to Henriques, FOUR, lovely, back-to-back boundaries for Henriques, runs down the track, gets close to the ball and drives it past the diving fielder at mid-off

Christian to Warner, FOUR, that's a poor ball from Christian, third man was inside the ring and he went full and wide outside off, Warner reached out for the slice, gets a thick outside edge that cleared the man in the ring

Unadkat to Henriques, FOUR, beautifully played, Henriques is playing a fine hand here, short and wide from Unadkat, Henriques waits on it, uses the pace on the ball and cuts it behind square on the off-side, beats backward point and rolls away to the fence
SN Thakur to Deepak Hooda, FOUR, edged and four, SRH will take these runs, length delivery outside off, Hooda swung across the line, gets a big edge that flies through the vacant first slip region

SN Thakur to Henriques, FOUR, nicely played by Henriques, he's playing a gem of a cameo here. Fraction short and wide of off, Henriques backs away, waits on the ball and cuts it in front of square on the off-side, beats point to his right this time and rolls away to the fence

SN Thakur to Deepak Hooda, FOUR, cheeky and four, this was slower bouncer from Thakur. Hooda waits on it and ramps it over Dhoni's head, third man was inside the ring and the ball rolls away to the fence

SN Thakur to Henriques, FOUR, nicely bowled but even better played by Henriques, raises his fifty as well. Thakur saw Henriques backing away, followed him with a full ball. Henriques makes room, plays with an open face and drives it through cover, no need to run for those

SN Thakur to Henriques, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Henriques, this was full and on the stumps, Henriques was backing away, plays with an open face and finds the gap behind square on the off-side, no one moved

Unadkat to Dhawan, FOUR, presses forward causing the bowler to shorten his length, quickly transfers his weight onto the back foot and spanks the pull through mid-wicket. Unadkat didn't get a lot of height with that and it sat up

Washington Sundar to Dhawan, FOUR, this time he goes fuller, and a little bit wider outside off, and allows Dhawan the room to free his arms. He's quickly onto the back knee to sweep it away through mid-wicket

Stokes to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan seems to have gained tremendously from his fifty the other day. He's playing with a good amount of confidence and fluency. Back of a length outside off, he punches it away with flair past backward point

SN Thakur to Warner, FOUR, doesn't nail the timing again but he's hit it with enough power to beat mid-on to his right. A full ball slanted in on off, Warner shovels it away down the ground with a lot of bottom hand

SN Thakur to Warner, FOUR, rather than using a horizontal bat this time, he just steers this past short third man and into the boundary. It was a slower ball from Thakur so wasn't a lot of pace to work with. But the timing is exquisite from Warner

Washington Sundar to Dhawan, FOUR, that's such a good shot and so difficult to do against Sundar. He's able to gallop down to the pitch of the ball to lift it back over the bowler's head. Really well played
Johnson to Samson, FOUR, crunched! Johnson pounds it short of length around off, Samson stands tall and punches it through the crowded off-side field, the ball races away to the fence

Johnson to Samson, FOUR, consecutive boundaries to finish an eventful first over. Too straight, on middle and leg, Samson flicks it off his pads past the square leg umpire, the quick outfield does the rest
McClenaghan to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, poor delivery and Iyer is off the mark. Slips it onto the legs, just needed a tickle and Iyer got plenty of wood on that, the ball raced away to the fine leg fence

Bumrah to Rabada, FOUR, chipped up. Was a serious miscue. But pockets a boundary for his efforts. With no one at the fence, thanks to all the wickets falling around, Rabada lofts it uppishly off the cue end over mid-off. That's all he had to do

Bumrah to Rabada, FOUR, the French cut now. Rabada keeping the flag fluttering up there. Gets himself too close for the cut but swishes through. Chops it off the under edge past the keeper. So very French
Johnson to Chris Morris, FOUR, brings up the 50 of the stand. A real fightback this. And gets there in some style as well with a lovely looking square cut. Guess what, there is no one out there

Krunal Pandya to Chris Morris, FOUR, brilliance to end in some sloppiness. A punishing drive this from Morris through the covers and the other KP runs around, swoops and dives to cut off what was meant to be a certain boundary. But in his attempt to get up and throw has his back leg spike brush the boundary cushions. Oh dear, the misery gets worse
McClenaghan to Chris Morris, FOUR, here comes the streak. Morris gives it his all, just throws his bat out at a short, wide pepper. Only manages a top-edge. More than enough to fly through the cordon
Hardik Pandya to Chris Morris, FOUR, keeps them in the hunt. Gets low on a knee and throws the bat out in carving it square. In the gap too. 19 needed off 4

Harbhajan to Rabada, FOUR, almost another. Rabada after getting squared up thanks to the nagging angle being created out here just throws his bat up looking to cut the ball away. Races away off the top-edge and flies through the hands of slip. Rohit the man out there. Too quick for the classification to come under a drop

Hardik Pandya to Rabada, FOUR, oh glorious. As clean as it could get. A pitched up delivery in the arc and Rabada gives his top order a facepalm moment with a full bat face presentation. Whizzes past the bowler
Harbhajan to Chris Morris, FOUR, would need many more of these. A wide liner this from Bhajji and Morris capitalizes with a reverse as he brooms it past the lone man perched at point
Chris Morris to Buttler, FOUR. Edged. One-bounce. Four. The fluke pays off. Buttler comes dancing down the track and slices the flash-drive off the outside edge. Raced away!
Zaheer to Krunal Pandya, FOUR. No pace. Krunal Pandya picked the bones out it. Shuffles towards the line of the ball and smears it in the gap between mid-off and extra cover

Zaheer to Pollard, FOUR, fine delivery that didn't deserve a boundary. Short delivery right under the batsman's throat, Pollard was backing away and was hurried on the pull, the top-edge flies away fine, one bounce and into the fence

Zaheer to Pollard, FOUR, second boundary of the over for Pollard. He holds the key for MI. Zaheer goes full and Pollard says thank you very much, drilled down the ground past mid-off. That ends Zaheer's spell, 4-0-36-0. He's still searching for his 100th IPL wicket

Mishra to Pollard, FOUR, smashed! The crowd are slowly finding their voices again. Flighted just outside off, Pollard drives it down the ground. How hard did he strike that? He didn't bother to run, that sums it up

Pat Cummins to Pollard, FOUR, would you believe it? Morris allows the ball to escape past him. Has his hands up to apologise to Cummins. Short delivery and Pollard pulls it without much timing. Morris was reluctant to come for the catch. Tries to take it on the bounce, but the side spins beats him

Chris Morris to Johnson, FOUR, streaky! But Johnson won't mind. He's off the mark in this IPL with a boundary. Very full and on leg-stump, Johnson slogs and the inside edge evades the leg-stump, runs away to the fine leg fence

Zaheer to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, pure timing. Just put bat to ball and the timing will take care of the rest. The thing that coaches tell you. PP did just that to a leg-side dart, dances away to the mid-wicket fence beating a desperate dive from one of the fielders
Zaheer to Buttler, FOUR. Help-me please. Leg-side fodder, Buttler tickles it fine
Zaheer to Buttler, FOUR. Right into his plate. Sits up perfectly for Buttler, he lifts it with lovely extension of the arms over extra cover
Mishra to Nitish Rana, FOUR, picks the length and reverse-sweeps Amit Mishra through backward point. There was a slip in place, but he got the timing right. Risky, but worth it

Sandeep Sharma to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, McCullum is off and running. No sighters needed. Short of length around off, McCullum hops a bit and directs the cut square on the off-side. There was a man at sweeper but he couldn't get there, such was the timing
Mohit Sharma to Raina, FOUR, easy peasy. Can't bowl on the legs of any batsman. Raina shuffles across to get inside the line, helps it along the way past the man at 45. Off the mark with a boundary
Axar to Jadeja, FOUR, the boundary that they will need in every over from now has come. Was a bit short, Jadeja went back and thrashed past the man at cover

Axar to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, not the kind of fielding effort you need. Dwayne Smith got on his knee and helped this flatter ball with a half-sweep. The man from deep backward square leg ran to his right, got to it but fumbled when it mattered the most
Axar to Andrew Tye, FOUR, gets low and across to use the inward angle from Axar, helps past the man at short fine leg. Welcome boundary

Sandeep Sharma to Karthik, FOUR, the length is great on this one but the line is awful. On the legs of Karthik and he whips it through backward of square leg. Now they have got the four, need to make it count

Sandeep Sharma to Andrew Tye, FOUR, short ball, comes late to Andrew Tye - that is what the shot suggested. Andrew Tye is early on the pull and slices off the outer edge, over the head of the keeper and into the fine leg fence

Sandeep Sharma to Karthik, FOUR, there's risk involved but he has to take all that is on offer. Karthik reverse sweeps this full ball to place it between short third man and backward point. This is his first fifty of the seaons. Will it be in a winning cause?
Sandeep Sharma to Basil Thampi, FOUR, aims for the blockhole and does well. Basil Thampi inside edges the drive past the keeper into the fine leg fence

Sandeep Sharma to Raina, FOUR, when Raina is in form, he plays some audacious shots. This was not a bad ball by any means, length ball around off, Raina swats it over mid-wicket and wide of mid-on. That was dealt with disdain

Sandeep Sharma to Raina, FOUR, top shot! Sandeep switches to round the wicket, fires in a low full toss around off, Raina stays low, opens the bat face and threads it behind point, right between short third man and backward point

Cariappa to Raina, FOUR, two fielders dived and both could not stop the ball. Trifle short and Raina is quick to go back and whip it, first beats the dive of mid-on and then deep mid-wicket's. Placed to perfection

Mohit Sharma to Karthik, FOUR, a gift first up for Karthik. Short delivery at 128kph, sat up nicely for the in form keeper, who swivels across and pulls it neatly behind square, well away from the short fine leg fielder
Cariappa to Karthik, FOUR, half tracker and Karthik pounces on it. It was the carrom ball and turning away, Karthik rocked back and slapped it in front of square, no chance for the man sweeping
Axar to Karthik, FOUR, rubbish to start off from Axar. Long hop asking to be punished, Karthik obliges, rocks back and pulls it in front of square on the leg-side, one bounce and into the fence

Stoinis to Karthik, FOUR, the little things in cricket cost you so much. Karthik should have never been on strike, but thanks to Maxwell he was and he collects a boundary. Slower short delivery and Karthik swiveled to pull it behind square, good connection as the ball bounced only once before reaching the fence
Shubham Agarwal to Amla, FOUR, and he is away, in style. Gets a tossed up delivery just outside off. Stays leg-side and drives past cover, in the gap
Shubham Agarwal to Amla, FOUR, poor ball to finish the over. And Amla won't let those go. It's short and wide.. well not that wide but wide enough for Amla to stay back and crack the cut past point

Nathu Singh to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, not off the meat of the bat. But still runs away to the fence. Was angled across around off and Shaun Marsh drove from the crease; toe-ended but had enough to get it past the fielders near the cover region
Andrew Tye to Amla, FOUR, clips it fine after getting across. Fetches a four to the fine leg fence to bring up his fifty

Basil Thampi to Amla, FOUR, shoddy from McCullum. You rarely associate that word with him. Full delivery on off, Amla jams the drive into the pitch and bounces over Thampi, McCullum from mid-off runs across and lets it through. No one to cover him and that's four more to Amla

Jadeja to Amla, FOUR, Amla's fast hands on display. Quicker and just outside off, Amla stays leg-side of the ball and brings his hands down on the ball, lofted inside out over extra cover, one bounce four
Jadeja to Maxwell, FOUR, Maxwell toys with Jadeja. Plants his front leg across the stumps and hoicks it behind square. Maintained a low base to get underneath the ball and that was the key

Andrew Tye to Axar, FOUR, shot! Stand and deliver stuff from Axar. It was the normal speed delivery and right in the slot, Axar didn't have to move much, extends his arms and lofts it straight back over Tye. A much needed boundary for KXIP

Basil Thampi to Axar, FOUR, bang! Axar strikes them really hard. Thampi missed the yorker length by a good couple of inches, Axar pumps the drive straight down the ground. Rocketed to the fence and beat long-off with ease

Dwayne Smith to Axar, FOUR, streaky! Angled across the left-hander, Axar throws everything he's got at it, the outside edge flies away fine to the third man fence. The man was inside the ring and he had no chance
Raina to Amla, FOUR, and again. Raina is shortish again and on seeing that Amla retreats, opens the face of the bat on the punch and cracks it through cover

Basil Thampi to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, cross-batted heave from Shaun Marsh. The angle was taking it across him but he took his chance, did not get it off the middle. But had enough to beat the man running from deep square leg to his right

Basil Thampi to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, that just about spoils the over for Thampi. Ended up giving room to Shaun Marsh just outside off. Enough for the latter to camp back and pierce the gap through point with a cut

Andrew Tye to Amla, FOUR, Punjab have got boundaries but not all of them have been well timed ones. This one too is not. Amla makes room, tries to go flat-bat on this short ball. Mistimes but does well to get it just over the fielder at mid-off
Andrew Tye to Amla, FOUR, too full a ball on off. Cannot be termed a poor ball but the brilliance of Amla. Opens the bat-face at the last moment and squeezes it square on the off-side

Shubham Agarwal to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, dances down the track again. Shubham Agarwal smartly bowls it wide but does not get away. Shaun Marsh manages to reach on the drive and cracks it to the deep cover fence
