Jadeja to Amla, FOUR, flatter this time. This is a result of what happened on the previous ball. Ends up on the legs of Amla, who helps it to the fine leg fence with a little sweet tuck
Badree to Narine, FOUR, cracking shot, that's a shot of a batsman, Narine comes down the track, gets close to the ball and drills it through extra-cover
Badree to Narine, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Narine, shimmies down the track, gets close to the ball and lifts it back over the bowler's head, a couple of bounces and over the fence
Badree to Narine, FOUR, three in a row for Narine, comes down the track to a well flighted delivery and lifts it over Gayle at short extra-cover. This is a smashing start from KKR

Badree to M Pandey, FOUR, lovely shot, width on offer from Badree, it was short as well. Manish plays with an open face and carves it behind square on the off-side, beats the man at backward point and rolls away to the fence

Negi to Woakes, FOUR, risky but four, pushed through flatter and on the stumps, Woakes backed away, exposed his stumps and gets a thick edge on the cut, rolls away past Kohli at slip and into the fence

Negi to Woakes, FOUR, takes on the tease, takes on the invite and gets himself a pressure releiving boundary. Clears his front leg, steps aside as well in the process and goes inside-out with his lofted drive

Aravind to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, a sweep off a seamer. A major punch on the ego for sure. 127kph, on the sitting up length in the slot and Yadav strolls well across, sits on a knee and unleashes a flat bat to place it to perfection behind square

Tymal Mills to Woakes, FOUR, length balls at this stage. Woakes keeps up with the tradition of putting them away. Gets right iunder it with a burial and just swings his bat through the line. All the timing in spanking it through extra cover

Aravind to Gambhir, FOUR, edged and four, it was deliberate from Gambhir, but was too close for comfort. Short of a good length and well outside off, Gambhir played with an open face and dabs it past Gayle at slip, rolls away to the fence
Aravind to Narine, FOUR, Narine continues to make merry, back of a length and just outside off, Narine prods across and pulls it back over the bowler's head, a few bounces and over the ropes

Aravind to Narine, FOUR, this will hurt RCB! Nothing wrong with the ball, just a fraction short and wide of off, Narine makes room and punches it in front of square on the off-side, splits the gap past cover and rolls away to the fence. KKR are off to a flier once again

Tymal Mills to Uthappa, FOUR, lovely shot, fraction overpitched and just outside off, Uthappa leans forward, presents the full face of the bat and drives it back past the bowler. AB dives but can't stop it, neither does the other diving fielder at mid-on

Binny to Uthappa, FOUR, sublime timing from Uthappa, length delivery on the stumps, Uthappa leans across and clips it towards mid-wicket, it was in the air but well wide of the fielder, races away to the fence in a hurry
Binny to Narine, FOUR, fuller length delivery outside off, the width was there and Narine threw his bat at that, ended up slicing it over backward point and into the fence

U Yadav to de Villiers, FOUR, away in style. Umesh tries the surprise full ball coming back in. Just that his opponent is a master of these tricks. Out-thinks him with a shuffle to clip it away through mid-wicket. Off and running, with some timing

Coulter-Nile to de Villiers, FOUR, a wasted delivery. Not quite the line to bowl to the best bat in these situations. Straying down leg hoping to swing it away and clips it behind square. Not quite the ideal one with a 7-2 field

Coulter-Nile to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, the streaky edge comes into play. Doesn't matter, it is the free hit. Throws his bat out at a wide delivery and takes the edge to ensure that it flies past second slip
Coulter-Nile to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, oh glorious. In the midst of the madness of wickets tumbling, we have another spanking drive unleashed. Full, wide and carves it away with a square slap
Coulter-Nile to Binny, FOUR, a release. Full, wide and squeezes it out with a ferocious square drive. Over point and ensures that it keeps wide of third man

U Yadav to Gayle, FOUR, his first boundary. Off a top edge. He wouldn't complain though. Another well-directed short bouncer squares Gayle completely after getting him opened up and. He responds with a slash of the horizontal bat and the streaky edge flies almost into the third man ropes
U Yadav to Binny, FOUR, width. Asking for the slap, gets the slap. But finds it just wide of Pandey;s full stretched dive at point. Rushes away `
Woakes to Aravind, FOUR, he checks the drive as the ball stops on him from a length, but the timing is splendid. It flies away over extra-cover for a boundary

SN Thakur to Buttler, FOUR, third man is up and Buttler squirts it right off the toe-edge to squeeze this through the gap. A poor delivery from Thakur. This is way too short and wide and although Buttler almost failed to reach out, it deserved the punishment that it got

SN Thakur to Buttler, FOUR, he's tickled that off middle and leg stump. Buttler walks right across, gets a full ball on the pads and just about gets his bat down in time. Would have been plumb had he missed
Unadkat to Rohit, FOUR, walks across. Sits down. Gets under the fuller delivery and scoops it over the keeper. Almost off the toe end but with the field behind square up in the circle it seems safe
Stokes to Pollard, FOUR, here's the brute. A short one here that refuses to get up. A bare 123kph and Pollard spanks it with utter disdain. Pulls the leather off it to mid-wicket

Tahir to Rohit, FOUR, a beastly slog. Opens and picks out the top-spinner half way down the track with a swivel to dispatch it just past the reach of a diving Rahane at mid-wicket. Takes his finger tips along as well
Stokes to Rohit, FOUR, take that. You bowl length at your own peril. Stokes learns it the harsh way. A mighty swing of the bat and a punishing drill through the covers
Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, he doesn't believe in gentle nudges. Gets a back of a length sitter in the arc and flat bats it with all his might over extra cover

Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, ruins it further. Hangs back patiently on the back foot toying around with the bowler's mind in waiting for the short-slower combo to get to him. When he does, he heaves and posts it bisecting the two men converging at cow corner

Washington Sundar to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, just over mid-on. He was itching to break free. It's slightly fuller from Sundar, but Parthiv isn't quite to the pitch of it. But he goes through with the loft. Enough on that to clear the infield
Washington Sundar to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, that's what he was looking for all this time. Width on offer. Parthiv lashes it away through backward point
Washington Sundar to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, third boundary of the over as Sundar drops it short again and this time, Parthiv pulls him away to the deep mid-wicket boundary

Unadkat to Buttler, FOUR, that's unfortunate for Unadkat. He's deceived Buttler for lack of pace while also bowling it wide of off with Buttler swinging leg-side. The cutter grips a touch, takes a thick edge and flies fine of short third man

SN Thakur to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, poor from Thakur. He strays in line again. That's not what Pune want at this stage as they strive to crank up the pressure. Parthiv picks it off his hips and glances it past short fine leg
Christian to Rohit, FOUR, wow. That's been driven on the up and over mid-on. Powerfully struck from Rohit. Maybe he's decided that's the way he wants to go today
Tahir to Rohit, FOUR, that's beautifully done from Rohit. He was initially beaten by the turn on this leg-break, but he didn't commit so he was able to open the bat-face and steer it past slip
Tahir to Rohit, FOUR, that's a magnificent shot against the turn. But because it was so full, he really didn't have to worry about it. Drifting in on middle, Rohit whips it away over mid-wicket

McClenaghan to Tripathi, FOUR, almost a maximum. Dances down the track and elevates this shortish ball over point with a fierce cut. He played it uppishly and almost got the distance. One bounce and into the fence

Karn Sharma to Smith, FOUR, Smith will use his feet against the spinners. Is quick to get out of the box and gets to the pitch of the flighted delivery, thumps it past the bowler. Karn had no chance to even get a fingertip on that

Karn Sharma to Smith, FOUR, that's adding salt to the wound. Karn drags the length back and Smith is all over it, uses the depth of the crease to hammer the pull past the diving mid-wicket fielder, no one in the deep to stop that

Johnson to Stokes, FOUR, gift first up for Stokes and he says thank you very much. Fired full and down leg, might have been the attempted yorker, Stokes helps it away fine and the pace of Johnson takes care of the rest

McClenaghan to Stokes, FOUR, streaky! Not where he intended but will take the final result. Steps out and aims for a nudge into the on-side, the inside edge nutmegs him and runs away to the fine leg fence

Johnson to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, in the air and just short of Hardik at mid-off. Johnson stays round the wicket, the cross-seamer outside off, Tiwary checks his drive and the ball lobs towards mid-off, dips in front of Hardik and runs away to the fence

Johnson to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries. Follows up the full delivery with a short one, Tiwary is on one leg to pull it away behind square leg. The man was inside the ring and there was no one stopping that

McClenaghan to Christian, FOUR, cracking shot! Brings up the 150. Half volley and not many batsmen miss out. Christian clears his front leg and pumps the drive through extra cover. No one at sweeper cover to stop it
Bumrah to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, dug in short and Tiwary fetched the pull from outside off, not off the meat but the key thing was he got it in the gap, between deep mid-wicket and long-on

Bumrah to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, Bumrah misses the yorker and Tiwary thrashes it away. He gets underneath the ball and smashes it towards the cow corner fence, one bounce and into the fence. Good start to the over

McClenaghan to Rahane, FOUR, good looking shot. McClenaghan pitches it up and Rahane meets it with a straight-batted drive. The bowler can't stop it and the mid-on fielder can't get there with a dive. Races away into the fence

Johnson to Rahane, FOUR, wow! Just a mere push and the ball dribbles away into the fence. Johnson comes round the wicket and darts it in full just outside off, Rahane prods forward and middles the straight drive/push. Gets it well wide of mid-off and the quick outfield does the rest

Bumrah to Rahane, FOUR, nice shot! There wasn't room there for Rahane to free his arms. He goes deep in his crease and manufactures his own to cut it through covers. A teasing chase for the cover fielder. Escorts the ball till the fence

Karn Sharma to Rahane, FOUR, nice shot to end the powerplay.Eleven runs off the over. Karn Sharma slightly tosses it up, Rahane hangs back and flicks it wide of mid-on. Once it cleared the fielder, there was none to stop that
McClenaghan to Tripathi, FOUR, McClenaghan drops it short and Tripathi stays in his crease and cuts it over backward point

McClenaghan to Tripathi, FOUR, McClenaghan shortens his length seeing Tripathi come down. He looks to cut and gets it off the toe end. The ball evades the keeper and runs away into the third man fence
McClenaghan to Rahane, FOUR, short of a good length delivery, Rahane nails the pull well in front of square on the leg-side. This is turning out to be an expensive over
Unadkat to Narine, FOUR, easy. Don't bother. When you have such good hands, just put bat to ball. Short of a length, sat up wide of off-stump, Narine flays it over point. Period.
SN Thakur to Narine, FOUR. Well placed. Needles the gap between mid-off and extra cover with a firm drive. Lot of bottom hand power on that
SN Thakur to Narine, FOUR, throws his bat at a wide delivery and gets four. Thick edge and it races away past the cordon
Unadkat to Gambhir, FOUR, up and over! Rises on his toes and lifts a wide ball with a flat bat, over cover and into the fence

Tripathi to Uthappa, FOUR, slower, much slower short ball. Uthappa has all the time in the world to place the pull behind square on the on-side to tease the man from deep square to give it a valiant chase

Tripathi to Gambhir, FOUR, ton for the combo!! That was deft, cute, earns a four with the help of an open face of the bat. The dive from the man at short third man spelt agony for Pune. The match continues to slip away
Christian to Gambhir, FOUR, ramps the ball over the man at point and that will run away for another four. This is turning out to be a canter for KKR

SN Thakur to Darren Bravo, FOUR, crunches the drive through the covers and that is it! KKR win!! They will spring to the top of the points table thanks to this mauling. The target of 183 never ever looked enough. Going back to the final ball: in the zone and Darren Bravo threaded the ball into the gap with a lot of muscle power
SN Thakur to Uthappa, FOUR. Just stand and deposit. Stays firm and picks the length early to lash a one-bounce four over mid-on, just an extension of the drive
Washington Sundar to Gambhir, FOUR, he does this time. Rocks back and nails the cut square on the off-side. No-one moved
Washington Sundar to Gambhir, FOUR, half-volley. Errs in length and Gambhir makes full use of...Times the pants of a drive through extra cover
Christian to Uthappa, FOUR, street-smart cricket. Saw third man was inside the ring, just opens the bat face and runs it fine of him. Lovely

Tahir to Uthappa, FOUR, dropped by Unadkat. He has made a habit of hurting his head this lad. A complete mistimed cross bat swing from Robbie, swirls high and looks to be setting safe into the hands of deep mid-wicket. Unadkat keeps swirling with the ball, lands awkwardly on his back as he bumps his head onto the ground. To make matters worse, it dribbles away to the boundary triangles
Tahir to Gambhir, FOUR, advances, gets to the pitch of the delivery and nails the straight drive. Take four
Washington Sundar to Uthappa, FOUR. Deft. Uses the crease to make subtle adjustments and glides a slider with a silk touch down to third man
Unadkat to Uthappa, FOUR, gorgeous. So pleasing to the eye. Watches the ball bull-eyed and extends his arms over the loft over mid-off. Pure timing

Unadkat to Uthappa, FOUR, vintage Uthappa. Shuffles outside his off-stump and hacks one into the deep backward square area. The key was he watched the ball till the last minute and ensured he dropped the stroke in no-man's land

U Yadav to Tripathi, FOUR, edged and four, that will go down as a chance, but it climbed over Uthappa, he had no chance of taking it. Short of a length and shaping away from outside off, Tripathi was rooted to his crease as he frailed at that, got a thin edge that flew over the keeper's outstretched gloves

Kuldeep Yadav to Rahane, FOUR, loosener from Kuldeep. Rank long hop on off, Rahane had all the time in the world to go deep in the crease and pull it in front of square, wide of deep mid-wicket and Rahane is getting a move on

Chawla to Rahane, FOUR, beautiful! Such a good cricketing shot. Rahane backs away to go inside out, Chawla fires it on the stumps, enough room to loft it handsomely over extra cover. One bounce and into the fence

Kuldeep Yadav to Smith, FOUR, precise placement from captain Smith. Floaty chinaman turning in around off, Smith stays low and plays the half sweep/pull, in the air and bisecting the two fielders in front of square on the leg-side
Narine to Smith, FOUR, streaky! Short and turning in, Smith goes with all his might on the cut, the ball takes the top-edge and flies away fine. No chance for Yusuf to haul that in

Chawla to Dhoni, FOUR, more sloppiness. This time Yusuf lets one through the legs. Dhoni comes down the track and flicks it to mid-wicket, straightforward stop and Yusuf makes a mess of it. Right through him and Dhoni is underway

Narine to Smith, FOUR, second time Smith has got a streaky boundary off Narine. Short and wide outside off, he throws the bat on the cut, right off the cue-end and the ball runs away fine to the third man fence

Woakes to Rahane, FOUR, cracking shot, long half-volley on Rahane's pads, that's easy pickings for him, prods across and clips it in front of square on the on-side. The man in the deep is square and has no chance

U Yadav to Tripathi, FOUR, lovely, much better from Tripathi, should make him feel much better. This was a back of a length delivery outside off, he stands tall, gets on top of the bounce and punches it in front of square on the off-side, beats cover and rolls away to the fence
U Yadav to Tripathi, FOUR, beautifully played, just a little shimmy down the track, Tripathi made room as he did so, drives it on the up and beats cover-point to his right, no need to run for those
Woakes to Tripathi, FOUR, smashed, length delivery outside off, Tripathi comes down the track, takes it on a half-volley length and drills it back past the bowler, no need to run for those
Narine to Tripathi, FOUR, nicely played by Tripathi, makes rom to a well flighted delivery, gets down on his knee and goes inside out over cover-point, a few bounces and over the ropes

Narine to Tripathi, FOUR, Tripathi isn't afraid of the mystery bowler, gets down low, uses his reach to good effect and sweeps it to the right of square leg, beats the diving fielder and rolls away to the fence

Narine to Tripathi, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Tripathi, almost an action replay of the previous shot, gets down low to a well flighted delivery and sweeps it in front of square on the on-side, the fielder at square dives to his left and can't stop it, ends the powerplay in style

de Grandhomme to Smith, FOUR, lovely shot, friendly full-toss from de Grandhomme and Smith takes full toll of it, shuffles across and shovels it in front of square on the on-side, beats the man getting across from the deep

Chawla to Rahane, FOUR, cracking shot, tossed up just outside off, Rahane bends down low, gets on top of the bounce, rolls his wrists over and sweeps it in front of square on the on-side. de Grandhomme has no chance - getting across to his right from deep mid-wicket

Badree to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, goes with the spin and gives it a full whack. Quick to rock back, pulls as hard as he can, Mandeep Singh from long-on does well to make a diving stop, but he seems to have made contact with the boundary triangles, the boot to be precise

Badree to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, looks as if Ishan Kishan has been given the license to express himself. Six balls, six whacks. Stamps his weight on the back foot and powers a biff-drive past a diving mid-off
Aravind to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, superb stroke! Punched off the middle, don't move! Uses the crease to adjust his feet movements as he unveils it in the gap between cover and point
Chahal to Raina, FOUR, flighted on middle, there's no one at square leg and Raina is quickly down on his knees to sweep him to the boundary
Chahal to Finch, FOUR, he's just toying with them. It's his day today. Chahal tosses this leg-break up outside off and Finch swats the reverse-sweep away very fine. All intentional, all in control

Head to Raina, FOUR, that's a really good shot. It's inside-out but it's off the back foot which is not easy to do at all. Flat from Head and sliding in, Raina stays in the crease and somehow finds the power to lift it over extra-cover and take it to the boundary
Head to Raina, FOUR, another one. He's timed this even better. Up and over extra-cover, the fielder dives in the deep but the ball sneaks through
Badree to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, short, inviting. Ishan Kishan clears his front leg and pulls it in the gap behind square square, there's no-one there and that will be an easy boundary
Aravind to Finch, FOUR, plenty of width, Finch throws the bat and gets a thick edge which races away to the third man fence
Aravind to Finch, FOUR, makes room while clearing his front leg and bludgeons Sreenath Aravind straight down the ground. Can't slot fielders for that kind of a shot

Aniket Choudhary to Finch, FOUR, mistimed, but worth it. He saw there was no-one at deep mid-wicket, takes on the short ball and despite the ball getting big on him, he pulls full-throttle. Excellent batting
Aniket Choudhary to Finch, FOUR, he is picking the gaps to perfection tonight. Covers for the line and lofts gorgeously over extra cover. He is turning it on...
Chahal to Raina, FOUR, slides this way too wide outside off and Raina reaches out to dab it away for his first boundary. Hasn't been himself today, maybe this will get him going

Jadeja to Negi, FOUR, not where he intended, but RCB will take any run now. They have become like golddust. Quicker around off, Negi goes for the steer and chops it off the under edge, nutmegs Karthik and runs away to the boundary

Jadeja to Negi, FOUR, again. Once more Jadeja fires it across the left-hander, Negi still does not get the connection right on the dab, races away fine off the under edge and no chance for short third man

Faulkner to Negi, FOUR, Negi welcomes Faulkner with a superb drive. He makes a bit of room to open up the off-side field, Faulkner helps his cause by dishing it full, pumped through extra cover and wide of long-off
Faulkner to Mandeep, leg byes, FOUR, back of a length on off, Mandeep is early into the pull. The ball kisses the back thigh and escapes past Karthik, he dived over the ball there. Bonus runs for RCB

Basil Thampi to Aniket Choudhary, FOUR, finally a boundary after 30 balls. Gets the crowd and cheerleaders going. They have been quiet all evening. Low full toss and Choudhary drives it uppishly wide of extra cover, Finch at long-off gave up the chase very early

Nathu Singh to Gayle, FOUR, slashes at that, the ball creams the outer part of the bat and goes between short third man and backward point for a four. It was full and well outside off. The bait was there and Gayle didn't back off

Basil Thampi to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, short delivery and the batsman is quick to latch on it. The short deliveries were getting predictable and the batsman rocked back to slaughter that. The man in the deep - Tye, dives but fails to pull it back
Basil Thampi to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, strays on the fuller side with length, on the pads with the line, flicked nonchalantly over the man at short fine leg for a four. Kedar is away!

Basil Thampi to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, up and over screams Danny. Short ball zoning into the batsman, Kedar Jadhav archs his body back and uppercuts the ball away over the man at point for a four. Hat-trick of fours and RCB try to break the shackles

Jadeja to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, uncocks the wrists on impact and goes inside out to get a four over cover. One bounce into the fence. Shot of the day so far. The execution looked serene despite not a lot of followthrough with the bat. Just a suplex of the wrists

Coulter-Nile to Nair, FOUR, first boundary of the match, short and angling into Karun's hips, he gets inside the line and tucks it behind square on the on-side. Fine leg was inside the ring and the ball rolls away to the fence

U Yadav to Samson, FOUR, nicely played by Samson, short of a length and on the stumps, he leans forward, presents the full face of the bat and flicks it over mid-wicket, beats the infield and rolls away to the fence
de Grandhomme to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, dragged down short delivery and down onto the leg-side, the batsman swivels on the pull and gets it fine past the man at short fine leg for a four

U Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, Looks to heave the ball away, the ball trims the leading edge and soars up for the man at third man to make a meal of that. The ball bounced up after landing in front of the man at third man - Pathan, who tipped the ball over the bar
U Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, poor ball, tickled away past the man at short fine leg and back-to-back boundaries get Delhi off a to a good start in this over
Narine to Pant, FOUR, drops it short does Narine and the batsman scooters back to pounce on it. Munches the cut past the man at backward point to send the ball racing into the fence
Coulter-Nile to Chris Morris, FOUR, short, wide, room, batsman cashes in. Opens the face of the blade and gets a four. Just used the pace of the bowler

Coulter-Nile to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, that was an explosive drive from Shreyas Iyer. Full and wide, the batsman threw the kitchen sink piled with utensils to spear that between cover and mid-off. Iyer is getting a move-on

Coulter-Nile to Bawne, FOUR, full on the sticks, the batsman winds up for the heave and picks the delivery away into the on-side for a four. There was no one square on the on-side and a four to start the over

Coulter-Nile to Nair, FOUR, too straight from Coulter-Nile, ends up drifting onto Karun's pads, he uses the pace on the ball and flicks it behind square on the on-side. The man in the deep was very square and has no chance

Coulter-Nile to Nair, FOUR, lovely, no wonder - the Daredevils are backing him despite poor form. This is a top shot, 'exquisite - a proper cricket shot', gushes KP on air. Nothing wrong with the ball, on a good length and just outside off, Karun leans forward, drives it on the up and splits the gap past cover-point, no need to run for those

Coulter-Nile to Samson, FOUR, nicely played by Samson, back of a length and just outside off, he waits on it, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and taps it past the lone slip, beats the man getting across from third man

Woakes to Samson, FOUR, beautifully played, on a good length and just outside off, Samson leans forward, drives it on the up and splits the gap between cover and cover-point, rolls away to the fence in a hurry

Woakes to Samson, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Samson, this is some supreme batting from the two Daredevils openers. Cross seasm delivery from Woakes, but it's short and wide of off, Samson waits on it and cuts it behind square on the off-side, beats the inner ring and rolls away to the fence

Zaheer to Narine, FOUR, there's the width and there's the first boundary for Narine. No feet movement at all from the spinner, stands his ground and slashes it off the outer half to third man, the fielder was inside the ring and it turned out to be a safe shot

Rabada to Uthappa, FOUR, Iyer helps Uthappa to get off the mark with a boundary. Full and drifting onto the pads, Uthappa with the kind of form he's in, clips it through mid-wicket. Iyer did the hard work of getting to the ball, but slipped while gathering it

Rabada to Uthappa, byes, FOUR, Pant had no chance. 147kph bumper that kept climbing, Uthappa ducked under it and evaded it with ease, but unfortunately Pant couldn't glove it even with a full stretch upwards
Corey Anderson to Gambhir, FOUR, this is gentle pace from Anderson. At 127kph, he has tried to bang it in short. The ball sits up for Gambhir and he pulls it off the waist through mid-wicket

Corey Anderson to Gambhir, FOUR, so much time for Gambhir against someone of Anderson's pace. The ball is short and wide, Gambhir plants his back foot a foot outside the off-stump to get to the ball and then slices it away past backward point into the boundary. Brings up two milestones with this one shot. Another fifty for him, as well as 6000 T20 runs
Mishra to Gambhir, FOUR, really poor delivery from Mishra. He strays in line, tosses it up on leg stump and all Gambhir does is paddle him away fine into the boundary

Mishra to Gambhir, FOUR, that's a tired dive from Zaheer at backward point. He's struggling with his hamstring too, so can't really blame him. But Mishra is just seething. He turns around in disgust. But this is awful bowling to begin with. Bowls it short and wide again, and Gambhir slices it neatly to the left of Zaheer. A younger fielder would have stopped that
Mishra to M Pandey, FOUR, drops it short again and Pandey swats him to the right of long-on to finish a truly horrendous over from Mishra. 13 off it
Chris Morris to Jackson, FOUR, that's more of a steer than a cut. Width on offer from Morris as he starts a new spell, Jackson times it beautifully as he guides it past backward point

Chris Morris to Gambhir, FOUR, DD are just waiting for this to get over. The field is well up. Morris bowls it full just outside off and Gambhir just has to get his placement right as he drives through extra-cover

Chris Morris to Jackson, FOUR, a good little cameo this from Jackson. He's handling himself really well. Short of length into the body, he swivels nicely and pulls it away through backward square. Uppish but in the gap
Rabada to Gambhir, FOUR, flicked away to the mid-wicket boundary. No one bothers to move. Huge open space in the field. Poor from DD. Not at all mindful of the net run rate
Corey Anderson to Gambhir, FOUR, first ball from Anderson and it is smashed for four. Short, wide and Gambhir had the width to free his arms, slaps it behind point and third man had no chance

Pat Cummins to Gambhir, FOUR, errs in line and that is enough for Gambhir to collect a boundary. On leg-stump, Gambhir gets inside the line and uses Cummins's pace to glance it past the diving short fine fielder
Rabada to Uthappa, leg byes, FOUR, sprays it down leg, Uthappa can't meet with the tickle, but the ball brushes the pad to beat Pant to his left. Poor ball that from Rabada

Rabada to Uthappa, FOUR, in the air and just over the leaping mid-on fielder. Uthappa is early into the pick up shot, more of a leading edge and the ball balloons over a backtracking mid-on fielder. The practice wickets take care of the rest

Mishra to Gambhir, FOUR, greeted with a dance down the wicket, gets right to the pitch of the flighted delivery and lofts it with the turn over mid-wicket, one bounce and into the fence. He's one of the best players of spin

Mishra to Uthappa, FOUR, now Uthappa uses the pace of Mishra to pick up a boundary. He waits and waits for the ball to arrive, then at the last second opens the bat face and runs it past the slip fielder

Mishra to Gambhir, FOUR, lovely shot! Another 50+ stand for the duo. Continuing from where they had left off in Pune. Loopy leg-break on the stumps, Gambhir makes just a bit of room and chips it beautifully inside out. The onus was on timing rather than power. Long-off dived in vain to stop that
Chris Morris to Uthappa, FOUR, full on off and middle, Uthappa flicks it uppishly over the mid-wicket fielder. Not timed well enough but has enough fuel to collect himself a boundary

Pat Cummins to Uthappa, FOUR, in the air and over the fielder. Cummins pitches it up and Uthappa does not need a second invitation, drives in the air and over Mishra at mid-off. Even a full length jump from Mishy wasn't enough

Corey Anderson to Gambhir, FOUR, the runs keep flowing. The 100 is up for KKR. The equation is down to a run-a-ball. This should be a cake walk. Banged in halfway down the wicket, Gambhir swats the pull over mid-wicket. He had to really reach out and did well to avoid the fielder

Bhuvneshwar to Guptill, FOUR, guess it was against Pakistan in 2016 World T20 Guptill played a superb knock. He knows the conditions well here. Doesn't move much, gets inside the line of a fullish delivery and lifts the drive over extra cover
Bhuvneshwar to Guptill, FOUR, inswinger, Guptill exposes all his stumps and spanks it straight down the ground. Sheer power
Nehra to Guptill, FOUR. Whang! Guptill is making full use of the opportunity. Clears his front leg and smokes a full ball over mid-on. There's Warner at long-on, but he can't get there in time
Henriques to Eoin Morgan, FOUR, drops a dolly short for the batsman to slap the ball away through the covers for a four. Eoin Morgan is away

Henriques to Eoin Morgan, FOUR, action replay of the previous ball and that has been powered away through the covers. The man at sweeper cover despite not having to cover a lot to his right, ends up being a spectator

Rashid Khan to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, the partnership between Shaun Marsh and Eoin Morgan is now 50. Short ball, flatter in trajectory and the batsman stays back to cut it away between short third man and point

Henriques to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, length ball at the sticks and the batsman slashes the ball away across the line and threads it between long-on and deep mid-wicket. Fifty for Marsh! Another valuable knock from the run-machine from Punjab
Henriques to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, BOOM! Flat bats the short ball and Warner at long-on had no chance to grab that. Even the FEDEX would have been proud of that forehand smash

Henriques to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, Hooda was hoodoo-ed there! Drops a skier at deep mid-wicket. The short ball it was, Shaun Marsh took on the bait and managed a huge top-edge. The fielder in the deep made a meal of it as it went through his hands and to make matters worse, the ball bobbled away into the fence

Rashid Khan to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, jumps out, takes the ball on the half-volley and then goes straight down the ground. On a bounce and into the fence goes the ball. The use of the feet ensured Shaun Marsh got an important four against the leggie

S Kaul to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, short delivery and slightly wide as well. The batsman opens his arms and cuts it away. Hooda in the deep puts in the slide but the ball goes away from him to hit the cushion

S Kaul to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, another chance for Shaun Marsh! This time Warner at deep mid-wicket allows the ball to burst through his fingers. Warner came in and then missed it. That was walloped though. The ball lands into a puddle

Bhuvneshwar to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, Marsh cooking up some great momentum now. Flurry of boundaries. Low full toss from Bhuvneshwar as he misses the wide yorker. Marsh uses the pace and steers it to split short third man and backward point
Nehra to Axar, FOUR, right off the toe-end of the bat as Axar chases a very wide ball from Nehra, squirts it away past the keeper into the third man boundary. Went very fine
Nehra to Axar, FOUR, overpitched outside off and Axar crashes it through extra-cover. Blistering shot. He's in some good hitting form, carrying on from the last match
S Kaul to Anureet Singh, FOUR, dipping slower full toss, 113kph, Anureet swings it away to the square leg boundary. Kaul disgusted with himself

Bhuvneshwar to Anureet Singh, FOUR, Anureet has unintentionally played the perfect slice to split short third man and backward point. He just swings hard at this length ball, wanting it carve it over extra-cover. The bat face opens beautifully on impact and the ball pops perfectly into the gap

Nehra to Ishant, FOUR, Nehra not impressed, either by the effort from the keeper, or by Ishant's attempt at a pull. Ishant is rushed by this short of length ball and sends an outside edge past the diving Ojha into the third man boundary

Nehra to Guptill, FOUR, mid-on chases...chases...chases and the ball wins the race. Not quite off the middle, but Guptill will take it. Slogs a length ball across the line to the right of mid-on where Siddarth Kaul comes second in the race
Nehra to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, lovely, lovely shot! Pitched up outside off, Marsh drives on the up and gets it in the gap between cover and extra cover
Nehra to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, waits on the slower ball and cuts it at the last possible second. Bhuvi at third man runs to his right and puts in a dive, couldn't quite get his body behind the ball
S Kaul to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, short ball, angling away outside off, Marsh gets a thick top-edge on the pull which sails over the keeper for a one-bounce four
Deepak Hooda to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, poor first ball from Hooda, dropped it short and wide of off, Marsh makes room and crunches it wide of point, no need to run for those

Deepak Hooda to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, another boundary and Marsh is piling it on. Hooda overcompensates and drops one short and wide of off, Marsh makes room and punches it in front of square on the off-side, beats mid-off and rolls away to the fence

Henriques to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, Marsh is looking in sublime touch! Width on offer from Henriques, a gentle loosener to start, he leans back and cuts it square on the off-side, beats the fielder in the ring and rolls away to the fence

Anureet Singh to Dhawan, FOUR, first boundary for SRH. It was marginally short and Dhawan is on it in a flash. Quickly transfers his weight and pulls it to deep mid-wicket. The fielder there had no chance of cutting that

Anureet Singh to Dhawan, FOUR, this is poor from Anureet Singh. Sprays it down the leg side, all Dhawan had to do was to get some wood. He gets plenty of it and the ball races down to the fine leg fence in a jiffy
Cariappa to Dhawan, FOUR, in his half and he smashes it for a one-bounce four over mid-wicket. Good, clean swing of the bat
Mohit Sharma to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan seems to be in mood today. Shuffles across his stumps and dispatches a slower ball with a thumping flick wide of short fine
Mohit Sharma to Williamson, FOUR, on the pads, he will hit those all day long. All Williamson needed to do was to get bat on ball, tickled away with ease

Cariappa to Yuvraj, FOUR, should have been a single, but a bit of bad bounce adds to Vohra's woes as he ends up conceding a boundary. Yuvi lifts the drive on seeing the line wide of off and gets a lucky a boundary
Cariappa to Yuvraj, FOUR, full toss, plenty of room on offer and Yuvi flays it away square on the off-side
Ishant to Williamson, FOUR, too full and wide, Williamson reaches out and uses his bat angle to slice it fine of third man. There's a desperate dive, but the timing was too good
Ishant to Williamson, FOUR, too much width and Williamson says thank you. Crouches and pierces the gap between backward point and short third. Amazing

Mohit Sharma to Williamson, FOUR, boy look at that strike-rate! He is watching the ball like a hawk tonight. Shuffles a long way across and scoops Mohit Sharma's slower delivery over short fine to bring up his fifty
Mohit Sharma to Warner, FOUR, that's crashed into the fence. Full length delivery on the stumps and Warner won't stop himself from clearing his front foot and nailing one to long-on
Mohit Sharma to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan picks the length quickly. Stands tall and pulls it well in front of square. Gets his third boundary with that
Axar to Warner, FOUR, what a shot that is. Nothing wrong with the delivery. Warner gives himself room and thumps it wide of mid-off. No chance of stopping those
Ishant to Dhawan, FOUR, angles it into the left-hander. Dhawan slogs across the line and hits it to deep mid-wicket. Didn't get it where he wanted, but had enough bat to fetch him a boundary
Cariappa to Dhawan, FOUR, two good balls followed by a poor one. Fires it down the leg side, Dhawan gets his paddle out. Short fine leg fielder is just a spectator
Anureet Singh to Dhawan, FOUR, streaky runs for Dhawan. Has a wry smile after that. Slogs across the line and gets a thick inside edge past the keeper. Wasn't far away from the stumps either
Anureet Singh to Warner, FOUR, short delivery down the leg. Not the ideal length to be bowling at that pace for Warner, who waits for the ball and turns it to vacant deep square leg
Anureet Singh to Warner, FOUR, this is class from Warner. Anureet Singh corrects his line but still goes for four as Warner waits for it longer and steers it past point. Third man had no chance

Maxwell to Dhawan, FOUR, poor line from Maxwell. Dhawan helps it down to fine leg and gets another boundary. Actually it was clever bowling from Maxwell, he saw Dhawan race down and fired it down leg, but the southpaw outdid him
Unadkat to Kohli, FOUR, cracking shot, width on offer from Unadkat, Kohli leans into the ball and cracks it in front of square on the off-side, splits the gap past point and rolls away to the fence

Chahar to Kohli, FOUR, creamed, but that was poor fielding from Tahir, went down in a heap and ended up diving over the ball. On a good length and well outside off, Kohli leans into the drive and finds the gap past cover. Tahir ran to his right and made a big mess of it
Chahar to Kohli, FOUR, edged and four, width on offer from Chahar, Kohli's eyes lit up, threw the kitchen sink at that, gets a thick edge that races away through the vacant slip cordon

Chahar to Kohli, FOUR, lovely, the best of the lot, it was a long half-volley from Chahar, on Kohli's pads, he presses across and flicks it in front of square on the on-side, the man in the deep has no chance

Christian to Aravind, FOUR, that's a good lofted drive, but RPS have won by a massive 61 runs. This will lift their net run rate by some margin. Is that it then for RCB? Maybe they still have an outside chance
Christian to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, nice way to get going, tad shorter and wider of off, Kedar is quick to rock back and pulls it high and over mid-on, a few bounces and over the ropes
Badree to Smith, FOUR, is quick to transfer his weight onto the back foot, and why? He spotted the length early, which is short, and smashed the cut behind point
Badree to Smith, FOUR, tweaks a touch outside off, Smith goes with hard hands as he looks to go stright of mid-off/cover. Thick outside edge escapes past the keeper
Binny to Smith, FOUR, thank you so much says Smith. Can't bowl there. On the pads, he gets his front leg away and bullies it behind square with sheer timing
Binny to Smith, FOUR, errs on the other side now. Too much width outside off, Smith adjusts his bat angle to smack it in the gap between backward point and short third

Milne to Dhoni, FOUR, there you go! There's no stopping. MS knows when to fancy his chances, cross-seam delivery with lot of room on offer, he cashes on the the opportunity as he slashes the cut behind point
Milne to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, whack! Short ball angling into the body, Tiwary gets into good position and telegraphs the pull to the left of fine leg

Milne to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, streaky but Tiwary won't mind. The Chineese cut as they say. Full, dipping in around the blockhole area, Tiwary flashes hard and a smidge of inside edge does the trick for him. Skims past the leg-stump and rushes down to the fine leg fence
Aravind to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, jumps down the pitch and looks to mow across the line. The bat face turns on impact and the leading edge runs wide of a diving short third. Much-needed boundary that
Milne to Tripathi, FOUR, short ball and Tripathi takes full toll of it. Gets into a good position and smack the pull through mid-wicket
Milne to Tripathi, FOUR, short ball at the body, Tripathi looks to pull and gets an inside edge that runs away into the fine leg fence. No chance for the man at 45
Badree to Smith, FOUR, slightly overpitched and Smith puts it away! He gets low and slog sweeps it behind square leg. What an excellent shot to get off the mark
Chahal to Tripathi, FOUR, backs away and slashes the drive between cover and point. The ball races away into the fence. The batsman manufactured his own room
Chahal to Tripathi, FOUR, good looking shot. Jogs down the track, gets to the pitch and lofts it over mid-on. The man at deep mid-wicket runs across, but couldn't stop it
Negi to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, nice way to get off the mark. Sliding in on the pads, Tiwary is quick to get low and sweep it fine. The ball has enough legs to dribble away past the boundary rope

McClenaghan to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, aggression from the bowler, the batsman not one to back off. Goes for the hook on the short ball, the ball kisses the gloves and goes over the keeper for a four. Lucky is Ishan Kishan
Malinga to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, short ball, do I need to say more? Brendon McCullum hangs back, allows the hands to do the talking and powers the cut uppishly past the point fielder for a four
Harbhajan to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, comes dancing out of his crease, the length was music to him and slaps the ball down towards long-on for a one bounce four
Malinga to Jadeja, FOUR, fires it too wide of off, Jaddu makes full use of it. Just angles his bat down which takes some wood and races down to the third man fence
Bumrah to Jadeja, FOUR, has liberty outside off and he frees his arms. Strokes the cut in the air and over backward point, third man can't get there

Bumrah to Andrew Tye, FOUR, he is not hanging around, is he? Lines up for a full ball and when he gets one, he lauches Bumrah straight down the ground. Mid-off (running back) and long-on converge, in the process of stopping the ball they fear about the collision and lets it through

McClenaghan to Faulkner, FOUR, makes plenty of room outside off and smears McClenaghan over extra cover. It was a slower ball that was bowled into the pitch which gave enough time for Faulkner to pick his spot
Bumrah to Andrew Tye, FOUR, bowls full and wide, Tye is seeing it like a hawk. Clears his front leg and clatters it square on the off-side
Bumrah to Faulkner, FOUR, Faulkner wants to have some fun now. Picks the slower short ball and thumps it over mid-wicket, no-one in the deep
McClenaghan to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, short and cut away now. Slight bit of room from McClenaghan and the batsman hammers the cut to the right of the point fielder for a four

McClenaghan to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, deft now! He has the bowler by his mercy. That was short, outside off and the batsman opens the face of the blade to guide it fine on the off-side. Third man was moved square after the last ball and had no chance

Harbhajan to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, Bhajji comes in, Bhajji is not going to be spared either. That was short again, hint of room and Ishan Kishan jumps onto the cut to spear it away past the man at point
Harbhajan to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, hangs back for the flighted short ball and then hacks it well past the man at mid-on for a four. He packs a punch in every shot
Basil Thampi to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, that's such a poor start from the bowler. Short and way outside off stump, Parthiv cuts easily over backward point

Basil Thampi to Buttler, FOUR, that's just a gentle flick, but this outfield is very fast. Beats the man giving chase from mid-on. Good length delivery on the leg stump, Buttler doesn't try to over-hit the ball, placed it to the right of mid-on and opened his account
Basil Thampi to Buttler, FOUR, fine! Excellent start for MI. Shuffles across a long way does Buttler and helps this length ball on leg, down to the fine leg fence

Faulkner to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, in the air and in the gap! On a good length that swings away a tad, Parthiv presses forward and shows the full face of his bat as he drives uppishly. Gets it between mid-off and extra cover. The quick outfield does the rest

Faulkner to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, short and wide asking to be punished. Parthiv crashes the cut wide of backward point who takes some pace off the ball with a dive. The ball has enough legs to dribble away past the rope

Raina to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, ouch! Has Tye hurt himself badly there? A rank full toss from Raina. Parthiv pummels the slog through mid-wicket. Tye at deep mid-wicket sprints to his right and puts in an awkward dive. The ball deflects off his body and runs away into the fence. Has he done his shoulder there? Hope nothing is serious. He goes off the field
Jadeja to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, the PP show rolls on! Short ball and the batsman trampled back to smack the pull away towards the deep mid-wicket region

Jadeja to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, short ball outside off and the batsman opens the face of the bat to run it down past the man at short third man for a four. A despairing dive from Faulkner is not enough

Faulkner to Pollard, FOUR, another edge, different result, elation previous, agony on this. That cut away from the right-hander, Pollard edged it as he had a feel for it. The edge carried just past the diving tentacles of Karthik. Only if they had a slip

Faulkner to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, length ball and that has been dragged down the ground with powerful sinews. The ball landed close to the man at mid-off and then raced away into the fence for a four. A much needed relief for MI
Basil Thampi to Pollard, FOUR, length ball sits up for the batsman to hack the pull away and loft it over mid-wicket. The man at long-on was light years away from that

Faulkner to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, goes for the slog, the ball chalks the inner meatier part of the bat and that is enough to send it away from the diving long-on fielder. BMac gave it a valiant chase and dived full stretched to his left but the ball landed away from him and went over the fence. That four has helped things for MI
Irfan Pathan to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, bangs it in short without any venom behind it. Patel gets into a good position and pulls it behind square on the leg-side

Irfan Pathan to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, 16 off Irfan Pathan's first over in IPL 2017. He errs in line drifting down leg, Parthiv moves across and helps it away behind square on the leg-side. The ball races away into the fence. MI are off to a flier

Andrew Tye to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, cheekiness at its best! Knuckle ball from Tye well outside off. The ball almost went past him, and Parthiv opens his bat face at the very last instant. The ball runs away into the third man fence
Ankit Soni to Nitish Rana, FOUR, too much width and Rana punishes him. The back-spinner, Rana crouches and lifts it inside out over cover for a boundary. That's Raina-esque
Axar to Rabada, FOUR, handy boundary for Rabada, comes down the track, gets close to the ball and drills it back over his partner's head, a couple of bounces and over the ropes

Sandeep Sharma to Samson, FOUR, nicely played by Samson, that should get him going, fraction short and wide of off, he leans forward, plays with a flat-bat and gets it in the gap - wide of extra-cover
T Natarajan to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, lovely shot, overpitched and wide outside off, Shreyas leans forward, meets the ball on top of the bounce and drives it crisply past cover, no one moved
Shami to Guptill, FOUR, Guptill and Punjab are away. Takes a step forward, manufactures his own room and thrashes it over cover. Kings XI anthem blares in the background

Shami to Guptill, FOUR, Guptill is in a hurry here. Wasting no time as he backs away to this back of a length delivery and bullies it through the packed off-side field. Not so productive start for Shami and DD
Rabada to Amla, FOUR, classic shot from Amla. Just a soft push from the crease to this full toss and it roars away to the fence. Beats extra cover, minimum effort there from the mighty Hash!

Rabada to Guptill, FOUR, cheeky and effective for Guptill. Cleverly arches his back on seeing this short ball outside off, opens his bat face and elevates it over first slip. One bounce and into the fence

Rabada to Guptill, FOUR, ooh, he didn't time it as he would've liked but still earns himself a boundary. A dipping low full toss from Rabada, Guptill miscued it as he dragged it off the cue-end. Squirts it over mid-off and off it goes away to the fence

Shami to Guptill, FOUR, raining boundaries off Guptill's willow. Again moves away to leg-side, takes on this back of a length delivery and blasts it wide of mid-on. He didn't find the sweet spot but it doesn't matter anyway
Shami to Guptill, FOUR, Shami's radar goes haywire. Spills it on the pads, easy pickings for Guptill as he gets inside the line and flicks it past the man at 45
Bhuvneshwar to Gambhir, FOUR, ends up being a short on the legs of Gambhir, who whips it from there. Through square leg and into the fence. Not quite timed but fetches him a four
Bhuvneshwar to Gambhir, FOUR, low full toss and Gambhir cracks it past mid-off to bring his second four of the over. The idea from Bhuvneshwar was to bowl a yorker but could not control it there

Rashid Khan to Jackson, FOUR, good shot. Looked pretty. Was bowled full and wide, Jackson had made the room early but inclines his weight across, pinned on his front foot, and smothers the drive through covers. 92 off 36

Bhuvneshwar to de Grandhomme, FOUR, a certain Bhuvneshwar Kumar yorker that's becoming famous by the day, quite beating his physique. Slightly leg-sidish and Grandhomme gets just enough tickle on this. Through fine leg. Boundary
S Kaul to Woakes, FOUR, uses the width on this cutter and cleverly steers it wide of backward point. In between the two fielders and gets a boundary. KKR will lose by 4 less now

S Kaul to Uthappa, FOUR, bit cross-batted but as long as they fetch runs. Got across to this length delivery and whipped between the man at mid-on and mid-wicket. Bhuvi with a chase there but soon realised it was only going to be a futile one. Kaul didn't like it one bit. Has a few words to say to which Robbie responds

Siraj to Uthappa, FOUR, that is a sonorous sound off the bat, not for the bowler of course. Is not that full around off, but Uthappa trusts the pace and drives on the up, past cover and into the fence in no time

Siraj to Uthappa, FOUR, he's played the field there. So aware of the men around him. The slip is wide and the third man is not covering for him. Uses the pace and opens the face of the bat to bisect the keeper and Williamson
S Kaul to M Pandey, FOUR, and that is what you get for keeping the bat straight. Uncomplicated stuff, hits the on-drive to this length ball on the up and leaves mid-on redundant

S Kaul to M Pandey, FOUR, majestic! Half-volley this time but Pandey knew where the field was, hit the straight drive in the air but past the bowler. Is so straight that long-on does not stand a chance to his right

Henriques to M Pandey, FOUR, not sure how well that was timed but it manages to beat Warner to the fence. Pandey once again backed away in the crease and to his liking got a shortish ball. A cross-batted whip beat the man at mid-on first, before Warner gave up running across from deep mid-wicket
Rashid Khan to Uthappa, FOUR, the previous shot forces Rashid Khan to pitch it short and Uthappa makes merry. Goes back and pulls it straight down the ground

Coulter-Nile to Warner, FOUR, Coulter-Nile overpitches looking for swing, but it's not moving. Warner lofts over the infield, the bat turned in hands, but made good enough contact to clear the man at mid-off. That gets the crowd going, first boundary of the game. 1000 runs for Davey Warner at Uppal
Woakes to Dhawan, FOUR, now Dhawan gets a boundary. Short and on the stumps, Dhawan pulls it through mid-wicket and beats the fielder in the deep
U Yadav to Williamson, FOUR, clever shot from Williamson. Spotted that long-off was inside the ring, picked the slower ball, went back and lofted that nicely over the top for a boundary
Narine to Warner, FOUR, in the airrr, Pandey dives full length to his right at long-off and gets a hand on it. Excellent effort. Flighted delivery from Narine, Warner smashed it down the ground
Narine to Warner, FOUR, he's picking the spots so well. Was cramped for room, backed away and managed to loft it over cover
Narine to Warner, FOUR, the carnage continues, flighted delivery down the leg-side, Warner sweeps, past the diving fielder at short fine leg for four

Coulter-Nile to Williamson, FOUR, that's lovely placement from Williamson. Another full toss from Coulter-Nile, Williamson doesn't try to over-hit the ball, lofts the drive over cover and beats sweeper cover

Woakes to Williamson, FOUR, that movement across the stumps was playing on the bowler's mind, he tried to bowl full and wide outside off stump again, Williamson stays put, lofts handsomely to the right of mid-off

Woakes to Williamson, FOUR, how did he manage to hit that so well. Good slower ball bouncer, Williamson got into an awkward position to scoop that, went through with that shot and it bounced inside the rope

Woakes to Williamson, FOUR, cheeky from Kane! Moved right across the stumps and paddled that, didn't middle it, got a bit of an edge, but that was good enough, short fine leg had no chance. 200 up for Hyderabad

Woakes to Warner, FOUR, that is class for you! Certainly not all that a bad ball, but Warner's in the mood. Short of a length, just outside off stump, so he had to manufacture a bit of space for himself to be able to cut that ball. He jumps and then backs away slightly to cut it away to the right of backward point
Y Pathan to Warner, FOUR, fine leg is inside the ring and Warner gets across the stumps to pull it over the man at 45

Y Pathan to Warner, FOUR, this is poor bowling, but that is what Warner can do! When he is in such a murderous mood, the bowler is afraid to bowl full, it's a short ball again, Warner knew what was coming, went back and cut it away over cover-point

Narine to Warner, FOUR, he's pierced that gap so well. Shortish and spinning away outside off stump, Warner cuts well and sends it between cover and cover-point. He wants to make the most of this powerplay

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhawan, FOUR, different bowler and Dhawan takes him on this time. Not the ideal start from Kuldeep, dropped it way too short, gave Dhawan enough time to camp back and smash it over mid-on
Kuldeep Yadav to Warner, FOUR, the switch-hit again and the backward point boundary is free. Bit of a top-edge from Warner, but the ball escaped. He doesn't want to allow the bowler to settle

Kuldeep Yadav to Warner, FOUR, have seen him practice those switch-hits in the training, it's coming out so well. Careful Davey, don't let the rule-makers take notice and force a rule change. This is smashed through point

Aniket Choudhary to Nitish Rana, FOUR, freebie and Rana won't miss out. He's a man in form. Kohli would not want his bowlers to bowl such balls. On the pads, easy glance to the fine leg fence. First boundary for the hosts

Chahal to Nitish Rana, FOUR, did that carry? No it didn't! Kohli is not happy as the ball escaped for four. The fielder didn't do much wrong there. He went for the catch and it landed just in front him. Rana swept uppishly towards backward square leg and got away with it
Milne to Rohit, FOUR, poor delivery! This is a pressure-releaser. Short and wide outside off stump, really poor delivery, Rohit cuts uppishly to the left of backward point and third man had no chance

Milne to Pollard, FOUR, turns out to be a 12-run over, just what MI wanted to get that momentum back. On the leg stump was the slower delivery, no one at fine leg and a gentle glance was all that was required

Chahal to Pollard, FOUR, Pollard gets a boundary but the bowler won the mini battle there, the batsman stepped out, was the googly, Pollard went through with the swing, mistimed it but managed to place it to the right of long-on
Aniket Choudhary to Rohit, FOUR, that's nicely played. Full and well outside off stump, Rohit waits for the ball to come and square-drives it past backward point

Aniket Choudhary to Rohit, FOUR, oh what a shot! Aniket over pitches this full delivery, Rohit leans forward and drives hard through cover, Chahal dives to his right and gets a hand on it, yet the ball comfortably reached the fence

Chahal to Karn Sharma, FOUR, smashed straight down the ground, can Kohli get there? He can but in trying to pull it back, doesn't deflect it back inside the playing area. It was too full and Karn Sharma knelt down to hit that back over the bowler

Watson to Rohit, FOUR, Chahal at extra cover gave that up very easily. But that was timed so beautifully by Rohit. A back foot punch with a high backlift, hitting the ball on the top of its bounce, the weight going into the shot and powered away. Great start to the over

Watson to Rohit, FOUR, MI win! Rohit does it for his team. No big celebrations. Just a big smile and then a hug with Hardik Pandya. Low full toss as Watson missed the yorker, thumped wide of extra cover and mid-off was inside the ring as well. Raced away and MI have done the double over RCB this season - but it must be said that the Kohli-led side had chances to win both games. 8th loss for RCB out of 11 this year. MI go top of the table

Chahal to Nitish Rana, FOUR, that's nicely played. Didn't try to over-hit the ball, flighted delivery outside off stump, Rana leans forward and drives along the ground, beats AB's dive to his right at mid-off

Milne to Buttler, FOUR, Buttler loves pace on the ball. He's at ease when he plays the fast bowlers. Milne went full searching for swing, but went as a juicy half-volley, Buttler drives it to the right of extra-cover and it raced away

Milne to Buttler, FOUR, now Milne bangs it short, this is not a WACA to trouble batsmen with bounce, sits up nicely, Buttler stands tall and doesn't bother to keep the ball along the ground as he pulls through mid-wicket

Milne to Buttler, FOUR, how well has he timed that? This is the second time the ball has gone past a diving AB de Villiers. Short of a length delivery outside off stump, Buttler plays a back foot drive, plays it to the left of cover and it escaped across the turf. This is a fast start from Mumbai, despite a first-ball wicket
Aravind to Nitish Rana, FOUR, wow! Lovely drive, Aravind bowls a full ball, didn't swing, Rana leant into the drive and placed it to the right of mid-on. Moves into the 20s
Aravind to Buttler, FOUR, overpitched and Buttler goes aerial. Just cleared his front leg a bit and lofted through the line, well wide of mid-off and on the bounce for four

Watson to Rohit, FOUR, Rohit has seen enough of this good length stuff from Watson. Decides to score a boundary, plays across the line and chips it over mid-wicket, splits deep mid-wicket and long-on to perfection

McClenaghan to Mandeep, FOUR, Mandeep is off the mark first ball. But with a boundary. Width outside off, crashed wide of cover-point and on this outfield, no-one is stopping that. Nice shot as he freed his arms

McClenaghan to Mandeep, FOUR, a mistimed pull, but four. Over square leg. The length wasn't there for the shot, but Mandeep muscled that, got it off the splice of the bat but managed to clear the square leg umpire

Malinga to Mandeep, FOUR, Anil Kumar Chaudhary has a wry smile on his face. Because Malinga was appealing for an lbw. The umpire spotted the tickle. A slower ball yorker from Malinga that dips on the batsman, Malinga's trademark weapon. But Mandeep picked that and got it wide of short fine inside the ring

Krunal Pandya to Head, FOUR, one bounce over the ropes at wide long-on. Head against the left-arm spinner is always advantage to the batsman. He kneels down and slogs it into the gap. Did well to hit it wide of Pollard
Karn Sharma to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, sees the tossed up delivery and is onto that in a flash. Skips down and blasts it straight down the ground. Clean strike and went the distance
Bumrah to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, fabulous whip off the pads. Drifting into middle, a length delivery and Kedar Jadhav used his strong forearms to power it away, beats deep mid-wicket's desperate dive
McClenaghan to Negi, FOUR, can't miss your length with this field. Since both long-off and long-on are wide. Full and outside off, blasted over the umpire's head. Negi is playing a blinder here

McClenaghan to de Villiers, FOUR, that's classy from de Villiers. This bouncing ball was cramping him for room, but he arched back and then created his own momentum to cut it over backward point. Wide of sweeper as well. That's a top top shot
Malinga to de Villiers, FOUR, low full toss outside off, belted past short extra cover. He needed to hit that gap and did so easily
Krunal Pandya to de Villiers, FOUR, lovely shot. Waited for the ball to turn away and then delayed the shot to send it wide of point, sweeper had too much distance to cover and the ball beat him
Unadkat to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, gee, this man. It's not short, it's just wide. And seams in a touch to cut the room, but the hands that McCullum has. Cuts it up and over covers. No feet, all hands

Unadkat to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, there wasn't any room there, not much pace either - some 124 odd kays - but the trick was in playing late. McCullum does that. Plays close to his body, opens the bat face and steers a boundary behind the dive of short third

Stokes to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, edged and four! Pacy length ball wide of off, McCullum looks to drive with hard hands and gets a fat outside edge. Runs well past the keeper's reach and races away into the third man fence. Tahir puts a desperate dive, but can't stop it
SN Thakur to Karthik, FOUR, shot! Right off the middle of the bat. Thakur offers with outside off and Karthik smacks the drive through extra cover. Reached the fence like a bullet

Stokes to Jadeja, FOUR, wow! A brave shot from Jaddu. Waltzes down the track, gets to the pitch of the delivery and thumps it down the ground. With mid-on inside the circle, that's a safe shot. Gets it well wide of him and the ball has enough legs to go past the boundary rope

Stokes to Jadeja, FOUR, boundary to end the over. It didn't come off the middle of the bat, but Jadeja won't mind. It was a short ball from Stokes. Jadeja is slightly late on his pull and gets it off the top part of the bat. Finds the gap in the deep mid-wicket area
SN Thakur to Jadeja, FOUR, that's a gift and Jadeja won't miss out. Short of a good length delivery drifting down leg, Jadeja tickles it fine. Runs away into the fine leg fence
Stokes to Karthik, FOUR, much needed boundary. Another slower delivery, Karthik dances down and heaves it away into the deep square leg fence
Unadkat to Karthik, FOUR, improvisation at its best. Reverses his stance even before the ball is delivered and brooms it away between short third man and backward point

Washington Sundar to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, completely duped. Totally. Kishan was looking to shimmy out but slipped, and to make things worse, Sundar drops it slightly wider. Kishan has to reach out and trims an inside edge past the leg-stump. Four. All that and four

Stokes to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, that's a shot that will shove you into a crisis. An outside edge or a glide? Yes, McCullum made room there but to drive, through covers. May have opened the bat face but that was an edge that beat short third, and raced away

Tahir to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, the partnership between Ishan Kishan and Brendon McCullum is now 50+. A low, flat dipping full toss on middle and leg, and Ishan has hurried himself into a sweep round the corner
Tahir to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, smacks a wide full ball, flat-batted, wide of Smith's one-handed leap at mid-off. Good aggressive shot that

SN Thakur to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, that has McCullum's swagger stamped all over it. Look at him making room, whilst stepping down the track, and smaking it flat-batted wide of Steven Smith at mid-off. Does put in a dive but that was motoring away. Not a chance, even with a dive
Christian to Finch, FOUR, now he's managed to get under a very full ball. The trick was in not reaching out for the ball. Stayed put, lifted the ball and got it over wide mid-on. Good shot
Sangwan to Rahane, FOUR, drifts on the pads of Rahane, who does not have to do much. Gets on his toes and tickles it into the fine leg fence to get things going
Sangwan to Smith, FOUR, the bait that Smith throws to the bowler - shuffles across to this inswinging ball and flicks through mid-wicket to get off the mark with a boundary

Dwayne Smith to Stokes, FOUR, Stokes leaves his crease too early. Dwayne Smith sees that and throws it pretty wide but that does not help him get away. Stokes manages to put some bat and squeezes it to the deep backward point fence
Dwayne Smith to Stokes, FOUR, now makes room to a ball that was always going to be fuller, and slaps it through covers. Top shot as a follow up to that brute of a ball
Basil Thampi to Stokes, FOUR, that's a I-don't-want-you-to-be-a-bowler hit. Takes his front leg out of the way and flat-bats Thampi over his head. Disparaging hit. Utterly disdainful
Sangwan to Christian, FOUR, past Faulkner at backward point. Dives sideways with outstretched right hand but can't stop this brutal cut from Christian. Saw the width and just laid into it

Faulkner to Stokes, FOUR, no more an IPL virgin. Pune goes loud and berserk as Stokes hits a century here. His first in the Indian Premier League. His first ever in Twenty20s. Backs away and slaps a drive through extra cover. What a gorgeous shot. Raises his bat after a fist-pump and screeches, in cramps and joy, err.. He's almost taken Pune home here

Sangwan to Stokes, FOUR, keeping things simple and straight is Stokes there. There was a hint of movement on this full ball. Stokes did well to not try something fancy, presented the full blade and bisected the gap between the bowler and mid-on

Basil Thampi to Stokes, FOUR, Stokes was on the charge for a moment but saw the length early. It was a bit shortish outside off and Stokes fetched the pull from there, hit it all along the ground to the deep mid-wicket fence
Sangwan to Tripathi, FOUR, wow shot from Tripathi. Pure timing from Tripathi. Stands tall to this short ball and cuts past the man at backward point

Faulkner to Stokes, FOUR, slower ball that is too wide, makes things easy for Stokes. He stays back in the crease and thumps past the man at cover. Once he has got that out of the ring, it is always racing away

Jadeja to Dhoni, FOUR, those trunk-like forearms take over. Jadeja tosses outside off and Dhoni drives with the turn. Places it wide of sweeper whose dive makes contact with the ball but fails to keep that in. First boundary for Dhoni

Siraj to Nair, FOUR, that's a cracking shot to get off the mark! That was a gift from Siraj. Short and wide outside off, Nair backs away, clears the front leg and slaps it hard over covers. One bounce and over the fence
Henriques to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, that's one of the best shots of the game. A slight move across and offers a straight bat to send it between long-on and deep mid-wicket

Siraj to Chris Morris, FOUR, placed! Well placed! This is what Delhi were lacking. It is a short ball and Chris Morris rolls his wrists on the pull to bisect the fielders converging from deep backward square leg and deep mid-wicket

Bhuvneshwar to Corey Anderson, FOUR, there is a thing called luck. But there is nothing called like a bowler's luck. He is always at the receiving end of things. It is a yorker, almost fells Corey Anderson down. Cannot get his bat down in time but manages to put some willow on it. That is enough to deflect this to the fine leg fence

Henriques to Corey Anderson, FOUR, Short ball. Corey Anderson pulls and mid-off is in the ring, this will be a four, giving Delhi a much-needed win. Has this been given as four or is it only a single? Yes it is a four. Delhi win by 6-wickets

Bhuvneshwar to Samson, FOUR, nothing wrong this time. Right off the middle. Kumar offers width wide of off on this short of length delivery and Samson takes advantage of it. He punches it and bisects cover and cover-point. Races away

Bhuvneshwar to Samson, FOUR, a very unlike Bhuvi over. He was all over the place this over. Shortish delivery outside off, you don't offer width to this guy. Flays the bat hard at it and lifts it over the infield on the off-side. Bullets into the cover fence

S Kaul to Nair, FOUR, 2 runs off the first four balls, and then leaks 10 runs off the next two. DD are off to a flier. Kaul pitches it up and Nair drills it down the ground with a shimmy down. All along the carpet, into the fence

Siraj to Nair, FOUR, nowhere near the middle of the bat, but Nair won't mind a bit. Nair backs away and wanted to loft it inside-out over covers. Since the ball was a slower one, he ends up slicing it over covers. The quick outfield does the rest

Henriques to Nair, FOUR, this time well over short fine. The keeper is up and Henriques bowls a full length delivery just outside off, Nair shuffles across and nicely scoops it away over Bhuvi and the ball races away

Henriques to Nair, FOUR, four more! The runs are coming thick and fast for DD. Not the greatest of deliveries from Henriques. Short and drifting down leg, Nair gets inside the line and pulls it fine, beating the diving fine leg fielder
Rashid Khan to Pant, FOUR, welcome to Delhi says Rishabh Pant. A loosener from Rashid Khan. Quick delivery well down leg, Pant is quick to get low and smack the sweep well wide of short fine
Rashid Khan to Pant, FOUR, poor ball and Pant takes full toll of it. Low full toss, Pant sinks low and smacks the sweep through square leg. Off the sweet spot of the bat
Henriques to Pant, FOUR, that's a gross delivery. Short and wide outside off, Pant waits for it and lifts it over extra cover for four runs

Henriques to Pant, FOUR, four more! Henriques isn't learning here. He is continuously offfering width outside off. Pant spots it and pummels it in front of square on the off-side. No chance for Dhawan in the deep
Jayant Yadav to Warner, FOUR, and he's away in a flash. Shortish and just outside off stump, Warner rocks back and cuts fiercely through cover-point
Rabada to Dhawan, FOUR, not the ideal start for Rabada. Fullish and swinging into the left-hander, Dhawan flicks, fine leg is inside the ring and he had no chance. Off the mark in a flash

Rabada to Warner, FOUR, oh this goes at a catchable height but there is no one at extra-cover. Would have been a straightforward chance. Warner is certainly having trouble facing Rabada's angle, chips gently, was a poor shot and he'd say that he deliberately played that with that gap on the off-side. Didn't look convincing though
Mishra to Williamson, FOUR, delicate. The googly just outside off, Williamson waited for it to arrive, opened the bat face and steers it past the diving short third man

Shami to Yuvraj, FOUR, oh gosh! That was vintage Yuvraj. Full delivery on the stumps, Yuvraj does not bother to get his front leg behind the line, short-arm jabs the loft over the bowler's head, one bounce and over the ad hoardings

Mishra to Yuvraj, FOUR, anything in his zone and Yuvraj is willing to take it on. The googly which is a bit full in length, Yuvraj's back leg is in the air as he lofts it over Mishra. Almost similar to the one he played in the last over
Shami to Yuvraj, FOUR, he's not gonna miss out twice in two balls. Shami drifts another one on the pads, Yuvraj gets the faintest of touches on the ball and it races away to the fine leg fence

Shami to Yuvraj, FOUR, brilliant stop from Mathews. But did he touch the cushions? The third umpire has a look and spots something in contact with the triangles. Short delivery and Yuvraj pulls in front of square, Mathews ran in from deep square, dived and stopped the ball, but it was spinning back towards the rope and he flicked it in and that's when he was in touch

Rabada to Henriques, FOUR, boundary to start the 18th. The slower delivery that drifts onto the batsman's hips, Henriques does not do anything fancy, tickles it round the corner and allows the outfield to do the rest

Rabada to Yuvraj, FOUR, unlucky! Yuvraj is hurried by the short delivery, but at this stage of the innings the batsmen tend to throw their bat at everything, the top edge flies over short fine and lands just in front of the rope

Rabada to Henriques, FOUR, big over for SRH. 20 off it and Rabada has been put under pressure. Fuller and width on offer, Henriques square drives and the placement is superb, well wide of the man sweeping on the off-side

Chris Morris to Yuvraj, FOUR, Morris is shaking his head, but there is very little he can do about that. The yorker just outside off, Yuvraj waited and went low, opened the bat face and dug it to the right of short third man, who dived just as an afterthought

Chris Morris to Yuvraj, FOUR, fifty for Yuvraj. Even though it is Delhi, the crowd are up on their feet to applaud the knock. Yuvraj acknowledges it with a wave of the bat. The slower length delivery, heaved in front of square, bisecting the two men in the deep

Rabada to Yuvraj, no ball, FOUR, horrendous start. He oversteps and dishes out a full delivery, Yuvraj's hands take over, he drives it past extra cover and the ball raced away to the fence. No chance for the sweeper

Rabada to Yuvraj, FOUR, too full and missed the yorker by a couple of inches, Yuvraj doesn't miss though, whipped it square and past the man at square leg. Boundaries flowing in the final part of the innings

Rabada to Yuvraj, FOUR, sloppy! The low full toss outside off, Yuvraj was trying to slice it behind point, got it finer than he would have liked. Jayant at third man makes a meal of that. Allows it to escape past him

Rabada to Yuvraj, FOUR, finishes the innings on a positive note. 19 runs off the over. Rabada went for 39 in his final two overs. You have to get the yorker spot on against Yuvraj. Slightly off and he puts it away, the bat comes down like an axe and he lofts it over Rabada, one bounce and into the fence

Chris Morris to Dhawan, FOUR, similar delivery to the previous one and this time Morris pays the price, Dhawan is looking good today. The shots have been timed well. This time he's executed the cover-drive to perfection

Chris Morris to Dhawan, FOUR, now the bowler overcompensates by bowling short. There wasn't much of width on this one, but hopped and backed away slightly to create a bit of room and cut it away to the right of backward point
Rabada to Warner, FOUR, Warner knew that a slower ball was coming, backed away nicely to free the arms and slapped it hard over extra-cover for four. Easy pickings those

Shami to Warner, FOUR, slower ball, heaved away, no timing but it escapes for four. Another great start from this lovely SRH opening pair. Fifty comes up in 5.1 overs. This one was in the air, but wide of the man at mid-wicket
Shami to Williamson, leg byes, FOUR, that's down the leg-side, Williamson misses the flick, the ball beats the keeper off the thigh pad and goes for four
Shami to Dhawan, FOUR, Shami tries the slower ball bouncer, Dhawan does well to roll his wrists and control the hook shot, sends it past short fine leg

SN Thakur to M Pandey, FOUR, whip of the wrists and off she went, one bounce four. Thakur is into his third over on the trot, full and angled into the pads, Pandey picks it over the mid-wicket fielder

SN Thakur to M Pandey, FOUR, third boundary of the over. Might be one over too many for Thakur. Short slower delivery and it sat up nicely for the swat from Pandey, he tonks it over mid-wicket and no one in the deep to stop that
Christian to M Pandey, FOUR, this time manages to elude the short third man fielder. Waits for the back of a length delivery to arrive, opens the bat face and delicately places it wide of Sundar

Stokes to de Grandhomme, FOUR, the initial call from de Grandhomme was "two". Even he didn't know how well he had timed it. Full toss just outside off, which is caressed through extra cover. Rahane at sweeper had given up the chase quite early

Christian to de Grandhomme, FOUR, Christian has his hands on his head. He shouted "catch it," but it was nowhere close to the fielder. Slower back of a length delivery, de Grandhomme punched it on the up and in the air, wide of extra cover and sweeper though

Tahir to de Grandhomme, FOUR, not where he intended, but the final result is what he was looking for. Floated up outside off, de Grandhomme wanted to go over long-off, sliced over backward point and Sundar saw the ball balloon over him
Unadkat to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, sweep shot off a pacer. You don't see that often. The slower delivery and Suryakumar spotted it very early, went across his stumps and broomed it over short fine

Unadkat to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, lovely shot! The off-pace delivery and Suryakumar is playing with Unadkat, makes room and lofts it inside out over extra cover, no chance for the long-off fielder to cut that
