Unadkat to Jackson, FOUR, makes room and does well by not going completely berserk with the shot. Had his eyes on the ball and slapped it past the man at backward point

Washington Sundar to Jackson, FOUR, Jackson skips down and does well with the loft. Did not appear to have given it everything. The focus was on the timing after he met the pitch of the ball. Lifted it pretty straight and fetched a four to the long-on fence
Stokes to Gambhir, FOUR, the way he had been caged, this was coming! Clears the front leg and swipes across the line, finding the gap through mid-wicket
Stokes to Gambhir, FOUR, consecutive fours for the skipper and this one is more classic. Goes back to this ball and tucks it fine after a hop in the crease. The ball races to the fine leg fence
Washington Sundar to Gambhir, FOUR, that's so pleasing to watch. Moves aside to open up a bit and then goes inside out over cover. Races away
Coulter-Nile to Rahane, FOUR, Rahane is away. Sees the width and throws his bat, gets an outside edge that flies past first slip. Would've been gobbled up by second slip, if there was ever one
U Yadav to Rahane, FOUR, that's a quality shot from Rahane. A short of length delivery outside off, Rahane gets on top of it and thumps it over the infield on the off-side
Narine to Tripathi, FOUR, slog-swept! Shabby fielding effort from Woakes at deep mid-wicket. Dives to his left, but doesn't stretch enough to flick the ball back
Coulter-Nile to Tripathi, FOUR, fabulous shot from Tripathi. Rides the bounce and cracks a solid punch that breaches the crowded off-side field. Races away to the fence

Coulter-Nile to Tripathi, FOUR, NCN overcorrects and dishes out a full toss, Tripathi sets up a solid base and drills it past mid-on. Didn't get it off the middle but manages it thread it past the fielder

Coulter-Nile to Tripathi, FOUR, 19 runs off the over. An expensive one for KKR. A short ball that sits up nicely for Tripathi, he spindles across and pulls it behind square. Goes all the way for a maximum

U Yadav to Smith, byes, FOUR, ooh, almost did him there. Smith gives the charge to this back of a length delivery that shaped back in, aiming to open the up the off-side field. In the process, gets an inside edge that eludes a diving Jackson. The umpire fails to spot it and gives it as byes
U Yadav to Tripathi, FOUR, Tripathi is cutting loose here. Reads this leg-cutter early, flashes it hard and gets it over backward-point.
Woakes to Tripathi, FOUR, Tripathi takes a cue from his skipper and plays a fabulous shot. Gets under this full ball and almost checks his shot past mid-on
Coulter-Nile to Tripathi, FOUR, magnificent. Shimmies out to meet the pitch and bullies it through extra cover

Coulter-Nile to Tripathi, FOUR, Tripathi is putting on a show here. He is 47 off just 18 balls. The short ball ain't working against him. Coulter-Nile isn't learing, peppers it short without any purpose. Tripathi is committed onto the front foot and flat-bats it over mid-on

Narine to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, Narine is greeted to the crease with a boundary. Deft from Tiwary, waits to the last moment and late cuts it to the third man fence. Almost fetched it from the keeper's gloves

Narine to Tripathi, FOUR, Tripathi reaches fifty in style. Fastest individual fifty for RPS. Walks across his sticks, goes low and scoops it to the fine leg fence. Raises his bat and Tiwary embraces him
Narine to Stokes, FOUR, audacious from Stokes. Changes his stance and employs the reverse-hit. Directs it behind square on the off-side

Sangwan to Nair, FOUR, Nair is off and running. Gets into business straightaway after having a sighter. Backs away to create some room, Sangwan kept it on middle and subsidized with width. Nair brings his bottom hand into play. Just extends his arms and steers it past the crowded off-side field
Sangwan to Nair, FOUR, such minimal effort from Nair. Waits in his crease for this short of length delivery to arrive, uses his magical wrists and effortlessly pulls it over mid-wicket

Faulkner to Pant, FOUR, oh dear. Ishan Kishan has defied the laws of living and walked through a ball at long leg. Or so it looked. Whipped off the pads, shipped away using the bottom hand and Kishan was charging in, and ran through
Dwayne Smith to Pant, FOUR, as if the choice of bowling Smith wasn't enough, the bowlers chooses a full ball to bowl. Clattered over mid-wicket with a disparaging whip. Enough. No one in the deep

Dwayne Smith to Pant, FOUR, he's wound himself up brilliantly there. So brilliantly that he's taken a full ball on the stumps and whipped it over backward square leg, cleverly opening that side of the field by shuffling across early and getting into position. 44 off 42 and I see the unicorn already. Well, almost

Jadeja to Pant, FOUR, now this is a back foot punch over covers. You have to see it to believe it. Jadeja is from over the wicket to the left hander here. Just a touch short, Pant is so early there to get back and punch it up and over. Graceful, if it's ever been any more brutal
Sangwan to Pant, FOUR, 16 off first 3 balls. Pant is on fire. Protracts his hands to this widish ball and cleverly guides it past short third man. Kotla breaks the sound barrier

Raina to Pant, FOUR, clumsy from Smithy. Makes a royal mess of this one. Pant blasts it hard off the back foot through extra cover. Smithy gets across, slides near the ropes but lets it through his boot laces. Into the fence

Nadeem to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, turn straightaway for Nadeem and he finds the outside edge. Smith was on the front foot to defend, the turn took the thick outside edge of the bat and it flew past the man at slip. The Lions are off the mark

Nadeem to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, that's swept away over backward square leg and it's four more. Turns out to be a good start for Smith and Gujarat. This was a delivery down the leg-side, Smith sweeps, gets a bit of top edge but he swung hard to send it over the infield

Nadeem to Raina, FOUR, the slog-sweep, in the air, but Raina has split the fielders in the deep. Deep mid-wicket and deep backward square leg thought they were in the business for a moment. Raina got down low on his knees and timed it well enough

Shami to Karthik, FOUR, magnificent shot to start the over! Shami serves width outside off, Karthik leans forward and biffs the drive over Karun Nair at extra cover. Once it cleared him, there was none stopping that
Shami to Karthik, FOUR, shot! On the pads to any sub-continent batsman, he won't spare you. He moves slightly across and middles the leg-glance. The quick Delhi outfield does the rest
Shami to Finch, FOUR, 19 runs off the over! Finch is underway in a grand style. It was bowled on the stumps, but overpitched. Finch blasts the straight drive. The ball bullets away into the fence

Rabada to Finch, FOUR, ah! Got to feel for the bowler. Finch was in no control of that shot, still gets a boundary. Quick short ball that keeps following Finch, who moved leg-side. The ball gets big on him. The batsman, with his eyes closed, goes for the pull. The ball pops up and flies wide of short fine and runs away into the fence
Pat Cummins to Finch, FOUR, that's a good shot! The batsman seemed to have been deceived by the short ball. He adjusted well, jumped and pulled fiercely through mid-wicket
Rabada to Finch, FOUR, trademark Finch shot! Backs away and reaches for this fullish ball outside off. Carves it inside out over extra cover. Mid-off is up and there is none to stop that

Pat Cummins to Raina, FOUR, uppish, but not convincing. Short of a length delivery on the leg stump, Raina chips it over the infield, more towards square leg, luckily for the visitors, the ball went in the gap
Shami to Raina, FOUR, the short ball but Raina backed away early to free his arms. Slashed at it with an open bat face to deliberately hit over the top through point for four

Shami to Raina, FOUR, this man is great with his inside-out lofted drives over the cover region. Can't really say that this is a bad ball from the bowler. Middle and leg line on a good length, Raina moved leg-side and played that easily over extra-cover

Pat Cummins to Karthik, FOUR, that's a lovely piece of timing from Karthik. Should get him going. Not easy to jump down the pitch to a pacy bowler. In fact this came down at 148kph, Karthik made it into a fuller length by using his feet and played an excellent off-drive, the dive goes in vain from mid-off

Pat Cummins to Raina, FOUR, stylish from Raina. So after a terribly scratchy start, Raina has managed to settle nicely. Poor full delivery on the pads, deserved to be put away, Raina moved across the sticks just a touch to open up the backward square leg boundary and he placed the flick shot wide of the man at short fine to sign off the over in style

Mishra to Karthik, FOUR, gee, what placement! Deliberately swung hard at it with an open bat face to send it through point. This was the googly from Mishra, making it a risky shot against the incoming ball, but the fact that it was too full made his life easy.

Mishra to Karthik, FOUR, and Mishy continues to struggle against the right-hander, very strange through. He is so unwilling to toss the ball up and has hardly made Karthik play off the front foot. It's a short delivery that turns away, Karthik cuts well through point and beats the sweeper's dive on the boundary

Aravind to Guptill, FOUR, this is one ground that he can make it big if he gets his eye in. The boundaries are short and even mishits can go all the way. Aravind bowled a fuller length and just outside off stump, Guptill lofted it over cover, didn't come from the middle of the bat, but good enough for a one-bounce four

Aravind to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, wow! Lovely piece of timing. Aravind bowls full in search of swing, it did swing away a touch, but Marsh was nicely forward to cream the cover drive from the middle of the bat

Negi to Maxwell, FOUR, was that a drop? Negi is not a happy man. The reverse sweep from Maxi and he almost picked out backward point. Aniket is a tall man and he did get a fingertip on it. It was struck fiercely and Aniket did not have much time to react

Chahal to Maxwell, byes, FOUR, what was Kedar Jadhav doing? Maxwell was beaten all ends up, tees off for a big mow to the leg-side, the ball goes on straight to beat him on the inside edge. Jadhav didn't even try to get his gloves behind the ball

Chahal to Maxwell, byes, FOUR, Kedar Jadhav is having a torrid time behind the wicket. Flighted just outside off, Maxwell drives and misses, he was undone by the lack of bounce and Jadhav is nutmegged. He should have had his legs together
Chahal to Axar, FOUR, good batting from Axar. A no risk shot this. Waited for the ball to arrive, used whatever pace was available and steered it fine, Badree had no chance at short third man

Aniket Choudhary to Saha, FOUR, Gayle at backward point and Badree at third man, you don't expect them to chase a ball down. Slower delivery and Saha relied on placing it behind point rather than knocking the cover off the ball. No chance for both the fielders

Watson to Mohit Sharma, FOUR, bad delivery and deserved the treatment. Short and wide, Mohit threw the whole kitchen sink at that, sliced it off the outside edge to third man, got it fine enough and beat Aravind to the fence

Watson to Axar, FOUR, Axar seems to be having no problems on a surface where others have struggled. Short delivery on leg-stump, Axar pivots on his front leg and pulls it backward of square, couple of bounces and into the fence. 12 off the first three balls

Watson to Axar, FOUR, turning out to be just the over KXIP needed. Kohli is furious at long-off. Kicks the ball back onto the ad boardings. Pitched up and Axar slams it straight down the ground. No chance for Kohli at long-off
Watson to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, gee, how quickly did that reach the fence? Watson bowls a gentle full ball outside off stump, Marsh crashes it through cover and picks up a boundary

Watson to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, that's lovely placement. No one at third man, he was actually inside the ring, so any width from the bowler is going to be easy, Marsh opened the bat face and nicely guided it past the man at 45

Badree to Vohra, FOUR, oh this one kept low and it's very unlucky for the bowler that the ball has gone for four despite taking the inside edge of the bat. This was the slider on the shorter side, Vohra went back to pull, the ball didn't rise, went off the inner part and split short fine leg and backward square leg to perfection

Sandeep Sharma to Kohli, FOUR, first ball. Shuffles and kills the inswing with a whippy clip, embarrassing us for all the bottom hand strength we don't have. Plays it real fine behind the wicket and gets a first-ball boundary to get off the mark
T Natarajan to Mandeep, FOUR, this was half a cut at best. Jabbed the ball through covers. Natarajan angles this away, Singh stays put and caresses it away

T Natarajan to Mandeep, FOUR, inside edge runs away. Had to shuffle here to get behind this ball angled away. Instead stays there and looks to fetch it, getting an inside edge much to keeper's left in the process
Aaron to Negi, FOUR, skates down the pitch, stays leg-side of the delivery and carves Varun Aaron over extra cover. The batsman in Negi speaks...
Aaron to Negi, FOUR, full and wide, Negi twitches his back knee and throws the kitchen sink, a big-blooded edge flies away to the third man fence

Aaron to Negi, leg byes, FOUR, the rib-tickler. With fine leg inside the ring, not sure if that's a great idea. Negi hops and misses the tickle, the slow-low nature of the pitch means it shoots a bit low to take the thigh pad en route to fine leg fancy boards

Aaron to Mandeep, FOUR, hence proven: Guptill has spring in his shoes. Hey ICC, are you watching? Cut but it's more off the edge, thanks to the bounce, and Guptill has almost gotten to it at backward point. Well almost. My commentary has been adulterated by my fanboyism, so maybe. But he really jumped there, and tumbling as he fell on the ground. Good to watch but Mandeep gets four runs here

Sandeep Sharma to de Villiers, FOUR, goes full this ball and that's been smacked delightly, delicately through the other side of the wicket -- Sandeep is from over the wicket to AB here. Takes the ball on the up and disparages it away
Aaron to Mandeep, FOUR, good shot. Sees the length short and pulls it up and over the infield. Clears it easily for a boundary
Aaron to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, what he's done here is ruled out Guptill at backward point. Hit it over him, and wide of him. Short and wide, talls up and cuts it ferociously. Powerplay done: 46 for 3
Mohit Sharma to Mandeep, FOUR, to be a cutter or to not be a cutter, that isn't the question. This was wide, and it's been cut away through backward point. Life's simple

S Kaul to Stokes, FOUR, oh my word! You don't often see a batsman play the reverse-hit to a fast bowler. But Stokes does the unthinkable. Sees the short of length delivery early, changes his grip and swats it over point. Outrageous!

S Kaul to Christian, FOUR, Christian is off the mark with a boundary. Would you believe it? This is only the second boundary of the innings. A juicy half volley outside off, Christian leans forward and creams it through extra cover
Bhuvneshwar to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, a boundary to cap off the over. A short of length delivery outside off, Tiwary reaches out and places it behind point. No chance for the third man fielder
Bhuvneshwar to Dhoni, FOUR, bad idea Kumar. Arrows it on leg-stump line, Dhoni swivels 360 and hacks it over square leg
S Kaul to Dhoni, FOUR, such a calculative shot from Dhoni. Kaul angled this slower ball outside off, Dhoni throws his bat to his fullest and gets it over point. Not off the middle but he won't mind

Unadkat to Dhawan, FOUR, lovely shot, poor ball from Unadkat, short and wide of off, Dhawan reached out and cracks it in front of square on the off-side. Rahane moved across to his left, put in the dive, but the ball was always wide of him

Unadkat to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan has come out aggressively. Someone might have told him that the Indian team for Champions Trophy might be selected tomorrow. Unadkat shortened the length as he spotted Dhawan running down the track, makes room and slaps it over cover. Rahane has no chance in the deep

Christian to Warner, FOUR, calculated risk from Warner. First ball from a new bowler, mid-off inside the ring and Warner was walking down the pitch, extends his arms and lifts it over the fielder, couple of bounces and into the fence

Tahir to Yuvraj, FOUR, that is cricket. A chance off the last ball followed by a boundary. Flighted delivery on a fullish length, righth in the arc for Yuvraj, who heaves it to the deep mid-wicket fence. Placed it expertly

Stokes to Williamson, FOUR, edged and four, a juicy full-toss from Stokes, might have slipped out of his hands. Williamson was startled as he pushed at that, gets a thick edge that rolls away past the keeper and into the fence. An immediate apology from Stokes, but that wasn't dangerous

Stokes to Yuvraj, FOUR, a gift and Yuvraj gleefully accepts! Short and wide from Stokes, Yuvraj climbs into the cut and deposits it over cover, a couple of bounces and the ball rolls into the ad hoarding
Washington Sundar to Warner, FOUR, that's a good comeback from Warner, tossed up on the stumps, he gets down low and sweeps it over square leg, no need to run for those

Washington Sundar to Warner, FOUR, lovely, Warner is getting into the act now, slower and just outside off, he gets forward, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and finds the gap past extra-cover, beats mid-off and rolls away to the fence

Washington Sundar to Warner, FOUR, cracking shot, this is good batting from Warner, he's beginning to read Sundar now, tossed up on the stumps, he gets well forward and lifts it back over the bowler's head, one bounce and over the ropes

SN Thakur to Yuvraj, FOUR, edged and four, more luck for Yuvraj, full and wide of off from Shardul. Yuvraj saw the width and threw his hands at that, gets a thick edge that flies past Dhoni and into the fence

SN Thakur to Yuvraj, FOUR, creamed, width on offer from Shardul, Yuvraj leans into the shot and drives it to the left of extra-cover. It was in the air but was perfectly placed as well, no chance for the fielder at mid-off
McClenaghan to Nair, FOUR, cheeky and effective. Makes a bit of room to this shortish ball that was going across him, guides it over the slip fielder, who is fairly wide. Third man too is in the ring

McClenaghan to Nair, FOUR, the swipe that Delhi batsmen have been attempting to no avail. But this time he has got a bit of bat on it. The delivery was slower than usual, might have helped his cause. Hits over mid-wicket and fetches a four
Bumrah to Nair, FOUR, wickets are tumbling at one end but Nair continues to impress. Arches back to this short ball and ramps it over the keeper. A couple of bounces and into the fence

Harbhajan to Corey Anderson, FOUR, starts round the wicket and gets it to turn a bit around off. Corey Anderson goes back to cut, the ball keeps a bit low and takes the under edge. Goes between the legs of Parthiv. Bumrah, from short fine leg, gives the chase for a while before the ball beats him to the fence
Malinga to Corey Anderson, FOUR, drags the mighty heave from around off. For a moment he seemed to have found mid-wicket. But it was in the gap between mid-wicket and mid-on

Corey Anderson to Rohit, FOUR, beautifully played! This was a back of a length delivery outside off, Rohit waits on it, uses the pace on the ball and dabbed it behind square on the off-side. Backward point dived to his left, short third man to his right - but both can't stop the ball

Zaheer to Pollard, FOUR, Pollard gets way with another slice of luck. He came down the track, set himself up for the lap sweep, Zaheer spotted it and went wider, finds the outside edge and it loops past Pant. Can't do much as a bowler in this format of the game

Rabada to Pollard, FOUR, full marks for effort from Iyer, but he could not stop the boundary. Length delivery on off, Pollard heaved and the inside edge squirted towards fine leg. Iyer ran across from deep square and dived, but the ball won the race

Pat Cummins to Pollard, FOUR, fifty for Pollard. The move has paid off. He raises his bat and acknowledges the applause from his team mates. He shouldn't have been on strike for this ball. The basics in cricket I tell you. Low full toss and Pollard drills it past mid-off. No stopping that

Corey Anderson to Pollard, FOUR, good finish to the over. Anderson misses the yorker by a couple of inches and that is enough for Pollard to tonk it back over him, one bounce and evades the long-on fielder

Pat Cummins to Pollard, FOUR, lovely batting. Low full toss outside off, not far from the yorker, Pollard is deep in the crease, opens the bat face and drives through extra cover. No chance for the sweeper

Pat Cummins to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, this was not the area Hardik was targeting. He was looking to go over extra cover, but the bat turned on impact and the length delivery was sliced over backward point
Zaheer to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, that's a poor ball, spoils the over for Zaheer. Down the leg-side, the cutter gone wrong. Parthiv Patel helps the pull past the man in the ring at short fine leg
Rabada to Simmons, FOUR, now he is playing with the mind of Rabada. It's a short ball, gives himself some room and slaps over cover-point
Pat Cummins to Simmons, FOUR, that's as Caribbean as anything. Clears the left-leg and slaps this length ball over cover

Pat Cummins to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, how far has that gone. Far enough but bounces just inside the ropes. Parthiv Patel took on the short ball and went for the hook, hitting it high and almost handsome. One bounce over the ropes at deep backwars square leg fence
Pat Cummins to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, Parthiv Patel is giving it all. Backs away to this fuller ball and slices it past the ring, races to the third man fence

Pat Cummins to Parthiv Patel, leg byes, FOUR, Cummins switches to round the wicket to finish the over. Does not bring about a change in fortunes, drifts down the leg and Parthiv Patel helps it past the keeper. In fact between the keeper and the man at short fine leg with a whippish pull. That is what I saw, the umpire saw things differently and correctly. Given as leg-byes, must have come off thigh or something else
Shami to Simmons, FOUR, shortish ball. Bad ball to start off the over. Might have been warming up. Simmons makes full use of it, cuts past the man at backward point
Shami to Simmons, FOUR, he is cracking those off the back foot. And the length from Shami is not helping the cause of Delhi. Bit of width, Simmons creates some more and cuts it past the man at point
Shami to Simmons, FOUR, he is not going to budge, this man who beats jetlags. Clears the front leg and hits it flat over mid-off, one bounce and over the ropes

Aniket Choudhary to Chris Lynn, FOUR, Lynn is off. Sheer timing fetches him his first boundary. Fuller and just outside off, Lynn drives through the line and the timing take care of the rest. There was a fielder in the deep and he had no chance
Aniket Choudhary to Chris Lynn, FOUR, drilled. Aniket pitches it up and is dispatched with disdain. Lynn does not bother to move his feet and hammers the drive past a hapless AB at mid-off

Badree to Narine, FOUR, in the air and over short third. Narine shimmies down and Badree pushed it wide, the outside edge flies towards Aniket, who misjudged it slightly by moving in and by the time he tracked back, the ball was over him

Negi to de Grandhomme, FOUR, shortish outside off, and it's been slapped to the point boundary. What's Mandeep done to himself here? He charged across from sweeper cover and put in the dive. Valiant but futile effort. Looks in some pain. He's fine

Chahal to Chris Lynn, FOUR, that length is not going to trouble Lynn or for that matter any batsman. Short and on off, Lynn makes a bit of room and cracks it in front of square, raced away to the fence
Chahal to Chris Lynn, FOUR, excellent batting. He is intimidating the bowlers here. Chahal is not tossing them up now, Lynn stays on the back foot and thumps it past the diving extra cover fielder
Badree to Narine, FOUR, now this is rubbish. Rank long hop and down leg as well, Narine helps it along the way with a pull over short fine, this is just brilliant batting from the duo

Aravind to Narine, FOUR, wow! This is some hitting. Fullish and outside off, Narine nonchalantly lofts it inside out over extra cover, the ball almost carried the distance. One bounce and into the fence

Aravind to Narine, FOUR, the runs seem to be coming thick and fast. KKR want to finish this early so we can start the second game on time. Back of a length and outside off, Narine slaps it past mid-off. Not where he intended but the end result is what matters

Aravind to Narine, FOUR, full toss, come on you have to do better than that. Narine stands his ground and heaves it over mid-wicket, no one in the deep to stop that. Can he record the fastest fifty this season?
Aravind to Narine, FOUR, fullish and outside off, Narine slices it over the infield. The carnage continues. Aravind just doesn't know where to bowl to Narine and he concedes 26 runs in the over
Chahal to Chris Lynn, FOUR, short and outside off, Lynn slaps it over the off-side ring. No need to run for those when you keep striking them like that. This is simply brilliant batting from the duo

Woakes to Mandeep, FOUR, nice way to get going, banged in short and just outside off, Mandeep backs away, comes down the track and slaps it high and behind square on the off-side. Almost went all the way, one bounce and over the ropes

Rajpoot to Head, FOUR, that ruins the over for Rajpoot, much needed boundary for RCB. Too short and on Head's hips, he gets inside the line and helps it on its way. Fine-leg was inside the ring and once it beat him, there was no way it could be stopped
de Grandhomme to Mandeep, FOUR, good shot! Just used the pace of de Grandhomme and guided it behind point, opened the bat face at the right moment and bisected the two fielders to perfection

Woakes to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, Jadhav is too good with those pick ups. Sees the back of a length delivery around the hip region, Jadhav maintains a strong base and swats it behind square on the leg-side, no chance for deep square leg

U Yadav to Negi, FOUR, wow! Was that the outfield or the power of Negi? Bit of both I reckon. Too full and outside off, Negi reaches out for the drive and almost jammed it through extra cover. The ball kept going away from the long-off fielder

U Yadav to Mandeep, FOUR, cracking shot, Mandeep is finally showing the form that made him a possible India selection a couple of seasons ago. Picked up the short ball from Umesh, swiveled across, rolled his wrists over and pulls it behind square on the on-side for a boundary

U Yadav to Head, FOUR, ends the innings on a high. The slowest of slower balls from Umesh. Took a while getting to Head, he waited for a long time before pulling it over the square leg umpire. Since there was no pace, the ball didn't travel the distance

Woakes to de Villiers, FOUR, cracking shot, AB gets going, Woakes shortened his length as he saw AB's charge. Quick hands does the trick for the Protean superstar, swivels across, rolls his wrists over and pulls it in front of square on the on-side, beats the man getting across from the deep

Narine to de Villiers, FOUR, classy, that's why he's the best in the business, Narine dropped his length short and wide outside off, AB was shuffling across, adjusts well and slaps it over cover, one bounce and over the ropes
U Yadav to Head, FOUR, lovely shot, leg-stump half-volley from Umesh, Head shuffles across and whips it in front of square on the on-side. The man in the deep is very square and has no chance
Narine to Mandeep, FOUR, lovely shot, Narine drops one short and wide of off, Mandeep waits on it and cuts it late, beats backward point to his right and rolls away to the fence
Sandeep Sharma to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, swinging into the pads, no real threat, Ishan Kishan puts it away with a flick of the wrists. No-one at fine leg
Mohit Sharma to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, leg-side dross. Smith won't spare. He clips it behind square, so far that the man at deep square couldn't reach
Mohit Sharma to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, slower half-volley outside off, Smith gets to the pitch of it and thrashes it away between mid-off and extra cover. Simple
T Natarajan to Raina, FOUR, full toss on legs. Raina helps it to the deep backward square leg fence. Horrible ball, overheard in the comm room
Aaron to Raina, FOUR, Raina makes room, gets followed by a short ball but does not flinch. Goes with the pull - tennis-like heave - and sends it to the deep mid-wicket fence on the bounce
Aaron to Raina, FOUR, and gets this one fine. Shuffled across to a short ball and tucked in the air, but fine leg was not in the ring. Managed to fetch a four in the end
T Natarajan to Raina, FOUR, steps down does Raina this time. Natarajan wants to out-think him with a slower short ball. Fails. Raina cuts him to the deep point fence
Aaron to Karthik, FOUR, Aaron don't look at Maxi. Short and slow outside off. Karthik cuts past backward point and releases the pressure
T Natarajan to Karthik, FOUR, slower ball and Karthik lofts over extra cover. No one in the deep and it just about trickles down to the fence. All over. GL win by 6 wickets
Sandeep Sharma to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, trying too much? I guess so. Looks for swing again, there's none. Sat up from a short length, Smith punches sweetly through the covers. Save your legs!
Aaron to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, shortens the length and takes the pace off, Smith had the width to free his arms and he delays the cut shot, that helped him place in the gap on the off-side ring

Aaron to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, looks to tuck a length ball in the air over mid-wicket, gets a thick leading edge which lobs up and rolls towards third man. Sandeep Sharma tried his best, but he ended up parrying the ball into the boundary boards
Sandeep Sharma to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, too full, Smith bludgeons it back over the bowler's head. There's no stopping that
Sandeep Sharma to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, right where Smith likes it. Wide of off-stump, he uses his wrist power to smash a drive wide of extra cover. High elbow and all that...
Mohit Sharma to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, they are just feeding to his strengths. Full ball on the pads, Smith picks it up and kills it over mid-wicket
Maxwell to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, nothing seems to be working. Starts with a short ball, Ishan Kishan camps back and pulls through mid-wicket

Maxwell to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, how good a shot that is. Look at the placement. Ishan Kishan charges on the front foot, sees the length and shapes back, cuts and beats the man at point and then sweeper who ran to his right
Faulkner to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, full and down the leg-side, Marsh easily glances it past short fine leg, Ishan Kishan runs to his left in the deep and dives but the ball wins the race

Faulkner to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, 112kph slower ball, but you can't offer width with both backward point and third man inside the ring. Marsh delays the late cut and guides it nicely between the two fielders

Basil Thampi to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, that's Marsh's strength. He is so good with the cut shots. Just can't keep him calm by bowling it wide of off, plants his back foot deep and thumps it away past backward point

Basil Thampi to Amla, FOUR, oh Amla! You bewdy! He was shaping up to scoop over the keeper, on seeing the yorker dip he stays still and slaps it off the face over short third, all wrists you know. He might have borrowed VVS' wrists. Seriously! Never seen someone scoring so many runs at ease with pure wristwork
Basil Thampi to Amla, FOUR, width on offer, Amla charges himself for another flay, goes deep and carves it away over point
Faulkner to Amla, FOUR, low full toss, straight at the stumps, Amla lifts it barrel straight, no-one's stopping that!
Basil Thampi to Amla, FOUR, low full toss and Amla smashes it away over extra cover. Just a hit away now

Sangwan to Amla, FOUR, that's class for you. The off-side is packed and Amla nonchalantly walks across the stumps, tempts the bowler to bowl at the stumps, Sangwan delivers a slower ball, Amla had ample time to flick along the ground, made sure he placed it well wide of deep square leg
Sangwan to Amla, FOUR, this time he clears the off-side field. Slower delivery outside off stump, Amla leans forward, delays his punch and hits it along the ground through cover

Basil Thampi to Amla, FOUR, now that is a top shot! The change of pace, but Amla has great eyes. Picked that from the bowler's hand, delayed his shot, opened up the front leg and used his wrists so well to lift it inside-out over cover

Faulkner to Amla, FOUR, that is pure wrist power. This was the slower ball, but it went too full, meaning that the batsman had a bit of extra time to react, Amla flicked nicely along the ground through mid-wicket

Jadeja to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, and again. As soon as Marsh comes on strike, Jadeja forgets words like "flight, air-time, tossing." MS Dhoni has to be behind the stumps to give him advice when he is under pressure. This is a big outfield and maybe he need not be afraid to toss a ball up. It's flat, quick, short, Marsh pulls it nicely past the deep mid-wicket fielder

Ankit Soni to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, it's a full toss, the idea was there to give the ball a bit more air, but the execution wasn't great. Marsh doesn't try to over-hit the ball, places the flick between long-on and deep mid-wicket
Jadeja to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, Jadeja continues to bowl quick, errs in line once again. Down the leg-side, Marsh glances it fine past the man at 45

Bhuvneshwar to Rohit, FOUR, this time he gets a boundary! Shortish and wide outside off, Rohit throws the kitchen sink, gets a fat outside edge that flies through the gap between backward point and short third man. There is no one to stop that

Henriques to Rohit, FOUR, wow! Stupendous shot. Henriques starts with an 117kph half-volley outside off, Rohit spots it like a hawk, waits for it and drills it through the covers. There was a man in the deep, all he could do was watch it go past the boundary rope

Henriques to Rohit, FOUR, this is turning out to be an expensive over. Length ball outside off, Rohit doesn't go hard on his drive. Gets it wide of extra cover and the long-off fielder can't cut it off either

Henriques to Rohit, FOUR, four more, third boundary in this over. Deft touch from the MI skipper. Waits for the ball to arrive to him and cheekily opens the bat face at the last instance to guide it well wide of the short third man fielder. The ball dribbles away into the fence
Siraj to Rohit, FOUR, cheeky and effective. Short ball aimed at the body of Rohit. The batsman waited for it, slightly bends backward and periscopes it over the keeper's head for a boundary

S Kaul to Karn Sharma, FOUR, ah! Boundary to finish the over. Still, just six off it. Attempts the yorker and ends up being a low full toss, Karn Sharma backs away and manages to squirt it away behind square on the off-side off the outside part of the bat

Siraj to Nitish Rana, FOUR, now then, now then, how about that for placement? What confidence to play such a shot when he has not even scored a run. Third man was inside the ring, Rana spotted that, as soon as he saw room on the ball, Rana guided it late and split short third man and backward point to perfection
Siraj to Nitish Rana, FOUR, overpitched from Siraj, the over-correction from the bowler, Rana leans forward and plays a lovely off-drive to the left of mid-off

Nabi to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, this is a brave hit and well executed too. Flighted delivery wide outside off stump, Parthiv was down on one knee and he had to fetch that shot, extended his arms and slog-swept it nicely into the deep mid-wicket boundary

Rashid Khan to Rohit, FOUR, deft touch from the skipper. Quicker delivery outside off stump, Rohit allows the ball to come, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and sends it to the left of short third man
Harbhajan to Warner, FOUR, short and wide outside off stump, Warner delayed the cut shot as the ball came slowly, hit that really hard through cover-point. He wants to make the most of the new ball
Malinga to Henriques, FOUR, a full toss now. Henriques rides his luck with a dish out of some elegant timing. Executes a short arm jab to whip it in the air through mid-wicket

Malinga to Henriques, FOUR, and the mid-wicket fence is disturbed again. This time courtesy a standing up pull. Overcompensates the full toss with a pepper and Henriques - just what Henriques was waiting for. Rides the bounce with a toe-rise and dispatches
McClenaghan to Yuvraj, FOUR, breaks the shackles. Gets a short one on the ribs and an angry swivelling pull comes out in spanking it into the square leg fence. Hides his pain under some runs

Bumrah to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, that's that. A juicy length delivery right in the slot and Shankar swings it over mid-on. Trickling away into the fence with the field brought up. Applies the finishing touches in style. SRH plant their flag again to reclaim the fortress
Malinga to Dhawan, FOUR, full ball in the slot, Dhawan feasts on it. Thumps the drive through extra cover with lovely balance, stand and admire stuff!
Bumrah to Henriques, FOUR, eye-pleasing! Back of a length wide of off, Henriques gets into to perfect position as he punches the ball on the up through the covers, blazed away...

Bumrah to Dhawan, FOUR. The Gabbar is so good with the pull shot. Picks the length early and slots it all along the carpet through mid-wicket, too much to do for deep square, he couldn't get there in time
McClenaghan to Henriques, FOUR, that's too much width and can't expect to get away by bowling such fodder. Henriques uses McClenaghan's pace to slash it away through backward point
Hardik Pandya to Henriques, FOUR, smash-me delivery. No real intent on that delivery. It just kept arrowing down the leg-side, Henriques helps it to the fine leg fence with a real muscular pull
Hardik Pandya to Henriques, FOUR, width on the off-side to the right hander this time, Henriques has no second thoughts, he stays his ground and cuts fiercely square on the off-side
Karn Sharma to Dhawan, FOUR, down on one knee and he goes boom on the sweep. Gets inside the line and picks his gap through backward square, timed well too

Harbhajan to Dhawan, FOUR, precision at its very best! Call it luck or placement, but Dhawan and SRH won't mind. Attempts the reverse sweep and for a fleeting moment he seemed to have mistimed it, but such is the luck, it flies in the gap between short third and backward point
Sandeep Sharma to Narine, FOUR, and that is an usual sight. Sandeep Sharma throws it full outside off, might have swung a bit. But how does it matter, Narine flays the drive uppishly through cover

Sandeep Sharma to Narine, FOUR, back to back now! Another fuller ball and Narine this time lofts the drive, not much of followthrough. Just an extension of elbow and off she goes, one bounce over the ropes at extra cover
Sandeep Sharma to Chris Lynn, FOUR, swings a bit outside off. Chris Lynn takes that into account, clears the leg and cracks the drive over cover

Matt Henry to Chris Lynn, FOUR, Henry might have had a wicket off the first ball this season. But the wicket-keeper and the slip fielder both are undecided. Nobody went for it. Length delivery and Chris Lynn goes hard at it, outside edges that flies between the two men behind the stumps

Matt Henry to Chris Lynn, FOUR, Henry's pacy puts Chris Lynn in tangle once again but there is no one at fine leg. The man is in the ring. Chris Lynn was hurried by the bumper and top edged the pull. And because he throws his bat so hard, these edges fly over the ring
Rahul Tewatia to M Pandey, FOUR, geez, I have jinxed it, haven't I? Has the readymade room made and mows it off the front foot, right between long-on and deep mid-wicket

Mohit Sharma to Chris Lynn, FOUR, the partnership between Chris Lynn and M Pandey is now 50+. Mohit caps the over with a poor, poor ball. Overpitches at his normal pace - must have been about 135kmph - and Lynn flays him back over his head. The shot was on. Andcredit to Lynn for reading the change of pace, for Sharma was on the slower side for all the over but this. 37 off the last 3

Matt Henry to de Grandhomme, FOUR, slightly slower in the early 130s and de Grandhomme has picked him. Slices it square on the off-side and manages to place it wide of the deep point fielder. 29 off the last two

Sandeep Sharma to Chris Lynn, FOUR, there's a long on this time but it has gone too straight. Sandeep Sharma once again teases his luck with a fuller ball. Chris Lynn, who was backing away, on-drives this one with a loft. Finds the fence with ease
Mohit Sharma to Narine, FOUR, slower ball but Narine waits, as if he knew what was coming, and drives uppishly over extra cover. Not off the middle but does the job for him

Mohit Sharma to Narine, FOUR, the best we have seen so far? Maybe! Is making room to this length ball, the length is just short of a length and hence decides to play a straight-bat punch. Times it well to beat mid-off to his right
Axar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, Axar throws it wide outside off. Chris Lynn keeps his front leg out of the equation and drives to the deep cover fence
Axar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, has to wait a bit as the length is a touch shorter. Cuts and finds the gap past a diving extra cover, another four

Matt Henry to Chris Lynn, FOUR, only with a man of steel-forearms can do it. Short ball outside off, Chris Lynn is committed on the pull but the ball does not quite come with pace. He does not flinch, goes with the pull and fetches it from outside off, almost clears the fence at deep mid-wicket
U Yadav to Guptill, FOUR, first boundary of the evening. A loose ball down leg, Guptill moves across slightly and nudges it very fine into the fine leg fence

Rajpoot to Saha, FOUR, the edges too come in. Ah, unfair. Rajpoot bumps it in, gets it at the perfect nagging height and Saha's compulsive pull gets the top edge flying over the keeper. You cannot stop these

Rajpoot to Maxwell, FOUR, piles it on. With the width not enough to force matters in the off-side, Maxwell takes it into the other side of the pitch. Another back of a length this from Rajpoot looking to cramp him up for room and responded with a flat bat this time. Barely bothers to keep it down either, gets it in front of the man looking to cut it off at mid-wicket
Narine to Saha, FOUR, too short. Too wide. Further amplified by Saha backing away violently. Waits on the ball to get close and slaps it through the covers
Woakes to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, for some reason switches to a half volley. Tewatia, waits, buries and meets it with a full-blooded lofted drive through extra cover

Woakes to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, spots the slower off-cutter. And ensures to dispatch it away. Tries to fox him with the loopy bouncer here does Woakes but a walk across to pull it past the man at short fine does the job
Rajpoot to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, hunts the fence. Much needed this for the Punjabis. Takes it off the pads and brings out the broom as he sweeps it this away
Narine to Vohra, FOUR, doesn't get away this time. Seam up delivery from a shortish length, Vohra punches it handsomely through the covers. Finds the gap and the ball races away
Narine to Vohra, FOUR, cheeky and effective. Uses the slightest of widths outside off and opens his bat face to guide it wide of the keeper into the third man fence
U Yadav to Vohra, FOUR, slower delivery and Vohra takes full toll of it. The attemped leg-break ends up right in the slot for Vohra. The batsman jogs down and heaves it over mid-wicket for a boundary
U Yadav to Vohra, FOUR, wow! Superb shot. Vohra spots the slower delivery well outside off and carves it over point. There is none stopping that

de Grandhomme to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, ah! Streaky, Marsh won't mind though. Seam-up delivery on a short of length, probably kept a tad low. Marsh wanted to work it through the on-side and gets an inside edge that eludes the leg pole and dribbles away into the fine leg fence
de Grandhomme to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, that's textbook stuff from Shaun Marsh. Half-volley just outside off, Marsh leans forward and middles the straight-drive. That's Instagrammable

D Kulkarni to Samson, FOUR, that's as minimal footwork as you'd get, and the ball has sped to the boundary at the rate of knots. What timing. What a start. Shows you how good a pitch this is as well. Back of a length from Kulkarni, curling away a touch outside off, and Samson just caresses it from the crease through the covers
Sangwan to Samson, FOUR, full again, but too much width on this occasion and Samson roundhouses it to the cover boundary. Just lashed at the ball and got it away through the ring

Sangwan to Pant, FOUR, first ball and he's away. We've seen that before from Pant this season. Isn't shy to take the bowler on, even as early as his first ball. Picks length quickly, and swats it through mid-wicket off the front foot. Dismissive
Jadeja to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, flat and wide outside off, Iyer waits for it on the back foot and cuts it behind square on the off-side. Runs away to the fence and that brings up his fifty
Basil Thampi to Corey Anderson, FOUR, that should ease his nerves. Slightest of widths outside off and Anderson opens his bat face at the point of impact and punches it through square on the off-side

Basil Thampi to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, Thampi throws it wide outside off, Iyer forces it behind square on the off-side and the ball races away towards the fence. The man in the deep isn't sharp to stop that
Jadeja to Brathwaite, FOUR, wow! Easily done! Brathwaite gets low on one knee and laps it away into the fine leg fence

Jadeja to Brathwaite, FOUR, was there bat involved? The ump thinks so. The premeditated shot fetches Brathwaite a boundary. It was fired outside off, Brathwaite reverses his stance and tries to play the reverse sweep. Probably, there was a bit of wood on it. DK can't stop it and there no one else to stop that from reaching the fence

Sangwan to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, four to start the over. Iyer backs away, creates room and hammers this length ball from round the wicket through the covers. Thampi, in the deep, dives and makes a mess of it
Sangwan to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, four more! Once again, Iyer moves leg-side, opens up the off-side and cuts it fiercely behind square on the off-side
Sangwan to Pat Cummins, FOUR, good shot to open your account. He relied more on power than timing. Clears the front leg and hammers a length ball through extra cover
Sangwan to Pat Cummins, FOUR, wow! DD are still in this game. Sangwan angles it on a length, Cummins moves slightly leg-side and flat-bats it down the ground
D Kulkarni to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, third boundary in a row. Full ball around off, Iyer waits for the ball and carves it between mid-off and extra cover

D Kulkarni to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, make that four! This is excellent batting. A mini shuffle across from Iyer and is helped by a low full toss on middle and leg. Helped away through backward square leg
D Kulkarni to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, and another one! Kulkarni is feeling the heat. Drifts one on the pads of Iyer. Tickled away fine into the fine leg fence

Faulkner to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, with mid-off up, you don't bowl full. That's exactly what Faulkner did and got punished. Iyer drills the drive wide of a diving mid-off fielder. 21 off the over and DD need just 23 with three overs to go

Faulkner to Shami, FOUR, oh Soni! What have you done? Slower ball, was a full toss as well. Shami backs away and throws the kitchen sink. Manages an outside edge, that goes to the left of short third man. Soni, there, initially went to his right and hence couldn't stop that as it spun away from his dive. That could well be the turning point

Basil Thampi to Mishra, FOUR, 3 off 3 now! What a shot! Dhoni-esque. Dances down the track and elegantly flicks it through mid-wicket after converting it into a full toss. Wristily played and it raced away off the bat. Jaddu gives up in the deep

Basil Thampi to Mishra, FOUR, Mishra has done it! He was the villain against RCB early in the tournament, not giving strike to Pant. Not today. With seven needed off four balls, he comes in and hits two boundaries. Cheeky shot. Back of the hand slower ball, was a full toss as well. Mishra moved across, waited for a long time and helped it away wide of the keeper. Akshdeep Nath at fine leg, tried his best, but couldn't stop the ball from going past the rope. DD win by 2 wickets

D Kulkarni to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, beautifully done. The ball is coming on so well that you need not go hard at it. All timing. Back of a length outside off, Iyer punches it through point with a firm bottom hand
Sangwan to Nair, FOUR, the bat-face opens as Nair tries to loft a drive over mid-off but he's got enough behind it to skew it over the infield. Gets it away into the extra-cover boundary
Sangwan to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, pounces on the width and flashes it up and over backward point. Poor delivery. Iyer up and running with a nice couple of boundaries

Basil Thampi to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, overpitches and Iyer puts him away. It's a juicy delivery on middle, with Thampi perhaps missing a yorker. Nice roll of the wrists from Iyer to flick it through mid-wicket. The man in the deep is too square
Basil Thampi to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, Thampi gets too straight and too full again and he's been whipped away. Iyer not missing out on any freebies he gets. Beats short fine leg to his right
Dwayne Smith to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, now here's a surprise. Dwayne Smith bowling in the powerplay. He drops it short and wide first ball and is crashed to the boundary. DD building some good momentum
Dwayne Smith to Nair, FOUR, treating Smith with utter disdain. That's dismissive. Good length ball, Nair muscles it with a lot of bottom hand over mid-on. Nearly carried all the way

Dwayne Smith to Nair, FOUR, he's decided that Smith has to go. Really good tactics from Nair. These are gentle medium pace deliveries and he's backing himself to clear the infield. Goes over mid-on again. One bounce and over
Dwayne Smith to Nair, FOUR, oh shocker. Very short and very wide. With third man up, all Nair has to do is make some connection, especially with him going so hard. Upper-cuts it over short third man
Jadeja to Nair, FOUR, goes down low, reverses his stance and scoops the reverse-sweep over short third man. Nair rattling along. 30 off 13 balls now

Faulkner to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, this is what he was trying to do the previous ball. Gets it spot on this time. Waits on the back of length delivery, allows it to pass him and then taps it just beside the keeper to have it racing into the third man boundary
Faulkner to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, and again. Such a deft touch. Normal pace from Faulkner and Iyer utilizes all of it and steers it cheekily. Karthik dives, third man dives, but to no avail

Zaheer to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, the outfield here is so quick. Cutter on the pads of Dwayne Smith and he tucks it past the square leg umpire. The man behind square on the on-side did not have much to cover, yet the ball beat him to the fence
Shami to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, precision at its best. A normal seam-up delivery around off and Ishan Kishan drives on the up, opens the face of the bat a bit to place it between cover and point

Corey Anderson to Karthik, FOUR, top shot! Short of length, Karthik rides the bounce and punches it beautifully through extra cover, the fielder at mid-off was a touch too straight and had no chance of stopping that

Corey Anderson to Finch, FOUR, not where he intended, but that should relieve some pressure. The cross-seam back of a length delivery delivery, Finch heaves and the inside edge goes behind square on the leg-side, Shami had no chance in the deep

Corey Anderson to Karthik, FOUR, poor delivery and Anderson pays for it. 9 runs off the first three balls. The off-pace delivery is on the pads, Karthik glances it fine and picks up the second boundary of the over
Brathwaite to Finch, FOUR, GL picking up the run rate. Six followed by a four. Rubbish from Brathwaite, sprays it down leg, Finch helps it along the way and beats a squarish fine leg

Zaheer to Finch, leg byes, FOUR, appeal for LBW and umpire Anil Chaudhary has got it spot on. Right off the back boot. Low full toss and Finch wanted to sweep it, missed and the ball runs away off the right boot. The ball had pitched outside leg and hence a good decision from the umpire

Brathwaite to Jadeja, FOUR, some charity from Brathwaite. A nice juicy full toss outside off for the new batsman, Jadeja had ample time to pick his spot and he slices it behind point, away from the deep point fielder

Brathwaite to Finch, FOUR, now the finesse from the Australian. Had the width to play whatever shot he needed, he chooses to back cut it behind square on the off-side, splitting backward point and short third man to perfection

Pat Cummins to Finch, FOUR, that is straight in Finch's alley. Full and outside off, and he is too good with the inside out shots, stays leg-side of the ball and goes over the fielder, couple of bounces and into the fence

Pat Cummins to Finch, FOUR, wow! What wristwork. He backed away and Cummins follows him, almost cramped for room is Finch, but still manages to whip it wide of long-on. The strong wrists come into play to execute that shot

Shami to Jadeja, FOUR, Shami's turn for some charity work. Second full toss Jadeja has got this innings and he has put that away, heaved wide of mid-wicket, got it high on the bat but more importantly had found the gap
Zaheer to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, shaping in this time. But Zaheer has gone too full, making things easier for Ishan Kishan. Whips it past mid-wicket. Timed it beautifully

Pat Cummins to Faulkner, FOUR, streaky, but GL will take it. It was a good over from Cummins. Full, fast and slanting into the batsman, Faulkner heaves across the line and the inside edge eludes a diving Sanju Samson

Shami to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, that's his area - behind square on the on-side and Shami is playing into his court by bowling it short. Now that Ishan Kishan has got the idea of the pace off the pitch, he is picking them well. Pulled this one over the man at fine leg, who is inside the ring
Zaheer to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, so lucky Ishan Kishan is there. Tries to drive a full ball from off and almost chops it on. The ball misses the stumps and rolls to the fine leg boundary
Pat Cummins to Raina, FOUR, Raina makes room and gets a short ball to his liking. Cuts over cover, a couple of bounces and into the fence
Pat Cummins to Karthik, FOUR, races off the bat of Karthik. Did not try to hit that hard. Just timing and made sure that he placed it well. Driven on the up past cover, what a way to get off the mark
Mishra to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, bad ball. Down the leg-side, Ishan Kishan does not have to do much, sweeps it well to the fine leg fence. Was trying a googly there
Mishra to Karthik, FOUR, slides down the leg-side. Karthik helps it fine off the inside part of the willow. Races to the fence
Brathwaite to Finch, FOUR, what timing from Finch there. Gets on his toes and accomodates the bounce and angle from Brathwaite, tucks through backward square leg
Hardik Pandya to Guptill, FOUR, swing for Hardik, but it's full and way outside off. Guptill leans into the drive and hits it over the man at cover-point, a few bounces and over the ropes

Hardik Pandya to Guptill, FOUR, edged and four, Harbhajan leaped at first slip, might have got a finger-tip on that, but there was no way he was catching it. Guptill came down the track to a floaty outswinger, gets a thick edge as he slapped, the edge just about cleared the leaping first slip fielder
Hardik Pandya to Saha, FOUR, cracking shot, width on offer from Hardik, it was short as well. Saha leans into the free-flowing drive and finds the gap past cover-point, no need to run for those

McClenaghan to Saha, FOUR, nicely played by Saha, hint of width outside off. Saha waits on it, opens the face of the bat and guides it past the slip cordon, no one in the deep and the ball rolls away to the fence

McClenaghan to Saha, FOUR, beautifully played, length delivery on the stumps, Saha gets forward, uses his wrists to good effect and flicks it over mid-on, almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes
Bumrah to Maxwell, FOUR, intentional! Maxwell waits for this seam-up delivery and opens the face of the bat at the last moment to get this one past the keeper to his right, races away

Harbhajan to Saha, FOUR, Saha is deceived for a while, in the flight. But does well to go with the shot and hits it well enough to beat the dive from long-off to his right. Eventually timed it really well
McClenaghan to Saha, FOUR, slower balls lose their venom when banged in short. Like this time. Saha has all the time in the world, waits and pulls to the left of the man at deep square leg
Bumrah to Saha, FOUR, such awareness from Saha, sees the mid-off is inside the ring, makes room and lofts over him so nonchalantly. A couple of bounces and into the fence

McClenaghan to Saha, no ball, FOUR, lovely shot from Saha, he's looking in good touch already. A no-ball as well as McClenaghan flicked the bails during his delivery stride. Turns out to be a low full-toss, Saha presents a straight bat and punches it back past the non-striker

Malinga to Saha, FOUR, expensive start from Malinga, it was the slower ball, but it gave Saha plenty of time to spot it. He makes room and carves it inside out over cover, a couple of bounces and over the ropes

Malinga to Saha, FOUR, this is turning out to be a very expensive over from Malinga, short and on the stumps, Saha swivels across and pulls it behind square on the on-side, back-to-back boundaries for Saha
Bumrah to Guptill, FOUR, drilled, Bumrah kept it full and on the stumps, Guptill backs away, makes room and drives it through the gap at extra-cover, no need to run for those
Karn Sharma to Guptill, FOUR, tossed up on the stumps, Guptill was setting himself up for the big slog sweep, gets a thick inside edge and beats the fielder at square leg, rolls away to the fence
Karn Sharma to Guptill, FOUR, lovely, tossed up nicely by Karn, right in the zone for Guptill, he clears his left leg and drills it back over the bowler's head, one bounce and over the ropes

McClenaghan to Saha, FOUR, cheeky and four, leg-stump half-volley from McClenaghan, Saha bends down low, uses McClenaghan's pace and laps it past the keeper, no need to run for those with fine-leg inside the ring

McClenaghan to Maxwell, FOUR, nicely played by Maxwell, back of a length and on the stumps, he waits on it, opens the face of the bat and runs it past the keeper. The pace of McClenaghan does the rest

McClenaghan to Saha, FOUR, this is excellent batting from Saha, McClenaghan went short and wide of off as Saha backed away, he waits on it, uses the pace of the bowler and taps it on its head, splits the gap between backward point and short third man to perfection
Sandeep Sharma to Simmons, FOUR, and Mumbai take off with Punjab's momentum. Gets a delivery nipping onto the pads and tickles it away fine enough to go all the way

Matt Henry to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, pouncing on the pace. Pouncing on the bounce. 142kays of it and Parthiv throws everything at it as he hacks it. And even a mistime is enough on this carpet to race it away into the fence - the mid-wicket one
Matt Henry to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, more of the pace offered. This time Parthiv forces it through the line. 142kays again and a front footed smear through the covers. Ah, elegance all over it

Matt Henry to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, make that three. Parthiv on a carnage. Pitched up further, more of the width and an invite to get back to the business of dispatching these away. Done with another full flowing cover drive

Ishant to Nitish Rana, FOUR, time for cliches, "Fortune favours the brave" chirps Laxman Sivaramakrishnan on air. Also, french cricket from Rana, goes for the almighty pull, the ball shapes in a touch, takes the inside edge and beats a diving Saha, who sprawled to his right. Runs away to the fence in a jiffy

Sandeep Sharma to Pollard, FOUR, it's a summer sale. Pollard is making a joke of these boundaries. Sandeep misses his yorker, serves it up on a fuller length, Pollard brings his bottom hand into effect, dumps it straight down the ground

Sandeep Sharma to Karn Sharma, FOUR, another massive over for Mumbai. Again, Sandeep offers a full toss, Karn frees his shoulders and clouts it wide of long-on, Maxi runs to his left and tries to keep the ball back in play but in vain
Mohit Sharma to Karn Sharma, FOUR, this match ain't over folks. To rub salt into the wounds and other jazz. Mohit goes wider of off, Karn protracts his hands and lifts it over cover-point
Mohit Sharma to Karn Sharma, FOUR, this is getting better and better for Mumbai. Full toss and outside off, Karn throws the kitchen sink and gets an outside edge that runs past short third man

Ishant to Simmons, FOUR, oh my. That's a punch, a ramp and an upper cut all in one. Ishant looks to climb onto his neck. A typical Caribbean back footed stride and an open batted punch to race it through the cordon
Sandeep Sharma to Simmons, FOUR, a wasted line. Ruins what was well on the course of turning out to be a top over. Down leg and helped along getting it past the man at short fine

Ishant to Simmons, FOUR, all timing. And glory. Nicely pitched up, very friendly. The reply isn't am afraid. A perfect approach to the pitch of the delivery and a smear to time the pants off it. Through the covers
Ishant to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, okay now a few runs for the luck brigade. Nicely snaking up and a desperate/compulsive pull takes the top edge and flies in no man's land. Over the keeper's head

Ishant to Simmons, FOUR, pile on the misery. Ishant slips, tumbles, falls down and then gets up to see the ball hitting the fence. A slip onto the hips and nurdled away fine enough. Mumbai well on course
Mohit Sharma to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, oh the cheek. The deft. Attempts the scoop and nails it. Off the middle of the blade, nothing streaky about this one as he guides it past the keeper

Mohit Sharma to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, now conventional. But keeps thudding the fence. Forces it full, forces it wide and amplified further with Parthiv backing away and smacking the drice off a knee. Sliced over a leaping Ishant at short third

Mohit Sharma to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, short. Down leg. But Parthiv refuses to relent. Keeps the dancing shoes on. Gets inside the line and pulls it away past the lurking short fine. This is murder. Call 100

Mohit Sharma to Nitish Rana, FOUR, a new man, the same old line down leg and the same old response. Doesn't matter that it is only the first ball he's facing. Whips it away with enough chunk of wood on it to take it behind square

Christian to Samuels, FOUR, lovely shot, width on offer from Christian, Samuels backs away and slaps it square on the off-side. Tripathi got across to his left from deep point, puts in the slide and drags the ball back in - but the ball slowly rolls back onto the ropes

Unadkat to Nair, FOUR, lovely shot, width on offer from Unadkat, Karun arches back, waits on the ball and cuts it late - gets it into the gap behind point and beats the fielder getting across to his left from deep point

Unadkat to Nair, FOUR, expensive over from Unadkat, topo short and at his pace it's easy pickings for the batsman. Karun waits on it and pulls it in front of square on the on-side. Long-on has no chance of cutting it off
Washington Sundar to Nair, FOUR, this is excellent improvisation from Nair. Gets well outside the line and sweeps it over short fine leg for a boundary

Washington Sundar to Nair, FOUR, good batting that from Nair. His eyes lit up for the tossed up delivery outside off and a perfect execution of the slog sweep. Finds the cow corner fence on the bounce
Stokes to Nair, FOUR, Nair showing his class now. Sees the width outside off and helps it wide of short third man. With the field inside the circle on the off-side, this shot was always on the cards

Stokes to Nair, FOUR, Nair is in the zone today. He is seeing the ball well and has the awareness of the field. Makes room to this short delivery and pulls it well over the infield. The ball bounces just once before crashing into the ad boards

Stokes to Nair, FOUR, Stokes tries to attack the pads of Nair. He backs away and chips it over mid-wicket. Fielder from deep square leg tries to get across, but fails to stop the ball from rolling over
SN Thakur to Pant, FOUR, Pant gets into the act now. Full and straight, Pant goes through the line and drills it straight down the ground. Smith had no chance of stopping that at mid-on
SN Thakur to Pant, FOUR, nicely done. Thakur slips one down the leg. Pant goes low and helps it down to fine leg. Fine leg was inside the circle and the ball raced away to the fence in no time

SN Thakur to Pant, FOUR, Thakur is struggling with his line. Left-right combination is making it much difficult for him to stick to one line. Now he slips onw down the legs of Pant, who helps it down to fine leg with a flick

Zampa to Nair, FOUR, 50-run stand comes up for the duo with a top shot from Nair. Wasn't all that short, Nair quickly jumps on the back foot and cuts it square of the wicket. The fielder in the deep was too square and had no chance of stopping that

Christian to Nair, FOUR, exactly what he could have done with the third ball this over. Short and wide again, Nair gets his back foot across and slaps it past backward point. The ball rockets to the fence
Zampa to Pant, FOUR, rank long hop from Zampa. Gets what it deserves. Pant rocks on the back foot and pulls it hard along the ground. Splits deep backward square leg and deep mid-wicket to perfection
Zaheer to Smith, FOUR, this one does not swing. And hence there is no exaggerated shuffle from Smith. Stands his ground and flays the drive through cover. Races away
Zaheer to Tripathi, FOUR, Tripathi shows how to tackle the inswinger from Zaheer. Steps down and clips with the swing to bisect the field between mid-on and mid-wicket

Shami to Smith, FOUR, slower ball. Smith does not bother getting closer to the ball. All hands from him as he drives through extra cover. Zaheer has his hands on Shami's shoulder. Must be some words of wisdom

Pat Cummins to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, another iffy slog which results in a miscue, but Tiwary gets enough on it this time to drag the ball over wide mid-on and into the boundary. That's precisely why he was targeting this shot. Mid-on is inside the ring, and with a little bit of fortune, he's able to muscle it over him

Mishra to Stokes, FOUR, that's brilliantly bowled, and Mishra is so unlucky here. Having not given anything by way of flight all through the over, he tosses up a googly and dangles it wide of off to reap the pay-off for his pressure. Stokes bites, has an almighty swish at it but he is trying to drag the ball into the on-side against the turn, a ball which is very wide in the first place. The edge is found but it zooms over the man at slip

Pat Cummins to Stokes, FOUR, hoho, fierce! Absolutely fierce from Stokes. He's just showed Cummins who's the boss. He gives charge, and accordingly Cummins bangs it in short. But Stokes isn't backing down. He thumps the ball wide of long-on into the boundary

Samuels to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, smart from Tiwary. Samuels generally bowls it quicker through the air, so Tiwary smartly stoops across on the back knee, uses the pace and paddles it round the corner. His placement is spot on, splitting the dives from short fine and long leg

Pat Cummins to Manoj Tiwary, leg byes, FOUR, away to the boundary, but that's not enough. What irony. The one ball which Cummins has nailed into the blockhole has gone to the ropes. Tiwary is beaten by it, the ball hits his boot, misses leg-stump by a whisker and leaves the keeper wrong-footed. But it's game over with eight needed off one
Nadeem to Smith, FOUR, steps down and almost loses the balance but does well to slap it past point. How often does he do he something like that? Pretty often
Nadeem to Smith, FOUR, and now Nadeem drops it short. Smith uses the depth of the crease and cuts past point
Shami to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, what a shot. Lets the ball shape away and then goes back to punch through cover. Found the gap with ease
Shami to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, just a little push but the sound it made was a proof of superb timing. Manoj Tiwary got on the front foot and then beat the man at cover

Mishra to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, too much risk involved for a single. Oh, wait. Shami at fine leg has made sure that Manoj Tiwary is rewarded well for the risk, Tiwary had taken his front foot long way across to fetch the sweep from off and middle. Was lucky to have connected
Nadeem to Stokes, FOUR, fuller ball on the legs of Stokes, who gets the toe-edge while trying to flick. The ball races to the third man fence
Bhuvneshwar to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, first four of the innings. Beats the five men on the off-side with a cracking cut. The width was there and he pounced on that beating a diving cover-point

Bhuvneshwar to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, the slip was there for Ishan Kishan's first ball. But he was taken off for this one and guess what the ball goes right through that gaping hole. Good delivery from Bhuvneshwar, hitting a length and getting bounce, the edge was found but there was no-one to catch and it runs away to the third man fence
Rashid Khan to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, mowed from outside off and beats long-on to his right. Knelt down and hit it, not with great timing but good enough to get it in the gap and four more

Bhuvneshwar to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, very sloppy from Dhawan. Attacked the ball in trying to prevent the second and gives away two more. Thrashed to him and in running to his left from sweeper, he lets it go through his hands. A slight bobble before the ball came to him, but still should've been stopped
Rashid Khan to Jadeja, FOUR, smashed. Too full and Jadeja used his levers to bullet it past the umpire. Who did well to get out of the way
Siraj to Faulkner, FOUR, low full toss and sliding down, helped past backward square leg. Easy delivery to get and Faulkner doesn't miss out

Bhuvneshwar to Jadeja, FOUR, awkwardly for Warner and he can't stop it. A high full toss, swung away by Jadeja, bounces just in front of his body and he can't even get a hand on that. Slips away from his grasp

S Kaul to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, four more. Again the pull. Can't bowl into his strengths. Into his range. This short ball sits up for him and he unleashes the Brian Lara-esque one-legged short arm-jabbed pull. Beats short fine to his right and races away
Siraj to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, short and wide outside off, Ishan Kishan rolled his wrists on the cut and got it down, beats extra cover and gets another boundary
Siraj to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, too full this time from Siraj and Ishan Kishan lofts over mid-off. Siraj is bleeding here and Ishan has raced to 31 off 13
Siraj to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, smashed past the stumps at the other end. Too full and Dwayne Smith has drilled that in a flash. Rocketed away

Nabi to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, and now four more. Nabi fired that fuller and faster on the stumps, a powerful drive and Warner at mid-off is slightly wide, so can't get there and once he did, didn't dive. Smith is hurting SRH

Rashid Khan to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, cute little paddle now. The line is down leg and with short fine inside that's not the way to go, Dwayne Smith gets sufficient bat on that and beats the man inside the ring
Henriques to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, Dwayne Smith is a monster when he gets going that is. Stands on the crease and butchers this slowish off-cutter that sits up, beats extra cover with ease
Henriques to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, everything going GL's way. A genuine outside edge and it has flown to the third man fence. Flashed at a length delivery outside off and got a thick edge
Bhuvneshwar to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, first four of the innings. Beats the five men on the off-side with a cracking cut. The width was there and he pounced on that beating a diving cover-point

Bhuvneshwar to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, the slip was there for Ishan Kishan's first ball. But he was taken off for this one and guess what the ball goes right through that gaping hole. Good delivery from Bhuvneshwar, hitting a length and getting bounce, the edge was found but there was no-one to catch and it runs away to the third man fence
Rashid Khan to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, mowed from outside off and beats long-on to his right. Knelt down and hit it, not with great timing but good enough to get it in the gap and four more

Bhuvneshwar to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, very sloppy from Dhawan. Attacked the ball in trying to prevent the second and gives away two more. Thrashed to him and in running to his left from sweeper, he lets it go through his hands. A slight bobble before the ball came to him, but still should've been stopped
Rashid Khan to Jadeja, FOUR, smashed. Too full and Jadeja used his levers to bullet it past the umpire. Who did well to get out of the way
Siraj to Faulkner, FOUR, low full toss and sliding down, helped past backward square leg. Easy delivery to get and Faulkner doesn't miss out

Bhuvneshwar to Jadeja, FOUR, awkwardly for Warner and he can't stop it. A high full toss, swung away by Jadeja, bounces just in front of his body and he can't even get a hand on that. Slips away from his grasp

S Kaul to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, four more. Again the pull. Can't bowl into his strengths. Into his range. This short ball sits up for him and he unleashes the Brian Lara-esque one-legged short arm-jabbed pull. Beats short fine to his right and races away
Siraj to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, short and wide outside off, Ishan Kishan rolled his wrists on the cut and got it down, beats extra cover and gets another boundary
Siraj to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, too full this time from Siraj and Ishan Kishan lofts over mid-off. Siraj is bleeding here and Ishan has raced to 31 off 13
Siraj to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, smashed past the stumps at the other end. Too full and Dwayne Smith has drilled that in a flash. Rocketed away

Nabi to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, and now four more. Nabi fired that fuller and faster on the stumps, a powerful drive and Warner at mid-off is slightly wide, so can't get there and once he did, didn't dive. Smith is hurting SRH

Rashid Khan to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, cute little paddle now. The line is down leg and with short fine inside that's not the way to go, Dwayne Smith gets sufficient bat on that and beats the man inside the ring
Henriques to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, Dwayne Smith is a monster when he gets going that is. Stands on the crease and butchers this slowish off-cutter that sits up, beats extra cover with ease
Henriques to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, everything going GL's way. A genuine outside edge and it has flown to the third man fence. Flashed at a length delivery outside off and got a thick edge
Johnson to Gambhir, FOUR, good shot. Not all that and he latches on to it, rocks back and pulls hard wide of mid-on. Races away
Vinay Kumar to de Grandhomme, FOUR, fine late cut. Waited for the rising back of a length delivery outside off and then played it late, eluded backward point and gave third man no chance

Vinay Kumar to de Grandhomme, FOUR, to the left of third man. This is an edge. Tried to force that through backward point, the ball got big on him and he couldn't control it. But it raced away through the vacant gully region

Vinay Kumar to de Grandhomme, FOUR, now Rohit is angry. Must be at Vinay Kumar. He brought the third man up and Vinay Kumar hasn't bowled to his field. A slower delivery outside off, de Grandhomme plays it late and directs it in the gap between backward point and short third. That's three fours in the over

Krunal Pandya to de Grandhomme, FOUR, third four in that area between backward point and short third. Delicately steering it in the gap, beating the dive of backward point. Simmons did his best but couldn't stop it. Raced away
Southee to M Pandey, FOUR, good start after the break. Sliding into the hips, elegantly flicked away, past short fine inside the ring and deep square can't get across. Stylishly put away too
Southee to Kuldeep Yadav, FOUR, cute from Kuldeep Yadav. On a length and outside off, Kuldeep Yadav opens the face of the bat and runs it down, beats third man. Raced away. Southee isn't happy at all

Southee to Kuldeep Yadav, FOUR, what is Johnson doing? A regulation stop and he lets it go through his legs. Rohit looks at him in surprise. Kuldeep Yadav moved across and helped the low full toss to fine leg's right. What was at best two became four

Johnson to Gambhir, FOUR, Johnson flashes a wry smile. After conceding a boundary. Short into the body, but not that high to cause any trouble, Gambhir swivels and pulls, beats deep backward square running to his left. So after the wicket maiden, 11 have come off the second over

Southee to Chris Lynn, FOUR, and he shows us here that it is not all brawn about him. There is a smart brain to go with it as well. This is down leg and with short fine inside the ring, he whips it over the man's head. 19 off the over and Chris Lynn is turning it on
Karn Sharma to Gambhir, FOUR, Gambhir comes down the track and then plays his favorite lofted hit. Over a leaping extra cover. Just managed to clear the man and that will be good in the powerplay

Johnson to Chris Lynn, FOUR, inhuman this fella is. Really. How hard and flat has he hit that. To a short rising delivery into the body. He just has smashed the leather off the ball and gave deep square no chance. Muscled that with sheer force
Johnson to Chris Lynn, FOUR, and now gets inside the line of this and helps the pull wide of short fine. Back to back boundaries and what was looking like a good over has been spoiled
Karn Sharma to M Pandey, FOUR, rocks back and tries to pull into the deep mid-wicket stands. But doesn't get that much power, into the gap and a four

de Grandhomme to Saurabh Tiwary, FOUR, Tiwary is off and running with a boundary, on a good length and just outside off, Tiwary gets across and punches it on the up, beats the laboured dive from Pathan at cover-point and rolls away to the fence

de Grandhomme to Saurabh Tiwary, FOUR, easy pickings for Tiwary, can't bowl short and wide - when you have third man inside the ring. Tiwary went hard on the cut, gets a thick top-edge that cleared the inner ring, almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes

Rajpoot to Saurabh Tiwary, FOUR, unleashes the anger. In the slot, the juicy length and Tiwary smacks it through the line. Doesn't hold a muscle back in his bat swing as he forehands it over the bowler's head
Narine to Rayudu, FOUR, brings out the broom. Spots the length, the friendly one and without bothering to read the turn this time sweeps it powerfully through square leg
U Yadav to Saurabh Tiwary, FOUR, delicious width. Gobbled up with glee. Gets the chance to free his arms and uses all of Umesh's pace as he slaps it hard. Over point

Narine to Rayudu, FOUR, gets another drag down. And the off-cutter. Opens up his front leg, lines up and has all the time to unleash a power through mid-wicket. A much needed fence hit for Mumbai - and Rayudu. Only his second
