Narine to Saurabh Tiwary, FOUR, too short. And pays the price. Some pressure off his shoulders with a rock back deep inside the crease and a pull into the cow corner fence. Piercing the gap to perfection

Narine to Saurabh Tiwary, FOUR, follows up the muscle display with some elegance. Walks into the line, to the pitch of the delivery and shows the maker's name in tonking it down the ground. Into the fence on the bounce. Brings up his half-ton as well. In the first chance he is given
U Yadav to Rayudu, FOUR, right off the screws. He's losing his radar here is Umesh, darting it wide and Rayudu slices it over point
Narine to Rayudu, FOUR, in the middle of all the power here comes the deft touches. Opens up his bat very late and uses up the iota of width in running it through the cordon
Boult to Rayudu, FOUR, on the up. And a dispatch. the strike rate is back to normalcy now. Stands up on the bounce, shows the full bat face and flays it through extra cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Rayudu, FOUR, he's into the toying around zone now. Dances down, inherits the ball in his slot and lofts it over the bowler. Effortless. The new bat I tell you
Boult to Saurabh Tiwary, FOUR, lovely shot, on a good length and just outside off, Tiwary leans forward, drives it on the up and clears Lynn at short extra-cover, no need to run for those

U Yadav to Rohit, leg byes, FOUR, poor ball from Umesh and not the greatest of keeping by Uthappa either, this was full and on Rohit's pads, he was looking to flick and missed. Uthappa went down slowly and only manages his fingertips on that, not enough and the ball rolls away to the fence
U Yadav to Rohit, FOUR, cracking shot, length ball on Rohit's pads, he leans forward, uses his wrists to good effect and clips it past mid-wicket, beats the fielder and rolls away to the fence

U Yadav to Saurabh Tiwary, FOUR, this is turning out to be an expensive over from Umesh, on a good length and just outside off, Tiwary leans forward, drives it on the up and finds the gap to the left of mid-off, rolls away to the fence in a hurry

Narine to Rohit, FOUR, the two men behind square on the on-side are in the ring and hence Rohit goes for the sweep. This is what he tried on the first ball as well, this time connects and fetches a four to the deep backward square leg fence
U Yadav to Saurabh Tiwary, FOUR, thick edge! Shortish ball outside off. Saurabh Tiwary goes for the cut and gets late, the ball is quick enough to beat the third man fielder, who ran to his right
de Grandhomme to Rohit, FOUR, nicely done. Did not try to overhit it. Let the short ball come to him and swiveled well to beat short fine leg's dive to his left
Kuldeep Yadav to Rohit, FOUR, goes with the turn does Rohit and which is why this slog looks elegant. On top of that, has found the gap too. One bounce and over the ropes at the deep square leg fence
Kuldeep Yadav to Rohit, leg byes, FOUR, wrong 'un. Rohit tries the sweep, without reading the turn on it. The ball turns away to beat the bat, ricochets off the outer part of his torso

Unadkat to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, almost another! On a good length and well wide of off, Marsh was leaning on the drive, the ball held up slightly and hits him high on the bat - went in the air and just wide of Tiwary at extra-cover, beats mid-off and rolls away to the fence

SN Thakur to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, cracking shot, leg-stump half-volley from Shardul, Marsh waits on it, leans into the on-drive and finds the gap wide of mid-wicket - should get plenty of confidence with that blow

SN Thakur to Eoin Morgan, FOUR, cracking shot, width on offer from Shardul, Morgan gets on top of the bounce and cracks it square on the off-side, beats the fielder at point and rolls away to the fence

Stokes to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, lovely shot, fraction overpitched and wide of off, Tewatia is quick to get forward and creams it into the wide gap at cover-point, no need to run for those and Tewatia is off and running in style

SN Thakur to Axar, FOUR, edged and four, nearly a fourth wicket for Shardul. This was a floaty delivery outside off, Axar saw the width and went with hard hands on the drive, gets a thick edge that perfectly bisects the keeper and Christain at wide slip

Mohit Sharma to Tripathi, FOUR, 'I am not going to change! That's how I play, that's how I will today as well...' Not my words but this shot from Tripathi suggests that. Steps down and cracks the drive past cover, gave himself a bit of room to help with the flow of the bat

Sandeep Sharma to Tripathi, FOUR, although he shows his cards too early, he has managed to get what he wanted. Some card he had. Stepped down and was followed by a short ball that did not have enough pace. Flat-pulled it along the ground to the deep square leg fence

Ishant to Tripathi, FOUR, off the toe of the willow but enough to beat third man to his right. Width on offer outside off and Tripathi stays his ground before cutting it past the man at backward point
Ishant to Tripathi, FOUR, too straight and with Ishant's inward angle it becomes all the more easy. Easily deflected to the fine leg fence, the man in that region is in the ring
Axar to Rahane, FOUR, shortish. Rahane sees early and shapes back to cut, beats the dive from the fielder at cover
Chahal to Nair, FOUR, top shot from Nair. Gets outside the line and sweeps controls the sweep wide of short fine leg for a boundary. The first one of the DD innings
Chahal to Nair, byes, FOUR, what happened there? Nair was loose with his shot. Drives away from the body and the ball spun a mile to beat the outside edge. Keeper too fails to glove that
Watson to Pant, FOUR, short of a good length ball on the middle and leg. Pant pulls well behind square on the on-side. Races away to the fence
Harshal Patel to Pant, FOUR, such a sweet, sensible shot from the young man. Sees the short ball, that is slow too. Waits, dabs between short third man and backward point
Harshal Patel to Shami, FOUR, not a bad shot to get off the mark. Moves across to this short ball and helps the pull to the fine leg fence
Harshal Patel to Shami, FOUR, full around off. Shami has nothing to lose, no tailender has! Crunches the drive to the deep extra cover fence
Avesh Khan to Shami, FOUR, 13 they will need off the last over, DD. Another short ball and Shami slices the pull over the keeper's head. A couple of bounces and into the fence
Avesh Khan to Nair, FOUR, that a top shot from Nair. Stands tall and admires the punch through covers. The fielder had no chance of stopping those. 6runs off 2overs from Avesh Khan

Harshal Patel to Nair, FOUR, poor start from Harshal Patel. With third man and point inside the circle, he gives batsman the room outside off. Nair waits for the ball and cuts it late to pick the gap perfectly
Harshal Patel to Nair, FOUR, cheeky from Nair. Walks inside the line of the ball and scoops it over short fine leg for his second boundary of the over
Harshal Patel to Nair, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Nair. It was short and wide outside off, Nair gets in position early and slaps it past point. The ball races away to the fence
Head to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, this time Shreyas Iyer splits the gap in the deep perfectly. Thumps it towards cow corner and the ball bounces a couple of times before hitting the ad boards
Chahal to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, Shreyas Iyer makes full use of the free-hit. A quicker delivery on the pads, Shreyas Iyer flicks it wide of short fine leg for a boundary

Zaheer to Gayle, FOUR, Gayle is off and running, no hat-trick of ducks for the big man. Too straight from Zaheer, ends up drifting onto Gayle's pads, he gets inside the line and helps it on its way, beats short fine leg and rolls away to the fence

Zaheer to Gayle, FOUR, lovely shot, overpitched and on Gayle's pads, that's easy pickings for him, gets inside the line and clips it in front of square on the on-side, beats the fielder getting across from the deep
Mishra to Kohli, FOUR, the dart again. But this time Kohli takes matters all along the turf. Making it look all the more elegant. Clears his front leg and whips it powerfully through mid-on

Shami to Sachin Baby, FOUR, misses the length. Dishes out a full toss and Baby piles on. Ensures that he bisects the two men in the off-side at the fence and gets it wide enough with his murderous drive

Pat Cummins to Sachin Baby, FOUR, intercepting the gap. Again. Dead straight with his drills down the ground. Banging it into the turf and it flies over the umpire and teases the two men converging. To beat them both

Corey Anderson to Negi, FOUR, width. Throws his hands out. Without holding anything back in the process. Skews off the outside half of the blade in the process. Not bad with third man inside the circle

Corey Anderson to Negi, FOUR, he does it again. Pierces the gap between the keeper and short third. Again with the outside edge. Crashes a bat throw at a wide delivery, just doesn't reach out fully but meaty enough with the outside carve flying away
Corey Anderson to Negi, FOUR, follows the edges with one off the meat. A half volley and sends it on a leather hunt with a spank through the covers. Bangalore touch 160

Shami to Gayle, FOUR, cracking shot, attempted yorker from Shami turns out into a low full-toss. Gayle presents the full face of the bat and punches it back past the non-striker, beats mid-on and rolls away to the fence
Mishra to Kohli, FOUR, cracking shot, flatter and on the stumps, Kohli rocks back and pulls it wide of long-on, the fielder gets across, puts in the slide and can't haul the ball back in
Nadeem to Kohli, FOUR, nicely played, Nadeem drifts this one on Kohli's pads, he gets inside the line and helps it fine, beats Mishra at short fine and rolls away to the fence
SN Thakur to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, the pitch is slow? What are you talking! PP evokes those emotions now. He chips a gorgeous drive over extra cover
SN Thakur to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, PP continues on his merry ways

Lockie Ferguson to Pollard, FOUR, driven past the diving mid-off this time. The key is he didn't force the shot, just allowed his instincts to take over, full and wide, all he needed was to locate the middle of the willow. Tiiiiimed!
SN Thakur to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, latches on the width on offer and flays it away past backward point, a real thrashing that
SN Thakur to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, short and slipping down leg, Hardik Pandya helps it to the fine leg boundary boards with a perfect swivel pull
Malinga to Rahane, FOUR, short and wide outside off, Rahane latches onto it. The Mumbaikar hangs back and cuts it fiercely to the left of a diving backward point fielder. The ball raced away

Krunal Pandya to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, in the air and in the gap. Tiwary gets down on one knee and plays against the turn. His slog sweep finds the gap between long-on and deep mid-wicket. One bounce and into the fence

Krunal Pandya to Rahane, FOUR, ah! That should have been a single. A fierceful - let's make words! - sweep shot from Rahane that goes through square leg. The Big Mitch in the deep can't stop it as the ball spin away from him. He didn't anticipate that and wen the wrong way

Bumrah to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, ah! That should have been either a single or a couple. Length ball outside off, Tiwary swung across the line and makes good connection. Simmons at long leg, slides across and makes contact with the rope while he had the ball in his hand

McClenaghan to Manoj Tiwary, no ball, FOUR, that's a horror delivery. Did that slip out of his hand? That should have been the case. A very high full toss on leg, Tiwary gets inside the line and swings his bat hard. Gets it fine of the fine leg fielder. No ball signalled
McClenaghan to Rahane, FOUR, the Mumbai boy decides to take matters into his own hands and lays down the old traditional mow to send it away into the deep mid fence. One bounce and away she went
McClenaghan to Rahane, FOUR, highish elbow, weight into the shot and a Test-matchesque shot gets the batsman a serene four. That was pitched up and the rest was done by Rahane
Karn Sharma to Rahane, FOUR, backs away and drives! That was again uppish, but the dive from the man at cover was never in contention to take that. It was close though!
Hardik Pandya to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, looks to push at it, the ball nips in from the surface and tickles the inside edge
U Yadav to Warner, FOUR, up on his toes and off she goes! Backs away and creates all the room he wanted, flays Umesh Yadav up and over cover, no-one in the deep. Take four!

Chawla to Yuvraj, FOUR, why do you bowl that? Easy runs on offer for Yuvraj and he gets off the mark with a delightful stroke. Quicker and overpitched outside off, Yuvi plants his front leg forward and middles the drive. No chance for long-off

Narine to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, bit like Guptill. Slogs across the line and the head is tilted downards. Slowish offie on middle and leg, Shankar swings across the line and gets good wood behind it. One bounce and into the fence. The man in the deep probably didn't pick it up

Chawla to Yuvraj, FOUR, Vijay Shankar isn't donning a helmet. I reckon, he should. Overpitched outside off, Yuvraj smacks it down the ground. Shankar did well to evade that by ducking under. That went like a bullet
Boult to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, much needed boundary for SRH. A walk down the track from Shankar to on-drive the short of length delivery to the right of Boult. No chance for long-on. High elbow
Boult to Warner, FOUR, 140ks, short and wide. What does Warner do? No feet, just uses the leeway and forehand smacks it dead straight, over the umpire and into the fence

U Yadav to Dhawan, FOUR, got complete hold of it this time. Umesh Yadav looks to bring the fine leg fielder into play. Tries the short ball again, but this one had no venom, right in the zone for Dhawan who hacks it away with blazing swing of the bat

Y Pathan to Williamson, FOUR, class written all over it. Gives himself room outside leg and lofts Yusuf Pathan inside out over extra cover. Can't set field for that kind of a shot when you are gonna pitch around middle and leg, sheer brilliance from KW!
Coulter-Nile to Williamson, FOUR, why worry when you can play shots like these? Walks well across his stumps and meets the ball with greatest of ease, chips the punchy on-drive over mid-wicket
U Yadav to Warner, FOUR, up on his toes and off she goes! Backs away and creates all the room he wanted, flays Umesh Yadav up and over cover, no-one in the deep. Take four!

Chawla to Yuvraj, FOUR, why do you bowl that? Easy runs on offer for Yuvraj and he gets off the mark with a delightful stroke. Quicker and overpitched outside off, Yuvi plants his front leg forward and middles the drive. No chance for long-off

Narine to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, bit like Guptill. Slogs across the line and the head is tilted downards. Slowish offie on middle and leg, Shankar swings across the line and gets good wood behind it. One bounce and into the fence. The man in the deep probably didn't pick it up

Chawla to Yuvraj, FOUR, Vijay Shankar isn't donning a helmet. I reckon, he should. Overpitched outside off, Yuvraj smacks it down the ground. Shankar did well to evade that by ducking under. That went like a bullet
Boult to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, much needed boundary for SRH. A walk down the track from Shankar to on-drive the short of length delivery to the right of Boult. No chance for long-on. High elbow
Boult to Warner, FOUR, 140ks, short and wide. What does Warner do? No feet, just uses the leeway and forehand smacks it dead straight, over the umpire and into the fence

U Yadav to Dhawan, FOUR, got complete hold of it this time. Umesh Yadav looks to bring the fine leg fielder into play. Tries the short ball again, but this one had no venom, right in the zone for Dhawan who hacks it away with blazing swing of the bat

Y Pathan to Williamson, FOUR, class written all over it. Gives himself room outside leg and lofts Yusuf Pathan inside out over extra cover. Can't set field for that kind of a shot when you are gonna pitch around middle and leg, sheer brilliance from KW!
Coulter-Nile to Williamson, FOUR, why worry when you can play shots like these? Walks well across his stumps and meets the ball with greatest of ease, chips the punchy on-drive over mid-wicket

Johnson to Jaggi, FOUR, the gallops are out. Jumps down, goes away, frees his arms and rubs the pressure inducing salts on the comeback. A half volley to help himself and throws everything his hands have on it to carve it through the covers

Krunal Pandya to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, the sweet sweeps. More of them. Gets one right in the slot and the premeditation does the rest. Brooms it in front of square..and well past the hopes of those perched out there

Krunal Pandya to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, now through the other side. A floater up on off, takes matters with the turn does Yadav, with a full-blooded inside-out drive. Doesn't even bother keeping it down
Malinga to Jaggi, FOUR, picks the bones out of this disguise. The literacy means that he reads the slower one, waits on it and mows it through mid-wicket. A serious move on this

Malinga to Jaggi, FOUR, a ground version of the helicopter. Not only does he share the same state, he shares the same shots too with the big man. The slower yorker, takes an eternity to dip down. Enough for the adjustment and a chopper to be unleashed. Talk about the precision in the placement too. Surgical in bisecting the two men at the fence

Bumrah to Rajpoot, FOUR, the perfect yorker. Right in the blockhole. Deserved nothing lesser than respect. Gets the boundary to its name instead. Rajpoot just about jams his bat down in the way, gets the inside edge and then banks on his luck to take it past the stumps
Johnson to Gambhir, FOUR, so he gets a pitched up delivery from Johnson and drives a boundary away. Why not. Room outside off, half a stride to middle it and off she goes through covers!
Karn Sharma to Gambhir, FOUR, inside-out over covers. Perhaps only Raina matches him there. Reads the flight early, drags himself inside the line and then goes over covers. Boundary

Johnson to Jaggi, FOUR, the gallops are out. Jumps down, goes away, frees his arms and rubs the pressure inducing salts on the comeback. A half volley to help himself and throws everything his hands have on it to carve it through the covers

Krunal Pandya to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, the sweet sweeps. More of them. Gets one right in the slot and the premeditation does the rest. Brooms it in front of square..and well past the hopes of those perched out there

Krunal Pandya to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, now through the other side. A floater up on off, takes matters with the turn does Yadav, with a full-blooded inside-out drive. Doesn't even bother keeping it down

Enough for the adjustment and a chopper to be unleashed. Talk about the precision in the placement too. Surgical in bisecting the two men at the fence

Bumrah to Rajpoot, FOUR, the perfect yorker. Right in the blockhole. Deserved nothing lesser than respect. Gets the boundary to its name instead. Rajpoot just about jams his bat down in the way, gets the inside edge and then banks on his luck to take it past the stumps
Johnson to Gambhir, FOUR, so he gets a pitched up delivery from Johnson and drives a boundary away. Why not. Room outside off, half a stride to middle it and off she goes through covers!
Karn Sharma to Gambhir, FOUR, inside-out over covers. Perhaps only Raina matches him there. Reads the flight early, drags himself inside the line and then goes over covers. Boundary

Washington Sundar to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, in the airrrr, in the gap and a poor effort from Dan Christian meant the ball escaped for four. He had to dive, thought about it, but took a long while to react. Sundar bowls full and outside off stump, Krunal lofts the drive inside-out, could have been cut off by the man running from long-off
Christian to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, length ball, no room, Krunal Pandya opens his arms and carves it away past point. The man at sweeper cover dived to make the tackle but in vain

Christian to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, full on the sticks, nothing really wrong with the ball. But Krunal Pandya moved across his line and slogged the ball away to the deep mid region for a four. Krunal is getting some momentum for MI

Lockie Ferguson to Rohit, FOUR, first boundary of the final, Ferguson offers a freebie, it was a half-volley outside off. Rohit waits on it, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and squeezes it behind square on the off-side, beats backward point and rolls away to the fence

Lockie Ferguson to Rohit, FOUR, Ferguson is relieving some pressure off Rohit and MI. Length ball on his pads, Rohit gleefully puts it away behind square on the on-side. It went in the air - but well wide of Unadkat at short fine

Lockie Ferguson to Rohit, FOUR, edged and four, streaky but Rohit will take it. On a good length and holding its line outside off, Rohit was looking to drive, the late wobble takes the edge and rolls away through the vacant slip region

Lockie Ferguson to Rohit, FOUR, classy, shot of ther final so far - on a good length and well wide of off. Rohit stands tall and drives it on the up - splits the gap between cover and cover-point, no need to run for those. 16 from the over and Ravi Shastri notes that MI have doubled their score
Zampa to Rayudu, FOUR, poor ball from Zampa, dropped it short and wide of off, Rayudu waits on it and cuts it hard, beats backward point to his left and rolls away to the fence

Washington Sundar to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, in the airrrr, in the gap and a poor effort from Dan Christian meant the ball escaped for four. He had to dive, thought about it, but took a long while to react. Sundar bowls full and outside off stump, Krunal lofts the drive inside-out, could have been cut off by the man running from long-off
Christian to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, length ball, no room, Krunal Pandya opens his arms and carves it away past point. The man at sweeper cover dived to make the tackle but in vain

Christian to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, full on the sticks, nothing really wrong with the ball. But Krunal Pandya moved across his line and slogged the ball away to the deep mid region for a four. Krunal is getting some momentum for MI

Lockie Ferguson to Rohit, FOUR, first boundary of the final, Ferguson offers a freebie, it was a half-volley outside off. Rohit waits on it, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and squeezes it behind square on the off-side, beats backward point and rolls away to the fence

Lockie Ferguson to Rohit, FOUR, Ferguson is relieving some pressure off Rohit and MI. Length ball on his pads, Rohit gleefully puts it away behind square on the on-side. It went in the air - but well wide of Unadkat at short fine

Lockie Ferguson to Rohit, FOUR, edged and four, streaky but Rohit will take it. On a good length and holding its line outside off, Rohit was looking to drive, the late wobble takes the edge and rolls away through the vacant slip region

Lockie Ferguson to Rohit, FOUR, classy, shot of ther final so far - on a good length and well wide of off. Rohit stands tall and drives it on the up - splits the gap between cover and cover-point, no need to run for those. 16 from the over and Ravi Shastri notes that MI have doubled their score
Zampa to Rayudu, FOUR, poor ball from Zampa, dropped it short and wide of off, Rayudu waits on it and cuts it hard, beats backward point to his left and rolls away to the fence

McClenaghan to Rayudu, FOUR, cracking shot! First boundary of the innings. Rayudu walks down the track and in the process moves leg-side, which allows him to free his arms. The length was on the shorter side and Rayudu slapped it away over wide mid-off

Mustafizur to Watson, FOUR, in the air, over the 30-yard circle and goes for a boundary. Angled across on a fuller length and Watson is bending forward to hammer the drive. Slices over the cover region off the outside half and the quick outfield does the rest. Not a pacy ball
Mustafizur to Jadeja, FOUR, half-volley from Mustafizur, duly hammered back through mid-off. CSK need a flurry of these to bring some life back in this contest
Mustafizur to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, stuck in the crease while flashing a drive away from the body, runs away off the edge for four. Third man was up in the ring

Mustafizur to Harbhajan, FOUR, McClenaghan has let this sneak right through him. Poor from the fast bowler. Mustafizur turns around in disgust. Good length ball slanted outside off, squirted off a thick edge and should have only been a single down to third man

McClenaghan to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, Bravo keeps fighting. He charges down the track while making enough room for himself to carve this short ball over cover. It was more of a slice, but he's still able to beat sweeper cover to his right
McClenaghan to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, bangs it in short seeing Bravo advance, but is still spanked away into the boundary. He's got himself in that kind of zone, where most things are disappearing

Mustafizur to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, he has done it! Make way for the men in yellow, for there are plenty of them who are storming to the middle to jump over Jadhav. Careful of that hamstring though. Oh forget about it, no one cares anymore. Full ball from Mustafizur, drilled through the covers. What a finish. Unbelievable
Mustafizur to Rayudu, FOUR, nine off the over! Fuller length delivery attacking the stumps, Rayudu stays leg-side of the ball and creams the drive through vacant extra cover
Hardik Pandya to Rayudu, FOUR, a wicket and 12 runs off the over! Pandya slightly overpitches and Rayudu took full toll of it. Bent forward and laced the drive wide of mid-off

McClenaghan to Rayudu, FOUR, nice batting! Moved slightly towards leg-side as the bowler was running to deliver the ball. That allowed him to free his arms. Shortish ball and Rayudu cracked it over cover-point. Powerfully hit and in the gap as well

Chahar to Rohit, FOUR, first boundary of IPL 2018, first runs of the tournament as well, on a good length and well outside off, Rohit's feet went nowhere as he extended his arms on the drive, hits it in the air and through the gap at extra-cover, no one moved

Tahir to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, not an ideal start for Imran Tahir in this IPL. Too full outside off, Ishan Kishan slammed it straight of long-off where DJ Bravo fumbles after putting a desperate dive to his left

Tahir to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, boom! Tahir is spraying it full, Ishan Kishan pouncing on it like a famished tiger. Uses his bottom hand power to biff it straight down the ground, whistles past the non-striker

Dwayne Bravo to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, they are going for the shots now. Short ball, arrives lazily...gives Suryakumar Yadav ample time to pick his spot, he bludgeons the pull over mid-wicket with disdain

Dwayne Bravo to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, through Jaddu's fingers at mid-off. Length ball outside off, Suryakumar Yadav stays leg-side of the ball and carves it flirtingly past the fieldsman at mid-off. Jaddu leapt full length, but the execution from Yadav was too good

Dwayne Bravo to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, showing his range now Suryakumar Yadav. Doesn't shy away from staying good few inches outside the crease and thumps the ball over a helpless mid-off this time. Gee, this is some clean striking
Mark Wood to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, easily done. Short ball angling into the body, Pandya half-ducks and swats, the ball grazes the top edge and runs away...

Mark Wood to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, can't stop Hardik Pandya, not when he gets short balls. Mark Wood went wide of the crease and sprayed this in to cramp Pandya up for room, but what does Pandya do? Just arches back nonchalantly and ramps the ball cleanly with an open bat face via third man

Tahir to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, the big brother is taking no sighters. He wants a move-on rightaway. Gets a half-volley outside off and Krunal Pandya slam-bangs it through covers. Don't bother running..

Mark Wood to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, pace can be your enemy sometimes, like on this occasion when you lose your radar. Short and slipping down leg, Krunal Pandya gets inside the line and tickles it away past a diving short fine to his left

Mark Wood to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, what do you do when your big brother plays shots like that. Just stand and admire at the other end. Hardik Pandya restricted to a spectator role this over and rightly so. Half-volley from Mark Wood, deserved to be punished, Krunal Pandya lashes it through covers making life difficult for the fielders inside the ring
Mark Wood to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, pitched up outside off, Krunal Pandya clears his front leg and hammers it straight past the non-striker. No-one's stopping that

Mark Wood to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, an action replay of the previous delivery, only difference? Krunal Pandya hit this dead straight. Overpitched, sent racing into the fence with a absolute thwack of the willow

Chahar to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, cracking shot, the shot of the day so far, fraction short and just wide of off, Suryakumar stands tall and punches it in front of square on the off-side, beats cover and rolls away to the fence

Watson to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, lovely, Suryakumar is looking attractive, back of a length and just outside off, Suryakumar stays back, gets on top of the bounce and punches it into the gap past cover, no need to run for those

Jadeja to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, nicely played by Kishan, fraction too full and wide of off, Kishan lunges across and then plays a cross-batted swipe past cover, the fielder in the deep at long-off is very square and has no chance

Jadeja to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, nicely played by Kishan, this was dropped short and well wide of off, Kishan waits on it, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and then dabs it past MS's gloves, RJ has his hands on his head, but that was supremely well played
Harbhajan to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, cracking shot, too short and too wide of off, Suryakumar makes room and clatters it past cover, no chance for the man in the deep

Mohit Sharma to Pant, FOUR, crunched away! Too full from Mohit and Pant lays into the drive, smashes it towards wide long-off where Karun put in a desperate slide. Got a hand on it but couldn't stop it cleanly. First boundary for Pant

Andrew Tye to Pant, FOUR, not entirely in control but gets the result. Another slower ball variation from Tye and Pant is early into the slog. Skies it high towards deep mid-wicket but it's in the gap. Finds the fence

Andrew Tye to Pant, FOUR, Pant has switched onto top gear! We could be in for some real carnage if he bats for a while. Attempted slower bouncer but Pant gets inside the line in a flash and pulls it easily over short fine leg. Proactive batting and Tye is under serious pressure here

Mujeeb to Pant, FOUR, such strong bottom hand! Wow! This kid certainly packs a punch, doesn't he? Fired fuller by Mujeeb and Pant was on the charge, adjusts to drill it powerfully past the bowler. Long-on had no chance

Mujeeb to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, what a shot to start! Gee, Tewatia has come out with a mission. Doesn't bother to have a look at Mujeeb's variation and opts for the reverse sweep straight away. It was the same shot that got Munro but Tewatia connects well to send it soaring over backward point

Mohit Sharma to Chris Morris, FOUR, just wide of Tye's outstretched hands running to his left from deep mid-wicket. Had a lot of work to do but was never really going to get to it. Slower ball on a shortish length and Morris went for the forehand smash. Mistimed it but luckily, got it in the gap. Or nearly in the gap. Doesn't matter how they come as long as they do
Axar to Gambhir, FOUR, quintessentially Gambhir. Axar was from round the wicket to the left-hander, Gambhir charges down whilst making some room and lofts it through extra cover. Superb hit
Axar to Gambhir, FOUR, now a one-kneed stylish slog-whip over deep square leg. Axar fired it in and sees it flying round the corner
Mujeeb to Gambhir, FOUR, lovely shot again. Makes room as he charges out and clouts it inside-out over extra cover. He'll keep doing that all day

Andrew Tye to Gambhir, FOUR, cracks away a pull shot. Who said he's not good with the short balls. Rises in sync with the height on this short delivery and pumps it through square leg. Another great shot today from the master
Axar to Gambhir, FOUR, top-edge through fine leg. A delivery going down leg from over the wicket, the left-hander is in no shape to sweep that. Goes for it and gets lucky

Mohit Sharma to Pant, FOUR, crunched away! Too full from Mohit and Pant lays into the drive, smashes it towards wide long-off where Karun put in a desperate slide. Got a hand on it but couldn't stop it cleanly. First boundary for Pant

Andrew Tye to Pant, FOUR, not entirely in control but gets the result. Another slower ball variation from Tye and Pant is early into the slog. Skies it high towards deep mid-wicket but it's in the gap. Finds the fence

Mujeeb to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, what a shot to start! Gee, Tewatia has come out with a mission. Doesn't bother to have a look at Mujeeb's variation and opts for the reverse sweep straight away. It was the same shot that got Munro but Tewatia connects well to send it soaring over backward point

Mohit Sharma to Chris Morris, FOUR, just wide of Tye's outstretched hands running to his left from deep mid-wicket. Had a lot of work to do but was never really going to get to it. Slower ball on a shortish length and Morris went for the forehand smash. Mistimed it but luckily, got it in the gap. Or nearly in the gap. Doesn't matter how they come as long as they do
Axar to Gambhir, FOUR, quintessentially Gambhir. Axar was from round the wicket to the left-hander, Gambhir charges down whilst making some room and lofts it through extra cover. Superb hit
Axar to Gambhir, FOUR, now a one-kneed stylish slog-whip over deep square leg. Axar fired it in and sees it flying round the corner
Mujeeb to Gambhir, FOUR, lovely shot again. Makes room as he charges out and clouts it inside-out over extra cover. He'll keep doing that all day

Andrew Tye to Gambhir, FOUR, cracks away a pull shot. Who said he's not good with the short balls. Rises in sync with the height on this short delivery and pumps it through square leg. Another great shot today from the master
Axar to Gambhir, FOUR, top-edge through fine leg. A delivery going down leg from over the wicket, the left-hander is in no shape to sweep that. Goes for it and gets lucky
Chahal to Narine, FOUR, here he is! Not wasting any time. He's at it. It's a tossed up delivery around off, Narine grounds his knee and pummels it dead straight over the bowler's head. Four runs!

Woakes to Chris Lynn, FOUR, first boundary for Lynn. Lucky to be still out there though. This was a full length delivery around off, Lynn swings hard at it and gets an inside edge, past the stumps and beats the fielder at short fine leg
Washington Sundar to Karthik, FOUR, you don't bowl full tosses to DK. Not when he's in such form. DK leans forward a touch and belts the leather through covers, blazed away...
Chahal to Karthik, FOUR, 'please hit-me,' will you? Short and wide delivery, DK rocks back and murders the cut in the gap between backward point and cover-point. See ya later...
Chahal to Karthik, FOUR, overcorrects and floats one up under DK's eyes, he thumps the drive through extra cover, wowza! What bat speed..

Woakes to Rinku Singh, FOUR, pressure? What's the spelling of that word? This guy seems to have exactly that sort of attitude. Gallops down the pitch, doesn't matter who's bowling, stamps his authority with a rollicking thump over mid-on. Came off the cue end, but he's got it under control with strong bottom hand power
U Yadav to A Russell, FOUR, length ball in the slot, goodbye! Russell clears his front leg and swats him over mid-wicket, one bounce and over the ropes

U Yadav to A Russell, FOUR, goes full and goes for a journey! There's no-one at deep extra cover, so what does Russell do? Manufactures ample room and lifts Umesh Yadav over extra cover, the timing on the shot takes care of the rest
Woakes to Karthik, FOUR, errs in line this time, short and angling into the body, DK rolls his wrists and nails the pull through mid-wicket

Kulwant Khejroliya to Vinay Kumar, FOUR, clears his front leg and lays the finishing marker on the game. AB at mid-on slides to his left, but realizes that's too far to fetch. So, Dinesh Karthik and KKR start off their campaign in style, a morale-boosting 4-wicket win over RCB. A typical slog from Vinay Kumar, all he needed to do was clear mid-off and boy did he hit that hard! Comfortably past mid-on
Woakes to Narine, FOUR, no stopping him, it seems. Short of a length and outside off, Narine slaps hard and evades the fielder at cover-point. He's in the zone folks!

Woakes to Narine, FOUR, beats the chasing RCB skipper this time around. It's a lightning quick outfield, just look at it. Even the fast moving feet of Kohli can't stop this. Fullish in length around off and Narine creams it through covers. The ball's lost, somewhere under the covers.

Washington Sundar to Narine, FOUR, he's taking down RCB single handedly, is he? Remember he scored the fastest IPL fifty against the same opposition last year (a record that was broken by a manic Rahul earlier today). Comes down the wicket and slaughters this one past mid-off
Kulwant Khejroliya to Nitish Rana, FOUR, full and wide outside off, Rana plays this one with only one hand, it came off as he threw his hand at it, ends up slicing it past third man to find the fence

U Yadav to Nitish Rana, FOUR, that was timed to perfection. Short of a length around off, Rana stands tall and chips this over mid-on. High elbows and poses for the camera. Not to forget the effort by AB though, sprinted back, kept his eyes on the ball and almost pulled it off

Vinay Kumar to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, that's not the start Karthik would have wanted from a senior pro. A classic case of nerves from the opening bowler because it is not all that easy to control the new ball immediately. Bowls a freebie length ball down the leg-side and McCullum gleefully flicks the ball behind square past the man at 45

Vinay Kumar to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, turns out to be a really poor over from Vinay Kumar, didn't bowl to the field. He bowls another one down the leg-side and you can't do that with fine leg inside the line. McCullum calmly waits and flicks the ball through square leg. Great start for RCB, 14 off the over

Chawla to de Kock, FOUR, that's a friendly flighted delivery full and outside off stump, de Kock leans forward and doesn't over-hit the ball, drives nicely along the ground and hits the gap at cover. The ball escapes past the diving fielder
Narine to Kohli, FOUR, he's so good with those cover-drives. Full delivery outside off stump, Kohli waits and lofts the drive over the infield and the timing was great
Johnson to de Villiers, FOUR, dismissed to the boundary by AB. Short of length, bounces only as high as the chest and the pull shot is swatted away backward of square
Nitish Rana to Mandeep, FOUR, shuffles across, bends on one knee and gets the sweep away fine. Races away once it beats the man
Narine to Mandeep, FOUR, poor from Narine. Drops it very short, and then turns it into leg-stump. Mandeep is able to free his arms on the pull as he whacks it to the long leg boundary

Narine to Mandeep, FOUR, the two off-breaks he's bowled in this over have both drifted down leg. Unlike the previous one though, Mandeep just helps this on its away and gets it fine enough to beat short fine leg
Johnson to Woakes, FOUR, full ball outside off, Woakes flings his hands at it and carves it through backward point. It goes to the fence like a bullet
Vinay Kumar to Mandeep, FOUR, now a full toss on the pads, whipped away over backward square leg. He's missed his lengths with the first two balls, and at his pace, he will disappear - as he has
Chawla to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, this time he cuts well and gets it in the gap between cover-point and backward point. The length was just short enough for McCullum to rock back and execute the shot

Kuldeep Yadav to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, that's completely mistimed, yet McCullum will get a boundary, this game is so cruel for the bowlers. Flighted googly outside off stump, McCullum wanted to loft that over long-on, but got it on the outside half of the bat, cleared mid-off and it ran away for four

Johnson to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, oh he's bludgeoned this very hard. Full and outside off stump, McCullum slices the ball hard and gets it in the gap at cover-point, the fielder in the deep had no chance

Johnson to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, the slower ball but it's been whacked by McCullum. This is a true surface in terms of bounce, so you can hit through the line, McCullum hits that over wide mid-off and it runs away for four
Bhuvneshwar to D Arcy Short, FOUR, half-volley on middle and leg, D Arcy Short eases it away with a nonchalant whip off the pads in front of deep square leg for four. Blazes away...

Rashid Khan to Tripathi, FOUR, lovely, Tripathi picked this one though, the attempted wrong'un, Tripathi gets a big stride forward, gets close to the ball and lifts it over cover, couple of bounces and over the ropes

Rashid Khan to Tripathi, FOUR, nicely played by Tripathi, fraction short and just outside off, the leg-break from Rashid, Tripathi waits on it, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and dabs it past KW at first slip, rolls away to the fence in a hurry

Rashid Khan to Shreyas Gopal, FOUR, lovely shot, Gopal is a top all-rounder for Karnataka and this shot just certifies it, read the leg-break, opens the face of the bat, used the pace on the ball and ran it past the lone slip

Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Gopal, FOUR, crunched, lovely cricket from Gopal, on a good length and just outside off, Gopal wasn't fully forward as he drove, the timing is sweet and the ball beats the fielder in the deep at cover
Bhuvneshwar to Samson, FOUR, a bit of outswing on a good length outside off, a hint of seam away, but Samson just check-drives it through the line to sweeper cover for four

Bhuvneshwar to Samson, FOUR, slower one, possibly knuckle, on a length outside off, Samson just picks the perfect moment in time to let leather meet willow with that authoritative whip away to deep mid-wicket for four
Shakib to Rahane, FOUR, shortens his length as Rahane comes down the track, and Rahane just adjusts his shot to flat-bat it through deep extra cover for four
Stanlake to Rahane, FOUR, short, no width, Rahane arches back into a semi-limbo and scythes that away to the deep backward point fence for four. Expertly done

Stanlake to Samson, FOUR, length delivery just outside off, straightening a little, and taking the leading edge of the closed bat-face to deep backward point. It was in the air for a while, but through the vacant region for four

Shakib to Samson, FOUR, angled in, was that armer, towards leg-stump, Samson came down the wicket, realized he wasn't to the pitch of it, but still went through with the shot Through deep mid-wicket for four

S Kaul to Samson, FOUR, short of length delivery in the channel outside off, Samson tries to open the bat-face and steer it away to third man, gets a thick edge past the keeper, to the long stop fence for four. Oh, if only we had the Saha of the Australia Test series last year...
Unadkat to Saha, FOUR, adding salt into the wounds for the Royals. Unadkat begins with a tripe delivery down leg. Easy pickings for Saha, gets across and whacks it over square leg

Unadkat to Dhawan, FOUR, edged and flies over first slip. Dhawan throws the kitchen sink - comes down the track, gets an outside edge and fortunately for him, it loops over a leaping first slip fielder

Shreyas Gopal to Williamson, FOUR, kaboooooom! That's been smashed to pulp and it's Williamson who has done it. Things that an IPL season does. Even the gracious batsmen look for power. Uses his feet and smacks it hard over the bowler's head. Gopal may have thought about a return catch but there was no time at all to react, chose to wisely save himself

Laughlin to Dhawan, FOUR, what a sound off the blade! Gee, he just nailed that one, did Dhawan. Back of a length and plenty of width outside off, Dhawan just leant into it and slap-punched on the up. Gets it past a diving mid-off fielder and it speeds away. Considering the form he has been of late and the way he has played today, he is bound to light this IPL up
D Arcy Short to Dhawan, FOUR, that's a freebie from D Arcy Short and Dhawan isn't going to miss out. Not in this carnage mode of his. Stays back and pulls it hard to the deep mid-wicket fence

D Arcy Short to Dhawan, byes, FOUR, that's beaten everyone! For a moment, I thought it was a genuine edge but it wasn't. D Arcy Short gets this to spin away from a fuller length and the drastic turn beats Dhawan's attempted drive. Buttler also fails to react in time and with no slip in place, free runs it is

D Kulkarni to Dhawan, FOUR, crunchy blow to end the game! Shortish and sits up nicely for Dhawan who rocks back to slam the pull over mid-wicket. Blazed away to the fence and with that, the Sunrisers have stormed to a win in their season opener
D Kulkarni to Dhawan, FOUR, Kulkarni goes short and offers width again, Dhawan will not miss out on these. Goes deep and bashes it with ferocity through covers

Unadkat to Williamson, FOUR, Williamson finds the gap this time. Off the mark with a boundary. Unadkat keeps it short, just a hint of width and Williamson takes toll. Waits back and punches it through cover-point
Gowtham to Dhawan, FOUR, quality from Dhawan. No misjudging of the length this time, picks the long hop early and hacks it over square leg. Kind of short-arm jabbed it
Gowtham to Dhawan, FOUR, back to back fours for Dhawan. Gowtham goes quick and flat outside off, Dhawan reaches out and slaps it through cover
Laughlin to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan is riding his luck. Banged in short on leg-stump, Dhawan swivels to pull and ends up gloving it over the keeper. Fine leg is squarer and had no chance there
Laughlin to Williamson, FOUR, 50-stand comes up between the duo. Short and width are like oxygen to Williamson. Gets on top of the bounce and caresses it through cover-point
Shreyas Gopal to Dhawan, FOUR, horror start for Gopal. Drags it short first up, ample time for Dhawan to rock back and pick his spot. Chooses cow corner and dismisses from his sight
Stokes to Dhawan, FOUR, no respect whatsoever for Stokes. Is greeted with a boundary. Short with no real venom, Dhawan goes back and muscles the pull over mid-wicket
Stokes to Dhawan, FOUR, consecutive fours for Dhawan. Stokes sprays it down leg, Dhawan just gets a tickle on it and sends it very fine. Races away to the fine leg fence

Stokes to Dhawan, FOUR, cracker of a shot! Dhawan is in top gear and brings up his 29th IPL fifty in some style. Short and wide, he stands tall and spanks it through backward point. Power, timing and placement all in unison

Stokes to Dhawan, FOUR, oh boy, that's top quality stuff! Slower ball from Stokes but Dhawan is in such a mood that he is picking everything. Waits for it and there was width on offer, so just reached out to hammer it through the covers. Rocketed away

Vinay Kumar to Watson, FOUR, not where he intended to hit that but he'll take it. Another short delivery around off, Watson takes his eyes off the ball and pulls, ends up getting an inside edge past the fielder at short fine leg and finds the fence

Vinay Kumar to Watson, FOUR, fine end to the over! Make that 16 runs off the opening over. Vinay Kumar conceded 14 runs in the previous match off the first over, concedes two extra in this one. It's a back of a length delivery outside off and all Watson does is simply punch it through the gap at cover-point. Into the gap and away to the fence she goes. Just the ideal start for CSK in this mammoth run chase

Chawla to Billings, FOUR, wow! Just a flick of the wrists and Rinku Singh, one of the quick movers, could not get around to stop it. Dances down and gets to the pitch, whipped against the turn to wide long-on, the timing was exquisite

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, FOUR, murdered! That might get him going. Need a boundary off the middle and he's got it. Shimmies down and gets close to the flighted delivery then drills it straight down the ground, went at the rate of knots

Chawla to Billings, FOUR, much needed boundary for CSK. It had been a quiet over so far. Billings didn't connect it properly but struck it in the gap, front leg out of the way and a swing of the arms, couple of bounces and into the cow corner fence
A Russell to Rayudu, FOUR, poor delivery by Dre Russ. Gifts a full toss to Rayudu who clips it nonchalantly past the fielder at short fine leg, easy pickings for the batsman there

Chawla to Rayudu, FOUR, 50 up for CSK! CSK, CSK are the chants at the stadium. Short of a length outside off, Rayudu camps back and cuts it past the diving fielder at cover-point to add four more to the tally
A Russell to Rayudu, FOUR, cheeky there. Short of a length outside off, Rayudu arches back and guides it smartly towards third man, very fine and you can't keep a fielder there

Tom Curran to Watson, FOUR, the newbie to IPL is welcomed in style by Watson. It's short again and looking at the kind of touch Watson is in he won't spare you. Pulls it nicely over mid-wicket, one bounce and into the fence she goes

Chahar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, Chris Lynn is underway! Typical Lynn. Shortish ball with width on offer, he'll punish you everytime. Stands tall and slashes it over point. Raced away and there's pin drop silence
Tahir to Karthik, FOUR, KKR will remain positive, Karthik brings out the reverse sweep with a slip in place, doesn't get hold of the shot, but has enough to get it past the fielder
Watson to A Russell, FOUR, lovely shot, a long half-volley from Watson, full and just outside off, Russell stays in his crease and drills it through extra-cover, no need to run for those
Watson to Chris Lynn, FOUR, that's been thrashed through extra cover. A fuller length ball, stand-and-deliver stuff from Lynn. Stood tall and hammered the drive between extra cover and mid-off
Watson to Uthappa, FOUR, easy pickings for Uthappa! Full and straying on the pads, a lean across followed by a nonchalant flick over backward square leg. One bounce and into the fence

Watson to Uthappa, FOUR, steered and just wide of the Raina at wide slip. A short of length delivery with width on offer, Uthappa opens his bat-face at the last moment and guided it to Raina's right, who dived full length. Trickles away to the fence

Tahir to Chris Lynn, FOUR, 'catch it' cries Tahir, but Lynn has got enough wood on that. Tahir saw the batter back away and fired on following him. Lynn toe-ends the drill over and wide of mid-off. Uppish, but safe

Jadeja to Chris Lynn, FOUR, another quick delivery, but errs in line, Lynn moves across, crouches and helps it along its way. Manages to beat short fine leg and there's no one to stop that. Not to forget, a poor effort from Harbhajan who dived over the ball at short fine

Harbhajan to Nitish Rana, FOUR, superbly played! Trifle short and Rana was quick to go on the back foot and pounce on it. Waited for the ball and scythed it through backward point. The man in the deep gives a chase, but to no avail

SN Thakur to Nitish Rana, FOUR, "that's not how you follow it up," says Ian Bishop on air. After bowling a good bumper, Thakur now bowls a fullish ball, Rana stays in his crease and hit it through the line. Lofted over wide mid-off and there is no one to stop that

Watson to Karthik, FOUR, cracking shot. Should settle Karthik's nerves, if any. Shortish ball wide of off, Karthik gets on top of it and cuts it fiercely through the off-side, beating the man at backward point
Gowtham to Pant, FOUR, spanked! Murdered! Four.. That was a little shimmy and a powerful blade smacking it down the ground

Gowtham to Pant, FOUR, kneels down and punishes it away. Gets it past the man at short fine leg and the ball races away between square leg and short fine leg for a four. Very well done. He preempted the angle and got it away
Unadkat to Maxwell, FOUR, lucky, Maxwell ain't complaining. The batsman goes for the big wild swing. The ball trims the outer half of the bat and flies over the man at short third man for a four

Unadkat to Maxwell, FOUR, that is sworded away! Full and wide, throws his bat at the leather whilst losing his balance and smears the ball over point for a four. That will do for DD. 14 of the over and that is exactly what they need in each of the rest three overs

Unadkat to Chris Morris, FOUR, full, little wide, the batsman opens the face of the blade and beats the man at deepish point. Much needed four but they need more. Good, intelligent batting from Chris Morris. 30 off 10 balls
Unadkat to Pant, FOUR, length slower delivery and the batsman pulls the ball away. Did not time it but gave it some good air miles. Once it landed, there was no one and it went into the fence
Laughlin to Chris Morris, FOUR, throws his hands at it and slices it flat-footed over covers. It's all but over....
Nadeem to D Arcy Short, FOUR, poor ball to start! Drags it short and it's the slider as well, width on offer for Short who smacks the back foot punch through the covers. Easy pickings
Rahul Tewatia to Buttler, FOUR, master of manipulating the field. There's a leg slip now instead of silly point, and the tossed up one on off is reverse-lapped to third man for four
Shami to Rahane, FOUR, that flat-batted swipe coming down the track to a length ball. Made room, slapped it inside out to deep extra cover for four past a diving cover. He's absolutely leathered that

Shami to Rahane, FOUR, short outside off, Rahane drags it towards the on-side with a clouted pull to deep mid-wicket for four. Boult made a lot of room, running across a few yards and diving in front, and nearly pulled off a screamer but the ball flicks his thumb and ricochets away into the fence
Chris Morris to Buttler, FOUR, short-ish and wide, Buttler slashes and slashes hard, as that blazes away in front of third man for four. The spin on that shows you how hard he sliced that...

Boult to Stokes, FOUR, whackkkkkkkkkk! Stokes has had enough of proding around. Charges down the track and makes room before blasting this wide of the man at mid-off. Races away to the fence in no time

Boult to Samson, FOUR, sheer class! Samson had some runs in the last game and hence, is in a good space mentally. Gets a full ball that's not all that wide but Samson got a nice stride forward and eased the square drive through point. The timing was fab

Boult to Rahane, FOUR, just short of backward square leg! For a moment, the fielder in the ring thought he had a chance but it bounced in front of him and sneaked through. Once it got past him, the outfield did the rest. Short of a length ball that Rahane pulled without bothering to keep it down. Fortunate that it didn't go to hand

Shami to Rahane, FOUR, freebie to start from Shami and Rahane puts it away in style. Half-tracker and it's asking for trouble on this easy-paced surface. Rahane swivels on the back foot and controls the pull with elan through backward square leg

Nadeem to Samson, FOUR, deft touch! If the previous shot showcased his power, this is all about finesse. Slower and around off, not all that short but Samson waits for it on the back foot before essaying the late cut. Gets it very fine and just past the keeper as it races to the fence. He is in the zone, is Samson
Rahul Tewatia to Rahane, FOUR, rubbish ball and Rahane will feast on these all day. Gets a drag on around middle and leg, sits on the back foot and nails the pull through square leg. Found the gap

Stanlake to Rohit, FOUR, lovely from Rohit, tad fuller and wider of off, Rohit leans forward, drives it on the up and finds the gap past cover-point, the timing is sweet and the ball rolls away to the fence

Rashid Khan to Pollard, FOUR, that is Pollard's riposte. The wrong 'un on a fullish and Pollard used his reach to good effect, pressed forward and struck it straight back over the bowler, couple of bounces and into the fence

S Kaul to Pollard, FOUR, needless. Kaul brought third man up and Pollard sends the ball there. Should have followed the mantra off the first five deliveries. On a length outside off, Pollard dabbed it late and beat short third man with ease

Stanlake to Pollard, FOUR, for the second time Pollard uses the pace of Stanlake to pocket a boundary. Fraction short and outside off, Pollard waits in the crease and steers it behind point, Kaul at third man should have done a better job of stopping that. He got there and allowed it to escape past him

S Kaul to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, lovely shot! Kaul might have been a bit too predictable with his length, Yadav moved to the leg-side and waited for the short delivery, swatted the pull backward of square leg and ended the over with a much needed boundary
Rashid Khan to Cutting, FOUR, that is cheeky. Pushed it through did Rashid and Cutting used the pace on that, shuffled across with bent knee and scooped it fine, giving short fine leg no chance

Sandeep Sharma to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, streaky and four, Kishan gets lucky and gets a boundary as well, comes down the track, doesn't get anywhere close to the ball, swings through the line, the big inside edge races away past the leg-stump and into the fence

S Kaul to Markande, FOUR, cheeky! Markande decides to do something about the length Kaul was bowling, moving across the stumps and laps the length delivery over short fine leg, enough legs on that to reach the fence

Sandeep Sharma to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, edged and four, more runs for Kishan, more frustration for Sandeep. This the slower ball on off, Kishan was perhaps looking to play with an open face, he didn't look to get it that fine though, past the keeper and third man was inside the ring
Stanlake to Lewis, FOUR, short of a good length and well outside off, Lewis stands tall and punches with a straight bat, finds the gap past cover-point and the ball rolls away to the fence

Stanlake to Lewis, FOUR, that's his answer to Stanlake, short of a length and angling across the left-hander, Lewis was backing away, has to reach out and carves it over cover, a few bounces and into the fence

Rashid Khan to Ishan Kishan, leg byes, FOUR, appeal for LBW, but I reckon it might have pitched outside leg. Kishan was setting himself up for a reverse sweep, lost his poise in doing so, ended up with a reverse hack, the ball clipped the pads and beat the slip fielder to the fence
S Kaul to Lewis, FOUR, smashed, half-volley outside off, Lewis gets forward and drills it past the non-striker, the fielder at mid-off was a mere spectator

Shakib to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, beautifully played, too full and too wide of off, Krunal gets close to the ball, that allows him to play against the turn, beats extra-cover with the drive and rolls away to the fence

Shakib to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, cheeky and four, tossed up well outside off, Krunal bends down low, reverses his stance, uses the pace on the ball and laps it very fine, beats short third man and it's back-to-back boundaries for Krunal

Stanlake to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, cracking shot, too short and well outside off, Suryakumar swivels across, rolls his wrists and pulls it in front of square, beats mid-wicket and rolls away to the fence

Sangwan to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan is underway! That's bread and butter for Gabbar. Too wide and he'll punish you all day. The length was on the shorter side as well - the recipe to get hit. Dhawan flashes his bat at it and slaps it through extra cover. Off the mark with a boundary

Bumrah to Dhawan, FOUR, second boundary for Dhawan. didn't try to over-hit, timed it well and the placement was good. The line is too straight from Bumrah - strayed on the pads and Dhawan used his wrists to glance it away in front of square on the leg-side. The man inside the 30-yard circle gives a chase, but can only escort the ball to the fence
Markande to Deepak Hooda, FOUR, charges out to the pitch of the ball and smokes it down the ground. What a way to start from Hooda. Wow

Mustafizur to Shakib, FOUR, poor delivery from Mustafizur, can't afford to release the pressure this way. MI don't have much to play with. Short and wide, Shakib sizes it up early and slaps it through point

Cutting to Y Pathan, FOUR, pivots on the back leg and whip-pulls this delivery to the left of fine leg. Ordinary short of length delivery from Cutting, sitting up comfortably around Pathan's chest to be dispatched

Cutting to Y Pathan, FOUR, this has been a really sensible partnership for the most part, and here comes the reward. Cutting sprays on the pads, allowing Pathan an easy release of pressure as he glances it away past short fine leg

Sangwan to Dhawan, FOUR, how good are those wrists? Must have learnt a bit from VVS. Wasn't a bad ball at all from Sangwan. On a good length and on middle and leg, Dhawan stayed in his crease and flicked it nonchalantly over and wide of mid-on

Sangwan to Saha, FOUR, dropped! Cutting is the culprit. An ugly hoick attempted from Saha and he mistimed it horribly. Cutting, at mid-on, went back and got to the ball, but couldn't hold onto it. What's worse? He allows it go for a boundary. It was a good length ball and Saha was slightly late into his shot

Sangwan to Saha, FOUR, the top-edge goes over the keeper's head and runs away for another boundary. No luck lor Sangwan, who banged one short and the bal got big on the batsman. Saha, despite not being in a good position, went with the pull shot. He will be happy with the result though

Cutting to Saha, FOUR, Cutting hurls one fuller and Saha decides to go after it. It was bowled wide of off, Saha comes down for a walk and muscles it over the bowler's head to collect his third boundary
Bumrah to Dhawan, FOUR, Bumrah overpitches and Dhawan takes heavy toll of it. The back leg is bent, to the pitch and then creamed the cover drive. The placement was spot on too
Bumrah to Dhawan, FOUR, 50 up for SRH! In a quick time. This was a pacy good length ball on middle and leg, Dhawan helps it along its way to fine leg. Runs coming thick and fast for the hosts

Bumrah to Dhawan, FOUR, edged, missed the stumps and races away to the fence. 14 runs off the over. It was a skiddy length ball from round the wicket and Dhawan checked his cross-batted stroke. The ball trimmed the inside edge, missed the sticks and evaded the keeper to the fine leg fence

Markande to Dhawan, FOUR, crashed away! The googly from Markande, but it's short and wide outside off. Dhawan trks back and muscles the cut through extra cover. Lewis sprints across and dives to his left, in vain

Mustafizur to Dhawan, FOUR, bangs one short does Mustafizur and there's no venom. Dhawan fetches it from well outside off and swivel-pulls it in front of square on the leg-side. He was in total control of the shot
Mustafizur to Williamson, FOUR, fullish ball outside off, Williamson opens the bat-face at the very last moment and runs it down to third man. Got it very fine
Markande to Manish Pandey, FOUR, shot! Too short, Pandey stays back and cuts it square of the wicket. Powerfully hit

Woakes to Rahul, FOUR, 16 runs off the opening over. Couldn't have asked for a better start. On the pads again and all Rahul does is clips it past the fielder at short fine leg, he dives there but the ball is too quick for him

U Yadav to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, off the mark in style, Agarwal too. Picks the length early, it's short on middle and Agarwal gets in position early to flick it over square leg, fine leg is too square and the ball wins the race

U Yadav to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, textbook straight drive! Presenting full face of the bat and high elbows. Fullish in length around off, Agarwal backs away, drives it straight past the bowler and gathers a boundary more

Chahal to Nair, FOUR, Chahal's over is ruined once again off the last ball, this was tossed up nicely outside off, Nair bent half-forward, reverses his stance and helps it on its way to the long leg fence, make it off the fifth ball

Kulwant Khejroliya to Ashwin, FOUR, cracking shot, short and on the stumps, Ashwin swivels across, rolls his wrists and helps it on its way, the man in the deep is square and the ball beats him to the fence
Kulwant Khejroliya to Ashwin, FOUR, beautifully played, length delivery outside off, Ashwin leans forward, drives it on the up and beats the diving fielder at cover, no need to run for those

Woakes to Ashwin, FOUR, lovely shot, this is turning out to be a fine cameo from Ashwin, comes down the track, uses his reach to good effect and clears cover with the lofted off-drive, couple of bounces and over the ropes

Kulwant Khejroliya to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, errs in line after a good start. This is a shortish one on leg and Agarwal doesn't miss out on the chance. Swivels and drags it down to the fine leg fence, can't keep a fielder there

U Yadav to Yuvraj, FOUR, what was the fielder doing there? He should have been back near the fence. Could have been a straight forward catch there. Short of a length delivery around off, Yuvraj swivels and pulls it over the leaping fielder at deep square leg, guess it was Sarfaraz Khan

Kulwant Khejroliya to Nair, FOUR, Rahul, Agarwal and now Nair. All Karnataka boys have got off the mark with a boundary or six tonight. Full length delivery around off, Nair keeps his head still and drills it past the fielder at mid-off, no chance to stop that

Woakes to Nair, FOUR, class apart. It's a short delivery around off, Nair arches back and guides it to perfection over the empty cordon, third man sprints to his left but it's one bounce and over the fence

Chahal to Rahul, FOUR, no... he doesn't! How often have we seen the last delivery of the over to be the spoiler! Darts it on leg and Rahul gets down on his knee to paddle it away and a chase by the fielder is not enough to stop this as the ball races away

Woakes to Rahul, FOUR, 16 runs off the opening over. Couldn't have asked for a better start. On the pads again and all Rahul does is clips it past the fielder at short fine leg, he dives there but the ball is too quick for him

U Yadav to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, off the mark in style, Agarwal too. Picks the length early, it's short on middle and Agarwal gets in position early to flick it over square leg, fine leg is too square and the ball wins the race

U Yadav to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, textbook straight drive! Presenting full face of the bat and high elbows. Fullish in length around off, Agarwal backs away, drives it straight past the bowler and gathers a boundary more

Chahal to Nair, FOUR, Chahal's over is ruined once again off the last ball, this was tossed up nicely outside off, Nair bent half-forward, reverses his stance and helps it on its way to the long leg fence, make it off the fifth ball

Kulwant Khejroliya to Ashwin, FOUR, cracking shot, short and on the stumps, Ashwin swivels across, rolls his wrists and helps it on its way, the man in the deep is square and the ball beats him to the fence
Kulwant Khejroliya to Ashwin, FOUR, beautifully played, length delivery outside off, Ashwin leans forward, drives it on the up and beats the diving fielder at cover, no need to run for those

Woakes to Ashwin, FOUR, lovely shot, this is turning out to be a fine cameo from Ashwin, comes down the track, uses his reach to good effect and clears cover with the lofted off-drive, couple of bounces and over the ropes

Kulwant Khejroliya to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, errs in line after a good start. This is a shortish one on leg and Agarwal doesn't miss out on the chance. Swivels and drags it down to the fine leg fence, can't keep a fielder there

U Yadav to Yuvraj, FOUR, what was the fielder doing there? He should have been back near the fence. Could have been a straight forward catch there. Short of a length delivery around off, Yuvraj swivels and pulls it over the leaping fielder at deep square leg, guess it was Sarfaraz Khan

Kulwant Khejroliya to Nair, FOUR, Rahul, Agarwal and now Nair. All Karnataka boys have got off the mark with a boundary or six tonight. Full length delivery around off, Nair keeps his head still and drills it past the fielder at mid-off, no chance to stop that

Woakes to Nair, FOUR, class apart. It's a short delivery around off, Nair arches back and guides it to perfection over the empty cordon, third man sprints to his left but it's one bounce and over the fence

Chahal to Rahul, FOUR, no... he doesn't! How often have we seen the last delivery of the over to be the spoiler! Darts it on leg and Rahul gets down on his knee to paddle it away and a chase by the fielder is not enough to stop this as the ball races away
Hardik Pandya to Roy, FOUR, that came right off the meat. On a length outside off, Roy stays put and punches this sweetly through the gap at covers, sweeper kept it place right after that shot

Hardik Pandya to Gambhir, FOUR, Pandya doesn't like it. He's not happy with himself. Bowls a shortish delivery on leg and Gambhir simply puts it away to the square leg fence with a nonchalant clip off his hips, 11 runs off the opening over

Dananjaya to Roy, FOUR, the spinner put under pressure right away by Jason. Picks the length early on this short delivery, camps back and hammers it past the fielder at wide long-on, no chance of the stopping that

Bumrah to Roy, FOUR, in the airrr and if Pollard can't get there with that trampoline jump of his, nobody can. Gee these batsmen have no mercy, not even for Jas Bumrah! Well, this was a freebie ball though, full and in the slot, Roy muscles it hard over mid-off and looks like Pollard has hurt himself coming down hard on the ground

Krunal Pandya to Pant, FOUR, welcome into the attack Mr. Krunal! Pant will love this - left-armer turning it back into him. Leg-side is going to be busy. This was actually bowled pretty well, very slow although full, Pant delays the lofted drive and manages to hit it straight over the bowler to split long-off and long-on

Markande to Maxwell, FOUR, the invitation there from the bowler with the flighted delivery, you can't blame him because he's going for wickets. But just that he's bowled this too full for the batsman to be troubled and Maxwell smashes it straight over the non-striker's head to take long-on out of the equation

Krunal Pandya to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, that should have been stopped by Rahul Chahar at deep point. Short and wide outside off stump, Iyer cuts, Chahar got there running to his left from sweeper, but he fumbled

Bumrah to Roy, FOUR, a dropped catch and then the MI's best bowler has been carted away for four next ball. Five runs off 2 balls and the asking rate is only around 9. Short of a length delivery on the stumps, Roy pulls powerfully and there's no one at deep square leg to stop the boundary

Bumrah to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, slower ball alright, but this is way outside off stump, Iyer delays the cut shot, puts it past backward point and the man sweeping the off-side boundary could not cut it off as well

Mustafizur to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, there is deep square leg, there is deep mid-wicket but Shreyas Iyer has expertly split them both with a well timed pull shot. Mustafizur went normal pace on this short ball and it didn't rise high enough for Iyer to be troubled

Mustafizur to Roy, FOUR, that's a quality hit from Roy but hang on, why on earth did you bowl normal pace Mustafizur? Full and wide outside off stump, Roy drills the drive over cover and there's no one in the deep. Great start to the over for DD

Hardik Pandya to Gambhir, FOUR, one bounce and into the cushions. That'll release a bit of pressure off Gambhir. Picks the length early, rocks back and pulls the shortish delivery over square leg, one bounce and into the fence

Hardik Pandya to Roy, FOUR, he's looking unstoppable, just like the MI openers were earlier in the day. Pandya dishes a full length delivery around off, Roy stays put and pummels it right over the bowler's head

Markande to Pant, FOUR, first one of the innings for Pant. This was short and wide outside off and was meant to be put away. Pant doesn't miss out, reaches for it and thrashes it away, beats sweeper cover quite comfortably

Markande to Pant, FOUR, strong bottom hand on that. Flatter delivery around off and it's short too, Pant drags it away with a firm pull and beats the man at deep mid-wicket this time around, this was a powerful blow by the pocket-sized dynamite
Markande to Pant, FOUR, reverse swept! Shortish delivery around off, Pant does well to reverse sweep that over short third man, gets four more

Markande to Pant, FOUR, Markande is not having a good day with the ball. 10 runs in the first over, already 16 off this. Went down on his knee and swept that flighted delivery over square leg nicely, two boundaries and a six in this over
Dananjaya to Pant, FOUR, and the boundaries continue to flow. Follows it up with a sweet sweep. Loopy delivery around off, Pant goes down and sweeps it firmly towards the long leg fence
Boult to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, mid-off a touch squarer and this full length delivery finds a way. Driven with a straight bat. Always on with the ball nicely pitched up in your half
Boult to Lewis, FOUR, just a trifle short that and Lewis swivels with the incoming angle. Blasts it one-legged in front of the square leg umpire

Boult to Lewis, leg byes, FOUR, leg byes given but looked like there was some bat. Hung over from the last boundary, Boult tries to cramp Lewis for room and overdoes it with a gimme down leg. Glanced away for four runs. Who cares if it's off the bat or not..
Nadeem to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, misfielded by Maxwell at mid-on. Flat from Nadeem, Suryakumar Yadav wrists it away and basks in the glory of someone else's plight

Maxwell to Rohit, FOUR, this is beautifully done from Rohit. So deft. Perfectly good delivery from Maxwell, turning in from a length towards off. Rohit's intentions are highly concealed all the way through, but just when the ball is about to pass him, he lays the softest of touches to deflect it past the keeper's glove into the third man boundary
Maxwell to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, oh poor delivery. He's fired this well down leg, Kishan sees the opportunity early and paddle-swats it to the fine leg boundary
Rahul Tewatia to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, he's bowled pretty short to Kishan so far, and unlike before, this time he's punished for it. Kishan rocks back and thumps his pull over mid-wicket

Christian to Rohit, FOUR, goes for the slower short ball again, but gets it down leg. With fine leg up, Rohit only has to help his pull past the fielder in the circle, which he comfortably does after swivelling into the shot
Shami to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, 124kph, short of length delivery just outside off, Kishan cheekily dabs it fine of short third man

Shami to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, these are weird tactics. Both fine leg and third man are up, so you'd expect the length to be full. But Shami's gone short more often than not. Now agreed, this one rushes Kishan on the pull as he's taken by surprise. But he swings into it and the top-edge balloons past the keeper. Always a risk with this field
Christian to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, just over extra-cover! 117kph, length ball wide of off, Kishan had to reach out for it but he throws everything and is able to smear it over the fielder
Shami to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, off-cutter from Shami, but it's right in the slot for Krunal to hammer it over mid-off
Boult to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, nicely done. He's not giving up. Pitched it right up there again, desperately hoping for some swing, but is driven handsomely down the ground

Boult to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, that's box-office chic and very good thinking. Short ball angled across, Suryakumar Yadav's ducking initially, then sees that the height isn't much and ramps that over to the third man fence with utter style
Nadeem to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, that's dropped a touch short, so even though it's turning the ball's hittable. Suryakumar Yadav rocks back and slaps that disparagingly wide of mid-off

Shami to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, now this is a fine, fine yorker.. and look what happens. Suryakumar Yadav squeezes it out with an open bat face and has that scooting to the third man fence. Who says cricket's for egalitarians?!

Shami to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, let's say Shami's gotten obsessed with bowling yorkers. More yorkers. Better yorkers. He wants redemption for that boundary that Suryakumar Yadav hit earlier in the over. Goes for one again, bowls a low full toss on leg-stump instead -- how? why? what? -- and is flicked round the corner
Christian to Lewis, FOUR, from over the wicket and that's been pitched full. Right there to be hit. Lewis doesn't even bother about the footwork. Stays put and slamns that through wide mid-off
Christian to Lewis, FOUR, about time we saw a half-volley. All he had to do was stay leg-side of the ball and deflect it with an open bat face. Does so, and it's a boundary through cover-point

Christian to Lewis, FOUR, another. Keep 'em counting. Another half-volley, and this one's been scorched through covers with an elegant bat flow. The deliveries remain the same, only Lewis's shots are evolving into something more telegenic

Stanlake to Chris Lynn, FOUR, that's a cracking shot. Width on offer and Lynn makes the most of it. Short and wide outside off, throws his bat at it and crunches it past the fielder at point, races away to the fence in no time

Stanlake to Chris Lynn, FOUR, Williamson pulls off a blinder, almost. Good length delivery around off, Lynn goes ahead with his lofted shot and miscues it over mid-off, Williamson goes back running, extends his right arm but can't take the catch, the ball crawls away to the long-off boundary
Shakib to Narine, FOUR, throws his hands at another ball drifting away and shoots an outside edge over the two fielders behind square on the off-side
S Kaul to Karthik, FOUR, back of a length delivery, punched exquisitely behind point
Rashid Khan to Karthik, FOUR, another leg break, Karthik waits and waits before dabbing that just wide of the keeper. Boundary through third man

Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, the power of Lynn on that shot will take that away to the fence. Slower delivery, the knuckle ball by Bhuvi, Lynn backs away and goes through with his horizontal slap, beats the man at mid-on and finds the fence. Wasn't middled properly but those muscles help him

Bhuvneshwar to Nitish Rana, FOUR, crunched away! Good length delivery angled away from the batsman, Rana rocks back and slams that through the gap at point, lightning speed on that as the batsman gets his first boundary, on the first ball. Positive start for the southpaw
S Kaul to Chris Lynn, FOUR, slapped away! Knuckle delivery, fraction short and outside off, Lynn frees his arms and goes aerial, evades cover-point with a cut and manages to get four runs

S Kaul to Chris Lynn, FOUR, lucky favoring Lynn tonight. This is a slower delivery again, full in length around off, the big man swings hard at it and manages to get an inside edge, past the stumps, past the man at short fine leg and into the fence

S Kaul to Chris Lynn, FOUR, glorious! He's off to a flier, like always. This is a full length ball and well outside off, Lynn doesn't miss out and drills it through covers, right into the gap, Kaul greeted with 14 runs, quite expensive.
Rashid Khan to Nitish Rana, FOUR, ends the over with a cracking boundary. This was short and width was there, enough for the batsman to go ahead with his square cut and find the fence
