S Kaul to Chris Lynn, FOUR, another inside edge and Lynn survives. Fullish around off, Lynn swings hard at it and gets an inside edge past the leg-stump, moves on to 46* with that boundary
Johnson to Saha, FOUR, first runs off the bat from Saha and SRH. It was on the stumps, Saha gets in the position quickly and whips it wide of the fine leg fielder for a four
A Russell to Saha, FOUR, just over of the square leg fielder. It was on a good length and outside off, Saha pulls it off the front root, manages to clear the fielder and ball races for a four

A Russell to Dhawan, FOUR, another short of length delivery, Dhawan gets into position quickly and pulls it in front of square for a four. He doesn't time it as well as he would have liked but the placement is good enough
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, FOUR, Williamson puts this away. Much needed release of pressure. Short googly from Yadav, the SRH captain sits back and pumps it through mid-wicket

Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, FOUR, four more. Two short balls in a row from Yadav. He'll be disappointed by this. Googly on leg-stump, Williamson picks length early, gets down low and swats it through backward square
A Russell to Shakib, FOUR, Shakib swivels into the pull but is clearly hurried by this short of length delivery. He's lucky that the top-edge has flown over the keeper's head
A Russell to Shakib, FOUR, now goes over mid-off! He was actually done in by the slower ball, as evidenced by his bottom hand coming off, but more importantly, he went through with it
Johnson to Y Pathan, FOUR, Pathan kills the crowd's enthusiasm, crashes this full ball through extra cover. What a hit. He nailed this drive to the fence

A Russell to Y Pathan, FOUR, hoists this over extra-cover. Pathan's stepping up to the occasion against his former franchise. Back of length delivery outside off, he gets it close to the bottom of the bat but there's enough on the drive to clear cover
Johnson to Saha, FOUR, Johnson is becoming predictable here with his length. It was on a short of length again, Saha holds his shape and pulls it over square leg for another four.
Johnson to Saha, FOUR, another slower ball outside off from Johnson. Saha reads the change in pace and drives it through the off-side for a four

Johnson to Saha, FOUR, cracking shot! It was touch fuller of good length, Saha lofts it wide of the mid-on fielder for a four. he played that shot with a straight bat and that made it even better. Minimum risk and effective result!
Chawla to Williamson, FOUR, beautiful use of the feet from Williamson. He comes down the track and drives it wide of the mid-off fielder for a four
Chawla to Williamson, FOUR, goes on the back foot in a flash and drives it through cover for another four. Stellar timing from the skipper

Gowtham to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, McCullum is off the mark and so is RCB, that too in style. Short and wide outside off, Brendon punches it hard towards cover and a misfield by Samson results in a boundary. He has scored 91* but can't take fielding lightly

D Kulkarni to Kohli, FOUR, elegance personified there. Full length delivery outside off, Kohli walks down the track and creams his drive, through the gap at cover and there's no stopping that, such was the precision in the placement

D Kulkarni to Kohli, FOUR, Chinnaswamy erupts as Kohli smokes one. Backs away, reaches for it and slams the length delivery over covers, one bounce and into the fence. Was middled to perfection, sweet sound of the willow too

D Kulkarni to Kohli, FOUR, another impressive shot. After two shots on the off-side, Kohli gets one through the on side. Moves towards the pitch of the delivery, keeps his eyes on the ball and flicks it over mid-wicket. Three boundaries already in the over. This is going to be an exciting run chase if Kohli keeps playing like this

Unadkat to de Villiers, FOUR, slower back of length ball again, this time there's a little bit of width which allows AB to carve it away between backward point and short third man. It was uppish, but the placement was spot on
Laughlin to Mandeep, FOUR, normal pace from Laughlin this time, Mandeep uses those extra 10kph and slices it away through backward point. Nicely done

Unadkat to Mandeep, FOUR, short of length delivery outside off, Mandeep slices the cut away through backward point. The ball spun away from sweeper cover who dived too early and fell at least 3 feet short of getting to it
Unadkat to Mandeep, FOUR, Unadkat not having a great time here. Bowls this full and wide outside off, Mandeep stretches across and slices it for another boundary, this time wide of third man

Stokes to Washington Sundar, FOUR, these are all useful runs to reduce the margin of defeat. Surely they can't win this can they? Stokes misses his yorker by a couple of inches and is sliced away over backward point

Laughlin to Mandeep, FOUR, gets inside this short of length delivery and helps the pull over short fine leg. It was really well done because this was a slower ball and there really wasn't a lot of pace to work with
Laughlin to Mandeep, FOUR, slower ball which swings away from Mandeep. He gets down low, uses the swing and slices it past short third man. Wonderful batting
Laughlin to Mandeep, FOUR, just short of the yorker mark, and Mandeep takes toll by hammering it down the ground for four. Really good showing from him, even though in a losing cause
Gowtham to Kohli, FOUR, Kohli continues to deal in boundaries. Rocks back, picks the length early and punches it through the gap at covers again, away she goes, into the fence

Gowtham to de Kock, FOUR, first one of the innings for de Kock. He has joined the skipper now. Flatter in trajectory and outside off, de Kock doesn't miss out on it and slaps it through the gap at covers, he needs to play along with Kohli if RCB want to make a match out of it. Can't be chased alone this target
Unadkat to de Kock, FOUR, beautiful! Pitches it on middle and leg, de Kock makes sure to send it to the long-on fence with a fine on-drive, RCB... RCB... are the chants all across the stadium
Gowtham to de Kock, FOUR, there's no stopping these two. Tossed up delivery around off, de Kock reaches for it with a shimmy and times his chip over long-off, quality shot

Gowtham to de Kock, FOUR, another one! The bowlers have no answers to this brilliance by the RCB pair. The left hand - right hand combination is make it difficult for the bowlers. This was floated on middle and de Kock went down on his knee to sweep it through square leg
Stokes to Kohli, FOUR, "welcome into the attack Mr Stokes," says Kohli. Picks the length on that short one early and makes sure to pummel it over mid-wicket, he's in the zone guys.

Stokes to Kohli, FOUR, can't bowl such freebies to a batsman of this class. It's a juicy full toss outside off, Kohli brings his bat down in time and angles it past the fielder at point, he's toying with the field here, finding those gaps with ease
Shreyas Gopal to Kohli, FOUR, right into the gap there! Shortish delivery on middle and leg, Kohli goes back and pulls it with authority beating the man at deep mid-wicket
Woakes to Rahane, FOUR, juicy. He's in some weird mood, happy to go horizontally right away, gets that length that sits up, hoping to be smacked. Obliged. Airy over mid-wicket
U Yadav to Stokes, FOUR, that sitting up length. On the tummy, quite Stokes' staple. He stays up, lets it get in his arc and heaves. Those muscles .. through mid-wicket

Khejroliya to Stokes, FOUR, high quality shot! Why move around the in the crease and swipe when you can play shots like this. This was full and quite wide as well, Stokes played the square drive late to bisect short third man and backward point with precision. Top stuff!!

Chahal to Buttler, FOUR, signature Buttler start! Wastes no time to get going. Brings out the reverse sweep and takes this on the full, makes enough connection to beat a diving backward point. Finds the fence

Chahal to Buttler, byes, FOUR, geee, that's beaten everyone! Comedy of errors really. Buttler went for premeditated paddle, de Kock anticipated and was en route to his left already but guess what, the stroke didn't connect and the ball went through the yawning gap between first slip and the keeper

Negi to Buttler, FOUR, edged but no slip! You don't expect one at this stage of a T20 inning either for most bowlers. Lovely piece of bowling from Negi, floated up nicely to invite the drive from Buttler and forced the edge as well. Too hard for de Kock and it raced past him to the fence

Woakes to Samson, FOUR, gets it away very, very fine! Didn't intend to get it that fine perhaps but he won't mind, will he? The perfect yorker from Woakes but Samson digs it out with an open bat face. Manages to slice itwell past a diving de Kock to the fence. When it's your day, it's just your day!

Woakes to Samson, FOUR, didn't I tell you that this is his day? Samson survives once more. Fuller ball and he goes for the lofted stroke over cover. For a moment, the man at sweeper cover thought he had a chance but was late I guess. Put in a late dive and it bounced before him, then sped through to the fence
U Yadav to Tripathi, FOUR, bleeding runs! Slower and short, the leg stump line doesn't help and Tripathi swivels to pull it easily over square leg. Another boundary
Washington Sundar to Rahane, FOUR, thank the injury. When you can't run, you slog. Rahane sits, uses the line already down leg to sweep. Hard. Behind square. One-bounced
U Yadav to Rahane, FOUR, backs away in the crease, converts it into one in his slot and goes all bottom-handed in lofting into cow corner. One way of avoiding run-outs
U Yadav to Rahane, FOUR, hoick. Mid-wicket. Again. It's getting familiar. Another friendly length for Rahane to get under and smoke it down

Chahal to Rahane, FOUR, on the sweep. Never mind the top-edge, the powerplay is his ally. His stride doesn't quite get him to the pitch of it, the spin's big too. But these big bats allow him to clear square leg, and that's enough
Chahal to D Arcy Short, FOUR, oh these nice float-ups. Short ain't getting foxed, lets it dip. Loads up. Might swing. And flat down the ground

Woakes to Rahane, FOUR, he's toying around. May his leg never recover. Makes Woakes bowl straight, threatening a move around. But sways inside the line, flat-batted and hammers it round the corner. Pile on the powerplay
Mohit Sharma to Watson, FOUR, throws his hands out. He's already given himself width with his exposed stance. Swings, uppish and slices it with ease over point. Never mind the mistime

Mohit Sharma to Watson, FOUR, 137.7kph. Turns cheeky. Mohit tries to correct, getting the channel close to off, but Watson's not getting foxed. He stays back, arches and ramps it ever so late, teasing the man at short third
Andrew Tye to Rayudu, FOUR, short ball, this time Yuvraj does not have time to react. The ball races away towards his right and into the fence

Andrew Tye to Dhoni, FOUR, he's muscled that! Look at that ball go so flat and one bounce into the wide long-off fence. Slower delivery outside off stump, Dhoni steps out and the ball sat up nicely for Dhoni to free his arms and smash

Andrew Tye to Jadeja, FOUR, oh that's a timely hit! Slower ball on the shorter side, Jadeja made room, lost balance but managed to cut that nicely over cover-point and there's no protection in the deep. 12 off the over, 55 more needed

Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, FOUR, in the airrr, could be out, oh the fielder makes a mess of it. Low full toss, Dhoni slogs, should have been held at deep mid-wicket, Dagar the sub wasn't quick enough to move forward, he dived but let it pass. He's immediately moved out of that position

Andrew Tye to Dhoni, FOUR, talk about presence of mind and there's Dhoni with a bit of deftness. Short ball with third man inside the ring, unbelievable from the bowler. Dhoni spots the field, just guides the ball over the infield to the third man fence. Sehwag smiles from the dug out

Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, FOUR, he's squeezed this in the gap. There were three fielders behind square on the off-side - point, backward point and short third man, yet Dhoni finds the gap. Can't blame the bowler for bowling a wide yorker, he bowled to the field
Barinder to Rayudu, FOUR, all timing. Back, lining himself behind and drills it to mid-off's right. Ashwin isn't the quickest, manages a palm. The outfield isn't Punjab's ally either
Mohit Sharma to Rayudu, FOUR, on the charge, converts the length into his arc and on-tonks. Not the legs, but nobody's cutting this off with nobody in the vicinity of long-on

Andrew Tye to Rayudu, FOUR, too straight. Never an ideal follow up delivery, never an ideal any delivery. Rayudu's quick to pounce, shuffles inwards and tucks, splitting the gap between the keeper and short fine

Mujeeb to Billings, FOUR, a heap of runs. A half-tracker, then the googly starting from middle and spinning well down leg. Billings isn't happy pocketing a wide, he reaches leg-sided, connects and heaves it into fine leg
Yuvraj to Dhoni, FOUR, drags the length down. Very defensively. Dhoni doesn't have time to pat things back tonight. He chases, hard, and powers it behind point
Ashwin to Rayudu, FOUR, doesn't matter what spinner this is - it's a full toss, down leg. Rayudu's on a knee, sweeping, slogging, everything
Ashwin to Dhoni, FOUR, oh the deft. Some width, Dhoni's surgical, waiting on it, shedding that brutal muscle, putting some nerves to use, dabbing it between point and short third
Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, breaks the barrier of respect and drives it on the up, uppishly. Over cover and into the fence. The ball was in the zone and the batsman did not hold back to smack it away

Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, ho ho ho!! That was creamed away. Length ball, dangling away and the batsman eases the cover drive away into the gap. The ball speeds away into the fence. Again the ball curved away but the neat footwork towards the line of the ball ensured the batsman had it covered. Action-packed start

Harbhajan to Gayle, FOUR, leaning drive! Classical touch play with a big stride forward and the ball screams past cover for a four. Slightly flatter it might have been and the batsman got it away. That would help
Dwayne Bravo to Yuvraj, FOUR, picked the gap beautifully did Yuvraj. Short ball at 123.6kph, Yuvraj picked the length early. Stood tall and pummeled the pull between long-on and deep mid-wicket

Dwayne Bravo to Yuvraj, FOUR, follows the bumper with a yorker and Yuvraj brings his bat down at the right time. Manages to get some wood off the cue end and the ball goes fine of the man at short third man. Bravo is appealing! For what? Bat before the wicket? Was clearly off the bat
Tahir to Nair, FOUR, good shot to get off the mark. In-drifter, slightly errs in line. Too straight and Nair's wrists does the rest. Flicks it through mid-wicket
Dwayne Bravo to Nair, FOUR, bad ball and Nair takes full toll of it. Length ball on the pads, tickled away fine to fine leg

Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, short ball, bad ball and put away. The batsman was waiting for it and swats the pull away fine on the on-side for a four. Crisply timed and it ran away. Rahul has run into a massive purple patch
Harbhajan to Gayle, FOUR, drops the ball short and that is a sin! The huge bat of Gayle comes down on it and swords the ball away past cover point for a four
Harbhajan to Rahul, FOUR, did I sanity? Pardon me. Gayle's partner-in-crime joins the act and creams the full toss outside off away into the covers. The ball raced away into the fence

Harbhajan to Rahul, FOUR, if it is power from one end, it is all grace from the other. The batsman leans into the drive and threads the ball away like a seasoned tailor. The man at mid-off had no chance even with the dive to his left. Superb bit of batting

SN Thakur to Gayle, FOUR, edged and gone! Gone for a four. Dhoni does not go for it to his left. Should be classified as a chance even if it might have been touch and go. The slip was wide and the ball goes between the keeper and the slip for a four. That is a huge reprieve for Gayle
SN Thakur to Rahul, FOUR, CSK have not done their homework. That was short again and the batsman stays back to pull the ball away with a lot of control. The man at deep fine had no chance
SN Thakur to Gayle, FOUR, short ball again, the batsman does not time the pull away. But he gets enough meat on it and sends it past mid-on for a four. Fifty up for KXIP. All carnage at Mohali

Chahar to Gayle, FOUR, crafty and controlled. The short ball, the batsman gets on top of it and guides it past short fine leg for a four. The man at short fine leg and deep square leg tried to cut it off but in vain
Chahar to Gayle, FOUR, punched and K.O! That was actually a pile driver down the ground. Picks the short of length delivery and punishes it down the ground, uppishly, for a four past mid-off
Tahir to Rahul, FOUR, full toss on the pads and Rahul adds four to his tally. That was clipped away and the slide from the man at deep mid is not good enough

Tahir to Gayle, FOUR, fifty on KXIP debut! The big boss is owning the evening. That was in the zone, too full and the batsman thumped it down the ground for a four. One bounce and it escapes into the fence. And look at the big man, he does the cradle act with both his arms. He is thrilled to bits
Harbhajan to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, sliced away! No respect for the veteran spinner and the ball races away into the fence. Man at sweeper cover had no chance
A Russell to Gambhir, FOUR, cracking shot, overpitched and well outside off, Gambhir leans forward and places it into the gap past cover-point, beat the man in the ring and rolled away to the fence
A Russell to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, short, wide and four, Shreyas Iyer's eyes lit up as he saw the width, got on top of the bounce and cracked it square past point, no need to run for those
Kuldeep Yadav to Shami, FOUR, more flight on this ball and Shami eyes the mid-wicket region. Swings hard and gets a fat outside edge that goes over the slip fielder. Runs away to the third man fence

Shivam Mavi to Pant, FOUR, change of pace from Mavi, but Pant spotted it well, waited on the short ball, rolled his wrists and helped it behind square on the on-side, beat short fine and raced away to the fence
A Russell to Pant, FOUR, much better from Pant, full and just outside off, Pant brings his bat down and drills it back past the non-striker. Mid-off is very wide and has no chance

A Russell to Pant, FOUR, Pant has been lucky in this innings so far, pitched up and well wide of off, he saw the width and threw his hands at that, slices it high and over cover, couple of bounces and over the ropes

A Russell to Maxwell, FOUR, just over cover and the small Eden Gardens outfield means it's a boundary for Maxwell. He backed away to a short and wide ball, had to reach out for the slap, didn't get it off the middle, but has enough to clear the infield
Shivam Mavi to Maxwell, FOUR, short, wide and four, no one moved after Maxwell flashed it behind square on the off-side, a poor ball and Maxwell took full toll of it

Narine to Pant, FOUR, much needed for DD, very full and around off, Pant gets his left leg out of the way, brings his bottom-hand into play and drills it wide of mid-on, beats the fielder in the ring and rolls away to the fence
Narine to Pant, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Pant, gets down low to a well flighted delivery outside leg, rolls his wrists and sweeps it behind square on the on-side for a boundary

Chawla to Pant, FOUR, this is excellent batting from Pant, Chawla dropped this one short and just outside off, Pant makes room, lets the ball go past him and then cuts it square behind point for a boundary
Tom Curran to Pant, FOUR, cracking shot, full and well outside off, right in the slot for Pant as he drives it past cover, the fielder in the deep has no chance

Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, FOUR, reverse sweep and four, flighted delivery outside off, Maxwell bends down half-way and then gets it past the keeper, no chance for short third man and the ball rolls away to the fence

Vijay Shankar to Nitish Rana, FOUR, right in between deep mid-wicket and deep backward square. The short ball sits up for Nitish Rana, who swivels on the back foot and though he pulls in the air, he hits the gap
Chris Morris to Karthik, FOUR, this is classy. Effortless batting by DK. Length delivery angling in to middle and leg, Karthik flicks over mid-wicket and leaves deep mid a spectator

Chris Morris to Karthik, FOUR, an action replay of the previous delivery. Chris Morris just stares in despair. At DK who has flicked him again over mid-wicket. Sheer timing and nearly went all the way, one bounce over the ropes. What form he is in at the moment
Chris Morris to Nitish Rana, FOUR, went for the short delivery again, but took the pace off it, sits up for Nitish Rana who slashes over point and beats sweeper cover running across
Boult to Shubman Gill, FOUR, goes short and Shubman Gill gets off the mark with four. On the body, pulled hard through mid-wicket and Gill finds the gap

Boult to Nitish Rana, FOUR, this guy has talent. Make no mistake about it. Turns a near yorker into a boundary. Special skill when you can do that. Backed away a tad and directed it with an open face, just wide of short third, who didn't get across. Should've done better

Chris Morris to Nitish Rana, FOUR, how good is he with those cuts and carves on the off-side. Sits deep in his crease, waits for the full delivery and then at the last moment opens the face of the bat to drive in the air, there's a fielder placed exactly for that shot, but the ball bounces wide of him and speeds to the fence

Chris Morris to Shubman Gill, leg byes, FOUR, poor delivery and deserved four. High full-toss sliding down leg, brushes the thigh pad of Shubman Gill and beats Pant's dive to his left. Runs away fast to the fine leg fence. Chris Morris has been disappointing with the ball tonight
Boult to Chris Lynn, FOUR, that is smashed. Belted by Chris Lynn as he saw the short of length delivery outside off and didn't hold back. Went aerial over cover-point and gets four

Nadeem to Chris Lynn, FOUR, he wants to go only one way - through the off-side. This is a good shot, hammers it hard and wide of extra-cover, who didn't dive. It was a quicker one and on the stumps, but Chris Lynn found the gap

Boult to Uthappa, FOUR, shot. Slightly fuller than a good length on the stumps, Uthappa just biffed it over the bowler's head. Not a very good connection, but good enough to clear everyone. Breaks the shackles a bit

Boult to Chris Lynn, FOUR, clobbered by Chris Lynn. Boult went round the wicket to cramp up the batsman, but provided the ideal length for the Aussie to hit, brutalised past the stumps at the other end. The ball was gone before Boult could stick his boot in

Boult to Chris Lynn, FOUR, nearly holed out. But gets four thanks to Morris' fumble. At long-on. He went for the catch, but the ball bounced in front of him and since he didn't get his body behind the line of the ball, it runs away. Was a full-toss and Chris Lynn biffed that in the air

Nadeem to Uthappa, FOUR, drags it short, the arm-ball went wrong. Fired it outside off, Uthappa cuts that hard and eludes a diving cover-point to his left. As soon as he got it past the fielder, it was four

Nadeem to Nitish Rana, FOUR, now shows his intelligence by sweeping wide of short fine leg. Knows deep square is too square and won't get there, got outside the line and knelt down to play the sweep well

Woakes to Rohit, FOUR, classy shot! He has been out of form but strokes like these should set Rohit up nicely. Half-volley and not all that wide, but he leans nicely to caress the drive through the covers. Raced away to the fence in no time
Corey Anderson to Rohit, FOUR, rubbing insult. A nothing half tracker, drifting down leg and Rohit loads up on the back foot, swivelling as he swats it powerfully behind square. One-bounced

U Yadav to Rohit, FOUR, now compensated with width too. The length stays short and friendly. Rohit carves, doesn't even bother keeping it down, given how fine third man is. And yes, it's a fifty .. his first of this season
U Yadav to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, and now feeds the pads for some reason. Umesh's dealing in binaries here. Whipped away, typically bottom-handed, teasing fine leg

Corey Anderson to Rohit, FOUR, angling wide across. Rohit in some form, he leans, frees up his hands, taking it head-on in hammering it square. Oh the way he opens up the face in slicing,check the leather!

Corey Anderson to Rohit, FOUR, that short-wide combo. And Rohit has no shortage of time on anything. Gets in line, angry bat, angry hands on the revenge from the run-out he's caused. And into deep point
Corey Anderson to Rohit, FOUR, clears his front leg. Goes conventional. Full meat, over the bolwer, and trickling further in. Deadly death batting this
Corey Anderson to Rohit, FOUR, another juicy full toss. Oh dear. Oh dear. Flat-batted, heaving it downtown. Oh the bleeding, it's getting painful to watch

U Yadav to Lewis, FOUR, wrong line and is duly punished. Short of a length and is down leg as well, cannot do that with fine leg in the ring. Lewis swivels across for the pull and although it came off the inner half, was always a percentage shot. Beats the fielder in the ring comfortably and races away
Corey Anderson to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, finishing touches. Make it 21 off the over -- and Pandya's done it with a flash straight down. 213 it will be ..

Washington Sundar to Rohit, FOUR, doesn't start well and on this pitch, there is little margin for error. Slightly short and a bit of width as well, Rohit sits back and crunches it through the covers. Found the gap and the outfield did the rest

Washington Sundar to Lewis, FOUR, super shot! Sundar is being put under pressure here. Flatter and a touch short outside off, Lewis waits on the back foot and punches this through the gap at backward point. Lovely stuff! Even Kohli cannot help but applaud the stroke

Washington Sundar to Lewis, FOUR, this is getting disastrous for the young off spinner but he has only himself to blame. Another fuller ball down leg, this time Lewis doesn't fail to connect. Sweeps it very fine down the leg-side and past the fielder who was in the ring

Siraj to Lewis, FOUR, bleeding runs here! This is a fab counterattack from these two and the RCB bowlers are wilting under the onslaught. Slower but short with a lot of width, allows Lewis to chance his arms with a slap cut through backward point

Woakes to Lewis, FOUR, raining boundaries! Cannot understand this ploy though, back of a length outside off with third man in the ring. Lewis stays back and glides it, just had to beat that man in the 30-yard circle and he does it with ease

Washington Sundar to Lewis, FOUR, not Sundar's night at all. Another drag-on, leg-stumpish and these are easy pickings for Lewis. Sits back and swivels across to clatter the pull to the deep mid-wicket fence. The offie has been unusually erratic so far

Corey Anderson to Rohit, FOUR, how hard has he hit this one! Boy, that's some power from Rohit. Charges down the track and makes room to create width. The length wasn't all that short but he clobbered it over cover. Rocketed away

Corey Anderson to Rohit, FOUR, does it again! Rohit is determined not to let his former MI teammate settle. Stays in the crease this time and just gets leg-side of the ball a touch before launching it inside out over extra cover. Delicious strokeplay!

Bumrah to Kohli, FOUR, what a shot. Bumrah overdoes, overpitches and that's too easy for Kohli. Gets forward, with a full face of the bat and creams it past mid-on. That boundary will ruin a decent over by Bumrah

Krunal Pandya to de Kock, FOUR, is greeted to the crease with a boundary. Flighted on the stumps, de Kock gets and sweeps. Gets it more off the top-edge but it sails over behind square. No-one there and they'll collect a boundary

Krunal Pandya to Kohli, FOUR, uppish and through Pollard's hands at short mid-wicket. Trademark Kohli whip. Clears his front leg and swats it off his pads. Pollard leaps but in vain. Races away to the boundary at deep mid-wicket
Krunal Pandya to Kohli, FOUR, this is tripe. Gift packed and delivered to Kohli. Flat and short outside off, Kohli goes back and thrashes it through cover
Markande to Washington Sundar, FOUR, lovely hit inside-out by Washi! The googly from Markande, seemed to have picked that from the hand, got a stride forward and lofted that beautifully over cover

Bumrah to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, he's guided this in the gap past backward point and it's running away for four. It was the slower delivery outside off stump, Sarfaraz gets the placement right by opening the bat face at the last moment
Mustafizur to Kohli, FOUR, he's middled this alright, doesn't bother running! The off-cutter, Kohli launches it over the bowler's head and beats long-on

Bumrah to Kohli, FOUR, outside edge and third man is inside the ring, the ball flies over him as Kohli goes hard on the attempted lofted drive. Can he get a hundred? 14 to get, 4 more deliveries to go

McClenaghan to Kohli, FOUR, su-sweet. Ends the over with a boundary. Juicy half-volley from McClenaghan, well outside off. Kohli isn't sparing those. Leans across, plants his front foot towards the ball and slashes it through extra cover. Beats a crowed off-side field

Mustafizur to de Kock, FOUR, this wasn't timed as he would've liked, but de Kock will still earn a boundary. The slower delivery from Fizz, de Kock didn't pick it as he was through the shot early. Still managed to get enough wood to place it over mid-on. There's no stopping that

Mustafizur to Kohli, FOUR, edgy but looked like it was intentional from Kohli. The slower ball from Rahman, ends up as a wide yorker. Kohli digs with an open bat face, runs it more off the outer half and it beats short third man

Mustafizur to Mandeep, FOUR, cracked. Rohit isn't happy, asks Rahman to bowl towards the stumps. Fizz overpitches and offers it outside off, minimal effort from Mandeep. Shifts his weight forward and caresses the drive that beats extra cover

D Kulkarni to Narine, FOUR, edged but safe! A short delivery around off, too close to cut and Narine goes ahead with the shot. Gets a top edge that eludes the leaping keeper and finds the fence. Lucky to be still out there, but this is how he plays
Laughlin to Nitish Rana, FOUR, low full toss outside off, Rana puts bat to ball and it skims away through the covers. Didn't go too hard on the drive, just focused on timing which was spot on
Gowtham to Nitish Rana, FOUR, Gowtham darting them in real quick - 95kph this one. Rana goes back, uses the pace of it and tickles it nice and fine. Bit too straight this one from round the wicket

Gowtham to Karthik, FOUR, oh lovely. He's already showing some excellent touch out there. 102kph delivery from Gowtham, Karthik stays back to it and then dabs it out of the keeper's gloves. So so late and really really fine
Stokes to Karthik, FOUR, full toss outside off, 144kph, Karthik carves it away through backward point. Rocketed off his bat
Gowtham to Uthappa, FOUR, showed glimpses of form in the previous game too. This is short around off, Uthappa camps back and punches it well past the fielder at mid-off, placement was bang on there

D Kulkarni to Narine, FOUR, finally manages to get a boundary. Was trying it since a while. This was a tad on the slower side but short enough for Narine to thrash it, goes aerial over covers and finds the boundary, his first convincing shot of the day

D Kulkarni to Narine, FOUR, this was even better than the previous one. No fielders moved, just mere spectators. Short of a length outside off, Narine throws his hands at it and times his drive through the gap there, that came right from the meat

D Kulkarni to Narine, FOUR, hat-trick of boundaries. Kulkarni put under pressure by Narine. Picks the length early on that short one, transfers his weight on to the back foot and pummels it through mid-wicket, the fielder there was too square to cut this off
Unadkat to Uthappa, FOUR, pulled away! Short of a length on middle and leg, Uthappa picks the length on it and pulls it neatly over mid-wicket, on a bounce and over the fence there
Unadkat to Uthappa, FOUR, slower delivery and that's been put away to the fence again. Just outside off and on a length, Uthappa stands tall and pumps it right over the bowler's head

Unadkat to Uthappa, FOUR, cheeky. That's Uthappa's experience for you. Shortish in length around off, Uthappa simply guides it down to third man and finds the fence again, can't keep a fielder so fine

Laughlin to Uthappa, FOUR, poor line! Can't bowl such freebies when a batsman is in good touch. This was a shortish delivery on the thigh and all Uthappa wanted to do is get it past the fielder at short fine leg, manages to do so. Drags it past the fielder and gets another boundary

Stokes to Narine, FOUR, another edge, another boundary. On a length around off, Narine goes hard at it and gets an outside edge that makes it fly past the keeper. Even a dive by Buttler wouldn't have helped his cause

Stokes to Uthappa, FOUR, misfield by Unadkat and Stokes isn't pleased by that. Was a back of a length delivery outside off, Uthappa went for it with hard hands, threw his bat at it and got an outside edge. Unadkat slips at square third man and misfields as the ball goes through him

Tom Curran to D Arcy Short, FOUR, well-timed and four. Sliding down and D Arcy Short didn't miss out. Short fine was inside the ring and deep square back, he beat the latter with a beautiful flick off the hips. That should hopefully get him going
batsman: Tom Curran to D Arcy Short

Commentary: Narine to D Arcy Short, FOUR, this is another short-arm jab, one bounce over the ropes at deep square. Way too short by Narine, on middle and leg, D Arcy Short picked him off easily, bisected the two men either side on the leg-side
Narine to Tripathi, FOUR, this is so unlike Narine. He hasn't looked himself tonight. Another drag-down, Tripathi controls the pull and beats Mavi to his left at deep mid. 10 off that over

Shivam Mavi to D Arcy Short, FOUR, he can do finesse too. Not only raw power. Used the pace of Shivam Mavi to full effect. Watched the back of a length delivery onto his bat and steered it to the right of the diving backward point, beats him and gives third man no chance
batsman: Shivam Mavi to D Arcy Short

Commentary: Kuldeep Yadav to Tripathi, FOUR, this is a proper pull. Dragged down by Kuldeep Yadav and Tripathi was onto the back foot in a flash, pulled it between wide long-on and deep mid. Found the gap to perfection. Hit hard as well
Narine to Buttler, FOUR, brutal. Fraction short and that's enough for Buttler, who marmalises the back foot forcing shot. Long-off wasn't even in the picture. A rare off night for Narine
Tom Curran to Buttler, FOUR, slightly off-line and four. Can't err in any way to Buttler. Low full-toss and swung to the left of long-on, one bounce over the ropes
Narine to Rahane, FOUR, first ball from Narine and Rahane takes the seam-up delivery and sweeps it through backward square leg, hit well and found the gap too
Narine to Rahane, FOUR, lovely batting. Down the track and to the pitch before slamming it in the air, but wide of the diving Russell at mid-off. Consecutive boundaries
Narine to Rahane, FOUR, three in a row. Too short outside off, Rahane has played around with Narine's mind. Takes full toll of this, by cutting this wide of point and cover-point

Narine to Rahane, FOUR, four more. This is brilliant batting. Without any risk too. That's 16 runs off the over. The last two balls have been short, even though this bounced from a back of a length, Rahane was back and across, cuts again and does so well, to find the gap between point and cover-point. An injection of momentum, so badly needed by RR
Shivam Mavi to D Arcy Short, FOUR, first one he has timed tonight. Picks the slower delivery from a length and swings cleanly over mid-off's head
batsman: Shivam Mavi to D Arcy Short

Commentary: Chawla to Rahane, FOUR, magnificent cover drive. When Rahane is on song, there are few better timers of the ball in India. This is overpitched and he leans forward to caress the drive wide of cover and extra cover. Threaded the needle there
Nitish Rana to D Arcy Short, FOUR, sliding down, just needed bat on that and D Arcy Short gets the glance going. Fine leg is too square and he had no chance
batsman: Nitish Rana to D Arcy Short

Commentary: Shivam Mavi to Samson, FOUR, he attempted that off the first ball and missed. Not now. Uses the pace of Shivam Mavi to great effect. Steers late and with an open face, right off the middle of the bat and Uthappa running around from third man can only watch it run away

Jordan to Gayle, leg byes, FOUR, bonus runs! Gayle checks his back a bit as that had struck him above the thigh pad. Back of a length around leg, he missed the flick off the back foot and it sped past a diving Saha to the fence
S Kaul to Nair, FOUR, up and over! Good batting from Karun, saw mid-off up in the ring and decided to go over the man. Succeeded easily. Fuller ball outside off,

S Kaul to Nair, FOUR, does it again! This time, Jordan at mid-off thought he had a chance and leapt full length but the ball sailed over him. Short of a length outside off, Karun flat-batted it with all the power and although he didn't keep it down, didn't matter at all. Runs bleeding at the moment

Jordan to Nair, FOUR, mid-off inside the ring and Jordan bowls it right in the arc for Nair. He just gets under it and tonks it with a straight bat and clean swing over mid-off. Beautiful hands from Nair. Ah, poses for the paparazzis as well
Rashid Khan to Finch, FOUR, Finch gets into the act. Backs away, makes room and Rashid helped him by slanting it on the stumps. Golf-swung over cow corner

Bhuvneshwar to Rahul, FOUR, elegant shot! The flourish of the bat was a sight to behold. Knuckle ball from Bhuvneshwar but too full and also too straight as well, Rahul shuffles a touch to flick it away sweetly. Bisected mid-on and mid-wicket with ease. Yusuf gave a chase but was never going to stop it even with the slide

Jordan to Gayle, FOUR, on the off-side now! Fuller ball on middle and off, Gayle is sensing the lengths early and backs away for the loft over cover. Carved it away over the infield with ease. He is getting into the groove

S Kaul to Rahul, FOUR, shot of the night so far! This guy makes batting look really simple, doesn't he? Fuller ball and Rahul got the stride forward nicely before absolutely creaming the drive. On the up and what stood out was the precision in placement, bisected extra cover and mid-off with such ease

S Kaul to Rahul, FOUR, over the infield this time! Rahul also joins in the fun. Another half volley from Kaul and this is lofted straight over mid-off. Comfortably over the fielder and away she goes to the fence

Deepak Hooda to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, almost carried to backward point! Reprieve for Agarwal, he went after this flighted delivery on seeing the width but couldn't connect the drive well. Sliced it in the air and it just fell short of the diving fielder. Sneaked past him eventually and sped to the fence

Shakib to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, beautiful placement! Tossed up generously from Shakib but it's too wide and Agarwal executes the inside out lofted stroke with finesse. There was a man at long-off but he's got this well wide of that man

Mohit Sharma to Williamson, FOUR, we have seen brute power from gayle earlier but this is total touch play from Williamson. It was a good length delivery outside off, Williamson gets in a good position and drives it on the up, ball beats the mid-off fielder for a four
Mohit Sharma to Saha, FOUR, picks up the slower ball early but doesn't time it as well as he would have liked, but he gets enough bat onto it to get a four to fine leg

Mohit Sharma to Manish Pandey, FOUR, 50-run stand up. Goes for the yorker but he's bowled a nice little full toss here -- something that Manish Pandey uses to hit his first boundary. Scythed round the corner, that full toss
Mohit Sharma to Manish Pandey, FOUR, room offered outside off and Manish Pandey's sliced it without fuss to the third man boundary. That will do
Andrew Tye to Williamson, FOUR, 129ks on a back of a length, and veering down, there's only one way the ball's going. To the boundary. Pulled behind square
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, FOUR, deftly played. Googly but it's wide, and Manish Pandey waits and glides it just wide of the keeper
Barinder to Shakib, no ball, FOUR, that's above the waist, and hence a no-ball. Shakib nicely arches away before realizing that he can get some bat on this. Glides it uppishly through third man

Mohit Sharma to Y Pathan, FOUR, Ashwin mistimes the jump and ball goes over him at mid-off for a four. It was fuller length ball at the stumps, Pathan lofts it over mid-off, just gets enough blade on the ball to clear mid-off
Andrew Tye to Y Pathan, FOUR, slower delivery at the stumps, it was fuller in length and Pathan picks up the slower ball early. He gets in a good position and hits it over mid-wicket for a four
Mohit Sharma to Y Pathan, FOUR, no one moved on that ball. It was a good length delivery outside off, Pathan swats it wide of the mid-off fielder for a four. Power and placement from Pathan

Ashwin to Williamson, FOUR, gorgeous shot! Pure class from Williamson. It was a leg-spinner from Ashwin, Williamson comes down the track and lofts it with the turn over cover for a four. One of the toughest shots to play but he reached the pitch of the ball and made it easier for himself
Binny to Watson, FOUR, he won't miss out on that, will Watson! Waits for the slower delivery, rocks back and pumps it right over the bowler's head to get off the mark in style

Binny to Watson, FOUR, that's bread and butter for Watto. Back of a length delivery outside off, Watson camps back, transfers his weight on the back foot and crunches this through the gap at covers, no fielder moved there

Binny to Rayudu, FOUR, who would want to be a bowler in this format? Dropped catch just on the previous ball and this one has been belted away. Full in length outside off, Rayudu advances down the wicket and smokes it over cover for a boundary

Unadkat to Raina, FOUR, these runs are hurting Royals, really bad. Both batsmen are looking unstoppable. Shortish delivery on leg, Raina swivels his pull past the fielder at short fine and ends the over with a boundary again. How often has that happened tonight!

Laughlin to Raina, FOUR, the boundaries continue to flow.. Room to leg and that opens up the off-side field nicely for him, even though it is back of a length, Raina thumps it on the up over extra cover. No chance for the sweeper

Shreyas Gopal to Raina, FOUR, streaky! But that's how Raina plays. No half measures. Darted in outside off and Raina threw his bat at that, sliced the drive over backward point and started another over with a boundary

Shreyas Gopal to Raina, FOUR, fabulous shot! It was the wrong 'un and Raina picked it right out of the hand. Got into position to play the inside out shot and struck it handsomely over extra cover. The timing was exquisite

Binny to Watson, FOUR, easy pickings! Back of a length on middle and leg, Watson waits and gently tickles it fine, the man is inside the ring at 45 and it was well wide of him, raced across the lightning outfield

Binny to Watson, FOUR, consecutive boundaries and this was not a poor delivery. Fab shot from Watto. Spotted third man inside the ring, waited for the back of a length delivery on off and dabbed it past a diving backward point, the quick outfield takes care of the rest

Binny to Watson, FOUR, third boundary of the over. Binny is going for plenty. Short delivery and at 132 clicks it is not going to trouble Watson, who pulls it along the ground in front of square, the placement was perfect
Binny to Dhoni, FOUR, 19 runs off the over. Raina's wicket has done nothing to slow down the scoring rate. Off-cutter on a length, Dhoni just guides it past backward point and short third man

Unadkat to Watson, FOUR, edged and four! Not where he intended, but when luck is on your side, everything goes your way. Unadkat comes round the wicket and cramps Watson for room, he attempts a cut shot and the outside edge runs away to the right of Buttler

Laughlin to Watson, FOUR, Watson needs to keep going for CSK. The runs have dried up a bit in the last few overs. Trifle short and outside off and Watson waits before playing the cut shot past the diving backward point fielder

Laughlin to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, delicate! Slower back of a length delivery, Bravo walked across his stumps to get inside the line and then glances it off the hips past the short fine fielder, just a roll of the wrists to pocket a boundary

Unadkat to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, offers room on this slower delivery and Bravo is quick to capitalize, he waits before unleashing the cut shot over backward point, no one in the deep to stop that. Much needed boundary for Bravo

Stokes to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, one-handed pull from Bravo. He was deceived by the slower delivery and the bottom hand comes off the bat handle, but the placement is behind square and a desperate dive from Klaasen is not enough to stop the boundary

Stokes to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, ends the over well. Made room while dancing down, the width on offer made him free his arms and send the ball sailing over the extra cover fielder. Rocketed away to the fence
Stokes to Rayudu, FOUR, boundaries continue to flow. Short and slow on middle and leg, Rayudu swivels and pulls it past the fielder at short fine leg, does well to get it past him

Stokes to Watson, FOUR, all bowlers are proving to be expensive. CSK openers are making the most of the powerplay. Again this was a gift of a delivery. Fullish and on the pads as Watson flicks it nonchalantly away to the fine leg region
Stokes to Raina, FOUR, typical Raina there. Full length delivery around off, gets down on his knee and sweetly times his inside out shot over covers, looked pleasing to the eye that shot
Stokes to Raina, FOUR, short one on the thigh and Raina drags it down to the fine leg fence. Stokes has struggled with his lines so far. Bowled a few looseners in his first over too

Stokes to Raina, FOUR, commits the same mistake again. Fires in a low full toss on the pads and Raina makes sure to get some bat on that. Tickles it away to the fine leg fence and gets four more, that's the third boundary of the over

Stokes to Raina, FOUR, brilliant! That's Raina's experience for you. This was a length delivery angled away from him and Raina played it late in order to guide it down to third man, the fielder was too square to cut it off. 16 runs of the over, all in boundaries!
Gowtham to Watson, FOUR, there's no stopping him tonight. This is short again outside off, Watson goes back in his crease and slams it through the gap at covers
Unadkat to Raina, FOUR, that's the second 50-run partnership of the match. Short and wide outside off, Raina beautifully cuts it over point and adds four to his tally

Chahar to Rahane, FOUR, edged and four. 14 off the opening over. Streaky, but Rahane wouldn't mind much. The ball came in with the angle and Rahane got an inside edge on his push, runs away to the fine leg fence

SN Thakur to Klaasen, FOUR, through the gates! That won't please the bowler, nor the captain. A fullish ball on middle and leg, Klaasen flicks it superbly, but was straight to the man at mid-wicket. Karn Sharma there allows it to go through his legs. First boundary in IPL for Klaasen

Tahir to Stokes, FOUR, drilled straight back, goes right through Tahir and then sneaks through Rayudu as well. Clumsy sliding effort at long-on there, but considering his bruised knee, we'll cut him some slack
Dwayne Bravo to Binny, FOUR, he's somehow glanced this yorker into the fine leg boundary. Really well done from Binny. The line - which was on leg-stump - helped his cause
SN Thakur to Unadkat, FOUR, oh shot. Nailed this pull shot through mid-wicket. Solid response after the previous ball
Karn Sharma to Unadkat, FOUR, the width on this delivery spelled it out for Unadkat's inside-out loft. He frees his arms to cream it wide of long-off
Karn Sharma to Unadkat, FOUR, quickly onto the back knee to swat this leg-break through mid-wicket. Plenty of muscle from Unadkat as he swishes it to the boundary
Tahir to Buttler, FOUR, hit hard! Buttler uses his feet to good effect. Dances down the ground to convert it into a half-volley and drills it down the ground. Long-on had no chance to mop that up

Watson to Stokes, FOUR, poor delivery and that's been put away. First boundary for Stokes! With fine leg inside the circle, he bowls a short ball down the leg-side. Stokes gets a glove on the pull and the ball goes fine of the fielder at 45
Tahir to Stokes, FOUR, cracking shot! Stokes backed away even before the ball was delivered and that allowed him to free his arms. It was darted outside off and Stokes crashed it through extra cover
Mujeeb to Chris Lynn, FOUR, loosener from Rahman and Lynn puts it away with ease. Stand and deliver stuff. Short, wide and outside off, Lynn says thank you very much and bashes it through cover

Ashwin to Karthik, FOUR, nicely played by DK, this was flighted well outside off, Karthik went down low, rolled his wrists over and slog sweeps it past mid-wicket, beats the fielder getting across from deep mid-wicket

Ashwin to Karthik, FOUR, lovely, has to be the shot of the day so far. Even Ashwin looks perplexed, this was tossed up nicely outside off, Karthik leant forward, played with the turn and drove it wide of mid-wicket, split the two men in the deep to perfection
Yuvraj to Karthik, FOUR, cheeky and four, slower and wider of off, Karthik waits on it, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and runs it past short third man, no need to run for those
Yuvraj to Chris Lynn, FOUR, that's powerfully struck! Yuvraj dropped this one short and just outside off, Lynn backs away and bludgeons past the bowler, the fielder at long-off had no chance
Andrew Tye to Chris Lynn, FOUR, cracking shot, Tye is running out of ideas, back of a length and well wide of off, Lynn gets on top of the bounce and clatters it over cover-point

Mujeeb to Karthik, FOUR, the boundaries are flowing for KKR, fraction short and sliding down the leg-side, Karthik went half-way down and pulled it behind square on the on-side, the man in the deep was square and has no chance

Ashwin to Chris Lynn, FOUR, dropped short and wide of off, Lynn makes room and cuts it square past point. Sran has a lot of distance to cover, he slides and pulls the ball back in. The third umpire has several looks and reckons that his boot was touching the ropes as he pushed it back into play, given as a boundary

Barinder to A Russell, FOUR, easy pickings for Russell, Barinder misses the yorker by an inch, turns out to be a swinging full-toss, Russell cleared his left leg, got his bat down and punched it back past the non-striker

Barinder to A Russell, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Russell, the slower short ball from Sran, but it was short and way down the leg-side, Russell swivels across and pulls it over backward square leg, couple of bounces and over the ropes
Barinder to Shubman Gill, FOUR, cracking shot, short and wide of off, Gill gets on top of the bounce and cuts it square past point, beat the diving fielder and raced away to the fence in a hurry
Rajpoot to Karthik, FOUR, that's a poor start from Rajpoot, short and wide of off, Karthik waited on that, played with an open face and beat Mujeeb's dive at short third man
Rajpoot to Karthik, FOUR, cheeky and four, this is excellent cricket from Karthik, fraction too short and wide of off, Karthik waits on it, opens the face of the bat and runs it past the keeper

Rajpoot to Shubman Gill, FOUR, beautifully played, too much of width on offer and Gill doesn't let it go. Prods across and crashes it square past cover, the man in the deep has no chance. 17 runs from the over, a terrible one from Rajpoot

Rajpoot to Uthappa, FOUR, edged but just eludes Gayle's outstretched right-hand. Rajpoot gains trampoline bounce outside off with this back of a length delivery, Uthappa pokes with hard hands and outside-edges it towards Gayle, who was at a widish slip. Gingerly stretched his right hand but it escaped away to the fence

Mujeeb to Uthappa, FOUR, adventure from Uthappa. Deals another flatter ball by bringing out the reverse sweep. Picked the length early and broomed it away to the third man fence. Key was he rolled his wrists there

Mujeeb to Uthappa, FOUR, two fours in a row for Uthappa. Sliding down leg as Rahman corrects his line. Uthappa drags the sweep, more of the bottom. But it beats short fine leg and races away to the fence

Mujeeb to Uthappa, FOUR, this was more streaky and Uthappa won't mind. Hat-trick of fours. Quick and skidded through, Uthappa was stuck on the back foot, looked to work it to the leg-side. Ends up squirting it more off the inner half and it eludes short fine leg, who's chase is vain in the end

Barinder to Chris Lynn, FOUR, the slower version of Sran's slower ball, Lynn didn't read it as he was early into the shot. But got it off the meat as he went for the pull and sent it behind square on the leg-side. No-one there and he'll collect a boundary

Andrew Tye to Uthappa, FOUR, this was out of the top draw. The slower delivery from Tye, on a short of length around middle and leg. Knuckle ball to be precise. Uthappa picked it early, with a roundhouse and helped it over short fine leg. Easy-peasy

Barinder to Chris Lynn, FOUR, brute force from Lynn. Such quicksilver hands. Was a decent delivery as Sran saw Lynn back away to leg and fired it wider of off. But the Australian threw the kitchen sink and managed to stroke it over extra cover

Shivam Mavi to Rahul, FOUR, oh almost chopped on and what a good first ball that was Shivam Mavi the young Shivam Mavi. Pacy, good length, seam pretty straight and just tailing back in and it seriously tests Rahul. He wanted to go for the drive, the feet weren't fully forward, lucky that the edge escaped past the off stick. Troubled by the movement in to him on that occasion

Shivam Mavi to Rahul, FOUR, now that's brilliant placement from Rahul. Third man up, so Rahul uses the width on offer on this good length delivery, allows the ball to come and guides it to the left of backward point and it came from the middle of the bat as well

A Russell to Rahul, FOUR, this is the thing about classy batsmen. They have this silken touch. Rahul hardly had a real go at this length delivery, just came forward and went through with an extended forward push, but found the middle of the bat or close to it and got it wide of the man at cover

A Russell to Rahul, FOUR, this is unfair on the bowler. He's actually surprised Rahul with extra bounce on this short of length delivery, but Rahul managed to play with an angled bat at the last moment, third man was inside the ring again and there was no protection in the deep

A Russell to Gayle, FOUR, Dre Russ vs Gayle and Gayle hits a four first ball. Russell missed the yorker there, bowled a juicy full ball and Gayle just placed the square-drive to the left of point, didn't try to hit that hard and this outfield is quick enough

Shivam Mavi to Gayle, FOUR, a boundary but this was hardly middled by Gayle. The bowler actually won a mini battle there, tried the outswinger, but that didn't swing much, the angle away troubled Gayle, who wanted to smash this over long-off, the ball hits the outside half of the bat and flies over cover-point

Shivam Mavi to Gayle, FOUR, that's sloppy from Narine, should have been stopped. Again Gayle fails to time the ball, this was a good length delivery that rushed, the ball took the inside edge of the bat and escaped wide of mid-wicket

A Russell to Gayle, FOUR, look at the frustration on Russell's face. He thought of outsmarting Gayle by taking pace off the ball, but Gayle cleverly delayed the shot. He moved leg-side early, but held the pose for a bit and then cut it between point and cover-point. Expertly done

Narine to Gayle, FOUR, that's the over spoiled, tried the offie again but sprayed it down the leg-side, fine leg was inside the ring and Gayle happily helps it on its way over short fine leg. Gee he's looking ominous

Chawla to Rahul, FOUR, hey Sunil! Gotta move buddy! Rahul went back and pulled this short ball fine, Narine was at short fine leg, he hardly moved, should have tried at least, instead he put his arm out to the man in the deep, who clearly had no chance

Chawla to Rahul, FOUR, this guy is striking them at 264 and bits but doesn't play rash shots. That's the feature of his batting. Spots the field, fine leg is inside, so he allows the ball to come, the line was down the leg-side and he just helped it away fine past the keeper

Kuldeep Yadav to Rahul, FOUR, absolutely no mercy from Rahul. Well, a rank long hop doesn't deserve respect anyway. Rahul quickly rocks back and pulls powerfully, splits long-on and deep mid-wicket quite easily

Narine to Rahul, FOUR, Rahul wants to finish this off early. Bravely races down the pitch and forces Narine to shorten the length, it was well outside off stump, but Rahul reached out and cut it away past cover
Narine to Rahul, FOUR, cut away fiercely past point and a big roar from the crowd! Who are they supporting? Quicker delivery outside off stump, Rahul goes back and cuts really hard

Woakes to Pant, FOUR, that four evens out the over. Once more Woakes goes for the fuller length and with mid-off inside the ring he was taking a risk, Pant hammers the drive straight of mid-off and collects the boundary

Siraj to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, top shot! Full delivery at 146kph, but Iyer had made some room to open up the off-side field, lofts it without much footwork over extra cover and pocketed a much needed boundary

Woakes to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, edged and four. Third man is square and Tewatia got it fine enough to beat him. Just a good length delivery angled across the left-hander, Tewatia went hard on the drive and the outside edge went away quickly to the fence

Woakes to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, just over. A mistimed shot that clears the backtracking mid-off fielder. Slanted across off, Tewatia made a bit of room and sliced the drive over Siraj, who put in a desperate dive and still couldn't get there

Woakes to Pant, FOUR, fifty for Pant. Mighty fine innings from the youngster. But with three overs to go he needs to keep going. Short of length delivery and Pant was early into his swivel-pull, off the toe-end and past the man at 45

Woakes to Pant, leg byes, FOUR, does not matter how they come as long as the runs keep coming for DD. The back of a length delivery on middle and leg, Pant swivels to play the pull, misses and the ball lobs off thigh pad over de Kock

Woakes to Pant, FOUR, geez! AB would be proud of that shot. The reverse scoop. Yes, he has played a reverse scoop off a fast bowler. Woakes went full and wide outside off, Pant kept his balance and spooned it over short third man. Even Kohli seemed impressed with that shot

Woakes to Pant, FOUR, another costly death over for RCB, 18 off it. The off-pace short of length delivery, Pant spotted it early, shuffled across to get inside the line and pulled it over short fine, once it cleared the fielder there was no stopping that

Corey Anderson to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, premeditation from Tewatia. Walked across his stumps even before Anderson bowled the ball, it was outside off and he still managed to lap it over short fine. Umesh gives chase and can only escort it to the fence
U Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, first one of the night! Short one on middle and leg, Iyer drags it away to deep square leg to score the first boundary of the match
U Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, back of a length well outside off, Iyer reaches for it and slams it through the gap at covers, that's his second boundary, and Delhi's second boundary too

Chahal to Pant, FOUR, slammed away! Rishabh Pant announces his arrival at the crease in style. Picks the length early, camps back and punches it firmly through the gap at cover to get off the mark with a boundary

Washington Sundar to Pant, FOUR, reverse swept! Flighted one around off, Pant goes down on his knee and reverse sweeps it past the man at backward point to score a boundary, did well to connect his shot and past the fielder

U Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, width on offer and that's been put away. Short and wide outside off, Iyer goes back in the crease and cuts it nicely through point. Sweeper cover sprints across in order to save it but fails in his quest

Boult to de Kock, FOUR, that's sweet from de Kock. Exquisite timing. Good length ball curling away from off, de Kock caresses it on the up through the covers. Just had to find the gap there, races away on this outfield
Harshal Patel to de Villiers, FOUR, 137kph on the pads. And it doesn't even pitch. Oh my. de Villiers's swipes, heaving it into square leg, flat

Harshal Patel to de Villiers, FOUR, gets well across, wanting to go over mid-wicket. And typically changes his mind, like only he can. Ruins a wide yorker, slicing it through extra cover all of a sudden. Just sublime. And yes, a fifty .. he's killing the contest
Chris Morris to de Villiers, FOUR, the carnage. Morris loses it down leg, the last hit has mentally scarred him. And is mowed away, fine

Chris Morris to Mandeep, FOUR, blame Mandeep for stealing AB's century. A fullish length and he throws every ounce of his muscle to cart it straight down. Roy chases, dives, and has probably cut himself on the rope. Yeah, none of it could stop the boundary though
Boult to de Villiers, FOUR, beautifully played, fraction short and just outside off, AB arches back and then ramps over third man, couple of bounces and over the ropes
Boult to de Villiers, FOUR, it's it. Lays into a half volley, screeching it through the covers, beating the leather off it. And RCB begin their move up

Nadeem to Kohli, FOUR, massive moment in the game. Tentative defence from Kohli, the ball turns away from him to take the edge which goes between keeper and slip. Was Morris standing too wide? He barely had time to move before it went through. Nadeem doesn't know what to do
Nadeem to de Villiers, FOUR, there he goes. De Villiers is underway. Walks across the stumps, gets down low and wallops the sweep through square leg

Nadeem to de Villiers, FOUR, now clears his front leg and lofts it inside-out over the covers. The off-side field is up and Nadeem has bowled to his field by drifting it in on middle, but AB is just too good
Nadeem to de Villiers, FOUR, swept away for four. De Villiers has started off brilliantly. Nadeem lands it on a length for him and is dispatched

Nadeem to de Villiers, FOUR, my word, how's this gone for four! Crazy. Unbelievable power with the bottom hand. He seemed to be cramped on the back foot but is somehow able to whip it between long-on and deep mid-wicket

Nadeem to de Villiers, FOUR, hat-trick of fours! Nadeem is clueless against AB at the moment. He tosses this up wide - the best thing he can think off - but AB still walks across and powers the sweep through square leg. Crowd going wild
Chris Morris to Kohli, FOUR, now Kohli joins in the fun. Not great from Morris actually. Can't feed him on the pads with a length ball, gets flicked away in a flash to the boundary

Bhuvneshwar to Raina, FOUR, beautifully played, will this help Raina break the shackles? Comes down the track, makes room as he did so and goes inside out over cover, one bounce and over the ropes. 13 came from the over

Deepak Hooda to Rayudu, FOUR, CSK gaining some momentum and it is the local boy - Rayudu who is leading the charge, flighted delivery around off, Rayudu reverse sweeps it backward of point and starts the over with a boundary

Shakib to Rayudu, FOUR, smashed! Flighted delivery and the idea from Shakib was to land it full enough to the blockhole, Rayudu had made room and that allowed him to open up his arms and strike it inside out over extra cover, no chance for the sweeper to stop that

Stanlake to Rayudu, FOUR, cracking shot! Once again the shuffle across aiding him. It is Stanlake's favourite length but he offers width on this occasion, Rayudu capitalizes and unleashes a powerful cut shot behind point, raced away to the fence

Stanlake to Rayudu, FOUR, edged and four. That is what pace does. Short and outside off, Rayudu made room this time and threw this kitchen sink at it, the thickish outside edge runs away fine beating the fielder in the deep

Stanlake to Rayudu, FOUR, massive over for CSK, 19 runs off it. It is another edge and another boundary for Rayudu. He runs down the wicket and looks to force the back of a length delivery through the off-side, the outside edge runs away quickly to the third man fence

Shakib to Rayudu, FOUR, now he is playing with the field. Walked across his stumps to the flighted delivery, sat down and broomed it backward of square leg, struck it fine enough to beat the man in the deep

Rashid Khan to Rayudu, FOUR, wrong 'un is dragged down and Rayudu was waiting for it in the crease, cleared his front leg and pulled it in front of square, bisecting the two fielders in the deep comfortably

Rashid Khan to Raina, FOUR, Raina does not want to be left out. He hangs back to this wrong 'un and since the ball is turning it away, it offers him the room to slap it past the diving extra cover fielder. Long-off can only pick the ball up from the fence

S Kaul to Rayudu, FOUR, wow! We saw Rishabh Pant play the reverse paddle yesterday, today it is Rayudu. This is more deft than Pant's powerful strike. Knuckle ball and Rayudu just bent down, reverse lapped it fine to the third man fence

Rashid Khan to Dhoni, FOUR, almost cleaned up Raina at the other end. The leg-break is right in the slot for him, small step forward and murders the ball straight back, Raina was ducking for cover and the fielder at long-on didn't even try to chase that

Rashid Khan to Raina, FOUR, poor bowling from Rashid. Very rarely does that happen. But he has had two off days back to back. Went for 55 against KXIP and today ends with 1/49. Short and down leg, all Raina had to do was help it past the fielder at short fine, he does so with utter ease

S Kaul to Dhoni, FOUR, top-edge and four. Not where he intended but Dhoni starts the over with a boundary. He was rushed by a short delivery and the pull is late, the edge goes away fine and he asks the umpire whether it is one for the over, the square leg umpire nods in approval

S Kaul to Raina, FOUR, fifty for Raina. A very unlike Raina innings. He bided his time before he got going. Now is well set to take CSK past the 180-mark. The knuckle ball with width on offer, Raina just laces the cut square on the off-side. The sweeper is straighter than usual and he doesn't get there in time

S Kaul to Dhoni, FOUR, Kaul has his hands on his hip. Not much he can do there. Just the class of Dhoni. A low full toss outside off, Dhoni opens the bat face and carves it past the diving short third man fielder

Stanlake to Raina, FOUR, risky but four, Raina backed away a long way, Stanlake followed him with a full ball, but Raina has enough room to free his arms and drives it square behind point, beats third man getting across for his first boundary

S Kaul to du Plessis, FOUR, on a length and well outside off, du Plessis comes down the track, doesn't get anywhere close to the pitch - but has enough to clear cover with the lofted drive, the timing wasn't great, but the ball has enough to beat the chasing pack

Rashid Khan to Rayudu, FOUR, that's brave from Rayudu, but he knew what he was doing, fetches this well tossed up delivery from well and slogs it over mid-wicket, there's no one in the deep and Rayudu gets going with a boundary

SN Thakur to Williamson, FOUR, first boundary of the innings! Williamson makes the most of the provided width. It's a short of a length delivery outside off, Williamson reaches for it and slams it through the gap at cover-point to gather his first boundary of the innings

Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, FOUR, very wide on the crease goes Bravo, but he loses his line. He strays this short of length delivery right into Pathan's chest. There's no fine leg in place, or if there is, it's not fine. Pathan helps this pull into the ropes
Dwayne Bravo to Rashid Khan, FOUR, they're still in this. Quite unbelievable. Full length ball outside off, Rashid swings for the rafters and sends a thick edge flying past short third man

SN Thakur to Williamson, FOUR, classic shot by Kane. Another short delivery well outside off, looking the class of Williamson he won't miss out. Plays a perfect square cut and pierces the gap at cover-point to end the over
SN Thakur to Williamson, FOUR, pulled away! Short of a length around off, Williamson camps back and pulls it nicely through the gap at mid-wicket, was timed sweetly by the skipper

SN Thakur to Williamson, FOUR, boundary to end the over. Just the over Sunrisers were looking for. Thakur drops it short again and has to pay the price for it as Williamson rocks back in order to pull it over mid-wicket, yet again...

Watson to Shakib, FOUR, off the mark with a boundary. That's not enough though. Needs a few more of them and get going. Picks the length early on this short one and pulls it in front of deep square leg who's too square in order to cut it off

Chahar to Shakib, FOUR, he's bowled 17 dot balls so it's okay if he concedes a boundary or two. Has been an excellent spell by Chahar this. Short of a length around off, Shakib jumps in his crease and cuts it away to the third man fence, beat the man in the deep quite comfortably
Jadeja to Williamson, FOUR, fine square cut by Williamson again. Was short and wide outside off and the Sunrisers skipper did well to time his cut as he beat sweeper cover with ease

Stokes to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, he's been superb with the pick-up shots today. Anything on the pads, SKY has dispatched it disdainfully. Here's another instance. Full down leg, Suryakumar gets across and whips it cleanly behind square. In the gap and zooms away to the fence

Gowtham to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, Yadav shows off his cheekiness. Manufactured room out of nowhere. Pushed through quicker outside off, Suryakumar went deep and sliced it in the gap between short third man and backward point. Threaded the gap beautifully

Jofra Archer to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, wonderful from Kishan. "Such a dynamic player he is" is the comment from Isa Guha on air. Greets Archer to the crease by chipping down the track, takes it on the full and lofted it with a clean swing of the arms over mid-off

Unadkat to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, more clumsy effort from RR in the field. Gopal, the guilty culprit this time, who lets it through. Kishan moved across on this occasion and helped this short of length delivery to short fine leg. Gopal was lazy to bend low and didn't get his body behind the line of the ball. Sneaked through his legs and off to the fence

Unadkat to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, excellent from the senior Pandya. How late he played that? Didn't have any room there at all to free his arms. So, he stayed back, opened his bat face and glided it in the gap between short third man and backward point

Jofra Archer to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, ouch. Take cover Rod Tucker, Hardik knocked off his head nearly. Very full on off, the slower ball at 123.1 kph, Hardik gets under it and hammered it straight down the ground ferociously. Tucker take evasive action and is on the floor
Stokes to Pollard, FOUR, Stokes is not happy with the effort by Gowtham. Should've stopped definitely. Pollard whacked it wide of long-on, Gowtham gets across, puts in the dive but doesn't stop it

Jofra Archer to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, 144.5kph, that's nicely picked away off the hips by Suryakumar Yadav. Another pacy short of length delivery, actually on the stumps, but Suryakumar got inside the line and helped it away past the man at 45

D Kulkarni to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, looked like it was going to either short third man or backward point for a moment, but Ishan Kishan has managed to split them with this uppish cut. Poor delivery from Kulkarni, gave too much width. Mumbai have picked up pace

Unadkat to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, massive space for sale beyond mid-wicket and Suryakumar Yadav, who is not afraid to walk across the stumps, meets this length ball with a flick to the right of mid-wicket and greets Unadkat with a boundary first up

Gowtham to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, this time he connects with the sweep, he actually played this with one hand. This line is a little more straighter than the previos one, Suryakumar hits the big gap at deep backward square leg

Shreyas Gopal to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, Archer dives but fails to stop the ball at deep mid-wicket. Short delivery on the stumps, Suryakumar pulls, deep mid-wicket runs to his left, actually got there but made a mess of it
Shreyas Gopal to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, Ishan knows he's going to bowl short, it's down the leg side and he helps himself to a boundary with a pull shot behind square on the on-side
McClenaghan to R Tripathi, FOUR, there's a short fine leg in place but this leg-stump delivery deserves nothing less than a boundary. Tripathi crouches and glances it wide of the fielder at 45

McClenaghan to Stokes, FOUR, now the overcook. McClenaghan tries sneaking in a quiet one, wide, full. Can't. Stokes' up there smart, reaching out and drilling it through extra cover. Here's the move on .. 16 runs in it
Mustafizur to Stokes, FOUR, sits up perfectly. Stokes up there tall, already given himself loads of room and carts it over the covers. Nothing streaky here

Hardik Pandya to Samson, FOUR, latches on. It's that sitting up length, and Samson goes flat-batted, riding the bounce and timing the leather off it through cow corner, splitting the two men converging. In the hope of converging

Mustafizur to Gowtham, FOUR, edge. And the Royals have a massive edge of life. 15 off this one and all of a sudden there's oxygen still there in this one. A low full toss, across Gowtham, who throws his bat out in an attempt to slice. He'll make his peace with the edge, running past the keeper

Bumrah to Jofra Archer, FOUR, very, very Caribbean. Okay former Caribbean. Archer transfer back, lets the ball get on par and waits on his drive, opening it to pierce the gap behind point. And that gap is huge
Bumrah to Gowtham, FOUR, utter disdain. Take that .. width, pace and it is back in that point zone. Thumped hard. How things turn

Bumrah to Gowtham, FOUR, goes pulling. And goes into the gap. Doesn't get enough meat, and thank heavens for that. It goes a lot finer, beating square leg in the ring. It's 10 off the final over. And you thought this was over, twice
Hardik Pandya to Gowtham, FOUR, top thinking. He's spotted third man inside the ring, and ramps his bat out to shove it over. Wrong line, wrong length

Krunal Pandya to Samson, FOUR, now what do I call that.. Will be an outside edge to the naive but this has been cleverly played late and just wide of the keeper. Bat face opens at the last minute and Krunal Pandya's grounded. Sort of. We'll see

Mustafizur to Samson, FOUR, full and wide, and the long-limbed Samson is not going to miss out. Reaches out, with footwork into a snooze, but who cares. It's all hands. Creams the drive through covers. Bullets it. Surgeons it. Whatever. It's Samson, okay? We're allowed to drool this season

Krunal Pandya to Rahane, FOUR, proper Rahane. Early to load onto the front foot and then drills it away through covers. Nothing Krunal Pandya could have done, except maybe pitching it a bit shorter. But then Rahane might have come up with something else

McClenaghan to Samson, FOUR, that's why you can't not like him. McClenaghan strategy is pretty obvious: Bowl it slow and angle it across, because there's third man and backward point waiting to cut the runs off. And Samson here has found the tiniest of gaps between the fielders. Beautifully done, opening the bat face just enough to cleave the fielders
Markande to Stokes, FOUR, this spins more, so this is the googly from back fo the hand. Stokes gets into a shape to sweep nicely and brooms it away through mid-wicket

Rajpoot to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, pumped over mid-off for first IPL runs. It wasn't as close as you want to hear it was. Chipped the loft over Ashwin, who's tall enough. Good use of the length ball and the slight width that Prithvi Shaw used to use his arms into effect
Barinder to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, throws his hands at this wide ball that's been angled across by Barinder from over the wicket. And gets away. Backspins and beats the keeper to his left

Barinder to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, wow, get the thesaurus out. That's been cracked away with utter disdain. Short and wide yeah, but look at the sound the bat makes. Pinches the slightest gap at point and lasers it away

Barinder to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, that's a bit ambitious.. and he's gotten some lucky runs here. Stays back and wants a stylish and uppish back foot punch through covers. Not in control of the bounce and the outside edge flies over the lone slipper in place

Ashwin to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, off-spin was working alright against Shreyas Iyer in the previous over for Ashwin and he gets whacked trying to bowl leg-spin. Short and wide, Shreyas absolutely nails it off the back foot wide of cover
Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, overpitched and Shreyas drills it straight down the ground between the sticks and the non-striker, long-on and long-off had no chance

Barinder to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, what a timely hit! He's moved across the stumps, got down on his knees and paddled the fast bowler around the corner through backward square leg. Brave hit! Barinder missed the yorker again and offered a full ball on the stumps

Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, inside edgeeee and it's past the dive at short fine leg. Lucky boundary and it's down to 5 runs off the last ball. Shreyas races down the pitch and slogs, gets a thick edge

Rajpoot to Maxwell, FOUR, timing isn't something Maxwell has made a name out of, but if these continue, we'll need a rethink. Archaism, I tell you. Gets a delivery on the pads and times the hell out of it through mid-wicket
Rajpoot to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, short ball sitting up, and Shreyas Iyer pulls it with authority through deep mid-wicket

Rajpoot to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, beautifully sliced wide of backward point's leap and that's been let through by Mujeeb, who's running across from third man. Covers the ground, slides but can't stop the ball. Was almost in control but then wasn't
Avesh Khan to Nair, FOUR, inside-out. That's some welcome. A wobbly seam off a length, looking to follow Nair as he backs away. But he goes uppish, lofting up a drive over extra cover

Avesh Khan to Yuvraj, FOUR, 141kph. And an inside edge allows Yuvraj the move on. He tries going against the line, pulling, without judging the length not being short enough .. inside half, and Pant diving behind deflects it into fine leg

Mishra to Nair, FOUR, another one in anger. Oh Mishra, typically after a catch being put down takes his frustration out by going fast, on the pads and Nair cashes in with a sweep, drilling it perfectly to split the two fielders behind square

Christian to Miller, FOUR, to third man, splits the slips. One slower ball too many, Miller's already standing exposing his stumps, swings in desperation and the fat edge is enough to run through the cordon. Who'll plug these in the 18th over ..
