Christian to Andrew Tye, leg byes, FOUR, slower in on the pads. Tye can't connect, flicking well before it gets there, rebounds and runs very fine, under Pant's late dive

Avesh Khan to Rahul, FOUR, streaky runs! Terrific end to what has been a sensational over from Avesh. On a good length just outside off, 143.7kph and Rahul was late on the forward push. Got a thick inside edge that just flew past leg stump and with fine leg really square, bonus runs for KXIP
Boult to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, crashed away! Short of a length angling across Mayank, a bit of width and he stands tall to flay the cut through point. Cracking stroke!

Boult to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, delicious, absolutely delicious stroke! More width and the length is shorter as well, Mayank doesn't go hard at it, instead relies purely on timing and boy, didn't he time this or what? Stays back and guides it past the left of the backward point fielder and it raced away. Third man had no chance at all

Boult to Rahul, FOUR, would have been a wide if Rahul left this but he chooses to go after it. Didn't time it well enough, still clears the infield on the off-side comfortably. Shorter length slower ball that was lifted over cover

Avesh Khan to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, kabooom! Mayank is off the blocks in a flash once more. Short of a length outside off, he just backs away a bit and hammers it on the up through the covers. Found the gap well and nobody really budged

Plunkett to Rahul, FOUR, up and over! Cannot bowl this length in the Powerplay, not on a true surface like this one. Half-volley and Rahul lifts it straight over the bowler's head. Perhaps not middled as much as he would have liked but still got enough on it

Avesh Khan to Nair, FOUR, glorious! Top quality stuff from Nair! Half volley from Avesh but look at the execution. Textbook front foot cover drive on the up. Brilliantly timed and picked the gap as well

Christian to Nair, FOUR, smart from Christian but Karun is smarter. Slower and short outside off, probably foxed the batsman initially but he adjusted well in the end. Stood tall and waited before guiding it past short third man. Mishra was probably a bit slow as well to come down on the slide and Christian clearly wasn't happy with the effort
Nabi to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, poor delivery to start off. Short and wide outside off, Suryakumar Yadav reaches for it and punches it firmly through the gap at cover
Rashid Khan to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, short and wide, Krunal takes full toll of it, rocks back and nails the cut behind square
S Kaul to Bumrah, FOUR, angled in, all Bumrah needed to do was help the ball finds its direction, he swivels and manages decent contact on the pull to slam the ball backwards of square leg

Sandeep Sharma to Lewis, FOUR, timed to perfection that was. Short of a length delivery angled away with a bit of away swing too, Lewis sits back in his crease and punches it through the gap at cover. Was in the air for a while but the placement was pretty good

Nabi to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, shot, good shot! Picks the length early on that. Was a shortish delivery outside off, Suryakumar doesn't miss out on it and slaps it towards mid-off. Thampi who's manning that position slips as the ball beats him and goes through. That won't please the bowler

Nabi to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, he's been playing so well since he has been promoted. This was played very late by Suryakumar. Was a quicker delivery outside off, he went back in his crease and guided it sweetly past the man at short third man. No chance of stopping that

Nabi to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for the opener. Picks the length early on the shortish delivery, rocks back and slams it into the gap at cover. Sweeper cover is too square to cut it off as the ball wins the race

S Kaul to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, beautiful. What a cracking cover-drive that was. Full length delivery around off, Pandya transfers his weight on his right knee and creams it through cover. Right into the gap and the fielders could do nothing but admire the timing and placement on it
S Kaul to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, good competition between bat and ball, this. Short of a length around off, Pandya does well to pummel it past the man at mid-on and get a four more

S Kaul to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, poor delivery to end the over. Tries for a yorker and ends up bowling a full toss. Pandya doesn't miss out on the gift and drills it past the diving Williamson to gather the third boundary of the over. Expensive over by Kaul and Mumbai fans get their voice back

Bumrah to Williamson, FOUR, magnificent shot. What a way to get off the mark. Wasn't a bad ball at all. On a back of a length and outside off, with extra bounce too, Williamson plays a top square cut, getting on top of the bounce and hitting the gap wide of cover-point

Bumrah to Williamson, FOUR, beauty! Williamson is in some form. Bumrah goes full and outside off, gets a hint of outswing too, Williamson though is almost on one knee as he bent forward and then opened the bat-face at the last moment to essay a square drive that left cover-point as a spectator. Not much Bumrah can do when he gets to see two world-class shots like that. Credit to Williamson

McClenaghan to Dhawan, FOUR, where's third man? No-one there. On a length and outside off, Dhawan throws the bat at that and the edge flies away to the unmanned third man fence, Dhawan gets a boundary to get himself going
Krunal Pandya to Y Pathan, FOUR, poor delivery and cut away. Short and wide outside off, Pathan had to miss backward point and he did that. Races away once it moved past that fielder

Bumrah to Manish Pandey, FOUR, a big confidence-booster for Manish Pandey. He wants runs and this is a fine shot. On the front foot and when he saw the back of a length delivery outside off, just knifed it on the rise. Through the vacant cover-point region for a boundary

McClenaghan to Manish Pandey, FOUR, when it is pitched up, Manish Pandey looks to go over the top. Has come out with an aggressive intent. This was full outside off, he lofted it cleanly and wide of mid-on

McClenaghan to Manish Pandey, FOUR, clean and over mid-off. The same delivery that got Saha, but Manish Pandey is in and seeing it well tonight by the looks of it. Goes over mid-off with a full bat-swing and clears the fielder comfortably

Hardik Pandya to Williamson, FOUR, Williamson gets lucky. Very lucky. A thick inside edge that on another day would've gone onto the stumps, misses them and runs away wide of short fine leg. The fielder didn't dive as well. Good length and on off, Williamson was late on the attempted dab

McClenaghan to Y Pathan, byes, FOUR, short, Pathan ducks under that and lets it go. Ishan Kishan is having a bad day in the office tonight. Leaps but can only parry it over and the ball runs away for four byes. Again off McClenaghan
Hardik Pandya to Williamson, FOUR, brilliant back-cut. As late as possible. Williamson cutting the ball behind him and the pace on the ball beats the chasing and diving McClenaghan. Top shot that one

Mustafizur to Williamson, FOUR, comical from KW. He hasn't realised that the ball has crossed the fence. Keeps running and then belatedly realises. But what a good pull shot that is. Rocketed off the bat, harmless short ball around waist height, Williamson murdered that and bisected the two men on the fence. Even a dive wasn't enough to stop the ball

Hardik Pandya to Nabi, FOUR, can't seem to string 6 good balls in an over. Overpitched and Nabi doesn't miss out. Gets forward and strokes it wide of cover. Sweeper had no chance at all. Right off the middle of the bat
Markande to Nabi, FOUR, too short and begging to be hit. Nabi rocks back and finds the gap between long-on and deep mid with a hard pull. Right into the gap

Markande to Y Pathan, FOUR, googly but wrongly directed, starts from middle and goes down, Pathan helps the sweep with one hand off the bat handle, good enough though to take the ball away from the man at deep backward square

Siraj to Dhoni, FOUR, finally, he guides this in the gap and that spoils a good over for Siraj. Bowled pretty well to be honest. Back of a length and outside off stump, Dhoni steers it between backward point and short third man

Corey Anderson to Rayudu, FOUR, now then, now then, you can't bowl way too short and slow either. No sweeper cover remember, only third man and deep cover, so Rayudu stands tall, delays the cut and hits it over the infield

Corey Anderson to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, that's the healthiest of edges you can get. Lucky runs. Precious runs for CSK. The yellow contingent believes. Ceee Esss Kayyy chants ringing in the ground. Shortish delivery outside off stump, Bravo slogs and gets a thick edge that flies over the leaping QdK

U Yadav to Raina, FOUR, that is an unbelievable shot. Especially if your name is Raina and you have a problem against the short ball. The world knows it. Yadav did nothing wrong there, followed the backing away Raina with a perfect short ball, but Raina turned on the style and forehanded like Rafa Nadal at Philippe Chatrier Roland Garros. So much topspin on the crosscourt and it swings and eludes wickedly past the great AB at mid-on. How he managed to get on top of the bounce and kept it down, only he will know
Siraj to Rayudu, FOUR, short and pulled away. Rayudu didn't hit it as well as he would've liked to, but gets a one bounce over the ropes four at deep square

Siraj to Raina, FOUR, another amazing shot by Raina. Siraj with the double-teapot pose, wondering what he has done wrong. Raina down the track, in a flash and even when there's no room on the back of a length delivery, whiplashes the slash, gets it through cover and extra-cover. Right into the gap. Top batting

Siraj to Rayudu, FOUR, belted straight down the ground. Rayudu knows what is coming from his Hyderabad teammate. Skips down and then brutalises the short of length delivery back over the bowler's head. Umpire was ducking for cover there
U Yadav to Billings, FOUR, now Billings flicks and gets four. Over mid-wicket and it races away. On the pads, Billings relies on timing and goes up and over

Chahal to Billings, FOUR, pre-meditated and four. Knelt down and paddled it fine, beats the long chase and desperate dive of Corey Anderson at fine leg. Almost played it onto the stumps, but got it wide of de Kock

Chahar to Kohli, FOUR, that's where Kohli is so good. Anything near his pads and he will not allow the bowler to get away. Full on leg stump and he just whipped it over mid-wicket. The uncorking of the wrists and the ball flew over the fielder

SN Thakur to Kohli, FOUR, didn't get all of it, but with the infield up, anything over them will be a boundary. Full outside off, Kohli wanted to go over extra-cover with the lofted hit, sort of sliced it, but had enough on it to clear the ring. Races away and the crowd get going as well

Tahir to de Villiers, FOUR, what batting. Must have picked it from the hand. Reverses the bat and sends the quicker dart outside off wide of short third. MS tried to get his legs in the way of the ball - as he always does, but placed so well

Jadeja to Mandeep, byes, FOUR, wow! Missed stumping? What has happened to this game all of a sudden. Like a man on drugs. This ball opens Mandeep up completely, rips off middle and squares up the batsman, leaves MS clueless too, drift in and spin away, past everyone including slip and races away
Jadeja to Mandeep, FOUR, too slow and too much time for Mandeep to reverse lap it over short third. Well played
Dwayne Bravo to de Grandhomme, FOUR, top shot. Gets under this full delivery and manages to power it over mid-off. Well wide of him and four more

Chahar to Kohli, FOUR, 200 marks to Billings for the effort. But it is four. Flicked effortlessly by Kohli, races across the turf to deep mid-wicket, Billings dives and pushes it back in play, but the ball rolls back to touch the cushions as the Kent man tried to pull it back the second time. Kohli and de Kock assumed that it would go for four and had to rush to make the third. Eventually all that was not needed as the third umpire judges it correctly

Dwayne Bravo to Washington Sundar, FOUR, brilliant from Washington Sundar. These might be crucial runs. Could well be match-winning. This 10-odd runs he has managed in the last over. Wide length ball from Dwayne Bravo, Washington Sundar reached out and cut between the two men in the ring on the off-side. No-one sweeping out there and RCB end with 205

Harbhajan to de Villiers, FOUR, this time shows off his prowess over the backward point region. Harbhajan isn't afraid to flight it, even after getting hit, but de Villiers backs away and slices it over the infield, four more, just opened the bat face at the point of impact and eluded the horde of fielders in the ring

Watson to de Kock, FOUR, back of a length around off, what a late-cut that is. Played it so late, almost behind him, splits backward point and short third to perfection. No third man and too wide for sweeper to get across

Sandeep Sharma to Andrew Tye, FOUR, dropped? Just fingertips I guess. Will go down as a missed opportunity. Andrew Tye walks out of his crease and clubs it straight down the ground, it kept teasing long-on and long-off, in the end Shakib from long-on decided to go for it, but didn't judge it well and it looped over his left shoulder
Rashid Khan to Mujeeb, FOUR, okay let's try something fancy decides Mujeeb and he goes for the reverse slap over point. Connects it well and gets it to defeat the dive from sweeper cover to his left
Rashid Khan to Mujeeb, FOUR, another reverse slap. Over short third man this time. Sweetly timed or not, it goes over the fielder and trickles into the fence

S Kaul to Rajpoot, FOUR, typical agricultural slog from Ankit Rajpoot, shaves the inside edge and runs past the keeper to his left. Thampi from short fine chases...chases...and chases...Never getting there. Ball wins the race
Nabi to Rahul, FOUR, superb batting. This isn't all that short. But Rahul's footwork is excellent, enabling him to spear this cut shot through point
Nabi to Rahul, FOUR, now anticipates a slightly fuller length, walks across the stumps and sweeps over short fine leg. Class batting from Rahul. He's out-thinking Nabi at every turn
Sandeep Sharma to Rahul, FOUR, Rahul silences the crowd with a glorious cover drive. Wow. Not even all that full, but he leans into it languidly and creams it through extra cover

S Kaul to Rahul, FOUR, he's not got it off the middle, but the fact he's got it over mid-on is incredible. He wasn't to the pitch of the ball after charging out, but goes through with a very stylish straight-batted punch. His strokes make for such good viewing
S Kaul to Gayle, FOUR, yorker outside off, and it's sliced away through the gap. Gayle stretches out to reach it and opens the bat-face to get it between short third man and backward point
Barinder to Dhawan, FOUR, cracking shot, width on offer from Sran and Dhawan was all over it. Reaches out on the drive and flat-bats it past cover, beat the infield and rolled away to the fence

Andrew Tye to Shakib, FOUR, nicely played by Shakib, much needed boundary for SRH. Banged in short and just outside off, Shakib swivels across and helps it on its way, beats short fine and rolls away to the fence

Ashwin to Manish Pandey, FOUR, bad misjudgement from Rajpoot in the deep. He lets this bounce in front of him and then weakly stretches out his hand, only to parry it over the ropes. Carrom ball on leg-stump from Ashwin, Pandey stood still and swiped it through square leg. Good contact

Andrew Tye to Manish Pandey, FOUR, had to make a big effort to get to this wide slower ball, and then manufactures remarkable power to cover it over extra-cover. Highly valuable fifty from Manish Pandey. It's given the Sunrisers a score
Andrew Tye to Y Pathan, FOUR, back of a length delivery on leg, Pathan helps it away past short fine leg. Tye immediately turned away, knew he had missed his mark horrendously
Rajpoot to Nabi, FOUR, sliced away over backward point for four. Useful from Nabi. Full and wide delivery, Nabi just about reaches it and then cleverly opens the bat face

Barinder to Saha, FOUR, that's a poor ball from Sran, too full and on Saha's pads, all he had to do was to get some bat on that, he does and beats fine leg with ease. Expensive start from Sran, 11 came from the over
Rajpoot to Dhawan, FOUR, chopped, short of a good length and just outside off, too close for Dhawan to play the cut, he gets a toe-edge and beats the lone slip, third man is square and has no chance

Barinder to Manish Pandey, FOUR, whipped, length delivery on the leg-stumnp line, Manish makes room, gets his left leg out of the way and flicks it wristily past mid-wicket, off the mark with a boundary
Barinder to Shakib, FOUR, the free-hit and it has been smashed away, high full-toss on Shakib's pads, he pulled it without much timing, but the placement was good, past square leg and into the fence

Barinder to Shakib, FOUR, short, wide and four, Shakib gets going after some luck, short and wide of off, he gets on top of the bounce, used Sran's pace and cracked it square behind point. Third man has no chance

A Russell to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, cracking shot! This lad is putting up an exhibition tonight. Fractionally short from Russell and Shaw doesn't bother going on the back foot. Is on his initial front foot trigger as he clobbers the pull over mid-wicket. High quality!

A Russell to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, oh glorious! Another classy stroke! Not all that full but Shaw reaches out and absolutely pumps the drive straight back past the bowler. Mid-off could only see it whistling away to the fence. Gee!

Johnson to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, this time he does! Iyer gets third time lucky. Another shorter length delivery from Johnson and was perhaps a touch closer to Iyer who connected the ramp nicely. Over Karthik and very fine which means third man has no chance. Nice innovation

A Russell to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, great placement! Nobody in the deep behind square on the off-side and all Iyer had to do was beat the man in the ring. That he does with a fine back foot cut. Too short and wide, got the treatement

Johnson to Maxwell, FOUR, hammers this! Very full and outside off, Maxwell holds his shape and lifts it straight over the bowler's head. Dead straight and it rockets to the fence. 11 off the over, a good one but those three dot balls, will they hurt on this seemingly belter of a pitch? Another over left though to make up for it

Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, what a shot! He's been playing breathtaking strokes for fun tonight. Here is another of those. Fullish length and Iyer sits in the crease before and blasts it down the ground towards long-off. No chance for the fielder there

Chawla to Munro, FOUR, beautifully played, nicely tossed up on off, Munro gets a big stride forward, gets close to the ball and drives it back past the non-striker, beats mid-off and rolls away to the fence

Chawla to Munro, FOUR, streaky but four, tossed up slower and spinning away from outside off, Munro was making room on the inside out drive, doesn't cover for the spin and slices it over backward point, couple of bounces and over the fence

Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, lovely, how well did Prithvi read this leg break? This was tossed up well outside off and spun away, Prithvi gets a big stride forward, plays with the turn and goes inside out over cover, one bounce and over the ropes

Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Prithvi, Chawla dropped this one short and on the leg-stump line, pulled away hard and past square leg, beats the fielder getting across from the deep
Shivam Mavi to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, cracking shot, back of a length and just outside off, Prithvi stands tall, plays with a straight bat and punches, beats point and rolls away to the fence
Shivam Mavi to Munro, FOUR, clobbered, Munro comes down the track, that allows him to free his arms and deposits it back past the bowler, beat mid-on to his right and races away to the fence

Narine to Munro, FOUR, nicely played! It wasn't a bad ball from Narine, slower and on the off-stump line, Munro made room by backing away, waits on the ball and finds the gap past cover with a blazing drive
Johnson to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, lovely, full and wide of off, Prithvi needs no second invitation as he threw his hands at that, clears cover-point and races away to the fence

Johnson to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, that's nicely played by Prithvi, let the ball come onto him, used the pace on the ball and then nudged it behind square on the on-side, beat the man in the ring and rolls away to the fence
Boult to Chris Lynn, FOUR, wrong lines from Trent Boult, pounds it short and sprays it around the ribcage, Lynn swivels and smacks the pull behind square
Maxwell to Narine, FOUR, no-one's preventing this one. Halftracker outside off stump, Narine transfers his weight onto the back foot and hammers it powerfully wide of extra cover

Plunkett to A Russell, FOUR, no fooling around this time! Stays back for the slower delivery and then thumps the ball away between mid-wicket and long-on for a four. That was out of the top-drawer from Russell

Boult to A Russell, FOUR, not all brawn with this man. Stands up and steers the ball over point for a four. That runs away into the fence. The ball was short and outside off, the room was there to send it away
Mishra to Shubman Gill, FOUR, dances down the track, picks up the googly and hoicks the ball away through mid-wicket and long-on for a four. KKR will take it, with open arms

Rahul Tewatia to A Russell, FOUR, more perspiration on the part of the DD team. Well tossed up delivery and the batsman this time thumps the ball over the bowler's head for a four. That was brutal again
Maxwell to Kuldeep Yadav, FOUR, down leg, swept fine and that will run away to the fence
Boult to Johnson, FOUR, does not miss out on the timing despite backing away. Too full and the batsman screamed the drive away through the cover region for a four

Boult to Johnson, FOUR, slogged away off a length ball towards the deep mid-wicket fence but does not matter. DD win this by 55 runs. This has been a superb show from DD, ably led by their new skipper - Shreyas Iyer. Two vital points and KKR have been jolted badly by this

Avesh Khan to Nitish Rana, FOUR, that ball went searching for the middle of the blade. Nitish Rana was in such a good position, everything right about it; reads the length early, punches crisply in the gap behind point with a still head. Take four

Avesh Khan to Shubman Gill, FOUR, one bounce and over the ropes. Making batting look so simple is Shubman Gill. Waits for this length ball to arrive and lifts the punch over mid-off with impeccable timing

Mishra to Shubman Gill, FOUR, tad short and keeps eerily low on middle, but Gill does well to keep his eyes on the ball and slam the pull along the ground through mid-wicket. A diving effort by the fielder at deep mid-wicket goes in vain

McClenaghan to Raina, FOUR, just wide of Ishan Kishan, but poor bowling from McClenaghan, sliding down and easy for Raina to get inside the line and help the ball with a faint tickle. Does enough to get it past the keeper

Hardik Pandya to Dhoni, FOUR, wow. Incredible hands by Dhoni. And almost six. One bounce over the ropes. Full and with mid-off up was asking for trouble. Dhoni whiplashed it over the fielder. Raw power

Hardik Pandya to Dhoni, FOUR, now goes over mid-wicket. Predictably Hardik Pandya pings it short, Dhoni is waiting on the back foot. Hammered the pull and there's no-one at deep mid. Takes another boundary. Intelligence and cricket awareness on display

Markande to Dhoni, FOUR, that's the genius of Dhoni. He was beaten in flight and had he not reached out low and found bat on ball, would've given Kishan a chance for a stumping, but stretches to his full reach and then carves it over wide long-off, for a one bounce over the ropes four. Incredible
Bumrah to Raina, FOUR, fine leg was inside the circle and Raina gets four. Gets inside the line and then waits for the off-pace delivery which is short, pulled well wide of short fine
Bumrah to Raina, FOUR, and Raina will go wide and over that man. Helped by Bumrah bowling a low full-toss, on the pads, flicked into the gap and Raina gets to 50

McClenaghan to Watson, FOUR, that has been hit so hard. Rohit at mid-off dove to his right at mid-off, got a hand on that and took the sting out of the shot, but it still raced away to the fence. When Watson saw the pitched up delivery he just plonked his front foot and drilled it

Hardik Pandya to Rayudu, FOUR, there's a backward point close in and then a short third man behind him, with no third man in place. Full outside off, Rayudu lashes a square drive in the air and manages to elude the leaping backward point fielder to his left
Hardik Pandya to Rayudu, FOUR, slower delivery outside off, Rayudu slashes and gets a thick edge that bisects Ishan Kishan and Krunal at short third. Races away
Krunal Pandya to Raina, FOUR, short and well outside off, Raina reaches out and cuts, beats backward point and sweeper cover has too much ground to cover. Beats him
Cutting to Raina, FOUR, hat-trick of slower balls and so predictable. Raina gets forward and lofts over and wide of mid-off. So easy
Markande to Raina, FOUR, too full and too close to Raina, who just lifts it back over the bowler's head. Hit clean and hard, no chance for long-off or long-on

Chahar to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, too much width and Yadav latches onto it. Bit of away-shape for Chahar, but the length is on the shorter side. Too easy for any batsman. Yadav stands tall and slashes it through point. SKY and MI get off the mark
Dwayne Bravo to Lewis, FOUR, spoils a good over by smearing the ball into the wide long-off boundary. To be fair, Bravo was asking for it by bowling this gentle full toss outside off. Duly punished

Dwayne Bravo to Rohit, FOUR, the Mumbai captain is up for it tonight. He's taking control of this chase now. Short of length ball, only chest high, and Rohit dismisses it with an authoritative pull backward of square. Huge cheers. It's a split crowd here

Watson to Rohit, FOUR, not the best effort from Tahir in the deep, lets the ball sneak through for four. He's immediately removed from that position. Good length ball outside off, Rohit doesn't get all of it but does enough to carve it away through sweeper cover's dive

SN Thakur to Rohit, FOUR, low full toss outside off, Rohit ingeniously slices it away over backward point. Shades of the shot Dhoni played the other night, but not quite as good. He just about clears Harbhajan though. Thakur must be crestfallen, this was a perfectly good ball
SN Thakur to Rohit, FOUR, that previous ball has messed his line up. This time he goes full at the stumps, Rohit shuffles inside the line of it and whips it away to the fine leg boundary. Top batting

SN Thakur to Rohit, FOUR, hat-trick of fours. Rohit's doing it for Mumbai. Short of length ball outside off, slower one, and the MI skipper is able to thread it through backward point and third man. Brilliantly glided

SN Thakur to Rohit, FOUR, kills the game off, surely. Tremendous batting from Rohit Sharma. He picks the bowler's mind, reads the incoming yorker and sweeps it away through backward square. Raises a fifty

SN Thakur to Lewis, FOUR, that spoils the over. Not a bad ball by any means. Banged one short and generated good lift, Lewis is late on the pull, off the glove and well wide of MS. Runs away to the fine leg fence
Chahar to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries. Length ball on the stumps, Yadav hops across and flicks it very fine. Bhajji is slightly too square and he can't cut it off
Chahar to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, nicely done! Ample time for Yadav to pick his spot. Normal-paced shortish ball, no venom in it. Yadav slightly crouches and elevates it over short third man
Watson to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, good placement. Just a bit of width outside off and that's enough for Yadav. Jumps, opens his bat-face at the last moment and forces it through backward point

Harbhajan to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, width served and Yadav doesn't miss out. Was on the shorter side as well and Yadav used the bowler's pace to good effect. Opened the bat-face to punch it through covers. Excellent placement

Tahir to Lewis, byes, FOUR, through Dhoni and that runs away into the fence. Very rare from MS. It was the googly from Tahir and Lewis tries another lofted shot. Is nowhere close to the bat and misses. Was marginally outside the tramline as well. Brushed the CSK skipper's pad and that's four bonus runs for MI

Tahir to Lewis, FOUR, a gift dished out and Lewis accepts it with both hands. He needed that. Connects and collects four. A rank full toss fired by Tahir and Lewis thumps it down the ground. Over the bowler's head and long-off had no chance

Sandeep Sharma to Rahane, FOUR, nicely done by Rahane! This tailed in sharply from a fullish length but the line was a bit too straight. Clipped away sweetly past the diving mid-wicket fielder and it raced away to the fence. RR are away
Y Pathan to Rahane, FOUR, slipping down. That's the customary loose stuff a part-timer dishes out. Quick sweep, ensuring it goes very fine

Basil Thampi to Gowtham, FOUR, gets his line wrong. Gets his length wrong. A yorker in the form of a half volley, the line stays on middle and Gowtham's hoick gets a fat inside edge, through his legs and through a vacant square leg

Shakib to Rahane, FOUR, beautifully timed! Placement was spot on too. Got this wide of mid-on and well to the left of the deep mid-wicket fielder as well. A touch short around middle, skids off the deck and Rahane whips it away with strong wristwork. Nicely done by the skipper

Basil Thampi to Samson, FOUR, delicious shot! Oozing class! Not all that bad a ball, just a fab stroke. On a good length just outside off, Samson just stood tall and cracked the back foot punch on the up. Through the covers and it blazed away. What a shot!

Basil Thampi to Samson, FOUR, clobbered away! This time, Samson connected the pull perfectly and it raced away. Short of a length around middle, not high enough to threaten the batsman and an in-form batsman like Samson isn't going to miss out. Sends this to the deep square leg fence. Thampi needs to recover quickly

S Kaul to Samson, FOUR, such is the form Samson is in, he doesn't need bad balls to score boundaries. Here is another example. A knuckle ball outside off, he just stands tall and uses his supple wrists to drop kick this wide of the long-on fence. The fielder there tried hard but couldn't get to it
Rashid Khan to Rahane, FOUR, 94.8kph, back of the hand stuff, drifting down leg though and generously full. Rahane is quick to pounce on, sits, uses the angle and drills his sweep behind square
Shakib to Rahane, FOUR, a defensive drag down. Rahane stays tall, picks his widely open cow corner. And whips. Splitting the men converging to perfection

D Kulkarni to Hales, FOUR, gentle loosener from Kulkarni and Hales duly dispatches it to the fence. Short, wide and plenty of width on offer, Hales reaches out by flailing his hands at that and bashes it through point, who's dive goes in vain. Real warm-up delivery from Kulkarni..

D Kulkarni to Hales, FOUR, back to shortish length and Hales chooses the mid-wicket region on this occasion. Picked the length extremely early, pivoted back and pulled it firmly in front of square on the leg-side

D Kulkarni to Dhawan, FOUR, third boundary of the over and you got to feel for the bowler. This full ball swung in late, but how well Dhawan played that. Cleared his front leg in a flash, such quicksilver hands that he flicked it in front of square. The outfield is lighting fast, despite a long chase from the mid-wicket fielder, the ball just about reaches the fence

Lomror to Hales, FOUR, half-tracker and Hales dismisses it from his presence. Ruins a good over from Lomror. Went back in a flash and clouted it brilliantly in the gap between deep mid-wicket and deep square leg

Unadkat to Williamson, FOUR, Williamson takes the adventure route. Walks across his sticks, waits for the ball to arrive and scooped it over short fine leg. Knew the fine leg was inside the ring and hence opted for the shot
Unadkat to Williamson, FOUR, 14 off first three balls. Unadkat overcompensates and hurls it well outside off. Williamson leant across and spanked it with ferocity over extra cover

Unadkat to Williamson, FOUR, oh, he's taking Unadkat to the cleaners. Streaky this time but Williamson won't mind. Throws his bat on this fuller length delivery outside off and gets a thick outside edge that flies away to the third man fence

Ish Sodhi to Shakib, FOUR, nice way to start for Shakib! Premeditates the paddle sweep and makes a fair amount of connection on it as well. Deflected it really fine down the leg-side and it raced away to the fence

Stokes to Manish Pandey, FOUR, up and over! With mid-off in the ring, perhaps not the ideal length from Stokes and he pays the price for it. Fuller ball and allows Pandey to get under it. Lifted cleanly over the fielder who did leap but was never going to get to it

Jofra Archer to Saha, FOUR, lovely shot. Mid-off is up and Archer bowls a fuller length to compound things. Easy for Saha though, he holds his shape and drives beautifully. Splits mid-off and extra cover easily to find the fence. Valuable runs

D Kulkarni to Williamson, FOUR, Kulkarni has been leaking boundaries. Errs in line again and provides width for Williamson, well outside off. KW just reaches across and slaps it square on the off-side

Jofra Archer to Williamson, FOUR, Williamson's special. Classic on-drive. Archer feeds a half-volley on the stumps, Williamson just shifted his weight forward, presented a full face of the bat and drove it neatly past mid-on. No need to run for those as it races away to the fence

Ish Sodhi to Williamson, FOUR, rank long hop and Williamson won't spare those. Well outside off, Williamson rocks back, picks his spot and hammers it to the cow corner fence. Threaded the gap beautifully
Ish Sodhi to Williamson, FOUR, excellent from Williamson. Goes inside-out over extra cover. Saw the flighted delivery early, bent low and lifted it effortlessly over extra cover

Stokes to Hales, FOUR, back to back fours for SRH. Stokes ushers a short ball at Hales, no venom and he went back to smoke it in the gap between deep square leg and fine leg. Hales having a move on here
U Yadav to Narine, FOUR, Narine is hurting RCB once again, short of a length and just outside off, Narine rides the bounce and steers it over short third man, no one in the deep and it's a boundary
Chahal to Chris Lynn, FOUR, crashes the sweep away behind square. He's doing nothing else, just sweeping. Gets the length he wants and muscles it
Murugan Ashwin to Nitish Rana, FOUR, oh poor finish to the spell from Ashwin. Lands the googly outside leg and is punished. Rana grounds his back knee to sweep it over short fine

Siraj to Nitish Rana, FOUR, Chahal fails to cut it off. He gave it his best, sprinting across and diving from deep backward point but couldn't get a strong enough hand. But how well has Rana timed this yorker. It's very close to the blockhole if not right in it, but Rana slices it superbly through the off-side
Siraj to Karthik, FOUR, full in the slot for Karthik who smears it away through extra cover. Excellent finish to the over from the captain. Hammered this drive to the fence
Southee to Chris Lynn, FOUR, back-to-back fours. The power of Lynn coming to the fore. Low full toss, not an easy ball to hit but Lynn muscles it straight of long-on

Southee to Karthik, FOUR, flurry of runs in the last few balls and suddenly KKR are bossing this. Short of length delivery, Karthik beautifully swivels into the pull and helps it into the gap between deep square and fine leg. His timing's on fire
U Yadav to Shubman Gill, FOUR, that's it. 18-year old Shubman Gill slaps this short ball to the point boundary and swings his bat in celebration. Back-to-back defeats for RCB at the Chinnaswamy
Southee to Narine, FOUR, top-edge and four, another lucky boundary for Narine, banged in short and on the stumps, Narine swivelled across on the pull, gets a fat top-edge that lobs over short fine

Southee to Narine, FOUR, just over mid-on, not RCB's night? Short and at the stumps, Narine backed away on the pull, gets it right off the bottom of the bat, but has enough to clear mid-on for a boundary
Chahal to Chris Lynn, FOUR, lovely shot, tossed up well outside off, Lynn shuffles across, gets well outside off and sweeps it behind square on the on-side for a boundary
U Yadav to Chris Lynn, FOUR, low full-toss and that has been drilled through cover, Lynn got his bat down like a sledge hammer and thread the ball through the infield
Chahal to Chris Lynn, FOUR, cracking shot, tad too full and too wide from Chahal, Lynn backs away and drills it over cover, one bounce and into the fence
Siraj to Chris Lynn, FOUR, cracking shot, short and wide of off, Lynn makes room, gets on top of the bounce and clatters it to the right of point, no stopping that
Siraj to Uthappa, FOUR, that's poor from the fielder at short fine, too straight from Siraj, on Uthappa's pads and he flicked it fine. Beat Ashwin's awkward dive and rolled away to the fence

Murugan Ashwin to Uthappa, FOUR, beautifully played, overpitched and on Uthappa's pads, he leans forward, gets close to the ball and then plays the on-drive, beat the two fielders in the deep to a nicety
Murugan Ashwin to Uthappa, FOUR, this is turning out to be an expensive over from Ashwin, dropped this one short and well outside off, Uthappa waits on it and then reverse laps it past the lone slip

Murugan Ashwin to Chris Lynn, FOUR, third boundary of the over, slower and shorter of off, Lynn bends down low and places it into the vacant gap at deep mid-wicket, split the two men in the deep to perfection

Narine to de Kock, FOUR, how slow is Uthappa? My word. Took an age to realise where the ball was going and then gave chase, but can only parry it onto the ropes. Wasn't so well-timed but Uthappa picked it up late from the bat and his sprinting ability left a lot to be desired
Narine to de Kock, FOUR, to the left of Uthappa now. No chance for him this time, another sweep, dragged from middle but gets it wide of short fine and it just raced away. de Kock gets going

A Russell to Kohli, FOUR, my word. What a shot. Half-volley outside off, Kohli has dispatched that royally through the covers. No-one moved. But seems to have done some damage to his right-leg after over-stretching on the drive. A limp or two but looks like he will shrug it off
Johnson to Kohli, FOUR, no problems with the timing there. Picks the slower delivery outside off and then laces the cover-drive on the rise, sheer timing and leaves sweeper cover as a spectator

Narine to Kohli, FOUR, for a moment when he sliced that, looked like he had holed out, but perfectly placed between deep cover and long-off. Picked the one that goes away, sliced the loft and it is a one bounce over the ropes four

Shivam Mavi to Kohli, FOUR, beautiful touch. Slower ball outside off, Kohli uses the wide gap between backward point and short third to direct the ball there. Shivam Mavi perhaps gave Kohli too much room outside off to play that shot
Shivam Mavi to Kohli, FOUR, short and wide outside off, Kohli needs to miss backward point and the sweeper, does so easily, launches it in the air and well wide of both the men, races away

Johnson to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, that's Brendon McCullum at his best. Brings the crowd to life. A shimmy down the wicket and then throws his fast hands on the short of length delivery, scythed over extra-cover. Brutal hit
Chawla to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, a shimmy but stays in the crease and slog-sweeps, to the right of deep mid, in the gap and well placed to get a one bounce over the ropes four
Narine to de Kock, FOUR, bit more air, and de Kock sweeps hard, beats mid-wicket on the dive to his left and deep square has no chance. Too full and de Kock found the middle of the bat

Chawla to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, horrible umpiring. Really poor. How is that runs? Brendon McCullum is beaten all ends up by one that squares him up, pitched on middle, turned past the bat and hit the back leg, raced away past DK. Chawla went for a slight appeal and then kept quiet. Llong the ump who has given it as runs. Not even close to the bat. KKR should've reviewed that, but since it was given as runs, they didn't go for it
Chawla to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, short third didn't even move. Nor did backward point. Short and wide outside off, cut right into the gap between the two
Boult to Watson, FOUR, full, swinging in, clipped away, four..That sped away off the bat in a jiffy. Little bit of erring in line and put away

Vijay Shankar to Rayudu, FOUR, connects this time! Clear intent from Rayudu, walks down the track and makes room to loft it inside out over extra cover. Clean strike and it races to the fence on the bounce

Vijay Shankar to Watson, FOUR, easy pickings! Full toss and a lot of width outside off as well, Watson doesn't even need these gifts in the kind of form that he is in tonight. Absolutely feasts on it with a slice through backward point. Sweeper had no chance

Vijay Shankar to Watson, FOUR, more power from Watson! There was a deep cover in place but he was a mere spectator as this blazed to the fence. Fuller ball outside off, juicy enough for Watson to lift it over extra cover. Cracked it away

Mishra to Rayudu, FOUR, freebie from Mishra and it's vanished to the fence in no time. Sprayed full and well down leg, Rayudu just had to beat the man at short fine leg and he does so with a hard sweep. All too easy

Boult to Dhoni, FOUR, he is playing around with the field here. Dhoni is on a roll. He is expecting the short ball and swivels to pull this wide of the man at short fine leg. Dhoni is motoring along here. DD need to somehow stop him

Boult to Rayudu, FOUR, Rayudu joins in the fun now and Boult is getting a severe beating here. Misses the yorker anmd gives a low full toss, Rayudu is already across the stumps and wrists it away powerfully wide of the long-on fielder. Nicely done

Plunkett to Rayudu, FOUR, gets it away very fine. Smart batting from Rayudu but this is equally poor from Plunkett who is having a horror night. Too straight in line on this short ball, Rayudu swivels across to get inside the line and pulls it away. Fine leg was too square

Plunkett to Rayudu, FOUR, bleeding runs. They have no clue how to bowl to these two at the moment. Plunkett pulls his length back but the width is there outside off, Rayudu just slashes hard at it and gets a slice that beats short third man comfortably to his left. Not exactly where he intended but he won't mind

Boult to Dhoni, FOUR, blasted away! Doesn't matter where you bowl to him when he is in this mood. Banged in short by Boult and Dhoni was down the track in a flash, flat-batted it powerfully past the Kiwi who did well to get out of the way. Rockets past mid-off who was in the ring. Incredible, simply incredible
Boult to du Plessis, FOUR, throws his hands at it and gets a thick edge. The ball flies away to third man and a lazy effort from Avesh Khan at deep third man allows the ball to slip under his hands

Boult to Watson, FOUR, gentle from the giant! That was short from round the wicket and the little bit of room was used well by Watson. Just guided the ball between point and short third man for a four

Rahul Tewatia to du Plessis, FOUR, drops it short and that helped the batsman as he was backing away. Drop kicks the ball over the off-side for a four. Much needed for Faf and CSK. Breaking the shackles moment?

Avesh Khan to du Plessis, FOUR, short ball at the body. Again skidded through and the batsman under-edges the ball away fine on the on-side for a four. That looked disconcerting for the batsman but he somehow got bat to it and sent it away. Lucky bargain for du Plessis. 56 off the PP!!

KM Asif to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, Shaw goes aerial and clears mid-off. Didn't time it as he would've liked but just enough to clear the fielder. On a back of a length on off, Shaw used his bottom hand to good effect to chip it over the ring. Couple of bounces and home

KM Asif to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, bosh. In the swinging arc for Shaw and he butchers it straight down the ground. Arrests his high backlift, again employs his bottom hand and bashes it straight down the ground. Watch out ump! Nearly knocked him out there
Jadeja to Pant, FOUR, Pant falls as he attempts that pull on the short of length ball but he gets enough bat and finds the gap through deep mid-wicket for a boundary

Harbhajan to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, poor delivery down the leg-side, Vijay Shankar puts bat to it and guides it wide of the short fine leg fielder for a four. DD needs more of these shots from Vijay Shankar

KM Asif to Pant, FOUR, sloppy effort from Rayudu at long-off. Pant doesn't get it anywhere near the middle of the bat but he puts power in the shot as he generally does and ball goes for a four. Pant brings up his fifty with that four
KM Asif to Pant, FOUR, Pant goes slightly to the off-side and sweeps it fine of the stumps, ball goes fine of the short fine leg fielder for a four

Dwayne Bravo to Pant, FOUR, the line is wrong and Pant is single-handedly threatening CSK here. Slower delivery down the leg-side, can't bowl there with fine leg inside the ring and Pant helps it away on his way over the man at 45
Dwayne Bravo to Pant, FOUR, low full toss and he's mishit this, yet it runs away for four. Long-on was very square and he had no chance of cutting this off

Lungi Ngidi to Pant, FOUR, you are kidding me! What sort of a shot is this? He was almost beaten by the change of pace by this shortish slower ball, slapped it pretty straight towards long-on despite having to fetch this from outside off stump. Dhoni has been having long-on very wide fro Pant and he had no chance. In fact, Dhoni and Bravo were not happy with Faf. Looks like he was standing very wide without instructions and maybe he was just wandering

Lungi Ngidi to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, Ngidi sought to fox Iyer once again but Iyer outfoxes him. Slipped it wider of off on seeing the batsman back away. Iyer throws his bat, reaches out and slaps it with ferocity, beating the packed off-side field

Watson to Munro, FOUR, expertly done by Munro. Watson was getting monotonously predictable with his lines. Full and outside off, Munro walked across his sticks and adjusted it beautifully to lift it over mid-on
KM Asif to Munro, FOUR, sledge-hammered over point by the Kiwi marauder. Picked Asif's slower ball early, waited and stayed deep to slash it over point

KM Asif to Munro, FOUR, now the overcorrection from Asif, feeds a tasty half-volley. Munro stayed leg-side of the ball, puts his bottom hand to good effect once again to blast it straight down the ground
Watson to Pant, FOUR, Watson is not learning. Shifts his line outside off, Pant knew the third man was inside the ring. Scythed it to his right and it zoomed away into the fence. Smartly done

Jadeja to Maxwell, FOUR, Jadeja errs in line and length, Maxwell makes him pay the penalty. Short, quick and outside off, Maxwell waited and flayed it through cover. Threads the gap and it races away to the fence

Krunal Pandya to Kohli, FOUR, that's one of his trademark shots. Saw the full middle stump delivery and then went inside out over cover. No chance for Polly at long-off. Gets forward and then gives himself room to get the elevation
Markande to Kohli, FOUR, phew! Markande despite getting a boot on that scorching drive, watches the ball run to the fence in a jiffy. Down the track and drilled so so hard
Markande to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, poor delivery, too much time for Brendon McCullum on the back foot. Was short and he pummelled the pull between deep square and deep mid. Perfect placement
Markande to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, and again. This time the slog-sweep. Brendon McCullum is playing a blinder now. Kneels down and nails this sweep, leaves deep square and deep mid as spectators

Hardik Pandya to Mandeep, FOUR, one ball per over he will bowl short. Or else he can't bowl. That's Hardik Pandya for you. This short ball doesn't rise enough to trouble Mandeep who rolls his wrists on the swivel-pull and beats deep square to his right
Duminy to Vohra, FOUR, that's a good shot. But he looks at his bat. Not entirely happy with the connection. Saw the tossed up delivery and charged Duminy, to the pitch and lofted wide and over mid-on

Duminy to Vohra, FOUR, that's a slog. But he has managed to elude mid-wicket leaping. Dragged the flighted delivery from outside off and even though it came off the thickish inside half, it was enough to beat Rohit
McClenaghan to de Kock, FOUR, this is a thick edge but it will do for de Kock. Backs away and slashes the short of length delivery, gets enough bat on that to clear backward point and short third
Markande to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, no third man. Nor there is short third. Easy shot for Brendon McCullum. He reverse-swats the length ball turning away from him wide of backward point

Hardik Pandya to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, slower delivery outside off, Brendon McCullum flat-bat thrashes that, didn't hit it really sweetly, but enough to beat long-off running to his left. Looks to be finding his touch. Had to after my earlier comments about him

Krunal Pandya to Kohli, FOUR, that's one of his trademark shots. Saw the full middle stump delivery and then went inside out over cover. No chance for Polly at long-off. Gets forward and then gives himself room to get the elevation
Markande to Kohli, FOUR, phew! Markande despite getting a boot on that scorching drive, watches the ball run to the fence in a jiffy. Down the track and drilled so so hard
Markande to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, poor delivery, too much time for Brendon McCullum on the back foot. Was short and he pummelled the pull between deep square and deep mid. Perfect placement
Markande to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, and again. This time the slog-sweep. Brendon McCullum is playing a blinder now. Kneels down and nails this sweep, leaves deep square and deep mid as spectators

Hardik Pandya to Mandeep, FOUR, one ball per over he will bowl short. Or else he can't bowl. That's Hardik Pandya for you. This short ball doesn't rise enough to trouble Mandeep who rolls his wrists on the swivel-pull and beats deep square to his right
Duminy to Vohra, FOUR, that's a good shot. But he looks at his bat. Not entirely happy with the connection. Saw the tossed up delivery and charged Duminy, to the pitch and lofted wide and over mid-on

Duminy to Vohra, FOUR, that's a slog. But he has managed to elude mid-wicket leaping. Dragged the flighted delivery from outside off and even though it came off the thickish inside half, it was enough to beat Rohit
McClenaghan to de Kock, FOUR, this is a thick edge but it will do for de Kock. Backs away and slashes the short of length delivery, gets enough bat on that to clear backward point and short third
Markande to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, no third man. Nor there is short third. Easy shot for Brendon McCullum. He reverse-swats the length ball turning away from him wide of backward point

Hardik Pandya to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, slower delivery outside off, Brendon McCullum flat-bat thrashes that, didn't hit it really sweetly, but enough to beat long-off running to his left. Looks to be finding his touch. Had to after my earlier comments about him
Jofra Archer to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, too full, too fine from Archer and that would run away. First four of the innings. Bad ball and put away with a cheeky touch through fine leg

Unadkat to Pant, FOUR, that's almost gone all the way! Pant lost his balance on this shot, which isn't unusual as we know but this is still outrageous to pull off. Swivels across on the pull and skies it in the air down the leg-side. Too fine though and the fine leg fielder could only watch it land in front of the ropes and brisk away

Gowtham to Pant, FOUR, these two are targeting Gowtham and this is the big push DD needed. Too short in length and Pant won't miss out on these. Swivels back and nails the pull. Well to the right of deep mid-wicket
Gowtham to Pant, FOUR, incredible stroke! As if his conventional strokes aren't working enough, Pant brings out the reverse sweep. Connects comfortably to clear short third man. Bleeding runs now

D Kulkarni to Pant, FOUR, this was hit so hard that the ball vanished to the fence in no time. Pant is expecting the wide yorker now and sets himself up for it. Gets a wide low full toss that's absolutely murdered through cover. Sweeper had no chance

D Kulkarni to Pant, FOUR, nearly took short extra cover's hand along with it! How hard is Pant hitting the ball! Gee, insane stuff! Half volley with a lot of width and it's absolutely crashed through extra cover. The fielder there got a hand on it and yet, it flew away to the fence. Pant is continuing exactly from where he left off in Pune the other night

Stokes to Pant, FOUR, the man at sweeper cover is of no use when Pant hits the ball like this. Can perhaps just help retrieve the ball from the fence. Full and quite wide outside off, Pant bludgeons this through the covers. Nobody moved at all

Jofra Archer to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, gets it away very fine. Not exactly where he intended but Shankar will take this. Short of a length outside off, he went hard on the cut and got a big slice that flew away to the third man fence

Unadkat to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, poor bowling and Shankar pounces on it. Too straight in line from round the wicket and all that the batsman has to do it get it over short fine leg. Does so with a lofted stroke after a walk across the sticks

D Kulkarni to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, slapped away!! Four between cover and mid-off. Stays leg-side of the ball, the room was there and the batsman lets his hands to whirlwind the ball away. Prithvi Shaw is handing out some pasting to Kulkarni
Gowtham to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, little backing away movement supplemented with fine hands. The ball threads into the gap on the off-side and the ball races away into the cover fence
Gowtham to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, full and flat outside off, sliced away in the gap between point and cover point for a four. The room was there and the batsman chased that widish ball to put it away

Unadkat to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, length ball, Shaw stays back and punches uppishly off the back foot. Bit of a slice, which is why he isn't in control, and interestingly gets it over the man at mid-on who was running back. Jofra Archer tried to fetch it back but the ball dropped in front of him and spun into the boundary ropes

Unadkat to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, check and four! The slower delivery and the batsman just checked his punch to ensure he lent enough power on the shot. The ball raced away to the fence teasing Gowtham, the man at mid-off, till the very end

Stokes to Pant, FOUR, short ball again but slower at 120ks. This time punished. He waited on it and muscled the ball over mid-wicket for a four. He was not over committed into the stroke and that helped him

Jofra Archer to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, sliced away nicely! Iyer has been backing away to the shorter length ball and does it again. This time he gets a fair chunk of the outer half and flies well wide of the third man fielder to his right
Nadeem to Buttler, FOUR, Buttler fails to reach the pitch of the ball, but his bat was gun-barrel straight and he lofts it straight down the ground for a boundary
Boult to D Arcy Short, FOUR, D Arcy Short likes pace on the ball. It was a fuller length ball outside off, Short drives it handsomely wide of the mid-off fielder for a four
Plunkett to R Tripathi, FOUR, cross seam delivery at the body of Tripathi who gets in a fine position and pulls it through fine leg for a four
Plunkett to Gowtham, FOUR, slower ball banged in short, Gowtham gets it off the outside half, slicing the ball fine of the short third man fielder for a four

Boult to Gowtham, FOUR, It is a four, and it's been dropped in the deep by the captain, can you believe it! Crazy scenes here at the Kotla. This is going down to the last ball, it was on a fuller length and at the stumps, Gowtham flaunts his hitting prowess and hits the ball over long-on, timing wasn't great and Iyer at long-on spills it. Right through his hands there. Couldn't close the palms, the ball rips through it and bounces once before tagging the boundary ropes. Maxwell is around too, standing close-in and watching everything. Tries to slap the rebound off the ground into the playing area but fails to get a hand. Four! Six needed off the last ball!
Avesh Khan to Buttler, FOUR, Avesh Khan is under pressure and he bowls a poor delivery, ball was outside off, Buttler makes full use of the room and scythes it through backward point for a boundary

Plunkett to Buttler, FOUR, Pant was flying in air like David De Gea, he gets a hand on it but fails to grab the catch. It was short of length delivery down the leg-side, Buttler gets some bat to it on the pull and ball goes just wide and to the left of the keeper for a four

Avesh Khan to Buttler, FOUR, young man is under pressure. It was another full toss and Buttler with this form is not going to miss out. He connects well and places it well through fine leg for a single
Boult to D Arcy Short, FOUR, intention was to hit it over deep mid-wicket into the stands, gets an inside edge and ends up hitting it wide of the short fine leg fielder for a four

Johnson to Watson, FOUR, oh, gosh. How did Watson manage to get this wide of mid-off. Lost timing totally as he went chasing for a drive to an outswinger slanted outside off. Way too early into the shot and canned it off the inner half, evades mid-off who refuses it put in a dive. All the way and Watson is off the mark with a boundary

Johnson to du Plessis, FOUR, edged and past the lone slip. Goodish length, moving away outside off. du Plessis threw his bat hard at it, ends up feathering a thick outside edge which flew past Uthappa at widish first slip. The third man had no chance as it sped away to the fence in a hurry

Chawla to du Plessis, FOUR, poor poor effort from Uthappa. What an error from the vice captain of KKR. Flat and quick outside off, du Plessis punches it from the crease towards Uthappa at cover-point, who clumsily lets it through. Chawla is not happy with the effort
Chawla to du Plessis, FOUR, tossed up teasingly outside off and du Plessis says thank you very much. Leans across, picks it up and lifts it disdainfully over mid-off. Clean swing of the bat!

Narine to Rayudu, FOUR, brilliant placement from Rayudu. Safe bet against Narine. Tossed up on middle and leg, Rayudu sank low and gets under it to sweep it in the gap between deep square leg and deep mid-wicket

Johnson to Rayudu, FOUR, edged and profitable result for Rayudu. Johnson wears a wry smile on his face. Slanted across outside off, lured Rayudu into playing a false shot. Gets the outside edge and unfortunately for Johnson, it flew past a diving DK to his right

Chawla to Rayudu, FOUR, poor line by Chawla. Can't bowl such freebies to a batsman in such fine form. Down the leg side and Rayudu sweeps it away to the fine leg fence. Fielder is nowhere close to cut this down
Chawla to Jadeja, FOUR, 50-run stand up with that blow. Was the googly around off, Jadeja walked down the wicket and slammed it right past the bowler and the umpire who had to take evasive action

Chawla to Jadeja, byes, FOUR, CSK will take that! Doesn't matter how they come. Was a quicker delivery around off, Jadeja tried to slog it away but couldn't connect and Karthik failed to grab it too. That raced away to the fence in no time, so quick that was

Shivam Mavi to du Plessis, FOUR, ah, time for French cricket from du Plessis. Late swing for Mavi again, du Plessis squirts an inside edge that almost shaved the leg-stump. Fine leg was inside the circle and it escapes away to the fence

Chawla to Dhoni, FOUR, Dhoni finishes off in style, with a boundary. Picks the length early on the short one, rocks back and pulls it right into the gap at deep mid-wicket. No fielder there as CSK end on a competetive score
Narine to Watson, FOUR, no half measures from Watson on this occasion. Spots the half-tracker early, chooses his spot and muscles it to the right of deep mid-wicket fielder. One-bounce four

Johnson to Watson, FOUR, oh goodness! What a strike from Watson. Johnson and the umpire had to take evasive action as it was struck so hard. Can you believe it? Still runs away to the fence. Full and on off, Watson stomps forward and hammers it back at Johnson, who puts up his left hand to take cover. The ball hits him and flies away past a ducking umpire Abhijit Deshmukh to the boundary. That must've hurt and it's his bowling arm
Chawla to Raina, FOUR, Raina takes on his former statemate. Stretches across outside off, gets under this flighted delivery and lofts it over cover. Excellent execution!

Chawla to Raina, FOUR, Chawla errs in line and Raina makes him pay. Half-tracker down leg, Raina will keep putting this away to the fence, seven days a week and twenty four hours a day. Half-swivels and helps it away past short fine leg
A Russell to Raina, FOUR, Russell loses radar and spills it down leg. Easy-peasy for Raina, just needed to get some bat on it. Does so and hacks it very fine
A Russell to Raina, FOUR, woah. How cleverly did Raina place that? Deft hands. Played it so late, just used Russell's pace, waited deep and glided it to the third man fence. Wonderful from Raina!
Kuldeep Yadav to Watson, FOUR, very smart from Watson. Knew there was no fine leg; plants his front leg across and rolls his wrists on the sweep. Sends it very fine and earns himself a boundary

Harbhajan to Karthik, FOUR, good shot to get off the mark. Hint of width on this short of length and that's enough for Karthik. He is quick to trek back and employ the cut shot behind square. Finds the gap and fetches his first boundary
Dwayne Bravo to Shubman Gill, FOUR, top shot! Bravo overpitches with mid-off inside the circle. Gill stays leg-side of the ball and thumps it over wide mid-off. One bounce and into the fence

Karn Sharma to Karthik, FOUR, moves leg-side evn before the ball is delivered does Karthik and that would have distracted the bowler. Karn Sharma fires one well down the leg-side and that's easy pickings for the skipper. Stays low and sweeps wide of the man at 45

Jadeja to Shubman Gill, FOUR, that's delicious. More air on this ball from Jadeja, Gill reaches out with a stride and gets to the pitch of the ball. Follows it up with a superb drive through extra cover

Jadeja to Karthik, FOUR, now DK tries the reverse sweep and manages to get some bat on it. Off the inside part, misses the batsman's pad and beats the short third man fielder too. The asking rate is below 6
Lungi Ngidi to Karthik, FOUR, all too easy. Ngidi doles out a short ball down leg and Karthik just helps it on its way. Pulled away to fine leg for another boundary

Dwayne Bravo to Karthik, FOUR, bowls a low full toss on the pads from round the wicket. A hit-me delivery. Flicked away very fine. Watson doesn't bother to put a dive. Why would you do that, when you already know the result

Dwayne Bravo to Karthik, FOUR, Karthik is just toying with the bowler. Well, Bravo hasn't been on target as well. Full toss on the pads, Karthik walks forward and flicks it over the square leg umpire's head

Dwayne Bravo to Karthik, FOUR, Karthik hits the winning runs. Slower ball wide of off, Karthik throws his bat at it and slices it wide of backward point, who put in the dive. Runs away to the fence and that's it. KKR win by 6 wickets!

Lungi Ngidi to Narine, FOUR, edged away! Full length delivery around middle and leg, Narine takes on the bowler, swings hard and gets an outside edge that flies over the slip cordon to find the fence. Every boundary Narine hits from here on will hurt Jadeja

Lungi Ngidi to Narine, FOUR, pulled away! He'll continue playing the same way, doesn't matter. Short length around around off, Narine clears his front leg again and pulls it over mid-wicket, beats the man in the deep with ease

Lungi Ngidi to Uthappa, FOUR, how quick is this outfield! Or is the timing by Uthappa? Fullish on the pads and Uthappa nicely flicks it through mid-wicket. Beats short mid-wicket and deep mid-wicket with his perfect timing on this flick

Watson to Narine, FOUR, another edge, another boundary! Was a full length delivery angled away from the batsman, Narine went hard at it, swung at it and got a thick outside edge that flew over gully this time. Hit out or get out, this is the only one way Narine knows

KM Asif to Narine, FOUR, Harbhajan Singh misfields! This is contagious. First Jadeja, now Bhajji. MS Dhoni would be livid with this. Was a full length delivery outside off, Narine went for a drive and got an outside edge towards third man where a misfield helped him with a boundary. Narine will be thanking CSK fielders for their generosity tonight

Watson to Shubman Gill, FOUR, how well has Gill played that? This was a short delivery and dipping into him. Gill adjusts well and pulls it nicely, beats deep square leg by some distance and gets off the mark

Watson to Shubman Gill, FOUR, that's called improvisation. Picks the length early again, goes back in his crease and guides this towards the third man fence. Opened the face of the bat real late and got a cheeky boundary

Watson to Shubman Gill, FOUR, that was in the air, but in the gap too. Ends the powerplay with a boundary, does Gill. Was short and wide outside off and Gill placed his square cut right into the gap between point and cover-point. End of a fruitful powerplay for KKR
Harbhajan to Rinku Singh, FOUR, what a way to greet a new bowler. Looped up delivery, but in the process overpitched, Rinku presses forward and chipped it inside-out over extra cover. Top shot

Harbhajan to Rinku Singh, FOUR, nicely done! Risky, but executed it so well. With a slip in place, Rinku employs the late-dab. Played very late and got it wide of the slip fielder. No third man to stop that

Harbhajan to Shubman Gill, FOUR, that's an incredible shot. Was a full ball and Gill doesn't get down to sweep. Can't call it as sweep. A half-sweep, half-whip. Powerfully hit through square leg. Raced away

Duminy to Gayle, FOUR, similar delivery but the field is slightly tinkered to Gayle. Sweeper cover was brought in and extra cover was moved back. Gayle knew it, so went deep and flashed it in the pocket between cover and backward point

Cutting to Nair, FOUR, some fortune for Nair. Walked across and tried to slog it across the line. Gets a thick top-edge and it flies away to the third man fence. The fielder was inside the ring and had no chance
Hardik Pandya to Stoinis, FOUR, Stoinis is playing a blinder for Punjab. Sees a short ball, backs away and bludgeons it powerfully wide of long-on. Evades the fielder comfortably
Hardik Pandya to Stoinis, FOUR, wow! This has been a morale-boosting over for Punjab. Banged short, at the stumps. Stoinis is too strong to miss out. Pulls it witheringly to the cow corner fence

Hardik Pandya to Gayle, FOUR, Gayle breaks free and this is his first attacking shot of the night, fraction too full and just outside off, Gayle gets his left leg out of the way, brings his bat down and thumps it back past the non-striker, one bounce and over the ropes

Hardik Pandya to Gayle, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Gayle, fraction too short and wide of off, Gayle backs away, gets his left leg out of the way and clatters it to the left of point, no stopping that

Hardik Pandya to Gayle, FOUR, three boundaries off the over and 16 came from it, too short and too wide from Hardik, can't bowl those lengths with third man in the ring, Gayle backs away and clears the fielder with the cut, one bounce and over the ropes
McClenaghan to Gayle, FOUR, Gayle has got going now, predictable delivery from McClenaghan, full and just outside off, Gayle gets forward and thumps it over mid-off, one bounce and over the ropes

Markande to Rahul, FOUR, nicely played by Rahul, too full and on the stumps, Rahul gets forward, doesn't bend down completely and plays a half-arm sweep past mid-wicket, bisects the two men in the deep to a nicety

Markande to Gayle, FOUR, this is excellent cricket, the wrong 'un from Markande, pitched well outside off and spun away, Gayle waited for the ball to do its bit, arched back and carved it over backward point, the fielder gave the chase, but the ball spun away past him and into the fence

Hardik Pandya to Gayle, leg byes, FOUR, sloppy from Ishan Kishan once again, low full-toss on Gayle's pads, he was looking to flick and missed, went fine and to the right of the keeper. Kishan was late on the dive and lets the ball slip through for four leg-byes

Stoinis to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, lovely stroke. Stoinis erred by gifting a low full toss on the pads, Suryakumar with that flourish of his wristed it away through square leg. Rajpoot was stationed well behind square and made a desperate attempt to get to the ball. In vain
Mujeeb to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, clubbed wide of long-on. It was in the air but Hardik got his placement right. On a good length from a flat trajectory, he gets under it and flays it away

Andrew Tye to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, Stoinis lets it through! Poor fielding and his Aussie teammate who is bowling won't be amused at all. Slower and fuller outside off, Hardik absolutely belted the drive but it shopuld have been cut off at sweeper cover. Instead it sneaks through Stoinis and crashes into the fence

Andrew Tye to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, good placement and timing to get Krunal off the mark. Finds the fence. Fuller ball on the pads, he shuffled across and flicked this well wide of the deep mid-wicket fielder who had lot of ground to cover

Stoinis to Rohit, FOUR, sublime stroke! Most people would have tried slogging this but not Rohit. Uses his timing and placement to find the fence. Full and wide outside off, unfurls the drive with finesse past a diving extra cover fielder. There wasn't any protection in the deep

Stoinis to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, an exact replica from Krunal and the runs are coming now. Full and wide outside off, slower ball but the width allows the southpaw to free his arms. Crashes it through extra cover and the man at sweeper is very wide

Stoinis to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, raining boundaries now! This is the over MI needed to turn this game around and Stoinis is bearing the brunt of it. Misses the yorker for the second time in as many deliveries and it's a full toss on the pads, easily chipped away aerially but well wide of short fine leg

Andrew Tye to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, not where he wanted to hit this but who cares? MI are cantering now. Slower and shortish, foxed Krunal for a moment but the length allowed him to adjust. Lobbed wide of backward point and it races away. Just 11 off 10 needed now!

Andrew Tye to Krunal Pandya, leg byes, FOUR, Mumbai are alive! They live on to fight another day this season. An anti-climax of a finish, slow yorker and Krunal missed the slog to be hit on the back leg. KXIP were busy appealing for LBW and the ball raced away to the fence. They didn't have any review to challenge the call anyway and so it meant that the game was settled

Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, that's been smuggled past Ashwin at mid-on. Slower ball yeah, and Suryakumar Yadav clips it safely wide of Ashwin there. Knew the chase, as lethargic as it'll be, will be more for the cameras. And it was..
Andrew Tye to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, so starts with a slower delivery that decks away and ironically allows Suryakumar Yadav the room to slap it off the back foot. Through extra cover
Axar to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, perfect length for Suryakumar Yadav. Not too full, not too short, so he could kneel and half-pull half-sweep that through fine leg
Stoinis to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, overpitched slower one and that's been burnt down to long-on. Absolutely drilled away with little respect

Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, more runs! Just the momentum MI were needing after a lull phase. Rajpoot errs on the shorter side and there is width as well, Suryakumar holds his shape and slaps the cut behind point. Fifty for SKY

Southee to Watson, FOUR, cracking shot! That is not the place to bowl to any batsman. Short, wide and outside off, just the delivery Watson would have liked to get him going, slapped the cut square on the off-side and opened his account in style

Southee to Watson, FOUR, even with a sweeper Watson collects a boundary. Southee is still searching for swing, pitches it up and Watson leans forward to caress the drive through cover. de Grandhomme gave up the chase early
de Grandhomme to Rayudu, FOUR, poor ball from de Grandhomme, short and angling into Rayudu's pads, he swivels across, rolls his wrists and pulls it behind square on the on-side for a boundary
Murugan Ashwin to Dhoni, FOUR, poor ball from Ashwin, drops his length short and well outside off, Dhoni is all over it like a rash, slaps it past cover and collects his first boundary

Southee to Rayudu, FOUR, slower delivery and Rayudu spotted that early, a much needed boundary for CSK that. Waited for the off-cutter, stood his ground and heaved it over mid-wicket. No chance for AB to pull it back in

Southee to Rayudu, FOUR, big over for CSK, 16 off it. Overpitched delivery and right in the slot for Rayudu, with the form he is, there is no missing out on such freebies, drills the drive wide of mid-off. Did Kohli err in giving Southee a third?

Chahal to Raina, FOUR, poor delivery from Chahal. Rank long hop and Raina had all the time in world to pick his spot, transfers his weight on the back foot and slots the pull past square leg, no chance for the man in the deep

U Yadav to Raina, FOUR, easy! That is well played by Raina. Short of length delivery, Raina shuffled across to get inside the line, picked it up from the middle stump line and tickled it fine. Runs starting to flow quite comfortably now

Willey to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, that's been so brilliantly placed. Short of length but it's just outside off, so escapes the ignominy of being a short-wide ball and adds to the genius of Brendon McCullum, who's nicely used his hands to glide it right between short third man and backward point

Lungi Ngidi to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, that's over mid-on. And comfortably. Seam-up back of a length ball that allows Parthiv Patel a cross-batted swat. Not right out of the middle but the shot thrust meant that it cleared the fielder
Lungi Ngidi to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, fuller and this has been deliciously chipped over mid-wicket. All timing. No show.

Harbhajan to de Grandhomme, FOUR, finds the fence! Much-needed one for RCB to break the shackles. de Grandhomme gets into the act. Used his feet to get to the pitch and what he did well was to go straight down the ground. Cannot afford to play across the line on this pitch and he does the smart thing. Hit it dead straight and Shardul from long-on did try to get to the ball but eventually missed it

Willey to Southee, FOUR, lucky runs but RCB will take them any way they come. Low full toss that Southee wanted to slug away on the leg-side. Gets an inside edge that just whizzes past leg stump. Too fine and short fine leg had no chance
Dwayne Bravo to Southee, FOUR, first ball for Bravo and he has been punished. Fuller ball outside off, Southee unfurls a cracking drive through extra cover. Finds the fence, 100 up for RCB finally

SN Thakur to Southee, FOUR, this is a very vital cameo from Southee, infusing respectability into the RCB innings. Funny shot though, walked across the sticks for the paddle scoop and instead skied it towards third man. Very fine and Ngidi tried to get to it, even got a hand on it but could only palm it to the ropes. Dropped!
SN Thakur to Kohli, FOUR, gee that's disrespectful. Transfers the weight on the front foot and flat-bats it over Thakur's head

Lungi Ngidi to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, and he makes me eat crow with a dismantling cover drive. Actually not even that. Far from it. A bit of room on this fuller length delivery and he's slapped it through covers. Threw his hands at it and somehow made it look like the prettiest thing you'll see today
Harbhajan to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, sliding on off-stump from round the wicket, and Parthiv Patel's greeted him with a reverse-sweep that he deftly places wide of the lone slipper

Harbhajan to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, top shot! Not much gap between backward point and short third man but Parthiv has found it. To begin with, there wasn't any width on offer as Harbhajan darted this around off, the southpaw still managed to get the cut away. Bhajji is not amused

Sandeep Sharma to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, crunched away! Short and wide outside off, Shaw throws his hands at it and crunches it through the gap at cover-point, races away to the fence in a jiffy. How good has he looked in his maiden IPL season!

Sandeep Sharma to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, a rare blip from Shikhar Dhawan in the field, you won't see this often because he's usually a good fielder. A dipping low full toss on off, Iyer smashes it down to long-off, Dhawan was pretty squarer and had to run across to his right. Did so and in the process, sort of took his eyes off the ball. Or got an awkward bounce too, failed to get his body behind the line of the ball and lets it through to the fence

S Kaul to Pant, FOUR, a welcome boundary for Pant, this should get him going. Kaul wafts it full outside off, Pant plonks his front foot forward and blasts it straight back at Kaul, who sticks his hand out but can't cling onto it. Brushes his fingertips and trickles away to the straight boundary. Umpire Bruce Oxenford had to take cover as it was coming at him

Bhuvneshwar to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, Shankar picks the leg-cutter on this occasion. Took a stride forward, opened his bat face and flayed it past point. Sweeper cover fielder couldn't get across and it runs away to the boundary

Sandeep Sharma to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, boundary to end the over. Short one on the pads and all Shaw has to do is help it on its way. Does so and drags it past the fielder at short fine leg, finds the fence and moves on to 28* with that, was the knuckle ball and Shaw picked it up nicely

Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, straight down the ground! Another slower delivery on a full length on middle, Iyer stays put and drives it straight back, almost takes down Shaw at the other end who takes evasive action and loses balance. Can't keep a fielder there as Iyer scores his first boundary
S Kaul to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, pulled away! He's looking to make the most of the powerplay. This was a short delivery around off, Shaw picked the length early and pulled it nicely over mid-wicket

S Kaul to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, Kaul is feeling the pressure. Struggling with his lines and lengths. Has tried the knuckle ball, the short one but nothing's going his way. This was on the pads and Shaw dragged it down to fine leg with ease

S Kaul to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, 20 runs off that Kaul over! Think this is Kaul's most expensive over of IPL 2018. Coming back to the ball it was a shortish one outside off, Shaw transfered his weight on to the back foot and crunched it through the gap at cover, two fielders went for the chase but none could stop that
