Rashid Khan to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, doesn't even spare Rashid Khan. Short one, probably the googly, Shaw camps back and pulls it well past the fielder at deep square leg

Shakib to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, that's a perfect example of a square cut. Was another short delivery outside off and Iyer was on to it in a flash. Rocks back and chops it right into the gap between point and cover-point

Avesh Khan to Hales, FOUR, lousy beginning from Avesh. Whangs in a short ball on leg-stump line, forgets the fine leg is inside the circle. Easy picking for Hales, swivels across and helps it over the man at 45. Didn't get it off the middle but enough to clear the fielder
Avesh Khan to Hales, FOUR, Hales is aware of the field. Perhaps realised another short ball was coming. Moved away to the leg-side, opened himself up and ramps it over short third man

Christian to Manish Pandey, FOUR, two fielders run across, see each other and neither go for the ball. Comical. Two overseas fielders - Roy and Boult. Was a low full toss and Pandey got underneath it to bunt it over the bowler's head. Long-on should have cut that off. Ordinary stuff!

Christian to Manish Pandey, FOUR, now these two boundaries have made a mess of Christian's figures. The length was shortened by Christian, Pandey danced out of his crease and slapped it through covers. In the gap and 13 came off that over
Boult to Y Pathan, FOUR, gold! Boult misses his mark. Doles out a wide-ish full ball and Pathan reaches out with hard hands. Sliced through backward point and that's gone for a boundary
Christian to Y Pathan, FOUR, just 2 needed now! Has to be SRH's game from here. Pacy bouncer and Pathan goes for the pull. Off the top-edge and goes over the man at short fine leg

Plunkett to Hales, FOUR, overcorrects and lands a fuller length delivery on the pads. Hales shuffled a bit and that must've put Plunkett off-guard. Moves inside the line and glances it very fine. The fielder was inside the ring and didn't have any chance

Plunkett to Dhawan, FOUR, Plunkett is spraying it all over the place. Misses the line and ends up offering a buffet ball for Dhawan down leg. Just needed to get some bat on that. Does so after a half-swivel and runs it down to the fine leg fence

Mishra to Dhawan, FOUR, that's a gift and Dhawan takes full toll of it. What was that from Mishra? Darts a full toss on the pads and Dhawan won't miss out on those. Bends his back leg and clouts it behind square leg. There's none to stop that

Bumrah to Chris Lynn, FOUR, edged and four, a second slip would have swallowed it, back of a length and in that channel outside off, Lynn pushed at that tamely, got a thick edge that flew past the lone slip

Bumrah to Chris Lynn, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Lynn and he's away, the slower ball from Bumrah, it was a back of a length delivery as well, Lynn spotted it early, got on top of the bounce and punched it through cover. Krunal Pandya gave the chase, but the ball sped away to the ropes
Cutting to Uthappa, FOUR, that's good anticipation. Knew Cutting will be slow and around off, so shuffles across on his knees and swept this through fine leg. Nicely done
Cutting to Uthappa, FOUR, another slower delivery. Not much to guess out there for Uthappa at the moment. Stays put and flashes the late cut in front of the backward point fielder. 79 off 51 needed

Cutting to Uthappa, FOUR, first fifty of the season for Uthappa. He's making a day out of Markande's drop. Another short ball, Uthappa stays front-footed and heaves that over mid-wicket. Gloriously weird shot
Cutting to Uthappa, FOUR, short and into his right shoulder, and here's what Uthappa does: Swivels and pulls it through fine leg. Life's ridiculously easy at times

Markande to A Russell, FOUR, that wasn't too short but look at Russell pin all his weight on the back foot, and deep in the crease, and swat it disparagingly wide of long-on. That fact that he had to summon the ball from outside off tells how powerful Russ is
Bumrah to Karthik, FOUR, short and wide, and pumped away with an uppish cut shot behind square on the off-side
Bumrah to Karthik, leg byes, FOUR, given as leg byes. Goes for the slower delivery but gets the radar wrong. Slipping down leg; beats the batsman and then the keeper too. 43 needed off 3 overs!
Hardik Pandya to Karthik, FOUR, good follow-up with the slower delivery but got the length wrong. And the line. Shortish outside off, allowing Karthik to stay back and flash it square on the off-side
Bumrah to Karthik, FOUR, misses the yorker by inches and that's good enough for DK. Went back and got under it, drilling it uppishly through a very straight long-on

Bumrah to Karthik, FOUR, Duminy drops it at deep square and then also lets it go for a boundary. Low full toss, Karthik got into a position early and swiveled the hack round the corner. It was right upto Duminy, who went for the reverse cup but lets it through. What's worse: it bounces once before the boundary ropes. Bad. Very bad
Krunal Pandya to Narine, FOUR, gee this is going south. Krunal has done nothing to allay fears. Bowls a full toss and is hammered down the ground. 19 off 5 needed
Krunal Pandya to Karthik, FOUR, wide full toss and Karthik's carved it over the infield square on the off-side

Bumrah to Chris Lynn, byes, FOUR, a hat-trick of boundaries ruins the over, lovely ball from Bumrah, cut back in sharply from a length outside off, Lynn was caught on the back-foot as he wafted, got beaten on the inside edge and the ball further swung away, leaving Ishan Kishan stranded

McClenaghan to Shubman Gill, FOUR, KKR are dealing in boundaries at the moment, tad too full and wide of off, Gill gets forward, closed the face of the bat and drives it in between the non-striker and the umpire, no need to run for those

McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, FOUR, this is turning out to be a fine start for KKR, too short and on the stumps, Lynn swivels across, rolls his wrists and pulls it behind square on the on-side, beat short fine and rolled away to the fence

McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, FOUR, cracking shot, this short-ball plan isn't working for MI, too short and just outside off, Lynn swivels across, rolls his wrists and pulls it in front of square on the on-side, the man in the deep is too square and has no chance
Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, FOUR, lovely, too full and too wide of off, allows Rana to free his arms as he scythes it past cover-point, off the mark with a boundary
Krunal Pandya to Nitish Rana, FOUR, cracking shot, the quicker ball from Krunal, but the length was short and wide of off, Rana backs away and beats the man at point with a fierce cut

Markande to Nitish Rana, FOUR, nicely played! Rana is looking a million dollars today, tossed up well outside off, Rana picked the length early, bent down low, rolled his wrists and swept it behind square on the on-side, beat the diving fielder in the deep

Krunal Pandya to Uthappa, FOUR, a gift and Uthappa accepts it with glee, full-toss outside off, all Uthappa had to do was to find the gap, he gets forward and drills it to the right of extra-cover, no chance for the fielder getting across from long-off

Cutting to Uthappa, FOUR, a gift and Uthappa will not miss out. Cutting lost his line as he attempted another slower ball, ends up drifting down the leg-side and all Uthappa had to do was to whip it into the gap - he does so, behind square on the on-side and MI continue to bleed boundaries

Prasidh to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, 134.3kph, short and wide outside off, Suryakumar Yadav spots the length quickly, gets on top of the bounce and cuts through point. Perfectly placed between backward point and cover-point. First boundary of the match

Chawla to Rohit, FOUR, fabulous shot! Wee bit of space offered from Chawla on this flighted delivery and that is enough for Rohit to put it away, strides forward and creams the drive through cover. The timing ensures that sweeper is also beaten

Chawla to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, dropped! Narine got fingertips to it. Floated up around off, Yadav stayed leg-side to play the inside out loft, didn't get the elevation he was looking for and Narine parried it over him. A more agile fielder might have taken it

A Russell to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, the elder Pandya has made his intentions clear. Anything there to be hit, he's going for it. Short and slanted across off, Pandya transfers his weight back and pulls it over mid-wicket. No protection in the deep there

Prasidh to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, slapped! In trying to shorten the length Krishna offers width outside off, Pandya stands tall and cracks the cut square on the off-side, raced away quickly beating sweeper cover

Prasidh to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, the last two deliveries ruins the over for Krishna and KKR. Superb batting though from Pandya. Shuffled across and paddled the back of a length delivery over and wide of short fine leg. Just used the pace of the bowler

Prasidh to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, streaky! This is a cruel game. Krishna deceived the batsman with a good slower delivery, Pandya was through the shot and the outside edge bisects Karthik and short third man perfectly

Prasidh to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, if he is going to bowl the wide yorker, then third man needs to be back. Yes, it was a bottom edge but the bowler and captain need to be smart, Pandya reached out with a bent back knee and squirted it off the toe-end to the fence
Johnson to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, over-corrects by overpitching outside off. Suryakumar Yadav won't miss those. Leans into the drive and caresses it through covers. Raced away

Johnson to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, there's the width and there's the slash to follow that. Bullets away. The length was perfect to be hit. Shortish and angling away, Suryakumar Yadav stands tall and cuts it fiercely through backward point

Narine to Lewis, FOUR, didn't time it well, but manages to fetch a boundary. This was bowled fuller and Lewis went hard on the drive. He probably wanted to go through mid-off and got it off the inside edge. Beats mid-on by a long way and once it beat him, the quick outfield did the rest
Narine to Lewis, FOUR, nothing wrong on this occasion from Lewis. Saw the length on the shorter side, quickly rocked back and cut it ferociously beating the cover fielder to his left

Chawla to Lewis, FOUR, four more! It was the googly from Chawla, not sure if Lewis picked it. He went through with his lofted drive and slices it off the outside half. Over the cover region and that dribbles away over the bouindary rope

Chawla to Lewis, FOUR, got to feel for the bowler. Bamboozled Lewis with another googly and Lewis was caught in his crease looking to block. Takes the outside edge and races away to the third man fence

Nitish Rana to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, that's a terrific shot! Wristy shot. Fired on leg and Suryakumar Yadav had his back leg off-air while he made contact. Whipped powerfully and finds the gap between long-on and deep mid-wicket. Raced away

Nitish Rana to Lewis, FOUR, how did that go for a boundary. Rana saw the batsman back away and fired a yorker, Lewis brings his bat down a touch late and manages to get a toe-end on it. Luckily for the batter, misses the stumps and runs away to third man for another boundary

Nitish Rana to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, 16 runs off the over! Another glorious shot. Bottom hand power. Shimmies down the track, converts into a half-vollet and Suryakumar Yadav drove it exquisitely through extra cover. All along the carpet and into the fence. 82/0 after 8 overs!

Kuldeep Yadav to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, wow! That was superbly played. Wasn't a bad ball from Kuldeep Yadav. A good length ball on off, Suryakumar Yadav went deep in his crease and that allowed him to free his arms. Plays the back-cut perfectly to beat a diving backward point fielder to his left. Third man was inside the circle as well
Jofra Archer to Gayle, FOUR, Gayle wants to show who is the boss here. He backs away, goes on the top of the bounce and punches it though cover for a four

Unadkat to Stoinis, FOUR, just past a flying Buttler to his right! Excellent bowling from Unadkat, totally bamboozled Stoinis with this off cutter and induced a thick edge on the drive. Buttler did all he could with a dive to his right but couldn't reach it. Raced away fine to the third man fence

Jofra Archer to Stoinis, FOUR, slammed away! Archer just misses his yorker and ends up dishing out a low full toss. Width on offer too and this is crashed past a diving extra cover. Sweeper cover ain't stopping this

Unadkat to Rahul, FOUR, more runs! Unadkat is being taken to the cleaners here. Came round the wicket and actually got his line right but Rahul is in such a mood that he will put even the good ones away. Makes room by backing away and steers it to find the gap. Bisects short third man and backward point with ease

Jofra Archer to Rahul, FOUR, fittingly a Rahul signature cover drive to finish the game. He's been fantastic tonight and has calmly ensured an easy win for KXIP. Overcooked from Archer and it's been creamed away off the front foot. Long-off had no chance of cutting it off. KXIP return to winning ways
Gowtham to Rahul, FOUR, Rahul backs away and cuts it to the right of cover for a four. Excellent timing and placement!
Gowtham to Rahul, FOUR, cheeky from Rahul. He brings out the reverse sweep and plays it fine of the short third man for a four
Gowtham to Rahul, FOUR, He is timing the ball really well. Rahul goes inside the line of the ball and slog sweeps it over short fine leg for a boundary
Jofra Archer to Gayle, FOUR, brute power! Fuller in length from Jofra Archer this time, Gayle clears his front leg and absolutely smashes it wide of the mid-off fielder for a four

Stokes to Nair, FOUR, throws his bat at a wide one and sends a thick edge wide of Rahane at second slip. Good effort from Shreyas Gopal at third man to cover a lot of ground to his left, but he fumbled a touch while on the dive and it runs away for a boundary
Stokes to Nair, FOUR, terrific shot, Nair portrays his class. It was a fuller length ball at the stumps, Nair brings his bat down gun-barrel straight and drives it straight down the ground for a four
Shreyas Gopal to Rahul, FOUR, touch short and Rahul makes full use of it. He goes deep in the crease and pulls it to the deep mid-wicket fence for a four

Anureet Singh to Rahul, FOUR, that shot had class written all over it. He waited and waited for the ball to come and just opens the bat face at the last moment, timing was perfect and so was placement. Ball beats the short third man fielder for a four
Ashwin to Buttler, FOUR, that's easy for Buttler! Bowls short and outside off, Buttler lets his lovely hands take over. Crisply punched through covers. CYA LATER
Rajpoot to Buttler, FOUR, Buttler is such a dangerous player at the top and this is why? Gets a short ball outside off, he half-swivels and pulls nonchalantly over mid-wicket. No-one there

Rajpoot to Buttler, byes, FOUR, unlucky for the bowler but Buttler and RR won't mind. Shuffled miles across his off-stump to try the funky paddle-scoop over the keeper, but Rajpoot sprayed it too far outside off to foil his plans, result? It flies past the helpless keeper
Rajpoot to Buttler, FOUR, short and wide, Buttler lashes that behind point. Gee, he's hit that with some power. Third man ain't getting there

Ashwin to Stokes, FOUR, sweet sound on that cracking shot by Stokes. This was pushed through outside off by Ashwin and Stokes was quick to camp back and slam it to the right of long-off. Beats the man chasing it with utter ease

Mujeeb to Stokes, FOUR, is it Stokes' night? Looking at the way he's played so far, definitely looks like. This was a flat delivery and full in length outside off, Stokes went for the reverse sweep and got it right past the fielder at short third man

Mujeeb to Buttler, FOUR, successive fifties for Buttler. Moving up the order is certainly doing wonders for him. Short and wide outside off, Buttler camps back and cuts it through the gap at cover point

Rajpoot to Gowtham, FOUR, misfield by Mujeeb results in a boundary. Rajpoot isn't pleased one bit with the effort and has his hands on his hips. This was a short and wide delivery that was cut to square third man by Gowtham. Mujeeb guarding that region lets it through and gifts four runs to the opposition

Rajpoot to R Tripathi, FOUR, won't be able to stop this though. Short again and outside off, Tripathi makes the most of the provided width and cuts it in the same direction once again. Mujeeb sprints to his right but the ball is too quick for him

Andrew Tye to Shreyas Gopal, FOUR, that shot was all about timing. How quickly it ran away to the fence, quite surprising. A low full toss on leg and Gopal times his on-drive. Mayank at long-on tried hard to cut this down but couldn't stop the boundary

Rajpoot to Shreyas Gopal, FOUR, these are useful runs for Royals. They'll take it and Gopal is playing a sweet little cameo here. A full length delivery outside off and the batsman slices it over point and gets a boundary

Rajpoot to Shreyas Gopal, FOUR, four more! Drags the length back and bowls a slower one outside off, Gopal goes after it with hard hands and gets an outside edge. Eludes the man at short third man and gets back-to-back boundaries
Rajpoot to Buttler, FOUR, not again! Another short delivery in Buttler's arc, he transfers his weight onto the back foot and smashes the hell out of that leather over mid-wicket
Mujeeb to Buttler, FOUR, Buttler is pouncing on anything short. He opens up his stance slightly to give himself enough leverage on the off-side, jumps back and clatters it past extra cover
Ashwin to Samson, FOUR, dished wide of off-stump, Samson frees his arms and clobbers it past backward point

Axar to Samson, FOUR, half-volley outside off, Samson's back lift is so high that it allows him to cream those drives through extra cover. Advantage Samson when you bowl full. Timed and placed to perfection...

Andrew Tye to Buttler, FOUR, more than 80 percent of Buttler's runs have come off short deliveries so far. KXIP aren't learning. To make matters worse, Tye sprays it down leg and all Buttler needed to do was help it on its way. Karun Nair dives, but all of that sliding effort goes in vain

Bhuvneshwar to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, beautiful shot! The inswinger from Bhuvneshwar but it's a touch too straight. Parthiv flicks it elegantly through in front of square on the leg-side and beats the fielder in the ring. Races away

Bhuvneshwar to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, finds the gap this time. Just past a diving mid-on to his right. Fuller ball attacking the stumps, forced away off the front foot past the bowler. Once it beat the infield, it was always going to the fence
Rashid Khan to Moeen Ali, FOUR, flashes at this googly turning away from him and the edge zooms over slip. Dhawan barely had any time to get his hands up

S Kaul to Moeen Ali, FOUR, two boundaries for Moeen so far, one off the outside edge and this one off the inside. Almost chopped it back onto off-stump. Back of length outside off, loosely wafts at it with cemented feet and gets lucky

Sandeep Sharma to Mandeep, FOUR, oh this is not good from Siddarth Kaul. A good over is spoiled as he lets the ball slip through his hands at the boundary. Back of length, Mandeep drags his pull through mid-wicket wide of the deep fielder. Should still have only been two at most. But Kaul couldn't get a hand on it while tumbling to his left
Bhuvneshwar to de Grandhomme, FOUR, good yorker from Bhuvneshwar, but he has to watch in agony as de Grandhomme's toe-edge runs away past short third man
Shakib to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, nails this one. Parthiv is keen to take Shakib on. Sees it floated up into the left-hander and launches the slog-sweep over mid-wicket. Clean strike

Shakib to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, hammered away. Parthiv is on a roll here. Baffling though to see KW hand the ball to a left-arm spinner in the Powerplay with the ball not really turning. Fuller ball around middle and leg, lofted cleanly over mid-on and it races away to the fence

Bhuvneshwar to Kohli, FOUR, the signature Virat Kohli cover drive! Short cover got a hand on it, mid-off tried to get to his left and put in a slide but it beat them both en route to the fence. Too full from Bhuvneshwar and it's creamed away off the front foot
Shakib to Kohli, FOUR, mowed away over mid-wicket. Kohli has had enough of plodding around. Sees this arm ball on a good length and clobbers it over mid-wicket. Easily over the infield

Shakib to Kohli, FOUR, got it finer than he intended to but he won't mind. Flatter and closer to off, executes the late cut and it dribbles away off the outer half. Beats short third man easily and speeds to the fence

S Kaul to Kohli, FOUR, new bowler but the strategy from Kohli continues to be the same - attack! Charges down the track early and plays his favorite pick-up stroke over mid-wicket. Rashid in the deep had a bit of ground to cover and tried hard but in vain. The RCB skipper is pumped up, that's for sure

Rashid Khan to Kohli, FOUR, goes through KW's hands at first slip! Is this the game for SRH? Massive moment in the game. Kohli plays this leg break off the back foot and ends up edging it straight to his opposition counterpart. Williamson didn't expect it to come so quickly perhaps and it went through him to the fence
U Yadav to Dhawan, FOUR, picks the slower delivery and pulls wide of mid-wicket. On the front foot too, with the weight going forward, hit the gap perfectly and it raced away
Chahal to Williamson, FOUR, poor delivery to follow. Very short, Williamson had all the time to rock back and pull. Chooses his area and gets it wide of CdG at deep square. Should've dived but didn't

de Grandhomme to Shakib, FOUR, CdG comes on and serves up a short and wide delivery outside off, again Shakib shows off his cutting skills. Plays it late and gets it to the right of backward point. No chance for third man who is pretty square, well placed
U Yadav to Williamson, FOUR, anything drifting into the pads is easy for Williamson. He glances and gives fine leg no chance. Poor from Yadav
U Yadav to Williamson, FOUR, mid-off is in and Williamson goes over extra-cover, slower delivery outside off, Williamson waits and waits, before lofting into the gap. He is getting a move on now
Siraj to Shakib, FOUR, backward square is in and Shakib splits him and short fine leg, with a heave. Length ball on off, thick inside edge is enough to go into the gap

Siraj to Shakib, FOUR, brilliant improvisation. Takes it from middle and scoops wide of short fine. Nothing wrong from Siraj who attempted the yorker, didn't nail it and it was the cleverness of Shakib that outwitted him there

Southee to Y Pathan, FOUR, Pathan knows what is coming. Gets inside the line to this short of length delivery, pulls over and wide of short fine, races away. Southee became to predictable there. Needs to bowl the yorker
Southee to Y Pathan, FOUR, no he doesn't. A slower ball short bouncer, at the head of Pathan, who hooks and gets it fine of Parthiv Patel, no chance for him. Successive fours and poor from Southee

U Yadav to Hales, FOUR, full on off, Hales goes through with the loft and even though he didn't get it off the middle of the bat had enough power to clear the fielder at mid-off. The extra ball goes for four and the SRH crowd including actor Venkatesh are on their feet
Southee to Williamson, FOUR, easy for Williamson. He is a class player. A gift from Southee, down leg, with fine leg inside the circle, a beautiful leg-glance and Williamson is off the mark with four

Southee to Williamson, FOUR, Southee got that wrong. Tried something different with the slower delivery, floated it up full and wide outside off, Williamson crashed the drive wide of mid-off. Left everyone motionless. Replays show that it was the knuckle ball from Southee, went wrong
Moeen Ali to Shakib, FOUR, that's a good cut. Dangerous but Shakib plays late and takes it from off, delays the shot to get it wide of the diving Umesh at short third. Much needed boundary for SRH

Moeen Ali to Shakib, FOUR, beautiful batting. Down the pitch and to the flight of the ball, lofted clean over Moeen Ali and bisects the two men on the straight boundary. Brings the crowd back into life
Gowtham to Rahul, FOUR, Rahul responds by coming down the track, he reaches the line of ball and lofts it over cover for a four

Gowtham to Rahul, byes, FOUR, it's a Test pitch now. Or seems like it. Spins in from outside off, sneaks through Rahul's drive away from the body and misses off-stump by a whisker - in the way also beating Buttler to his left

Anureet Singh to Axar, FOUR, heaved away. That kinda slower delivery that gives away its cards early because it's been pitched on a length. Axar delays his cross-batted mow and picks a boundary through wide long-on. Uppish and safe

Anureet Singh to Rahul, FOUR, leg cutter and Rahul's smashed him off the front foot. Shortish, decking away, and hammered through mid-wicket with utter disadain. Another day at work, another fifty for Rahul
Unadkat to Rahul, FOUR, fetches it from outside off and heaves it between mid-wicket and long-on. Shuffled just a bit from leg to off, got behind the line and let his bottom hand take over

Jofra Archer to Rahul, FOUR, not great cricket overall, except from Jofra Archer. Bowled the slower one that spins away, Rahul looked ungainly while chipping this, because he was aiming cow corner. Just manages to clear mid-off, and there's Unadkat in the deep, sliding with the ball into the ropes..

Jofra Archer to Rahul, FOUR, oh that's another stunner from Rahul. Shuffled across and timed his pick-up scoop just right. Not easy if that's almost a yorker from Jofra Archer. Perhaps an inch short but how good was Rahul, laying into it like it's a right he's earned
Jofra Archer to Rahul, FOUR, this boundary means that 32 is required off the last over. Rahul gets into the scoop position again, and ramps this up over short fine leg
Unadkat to Rahul, FOUR, now he's opened his stance completely here. Chest facing the bowler as he reverses this over short third man
Unadkat to Rahul, FOUR, another similar open-chested reverse-hack over short third man but unfortunately, it's not enough for KXIP. Rajasthan Royals win by 15 runs
Stokes to Rahul, FOUR, Rahul latches on anything loose, he absolutely does. It was a fuller length delivery outside off, Rahul reaches for it and slams the drive over point
Stokes to Rahul, FOUR, treat to watch! Good length delivery outside off, Rahul gets into good position and drives it sumptuously through cover, raced away all along the carpet

Lomror to Akshdeep Nath, FOUR, excellent shot from Akshdeep Nath. This will give him some confidence. He comes down the track and at the same time makes room for himself to loft it over deep cover for a handsome boundary
Lomror to Rahul, FOUR, touch short, Rahul picks up the length quickly, goes deep in the crease and pulls it through deep mid-wicket for a four

Stoinis to Buttler, FOUR, 135.7kph. Strays. Feeds the pads, trying out the surprise inswinger after the set up with a couple of away ones, gets it wrong and Buttler is quick to whip, neatly behind square
Stoinis to Buttler, FOUR, oh the punch. Walks down, gets behind the line, on top of the good length, and straight bats, down the ground
Axar to Buttler, FOUR, gets the width, makes it look worse moving away and inside-outs it over extra cover. Ah, the delight of watching him open

Axar to Buttler, FOUR, very, very poor effort from Tye. Too lazy to bend down and Axar is not happy at all. Slashed wide of long-off, Tye moves across to his left, went with one-hand pretty late and ends up letting it roll away to the fence

Ashwin to Samson, FOUR, 50-stand comes up between the duo. Overdoes the carrom ball. Short, wide and width for the taking, Samson accepts it with glee and slaps it past cover-point. No sweeper cover and it'll be a boundary

Ashwin to Stokes, FOUR, biceps and triceps. Wrists and fists from Stokes. Gets into business by backing away to leg and hammers it over the bowler's head. So powerful! Picked the safest spot in the ground as well
Andrew Tye to Lomror, FOUR, oh, this will do for the Royals. Finally, Lomror gets some bat. Goes low and scoops this full ball at the stumps over short fine leg

Mohit Sharma to Buttler, FOUR, 134.6kph. Warms up with a rather innocuous back of a length sitter. Buttler doesn't need any further warming up though. He stays up tall, rocking back and flat-bats. Hard. Crunched through mid-wicket
Mohit Sharma to Rahane, FOUR, third man isn't there. Rahane has a measure of it, and holds his cut back. Waits, lets it get close and chops it to pierce slip and short third, to perfection
Mohit Sharma to Buttler, FOUR, 134.1kph. So damn deft. A seam up outside off, and Buttler, lines himself up, opening his bat face very late, just to guide it through the cordon. The empty cordon
Andrew Tye to Buttler, FOUR, overcooked on the legs. And Buttler owns him, all bottom-hand in this whippy on-drive. He knows there's no long-on, and he bisects the ones inside the ring to perfection

Andrew Tye to Buttler, FOUR, further dismissive. Tye overcorrects his line, goes outside off, but the length remains just as friendly. Matters taken over the covers now, leg-bent, hands flowing and creaming it one-bounced
Mujeeb to Buttler, FOUR, sprays it down leg. Buttler's quick to latch on, swivelling, swiping flat and hammering it fine

McClenaghan to Narine, FOUR, just over. For a second Narine would have had his heart in his mouth. The full length delivery from McClenaghan, Narine stays leg-side and toe-ends the loft over Rohit at mid-off. He was standing well inside the circle. Had he been on the edge, he would have gobbled that up

McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, FOUR, streaky! But Lynn won't mind it. He's off the mark with a boundary. The idea from McClenaghan is to push it across the right-hander, Lynn throws everything at the drive and the outside edge runs away fine

McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, FOUR, now on the other side of the ground. McClenaghan needs to stick to one plan. Short and on leg-stump, Lynn didn't go hard on the pull, just relied on placing it fine and pocketing a boundary

Hardik Pandya to Tom Curran, FOUR, streaky! Once again Curran plays down the wrong line. He wanted to punch the back of a length delivery and got an inside edge, the ball flies over the stumps and goes away to the fine leg fence
Bumrah to Rinku Singh, FOUR, short of length delivery angled away outside off, Rinku Singh delightfully ramps it over slip. Lovely touch
Cutting to Tom Curran, FOUR, short of length, sits up for Curran who whacks it away through mid-wicket. Dismissive pull shot
Cutting to Chawla, FOUR, awful delivery. Short of length ball down leg, Chawla helps it away past the keeper
Markande to Tom Curran, FOUR, he's done well to make the contact he's made. Floated up very wide, Curran reaches out and belts the flat-batted drive wide of long-off

McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, FOUR, McClenaghan has lost the plot a bit against Lynn. Goes short and at the body, no pace this time and Lynn is able to pick his spot, swivels around and places the pull backward of square. All along the ground

Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, FOUR, nice way to start the over. Rana gets a leg-stump half volley and he puts it away nonchalantly, leans forward and flicks it backward of square leg, fine leg was inside the ring and the man in the deep was square

Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, FOUR, bisected Ishan Kishan and wide slip to perfection. The off-cutter from Pandya and Rana read it early, waited back in his crease, opened the bat face and glided it right between the two fielders

Markande to Karthik, FOUR, smacked! Karthik needs to get on with the game. Tossed up on off and middle, Karthik bents his back knee and powers the sweep in front of square, splitting deep backward square and deep mid-wicket

A Russell to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, he's in sublime touch and couldn't have got off with a better shot. This was short and wide outside off, Suryakumar makes the most of the provided width and slaps it past the man at point. Was timed well and raced away to the fence in no time.

Chawla to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, Ishan Kishan is going to play his shots. Premeditated and makes good contact. A powerful reverse-sweep and strikes cleanly. Got it over short third man and there is no one to stop that
Chawla to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, nicely done! Fullish ball, Ishan Kishan gets down and paddle-sweeps it behind square leg

Chawla to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, in the air, in the gap and that's Ishan Kishan's third boundary in this over. Once again, Chawla bowls one on the shorter side and Kishan went back to heave. Didn't quite get it off the middle, but the placement was right

A Russell to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, glorious shot! Full and outside off, was probably overpitched and Ishan Kishan pounced on it. Crouches low, reaches out and powerfully cracks it through extra cover. Raced away
Prasidh to Rohit, FOUR, edged and four! The Mumbai captain saw the width outside off and slashed his bat hard. Takes the edge and runs away to the third man fence

Prasidh to Rohit, FOUR, miscued pull and the lightning quick outfield ensures that it is a boundary. Got to feel for the bowler. Bowled two good balls and both have gone for fours. Banged it short and got good lift, cramped Rohit for room. Rohit, despite not being in a good position, went for the pull. Got decent wood and more importantly it went in the gap between deep mid-wicket and long-on

Prasidh to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, nothing wrong about this shot. Picked the short ball got early, gets into a strong position shuffling across and elevates it over backward square leg with his front foot off air. Pulled away!
Chawla to Cutting, FOUR, now a four. Another fast-paced delivery, Cutting swings hard and makes good contact. Goes into the cow corner fence

Tom Curran to Lewis, FOUR, cracking shot! Sweet sound on that blow. Full length delivery outside off, Lewis doesn't miss out and crunches this one through the gap at cover. Was in the air for a while but no fielder was anywhere near

Tom Curran to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, ahh, the form he is in! Lovely shot by Surya there. Was a length delivery outside off, Suryakumar waited for it and opened the face of the bat real late. Gets it past the man at wide slip to find the third man fence

Narine to Lewis, FOUR, beats Russell's sprint. Another example of how quick this outfield is. Even the fastest runner in KKR couldn't reach anywhere close to this. Was a short delivery outside off, Lewis was quick to rock back and crack it to the wide of long-off. That boundary will spoil Narine's over

Prasidh to Lewis, FOUR, wasn't middled. Pitched up on a full length outside off, Lewis shuffles a bit and gives it all. Throws his bat at it and gets the outside edge beat the man at third man. No chance of stopping that
Chawla to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, what a poor delivery to start off. Gifts a juicy full toss on middle and leg, Yadav gets down on his knee and sweeps it over square leg

Chawla to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, this was even better. A full and tossed up delivery around off, Yadav strides forward and lofts it to perfection over extra-cover. His confidence is high and that shot will make him feel even better
Kuldeep Yadav to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, the boundaries from Suryakumar continue to flow. On the pads and the batsman does well to get down and sweep it sweetly to the fine leg fence

Sandeep Sharma to Roy, FOUR, uppish and just past the diving cover fielder! Dhawan tried but it was past him in a flash. Fullish ball and Roy was committed on the drive, doesn't bother to keep it down but the good thing was that he found the gap

S Kaul to Pant, FOUR, another poor delivery. He's struggling with his lines and lengths tonight. Bowls a short one again but on the pads, easy for the batsman to help it on its way to the square leg fence with an easy whip. No fielder anywhere close to cut this down

Rashid Khan to Pant, FOUR, Pant is playing a gem here. Delhi need him to play a few of these. Flat and quick around off, Pant premeditates and reverse sweeps it through short third man. Was a well played shot by the southpaw

Rashid Khan to Pant, FOUR, successive boundaries for Pant. This was full on middle and leg, Pant gets down and goes for a sweep, gets a glove to it and manages to evade short fine leg this time around

Rashid Khan to Pant, FOUR, that's the third boundary of the over. Pant is showing no mercy against Rashid. Another short delivery down the leg side, Pant does well to drag it down to the long-leg fence. 15 runs of that over and Pant moves into the 40s
Sandeep Sharma to Pant, FOUR, easy pickings for the batsman. On the pads and can't get any easier for Pant who glances it past short fine. Needs one boundary more to reach his fifty
Shakib to Pant, FOUR, another impressive hit by Pant. Comes down the wicket, converts the length into a full one and hammers it past Shakib. That raced away to the fence in no time
Rashid Khan to Pant, FOUR, he has all range of strokes in his kitty. Brings in the reverse sweep into play and gets it over the point fence on a couple of bounces
Bhuvneshwar to Pant, FOUR, on to 90* is Pant. On a length outside off, Pant throws his hands at it and smacks it over the cover fence, on a few bounces and into the fence

Bhuvneshwar to Pant, FOUR, amazing shot that. Was a length ball outside off, Pant does well to ramp this over short third man. The ball is just flying all over the place, to all the corners. Awestruck by this display of batsmanship!

S Kaul to Pant, FOUR, that's Pant's maiden century in the IPL. Has missed out on a few occasions previously but doesn't miss out tonight. Gets a full toss around off and makes sure to muscle it over mid-wicket with all his might. Gets to the milestone and celebrates in style. Maxwell gives him a tight hug!
S Kaul to Maxwell, FOUR, first one of the night for Maxwell. Another full toss around off, Maxwell stays put and smacks it right past the bowler, intercepts long-off and long-on to perfection

Bhuvneshwar to Pant, FOUR, have run out of adjectives to describe this masterclass by Pant. Was a full length delivery around off, Pant gets into position early and scoops it over short third man with an angled bat
Bhuvneshwar to Pant, FOUR, how easy? Similar to the previous shot. An exact replica. A fullish one around off, Pant is quick to get into position and scoop it over short third man once again

Bhuvneshwar to Roy, FOUR, smart batting! Roy has sussed the pitch and decides to go straight with his aggressive shots. Pays off instantly. A touch fuller from Bhuvneshwar and it's been launched straight over the bowler's head

Shakib to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, excellent footwork from Shaw! This wasn't all that full but he came down the track in a flash and lofted it over Shakib's head. Mid-on was a mere spectator. Top stroke! Not a bad ball at all, just a top shot
S Kaul to Pant, FOUR, that's a typical Pant stroke! Back of a length and a bit of width on offer. He throws his hands to slam it on the up and finds the gap at cover as well. Raced away in a flash

S Kaul to Pant, FOUR, does it again!' Squarer this time, result is the same. Short again from Kaul and more width on offer, he stands tall to force it away through backward point. Finds the gap once more. Pant is intent on taking it on

S Kaul to Pant, FOUR, flashy runs this time but another boundary! Three in a row for Pant who isn't going to die wondering. Round the wicket from Kaul and angles this into the left-hander, it's a drive with hard hands and the edge flies past the diving Goswami to the fence
Boult to Hales, FOUR, back of a length ball and that's been swatted away. Rocks back, opens his stance and swivels a boundary through mid-wicket
Harshal Patel to Hales, FOUR, back of a length but there's enough room outside off. Hales makes some of his own and punches it behind point. Softly done

Harshal Patel to Hales, FOUR, that's no way soft. No way near to soft. Back of a length again and this time Harshal Patel angles it in. Umm, only for Hales to swivel and pull that round the corner. Used that incoming angle to his advantage, does Hales

Mishra to Dhawan, FOUR, now Dhawan was almost hoodwinked in the air. Mishra saw him charging down and bowled it slow down leg. But Dhawan was upto it. Would have been stumped otherwise. Gets some bat and deflects it wide of the keeper

Harshal Patel to Dhawan, FOUR, he's read this slower ball! gosh he has. Slow and short, Dhawan stays on the front foot as he mauls this over deep mid-wicket. Raises his bat to a fifty but we are left wanting for the pat-thigh-Mo'-twirl celebration
Maxwell to Dhawan, FOUR, there's no mercy in the world for things that're short. In cricket too. Dhawan rocks back and smashes the pull through square leg

Boult to Williamson, FOUR, is welcomed to the crease with a boundary. Kiwi to Kiwi and Williamson greets him with a flick of his wrists to the fence and brings up his fifty as well. Superbly constructed knock from the SRH skipper, waves his bat to the dug-out. His 6th half-century of the season. It was too leg-sidish from Boult, Williamson moved across and wristed it nonchalantly through square leg. In the gap!
Boult to Williamson, FOUR, Boult is not learning. Sprays another full ball and it ends up as a half-volley again. Drilled fluently square on the off-side
Harshal Patel to Dhawan, FOUR, this boundary brings the 150-run stand between the duo. Harmless length delivery outside off, no mercy whatsoever. Dhawan leans across and bashes it over extra cover
Plunkett to Williamson, FOUR, Plunkett ends his spell with a four. He has taken quite a beating today. Overpitches this time, Williamson accepts the gift with glee and drills it through extra cover

Boult to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan moves into the nineties. Short, aiming at the body. No problems for Dhawan, who gets into a strong position and pulls it witheringly through mid-wicket. No chance for the fielder in the deep

Boult to Williamson, FOUR, game, set and match - SRH. Williamson finishes things off in style. Slanting on middle and leg, KW gets across and whips it over square leg to take SRH into the Playoffs. No-one in the deep and it'll be a boundary

Harshal Patel to Dhawan, FOUR, Harshal Patel has bowled exactly like he didn't need to. Got it right first ball but not this time. Pacy ball wide of off, and Dhawan's scorched it away through point. Free swing of the arms and poof, the ball disappears

Plunkett to Williamson, FOUR, Harshal at square third man can't get to it. Played much finer by Williamson this time, opening the bat face and slicing it just wide of the keeper. No pace lost here. Plunkett bowling them at over 140 clicks and Williamson ensuring that they run to the fence as quick. Conservation of pace
Boult to Dhawan, FOUR, length ball and a front-footed Dhawan mows it over mid-on. No shame in conceding a boundary to that

Mishra to Williamson, FOUR, slowish leg break and that's a feeder to Williamson's glory. Opens the punch and splits it between backward point and short third man. Mishra isn't happy but pretty sure he wouldn't have been able to field it either. Pretty sure.
Vijay Shankar to Dhawan, FOUR, over mid-off. And by a long way. Goes through the line and lofts it disdainfully there
Mishra to Dhawan, FOUR, ala laser beam. Ues his feet and drills that straight down the ground
Plunkett to Williamson, FOUR, he's gawked at Plunkett's release and read the slower delivery. Full too, so he's knelt and drilled that drive through extra cover

Plunkett to Williamson, FOUR, "that's terrible, I am sorry," says Bishop on air. Another full slower delivery from Plunkett. He's not giving up on the plan. And Williamson, not for the first time this over, creams the drive past the diving mid-off fielder

Gowtham to Rayudu, FOUR, that is the form talking. Shimmies down and though he isn't close to the pitch of the ball, but still goes through with the loft over extra cover, one bounce and over the fence

Ankit Sharma to Rayudu, FOUR, Rayudu has decided to play his shots in the powerplay. The ball was come on nicely and that is the best time to score. Dances down and lofts it straight back over Ankit, Gowtham does well to get across from long-on and get a hand to it, but the ball still rolls into the ad cushions

Ankit Sharma to Watson, FOUR, freebie and Watson accepts it gleefully. Short and sliding down leg, Watson crouches low with a bent knee and sweeps it powerfully backward of square leg, split the two fielders there to collect his first boundary

Gowtham to Raina, FOUR, that's nicely done. Goes back in the crease, picks the length early on the short one and helps it down to the fine leg fence. Short third tried hard to cut it down but it's a lightning quick outfield

Jofra Archer to Watson, FOUR, edged but safe! So unlucky for the bowler. Bowls a pacy short delivery around off, Watson goes hard at it with a pull but a thick top edge eludes the keeper to find the fence

Stokes to Billings, FOUR, that's an impressive drive. Only the second delivery he's facing, superb stuff. Fullish delivery, slower in pace too, Billings reads it well and creams his drive and gets it past wide mid-off

Jofra Archer to Dhoni, FOUR, no he doesn't. Was a good delivery fired into the blockhole, Dhoni went after it with a huge swing, got an inside edge, past the stumps and past short fine leg to meet the fence

Stokes to Billings, FOUR, boundaries in succession. Billings finally gets one right. Stokes bowled a shortish delivery and his team mate did well to connect his pull, beats the diving fielder at deep square leg
Stokes to Billings, FOUR, a cracking boundary to bring up the 50-run stand. Moves away, picks the length on the fuller one and lofts it well over mid-off

Jofra Archer to Raina, FOUR, Raina opens his account with an elegant flick. Archer goes round the wicket and fires in a full delivery, angled into the left-hander and Raina whips it past the man at short square leg. Raced away to the fence

Jofra Archer to Raina, FOUR, Raina makes the most of the free-hit. Archer is not impressed. Very full and outside off, Raina bends down and uses the pace of the bowler to squeeze it behind point. No chance for third man to cut that off
Gowtham to Raina, FOUR, fraction short and Raina is quick to make Gowtham pay, he goes back and punches it square on the off-side, he used the pace of Gowtham to beat the fielder at point

Gowtham to Raina, FOUR, top shot! This is Raina at his best. The slider which skids on from a fullish length, Raina makes room, exposes his stumps and drives it inside out through the packed off-side field

Stokes to Raina, FOUR, that is a horrible delivery from Stokes. Tried the slower short of length delivery, sat up nicely in the surface, Raina had all the time to pick his spot and he muscled it over mid-wicket, for a one bounce four

Willey to Buttler, FOUR, that's a gimme! No room for error when you are bowling to Jos Buttler. He likes it short and gets some width to work too, just stands back and stabs the ball through the off-side ring

Willey to Buttler, FOUR, we have seen this in the last game! Anything short and Buttler will pounce on it. Gets another back of a length dart wide of off-stump, he transfers his weight onto the back foot and drills it wide of mid-off
Willey to Buttler, FOUR, brilliant hand-eye co-ordination. Willey continues to bowl short and wide, Buttler set himself up early on this occasion, raced away off the sweet spot behind point
Harbhajan to Buttler, FOUR, drifts on Buttler's pads and gets picked away, wasn't a controlled shot that, but Buttler made enough contact off the bat to send it fine past the keeper

Harbhajan to Buttler, FOUR, reverse slap. Buttler is not hanging back. Makes his intentions clear, sees the ball outside off and times the pants of it, got it in the gap too. Just behind backward point

Willey to Samson, FOUR, really lucky for Samson. Pressure was building on him, he makes some room and slices this up off a thick edge over short third man. The idea was to go over backward point, but it spooned up over Bhajji off the edge

Dwayne Bravo to Chopra, FOUR, beautiful timing. That sped off his bat through backward point. Back of length just outside off, not that bad a delivery, but Chopra leans back and spears a cut through to the fence
SN Thakur to Chopra, FOUR, full at the pads, Chopra gets his bat down from the big back-lift and flicks it stylishly behind square. Beats the fielder's dive in the deep
SN Thakur to Binny, FOUR, throws his hands at the width on offer and lashes it through backward point. Two ordinary deliveries from Thakur back-to-back. Not good

Watson to Buttler, FOUR, audacious from Buttler, but then that's what he is about. Slower length ball, he gets into position early and slaps the reverse-hit through backward point. Much needed boundary off the over

Willey to Buttler, FOUR, oh well well. Where is sweeper cover? The fielder was very square in his position, and Buttler made some room to slap the ball away from off-stump. Brilliant batting. But was that the plan or did the fielder stand out of place. Willey shakes his head as he walks back
Jadeja to Buttler, FOUR, this is batting of the highest class from Jos Buttler! Steps outside leg to create room and lifts it nonchalantly over extra cover. The timing on that takes cares of the rest

Harbhajan to Buttler, FOUR, that's so effortlessly done! So, its a short ball on middle, Buttler jumps back to create that extra leeway on the leg-side, spots the ball and punches it crisply through mid-wicket. Easy peasy
Harbhajan to Stokes, FOUR, makes room once again and swings wildly, the drift picks the thick inside edge and runs fine of the keeper to his right
Jadeja to Rahane, FOUR, dragged short and drifting down, Rahane clears his front leg and helps it away through backward square

Jadeja to Buttler, FOUR, Buttler's game keeps getting better and better! Employs one of the best tactics to play spin. Gets down on one knee and swats the reverse sweep from outside off, right in the gap behind point, sweeper cover can't get there
Karn Sharma to Buttler, FOUR, spins away from a shorter length, Buttler goes hard and sends a thick edge fine of third man. Streaky, but Buttler won't mind
SN Thakur to Samson, FOUR, that's a gift. Full and down leg, Samson glances it off his pads and off she goes...

Mohit Sharma to Chris Lynn, FOUR, how lucky is Lynn? This could have easily chopped on. Short and wide outside off, Lynn plays it with hard hands and gets an inside edge that goes past the stumps and all way to the fine leg fence

Mohit Sharma to Chris Lynn, FOUR, replica of the previous delivery. Believe in luck? Another short delivery outside off, Lynn goes after it and gets an inside edge, past the stumps again to meet the fine leg boundary in succession.

Barinder to Narine, FOUR, carnage! Haven't seen a better knock from him. Was a full toss and Narine made sure to time his flick through mid-wicket. KKR chants in the crowd as the batsmen are showing no mercy
Andrew Tye to Narine, FOUR, full and wide outside off, Narine stands tall and pumps it over cover. One bounce and into the fence. Running out of adjectives here

Axar to Karthik, FOUR, played, well played DK! This was a flighted delivery and Karthik played with an angled bat to pierce the gap on the off-side. Gets it past short third man and the timing was such that it races away to the fence

Axar to Karthik, FOUR, edged away! If there was a slip, this could have been a catch. An easy one. Karthik went back in his crease to cut it but got an outside edge, through the empty slip cordon to find the third man boundary
Axar to Karthik, FOUR, swept from in front of off-stump and Tye's lazy at the deep square leg ropes. Doesn't bend down enough as he picks it one-handed

Mujeeb to Karthik, FOUR, that's the front of the hand cutter kinda delivery. Slow off the deck and bouncing, and Karthik got a top-edge as he looked to swat it leg-side. Wide of the keeper and it runs away, deflecting off KL's helmet

Mujeeb to A Russell, FOUR, it's gone a little wrong for Mujeeb this over. Overcooks the googly down the leg-side and Russell's helped him through short fine leg for a boundary. A 19-run over followed by a 21-run over

Andrew Tye to A Russell, FOUR, squeezed away over Gayle at short third man. Wide yorker length delivery, Russell threw his hands at it and popped it over the fielder. Very deliberate, with the open bat face

Mohit Sharma to Nitish Rana, FOUR, Miller's jump at long-off isn't good enough. This was barelled away by Nitish Rana. Absolutely brutal. Gets a fullish delivery and he got under it, pumping it with a straight 45-degree bat for a hit in the V. Now who doesn't like it
Mohit Sharma to Karthik, FOUR, switches his stance open and reverse-pulls that to the third man fence. Cricket in modern times is truly ridiculous. And fun

Andrew Tye to Shubman Gill, FOUR, Gayle's fielding in boots so heavy that it doesn't allow him to move. Standing at short third man, intending to field this outside edge from Shubman Gill, but his feet don't move. And he surrenders to his constraints
Barinder to Shubman Gill, FOUR, played the slower ball at 93ks brilliantly here. Waits and pulls, splitting the two fielders in deep square on the leg-side
Barinder to Shubman Gill, FOUR, tries to bowl the pacy full-wide ball from over the wicket but Shubman Gill's reached out and ushered it to the ropes off the toe-end. Through to square third man

Ashwin to Narine, FOUR, Ashwin goes full this time. Tossed up delivery around middle, Narine clears his front leg and smacks this one over mid-on. The fielder there tried all that he could with a leap but the ball eluded him with ease
Barinder to Narine, FOUR, up and over! Shortish delivery, bowled at express speed. Narine goes after it with a swing and gets an outside edge. Beats short third man and finds the fence on one bounce
Barinder to Narine, FOUR, boundaries continue to flow as Narine continues to take them on. This was a full length delivery and Narine manages to heave it over mid-on. Expensive first over by Sran!

Andrew Tye to Narine, FOUR, Narine keeps marching on. Wickets won't make any difference to him, he'll play like he always does. This was a short delivery aimed at the hips and all Narine had to do is help it on its way. Manages to do so and beats short fine leg
Ashwin to Narine, FOUR, there's no stopping him. Walks down the wicket and chips the widish delivery over cover. Long-off sprints across to stop it but the ball wins the race
Ashwin to Narine, FOUR, successive boundaries! Goes straight this time, smacks the tossed up delivery hard and beats the fielder at long-on this time around

Axar to Uthappa, FOUR, first one of the innings for Robbie. Stays put and times his loft right over the bowler's head. The man in the deep was a bit wide and even if he was fine, wouldn't be able to stop it
Axar to Narine, FOUR, pulled away! Shortish on the pads and Narine goes back in the crease to pull it past deep square leg. Striking at a rate of over 200 at the moment
Ashwin to Uthappa, FOUR, Gayle has given up! As soon as this was swept. Was the leg spinner around the leg stump and Uthappa did well to elude Gayle at short fine leg
Prasidh to Rahul, FOUR, 137ks and on a back of a length, Rahul looked a little cramped for the glide to third man and squeezed it out off the splice. Wide of the lone slipper

Kuldeep Yadav to Axar, FOUR, good use of the feet. Axar puts on the dancing shoes and gets close to the flighted delivery, then muscles the drive straight of long-on, where Russell's dive is an after thought
Chawla to Ashwin, FOUR, similar to the previous delivery and this time Ashwin uses the pace on the ball smartly, waits and back cuts it behind point, bisected the two fielders there to perfection
Narine to Ashwin, FOUR, delicate. The quicker offie and Ashwin picked it alright, camped back in the crease and used the pace on the ball to direct it fine past short third man
Narine to Ashwin, FOUR, now shows his power. Narine offers him the space to free his arms and Ashwin thumps it straight back over Tye, no chance for long-on to get across and stop that
Prasidh to Andrew Tye, FOUR, length delivery and Tye gives it his all, shuffled across to get inside the line and powered it away along the ground to deep mid-wicket, no chance for Gill to get around

A Russell to Ashwin, FOUR, KXIP are in this mathematically. 38 off 7. Ashwin is playing a gem here. Short delivery and Ashwin cheekily periscopes his bat up and ramps it over DK. It almost went the distance

Prasidh to Mohit Sharma, FOUR, fuller and outside off, a handsome square drive to get off the mark from Mohit, he presses forward and creams it with an open bat face square of the wicket, giving sweeper no chance
Searles to Rahul, FOUR, this is why the first ball to Rahul was into the batsman. A bit of width and Rahul's found the room to slash it disembowelingly wide of backward point
Searles to Gayle, FOUR, switches to round the wicket to Gayle, who's laid into this room offered outside off. Cracks it with a slash over third man

A Russell to Gayle, FOUR, action-reaction law? Gayle rubbished it. Hits it harder than it arrives. Full, he's drilled it off the toe-end and you had to look at Russell and the umpire ducking to save their lives

Searles to Axar, FOUR, crunched! 100 comes up within 10 overs and KXIP still need to strike over 14 per over. On a length and outside off, Axar stands and thumps it on the up past Russell at extra cover. Raced away!
U Yadav to Roy, FOUR, tad full and that's all Roy needed. Transfers his weight onto the back foot to cream the punchy-drive through covers. No-one moved
de Grandhomme to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, nice use of the pace from Shreyas Iyer, sits back in the crease and opens the bat face at the right moment to send it fine of third man

Chahal to Pant, FOUR, 7th IPL fifty for Rishabh Pant! The DD dug out is up and applauding this wondrous talent. Slightly short and he's laced all the power into the pull shot, raced away behind square
Moeen Ali to Pant, FOUR, that's a one-handed hoick. Saw the line (drifting down leg) and swiped it as hard as he can, no-one there at fine leg. Great placement
U Yadav to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, oh dear. With nobody at fine leg, Yadav for some strange reason decides to feed the ribs. Shankar swivels, pulls, one-legged. And his strike-rate's up to decency

Siraj to Abhishek Sharma, FOUR, oh the swagger. It's supposedly his first ball in the IPL and he starts off in all glory. A juicy pitch up, he gets under, flows through the line and lofts it over mid-off. Well over
Southee to Abhishek Sharma, FOUR, on the dance down, flings his hands out and slices. Can't keep it down. And Siraj running in from third man can't keep it in. Misjudges his dive

Siraj to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, and now Shankar rubs it in. He's playing second fiddle mind you, but he's got enough punch lines with himself. Another horrific delivery, down leg, all it needs is a tickle and Shankar gives it a glance instead. Save your legs

Siraj to Abhishek Sharma, FOUR, and now save your heads. Siraj dishes out friendly length at this stage, Abhishek gets under and puts all his muscle in drilling it straight back. Everyone in the firing line .. and everyone can only jump out. Boundary + the 50-run stand
Chahal to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, googly again, Iyer picks it out of the hand, had enough time to pick his spot; just backs away and stabs the ball behind point. Raced away...
Southee to Pant, FOUR, short and smashed! Pant picked the length early there, the line was there to help him too. Just swivels and belts the pull backwards of square leg
U Yadav to Pant, FOUR, short and no sparing this. Pant gets into good position to maul this pull through mid-wicket, gee! He's hit that with some power
U Yadav to Pant, FOUR, width on the other side this time, Pant frees his arms and thrashes it over extra cover
de Grandhomme to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, that's a friendly dart outside off stump, Iyer makes use of the width on offer and glides late with an angled bat wide of short third

Lamichhane to Parthiv Patel, byes, FOUR, foxing through everyone. Patel doesn't read the wrong 'un, pulls all around it, and it's too good for Pant behind as well. Never mind the dive at the ropes, Harshal Patel's boot is touching. Just

Boult to Kohli, FOUR, draws the edge. But this is no England, this is not 2014 - so this will be a boundary. Kohli's squared up with the angle going across him on off, jabs his bat out, outside-edging it past the lone slip
Harshal Patel to de Villiers, FOUR, cheeky! This guy is not all about power! Full ball and he's smartly moved across to scoop this over the infield with fine leg inside the ring

Harshal Patel to de Villiers, FOUR, oh lovely. Third man is inside the ring and that is exactly why de Villiers wants to give himself a bit of room. Short of a length delivery outside off stump, de Villiers cracks the cut past backward point

Mishra to Kohli, FOUR, oh you are unreal man! This fella has bowled a pretty decent leggie and you've whipped it with your rubber wrists from the within the stumps, finding the cow corner fence. Not many would have split deep mid-wicket and long-on because it's hard to time that ball so well with such a shot

Harshal Patel to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, lovely lofted drive and this should lift Sarfaraz Khan's confidence. Straightaway looks to the heavens after connecting well. Full ball outside off stump, Sarfaraz hits this over cover

Harshal Patel to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, oh superbly guided away past point and he thanks the heavens again. Short of a length delivery outside off stump, Sarfaraz uses the pace on the ball and beats third man
Lamichhane to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, goes straight. From the back of the hand goes Lamichhane, flighting it full and Patel is quickly down slamming it down, with all the anger
Junior Dala to Kohli, FOUR, that one sighter is enough. Premeditates another back of a length, gets his front leg out and delightfully crunches it, flat-batted through mid-wicket
Junior Dala to Kohli, FOUR, keeps bettering them. Dala keeps it full, Kohli isn't complaining, leans out, and inside-outs it over extra cover

Harshal Patel to de Villiers, FOUR, his famed cut. Those four dots were always leading into this, doesn't try and go too hard, waits for the room dished out outside off get big and bisects mid-off and extra cover

Harshal Patel to Kohli, FOUR, you mind-reader Kohli. Knows he's going to get it full, so moves away, gives room and with a measure of mid-off in the circle, goes inside-out in his lofted drive over. So very easy
Boult to de Villiers, FOUR, nothing half-tracker, AB's quick to pounce. And he does with a swipe, mowing it into mid-wicket. On, on
Lamichhane to Kohli, FOUR, no it gets better. Some width in the float up, Kohli crouches, with his rubber wrists, whisking it through extra cover

Junior Dala to Kohli, FOUR, tickled and fifty for captain Kohli. Immediately raises the bat to the dug-out and the crowd. Looks determined as always. Really terrible short of length delivery down the leg-side, just helped on its way with fine leg inside the ring

Sandeep Sharma to Watson, FOUR, Sandeep offers width and Watson doesn't let it go scot-free. Flails his hands and creams it with super timing past a diving Manish Pandey at cover-point. First boundary of the innings

Sandeep Sharma to Watson, FOUR, just bowled a slower ball, tries to repeat, but this is well outside off stump and the batsman read this from the hand. No third man, so Watson camps back and cuts past backward point. A 31-ball fifty for Watto, another very handy innings at the top

S Kaul to Rayudu, FOUR, wow! Just wow! The yorker goes as a juicy full ball and Rayudu thrashes the drive wide of extra-cover. Interesting to see Kaul try three bouncers and then only try the yorker. What's the thought process there?

Bhuvneshwar to Watson, FOUR, the runs are leaking. Short of a length on the leg stump, poor line with not much of protection behind square on the on-side, Watson pulls and sends it to the long leg boundary
Shakib to Rayudu, FOUR, use of the feet again, Rayudu is just rubbing it into Shakib, who has had a catch being put down. Goes straight down the ground and over the umpire's head. Into the 90s now
Bhuvneshwar to Dhoni, FOUR, oh he's hit this for four. CSK need 3 more to win and Rayudu needs one for a hundred. Length delivery down the leg-side, Dhoni swings it away behind square on the on-side

Rashid Khan to Rayudu, FOUR, Rayudu brings out the sweep. Safe bet against the spin. Went low, rolled his wrists and placed it in the gap in front of square on the leg-side. Hooda from the deep ran across and dived near the ropes, but in vain
Shakib to Watson, FOUR, begins with a tripe on leg-stump. Watson accepts it with glee and glances it off his pads, beats short fine leg and races away to the fence
Shakib to Rayudu, FOUR, 50-up for CSK with this boundary. Rayudu takes on Shakib, uses his feet and reaches the pitch. Lets his bottom hand do the talking. Lofting him over Shakib's head

S Kaul to Rayudu, FOUR, short, no real purpose and Rayudu pulls it away to the mid-wicket boundary. Didn't time it alright, but placed it in the gap. The ball hurried onto him a bit and that foiled his timing

S Kaul to Rayudu, FOUR, magnificent. No half-measures whatsoever. Saw a pitched up delivery outside off, props forward and presents a straight bat to drill it past mid-off. Third boundary of the over so far
Shakib to Watson, FOUR, splits the gap perfectly. Shakib goes short once again, Watson stays low and pulls it through mid-wicket. Beats long-on and deep mid-wicket
Rashid Khan to Rayudu, FOUR, half-tracker and punished. Rayudu camped back, twirls his wrists and hammers it to the cow corner fence. Shikhar had no chance cutting that off

SN Thakur to Dhawan, FOUR, a french cut to get his first boundary. On a good length around off, shaping into the batsman. Dhawan tries to fend it late and ends up getting an inside edge. Past the leg stump and all the way to the fence she goes, in a jiffy.

Jadeja to Dhawan, FOUR, that was four the moment it was hit. A good length delivery around off, Dhawan is quick to camp back and punch it away. Beats the fielder at extra cover and the man at sweeper cover too

Watson to Williamson, FOUR, the boundaries have started to flow. A good length delivery outside off, Williamson moves away and carves it over point. No chance for the fielder at third man to cut this down

Willey to Williamson, FOUR, 100-run stand comes up between the duo. Cross-seamer from Willey, but it's too full outside off. Can't bowl there with mid-off in the circle. Williamson leans forward and drills it over the fielder's head beautifully

Willey to Dhawan, FOUR, swings south does Dhawan. But the ball goes in the direction of north. He won't mind though as long as boundaries are coming. Shortish outside off, Dhawan goes hard and gets a thickish outside edge that flies away to the third man fence

Willey to Dhawan, FOUR, stand and dismiss stuff from Dhawan. Just admires the shot, knew the moment he connected it was a boundary. Willey serves it full, in the slot and Dhawan blasts it with ease to the long-off fence. The fielder was squarer and had no chance
Dwayne Bravo to Williamson, FOUR, Bravo is welcomed to the crease with a boundary. Feeds it full, overpitches it a tad and Williamson makes him pay by cracking it through extra cover

Dwayne Bravo to Dhawan, FOUR, expertly done. Uses his quick-silver hands to direct this wide yorker into the third man fence. Gets his bat down in time and threaded the gap between short third man and backward point with perfection
SN Thakur to Deepak Hooda, FOUR, mid-off in the circle and Hooda goes over his head. Scrambled seam lengh delivery around off, Hooda backs away and gives charge to lift it over mid-off

Dwayne Bravo to Shakib, FOUR, just eludes Rayudu's outstretched right hand. Bravo lands the slower ball on the middle stump, Shakib gets low and slogs it across the line. Rayudu tried his best at square leg, but it evaded him
Willey to Dhawan, FOUR, that'll give him some confidence. Length delivery on middle, Dhawan stands tall and pummels this one over mid-wicket, that's a fine shot by the southpaw

Willey to Dhawan, FOUR, this one is even better. Full length ball outside off, Dhawan reaches for it and slaps it through the gap at extra-cover. The fielders on the off side had hardly any time to react

SN Thakur to Williamson, FOUR, that's the form he is in. Picks the length early on the shortish delivery. He's quick to transfer his weight on to the back foot and pull it to perfection through mid-wicket. Made sweet sound of the willow as the ball met it

Harbhajan to Dhawan, FOUR, well played! This was a tossed up delivery, Dhawan comes down the wicket and smokes it right over the bowler's head. Straight as an arrow, on a bounce and over the fence. Hit the cushions in fact

Chahar to Dhawan, FOUR, here it is! Finally a boundary against Chahar. This was a half-volley outside off, Dhawan is quick to lean ahead and cream his drive through cover. Beats the two fielders chasing to stop this from reaching the fence
Dwayne Bravo to Williamson, FOUR, finally a boundary of Williamson! That'll give him some relief. This was short one on leg, Williamson does well to drag it down to the fine leg fence

Dwayne Bravo to Dhawan, FOUR, poor effort by Bhajji near short fine leg. Perhaps he slipped there, hence couldn't stop the ball. This was a short one down the leg-side and Dhawan pulled it away, beating Harbhajan at short fine
Gowtham to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, now the homeboy roar. On the dance, in the slot and tonking it straight down. Oh the bat flow
Gowtham to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, defensively wide. Suryakumar smart enough, stays back, stretches and carves it away through extra cover
Gowtham to Lewis, FOUR, oh boy. If 0.3 was timing, this is its square. Pitched up, Lewis strides, flows through with a defensive push. Yeah, that's all. And screeching past mid-off. Wow, Wankhede ..
D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, width. A helpful dragged back length too and he stays back, opens his bat face and whacks, hard, square

D Kulkarni to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, not timed, but Kishan will collect the boundary. Rushed him with a short delivery and Kishan took it on, pulls off the splice and once it clears the fielder at mid-wicket, the lightning fast outfield does the rest

D Kulkarni to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, cheeky! He plays this shot quite a lot, does Pandya. Banged in and the line being outside off allowed Pandya to periscope the ramp to the third man fence. Got it fine enough to beat the fielder

Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, now the attempted wide yorker goes wrong, full toss outside off, Pandya crouches a bit and slices it deliberately over backward point, one bounce and over the fence. Wankhede finds its voice again..

Stokes to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, premeditated. Pandya shuffled across early and Stokes smartly dragged his length back, Pandya still went through with his paddle and got the faintest of connection to beat Buttler to his left

D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, connects. Kulkarni gets a touch too straight in trying to cut off the off-side play, but Yadav's quick to get one-legged, lifting a glance of sorts over mid-wicket

D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, he's expensive. Can't expect to pitch it up to Suryakumar and not pay the price .. it's the delightful price of watching it being driven straight back. Thank god for Lewis' duck, it's saved a head

Stokes to Lewis, FOUR, short, nothing in terms of pace, everything in terms of width. And Lewis makes it worse with him backing away, throws his hands out, gets a fat edge. And a vacant cordon is enough

D Kulkarni to Lewis, FOUR, 118.3kph. Those hands, those adjusting hands. It holds up for much longer, Lewis almost commits into his slap early, but all of sudden can hold it, let the ball get close and guide it to point's left. Now ..

D Kulkarni to Lewis, FOUR, full toss number five. And for a change Lewis can put it away. Swings a little too hard, mistimes his swinging slap, but the powerplay is enough to find him the gaps at sweeper
Unadkat to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, nothing two-paced when you grant out a friendly overpitch. Lovely bat swing, opening up the gap over mid-off and timing the pants off it .. inside-out slap
Unadkat to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, that backlift. And then that drive on the up. So damn predictable. With mid-off in the circle, these are serious runs being leaked

Bumrah to D Arcy Short, FOUR, streaky! Bumrah thought he had his man, so did Rohit. An curling low full toss right at the stumps, Short does extremely well to bring his bat down and squirt it off the inside edge to the fine leg fence. He was a goner had he missed

Bumrah to Rahane, FOUR, cracking shot! Losing Short might not be the worst thing happening for Rajasthan. Brings Rahane in early and he likes the new ball coming on. Pitched up outside off, Rahane leans forward and creams the drive through the packed off-side field. Off the mark in style

Hardik Pandya to Rahane, FOUR, a helluva lot happened off this one ball. Now Rahane was shaping to scoop, and Hardik Pandya nicely bowls the cutter wider of off-stump. Rahane adjusts though. Slices it, making the most of the room he had, but wasn't in control. Just cleared short third man's right-handed leap

Hardik Pandya to Buttler, FOUR, five fifties in a row for Buttler in IPL 2018. He's equaled the record of Sehwag, who was harvesting runs for a living back in 2012. And what a way to get there. Backs away, exposes the stumps and slaps the ball from in front of them audaciously. Connects. Anyone who's near as good as Sehwag -- statiscally! -- will connect

McClenaghan to Buttler, FOUR, some width on the cutter, and that cut shot creams past Lewis's dive at deep cover. Just slid through the ball there, cutting the trajectory at 90 degrees. Must be a good outfield

Hardik Pandya to Buttler, FOUR, front leg is already out of the way, and this fuller delivery goes for a four. Just moved a little to the off-stump and opened his torso side-on, and goes through with the flat mow through long-on

Bumrah to Buttler, FOUR, he's making a living out of his hands. Nicely keeps his weight distributed between front and back, so he can go either way. Opens the stance and swats this back of a length delivery over mid-wicket
Markande to Samson, FOUR, drifting on leg-stump and it's been cutely paddled away. Runs very fine, through keeper's left and runs for a boundary. Not a great start that by Markande

Markande to Samson, FOUR, he's joining the party. Very slow from Markande, trying to get Samson to miscue one, but doesn't on this occasion. Makes room, waits for the dip and lofts it over straight mid-on
McClenaghan to Buttler, FOUR, that's been muscled through long-on. Going against McClenaghan's angle from over the wicket and going through the line. One bounce and into the ropes. Just the 16 needed
McClenaghan to Rahane, FOUR, wrong lines. Off-cutter down leg, Rahane tickles it fine past short fine leg. The fast outfield does the rest

McClenaghan to Rahane, FOUR, second boundary and it is to the same area. This was not on leg-stump, but straight enough for Rahane to glance it wristily past short fine leg, just used the pace on the ball

Krunal Pandya to Buttler, FOUR, wow! That is a fine shot. Moved away to leg and even a dragged back length didn't deter him, went up and over the infield off the back foot. A very difficult shot to play but Buttler made it look easy

Hardik Pandya to Buttler, FOUR, that's more like it. Stand and deliver. Gets a length ball in his arc and he gives it his all. In fact it was the knuckle ball and Buttler dispatched it straight back over Hardik

Bumrah to Buttler, FOUR, that was an attempted slower delivery but it turned out to be a full toss. Manjrekar on air said how he's never seen Bumrah bowl "such a slower ball." Anyway, Buttler makes a bit of room and thumps that to the fence through long-off
Markande to Buttler, FOUR, a bit of flight and Buttler goes through the line. Weight on front foot and boom, it's flying over straightitsh long-on already
Southee to Gayle, FOUR, powers the ball away! That is a four. Little backing away movement and the batsman gatecrashes that one past cover for a four. The lack of pace did not help

Southee to Gayle, FOUR, that is typical Gayle! Clears his front leg, moves to the leg-side and then the long tentacles get into the act. Fetches the short of length delivery and clubs the pull away towards the deep mid area for a four
Southee to Gayle, FOUR, absolute gift! Full toss, little dip on it but the batsman lifts the ball away easily over mid-off's head for a four. This will break the shackles

U Yadav to Gayle, FOUR, clears his front leg again, the typical Gayle template to get the boundaries away and is successful. The men at cover and mid-off had no chance. The length ball also helped the cause of the batsman
Siraj to Finch, FOUR, tries to land it on a length and is greeted with a drive on the up. Lovely timing and placement on it takes it away to the fence. Finch is away
Ashwin to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, Parthiv decides to get a move on. On the shorter side from Ashwin and it's leg stumpish as well. Pulled away through the gap between mid-wicket and mid-on. Races away
Andrew Tye to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, gift for Parthiv and he accepts it with glee. Tye strays on the pads with a half-volley, easily glanced away down to the fine leg fence

Andrew Tye to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, that's a signature Parthiv Patel stroke. Not all that full but there was width and that's what the southpaw loves. Uses his quick hands to power it on the up through the gap at cover
Rajpoot to Kohli, FOUR, hammered away. Cannot bowl that length at this pace to Kohli. He'll punish you all night. Back of a length from Rajpoot and it's pulled away wide of mid-on. All too easy

Rajpoot to Kohli, FOUR, he is on the charge, is Kohli. He doesn't want to let this opportunity of a crushing win slip. Charges down the track and makes some room for this good length delivery. Slaps it away over point comfortably

Mohit Sharma to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, crunched away! Full and quite wide outside off, right up Parthiv's street and he feasts on it. Unfurls a lovely square drive through cover-point. Blazed away in a flash

Mohit Sharma to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, good adjustment from Parthiv. Seemed like he was early on this slower bouncer but then decided to just control it. Got it wide of short fine leg and that was enough. Brings up the 50 as well

Mohit Sharma to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, this has been pummelled away. Banged in short by Mohit and this is the normal pace delivery, sits up nicely for Parthiv who swats the pull through backward square leg. The man from deep square did try hard to get to it but was never going to reach it in time
Andrew Tye to Kohli, FOUR, deft touch from Kohli. Pacy back of a length delivery, he just waits on it and dabs it late. Only had to beat the short third man fielder and he did it with ease

Stoinis to Kohli, FOUR, sublime, really sublime. Oh, he is making this look like an exhibition match. Short of a length, a touch wide and he stands tall to punch it beautifully through backward point. Timed it so sweetly
