Stoinis to Kohli, FOUR, fantastic placement. A trifle too short from Stoinis and Kohli clobbers the pull by standing up tall. Splits deep mid-wicket and long-on with precision

Andrew Tye to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, back to normal pace and Tye suffers. Shortish length and Parthiv waits to ramp it just wide of Rahul. Got it very fine and third man had no chance. Just a hit away now

Rajpoot to Kohli, FOUR, RCB have demolished KXIP! Not the fairytale big hit to finish but a boundary nevertheless. Short ball and Kohli only manages a top edge on the pull. Gets it comfortably over a leaping Rahul and that's the end of that
Gowtham to Narine, FOUR, this flies squarer but he's middled it again somewhat. Swivels a little, carting the ball round the corner
Gowtham to Narine, FOUR, he's an antidote to everything that Gowtham can be tonight. Backs away and lofts one at the stumps, splitting the air-gap between mid-off and extra cover
Unadkat to Chris Lynn, FOUR, 119.3kph. And then half way down the pitch. And then down leg. Well .. well. Lynn swivels, adjusts to the lack of bounce. But pulls, very fine
Anureet Singh to Karthik, FOUR, that's the ruin. All the width put out for Karthik to get .. and he chases, carving it over extra cover
Jofra Archer to Chris Lynn, FOUR, 118.9kph. And then length and width. Lynn gets forward, and rocks back in a fierce cut. Nothing a diving point can do

Jofra Archer to Chris Lynn, FOUR, rub in the luck too. Neat bouncer, at the nose, but Lynn's already moving away, putting everything in his hooky-swing. Gets a fat edge that proves just enough to clear the keeper
Ish Sodhi to Karthik, FOUR, gets cheeky. Picks up the floaty leggie outside off, knows there's nobody at third man. And reverses. Nailing it past slip
Unadkat to A Russell, FOUR, innocuously short, dishing out full pace. Russell gets back fiercely on his back leg, swings his cut, going over point and almost into deep point .. millimeters

Unadkat to Karthik, FOUR, pulls out some deft dabs from his bag of tricks. Unadkat keeps going through with full-paced seam ups .. Karthik's waiting, showing it the opened up face and dabbing it just wide of Buttler's dive
Jofra Archer to A Russell, FOUR, oh the hammer. Brute. Archer misses the yorker by an inch, Russell takes out a mile. Launching into the overcook to crunch it through the covers

Jofra Archer to Karthik, FOUR, genuine edge. Zips up off the turf to take the splice on Karthik's lost overused dab. But the pace is enough to run it into third man. Or is it? Gowtham chases, dives, but nope, can't get his hand off the ball while his leg touches the rope

Jofra Archer to Chris Lynn, FOUR, now over third man. Just bounces inside the ropes and hits the cushions on the half-volley. Jofra Archer bowled it short again but shifted the line to outside off, and Chris Lynn nicely ramps it away

Stokes to Chris Lynn, FOUR, that's a nice drive through covers. Chris Lynn leaning a bit into it and reminding Stokes that he wasn't the batsman who faced the short ball, so a full ball outside off isn't going to work
Jofra Archer to Nitish Rana, FOUR, past Samson's one-handed effort at backward point. An uppish cut shot that he placed just wide enough of the fielder

Ish Sodhi to Nitish Rana, FOUR, that's past backward point's dive. Got the ball to straighten on off-stump, which makes Nitish Rana's shot a good one. Didn't have much room to work, so uses his cocked wrists and thrusts the ball away
Unadkat to Karthik, FOUR, that's a glorious front-foot punch through covers. Gets on his toes and on top of the bounce to pack a punch through diving cover
Prasidh to R Tripathi, FOUR, short and a little wide, no power, just a dab off the back foot, placed perfectly behind backward point for four. Surgical precision...
Prasidh to R Tripathi, FOUR, a bit of swing away from a good length outside off, Tripathi tries a preempted helicopter and gets a leading edge to third man for four.
Kuldeep Yadav to Samson, FOUR, perfect length, but it doesn't matter which variation it was, Samson reaches out and sweeps it hard to backward square leg for four. Incredible shot, and four...
Shivam Mavi to Unadkat, FOUR, just a push..may be an exagerrated punch. But that raced away across the turf past the man at cover. Whatta shot. Not a pushover for sure
Narine to Unadkat, FOUR, little short outside off and the batsman latches on to it. Smokes the cut past point and the ball reaches the ropes. These are useful runs on the board

Narine to Unadkat, FOUR, phew! That was close. Shortish, again slightly turning in and the cut is played off the top-half of the bat. The man at backward point leapt up but still could not even get finger-tips to it. 10 runs of the over and RR fight on thanks to this cameo from Unadkat. Narine ends a decent spell - 4-0-29-1

Prasidh to Jofra Archer, FOUR, not a bad start! Short ball at the body and pulled away into the on-side for a four. The man at fine leg had no chance. He played it slightly late but did well to get enough meat on it

Prasidh to R Tripathi, FOUR, why try the helicopter when you can play these? Half-volley, on middle and leg, Tripathi gets slightly forward and push-drives it straight down the ground for four. 19 off the over.
Shivam Mavi to Buttler, FOUR, short and wide, Buttler is about half a meter outside leg reaches out Sehwagesquely to slice it towards the third man boundary for four
Shivam Mavi to Buttler, FOUR, short and fractionally wide, Buttler has a lower and wide stance and has a solid base to execute the perfect cut shot to deep backward point for four. Unbelievable...

Shivam Mavi to Buttler, FOUR, length ball outside off, a cardinal sin in T20, Buttler opens up his stance, clears his front leg, and carts it away cross-battedly to long-on for four. RR bowlers under fire, and Buttler's epiphany continues...

Shivam Mavi to Buttler, FOUR, full and wide outside off, Buttler reaches out and slices that away to square third man for four, and that's the second time Mavi has conceded more than 28 in an over in this IPL. Surreal hitting...
Narine to R Tripathi, FOUR, flatter trajectory, off-break and in the slot, R Tripathi gets on his knees and mows that to wide long-on with a slog-sweep. Up comes the 50 partnership!

Narine to Buttler, FOUR, thats almost an inch-perfect yorker outside off, errs marginally, Buttler, with all his hockey experience, gets under it to bottom-hand that away to the deep extra cover fence for four
Narine to Rahane, FOUR, shortish off-break, erring in line, drifting into the pads, whipped away off the back foot to the backward square leg fence for four. Threaded the needle there...
Prasidh to Samson, FOUR, just a fraction short, a tad outside off, Samson pokes it with an angled bat away to the third man fence for four. Races away...

Krunal Pandya to Finch, FOUR, that's well done. Finch walked across, expecting Krunal to keep it straight and quick. He got inside the line of the ball and then swept it powerfully past short fine leg

McClenaghan to Rahul, FOUR, short fine leg is motionless as Rahul helps this pull shot past him. Poor ball really. Angled into the body from round the wicket, all Rahul has to do is to miss the lone fielder after swivelling across and that's what he does as he leaves Surya a mere statue

McClenaghan to Finch, FOUR, mid-off is up so Finch clears his front leg in order to go over the infield. It's a short of length delivery from McClenaghan, not the ideal ball to hit straight down the ground, but Finch had his mind made up. He flat-bats it hard enough, and although it came off the toe-end, it's enough to go over the fielder. Cutting gives good chase and tries hauling it back in with a slide, but his foot was in contact with the ropes

Krunal Pandya to Finch, FOUR, he's hit that with a battering ram! Makes some room, Krunal darts it into the slot for Finch who tonks the leather off it by muscling it back over the bowler's head. Krunal tried going for the catch, but by then the ball was whistling into the fence
Cutting to Rahul, FOUR, Rahul gets this away! This is the man standing between MI and victory. Short of length at the body, Rahul nails the pull backward of square

Cutting to Rahul, FOUR, oh my, this is extraordinary. The expression on Rohit's face, rather the blankness of it tells the story. Wide leg-cutter from Cutting, Rahul switches his stance and reverse-scoops it over short third man

Cutting to Rahul, FOUR, he's done it again. He has done it again. Quite brilliant. Slower ball wide of off, and Rahul puts it over short third man's head. He's whisked into the 90s. Some player this lad
Hardik Pandya to Gayle, FOUR, another short one, this time across the left-hander, Gayle tries to cut it away, gets a top-edge over the fly slip and towards fine third man for four

Hardik Pandya to Rahul, FOUR, edged, and gone for four! Fortuitous boundary to third man. Knuckle ball pitching on a length, seaming away, Rahul gets a controlled outside edge with soft hands and it rolls away to the third man fence
McClenaghan to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, short of length delivery at the body, swivelled away past short fine leg. But it doesn't matter. MI clinch this by three runs to stay alive in the tournament

Hardik Pandya to Rahul, FOUR, yet another slower one, errs in length this time, half-cook, and Rahul transfers his bodyweight into an elegant extra cover drive for four. Balances himself and poses for the cameras after the shot. Yep, that was right out the meat!

McClenaghan to Gayle, FOUR, geee, that was hit hard. Fuller ball just outside off, Gayle clears his front leg and slugs that over mid-on to the long-on fence for four. Lands just short of the rope. Odd how the top-edge carried and this didn't :O
Krunal Pandya to Rahul, FOUR, a hint of flight, pretty good length, on off stump, Rahul gets down the wicket and lofts it nonchalantly towards long-on for four
Krunal Pandya to Rahul, FOUR, fired in on the stumps again, lap-swept expertly to fine leg for four. Knew where the short fine fielder was and got it well past him
Markande to Rahul, FOUR, flat leg-break just around off-stump, Rahul crouches low and cuts that when it was inches from the stumps past backward point for four
Krunal Pandya to Rahul, FOUR, short and wide outside off, Rahul carves it away to deep backward point for four. A hit-me delivery and gets the treatment.
Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, edged and four, width on offer from Rajpoot and Suryakumar threw his bat at that, gets a healthy edge that flies through the vacant second slip region
Stoinis to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, half-volley, keep 'em coming screams Krunal's willow. Just leans forward slightly and creams it off the middle wide of mid-off

Rajpoot to Pollard, FOUR, sloppy work from Finch. A crisp drive to the left of mid-off, Finchy was late to react and hence the dive came in late, gets some hand on it, but ends up parrying it to the fence
Rajpoot to Pollard, FOUR, full on the pads, CYA TOMORROW! KP was quick to pounce, just needed to help the ball and he did that with some ease, past square leg with courtesy a magical wristwork
Stoinis to Pollard, FOUR, cross-seamer, fuller and wider of off, KP manages enough contact on the rash drive and the edge flies wide of the keeper
Stoinis to Pollard, FOUR, another wild swing and another edge. Looped up and kept third man interested for a while, Yuvi with the dive to his left, but he fails to flick the ball back into play
Andrew Tye to McClenaghan, FOUR, full toss wide of off-stump, McClenaghan thrashes it powerfully square on the off-side. No-one there and it's a boundary
Mohit Sharma to Markande, FOUR, seam-up short ball wide of off-stump, Markande waits and opens the bat face to ramp it over short third. Smart batting

Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, lovely shot, too short from Rajpoot, Suryakumar swivels across, rolls his wrists and pulls it past square leg, no one in the deep and it's a boundary - Suryakumar's second of the night

Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, cheeky and four, back of a length and just outside off, Suryakumar waits on it, lets the ball come onto him and then defltly glides it past the keeper, third man was square and has no chance, 21 from the over

Mohit Sharma to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, edged and four, unlucky for the bowler, on a good length and a hint of seam away from the left-hander, drew Kishan into the drive and found a thick edge, past the lone slip and races away to the fence

Stoinis to Pollard, FOUR, beautifully played, this should give Pollard some confidence, back of a length and wide of off, Pollard stands tall andc punches it in front of square on the off-side, beats cover and races away to the fence

Sandeep Sharma to Kohli, FOUR, what a shot to get off the mark. Kohli on the walk, trying to get ahead of Sandeep Sharma and prove his superiority over him. Converts a length ball into a half-volley and drives it wide of mid-off, superb shot and all along the ground, lovely way to get going and a statement made by Kohli
Shakib to de Villiers, FOUR, like Kohli de Villiers too gets off the mark with a boundary. Fraction short around off, de Villiers makes room and cuts wide of point. Expertly placed and it raced away

Shakib to de Villiers, FOUR, this is how he started against Nadeem. Went bang bang. This is a top top shot. Shakib loops it up on the stumps, de Villiers gets forward and opens his body to go inside out over extra cover. That's trademark AB

S Kaul to de Villiers, FOUR, how good is de Villiers. Unbelievably good. Was a back of a length delivery around off, de Villiers pummelled the cut and left the sweeper with no chance. The fielder just had to cover a little distance but gave up as it rocketed to the fence

S Kaul to de Villiers, FOUR, now pulls regally and gets to fifty. Is this the knock that will win RCB the game tonight? Was a length ball on the stumps, powerfully hit wide of deep mid, again one bounce over the ropes and the fielder was left helpless

Basil Thampi to Moeen Ali, FOUR, Moeen Ali gets to his maiden fifty. Gets a hug from de Villiers. Kohli punches the air in delight. They are happy for him and rightly so. What a time to come to the party. Low full-toss, sliced in the air but in the gap as well

Basil Thampi to de Villiers, FOUR, only he can execute this shot with so much success. Sits down and moves across even before the ball has come out of the bowler's hand. It is a slower delivery on the stumps, de Villiers waits and pulls over short fine

Sandeep Sharma to de Villiers, FOUR, he doesn't want the wide, he wants more. Sits almost as he connects, back knee on the ground, reaches out to a slower delivery outside off, carves it over backward point. That's enough. Had he left that, it was a wide

Rashid Khan to Moeen Ali, FOUR, from round the wicket, tossed up and Moeen Ali has smote it back over Rashid Khan's head. Flat hit and bisects long-off and long-on. Super shot. He is continuing his stroke-making
Basil Thampi to de Grandhomme, FOUR, thick outside edge and four. Wide full delivery outside off, de Grandhomme's edge flies over short third

S Kaul to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, Basil T is having a mare out there. KW - the cool cat - just rubs his beard. That's his way of showing disappointment. Cut late by Sarfaraz Khan and Basil diving to his right at short third allowed the ball to sneak under his hands. One becomes four

Basil Thampi to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, my colleague Kumar who dines and drinks on stats tells me this - Basil Thampi now has the most expensive figures this IPL. Not a proud record if you are the youngster. Good shot, full delivery on off, Sarfaraz Khan opened the bat face and that's why he could find the gap with the square-drive wide of the fielder in the deep

Sandeep Sharma to de Villiers, FOUR, one-handed back foot square drive. On a short of length outside off, de Villiers didn't intentionally pull the bottom hand off, but it raced off the middle and split cover-point and backward point. AB is in the mood tonight
Sandeep Sharma to de Villiers, FOUR, superb shot. The crowd go wild. So cleanly struck too. On a length and around off, lifted over extra-cover. A proper cricketing shot

S Kaul to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, Sarfaraz Khan has played his part. Whips a full-toss on the stumps wide of backward square and it raced away. Grand end to the innings and he walks back with a swagger. RCB end on 218

Shakib to de Villiers, FOUR, he is looking to play aggressively and maximise the powerplay. This is tossed up outside off, de Villiers moves across and slog-sweeps over mid-wicket, one bounce over the ropes. Lovely batting
Rashid Khan to Kohli, FOUR, short and pulled over mid-wicket. Judged the length so quickly, left deep square chasing shadows. Top shot

S Kaul to de Villiers, FOUR, not sure whether it is four or six. de Villiers grits his teeth and it is not a six. Maybe AB thought it didn't go all the way. It has been sent upstairs. Has the ball landed bang on the cushion? After de Villiers lifted a length ball on the stumps towards wide long-on. Still looking. Umpire Chettithody Shamsuddin wants to get this absolutely correct in the third ump's box. They are zooming in and zooming out. Crowd keep waiting. S Ravi does too. To get the orders from above. They could have taken the strategic timeout and got done with it. More than 3 minutes as I type. Finally a decision has been made. It is four. And it is the right call too, one angle showed clearly that the ball bounced in front of the cushions. The game moves on - thankfully

Rashid Khan to de Villiers, FOUR, not sure what Rashid Khan is appealing for? Clearly off the bat as de Villiers reverse-swept and got a bottom edge, also de Villiers had got outside the line when playing the shot, beats short third and it raced away

Basil Thampi to de Villiers, FOUR, his eyes were wide open as Basil Thampi was running in, maybe he was waiting for the short ball. Murdered through mid-wicket. That's actually so disrespectful to a fast bowler, but this is a tough game
Siraj to Williamson, FOUR, slower one @117km/h, Williamson waits for it, calm as a cucumber (maybe change the idiom to Dhoni), steers it away to deep backward point for four

U Yadav to Williamson, FOUR, not even close to a half-tracker, just outside off, uses those beautiful wrists and splits that gap surgically behind backward point for four. Class. Yes, even T20 can be classy.

de Grandhomme to Manish Pandey, FOUR, anti-climactic end to a superb effort. Put in a pool like dive at deep mid to get to it. But then kept sliding and the ball slipped away. Just touched the ropes and their was dismay on the face of the skipper. The short ball was thumped away between mid-wicket and long-on by the batsman
de Grandhomme to Manish Pandey, FOUR, low full toss, dipping and the batsman clips the ball away past deep square leg for a four. That was superb from Manish Pandey as he gets it away
Chahal to Manish Pandey, FOUR, drags the ball short, bad ball and put away. The batsman decides to drag the pull behind square and gets it past the man at 45 degrees for a four. SRH would take it

Siraj to Manish Pandey, FOUR, slower ball, Manish Pandey waits till eternity and upper steers the ball over short third man for a four. 10 off the first two balls. Pressure back on RCB and Siraj as Kohli tries to egg his bowler on

Southee to Manish Pandey, FOUR, slippery conditions or too casual was CDG? The batsman biffed the full and wide ball over the bowler. The man at long-on did the slide well but the ball bobbled away after hitting the torso. Pressure is doing all the talking now. 31 needed now
Southee to Manish Pandey, FOUR, mid-off inside the circle and the batsman gets under the fullish ball to nail it over mid-off. That is something SRH would take with open arms

Southee to Manish Pandey, FOUR, four to end! The drama continues. 20 to get in the last over. That was full, more of a half-volley as he missed the mark and the batsman brought all his sinews to play. Muscled past long-off, to his left for a four

U Yadav to Hales, FOUR, Siraj is the man at mid-on. Last over it was AB, they changed and the pacer allows the ball to miss his hand on the dive, wristily flicked wide of mid-on. Credit to Siraj for the run and dive, but the ball bounced over the hand

Chahal to Williamson, FOUR, that has to be the softest stroke played to get a four this IPL. Unreal actually. Too full and Williamson got forward before wristing it wide of a diving Southee at mid-on. Placed expertly and the ball kissed the turf along its way to the fence. Delightful from KW

Chahal to Hales, FOUR, the last ball goes for four. Dragged down and Hales lapped it over short fine's head. Needed to get enough bat to clear the fielder and did so. Poor end to the powerplay for RCB
Southee to Williamson, FOUR, a tad short and angling into the body, Williamson shuffles across and guides the pull to backward square leg where Sarfraz misfields and lets it through for four
Southee to Williamson, FOUR, short and wide outside off, Williamson gets down the wicket and slaps that over deep extra cover for four
Moeen Ali to Williamson, FOUR, flat delivery, skidding, Williamson gets low and swat-sweeps that to deep square leg for four
Moeen Ali to Williamson, FOUR, tossed up outside off, pitched up, Williamson comes forward and whips it between mid-wicket and long-on expertly for four. Elegance personified
Maxwell to Raina, FOUR, vintage Raina! Tossed up outside off, Raina reaches out, gets to the pitch of it, and lofts that inside-out over extra cover for four
Maxwell to Dhoni, FOUR, what amazing placement! Flat one just outside off, not short at all, Dhoni whips a cut between gully and backward point for four. Surgically bisected the field

Avesh Khan to Rayudu, FOUR, crashed away! He had been trying to blast it for a while and finally, connects. Wide half-volley and Rayudu's quick hands on display as he thumps this with all his power. Well wide of mid-off who was a mere spectator

Avesh Khan to Rayudu, FOUR, blasted away. Avesh needs to be careful with his lengths here. Errs on the shorter side once more and Rayudu gets across to blast it over mid-wicket. Just on the bounce before crashing into the ad hoardings
Mishra to Rayudu, FOUR, full, gives it a bit of air outside off, in the slot for Rayudu, who shimmies down, makes a bit of room, and punches that through deep extra cover for four
Harshal Patel to Rayudu, FOUR, very quick, almost yorker length on leg, misses by half an inch perhaps, and Rayudu shuffles across to tickle it away to fine leg for four
Chahar to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, Shaw opens his account with a boundary. A shortish ball that's picked early by the batsman. Gets into a good position and pulls it over square leg. Good shot

Dwayne Bravo to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, that's been hammered. A half-volley, Vijay Shankar stands tall and drills it straight down the ground. Bravo, in his followthrough, moves away from it. Rockets away to the fence

SN Thakur to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, that's a freebie and Shankar puts it away. Shortish and sliding down leg, he just walks across a bit and deflects it well wide of Dhoni with a neat glance. Races away to the fine leg fence

Lungi Ngidi to Harshal Patel, FOUR, handy blow from Patel. He does pack a punch in his shots, as we saw during his batting promotion earlier this season. This is fractionally short and there is a lot of width as well, he waits for it and slaps hard past extra cover. Once it beat the infield, it was always racing to the fence
Chahar to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, shot! Backed away, manufactured room and then slapped this short ball over backward point. Once bounce and into the fence
Chahar to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, cheeky! Chahar bangs one short, Iyer waits for the ball, hops and elevates it over the slip cordon. There is no one to stop that
SN Thakur to Pant, FOUR, Thakur bowls a short ball, no venom. And Pant takes full toll of it. Swivel-pulls it fiercely in front of square leg for a boundary

Jadeja to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, the gap is found. Jadeja shortens his length and serves a bit of width, Iyer stays back in his crease and cuts it to pierce the gap between short third man and backward point. Superb placement
Harbhajan to Pant, FOUR, short, wide, turning away, Pant, who was initially pressing forward, goes deep in the crease and scythes it through covers. Powerfully hit
Harbhajan to Pant, FOUR, short-and-wide outside off, asking to be punished. Pant stays back in his crease and cuts it fiercely between short third man and backward point

Ish Sodhi to de Villiers, FOUR, sixth fifty for Mr. 360! That was shortish, the batsman jumped on the opportunity and muscled the ball away past the dive from the man at deep square leg. Superb execution
Unadkat to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, slower ball and drop-kicked over mid-off. Played the drive on the up, did not intend to keep it down and got it over the head of the fielder for a four
Laughlin to Siraj, FOUR, something to cheer for RCB fans. Short ball and has been pulled away into the on-side past deep square leg. He got hold of the short ball and muscled it away into the on-side

Jofra Archer to Southee, FOUR, slaps the low full toss back at the bowler. Archer could not react in time to clasp that and the ball goes through his hands to race away to the long-off fence for a four. 44 off 18 balls is of academic interest. Or is it?

Unadkat to Southee, FOUR, flogged away as he picked the slower delivery up like dead meat. Then muscled the ball away between deep mid and deep long-on to pick the bones out of it. Southee was deep in his crease and waiting for the slower ball
Unadkat to Siraj, FOUR, reverse paddle and gets the ball away past short third man. That was on the sticks and the batsman got it away amidst an appeal from the bowler

Jofra Archer to de Villiers, FOUR, de Villiers is away. How easy he makes it look. Pacy short ball on the hips, he just whipped that wide of short fine, and Jofra Archer is bowling in the high 140s. Only a genius can do things that de Villiers does
Jofra Archer to de Villiers, FOUR, wow. Wow. What a front foot punch that is. Just a checked punch and look at the ball race away. Extra-cover was wide open and it raced away

Jofra Archer to de Villiers, FOUR, Jofra Archer ends another expensive over with a good length delivery on off and middle, flicked through mid-wicket, in the air but in the gap. He again looks in the mood today and that's bad news for RR fans
Laughlin to de Villiers, FOUR, again greatness from AB. Got close to the swinging slower knuckle ball, but used his bottom hand to great effect, squeezing down on it hard and beats mid-on to his left

Laughlin to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, Parthiv Patel gets lucky. Sliced the slower delivery straight up but it had enough elevation to clear the short third man fielder. Came down the track and aimed to go over cover, was beaten by the angle across him

Unadkat to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, superb effort from Samson but he has dropped that and it has rolled to touch the cushions. Length ball on middle, heaved away towards deep mid, Samson was in from the boundary, backtracked and stuck his right hand up on the leap to catch, but it didn't stick. Would've been a competitor to Boult and Rashid Khan's catches had he hung on. Has a wry smile on his face
Unadkat to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, very full, Parthiv Patel crunches a drive between extra cover and mid-off. Really hit it hard and gets another boundary
Ish Sodhi to de Villiers, FOUR, he got out against CSK playing this, but that was to an offie, this is a leggie, reverse-swept and well wide of backward point. Ish Sodhi is welcomed with a boundary

Ish Sodhi to de Villiers, FOUR, Archer is having a nightmare today. Pulled to the left of him at deep mid, he got there and picked up the ball with his left-hand, then inadvartently the right-hand flicked the ball onto the cushions. Tried to scramble and pull the ball back with a dive, to no avail

Chahal to R Tripathi, FOUR, the boundaries have started to flow. This was fired outside off, Tripathi came down the track and threw his hands at it. Gets a thick outside edge that flies down to the third man fence

Siraj to Klaasen, FOUR, that's the french cut. Short of a length around off, Klaasen goes at it with hard hands, pulls and ends up getting an inside edge. Past the off-stump and runs down to the fine leg boundary. Was very close to knocking down the off-pole

Siraj to Klaasen, FOUR, this is better. Will make him feel better, this shot. Makes room and punches the length delivery through extra-cover. No fielder in the deep as Klaasen collects his second boundary

Siraj to Klaasen, FOUR, improvisation at its best. This was a full toss outside off, Klaasen shuffles across and scoops this gift over short fine leg. On a bounce and into the fence she goes. Has quietly moved into the 30s
U Yadav to Rahane, FOUR, good looking shot! Slightly on the shorter side, Rahane treks back and opens his bat face to force it through point. Races away
U Yadav to Rahane, FOUR, shot! Offers a straight bat and lifts it downtown. Over and wide of the mid-on fielder. Slightly overpitched and Rahane pounced

U Yadav to R Tripathi, FOUR, shortish ball, Tripathi was expecting that. Remains back in his crease and heaves it over mid-wicket. Didn't get it off the middle, but had enough wood on it to go for a boundary. 13 off Umesh's second over

Southee to Rahane, FOUR, nicely done! Didn't over-hit and relied on timing. Scrambled seam short of length delivery, on the stumps, Rahane hops across and tucks it through square leg. No chance for the long leg fielder to cut it off

Chahal to R Tripathi, FOUR, lovely shot! Tossed up delivery, Tripathi dances down the track and in the process backs away to manufacture room. And then, follows it up with a sweetly timed lofted inside-out shot over extra cover
Chahal to R Tripathi, FOUR, now Chahal overcorrects. Drags the length short on this leg-break and Tripathi was quick to latch onto it. Goes back in his crease and muscles the pull through mid-wicket

U Yadav to R Tripathi, FOUR, he was in good shape when he made contact with the ball. Overpitched, Tripathi with a high-backlift lofts the drive over extra cover. No chance for long-off to stop that. High elbow and there's the pose for the photographs
Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, room on offer and Lynn accepts gleefully! Frees his arms and flashes it past cover-point. Absolutely creamed

Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, length and width, that's a harmful combo to serve in the powerplay; Lynn doesn't miss out. Pounces on it with a wielding willow and hits the gap with an air of authority
Sandeep Sharma to Narine, FOUR, just over a leaping backward point! Just. Full and wide, Narine drills off the lower half and manages it get it just over the fielder. Lots of oohs and aahs
Sandeep Sharma to Narine, FOUR, jumps down the pitch and squirts an inside edge on the cross batted swat, no-one in the deep at mid-wicket and he'll claim another boundary

Sandeep Sharma to Narine, FOUR, that's not the area to be bowling, certainly not to Sunil Narine. He loves width and with the length full it only makes matters easy for him, pumps this over extra cover with ease
Shakib to Uthappa, FOUR, now uses the pace and splits short third man and backward point. Played that delightfully late, with a nice clean lean towards off-side
Rashid Khan to Uthappa, FOUR, overpitched, and that's flying over Uthappa's scalp. Scooped away straight down the ground
Brathwaite to Karthik, FOUR, slower delivery sitting up, and the perils of having DK at the death. Hits the pull flat over the mid-wicket region. It's racing away.. it's a four!

S Kaul to A Russell, FOUR, that top-edge to fine leg has arrived, beaten Sandeep Sharma and run away for a boundary. Sandeep, running to his right, leapt in front, went two-handed but the ball just slid through, deflecting to the ropes. 13 needed, only

Brathwaite to Nitish Rana, FOUR, tries to bowl very full and wide from round the wicket but Nitish Rana's reached out to it. Throws his hands, slices it away, and it's been hit with power. Skittles away, beating Sandeep's dive. Scores level

S Kaul to Chris Lynn, FOUR, smart cricket from Lynny! Knuckle ball, Lynn had all the time in the world to pick his shot, makes room outside off and bludgeons it straight back over the bowler's head for a one-bounce four
Shakib to Narine, FOUR, half-tracker, the line doesn't matter, Narine rolls his wrists and slambangs it with a swivel pull down to deep square
Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, smacks the ball and flexes his muscles. Doesn't move. Whoa, how's that for a confidence! Slightly fuller and wider of off, Lynn cracks it straight past mid-off
S Kaul to Uthappa, FOUR, no-one at deep mid-wicket and Kaul bowls a rank bad ball. Short on middle, Uthappa swivels and crunches the pull over mid-wicket
Nitish Rana to Dhawan, FOUR, that's a dream start from Dhawan, Rana dropped one short and just wide of off, Dhawan backed away and cracked it square past cover, no need to run for those
Prasidh to Dhawan, FOUR, lashed over backward point, width on offer from Krishna and Dhawan cashed in big time. Reaches out and slaps it over point, a few bounces and over the ropes

Prasidh to Dhawan, FOUR, was that a half-chance? Short and wide of off, Dhawan got on top of the bounce as he cut, didn't bother to keep it down, went to the right and well wide of Uthappa at backward point, the man in the deep has no chance

A Russell to Manish Pandey, FOUR, two dots and Pandey breaks free. Employs his dexterous wrists - ala Dhoni. Full and just outside off, Pandey jumped back and wristed it beautifully to bisect long-on and deep mid-wicket

A Russell to Manish Pandey, FOUR, KKR have been very clumsy and poor in the field. Here's more evidence. Half-volley just outside off, Pandey slammed the drive wide of long-off and called "Two". Chawla was patrolling the fence and sprinted to his left, trips and loses his balance allowing the ball to roll away to the fence. Messy!
A Russell to Shakib, FOUR, Russell persists with short to Shakib, but it was the slower short ball and Shakib read it early. Stayed back and pulled it over square leg

Prasidh to Shakib, FOUR, misses the yorker on this occasion and Shakib makes him pay. Fuller length delivery outside off, Shakib plants his front foot across and hammers the drive through extra cover. Rocketed away to the fence

A Russell to Goswami, FOUR, cracking shot, Goswami is chancing his good luck now, this was full and this was wide of off, Goswami makes room and cracks it square past cover, beats the fielder in the ring and scorches away to the ropes

A Russell to Goswami, byes, FOUR, that took off from a length, this is turning out to be a big over for SRH. This was a back of a length delivery just outside off, surprised Goswami as it took off from a length, he stabbed and was done in by the bounce, it kept rising and even a leaping keeper can't stop it, four byes added to the total

A Russell to Goswami, FOUR, finesse from Goswami, back of a length and just outside off, Goswami waits on it, plays with an open face and steers it in the gap behind square on the off-side, 20 from the over

Chawla to Goswami, FOUR, woeful from the fielder at cover, I think it's Uthappa. This was tossed up wide of off, Goswami reached out and crashed it towards cover. The ball bounced awkwardly in front of him and Goswami didn't get his body behind it either

Chawla to Dhawan, FOUR, that's all too easy for Dhawan, wrong line from Chawla, drifted this one down the leg-side, the fielder at fine leg was inside the ring and all Dhawan had to do was to find the gap past him, he does so with the sweep and raises SRH's 50

Kuldeep Yadav to Goswami, FOUR, beautifully played, this was tossed up well outside leg, Goswami went down low, reversed his stance, got on top of the bounce and then found the gap behind square on the off-side

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhawan, FOUR, poor ball from Kuldeep, dropped it short and at the stumps, Dhawan had plenty of time as he rocked back and pulled it wide of mid-wicket, even the big dive from Russell can't prevent the ball from hitting the ropes

Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, FOUR, cracking shot, that's quite a way to get going, dropped short and at the stumps, Williamson gets halfway down and pummels it past square leg. Kuldeep is disappointed, knew immediately that it was a bad first ball to the new batsman

Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, FOUR, fired in from round the wicket once again, angling towards leg-stump, Maxi plants his front leg across and slugs a pseudo-pull off a low stance towards fine leg for four. Used the pace and angle, didn't need much power

Bumrah to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, slips through slip's hands! A fraction short, very little width, Shaw's teenage upper body tries a cut, gets a top-edge that flies over Suryakumar Yadav at slip, as he gets a fingertip to it. Away to third man for four

Mustafizur to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, edged and four, Vijay Shankar was clueless when he last batted against Mustafizur, but he gets away with a boundary first ball this time. Nothing convincing about the shot though, this was the off-cutter that gripped the surface and was pushed across the right-hander, Vijay Shankar went hard on the cut, got a fat top-edge that flew in the gap between the keeper and short third man

Hardik Pandya to Pant, leg byes, FOUR, poor line and length from Hardik, length ball on Pant's pads, he was looking to flick and missed, struck his pads and ran away fine, beat the keeper and rolled away to the fence

Cutting to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, another poor ball from Cutting, full-toss on Vijay Shankar's hips and all he had to do was to clip, he does so and beats the tumbling dive from Rahul Chahar - running across from fine leg

Bumrah to Maxwell, FOUR, back of a length delivery angling towards off and middle, Maxwell shuffles across to get off-side of the ball and tickles it away to fine leg for four. Uses the pace extremely well, does Maxwell. Not something he's known for, but there he is proving everyone wrong and playing the finesse game
Hardik Pandya to Maxwell, FOUR, good length delivery in the channel outside off, Maxwell lets it come on, true bounce and no lateral movement, driven away on the up to deep extra cover for four

Hardik Pandya to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, short delivery outside off, Prithvi shows poor technique and shot selection, trying to drag it towards the on-side with a pull, gets a thick under-edge away to fine leg where Bumrah puts in the dive but in vain as it goes through for four. Good effort, but not good enough
Bumrah to Maxwell, FOUR, slower one, off-cutter on a good length, not much deviation, and Maxwell bottom-hand-lofts it through the line to long-off for a one-drop four
Mustafizur to Pant, FOUR, shortish delivery, not much width, Pant punches it to sweeper cover off the back foot and freeze-frames his stance for a future batting manual
Markande to Pant, FOUR, leg-break, but down the wrong line, and a tad short, Pant gets back and helps it on its way with a pull to backward square leg for four. Easy picking for a man in form.
Cutting to Pant, FOUR, crash, bang, wallop! Short, fractionally wide, Pant lashes out at it and finds the gap between short third and backward point for four. Hardest cutter since Sehwag, may I say?
Markande to Pant, FOUR, drag-down of a leg-break, Pant gets on the back foot, clears the front leg, and whip-pulls that to deep square leg for four
Hardik Pandya to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, shortish and skiddy outside off, Vijay Shankar gets low and slices that away to deep backward point for four. Perfect placement behind backward point

Lamichhane to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, poor start from the young leggie. Real loosener - a rank long hop, offering a freebie for Suryakumar first up. The batsman rocks back and murders it over mid-wicket

Lamichhane to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, hammered! Pressure on the teenager. Lamichhane tries to fire it full and outside off, Pandya did well to get under that and drill the drive through extra cover. No chance for Boult from long-off to cut it off

Boult to Rohit, FOUR, there's the boundary for the over Mumbai need. Low full toss outside off, Rohit crouches a bit and uses the pace of Boult, opens the bat face and steers it between backward point and short third man

Boult to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, 17 off the over and that releases the pressure that Mishra and Lamichhane built up. Full and on the pads, easy pickings for Pandya, who flicks it nonchalantly past the diving short fine leg fielder. It was just the matter of putting it in the gap and Pandya did it to perfection

Plunkett to Cutting, FOUR, good way to start the over. Shade too straight from Plunkett, on off and middle, Cutting gets inside the line and whips it backward of square leg. He ensured that he got it past the man at short fine leg

Plunkett to Cutting, FOUR, 14 runs off the first three balls. Pressure. Pressure! Once again Plunkett goes full with a pacy delivery, Cutting says thank you very much and smashes the leather off the ball, right over Markande and giving long-on no chance. Even Rohit could afford a clap with that boundary
Harshal Patel to Lewis, FOUR, Lewis was waiting for this. Half-volley begging to be smashed and Lewis accepts it with glee. Planting his front foot across and belts it through cover

Harshal Patel to Lewis, FOUR, ungainly loft but Lewis manages to clear the in-field on the off-side. Cutter outside off, Lewis threw it all, lost his shape but the power of his willow takes it all the way to the fence. Iyer with a desperate chase, but in vain
Maxwell to Lewis, FOUR, two dots and Lewis breaks free. Flat and short down leg, Lewis swivels across and helps it behind square for a boundary
Lamichhane to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, Krunal is off the mark with a boundary. Floated on leg, Krunal sinks low and sweeps, gets it much finer and collects a boundary
Ashwin to Chahar, FOUR, short and wide, Chahar stretches out to reach it and then cuts it away to the point boundary. He's taking Ashwin apart

Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, FOUR, Dhoni absolutely nails this! Spoils what was turning out to be a good over. Brings up 4000 IPL runs for himself as well. Back of length at the stumps, he opens himself up and swings into a brutal cross-batted smite through square leg

Andrew Tye to Raina, FOUR, sliced away in front of deep point, where the fielder dashes in only to find that he's badly misjudged it. Then he doesn't put his body behind it either, allowing it to slip past the side of him
Andrew Tye to Raina, FOUR, short ball at the head, Raina swivels across nicely and helps the pull away to the fine leg boundary. Just one more needed. What a late assault
Mohit Sharma to du Plessis, FOUR, in the air... but safe! Length ball around off, du Plessis checks his drive and manages to elude the bowler. Any other day and this would have been a catch

Rajpoot to du Plessis, FOUR, du Plessis is riding his luck! This was a length delivery snaking away, he tried to punch it on the up and got a thick outside edge. Past the man at second slip and into the third man fence. As a result of this, Ashwin has decided to bring in the third slip too

Rajpoot to du Plessis, FOUR, first convincing shot of the day by du Plessis. Thinks he's had enough of Rajpoot! Dances down the wicket and chips the back of a length ball over cover. That'll make him feel much better
Andrew Tye to Raina, FOUR, width on offer and Raina pounces on it. Was short and wide outside off, Raina reached for it and carved it over point. Third man is too fine to cut this down

Andrew Tye to Raina, FOUR, what a fine shot! This is what he's known for. Charges down the wicket and drills this one past the bowler. Tye had no chance to stop it, nor did any of the fielders out there
Mohit Sharma to Harbhajan, FOUR, this is what he's here for! Short of a length around off, Harbhajan clears his front leg and slashes this over backward point. One bounce and into the hoardings
Axar to Harbhajan, FOUR, wants to drag the sweep shot from well wide of off, but only manages an under-edge. Cruelly for Axar though, it's gone between the keeper's legs for four
Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, magnificent stroke! Not a bad ball by any means. A good length outswinger, Rahul leans forward and creams the drive through extra cover. No need to run for shots like that

SN Thakur to Nair, FOUR, Nair continues to march on. The wicket won't make a difference to him. A full length delivery around off, Nair moves away and chips it over covers. Billings can't get there in time

SN Thakur to Nair, FOUR, 18 runs off the over! Just what the doctor ordered for Punjab. This was full and outside off, Nair threw his bat at it and got an outside edge that eluded Dhoni and found the fence

Dwayne Bravo to Nair, FOUR, that's a fantastic shot by Nair. Full length delivery on leg, Nair improvises at the last moment and reverse whips it over backward point. Just eludes the man stationed in that position
Chahar to Finch, FOUR, seam-up delivery swinging away, Finch rocks back and punches it beautifully through covers, beating a diving Faf. First boundary for Finch

Chahar to Miller, FOUR, good shot to get going. He is out of his crease to negate swing. Chahar's inswinger ends up on his pads and Miller doesn't miss out. Leans across and flicks it beautifully through backward square leg

Harbhajan to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, horror ball to begin. Short, wide asking to be punished. Tiwary stays leg-side of the ball as he goes deep in his crease. Then employs the cut shot behind square on the off-side

SN Thakur to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, not sure if he intened to go there. Fuller length ball swinging in on leg, Tiwary's bat turns at the point of impact as he looks to on-drive. The ball races away to deep square leg off the inside half of the bat

Dwayne Bravo to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, edged and four. Tiwary didn't see a short ball coming ball. Got big on the batsman and Tiwary persisted with the pull shot. The top edge flies over Dhoni's head for a boundary

Sandeep Sharma to Raina, FOUR, too short and too wide from Sandeep, that's a loosener and that's been put away with ease. Had to reach out - Raina, but he got on top of the bounce and found the gap past cover-point

Sandeep Sharma to Raina, FOUR, lovely shot, too full and too wide from Sandeep, he hasn't found the right line and length so far. Raina leans into the drive, didn't get close to the ball, as a result it was in the air for a long time, but he found the gap to the left of cover and it scooted away

Sandeep Sharma to Raina, FOUR, cracking shot, this is the best of the lot, full and just outside off, Raina leans forward, presents the full face of the bat and drives it back past the non-striker, no need to run for those

Shakib to du Plessis, FOUR, backs away against this arm-ball and hacks it through mid-wicket. He's got it between long-on and deep mid-wicket, and despite a committed dive from Manish Pandey, he can only parry the ball into the ropes

Sandeep Sharma to du Plessis, FOUR, carved away over extra-cover, and all of a sudden CSK have the momentum. Full ball outside off, Faf somehow manages to get under it and lifts it over Williamson in the infield
Brathwaite to du Plessis, FOUR, he's successfully targetted extra cover again. Full ball outside off, pretty short of the blockhole, so Faf has enough space to get it over Williamson's head
Brathwaite to du Plessis, FOUR, four more. Just the over CSK need. Leg-cutter on a back of length, and although he's deceived by it, he's able to drag it away past short fine leg

Brathwaite to du Plessis, FOUR, he's got the boundary. Full ball outside off, the field is set in a way that there are three fielders to the left of point in a ring, and sweeper cover is pretty straight. So Faf carves this full ball square enough of Rashid in the deep to beat him. What a knock he's playing

S Kaul to SN Thakur, FOUR, forget turning the strike over, Thakur has squirted this for four. It's running CSK's way. Kaul's so terribly unlucky though. Beaut of a yorker on off, Thakur gets it right off the toe-end, and with third man up, it runs away
S Kaul to SN Thakur, FOUR, would you believe it? Another french cut for four. Kaul doesn't know how to react. Back of length, cramps Thakur up and takes the inside edge to the fine leg boundary

S Kaul to SN Thakur, FOUR, Shardul Thakur, are you kidding me! He's making up for all the punishment he took from the hands of Carlos Brathwaite. Wankhede erupts. Full ball at the stumps, drilled back past the bowler's head. Swirls away into the fence

S Kaul to Raina, FOUR, lovely, sublime timing from Raina, full toss outside off, he waits on it, uses the pace on the ball, plays with an open face and guides it behind square on the off-side, beats Manish and runs away to the fence
S Kaul to Dhoni, FOUR, lovely shot, too short from Kaul and he can't afford it at his pace, Dhoni swivels across, rolls his wrists and pulls it over square leg, no chance for the fielder at long leg

Chahar to Williamson, FOUR, that's what players like Williamson do. Let the bowler bowl to his strengths that is. It was full, but the line's wide of off-stump, KW leans forward and creams the drive wide of mid-off
Chahar to Williamson, FOUR, seam-up, searching for swing around middle and leg, too easy for Williamson as he shuffles to flick that wide of fine leg

Chahar to Williamson, FOUR, another hit-me on leg-stump, all Williamson needed to do was get some bat on that; he spots the line early and manages enough contact to clip that fine for a boundary. A wicket a three fours, an eventful over comes to an end

SN Thakur to Y Pathan, FOUR, boundary after ages. Much needed one for SRH. They need to get a move on here. Full and sliding on the pads, Pathan gets enough on the flick to clear Watto at mid-wicket. No chance for the fielder in the deep to cut it off

Jadeja to Y Pathan, FOUR, excellent placement from Pathan. Waited for the quicker delivery and then back cut it past a diving backward point. Once it beat Bhajji there was no stopping that. Superb spell from Jadeja, who has come into his own as the tournament has progressed, ends with 4-0-13-1

Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, FOUR, Pathan has slowly started to up the ante. Slower short of length delivery and it sat up nicely for Pathan, who forehands the slap in front of square and gives sweeper cover no chance

SN Thakur to Brathwaite, FOUR, wow! What power! This was close to yorker length, but Brathwaite used the depth of the crease nicely, went deep to get underneath it and hammered it over extra cover. There was a fielder in the deep but he had no chance

Lungi Ngidi to Goswami, FOUR, second slip would have gobbled that! Genuine outside edge. Just a push away from the body, the ball swerved away off a good length to click the edge and even a dive from first slip (to his left) wasn't good enough
Chahar to Williamson, FOUR, smashed! Not an error from the bowler, but that shot was all about Williamson's class. Hawkeyed the ball and freed his arms to slaughter the cut through covers
Lungi Ngidi to Goswami, FOUR, too full and gets slammed! Right in the swinging arc for Goswami who times the pants of a flashy drive and gets it in the gap through covers
SN Thakur to Shakib, FOUR, cross-seam delivery, width on offer, Shakib stands tall and stabs it through covers. The fielders on the off-side ring stay unmoved
Chahar to Shakib, FOUR, sits up from back of a length, Shakib had all the time in the world to pick his spot; swivels and muscles the pull behind square
Gowtham to Narine, FOUR, Narine wastes no time in getting away. Backs away to this flatter ball, to make room, and bashes it through the covers. KKR are away

Gowtham to Uthappa, byes, FOUR, that's beaten everyone! Lots of turn on this off break and Uthappa brings out the reverse sweep to combat it. Cannot connect and Klaasen didn't anticipate the spin either. Races away

Laughlin to Shubman Gill, FOUR, and now young Gill takes a leaf out of his skipper's book. The seam-up ball that held its line just outside off, Gill is pretty glued to the crease and smartly just uses the pace of the bowler to guide it to third man. Beats Sodhi on this occasion, who tried his best but couldn't stop it
Shreyas Gopal to Shubman Gill, FOUR, there's that customary dragger from the leggie. Rare loose ball, short and width for the taking, Gill carves his bat staying deep and finds the gap, beats point

Jofra Archer to Shubman Gill, FOUR, Eden Gardens is loving it. Fearsome striking by Gill. No margin for error at all, Archer errs by giving him the width, Gill stands tall and crashes it through extra cover. Fierce!
Unadkat to A Russell, FOUR, Unadkat is not learning. Just shortens his length and keeps it outside off, Russell reaches out and slaps it through extra cover. Rocketed away to the fence

Laughlin to A Russell, FOUR, misses the length and Russell makes him pay. Clears his front leg, unleashes his bottom hand and whacks it across the line, the practice pitches help his cause. Trickles away wide of long-on
Laughlin to A Russell, FOUR, wow! Bludgeoned away. Russell gets deep in his crease, Laughlin fails to nail the yorker. And Russell caresses it through extra cover

Gowtham to Chris Lynn, FOUR, bludgeoned away! Typical brute force from Lynn. He had been trying to break free for a while now and finally, gets one away. Not much room, but he makes some by backing away and smacks it away through the gap at cover. Nobody moved

Jofra Archer to Karthik, FOUR, beautifully timed! Karthik is away with a sublime stroke. Half volley on the pads, he latches onto it with a wristy flick that's placed quite wide of the fine leg fielder

Unadkat to Karthik, FOUR, up and over! Loosener from Unadkat to start with, wide half volley and Karthik just ensures that he clears the infield. That he does so with a front-footed lofted chip over cover. Easily done

Unadkat to Karthik, FOUR, cracking stroke! The previous one was a bad ball but this is just a stunning shot. There was width but on a length, Karthik just went through on the front foot and thumped the drive on the up. Bisected mid-off and extra cover easily

Unadkat to Chris Lynn, FOUR, Lynn joins the party. Have to say that Unadkat is releasing all the pressure built with some poor bowling. Once again gifts width outside off and Lynn was waiting for this for a while now. Frees his arms to go over cover. Didn't middle that well but still had enough to go over the infield

Shreyas Gopal to Karthik, FOUR, deft by Karthik. This is sliding down leg and on the shorter side as well. He just gets across to get a tickle that beats Klaasen. Quick outfield and short fine leg's chase is in vain
Prasidh to Rahane, FOUR, feeds the pads. Rahane gets on his toes, shuffling inside the line and whippy hands in flicking it in front of square. The class .. sheer tons of it
Narine to Klaasen, FOUR, the reverse sweep! Played with disdain as he lofted it high over short third man for a four. He did it against the Indian spinners in South Africa. Rang a bell?

Chawla to Samson, FOUR, low full toss, trying for a yorker but gets it wrong. That was 120kph! The batsman though stays calm, maintains his shape and open-faces the ball over cover for a four. The deep cover was too straight. Three men were around the point region

Chawla to R Tripathi, FOUR, rare float up. So unlike Chawla .. wide, asking for treatment. And obliged. Tripathi reaches out to the pitch, clearing his back leg and then full flowing hands as he drills it through the covers

Prasidh to Gowtham, FOUR, mark the calendar! KKR vs SRH - 25th May! KKR win this by 25 runs as they did the choking act much better than RR in the death overs. RR's dream run has been stalled. The last ball was short, the pull was not controlled but went fine on the on-side for a four. Did not matter

Prasidh to Rahane, FOUR, 134.1kph. Sitting up in the slot, nicely getting onto the hips at a good height for Rahane to latch. Does it with a swiping glance, getting airborne and pinching the mid-wicket gap

Prasidh to Rahane, FOUR, typical overcompensate. After a drifter into the pads, Krishna goes into a bouncer, wide outside off. Rahane has his timing tonight, and enough on it to jump-cut it square. The powerplay's enough to do its bit

Narine to Rahane, FOUR, no Rahane ain't cheeky enough for these late cuts. Just can't line himself up right, just about fetches it out of DK's gloves as he outside-edges it past the cordon. Ah, never mind
Kuldeep Yadav to Samson, FOUR, juicy half tracker. Samson waits, waits some more. And some more. Loads up a pull, with all the muscle to swat it away through mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Samson, FOUR, rubs in some more elegance. Clears his back leg, reads the flight, reads the googly and inside-outs it over extra cover. Oh Kolkata need the breather .. time-out
Searles to Samson, FOUR, more width. Samson's as good as most with flat-bats. This time he's carving them behind point. Absolute crunch
Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, length ball wide outside off, a horizontal-batted crash to deep point for four. They're away
K Khaleel Ahmed to Narine, FOUR, full delivery sliding towards the on-side, a tickle away to fine leg for four. @143.6km/h, good pace

Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, no frickin' way! Lady luck can't possibly be so mean! Back of a length outside off, jumps up and catches Chris Lynn by surprise, who gets a leading edge which, believe me, goes through the gap at deep backward point for four

Rashid Khan to Chris Lynn, FOUR, Lynn has made his mind up. He isn't deviating from it. This is what he'll do, live or die. Length ball at the stumps, and he sweeps it away through square leg. It was uppish, and there was a fielder in the ring, but he got it to his left
Rashid Khan to Karthik, FOUR, beautiful footwork from Karthik, so nimble. He's been in such sublime form. The length is short, which he picks in a flash, and pummels the pull through mid-wicket

K Khaleel Ahmed to Shubman Gill, FOUR, stunning timing from Shubman Gill! Back of length outside off, Gill didn't even go through with this back foot punch. He checks the shot late, but it skims off the sweet spot to beat Williamson at extra cover
batsman: K Khaleel Ahmed to Shubman Gill

Commentary: Bhuvneshwar to Shubman Gill, FOUR, Bhuvneshwar dared to put his hands up, but he wasn't stopping this. A bit short of the blockhole this time, Gill accentuates the error by going deep in his crease and drills it hard and straight. Keeps KKR breathing
Brathwaite to Shivam Mavi, FOUR, how are the nerves now SRH? How are the nerves now Carlos? Full ball outside off, Mavi slices it away over backward point
Bhuvneshwar to Narine, FOUR, 3rd full-toss from Bhuvi! Low full-toss around off, Narine punches that to sweeper cover for four. Pure timing!

Bhuvneshwar to Narine, FOUR, wow, Bhuvi under pressure straight away! Is Narine the new Jayasuriya? A back of a length delivery drifting into the pads, a slog across the line, and a thick inside edge to backward square leg for four
Bhuvneshwar to Narine, FOUR, another back of a length ball, and just cross-batted disdainfully over the bowler's head for four. No respect!
S Kaul to Chris Lynn, FOUR, full toss down leg, tickled away to fine leg for four
Brathwaite to Chris Lynn, FOUR, short and wide, Chris Lynn slashes at it, gets it over the infield towards third man for four
Brathwaite to Chris Lynn, FOUR, wide half-volley outside off, Chris Lynn has his feet glued to the turf and lofts it towards sweeper cover for four. Lands about a centimeter short of the rope
Shakib to Nitish Rana, FOUR, flat and angling towards middle, Nitish Rana switches his stance into a right-hander's, reverse-sweeps to third man for four

Kuldeep Yadav to Saha, FOUR, lovely, Saha is sweeping Kuldeep into frustration, this was very full and well wide of off, Saha bent down low and then swept it in front of square on the on-side. Lynn was very square on the on-side and even a big dive can't help him pull the ball back into play

Chawla to Shakib, FOUR, boundaries starting to flow for SRH. They need to move on here. Chawla has been too full today and this was no different, googly overpitched and Shakib drills the drive through extra cover. The fielder at long-off didn't even bother to chase

Chawla to Shakib, FOUR, Shakib backed away to free his arms and unlike Narine, Chawla tosses it up on the stumps, right sort of room to play the drive and Shakib places it perfectly past extra cover, even beat long-off to his right

Narine to Shakib, FOUR, half tracker and Shakib makes him pay. There was ample width as well, Shakib reached out and flayed the cut behind square on the off-side, no chance for the sweeper cover to get across

Narine to Shakib, FOUR, now to the other side of the ground. Bit more air and Shakib fetches the sweep from outside off, he rolled his wrists to place it in front square on the leg-side - right between deep mid-wicket and long-on

Prasidh to Rashid Khan, FOUR, streaky! But that is the way Rashid plays. Short and outside off, he just threw the kitchen sink at it and the top-edge flies over a leaping Karthik. Big over for SRH, but the loss of Brathwaite would hurt them

Prasidh to Bhuvneshwar, FOUR, good start to the over, some glove love as well between Bhuvi and Rashid. Short and outside off, Bhuvi arches back and carves the cut over backward point. No one out there to stop that from reaching the fence

Prasidh to Rashid Khan, FOUR, lovely batting from Rashid. It was the slower delivery and he didn't try to overhit it, saw mid-off inside the circle and delayed his loft for a second, struck it cleanly and got a one bounce four

A Russell to Dhawan, FOUR, smashed, Saha had to jump and get out of the way, it was coming at a rate of knots, back of a length delivery outside off, Dhawan got forward and absolutely drilled it back at the non-striker, no need to run for those

A Russell to Dhawan, FOUR, lovely, four men in that off-side ring and still Dhawan manages to pierce the gap. The slower ball from Russell, a hint of width on offer and Dhawan was all over it, crashes it square past cover-point and watches it hit the ropes

Shivam Mavi to Saha, FOUR, edged and four, handy runs for Saha, back of a length and rising onto the batsman, Saha didn't get on top of the bounce, was looking to cut, gets a thick edge that runs away past the lone slip

Shivam Mavi to Saha, FOUR, cracking shot, that might help Saha break the shackles, on a good length and just outside off, he plonked his front-foot forward and lifted it through the line, over mid-wicket and almost all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes

Chawla to Dhawan, FOUR, lovely shot, very full from Chawla, right in the zone for Dhawan, he gets his front-foot forward and drills it to the left of the umpire. The two fielders in the deep have no chance

Chawla to Dhawan, FOUR, cracking shot, Chawla has been too full this over, Dhawan gets forward, gets close to the ball and drills it back past the non-striker, even a big dive at long-off can't stop the ball, it was Prasidh there
Prasidh to Saha, FOUR, beautifully played, a rare bad ball from KKR tonight, a floaty half-volley outside off, Saha leans into the shot, finds the gap past cover and watches it roll away to the fence

Kuldeep Yadav to Saha, FOUR, nicely played by Saha, Narine gave up the chase very early, this was tossed up on middle, Saha went down low, used the pace on the ball and lapped it fine, beat short fine and rolled away to the fence

Sandeep Sharma to du Plessis, FOUR, punched away off the back foot with a slightly horizontal bat. Stays forward and takes care of the shortish ball. Not too short and the batsman thumped the ball away. He is in good form

Rashid Khan to Raina, FOUR, round the wicket, fired down leg, Raina tries a sweep, gets a tickle on it to get it away to (extremely) fine leg for four. Almost long stop. Runs coming in a hurry for CSK

Brathwaite to Watson, FOUR, this will do. This will do for CSK. Slower ball but Brathwaite landed that way too short, pulled powerfully through mid-wicket and it's well wide of the fielder in the deep

Sandeep Sharma to Watson, FOUR, low full toss and he's crashed that over extra-cover, the shoulders are dropping in the Orange camp. The yellow in the stands is very bright. Watson got down low on his knees and loft-drove that

Sandeep Sharma to Watson, FOUR, oh this is sublime batting from Watson. Knows Sandeep Sharma is going for the wide yorker with third man inside the ring and he smartly squeezes it in the gap between short third man and backward point. A massive 27-run-game-killing over

Brathwaite to Watson, FOUR, audacious is the word for this shot. The bowler runs in and bowls a pacy length ball, this lad doesn't move and just opens the face of the bat at the very last moment to beat the diving short third man fielder. He's playing around with the bowlers and the fielders
Rashid Khan to Watson, FOUR, cheeky, gets inside the line of this googly and paddles it past the man at short fine leg, this is clever batting from Watson

Rashid Khan to Watson, FOUR, the fielder at deep backward square leg has misjudged this. Watson slogged this in the air, the fielder dived but couldn't get there. On the biggest night, CSK have negated Rashid Khan without a wicket
S Kaul to Watson, FOUR, oh that's a bowler-killer. Luckily it didn't come very straight at Kaul. Very full from Kaul, Watson drills it hard and beats long-off

S Kaul to Watson, FOUR, and he's doing it in style. Kaul tries the yorker and Watson drives it straight and hard, Kaul takes his leg out of the way to save himself and the ball rockets to the boundary

Brathwaite to Rayudu, FOUR, that's it! Chennai Super Kings are champions of IPL for the third time. What a brilliant return to the stage this is from CSK after a two-year ban. The players rush to the middle to mob Watson. Meanwhile, captain Dhoni is gently walking around with a gentle smile of his
Sandeep Sharma to Watson, FOUR, full, too full and biffed! Murdered down the ground past the bowler for a four. The man at mid-off had no chance
Sandeep Sharma to Watson, FOUR, full delivery and the batsman has pile-driven the ball down the ground. The man at mid-off was wide enough for the ball to fly into the fence on a bounce
S Kaul to Raina, FOUR, short one from over the wicket, Raina just has to guide the pull to fine leg for four. Easy pickings
S Kaul to Raina, FOUR, just a fraction short towards leg-stump, Raina twists his torso into another late pull to fine leg for four. Excellent over for CSK!
S Kaul to Watson, FOUR, short-ish delivery outside off, Watson reaches out and cross-bats the loft towards long-off for four. Falls only just inside the rope

Lungi Ngidi to Dhawan, FOUR, Karn Sharma might have saved a few for CSK. Ngidi errs in line, on the hips and Dhawan glances it towards fine leg. Karn was square and had a lot of ground to cover, he runs to his left and puts in the full length dive, flicks the ball in play. Third umpire has a look and sees that he is in contact with the ad cushions, first boundary off the final

Jadeja to Williamson, FOUR, a leaping Ngidi .. and if something evades him, it's never a catch good enough to be called a drop. Williamson half-dabs, off the outer half and short third man can only try
Jadeja to Shakib, FOUR, and he drills it better. It's fuller, it's wider, but Shakib's back on his knee, slapping it much straighter. Yea, there's nobody at long-on
Dwayne Bravo to Williamson, FOUR, oh these hands. Bravo keeps dishing out full-paced stuff, and overcooks don't help his cause either. Williamson shuffles, leaning to bottom-hand it into extra cover

Dwayne Bravo to Williamson, FOUR, some more. Bravo decides to compensate, dragging in a half tracker. Williamson's way too smart to see through these ploys .. stays back tall, heaving it away. And mid-wicket will only chase
Karn Sharma to Y Pathan, FOUR, woah. He can get cheeky too. Lets the ball get big beside, uses up the width and cuts, fine, very fine
SN Thakur to Y Pathan, FOUR, oh my. You really don't bowl wide to Yusuf, you surely don't bowl short sitter to Yusuf. But when you do both, Yusuf can slap, powering it square
Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, FOUR, that massive front foot clear, and then those hands. Absolutely crunches this carve away over the covers
Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, FOUR, brute Yusuf! Bravo has another poor cutter, only apt to end his spell with a muscle over the umpire. Nah, nothing Rayudu trying to cut it off can do

Chahar to Williamson, FOUR, poor bowling from Chahar. He tries the slower delivery when his natural deliveries were causing all sorts of problem, sits up as a half tracker and Williamson dismisses it with a pull in front of square leg

Karn Sharma to Dhawan, FOUR, wrong line from Karn. Lands it outside leg and Dhawan is quickly down on his knee to play the sweep, picked the googly and slotted it wide of the deep backward square. The fielder had no chance of stopping that

Dwayne Bravo to Williamson, FOUR, superb shot! It is not easy to hit Bravo's slower balls. But Williamson does it superbly. Just delayed his shot and lofted the full off-cutter over extra cover. The placement was also perfect as he got it wide of sweeper cover

Jadeja to Shakib, FOUR, Shakib is off the mark with a boundary. Watto tries his best to stop it at short third man, but just couldn't get across. Fraction short and around off, Shakib manages to chop the cut behind square and Watson's dive is just an after thought. The sweeper also dives in vain near the boundary rope

Chahar to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, MS won't be happy with this effort. It was touch fuller of good length and there was just enough room, Parthiv Patel throws his bat at it and creams the drive to mid-off. Shardul Thakur there misfields and it goes for a boundary to long-off
Jadeja to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, nicely done! It wasn't too wide, Parthiv Patel jumped back and slightly moved leg-side. And then, the lefty opened his bat-face to guide it fine of short third man

Tahir to de Grandhomme, FOUR, leggie on the stumps, de Grandhomme clears his leg and flicks it nonchalantly, he finds the gap wide of long-on and it thuds into the fence. Welcome boundary for de Grandhomme and RCB

Chahar to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, MS won't be happy with this effort. It was touch fuller of good length and there was just enough room, Parthiv Patel throws his bat at it and creams the drive to mid-off. Shardul Thakur there misfields and it goes for a boundary to long-off
Jadeja to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, nicely done! It wasn't too wide, Parthiv Patel jumped back and slightly moved leg-side. And then, the lefty opened his bat-face to guide it fine of short third man

Tahir to de Grandhomme, FOUR, leggie on the stumps, de Grandhomme clears his leg and flicks it nonchalantly, he finds the gap wide of long-on and it thuds into the fence. Welcome boundary for de Grandhomme and RCB
Sandeep Sharma to Nitish Rana, FOUR, too easy. Full pitch up, Rana's down quickly as well, sweeping him with utter disdain into an behind square region. Zero respect
Rashid Khan to Nitish Rana, FOUR, just too short. Also the googly going away from him helps, which Rana's quick to pounce on with a fierce cut. And there's no one at point
Rashid Khan to Nitish Rana, FOUR, premeditates the reverse, and knows third man is inside to sweep it neatly over him, perfectly
Rashid Khan to A Russell, FOUR, picks. Dispatches. Spots it outside off and carves it away, no clobbers it away over extra cover. Almost all the way too ..

S Kaul to A Russell, FOUR, more carnage. Russell's turning the tables, and turning them with muscle. Kaul dishes out another short sit-up outside off, for Russell to move away to, free up his arms and slap it away powerfully through extra cover

Bhuvneshwar to A Russell, FOUR, well, well, well. Bhuvneshwar's got this one to reverse, tailing in sharply on the pads. But Russell's rocked behind in his crease, with all his bottom-hand coming in this whip through mid-wicket
Bhuvneshwar to A Russell, FOUR, it's a joke. It really is. It's a yorker, no less, but Russell's adept at squeezing it away from leg-stump with a drill into long-off

Bhuvneshwar to Nitish Rana, FOUR, clumsy from Rashid and he looks to be in some trouble - short of a length and well outside off, Rana gets on top of the bounce and cracked it straight to cover-point - Rashid jammed his fingers at the ball and let it slip through. 'It's paining', he says cheekily later
Bhuvneshwar to Uthappa, FOUR, nicely done, short of a length and at the stumps, Uthappa gets inside the line and tucks it fine - backward square leg was inside the ring and has no chance

Sandeep Sharma to Nitish Rana, FOUR, lovely, fuller length delivery and at the stumps, Rana leans forward, head on top of the ball and then lets his wrists take over - drives it sumptuously wide of mid-wicket for a boundary
Sandeep Sharma to Nitish Rana, FOUR, edged and four, the slower off-cutter from Sandeep, did Rana in for pace - was early into the drive and the thick edge runs past the keeper for a boundary

S Kaul to Uthappa, FOUR, handy runs for Uthappa, backed away to a full ball and drove with a closed face - Kaul couldn't stop the ball on his followthrough and although it wasn't sweetly struck - managed to beat the diving mid-off fielder

Shakib to Uthappa, FOUR, jumps down, a little too close for comfort eventually, but then has quick hard hands and good enough power in squeezing out this eventual yorker through sweeper. Yup, the powerplay does help ..
Rashid Khan to Nitish Rana, FOUR, another ugly across-the-line swipe. And Uthappa's luck rubs into Rana, who goes hard, gets a thick top-edge, flying over slip
Sandeep Sharma to Nitish Rana, FOUR, fine leg's inside, and if that's not a legality to go extravagant, nothing is! Rana reads the slower one, shuffles, sits on a knee and sweeps, well past 45
Chawla to Warner, FOUR, first boundary for SRH and Warner! Another googly by Chawla, the southpaw rocks back and places it right through the gap at covers with a firm backfoot punch
Chawla to Warner, FOUR, second boundary of the over! Not a great start by Chawla. Darts this one around off and Warner thumps it through the gap at covers once again. The outfield is lightning quick
Nitish Rana to Bairstow, FOUR, cracking shot, dropped short and wide of off, Bairstow makes room and clatters it behind square on the off-side for a boundary
Ferguson to Bairstow, FOUR, streaky and four, short of a length and at the stumps, Bairstow was backing away on the pull, gets a thick inside edge that flies over the top of leg-stump
Chawla to Warner, FOUR, lovely, the wrong 'un from Piyush, but the length is well short, Warner makes room and clatters it over cover for a boundary

A Russell to Manish Pandey, FOUR, cracking shot, the slower ball and Manish spotted it, backed away and slapped it in the gap wide of cover, no chance for the men in the ring and Manish collects his first boundary

Prasidh to Shankar, FOUR, handy runs for Shankar, on a length and tailing back into the right-hander, he waited on it and then clipped it backward of square on the on-side - right in the gap between the two fielders in the ring and it runs away to the ropes
Ferguson to Shankar, FOUR, much-needed boundary for Shankar, spotted the slower ball and then delayed the pull, gets it wide of mid-wicket and runs away to the ropes

Prasidh to Warner, FOUR, stand and deliver! No need to move, anyone. Stay put. Short in length around off, Warner rocks back and pulls it over mid-wicket. No fielders in the deep and that shall be four runs to end the over
Ferguson to Warner, FOUR, boundary to end the over! That'll spoil his first over. Bowls a low full toss outside off and Warner carves it through the gap at covers. The outfield does the rest
Narine to Warner, FOUR, fine start for SRH as the 50 comes up! A long hop down the leg side and Warner drags it past the fielder at short fine leg. Struggling with his lines is Narine
Narine to Warner, FOUR, another loosener down the leg side and it's been hacked through square leg by Warner. Clears the infield convincingly for four more
Kuldeep Yadav to Warner, FOUR, class! Returning to the IPL after a couple of years but it seems he never left. Premeditates and puts this one away to the third man fence with a fine reverse sweep
Narine to Bairstow, FOUR, played! Finesse in that shot. Goes down on his knee and scoops the floater right past the keeper. No fine leg in place and that shall be four runs for YJB

A Russell to Warner, FOUR, impeccable power on that! Width on offer and Warner slams it past the fielder at covers. Just a boundary away from a lightning quick fifty, is Warner. Narine is walking off the field as he got hit on his nails while trying to stop this bullet that was fired at him

McClenaghan to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, hammered! Fractionally short and that's enough for Shaw to take it on, Goes on the front foot to launch the pull over mid-on. Gets it well wide and also comfortably over the fielder
Krunal Pandya to Ingram, FOUR, he was saving the power for this shot. It was full and was wide of off, Ingram smkoes it straight down the ground and it rockets to fence
Krunal Pandya to Ingram, FOUR, this one was much slower from Krunal Pandya, he was guilty of providing width again. Ingram delays his bat swing and powers it wide of backward point for a boundary

Krunal Pandya to Ingram, FOUR, bowling against left-handers for a left-arm spinner is never an easy prospect and Krunal Pandya is finding it really tough at the moment. It was on the shorter side and there was width, Ingram uses the width to good effect and punches it wide of cover for another four. He is looking in fabulous touch

Bumrah to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan is finally getting a move on. He must have faced million balls of Bumrah in the nets and that experience comes to his advantage. He comes on the front foot and drives it wide of mid-off, it races along the carpet for a boundary
Cutting to Ingram, FOUR, shot man! He is finding the gaps to perfection, moves across to the off-side and plays a cheeky little paddle over short fine for a boundary

Cutting to Dhawan, FOUR, that is immaculate placement from Dhawan. He waits for the ball to arrive, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and guides it in between short third and backward point for a boundary

Cutting to Pant, FOUR, that is Pant-madness for you! It was a good length delivery on the stumps, Pant moves to the off-side and half-paddle-half-flicks it over short fine. He gets enough bat on it and it lands centimeters short of the boundary ropes

Cutting to Pant, FOUR, Pant gets lucky. It was a short of length delivery on the body, he was taken aback by how sharply it lifted off the deck and was too early on the pull shot. Gets it off the glove and just clears the keeper for a boundary

Hardik Pandya to Pant, FOUR, just to tell people that he can hit it over the off-side too. It was a slower one wide of off, Pant delays his bat swing just a little bit and powers it wide of long-off for a boundary

McClenaghan to Pant, FOUR, it takes some talent to hit that high full-toss for a boundary. And Pant indeed has that. Not the most elegantly but it surely was effective. It was a full-toss on the stumps, Pant stays in the crease and pumps it wide of long-off for a boundary
