Stokes to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, much needed boundary for RCB. Parthiv has been mistiming those pulls/heaves but not this time. He waits for the delivery to arrive and pummels it to wide long-on, couple of bounces and into the fence

Jofra Archer to Moeen Ali, FOUR, streaky! Spears a full delivery at 147.6ks and Mo squirts a thick inside edge through his legs, the placement is such that he splits fine leg and deep square leg perfectly

Stokes to Stoinis, FOUR, thumped! Stoinis picks the slower delivery, maintains a good base by going deep in the crease and whips it with a lot of bottom hand to wide long-on, one bounce and over the ropes

Jofra Archer to Moeen Ali, FOUR, past Gowtham's dive. Lands the slower delivery in a fullish range, Mo with a readymade clear of his front leg pumps it straight down the ground, the wet outfield makes the ball skid off the ground

Jofra Archer to Stoinis, FOUR, cheeky! Stoinis had made up his mind even before Archer was about to bowl. He crouched low, moved across his stumps and scooped the full toss to the fine leg fence, 17 off the final over

D Kulkarni to Kohli, FOUR, nicely played - was in the air for a long time, but Kohli got the placement right - took a step down the track on the flick, didn't time it all that well - but found the gap

D Kulkarni to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, lovely shot, the slower ball from Dhawal, but sprayed it onto Parthiv's pads, whipped away over short fine, couple of bounces and over the ropes - RCB needed some momentum and 9 came from this over
Jofra Archer to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, cheeky and four, short and just outside off, Parthiv arches back, opens the face of the bat and then runs it late - past the keeper, one bounce and over the ropes

Jofra Archer to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Parthiv - not all that convincing, but he will take the runs on offer - the idea was right, fine leg was inside the ring and he was looking to clear him - late on the shot, off the gloves and past the diving keeper
Jofra Archer to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, beautifully played, length ball and Parthiv was waiting on it, gets a good stride forward and thumps it over mid-off, couple of bounces and over the ropes
Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, FOUR, cheeky from AB, a pre-meditated lap sweep, bends down low, uses the pace on the ball and laps it past the keeper for a boundary

Aaron to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, lovely shot, Aaron - from round the wicket, slides this one onto Parthiv's hips, he gets inside the line, uses the angle and clips it behind square on the on-side for a boundary
Aaron to de Villiers, FOUR, streaky and four, fuller length delivery and well wide of off, AB saw the width and threw his hands at that, gets a thick inside edge that races past the off-stump

Aaron to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, Parthiv is putting on a show here - Aaron leaks 16 in his first over, width on offer and Parthiv chopped it behind square on the off-side, to backward point's right and the man in the deep had a lot to do - can't get there despite the slide
U Yadav to Buttler, FOUR, Buttler is off and running. Done with his sighter and stands tall to this length delivery. Gets on top of the bounce and caresses it through the gap at extra cover

Navdeep Saini to Buttler, FOUR, Buttler rubs salt into RCB's wounds. Fullish and stops on the pitch a bit, Buttler didn't go with full conviction, just checks his loft straight down the ground and it races away to the fence

Navdeep Saini to Buttler, FOUR, wow! This was brute power. Dismissive stuff from Buttler. Saini floats up a half-volley just outside off, Buttler with his quicksilver hands lunges across and slaps it with precision through extra cover

Stoinis to Smith, FOUR, streaky! Slightly slower - 129.9kph, doesn't bounce much and Smith is early into his pull shot as he fetches from outside off. Gets a fat inside edge that eludes the leg-stump and runs away to the fine leg fence

Moeen Ali to Buttler, FOUR, Buttler doesn't need sighters against his fellow countryman! Fifty for Buttler and he brings it up in style. Tossed up ball, Buttler skips down the pitch and batters it straight down the ground. No chance for the long-off fielder

U Yadav to Smith, FOUR, 139.8kph, length ball outside off, Smith gets a thick outside edge as he looks to force it through the off-side. He did open his bat-face, but it was clearly off the edge. Goes fine to third man for four more
Stoinis to R Tripathi, FOUR, 125.3kph, a harmless short ball that sits up nicely for the right-hander. Tripathi waits for it on the back foot and easily pulls it over mid-wicket for a one-bounce four

Siraj to R Tripathi, FOUR, 139.5kph, fuller than a good length ball outside off. The width was on offer for Tripathi to free his arms and the Royals batter takes full toll of it. Presses forward and lifts it handsomely over extra cover. Classy shot!
Navdeep Saini to R Tripathi, FOUR, 142.2kph, full toss on the stumps, Tripathi backs away a long way and carves it behind backward point. Used the bowler's pace to his advantage did Tripathi

U Yadav to Rahane, FOUR, that's criminal from Umesh. Veers it down leg with fine leg inside the ring, easy-peasy for Rahane. Slower ball, goes all awry and Rahane with soft hands that beats the keeper

U Yadav to Rahane, FOUR, consecutive fours for Rahane. Umesh corrects his length and pounds it short just outside off, Rahane exploits the width and flashes his bat. Hetmyer should've done well at point, fails to stop it and off she goes to the fence in a hurry

Navdeep Saini to Buttler, FOUR, boom! That's a fierce slap from Buttler. Suddenly, it's raining boundaries for RR. Very full and overpitches in the process just outside off, Buttler conserves some energy by wielding his bat and creams the drive through extra cover

Navdeep Saini to Buttler, byes, FOUR, nothing is going right for RCB at the moment. Sloppy from Nath. Full and swerved in a little, Buttler failed to connect on the big heave and Nath makes a mess of it behind. Very lazy stuff, was late to bend down and misses it altogether

Navdeep Saini to Buttler, FOUR, this looked intentional from Buttler. Shows off his dexterity. Lenght delivery cutting back in just outside off, Buttler uses the pace and opens his bat face at the last moment in running it past short third man, who's dive went in vain

Navdeep Saini to Rahane, FOUR, woah! This is a very uncharacteristic from Rahane. Kohli-esque wristy flick. Very full and around off, Rahane shuffles across and twirls his wrists at the nth minute to clip it nonchalantly through mid-wicket. All swag from the RR skipper!

Navdeep Saini to Rahane, FOUR, lofted over extra cover. He's one of the best manipulators on the off-side. But Saini keeps providing him with freebies like these. Pitched fuller and just outside off, Rahane shifts his weight forward and handsomely lifts it over the in-field

Stoinis to Buttler, FOUR, short and put away behind square with disdain. Nothing delivery from Stoinis, can't drop at this length, especially at his pace. Sits up nicely for Buttler, who takes full toll of it

Stoinis to Buttler, FOUR, expertly done by Buttler. Stoinis went for the slower short ball but Buttler was upto the challenge. Jumped high and plays the pull off the front foot over mid-wicket. Generates some power and collects four

Malinga to Watson, FOUR, edged and flies over the slips. Doesn't matter how they come but Watson will take it. Fuller length and seaming away just outside off, Watson goes hard on the downtown swing and gets a thick outside edge which balloons over to the third man fence

Krunal Pandya to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, much needed boundary for CSK! Jadhav didn't get hold of the slog sweep that well here, still got enough and also found the placement well. Speeds away to the deep square leg fence

Hardik Pandya to Dwayne Bravo, leg byes, FOUR, not off the bat but CSK won't mind. Was angling in on leg stump and Bravo shuffled early for the flick. Off the pads and races away down to the fine leg fence

Malinga to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, cheeky way to bring up a fine fifty! Shortish with good bounce from Malinga, Jadhav just waits and dabs it with an open face. Well wide of de Kock and quite fine to the third man fence. It's been a good knock so far from Jadhav but he has lacked support

Malinga to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, sensational stroke! It was fed on the pads, yes, but the execution of the stroke was superb from Jadhav. Drop kicks it through backward square leg and a sliding Bumrah from fine leg can't cut it off. Perfect start for CSK in this over
Bumrah to Chahar, FOUR, nicely struck! Overpitched and Chahar makes room to biff it over extra cover. Clean hit and in the gap as well

Hardik Pandya to SN Thakur, FOUR, smacked hard! Thakur having some fun here. Another overcooked delivery from Hardik with width on offer, blasted away through extra cover and well wide of long-off. Handy runs for CSK to reduce the margin of defeat

Malinga to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, this is poor bowling from Malinga. He's just not finding his lines right. For the umpteenth time, drifts it down leg. Bread and butter for Jadhav, who picks it away over short fine leg. Behrendorff leaps but it comfortably clears him

Behrendorff to Raina, FOUR, educated edge and Raina collects a boundary. Shortish just outside off, Raina intentionally opens the bat face at the last minute and guides it through the vacant slip cordon. Cheekily done!

Behrendorff to Raina, FOUR, consecutive fours for Raina and the "CSK, CSK" chants are back. Behrendorff wafts it full and gives some width for Raina to free his arms. Lifted over mid-off, holds his shape nicely and desperate chase from the fielder but in vain

Bumrah to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, dismissive pull from Jadhav. Skiddy short of length just outside off, Jadhav gets quickly onto the back foot and short-arm jabs it wide of mid-on. Rolled his wrists at the right time to find the gap

Bumrah to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, wow! Helicoptered over mid-on. Brilliant from Jadhav. It was nearly a yorker length from Bumrah, Jadhav took his front leg out of the way and stayed deep. Lifted it excellently over mid-on. Even the inventor of the helicopter shot, MS Dhoni - who's at the other end - would've enjoyed that

Bumrah to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, four more. He's a smart customer, is the pocket-rocket Jadhav. Bumrah is under pressure now. Peppered it short outside off, Jadhav cleverly arched his back at the last moment and elevated it over the slip. Third man had no chance and he'll collect a boundary

Rahul Chahar to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, outside edge and beats short third man. Floated up, spins away after pitching and lures Jadhav into a drive, who goes with hard hands and gets an thick outside edge. Zooms away to the third man fence
Tahir to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, fired down the leg-side, Suryakumar gets down on one knee and sweeps it fine past the man at 45

Mohit Sharma to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, this will ease his nerves a bit. Mohit Sharma is bowling back of length balls so there was no long-off in place. Krunal Pandya moves forward, and lofts it over mid-off. The timing again wasn't great but it was good enough to get it over mid-off

Mohit Sharma to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, poor effort from Rayudu in the deep. And that will result in a four. Back-to-back fours for MI and Krunal. It was short and was on the body, Krunal Pandya gets behind it and pulls it with a lot of power to deep square leg. Rayudu there should have easily stopped it but instead he lets it go

Dwayne Bravo to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, nicely done from Suryakumar Yadav! He was anticipating a slower one and it indeed was one, Suryakumar Yadav backs away, makes room and eases it past short third for a boundary. No need to run for that!

Mohit Sharma to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, time to buy a lottery ticket, Krunal! He has been saved three or four times in this knock so far. It was a slower one wide of off, Krunal Pandya attempts a slog, it comes off the outside half of the bat and just about clears short third. Jadhav gives a chase but ball will win

Mohit Sharma to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, just above the cover fielder. Can you believe it, he is teasing the fielders to the fullest at the moment. It was on a fuller length and was wide of off, Krunal Pandya gets it just enough bat on it to send it to fence

Dwayne Bravo to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, that has been clobbered down the ground. And it will beat Jadeja at the long-on fence. Dwayne Bravo misses the yorker just a bit but that allows Suryakumar Yadav to get under it and power it straight back past the bowler. Jadeja dived full-stretch but his effort went in vain

Dwayne Bravo to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, he has powered this one for another four. Hardik Pandya is playing a gem. It was a fuller length delivery wide of off, Hardik Pandya reaches for it and pumps it wide of cover for another boundary. He loved it! Punches the air in delight!
Chahar to de Kock, FOUR, inside edge past the sticks. It's always dangerous playing a horizontal shot to an inswinging delivery, de Kock wanted to cut, luckily it missed the poles and beat fine leg

SN Thakur to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, overpitched and Suryakumar just essays a lovely cover drive. Gentle step forward and then the free flow of the bat, he ball bounced over cover-point, that tells you how good the square is. A batsman's paradise it should be

SN Thakur to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, MI need more of these. The start doesn't justify the surface on offer, yes CSK bowled tight, but they could have had more runs. This is full and on the stumps, Suryakumar on-drives and beats mid-on

SN Thakur to Rohit, FOUR, in the airrrr and just wide of cover-point. It went just a yard or two away from Raina's outstretched left arm. Short and wide delivery, poor delivery, Rohit cuts uppishly and gets away with it

Chahar to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, now then, this is too much from CSK! Yes, the ball is swinging away, but you can't have such a big Test-match kind of gap at cover in a T20 game and this isn't the red ball which moves better. Fullish and outside off stump, Suryakumar easily drives and picks up a boundary

Chahar to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, oh shot! Brilliant hit, the shot of the game thus far and will take some doing to beat this. A simple on-drive it looks like, but it's tough to play an on-drive with a straight bat to the right of mid-on, let the short of length delivery come and timed it sweetly, Rayudu gives chase and loses the race

Chahar to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, freebie down the leg-side and Suryakumar won't miss out after this kind of a start, a gentle flick shot in the gap at mid-wicket and that's all you need at the Wankhede with a fast outfield
Jadeja to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, out comes the reverse paddle from Krunal, third man was inside the ring, so he did well to get bat on ball and it escaped to the boundary to ease some pressure

Bhuvneshwar to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, oh my word! What a shot, definitely not a bad ball at all. The end result of this back foot punch was great, but that's not how you should actually be playing. Worked on that occasion, could have been a drag on another day. Inswinger from Bhuvi, Shaw has this strange ability to play off the back foot to ones that aren't actually short, the ball escapes through the gap at cover

Bhuvneshwar to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, it's such a poor idea to remove the slip without seeing through at least one over, Bhuvi does this time and again, now one escapes through the vacant cordon, a wide slip would have had him. Short of a length delivery outside off stump, Shaw looks to punch off the back foot, gets a thick edge that runs away to the third man fence

Sandeep Sharma to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, lovely shot! Tewatia can bat. And he can to do it at a brisk rate. Delhi would want him to get them the momentum. On a length around off, Tewatia stays leg-side and uses the space he created to drive on the rise past mid-off

Sandeep Sharma to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, much needed for Delhi. The crowd find their voice with this boundary. Sandeep bangs it in short and at his pace on this surface it sat up, Iyer thumps the pull over mid-wicket and the ball raced away to the fence

S Kaul to Chris Morris, FOUR, almost similar to the Ingram delivery. Slow but on the shorter side outside off, Morris keeps the cut down and hits it behind point, got enough power to beat third man in the deep

Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, that is a top shot. Iyer has been so good today. He has waited for the bad delivery and once he has got one, he's ensured to put it away. This was an overpitch and Iyer smacks it straight back over Rashid
Bhuvneshwar to Axar, FOUR, fine shot from Axar! Width on offer and although the length isn't very full, his hands do the rest as he powers this through extra cover. Finds the gap perfectly
Nabi to Dhawan, FOUR, this time backward square leg is back for Nabi, but Dhawan sweeps this very fine from him and also takes out the man at 45, nicely placed
Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, full toss to begin with, Iyer creamed that nicely along the ground to cover, freebie to begin with from Rashid Khan
Lamichhane to Bairstow, FOUR, fine shot to start for Bairstow! Picked the googly and got across on one knee to sweep it hard. Connected well, got it wide of short fine leg and it raced away
Rahul Tewatia to Hooda, FOUR, and here's the overcompensated rubbish to follow up the ripper. Drifting well down leg, very full too .. and swept away firmly behind square

Lamichhane to Y Pathan, FOUR, when you're six-foot-something, you'd rather use it. Well Pathan does, stretching forward big time, getting to the pitch of the ball outside off and nailing his sweep behind square. Rabada tries sweeping and diving, but no, can't

Chris Morris to Nabi, FOUR, oh easy. Short, but not short enough. Leg-lined and leg-lined enough. Quick and real quick enough. All Nabi needs is a bat, swivelling, pulling and getting enough of a tickle fine past the keeper

Rabada to Nabi, FOUR, drags it off the inside half, ahh, no wonder it's a batsman's game. Rabada tries a slower cutter on the stumps, which Nabi makes room to and tries slicing over the covers -- but ends up with the edge on the inside pulling through an empty cow corner. Just a shot stands in between Hyderabad and a victory

Lamichhane to Bairstow, FOUR, more runs! A wild slog this time from Bairstow who picked the googly but got it off the inside half of the blade. Still had enough on it to find the deep mid-wicket fence

Chris Morris to Bairstow, FOUR, he's carrying on from where he right off in Hyderabad. DC are helping him by offering pace too. Morris bangs this short and that's right down Bairstow's ally. Forehand pull pumped away to the deep mid-wicket fence

Chris Morris to Bairstow, FOUR, clears the infield! Bairstow's intentions very clear, he wants to kill the game in the Powerplay. Not really in the slot but he goes through with the chip shot down the ground. Easily over mid-on and it speeds to the fence
Chris Morris to Bairstow, FOUR, he's toying around with the bowling, Bairstow. Another loose half tracker and he picks it up with a shovel pull over short fine leg. Wrong line and duly punished

Chris Morris to Bairstow, leg byes, FOUR, bonus runs! They all count though. Pacy delivery on leg stump, was a freebie in every sense and though Bairstow couldn't get bat on the flick, it brushes the pad and splits the keeper and short fine leg

Axar to Warner, byes, FOUR, It goes through everyone. It was a short of length delivery, keeps low, Warner was taken aback by the low bounce. He fails to get any bat to it. It misses the leg-stump by a whisker and the low bounce beats Pant too

Axar to Bairstow, FOUR, Jonny is on fire! He dashes down the ground, wasn't to the pitch of the ball still goes through with the shot and times it well enough to smash it down the ground for a boundary

Rabada to Bairstow, FOUR, kind of a shot Jonny would salivate upon for days! It was on a fuller length and was on the stumps, Bairstow takes a good stride forward and creams it through cover for a boundary. Another 50-run wasy partnership for Jonny and Warner. It's an easy game for them at the moment
Rabada to Bairstow, FOUR, wow! Jonny, you champion! He can't do nothing wrong at the moment. Waits for the slower one, delays his bat swing and tonks it straight down the ground

Rabada to Bairstow, FOUR, that's edged and four! All of a sudden, this has become a different match. We are playing on the same wicket, mind you! It was a fuller length delivery on the stumps, Bairstow waits for it to arrive and opens the face of the bat at the very last moment to guide it past third man. No stopping that!

Chris Morris to Shankar, FOUR, gee! He is in some form these days, few months back, he would have hit it straight to cover. But, not now! He clobbers it over cover, bat turns in his hands but that didn't make any difference. It canters to the fence
Southee to Chris Lynn, FOUR, adding insult to injury. Poor follow up delivery from Southee, drifting on the pads and Lynn duly puts it away with a fine clip off his pads over short fine leg

Southee to Chris Lynn, FOUR, not a good finish by Southee. Another loosener outside off, too short and wide of off. Lynn throws his bat and drills it hard along the ground through extra cover. Strong bottom-hand power and beats a desperate dive from Klaasen at sweeper cover

Navdeep Saini to Narine, FOUR, the plan was right from Saini, almost had Narine in trouble but somehow the batsman manages to help it away towards the fine leg fence. Bouncer following Narine, who was moving to leg and he gets cramped for all room because of the spicy bounce but Narine manages get it away to the boundary

Navdeep Saini to Narine, FOUR, miss the yorker, get set to face the penalty. Saini misses it by an inch, ends up as a low full toss and Narine after clearing his front leg, whips it to the left of mid-on. Raced away in a jiffy
Negi to Nitish Rana, FOUR, blasted away! Much-needed for KKR. Gets width on offer and he was hanging back for the slap-cut. Smashed hard and it's wide of sweeper as well

Navdeep Saini to Karthik, FOUR, almost a blinder at mid-off by Kohli! Dived swiftly to his left and had it in his left hand mid-air but couldn't hold on. RCB have spilled quite a few already tonight and though this isn't an easy one, you'd hope that some stick at least. Was a bludgeoning drive from DK and he couldn't quite keep it down. Nearly paid the price but eventually gets a boundary
Southee to A Russell, FOUR, more runs! He can do no wrong! Short ball this time, Russell waits for it and ramps merrily over Parthiv. Races away to the fence in no time

Navdeep Saini to Uthappa, FOUR, top-edge and over the keeper. Sometimes extra pace can let you down but Saini shouldn't mind this. Bouncer, rearing off the deck and Uthappa for the nth time tries the pull and gets a top-edge to his favour
Southee to Chris Lynn, FOUR, larruped over mid-on. Easy-peasy for Lynn. Southee missed the yorker, Lynn gets deep and clears his front leg to whip it firmly over the in-field

Southee to Chris Lynn, FOUR, back-to-back fours for Lynn. He's getting a move on. Southee overcorrects and slips in the slower short ball, Lynn waits and pulls it after twirling his wrists behind square. Big gap and he will earn a boundary

Southee to Uthappa, FOUR, textbook-esque inside-out loft from Uthappa. All class from Robbie. Expensive over for RCB. Nothing delivery from Southee, pitches it right in the slot and Uthappa gets forward and just stylishly lifts it over extra cover

Siraj to Uthappa, FOUR, woah! All timing from Uthappa. Very cheeky, saw the width provided, so just waited deep and steered it behind point. This outfield is pretty quick and third man can't cut it off
Siraj to Uthappa, FOUR, Siraj is epitome of waywardness. Slips this one down leg, just help-your-self-with-a-boundary ball. Uthappa accepts it with glee and walks across to tickle it very fine

Siraj to Uthappa, FOUR, stand and deliver from Uthappa. Half-volley from Siraj, begging to be hit and Uthappa takes his front foot across and slams the drive with brute power past mid-off. Nobody moved and it sped off the bat in a hurry

Siraj to Uthappa, FOUR, this is ridiculous from Siraj. The slower bouncer, well wide of off and third man was inside the ring. Too easy for Uthappa, just waited and dinked it effortlessly over the fielder at 45. Big over for KKR, 19 coming off it
Prasidh to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, early signs that this deck is a beauty. It was banged in short, came at a comfortable hip-height for Parthiv and he whips it over short fine for a boundary

Prasidh to Kohli, FOUR, Kohli-special! Treat for the crowd. It was on a fuller length and was on the stumps, Kohli takes a good stride forward and leans into it, he times the drive superbly well. It beats the cover and races to the fence

Prasidh to Kohli, FOUR, back-to-back fours for Kohli. And this crowd is buzzing with excitement. Prasidh is looking for some swing on offer, he bowls another fuller length delivery, Kohli takes a good stride forward and drives it like a boss through cover. No stopping that!
Chawla to de Villiers, FOUR, gets loop, gets room, gets turn too. And AB decides to help it along .. stepping forward a touch and lofting it inside-out over extra cover
Chawla to Kohli, FOUR, 50*35. Chawla drags the length back, which means Kohli decides to wait. And wait. And wait some more, before fetching a real late cut out of DK's gloves to guide it real fine

Narine to de Villiers, FOUR, dropped short. AB makes it look much, much worse, rocking behind in the crease and then throwing his weight behind a tonked loft, splitting long-off and extra cover in the deep perfectly
Narine to de Villiers, FOUR, another backing in, another flat-batted throw, and another hammer over extra cover. Oh he's making it a habit, a very, very lovely-looking habit

Nitish Rana to Kohli, FOUR, 105.6kph. Yorker. Leg-lined. Kohli's wrists are quicker, with a lot of bottom-hand flicking it away behind square. Kuldeep sweeps from fine leg, dives, and his palm can only parry it over

Prasidh to de Villiers, FOUR, 110.9kph, ah, Djoker! The change up finally goes wrong. AB reads the long hop, stands up full height and forehands it inside-out over extra cover. It's his fifty too -- 30th
Prasidh to de Villiers, FOUR, the horrors of a wide full toss. High. Lots of width. AB doesn't overhit, piling on and just slicing it behind point
Ferguson to Kohli, FOUR, 130.7kph, just too full. Kohli's already deep in his crease, incubating half vollies and then carving them inside-out over long-off
Kuldeep Yadav to Stoinis, FOUR, big edge. Stoinis misreads the googly, wafts down the wrong line, but what are outside-edges for? The ball gropes at it, running through the slip cordon

Prasidh to Stoinis, FOUR, 150.3kph in a low full toss. Stoinis' measured this field, he knows Krishna can't bowl short with the first ball wide and then sits way, way inside his crease to slash it away through an empty point
Narine to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, gee! Parthiv Patel is in some form. He goes down on his knees and slog sweeps it over deep mid-wicket with utmost ease for a boundary
Prasidh to Stoinis, FOUR, and gets funky. Shuffles, doesn't mind showing away his stumps as he scoops this one really fine .. 18 off this one, 205 in all, and Bangalore nail the perfect finish!

Ferguson to Kohli, FOUR, ball has flown off the bat. Wow! What timing! Ferguson did the mistake of bowling on the pads and Kohli generally punishes when someone makes such mistake. He gets in a good position and whips it wide of mid-wicket for another four

Ferguson to Kohli, FOUR, it's raining boundaries here! It was on a fuller length and wide of off, Kohli plunges forward and times the drive incredibly well. The placement was excellent too, it beats backward point and third man. And canters to the fence

Ferguson to Kohli, FOUR, an on-drive with a straight bat is one of the hardest shots to play in our sport. But how insanely easy Kohli made it look. Class, sheer class! He comes on the front foot and drives it past mid-on for another four

Chawla to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, he wants to match Kohli, It was on a fuller length and was on the stumps. Parthiv brings his bat down early and sweeps it wide of deep backward square leg for a four. Incredible bat-speed!

Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, FOUR, bonus runs for RCB, exacly what they want. Very rarely, a bowler of Kuldeep's caliber delivers a morsel like this. It was down the leg-side and Kohli just helps it to the the fine-leg fence with a flick
Ashwin to Watson, FOUR, rank length, quite leg-lined too .. and Watson's quickly under it, sitting on a knee and sweeping it firmly through square leg

Shami to Rayudu, FOUR, pace is one thing you can't bowl on this surface. 143.2kph and Rayudu even advanced to make his own speed, makes just enough room to thump it over extra cover, Miller tried his best but the timing was good enough to beat him
Tye to Dhoni, FOUR, and thumped! That was a mini helicopter as he smashed a full ball down the ground past long-off for a four. The ball was full, Dhoni just gave himself a little room and smashed it
Sam Curran to Dhoni, FOUR, and that wasn't timed! Off the inner half of the bat and the ball escapes into the gap between deep square and deep mid for a four. Poor delivery and was put away

Sam Curran to Dhoni, FOUR, fuller and channelling away, Dhoni lifts the ball away over cover and that is a four. One bounce into the fence. These death overs are his territory and Sam Curran is messing up his lengths as well

Shami to Dhoni, FOUR, not the smartest of bowling from Shami. The deep fine was in and Shami bowls it short. Dhoni hangs back and pulls it over short fine leg for a four. The Chennai crowd loving every bit of it
Shami to du Plessis, FOUR, ah, neat. When there's no pace off the pitch, Faf decides to generate some himself. Lovely step away, step down and goes inside-out over mid-off

Shami to du Plessis, FOUR, another Shami outfoxing. Faf continues coming down the pitch, Shami tries pulling his length back, but then Faf is happy to wait on it, present a nice full bat face in slapping it away over point
Tye to Watson, FOUR, juicy. Full, easily down leg, and all Watson has to do is tickle - but he swings, middles his sweep behind square powerfully
Sam Curran to Watson, FOUR, ruins what should've been a really good over. Slips into the pads and Watson plays some sort of a half-flick, half-sweep to nail it in the gap behind square

Tye to Raina, FOUR, that line was not going to work for long, especially with third man in. Angled outside off and Raina uses that smartly to steer a boundary behind point - splitting backward point and short third

Chahar to Gayle, FOUR, prodigious movement for Chahar. Pitched up and late shape away for Chahar just outside off. Gayle goes after it, hard hands and gets a thick outside edge which eludes Bhajji at short third man
Kuggeleijn to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, and the dilscoop! Done really well as he scooped it over the keeper's head for a one bounce four. And Sarfaraz Khan has a go at someone after playing the shot

Kuggeleijn to Miller, FOUR, it was in the arc for Miller and he dispatched it for a boundary. Kuggeleijn after bowling brilliant slower ones decides to bowl a yorker. He fails to get the yorker right, Miller gets under and powers it wide of long-off. It rockets to the fence

Chahar to Sarfaraz Khan, no ball, FOUR, it slips out of Chahar's hand. And this is not the first time it has happened. It was a full-toss above the waist height and Sarfaraz Khan reaches for it and smashes it wide of third man for a boundary. Free-hit coming up!

Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, glorious from Rahul. Indipper on a fuller length at the stumps, Rahul doesn't try to hit it too hard. Just presents a straight bat face and drives it elegantly past mid-on. His drives are a thing of beauty..

Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, follows it up with another loosener down leg, Rahul makes him pay again. Tried the in-angler, overcompensates and Rahul gets across to tickle it very fine. Good over for KXIP, all the pressure created has been released now off the final two balls
Tahir to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, poor finish to the over. Too short and too wide of off, Sarfaraz goes back and opens his bat face to lace it past point. Sweeper cover tries his best but in vain
Jadeja to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, wonderfully done! Waits on it, and then dabs it away with an open face of the bat. Dhoni did spread his legs in anticipation but it nutmegged him
Jadeja to Rahul, FOUR, was that a punch or a cut! But was beautifully done as he used the pace of the bowler to send it away. The man at deep cover put in a clumsy dive but couldn't cut it off

Rashid Khan to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, and the extra delivery costs them a boundary.. Quick and drifting across the left hander, Kishan plays the late cut even though there's a slip in place, but the pace of Rashid was too quick for Warner to react
Rashid Khan to Rahul Chahar, FOUR, oh, this is nicely done by Rahul. He's no mug with the bat. Picks the googly, waits and waits before dabbing it past slip. Has enough legs to reach the fence

Bhuvneshwar to Rahul Chahar, FOUR, well, this is clever batting frm Rahul. He's too good with the dinks. Again picks the length delivery, gets deep in his crease and opens his bat face at the last minute to glide it past Bairtsow
Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, FOUR, chipped over extra cover! Fuller and wide of off, Pollard with his long levers spanks it over the in-field. It came off the cue-end but comfortably cleared the fielder

Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, FOUR, another blemish and it's a boundary. MI and Pollard will not mind this. Very full from Kumar, Pollard clubs it down the ground. Hooda misjudges it and charges in way too early, doesn't get his body behind the line of the ball and lets it through to the boundary
Sandeep Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, punched down the ground! Hits it on top of the bounce with the full face of the bat and beats mid-off with elan
Y Pathan to de Kock, FOUR, bad ball on to the pads and has been paddled away fine past short fine leg for a four

S Kaul to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, what timing! It was just a short-arm jab on the dab and the ball races to the fence. Short of length, Kishan rides the bounce and steers it late behind point, Pathan had no chance in the deep

Behrendorff to Bairstow, FOUR, crunched through cover. Shows the kind of form he's been in this tournament. Short and fraction width provided, enough for Bairstow to cash in. Getting on top of the bounce and slapping it in the gap
Rahul Chahar to Hooda, FOUR, goes on the back foot and cuts it well, beats deep backward point for a boundary. Welcome boundary for SRH!
Alzarri Joseph to Sandeep Sharma, FOUR, on the legs at full pace. Sharma gets a tickle, and that's all he needed to .. into fine leg

Behrendorff to Warner, FOUR, poor delivery from Behrendorff and gets the punishment. Swinging into the pads of Warner, who shuffles across and flicks it with supreme timing behind square on the leg-side. There was a fielder in the deep but had no chance of stopping that

Behrendorff to Bairstow, FOUR, seems like Bairstow read the bowler's mind here. Expected the short delivery, went deep in his crease and cleared his front leg to mow it over mid-wicket. Vijay Shankar in the dug-out enjoyed that
Behrendorff to Bairstow, FOUR, strokes it on the rise but it beats Rohit's dive at mid-off. Fullish just outside off, Bairstow hammers it hard and luckily the ball teasingly evades the MI skipper

Rahul Chahar to Warner, FOUR, Warner latches onto it, on this occasion. Pushed through quicker on middle, Warner took some time in getting his bat down on the heave, gets it off the inner half in the pocket between short fine leg and square leg
Rahul Chahar to Shankar, FOUR, width available that time, Shankar waits for it to spin and steers it wide of backward point for a boundary

Southee to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, should have been stopped by Chahal there. Iyer leans ahead and times his square drive to beat the leggie's dive at point. First one of the innings for Delhi and their skipper
Negi to Ingram, FOUR, too short. Ingram rocks behind, lining up well to allow the ball to do its bit and then cut it away really late past the keeper

Chahal to Ingram, FOUR, nails the sweep. Ingram gets out a big stride, and then does well to roll his wrists on the ball as he powers it away despite the slight kick up off the pitch - keeping it down and into square leg

Chahal to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, chops the cut away off the back foot and gets it past the man at point for a four. DC are racing away towards the target. 42 needed now. Dropped it slightly short and Shreyas Iyer was quick to pounce on it

Navdeep Saini to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, fundamental error! The ball lands on the practice wickets and skids. Siraj at third man took it easy and the skid off the ground had enough pace to burst through the hands of the fielder. Shreyas Iyer picked up the short ball and slashed it for the ball to race away off the outer-half of the bat

Moeen Ali to Pant, FOUR, fetches the length ball from outside off and drags the sweep away into the on-side. The ball raced away square of the wicket on the on-side for a four. Didn't time it but had enough on it for a single
Chahal to Pant, FOUR, terrible delivery and has been put away. Pant rocked back and allowed the bat flow to take over and cut it past point. The man at deep cover had no chance

Siraj to Axar, FOUR, and those are the winning runs! Stand and deliver. Length delivery decking away, Axar lifts the ball over the in-field and gets it away to the fence for a four to complete the formalities

Southee to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, that's a good shot by Shaw. Has timed the ball nicely so far. Gets one overpitched dolly on the pads and he makes sure to put it away to the deep mid-wicket fence with a flick

Southee to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for the youngster. Gets one short ball down the leg side and Shaw drags it past the fielder at short fine leg. Kohli's expressions say it all, not a great line to bowl
Southee to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, shawt! Width on offer and no great pace either, Prithvi Shaw reaches out for it and slaps it through cover-point. Hat-trick of boundaries for the opener

Southee to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, make it four in a row. Exhibition of stroke play by Shaw. Short ball well outside off and the batsman plays an exquisite square cut. No chance of stopping that, neither for the fielder at point, nor for the fielder at third man

Southee to Prithvi Shaw, leg byes, FOUR, from bad to worse. 20 runs of the over already. Short ball around leg, Prithvi Shaw tries to flick it away but the ball clips his pads instead and races away to the fine leg fence

Navdeep Saini to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, doesn't matter where the field is when you're bowling full tosses. Shaw stands deep in his crease, swinging with a lot of bottom-hand to whack it straight down the ground

Navdeep Saini to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, hard slog across the line. Doesn't pick it cleanly, dragging it in the end only off the inside half of his bat .. the powerplay and Southee's chasing dive can't stop it from trickling into cow corner
Negi to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, just too easy. Strays down leg, and then refuses to turn back in. But Iyer turns on his heel, swivelling big to heave it away fine

Siraj to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, 144.7kph. Damn, violence. Iyer anticipates the back of a length sitter with a lot of width outside off and backs away further to free up his hands as he slices a flashy cut into an empty backward point zone
Negi to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, continues backing away in the crease, giving his arms the free-up space and slaps, hard, through point

Moeen Ali to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, cheekily experimental. An early premeditated lapped-scoop on realizing that there's no short fine leg, and Iyer doesn't mind walking all the way across his stumps if he has to. Doesn't find the middle, but the ballooning miscue is just as good
Ishant to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, lovely, Parthiv is the man in form for RCB, length ball on the pads, he gets inside the line and clips it over mid-wicket, couple of bounces and over the ropes

Chris Morris to Kohli, FOUR, edged and four, Dhawan was the fielder at wide slip - dived to his right, but the ball was just wide of him. An awkward jab from Kohli as he pushed away from his body, didn't count for the extra bounce

Ishant to Moeen Ali, FOUR, wow! Mo has just squeezed a yorker for a boundary. The only thing wrong on Ishant's part is - it was outside off, Mo bends down, opens the bat face and squeezes it past backward point

Lamichhane to Akshdeep Nath, FOUR, cheeky! First ball and Akshdeep is down on his knee to play the paddle, uses the pace on the ball and places it fine, the lightning fast outfield took care of the rest

Chris Morris to Akshdeep Nath, FOUR, it was boom or bust for Akshdeep with three dots, he decides it is the latter. Charges down and converts it into a full length delivery, cracks the drive past extra cover and there was no stopping that

Lamichhane to Akshdeep Nath, FOUR, good effort by Morris, but in vain. Akshdeep Nath was down the wicket to chip this widish delivery to long-off. Morris sprints across, gets his hands to it but his knee gets stuck in the turf, hence he fails to stop it cleanly

Rabada to Akshdeep Nath, FOUR, cheeky shot by Akshdeep! Waits for the ball to arrive, opens the bat face very late and guides it to the third man fence. With that pace, it was always going to race away to the fence

Ishant to de Villiers, FOUR, lovely, more of the AB we know and love of the past - back of a length and just outside off, not a bad ball by any means, AB comes down the track, makes room and cracks it square past cover-point - Two men dived, but the ball split them expertly

D Kulkarni to Chris Lynn, FOUR, french-cut! Drags back the length, does Dhawal and Lynn goes ahead with a pull shot. Gets an inside edge that rockets past the stumps and races away to the fine leg fence

D Kulkarni to Chris Lynn, FOUR, second boundary of the over! Short and wide outside off, Chris Lynn reaches out for it and slaps it past the diving fielder at cover. Once it's past the ring it's always going to be a boundary with such a quick outfield
Gowtham to Narine, FOUR, easy pickings for Narine! This was a flatter delivery on the pads and the southpaw flicks it past the fielder at short fine leg, nicely placed shot that
Gowtham to Narine, FOUR, expensive over so far... Floated around middle and leg, Narine picks it over square leg and adds four more to his tally. That's the only way he plays

Gowtham to Narine, FOUR, another mediocre delivery by Gowtham. Drifts this one on the pads and Narine gets it over square leg with a nonchalant flick, the home crowd is loving this even though the Royals are getting belted here

Stokes to Shubman Gill, leg byes, FOUR, the pad-tickles will do just as well. Stokes slips in radar and Gill would feel he's missed out on some free runs here, missing the glance, but his pads take it fine enough

Gowtham to Narine, FOUR, 22 runs of Gowtham's opening over! The required run rate is down to 6 within a span of 6 deliveries. Narine treks back and chips the short ball over the infield at wide mid-off

Jofra Archer to Chris Lynn, FOUR, has been the Lynn and Narine show so far! Short in length and width on offer, the batsman reaches out and carves it past the fielder at square third man, four more for the right hander

D Kulkarni to Chris Lynn, FOUR, can you believe this? Dhawal could have had two wickets in two deliveries, but the wicket column reads zero. Lynn had got an inside edge that richocheted on to the stumps and raced to the fine leg fence thereafter. Happened with Dhoni a couple of days back as the bails didn't move. Lynn had even started walking but according to the law he survives. His night, probably

D Kulkarni to Chris Lynn, FOUR, short and punished! Was a slower delivery and Lynn hacks it over mid-wicket. Four more to the opener who was somewhat deceived due to the lack of pace and was early in his shot

D Kulkarni to Narine, FOUR, in the air but it's in the gap too. Narine had slogged the length delivery towards cow corner but the fielders were stationed at long-on and deep mid-wicket. Neither of them could reach as the ball found the fence

D Kulkarni to Narine, FOUR, nothing's going right for Dhawal Kulkarni. Attempts another slower delivery and Narine bludgeons it over mid-on. Had enough elevation to clear the fielder stationed inside the ring
S Midhun to Uthappa, FOUR, was a flighted ball and Uthappa got to the pitch of the ball to slam the drive past cover. Was hit well enough for the ball to race through to the fence
S Midhun to Chris Lynn, FOUR, drops the ball short and has been cut away. More of an outer-edge on the cut and that was well away from the man at slip for a four. Tripathi had no chance this time
Chawla to Rahane, FOUR, lovely, tossed up just outside off, Rahane went down on his knee, played with the spin and swiped it over mid-wicket, one bounce and over the ropes

Kuldeep Yadav to Smith, FOUR, edged and four. The googly with some extra bite, Smith was taken aback by the bounce and tried to withdraw his bat, but the outside edge had already been found and it raced away fine

Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, FOUR, read the batsman changing his grip and fired in a quicker delivery at 107ks, Buttler still adjusted and reverse swept it past a diving Lynn at backward point. It was a tentative dive from the Australian
Prasidh to Smith, FOUR, expertly played! The off-cutter on a shortish length and moreover Smith had the width, he back cuts it behind point and Narine never looked like getting to the ball

Prasidh to Smith, FOUR, fifty for Smith. He is the key for RR if they have to get a good total. Has played himself in and now has the hang of the surface. Waits for the slower delivery, shuffles across and pulls it backward of square leg
Prasidh to Smith, FOUR, edged and runs! Four of them. Yorkerish delivery outside off, Smith squeezes it out and the ball flies away past the dive of the keeper for a four
Gurney to Smith, FOUR, and finally a four! Smart play from the Aussie. Was a full ball, Smith opened the bat face and placed it in the gap between short third and point

Chawla to Buttler, FOUR, lovely, the wrong 'un from Chawla, but the length is way too short, allows Buttler to go back and whip it behind square on the on-side - no one in the deep and the ball runs away to the ropes

Prasidh to Buttler, FOUR, nicely played, Buttler was so quick in reading Prasidh's slower ball, prods across and clips it in front of square on the on-side - beats mid-wicket and runs away to the ropes
Prasidh to Buttler, FOUR, lovely, this is Buttler at his best, length ball outside off, he's quick to move across and then paddles it towards the vacant fine leg region, one bounce and over the ropes

Narine to Smith, FOUR, cracking shot, much needed for the Royals, dropped short and spinning back into the right-hander, Smith waited on it and then cut it late - beat backward point and raced away to the fence

Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, FOUR, much needed boundary for Buttler. He was feeling the pressure. Waits for the flighted delivery to land and reverse sweeps it over backward point, came right off the meat as it raced away

Kuldeep Yadav to Smith, FOUR, shot! He picked the wrong 'un and though he was hitting against the spin, he was in complete control. Went down on his knee, rolled his wrists and broomed it to deep square leg

Sandeep Sharma to Gayle, FOUR, there he goes - the enforecer - clearing out his front leg, not quite getting hold of his rather agricultural hoick, but his biceps will do it, get it over the mid-wicket infield
S Kaul to Agarwal, FOUR, driven on the up and the length ball disappears into the deep cover fence. Climbed into the delivery and hit it on top of the bounce to get it between cover and mid-off
S Kaul to Rahul, FOUR, picked his spot and pulled it away! Short ball, was chest high and Rahul pulled it with a lot of disdain. One bounce and into the fence. Man at deep mid had no chance
Nabi to Rahul, FOUR, deft touch from Rahul! Spotted the length of this flat delivery early and opened the bat face at the last minute to guide it past Bairstow's gloves fine of third man

Nabi to Rahul, FOUR, fifty for KL Rahul! His third in his last four games. Jumps out of his crease and hacks the flat delivery wide of long-on, Manish Pandey runs across and dives but couldn't only manage a fingertip on that

S Kaul to Agarwal, FOUR, thwacked from the crease. No feet. Just stand and deliver: pumps the length ball to the right of long-off and Manish Pandey does well to flick the ball back while on the move. He, however, took a brief while to regather his momentum and by that time the ball had rolled back to kiss the boundary hoardings. Unlucky!
Nabi to Rahul, FOUR, flat and full on off, Rahul hammers it straight and got enough power to beat the diving fielder at long-off. Crowd going bonkers now
Rashid Khan to Agarwal, FOUR, quicker slider in the slot, and Agarwal's already taken his front leg out of the way to drill it uppishly down the ground

Bhuvneshwar to Rahul, FOUR, 138.4kph. Too full, Rahul does well going inside-out with his slice over backward point .. but Kaul runs across from third man, gets the slide in as well, but probably ends up slipping with the dew, slipping all over it

Nabi to Rahul, FOUR, just doesn't give out any pace to work around with, but Rahul has enough of his own. Making some room, and going back in the crease to pile on the drag down as he slaps it damn violently through extra cover

S Kaul to Rahul, FOUR, wow! That was a superb shot. High elbow in combination with a still head helps the ball to speed past the dive of the man at mid-off. Pitched up delivery and Rahul hit it on top of the bounce to thread it through

Ashwin to Shankar, FOUR, finally a boundary for Hyderabad! All about timing, this shot was. A floated and full delivery and the batsman chips it straight to long-on. The fielder in the deep was a touch square, hence he couldn't cut this down

Ashwin to Warner, FOUR, that's a rare loose delivery by Punjab tonight. Ashwin darts this one outside off on a shorter length and Warner makes the use of the width on offer. Reaches out for it and slices it past the fielder at point. No fielders in the deep and that shall be the second boundary of the over
Mujeeb to Warner, FOUR, nicely done by Davey! Premeditates and puts this straighter delivery away to the deep point fence with a well timed reverse sweep
Ashwin to Warner, FOUR, short ball down the leg side and Warner drags it past the fielder at short fine leg, sends it to the fence and adds four more to his tally
Shami to Manish Pandey, FOUR, backs away and blasts it past mid-off for a four. That was on a length, Manish Pandey backed away, created room and allowed his hands to do the needful
Shami to Warner, FOUR, backs across, gives away and swords the ball past point for a four. Much needed boundaries these for SRH. The run rate getting a facelift here. Poor length again from Shami

Sam Curran to Manish Pandey, FOUR, slower length delivery and jhas been upper steered away past the short third fielder for a four. Was preempted and despite that being a slower ball, Manish Pandey managed to usher enough pace on to the shot to get it past the fielder. Cheeky Pandey

Sam Curran to Warner, FOUR, and a good ball but a bad result. Squeezed through the third man region for a four. Got bat to ball and almost an educated edge to put it fine past short third for a four. 11 off the over. 31 runs off the 3 last overs

Shami to Hooda, FOUR, walks across his sticks and tickles the ball away fine. Perfect ball but Hooda managed to get enough bat on it to peel the ball away fine. Shami almost went up in an appeal before realizing that it was off the bat
Shami to Hooda, FOUR, brilliant shot! Straight drive down the ground. Back past the bowler and it was a four. Was full and Hooda nailed it

Mujeeb to Shankar, FOUR, overpitched and Shankar puts it away. Mujeeb overcooks the flighted delivery and offers width as well, Shankar bends his back knee and creams the drive through extra cover. He did well to pierce the crowded field

Rajpoot to Warner, FOUR, that might just ease Warner. Full and on the stumps, Warner stays back but leans forward and clips it wide of mid-on, Ashwin's dive is not good enough to stop the ball and it races away
Chawla to Watson, FOUR, proper half volley. That's no hard work for Watson, just cruising through the line and drilling it through deep extra cover

Kuldeep Yadav to du Plessis, FOUR, this was probably the first quicker one from Kuldeep Yadav, it was on a fuller length. And du Plessis goes down on his knees and slog-sweeps it wide of deep mid-wicket for a boundary
Chawla to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, whatta start! Gets a flighted ball outside off and has been lifted over cover for a four. That was unexpected. First ball and he went for it
Gurney to du Plessis, FOUR, low full toss and slapped over cover for a four. Few bounces and into the fence. Stayed steady and slammed it

Gurney to du Plessis, FOUR, waits on it and pulls it down past short fine leg for a four. Drops it short and slow, du Plessis stayed still and waited on it before pulling it past the fielder. Only 6 runs needed now

Narine to Watson, FOUR, quick legs. And quicker hands. Narine starts short with an off-break spinning into leg-stump, giving Watson ample time to go deep in his crease and punch it away as he splits the two men on the off-side
Prasidh to Raina, FOUR, vintage. Typical. Backs away, makes a lot of room and slices it inside-out over cover. Timing, placement don't really get better

Prasidh to Rayudu, FOUR, Rayudu makes full use of the free-hit, he picks up the slower one early, gets himself in a good position and tonks it wide of deep mid-wicket for a boundary. This should get him going
Gurney to Rayudu, FOUR, Gurney is guilty of providing width on this one, Rayudu delays his bat swing and cuts it wide of backward point for a boundary
Kuggeleijn to A Russell, FOUR, short again and Russell pulls it in the gap this time. Backed himself, stayed deep in his crease and puts it in the gap between deep square leg and deep mid-wicket
Tahir to A Russell, FOUR, that's crunched past long-off. Loopy low full toss, Russell makes a bit of room and frees his arms to slap it firmly down the ground. Long-off had no chance
Kuggeleijn to A Russell, FOUR, 110.2kph. Slow, short, spinning in. Russell clears out his front leg, very agriculturally in a murdering heave through mid-wicket

Kuggeleijn to A Russell, FOUR, another muscled heave. It couldn't have gone quicker through square leg, where Rayudu tries his best to leap up on the bounce and pull it back into play, but no, such is the momentum on this that even his palm-ricochet has the legs to roll over

Kuggeleijn to A Russell, FOUR, and it'll end with another. Russell - like he has been all season - continues to be the lone hand, getting under another pretty full delivery and still manages to generate a lot of bottom-handed power to drill it straight back, beating long-off as well .. 108 it will be

Jadeja to Karthik, FOUR, edged but doesn't carry and beats first slip! Jadeja is getting some bite off the pitch, got this to spin away sharply but Karthik did well to play with soft hands. Hence, the edge fell short of Watto and beat him as well to the fence. Bhajji gave chase but in vain

Chahar to Uthappa, FOUR, uppish but just through the gap! Was a 'hit me' ball from Chahar, shortish with width on it but Uthappa didn't want to keep the cut down. Not a wise thing on this pitch but he got it in the gap
Chahar to Uthappa, FOUR, fab shot! More authority this time from Uthappa who sat back to the half-tracker and nailed the pull comfortably over mid-on
Jadeja to Karthik, FOUR, good shot! Fraction short and this time Karthik sits deep in the crease for the cut. Beats the diving point fielder and it races away

Tahir to Karthik, FOUR, oh risky but it's come off for Karthik. Preempts, gets down low and paddles it. Nutmegs Dhoni and runs away to the fine leg fence. It skimmed the under-edge but it's DK's pet shot, so he earns a boundary

Hardik Pandya to Miller, FOUR, not where he intended but it's a welcome boundary for Kings XI. Just been a bit of a lull after Gayle's dismissal. Length ball angling away outside off, throws his bat at it and carves it off a thick outside edge between short third and backward point
Bumrah to Sam Curran, FOUR, quite a start from Sam Curran who effortlessly lofts Bumrah on the up over extra cover, with no one back at the boundary there
Bumrah to Sam Curran, FOUR, two fours out of two. Clears the front leg and scythes this full-wide delivery to the left of sweeper cover
Bumrah to Rahul, FOUR, full ball outside off, not quite in the blockhole, and Rahul uses that error in length to slice it through past backward point

Hardik Pandya to Rahul, FOUR, over extra cover again. This time it's close to the bottom of his bat, so doesn't have enough power to clear the ropes. But it does have enough power to clear the infield

Behrendorff to Rahul, FOUR, kind of a shot batsman would salivate on for days. Wow from Rahul! It was on a good length and was wide of off, Rahul rocks back and punches it off the backfoot. It beats the cover fielder and races to the fence on this rapid outfield
Bumrah to Mandeep, FOUR, short of length delivery outside off, Mandeep makes room for himself and spears the cut between short third man and backward point. Smashing finish for the Kings XI
Behrendorff to Gayle, FOUR, another off-cutter from Behrendorff and this time, Gayle was ready for it. He hangs back and smashes it over the in-field on the off-side for a boundary

Bumrah to Rahul, FOUR, these two compliment eachother so well. If, Gayle bludgeons the ball, Rahul just caresses it. It was a slower one from Bumrah, Rahul picks it up easily, gets in a might fine position and punches it like a boss. It beats cover and races to the fence

Alzarri Joseph to Rahul, FOUR, another terrific shot, his back leg was flying when he attempted that shot. And white cherry was flying too. Picks up the slower one quickly, delays his bat swing and lifts it over mid-off for another four

Rahul Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, terrific shot! Flighted delivery on the stumps, Rahul whips it with a lot of class and authority. It beats deep mid-wicket and canters to the fence. He is in fabulous touch!

Hardik Pandya to Gayle, FOUR, that has been smashed. Wow! What power. It was on a fuller length and was in the arc of Gayle, he clears his front leg and pumps it straight down the ground for a boundary. No stopping that!

Hardik Pandya to Gayle, FOUR, Hardik Pandya needs a hand on his shoulder. And yes, Bumrah is there. He is your mate, Pandya. This is serious hitting from Gayle, it was wide of off and Gayle carves it wide of long-on for another four
Rajpoot to Lad, FOUR, back of a length delivery and has been helped off the hips again. Tucked past deep fine leg for a four. A strike-rate of 500 for Lad

Ashwin to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, slapped over extra cover! Just the kind of release shot Kishan was looking for. Wide half volley, he reaches out and chips it comfortably over the infield. No protection in the deep

Sam Curran to Pollard, FOUR, just past the diving mid-wicket fielder! But this was struck beautifully by Pollard. Sat deep to this extra fullish delivery and jabbed it with those strong wrists of it. Flew off the bat and sped to the fence in no time

Viljoen to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, not in control but he's found the gap behind square on the leg-side. Short ball that climbed on Pandya who miscued the pull over backward square leg. Split fine leg and deep square leg with precision

Ashwin to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, here we go, Hardik gets off the blocks. Rubbish half tracker from Ashwin, not much bounce but Hardik crouches low and slaps the pull into the gap at deep mid-wicket fence

Shami to Alzarri Joseph, FOUR, dropped! Henriques at deep square leg got across to his right and put in a dive, got his hand on it too but didn't stick. And worse, it trickled past him to the fence too. Did take a fine catch earlier and nearly had another really good catch to his name. Joseph was clearly rushed on the bumper and he managed only a top edge on the pull. Gets himself a useful boundary in the end

Shami to Alzarri Joseph, FOUR, hammered wide of mid-off! Joseph showing that he can fetch boundaries too. Not the right length from Shami who put this on a length and Joseph just made room to biff it through the infield. Found the gap perfectly

Sam Curran to Pollard, FOUR, that went to the fence like a bullet! Oh, my! Curran missed his length and delivered a slot ball, width on offer as well and Pollard won't miss out. Smacks the bones out of this one and it goes on the bounce to the wide long-off fence

Rajpoot to Pollard, FOUR, MI are almost there! The captain for the night is producing a knock for the ages. Shortish one on leg stump, Pollard just swivels across and helps it well wide of short fine leg. Just a hit away now!
Rajpoot to de Kock, FOUR, length delivery on the pads and heaved away off the inner half of the bat. The ball dribbled away towards the deep mid fence for a four
Rajpoot to de Kock, FOUR, walks down the track, gets hold of the slower length delivery and pierces the gap between cover and extra cover for a four with a drive on the up. Back-to-back fours
Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, starts the over with a short one and has been dispatched away past point for a four. Suryakumar Yadav played it late and got it fine enough

Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, in the slot and disappears over the bowler's head. The cameras pan on Miller, who has a clueless expression on his face. Poor delivery it was and Suryakumar Yadav muscled it down the ground

Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, he does this so often! Uses the pace of the bowler and just dabs it fine to send the ball racing away to deep third man for a four. Was wide, and Suryakumar Yadav just got enough wood to send the ball away. 12 runs off the over. Rajpoot has gone for 37 already

Viljoen to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, pulled or tucked? Decide for yourself. Was very wristy though as he got hold of the short ball and just gave it direction to get it past short fine leg. That scorched away

Unadkat to Raina, FOUR, Raina is away and how! He is fearless and he flaunted that there. It was on a length and was wide of off, Raina backs away, makes room and thumps it wide of cover for a boundary

Riyan Parag to Rayudu, FOUR, nails this overpitched delivery straight back down the ground. This is excellent batting. They've not allowed Rahane to get through a few cheap overs of spin which he would've so dearly loved
Unadkat to Rayudu, FOUR, sits back deep in the crease to a slower ball, getting in a great position to dispatch it through midwicket. That brings up his fifty, just the boost in confidence he needed
Stokes to Dhoni, FOUR, short of length at the body, carrying none of the venom that Archer's bouncer did. So Dhoni just leans back and helps the pull away comfortably wide of fine leg
Jofra Archer to Dhoni, FOUR, and the inside edge for four. That's just kept CSK in it. Full ball angled in on leg, it was in the slot and Dhoni swings hard, only to send it racing off the inside edge

Chahar to Buttler, FOUR, Buttler gets off the mark in style! A 132.7kph length ball, Buttler walks forward and across, closes his bat-face and clips it through the mid-wicket region. The fielder on the on-side got a hand to it, but the outfield is swift here
Santner to Rahane, FOUR, good shot! The RR skipper shimmies down the track, gets close to the pitch of this quicker ball and chips it over wide mid-on

Santner to Rahane, FOUR, once again Rahane advances down the track, Santner saw that and shortened his length. It was slower as well. But, Rahane is well equipped. Despite not getting to the pitch of the ball, he holds his shape and lifts it over extra cover
Tahir to Riyan Parag, FOUR, lovely shot, a juicy full-toss from Tahir, Parag comes down the track and clears mid-wicket with the lofted on-drive

Tahir to Riyan Parag, FOUR, that was a half-chance, but Tahir was way too late to react - dropped short and at the stumps - Parag backed away on the punch, was done in by the wrong 'un and looped it back at the bowler - huit it hard enough to bisect both men in the deep
Tahir to Stokes, FOUR, lovely, tossed up just outside off, Stokes is quick to bend down, rolls his wrists and then plays the reverse sweep - past short third man and runs away to the ropes
Chahar to Shreyas Gopal, FOUR, lovely, the slower ball and Shreyas picked it, backed away and lifts it over mid-off, almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes for a boundary

SN Thakur to Shreyas Gopal, FOUR, cracking shot, Shreyas is playing a handy cameo here, length ball and he drilled it back over the bowler's head - mid-off was inside the ring and the man at long-on couldn't get across in time
SN Thakur to Jofra Archer, FOUR, cracking shot, this is a poor over from Thakur, banged in short and at the stumps, Archer swivels across and helps it over short fine, one bounce and over the ropes

Chahar to Rahane, FOUR, shot! A short of a good length ball at 133.4kph, Rahane stays back in his crease and punches it superbly through the gap between cover and cover-point. Once he found the gap, the outfield did the rest

Chahar to Samson, FOUR, terrific shot to get off the mark! Chahar shortens his length, no real pace to threaten the batsman. Samson stands tall and pulls it backward of square leg. The man in the deep dives, but in vain
SN Thakur to Buttler, FOUR, Buttler welcomes Thakur with a boundary. Another venom-less shortish ball, Buttler pulls it hard behind square on the on-side
SN Thakur to Buttler, FOUR, shot! Thakur bowls length at 140kph, Buttler stays in his crease, slightly clears his front leg and batters it between mid-off and extra cover
SN Thakur to Buttler, FOUR, hat-trick of fours! Too straight on this occasion and Buttler tickles it to fine leg for another boundary

Chahar to Smith, FOUR, makes contact on this occasion and the ball reaches the fence in a jiffy. Similar length - back of a length - normal-paced though. Smith picked the length early and pulled it through the gap between mid-on and mid-wicket
Jadeja to R Tripathi, FOUR, shot! Jadeja bowls it slightly fuller and Tripathi plays the inside-out shot superbly. Faf runs across and slides to his left, but allows it to go past the ropes

Ferguson to Dhawan, FOUR, the partnership between Dhawan and Pant is now 50. Sublime! Pitched up delivery outside off and Dhawan cracks the drive past cover for a four. The ball sped away past cover in a flash. Stand and deliver from Gabbar
Ferguson to Dhawan, FOUR, pitched up delivery and that has been spanked on the up. The ball rockets off the bat and past the dive of the man at cover for another four
Chawla to Pant, FOUR, thrashed! That was a poor delivery and has been spanked off the back foot. Picked the googly and smashed it past cover for a four

Chawla to Pant, FOUR, takes it from well outside off and sweeps it away squarer. That was off the inner half of the blade and made enough contact to speed away into the gap on the on-side. 49 needed. The game getting easier for DC

Prasidh to Dhawan, FOUR, the sound of the bat when it met leather! Wow. Pitched up delivery and smoked past mid-off. Russell put in a pool-like dive but in vain. The pitched up deliveries aren't working

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhawan, FOUR, chips down the track, converts it into a pitched up delivery and smokes it down the ground for a four. He has been finding gaps at ease tonight. That was the googly from Kuldeep Yadav
A Russell to Pant, FOUR, blasted! Full again. The length on the fuller side has disappeared. That was rocketed past cover for a four. 26 off 22
Chawla to Ingram, FOUR, handy runs! Looks to smash it away and the ball runs away off the outer edge for a four. 7 more needed now. He wanted to smack it out of the park but ended up edging it

Prasidh to Dhawan, FOUR, both batsmen have a good time out in the middle. They're making the most out of these powerplay overs. Dhawan puts down on his dancing shoes and slices the short ball over cover-point. No fielder in the deep and that's a boundary

A Russell to Dhawan, FOUR, that's an awful misfield by Krishna! Russell ain't a happy man. Was a short delivery that was chopped to short third man where Krishna lets it through him and gifts four to the batting team

A Russell to Dhawan, FOUR, edged but safe! On a length outside off, slanted away from the batsman, Dhawan pokes at it and gets a regulation outside edge. Rana was stationed at wide slip throws himself to his right but fails to cling on to the catch

A Russell to Dhawan, FOUR, gorgeous shot by Shikhar! Gets an overpitched delivery and the southpaw makes sure to make the most out of it. Drills it straight past the fielder at mid-on who was a touch square, four more for Dhawan

Ferguson to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, 50 up for Delhi and it has come at the rate of knots. Ferguson serves another overcooked delivery and the Delhi skipper plays an exquisite on-drive. Mid-on is no where close to cut this down, beautiful shot!

Ferguson to Dhawan, FOUR, dispatched with disdain! Short in length around off, Dhawan stands tall and hacks across the line. Times this one to perfection and sends it to the deep mid-wicket fence. Proper knock-out punch this is proving to be. Things are only going to get worse from here on, especially with the dew setting in

Chawla to Pant, FOUR, slogged away! Pant gets his first boundary of the night. Goes down on his knee and places the slog to perfection. Finds the pocket at cow-corner and that shall spoil Chawla's opening over. Had conceded only six till then, but the boundary takes it into double digits

Brathwaite to Dhawan, FOUR, 34th fifty for Dhawan! Gets there in style in. Slower ball outside off, Dhawan reaches for it and smashes it through the gap at covers. Gets to the milestone and announces his return to form

Brathwaite to Dhawan, FOUR, gift of a delivery for the batsman. Short in length on leg and Dhawan pulls it with nonchalance. Beats the fielder at deep backward square leg and adds four more to his tally

Chris Morris to Shubman Gill, FOUR, beautifully played, a gentle loosener from Morris, half-volley on Shubman's pads, he gets inside the line, brings his wrists into play and flicks it past square leg
Chris Morris to Uthappa, FOUR, lovely, too straight from Morris, he hasn't hit his stride as yet - Uthappa gets inside the line and clips it neatly through mid-wicket, no need to run for those
Axar to A Russell, FOUR, Russell is away. Gets width on offer and he just backs away to hack this through point. Well wide of sweeper who had no chance

Axar to Shubman Gill, FOUR, deft touch and more runs. Axar fires it well down leg and Gill responds with a calm paddle sweep. Gets it past the diving short fine leg fielder and this outfield shows no mercy

K Paul to Shubman Gill, FOUR, batting of the highest class! There is a backward point and short third man in place, it's a slower ball and what does Gill do? Calmly open the face of the blade to split the two with pinpoint precision. The lad is putting on a show here
K Paul to A Russell, FOUR, wrong line from Paul who gets this shortish length ball on the hips, Russell just gets a tickle down to the fine leg fence

Rabada to A Russell, FOUR, clever from Russell. Was winding up for the big hit but sensed the slower ball, adjusted and opened the bat face ever so late. Split the diving backward point fielder and it was wide of short third man too

Chris Morris to Chawla, FOUR, fortune for Chawla but he won't mind as long as the runs keep coming. Wanted to heave this away but got deceived by the slower ball and got an inside edge onto the pad. Trickled past leg stump and went very fine down the leg-side to the fence. Handy for KKR

K Paul to Chawla, FOUR, squeezed away by Chawla! He's providing the hosts with some useful runs. Terrific yorker from Paul and it's stabbed with an open bat face. Gets it wide of short third man somehow and away she goes to the fence

Ishant to Shubman Gill, FOUR, cracking shot, fraction too short from Ishant, Shubman stands tall and pulls it in front of square on the on-side - beat mid-wicket and raced away across the fast outfield

Rabada to Uthappa, FOUR, that's a typical Uthappa shot - made room to a good length delivery and then sliced the drive over backward point - didn't get hold of the shot, but has enough to clear the fielders inside the ring

Rabada to Uthappa, FOUR, lovely, floaty half-volley on the pads and Uthappa needs no second invitation, gets inside the line and flicks it behind square on the on-side - almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes

Rabada to Uthappa, FOUR, nice touch from Uthappa, back of a length and just outside off, Uthappa waits on it, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and runs it fine, good enough to beat third man
Ishant to Shubman Gill, FOUR, lovely, tad too short from Ishant, Shubman waits on it and then flat-bats it wide of mid-on, no need to run for those

Ishant to Shubman Gill, FOUR, beautifully done - he's got a promotion and he's showing his class, leg-stump half-volley from Ishant, Shubman gets inside the line and flicks it over square leg, one bounce and over the ropes
K Paul to Shubman Gill, FOUR, lovely, back of a length and well wide of off, Shubman stands tall and caresses the punch behind point - the timing is sublime and the fielder at third man has no chance
D Kulkarni to de Kock, FOUR, spanked! Slow, short and wide - asking to be punished. de Kock makes room as he walks down and slaps it through extra cover. Raced away to the fence

Unadkat to de Kock, FOUR, 114.1kph, slower full ball around off, de Kock gets down to swipe across the line, gets a fat top-edge and the ball runs away fine for a one-bounce four into the third man fence

Jofra Archer to de Kock, FOUR, streaky runs but MI won't mind it at this stage of the innings. Full toss and should have actually been dispatched for a six but de Kock doesn't middle it well enough. Gets a fat inside edge that's well wide of short fine leg and speeds away

Jofra Archer to de Kock, FOUR, clears a flying extra cover fielder! Good hit from the increasingly tired de Kock. Made room and read the slower ball well before slapping it over the infield. Smashed it really well
Unadkat to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, Kishan joins the party now. Length ball from Unadkat, horror stuff at this stage of the innings and it's heaved away over the gap at mid-wicket. Struck really hard

Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, two was the call from Hardik as he hit this but he's got enough power to get this all the way to the fence. Slower short ball, he tried to muscle it with all his might and forced this through the gap at mid-wicket. Bisected the big gap on the leg-side and though the mid-wicket fielder tried to get across, he couldn't
Gowtham to Rohit, FOUR, nicely played, flighted on the leg-stump line, Rohit bends down low and then helps it over square leg with a half-lined sweep, couple of bounces and over the ropes

Gowtham to de Kock, FOUR, this is excellent batting from de Kock, tad too full from Gowtham, can't do so with mid-on inside the ring - de Kock gets a good stride forward and lifts it over that man, almost went all the way, one bounce and over the ropes - 18 from the over
D Kulkarni to Rohit, FOUR, cracking shot, width on offer from Dhawal, Rohit leans into the drive, played with a closed face and found the gap wide of cover-point for a boundary
D Kulkarni to Rohit, FOUR, this is all too easy for Rohit, length ball outside off, he backed away, opened up the off-side and cleared cover with the lofted drive, one bounce and over the ropes

D Kulkarni to Rohit, FOUR, cracking shot, too much width from Dhawal, can't do so against the quality of Rohit - he leans into the drive, plays with an open face and drives it square past cover-point for another boundary

Jofra Archer to de Kock, FOUR, edged and four, wry smile on Archer's face, shortened his length and got it to hold its line, de Kock was looking to work it to the on-side, closed the bat-face, got a thick leading edge that raced away through the vacant slip cordon
Gowtham to Rohit, FOUR, Gowtham bowls it slightly wide of off, but Rohit is well equipped to put that away. Bends his back leg, gets underneath the ball and tonks it over the bowler's head
Gowtham to Rohit, FOUR, a dart at 99.8kph wide of off, Rohit throws his bat at it and slashes it through backward point. 15 off the over with two balls to go

Behrendorff to Rahane, FOUR, dropped by Rohit! Sharp chance but he didn't time the leap well, ended up getting a hand and it dribbled away down to the long-off fence. Was in the slot as Rahane went for the loft down the ground. Didn't get it off the middle and if not for Rohit's lapse in fielding, the RR skipper might have been on his way

Alzarri Joseph to Buttler, FOUR, lifted over the infield! One of Buttler's go-to shots in the powerplay. Stands tall this time to the good length ball and carves it over cover. More off the cue-end really but he's got enuugh power to clear the field and it trickles away
Alzarri Joseph to Buttler, FOUR, they're taking the game away in a rush. Pitched up outside off, Buttler stands where he is, no movement of the feet and crashes it through extra cover

Alzarri Joseph to Buttler, FOUR, no stopping him here. Joseph's given a full toss, he's pitched one full and wide, and now he's gone for a back of a length slower ball outside off. Buttler picks it up, waits on it and cuts it through backward point
Alzarri Joseph to Buttler, FOUR, and even a yorker isn't spared. Reaches out for this outside off and squeezes it past the keeper. Third man was in the ring anyway

Alzarri Joseph to Buttler, FOUR, steers another yorker to the third man boundary. Mumbai looking absolutely clueless. Rohit claps for his bowler who's hardly faltered with his execution, but that's hardly much consolation for Alzarri Joseph
Krunal Pandya to Smith, FOUR, premeditates a paddle-sweep, then has to reach for it as Krunal bowls this well wide outside off, but somehow gets a top-edge over the keeper's head
Krunal Pandya to Samson, FOUR, drifting in on off and middle, Samson bends across and deflects it fine with a paddle-sweep

Bumrah to Shreyas Gopal, FOUR, flies away off the outside edge through to the third man boundary. Short of length outside off, maybe not the best option from Bumrah as it gives a slashing Gopal more than a fifty-fifty chance. He just needed to get something on it, which he did

Hardik Pandya to Shreyas Gopal, FOUR, full on off, Gopal doesn't time it perfectly but manages to drive it through the gap at extra cover. Rajasthan Royals, who almost messed up the chase at the end, have been bailed out by Shreyas Gopal

Alzarri Joseph to Buttler, FOUR, paddlescooped just past short fine leg! Once again, Buttler hasn't got it off the middle but still has enough wood to get it past the fielder in the ring. Walked across very early, signaling his intentions to this fuller ball, had to fetch it from outside off but his brisk initial movement allowed him to do that, just
