Behrendorff to Rahane, FOUR, not a kind of shot that you would associate with Rahane. Gets a length ball and just clears his legs to club this over mid-wicket. An agricultural hoick of sorts and it's come off

Behrendorff to Rahane, FOUR, silky stroke from Jinks. Was a bad ball though, full and down leg, he just got across to glance it wide of short fine leg. The outfield here is the batsman's ally once he gets past the infield
Alzarri Joseph to Rahane, FOUR, full and outside off, Rahane bends down and spoons it over the infield, there was a man at deep point but he couldn't get there in time to stop the boundary
Alzarri Joseph to Rahane, FOUR, now the finesse. Banged in and the ball was climing around off-stump, Rahane arches back and ramps it over de Kock, one bounce and over the ropes. Rohit looks worried!

Bumrah to Rahane, FOUR, welcome, Mr. Bumrah. This is Rahane at his best. Full delivery outside off, he has a good front foot stride, the high elbow and the straight bat - creams the drive textbook style through extra cover. None of the fielders moved

Bumrah to Buttler, FOUR, boundaries continue to flow.. Even Bumrah has conceded two in the over. A venomless short delivery that sits up for the Englishman, Buttler swivels and pulls it over the square leg umpire. No protection in the deep

Behrendorff to Samson, FOUR, worrying signs for Mumbai. They can't afford to leak runs from both ends. Samson holds a good shape and lofts the length delivery inside out over extra cover. A calculated shot as mid-off was inside the ring

Behrendorff to Buttler, FOUR, the angle works against Behrendorff. He slips on the pads and that is easy pickings, Buttler got some wood on that, the ball then deflected off the pad to the fine leg fence

Navdeep Saini to Gayle, FOUR, Gayle has had enough of pushing and prodding, makes room to a good length delivery and hoicks - off the thick inside edge and past square leg, runs away to the ropes in a jiffy
Chahal to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, poor delivery and Chahal knows it immediately. Drifts it way down leg and Sarfaraz helps it along the way with a bit of glove, the fast outfield takes care of the rest
Chahal to Gayle, FOUR, in an attempt to keep it away from Gayle's range, Chahal sprays it down leg, the left hander gets enough bat on the glance to take the ball fine and into the fence

Navdeep Saini to Mandeep, FOUR, timely boundary for Mandeep who has been looking to make a move on for some time now. Shortish and angling into him, was pulled away hard in front of square through the leg-side. ABD in the deep got across but probably timed the slide wrong. Ends up palming it past the ropes

U Yadav to Gayle, FOUR, full toss and you can't be bowling those at this stage to a well-set Gayle. He shovels it over mid-wicket, into the gap between deep mid-wicket and long-on. Was more of a chip stroke and gets the boundary

Siraj to Gayle, FOUR, Gayle inches closer to another IPL ton. Wide full toss and there aren't many worse deliveries to bowl to a set batsman. Especially with third man in the ring. Gayle slices it away, well wide of the fielder in the ring and away she goes to the fence
U Yadav to Gayle, FOUR, cracking shot, fraction too short from Umesh, Gayle stands tall, rolls his wrists and pulls it in front of square on the on-side, no need to run for those

Siraj to Gayle, FOUR, he almost did! Ends unbeaten on 99! Gayle would have wanted that one run but then, don't think he will be too worried about not getting to the milestone. Siraj missed the wide yorker marginally this time and it was sliced away, well wide of short third man and to the fence for a boundary. Gayle is only the second batsman to end on 99 not out in the IPL after Raina

Navdeep Saini to Gayle, FOUR, that has been muscled away, think he didn't get it off the middle of the bat, but almost sent the ball over the ropes - backed away to a length ball and went over the bowler's head
U Yadav to Rahul, FOUR, that's easy pickings for an in-form batsman, leg-stump half-volley and Rahul whips it away behind square on the on-side for a boundary

U Yadav to Rahul, FOUR, that's some timing from KL, length ball at the stumps, Rahul leant forward and played a one-handed on-drive - was in the air for a while but rushed past the diving fielder at mid-on
Siraj to Gayle, FOUR, that's some way to welcome Siraj to the crease, length ball outside off, Gayle backs away and drills it through the line, one bounce and over the ropes at long-off
Siraj to Gayle, FOUR, hat-trick of boundaries, short of a length and well outside off, Gayle leans across and cuts it in front of square on the off-side, past AB at cover and runs away to the ropes
Siraj to Gayle, FOUR, make that 24 off the over, length ball on the pads and it's flicked away disdainfully past short fine. RCB need time to breathe and they call for a strategic break
Moeen Ali to Agarwal, FOUR, cheeky and four, tossed up well outside off, Mayank bent down low, used the pace on the ball and lapped it fine, fine leg is very square and has no chance
Sam Curran to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, classy shot from Parthiv! Curran provides a floaty half volley and it's creamed through the gap at cover. Lovely timing and it raced away. RCB are away in style

Shami to Kohli, FOUR, the signature Kohli straight drive! Like Curran, Shami also starts with a half volley. The RCB skipper leans forward and strokes it past the bowler and beats the diving mid-off fielder

Shami to Kohli, FOUR, Kohli is off the blocks in a jiffy. Not that bad a ball, just a superb shot. Was on a length around off, he shuffled across and clipped it away sweetly through mid-wicket. Once again, outstanding timing on the shot. Nothing much you can do as a bowler except applaud the batsman

Shami to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, heaved away! The length is wrong from Shami this time, gives one in the slot for Parthiv who is ready to throw his bat at anything that's within his reach. Clubs it through mid-wicket

Ashwin to Kohli, FOUR, the partnership between Kohli and de Villiers is now 50. Slow through the air - 81.6kph, Kohli cuts off the back foot and Shami at backward point is too slow to bend down to his right. Doesn't get a hand on it and the ball reaches the fence in a jiffy. Ashwin isn't happy with that effort
Tye to Kohli, FOUR, wayward ball. Slips it down leg and Kohli clips it square of the man at short fine leg. Easily put away
Sam Curran to de Villiers, FOUR, plants his back knee across off stump and swipes this slower ball over short fine leg. Almost went for six, just the one bounce

Tye to Stoinis, FOUR, nicely whipped away by Stoinis. He's timed it beautifully, although Tye did much of the work for him by giving a gentle full ball on the pads. And then Stoinis gratefully picked it up backward of square, past fine leg

Tye to Stoinis, FOUR, short of length delivery wide of off, it's a slower ball but on this pitch, it has come on so brilliantly onto the bat. Stoinis has just opened the face, that's it, but it's sped away through backward point
Shami to Stoinis, FOUR, this won't please Ashwin one bit. Having called mid-off inside the ring, Shami bowls a low full toss and is tonked straight back over that fielder. Another chat
Sarfaraz Khan to Stoinis, FOUR, drops it down short and is smoked back down the ground. Slapped to the fence for four

Sam Curran to Kohli, FOUR, ominous signs for KXIP because Kohli is timing them sweet and crisp. Not that full in length but he is well forward and punches it on the up. Beats the diving mid-off fielder and it's sped away to the fence

Sam Curran to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, raining boundaries in the Powerplay. Just the kind of start RCB were looking for. Too full from Curran and it's hammered straight back past him and down the ground. Mid-off had no chance

Sam Curran to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, Curran is spraying them all around. Shortish this time but at a gentle pace and leg stumpish, Parthiv just had to beat short fine leg to get a boundary. He ends up clearing that fielder comfortably with a half-pull

Ashwin to Kohli, FOUR, smacked straight back past the bowler! Those famous wrists of Kohli and although it was aerial, Ashwin had no chance. Was a float up that got drilled mercilessly down the ground. Rocketed to the fence

Shami to de Villiers, FOUR, AB de Villiers is underway! Seam-up ball, the length is on the shorter side and de Villiers is quick to pounce on it. Jumps on the back foot and punches it wide of mid-off beating the fielder to his left. Excellent placement

Shami to de Villiers, FOUR, nicely done! Good length, seam-up delivery, marginally outside off, de Villiers opens his bat-face at the last moment and runs it very fine to the third man fence. Used the bowler's pace to good effect
Murugan Ashwin to Kohli, FOUR, too wide from Murugan Ashwin and Kohli punishes. Camps back and cuts it in the direction of the turn. Beats point and races away to the fence

Murugan Ashwin to Kohli, FOUR, four more! A desperate dive to his left in the deep from Mayank, but in vain. A length ball and Kohli walked across towards off to clip it away through mid-wicket using those mighty wrists. Agarwal got a hand to it, but couldn't stop the ball from going past the ropes
Tye to de Villiers, FOUR, de Villiers has no trouble this time. Slow, short and wide outside off. AB jumps and slaps it up and over extra cover. Easily done

Murugan Ashwin to de Villiers, FOUR, sloppy, slippy! KL Rahul, the culprit. de Villiers drove this flighted delivery all along the ground to the left of long-off. There was no need to slide, but KL does that and over-does - courtesy dew? In the end, he could only watch the ball go past the ropes
Prasidh to Watson, FOUR, and that's a fine start for CSK! Fuller delivery and has been on-driven down the ground. The full face of the bat showcased and the ball sped away
Prasidh to du Plessis, FOUR, fuller ball on the pads and clipped away past the square leg umpire for a four. Poor from Prasidh. Too full and put away off the pads

Kuldeep Yadav to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, rank long hop and Jadhav takes full toll. Kuldeep Yadav knows it was a bad delivery and he's disappointed with himself. Pulled his length back, Jadhav pivots back and muscles it in the gap - splitting deep mid-wicket and long-on
Chawla to Raina, FOUR, this time he knows exactly what Chawla has bowled. Picks the googly, steps away from the line and opens the face on his cut past backward point
Gurney to Raina, FOUR, that's a shocking delivery. A full toss on the pads from round the wicket, that too with fine leg in. Raina can't believe his luck as he glances it to the fence
Prasidh to Jadeja, FOUR, now that's been struck extremely sweetly. Full ball around off, Jadeja gets the front leg out of the way and nails the drive straight of mid-off
Narine to Raina, FOUR, what a bonus for CSK. Don't think they're looking to attack Narine, but he himself has presented a half-tracker. Raina happily belts the pull wide of long-on
Gurney to Jadeja, FOUR, advances down close to the pitch and hammers it down the ground, with Gurney having to duck for cover

Gurney to Jadeja, FOUR, pitched up on middle, Jadeja swipes right across the line of it, and it somehow balloons off his leading edge over backward point. Third man was inside the ring, so it runs away for four. Back-to-back boundaries for Jadeja

Gurney to Jadeja, FOUR, really poor from Gurney, who switched to round the wicket and delivered a low full toss on the pads with fine leg inside the ring. The second time he's done that tonight. Easy put away for Jadeja

Chawla to Jadeja, FOUR, 120kph, seam up delivery that's short and wide outside off. Definitely surprised Jadeja who was late on it, but he managed to get it off the toe-edge. The pace on the ball did the rest as it raced past a helpless short third man
A Russell to du Plessis, FOUR, short ball, bad ball and has been put away. Swivelled on the back leg and pulled it in front of square for a four
A Russell to du Plessis, FOUR, not too short but punished again. Stood up, bent his back a bit and pulled it flat towards deep mid for a four
A Russell to du Plessis, FOUR, the short ball ain't working here. Walks across his sticks and scoops it fine on the on-side for a four. Third four in succession

A Russell to du Plessis, FOUR, Russell getting a taste of his own medicine. That was a slower delivery and du Plessis walked across his sticks again and scooped it fine. The short fine fielder had no chance
Gurney to Raina, FOUR, on the pads, clipped away to deep mid-wicket and that has raced away to the fence in a jiffy

Prasidh to Raina, FOUR, that's a buffet ball from Krishna. Sends a length delivery down leg, easy pickings for Raina as he gently shuffles across and helps it very fine. Fine leg was inside the ring and just watched the ball elude to his left
Prasidh to Raina, FOUR, oh, this is wayward stuff from Krishna. Another loosener down leg and Raina tucks in the gift. Moves across, allows for the ball to arrive and glances it past short fine leg
Narine to Raina, FOUR, that's a horror delivery from Narine. Slips it down leg, too easy for Raina as he bends low and sweeps it very fine, earns himself a boundary

Chawla to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, Jadhav picks the googly and lifts it over extra cover. High percentage shot against spin. Waited for the ball to arrive, lunges forward and cashes in with a nonchalant loft. All grace from Jadhav

Chawla to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, now the cheekiness. How smart is Jadhav here? Nothing wrong with the delivery from Chawla, it was flighted delivery just outside off but KJ cleverly went deep in his crease and opened his bat face at the last moment to guide it past short third man. The fielder gave a long chase but the ball wins the race

Chahar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, 1000 runs for Lynn in IPL! Wide-ish delivery in the channel outside off, very close to tramline, Lynn gets down on his knee and smacks it over covers, one bounce and into the fence she goes

Chahar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for the opener! This was slightly short in the channel outside off, Chris Lynn treks back and slaps it wide of the fielder at sweeper cover, great timing and power on that

Jadeja to Karthik, FOUR, cheeky and four, nicely done by Karthik, this was the drifter that was angled down leg, he bent down, used the pace on the ball and lapped it behind square on the on-side for a boundary, 23 from the over
Tahir to A Russell, FOUR, .. and he's off and running with a boundary - tossed up on the leg-stump line, Russell gets forward and thumps it wide of mid-wicket - no one in the deep to stop that
Santner to Karthik, FOUR, nicely done, low full-toss from Santner, Karthik leans forward and chips it over mid-wicket for a boundary

Chahar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, that's in the air but it's wide of the fielder at deep mid-wicket. Lynn latches on to the short ball and hacks it over mid-wicket. On a bounce and over the ropes. The fielder near the boundary was sprinting across but couldn't reach there

Chahar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, drilled through extra cover! Pitched on a full length and Lynn creams it past the fielder at wide mid-off. Pressure on the bowler, 14 runs of the over already. Still 3 balls to go!

SN Thakur to Chris Lynn, FOUR, bludgeoned down the ground! An overpitched delivery around off and Lynn had absolutely hammered it past the bowler, no chance of stopping that. Thakur hardly had any time to react

SN Thakur to Chris Lynn, FOUR, looks a belter of a wicket this one. Just look at the timing on that. Minimum effort, maximum result. Was swinging into the batsman this full length delivery and Chris Lynn creams it past the fielder at cover-point. Lynn has scored six boundaries and a six, Narine none

Jadeja to Nitish Rana, FOUR, good move by DK to send Rana at number 3. With two left arm spinners in CSK, he can get a few handy runs. This was wide outside off and Rana slaps it wide of the fielder at cover, placement was the key on this occasion

Jadeja to Chris Lynn, FOUR, Lynn is looking in good touch today! Intent in his gameplay. This was short and wide outside off, the opener makes use of the width on offer and thrashes it past the man at cover

Jadeja to Nitish Rana, FOUR, excellent square cut by Rana! This was another short ball and well outside off, Rana sees the opportunity there and cuts it very late, past the fielder at backward point and that's four more
Jadeja to Nitish Rana, FOUR, lovely, RJ dropped one short and wide of off, Rana made room and then chopped it behind square on the off-side for a boundary
Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, FOUR, oh outside edge and it's flew past the man at slip. Outswinger from a good length, Dhawan tries to defend, gets a thick edge and gets away with it

Shankar to Pant, FOUR, another edge and Pant escapes this time. Hands on the head for SRH's fielders. It was pitched up outside off, Pant's eyes light up as he goes hard on the drive. No feet, just hands following the ball. Thick outside edge beats Bairstow to his left - who dived but it was far from him
Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, smacked over mid-wicket. Rare loose ball from Rashid, a rank long hop and Iyer was so quick to read it. Hangs back and places it supremely in the gap

Sandeep Sharma to Pant, FOUR, oh, poor Rashid. The ball's following him and this time he fails to stop it. Should have done better definitely because the standards he sets in the field is amazing. Shortish from Sharma, well outside off. Pant gets deep and cuts it past point. Rashid did cover good ground but ended up letting it away to the fence at sweeper cover

Sandeep Sharma to Axar, FOUR, finally a boundary for Delhi! It has come after ages. A wide full toss by Sandeep and Axar makes sure it's sent to the boundary. Reaches out for it and slaps it past the man at cover, also manages to beat the sprinter in the deep
Sandeep Sharma to Munro, FOUR, a man at slip would have swallowed that. Outswinger outside off stump, Munro slashes hard, gets a thick edge and escapes

Sandeep Sharma to Munro, FOUR, driven hard into the square and it bounces to the right of the man at cover, Rashid tries to hunt it down, but can't cut it off in time, he flicked the ball but it touched the rope
Khaleel Ahmed to Munro, FOUR, fullish and swinging away outside off stump, Munro stays in the crease and cuts hard, through cover-point and it races away for four

Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, outside edge and it's escaped past the diving man at slip, fullish delivery outside off stump, Iyer plays inside the line and tries to push at the ball, gets away with it
Khaleel Ahmed to Munro, FOUR, oh good bouncer but Munro has managed to top edge this fine to the fine leg boundary, smiles at the bowler acknowledging that it was a good ball
Hooda to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, how did he cut a ball that wasn't short! Iyer gave himself room and sliced the ball square past backward point, Ricky Bhui couldn't cut it off

Shankar to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, wow! Surgical precision from Iyer. Two fielders dived but in vain. Juicy half-volley from Shankar, Iyer gets his front foot across and nails the drive fabulously through extra cover

Rashid Khan to Pant, FOUR, Pant greets Rashid to the attack with a boundary. Not the ideal start as he drops it short, Pant rocks back quickly and swats it in front of square on the leg-side. Threads the gap between deep square leg and deep mid-wicket to perfection

Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, edged and flies past slip. Steaky but Iyer won't mind. Loopy delivery, almost a yorker length outside off. Iyer squeezes it and gets a healthy outside edge which eludes slip and beats short third man as well

Rabada to Warner, FOUR, welcome into the attack Mr. Rabada! Back of a length delivery at 150kph, Warner swings hard and gets it off the inside edge through square leg. No fielders stationed in that region and that shall be the first boundary of the innings

Rabada to Bairstow, FOUR, not a great line by Rabada! Short ball at the hips and Bairstow glances it past the fielder at short fine leg with nonchalance. All he had to is get some bat on it, which he does. The pace at which Rabada is bowling makes it easy to take it away to the fence

Chris Morris to Warner, FOUR, takes strike after sometime but that doesn't deter him from getting a four. Jumped on to the short ball and pulled it away towards deep mid for a four. Played it in front of square and got it in the gap
Chris Morris to Warner, FOUR, gift of a delivery. A full toss. And Warner laces that by backing away. Crunched it past cover for a four. Important four
Ishant to Bairstow, FOUR, Bairstow knows only way! The aggressive way. Sees the width on offer and slices the shortish delivery over point. Enough wood on it as the ball races away to the boundary
Ishant to Bairstow, FOUR, successive boundaries for the Englishman. This was on his pads and Bairstow flicks it wristily over square leg. Very VVS-esque shot that and it's four more for the opener

Axar to Bairstow, FOUR, slightly short, Bairstow quickly responds by jumping back on the cut. But it's not really that short. So he's not in control, gets a thick outside edge and it runs away through the vacant slip region

Axar to Bairstow, FOUR, only slightly short, not a lot, but Bairstow has gone so far back in the crease, using the depth of it superbly. He's manufactured this pull shot through midwicket, and then succeeds in beating deep midwicket too
U Yadav to de Kock, FOUR, bottom-handed whip and it finds the gap between mid-wicket and mid-on for a four. On a length, de Kock swipes across the line and gets it into the gap for it to dribble away
U Yadav to de Kock, FOUR, poor channel from Umesh, slips it down leg and de Kock swivels on the back foot to pull it fine for a four. Was a gift of a delivery from Umesh

Chahal to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, smartly played by Krunal Pandya! Gets down on one knee and paddles the full legbreak in the gap through short fine, Siraj puts in a dive after a long sprint but ball wins the race
Chahal to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, gets as low as he can, picks the flighted delivery from outside off and swipes it over square leg for his first boundary
Negi to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, why bowl a short quick ball when the flighted deliveries are doing the job for you. Surya stays back, lets the ball come and cuts to the right of short third man

Navdeep Saini to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, I have no idea how Hardik has cut this all the way towards widish third man. Short ball yes, but looked like Hardik was slightly late on the shot, but he actually middled it, just fell an inch inside the rope, poor start to the over for RCB

Navdeep Saini to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, in the airrr, Southee was at mid-on, runs back but only manages to fingertip it to the boundary. Clever batting from Hardik, he lofted that deliberately in the air knowing there was no one in the deep, Navdeep Saini bowled very full this time and paid the price. Hardik went back and across for this ball, he went so deep in his crease that he would have been out hit wicket had he been in line with the stumps

Siraj to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, don't understand this field. Mid-off in at this stage to a player who loves lofting the ball straight. Siraj dishes out a full ball and Pandya happily powers it over the bowler's head
Negi to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, is that the game already! Poor short ball wide outside off stump, Pandya slaps it hard and splits long-off and deep mid-wicket to perfection
Negi to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, Hardik Pandya has killed the game. Or should I say Negi? Why dart the ball when it's turning! Pandya slogs and hits it well enough and wide of long-on
U Yadav to de Kock, FOUR, fuller ball and has been laced off the front foot past cover for a four. Fuller, wider and de Kock got enough bat on it to send it away into the gap
U Yadav to de Kock, FOUR, and off the outer edge. Toe-end may be. Cruel game for the bowlers. Length delivery outside off, de Kock looks to mow it across the line and gets it off the edge
Siraj to Rohit, FOUR, this is pick your spot bowling from Siraj. Short delivery outside off, pleading to be hit and Rohit slaps it over cover. MI are off to a flier
Chahal to de Kock, FOUR, sits down on one knee, picks the length early and swipes it over square leg with sheer timing
Navdeep Saini to Rohit, FOUR, in the slot for Rohit Sharma! Full and plenty of width outside off, Rohit lashes on it with a crunchy drive through extra cover, superbly timed!
Behrendorff to Kohli, FOUR, stylish shot to get off the mark! A tad too straight in line, full as well and Kohli wrists it away past the diving forward square leg fielder. Timed it sweetly
Rahul Chahar to de Villiers, FOUR, de Villiers brings out the innovation. Spotted the leg-break early, gets low and reverse-sweeps it past short third man. Brilliant!

Behrendorff to Moeen Ali, FOUR, slapped through extra cover. Behrendorff goes full, overpitches it in the process just outside off. Ali stays deep and creams it hard, beats a desperate dive from Chahar at sweeper cover. Flawless timing from Ali
Bumrah to de Villiers, FOUR, misses the yorker, not by much and de Villiers was quick to squeeze the ball between mid-off and cover for a four. Genius on show
Bumrah to de Villiers, FOUR, again Bumrah misses the yorker and de Villiers shows his wizardry. Gets deep, opens the bat face and pile drives the ball past cover for a four. Superb from Mr. 360

Behrendorff to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, just clears mid-on! Was a miscued lofted flick from Parthiv who saw the length full and tried his luck. Wasn't off the middle of the blade, yet managed to get it past the leaping fielder in the circle

Behrendorff to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, slapped over mid-wicket! Fractionally short and Parthiv picked the length early, didn't bother going back as he pulled this comfortably over mid-wicket. Clean strike

Behrendorff to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, deft touch this time from Parthiv! Uses the pace of Behrendorff and steers it with an open bat face. Splits the slip and gully fielder to pick up a boundary. Smart batting

Behrendorff to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, more runs! This is a good counterattack from Parthiv. Not in control this time as he goes for a flashy drive, slices it wide of the slip and once again, it's wide of gully and races away to the fence

Bumrah to de Villiers, FOUR, clubbed over point! First confident shot from de Villiers for the night. Short and wide, he stands tall and bashes it square through the off-side. Didn't connect cleanly enough but had enough wood to clear the infield with ease

Rahul Chahar to de Villiers, FOUR, cheeky from ABD! The reverse paddle and it's actually risky with a slip in place but the South African connects fairly well. Well wide of backward point to get a boundary

Hardik Pandya to de Villiers, FOUR, french-cut from de Villiers and it almost shaved the off-stump. Nervy times for the South African these. This good length delivery nipped in a bit and de Villiers was cramped for room as he went for the cut - too close for comfort. Thick inside edge goes teasingly past the stumps to the fine leg fence

Unadkat to Rahul, FOUR, first boundary for the opener has come in the 12th over! Rahul makes room for himself, shimmies down the wicket and lifts the shortish delivery over mid-off. The fielder was inside the circle and all he needed was to clear him, which he does. A sigh of relief for KL

Shreyas Gopal to Miller, FOUR, finally a boundary for Miller! He was trying to find this gap since quite some time. Goes down on his knee and finds the fence with a nicely timed sweep shot, first one of the innings for him

Unadkat to Rahul, FOUR, time for the Rahul show! Goes down on his knee and scoops the length delivery over fine leg. The fielder was inside the circle and the opener clears him comfortably. That almost went the distance

Jofra Archer to Rahul, FOUR, super shot! Saw the length slightly short and though there wasn't room, he created some by backing away and punched it sweetly wide of the mid-off fielder. Raced away to the fence. Another 50 for Rahul this season! This has been brilliantly paced, was really slow to begin with but is shifting gears with ease now

Unadkat to Miller, FOUR, launched over extra cover! Spoils an otherwise good Unadkat over. A trifle too full and a bit of width as well, Miller stood still and lifted it easily over the infield. Clean strike

D Kulkarni to Ashwin, FOUR, useful boundary for KXIP! Width on offer and shortish as well, Ashwin was waiting for any room to be provided and sliced it away wide of backward point. Third man had no chance of cutting it off

D Kulkarni to Gayle, FOUR, this is erratic from Kulkarni. Serves up a low full toss outside off, Gayle reaches out and throws his bat. Gets a thick outside edge but the third man is inside the ring and it beats the fielder at 45 before running away to the fence

D Kulkarni to Gayle, FOUR, very predictable from Kulkarni. He's bowling an array of slower balls, Gayle anticipated it and made room to spank it in the pocket between short third man and backward point

Jofra Archer to Gayle, byes, FOUR, messy. Archer is fuming as Samson fumbles behind. Can't blame him much because he got an iffy bounce. Off-pace delivery, snaked away sharply outside off. The keeper couldn't get his body behind the line and it runs away to the boundary

Shreyas Gopal to Agarwal, FOUR, what a shot. Gopal drags it short, Agarwal is extremely quick to read the length. Pivots back and hammers it through mid-wicket. Stuart Binny from the deep sprints across and dives, but ends up parrying it to the boundary
Shami to Rahane, FOUR, great timing from Rahane as he whips this delivery backward of square. Back of a length on middle and leg, Rahane climbs onto it. A boundary at the start of his innings
Shami to R Tripathi, FOUR, poor from Shami. Bowls a hit-me on leg-stump and Tripathi tickles away neatly in the gap between deep square and fine leg
Shami to Binny, FOUR, Binny's off the mark with a boundary! A gentle short delivery on the stumps, Binny waits on the back foot and pummels it over mid-wicket with brute power

Arshdeep Singh to Buttler, FOUR, another beautiful shot! Buttler is turning it on. Sees width on offer and just eases it through backward point. Just relied on timing and boy, didn't he time the pants off this one! Sweeper tried hard but was never chasing it down

Shami to Binny, FOUR, KXIP - 2, RR - 0 this season! A comfortable victory for the home team, win by 12 runs. Binny sliced the full ball one-handed and managed to get it over extra cover, Mayank Agarwal chases the ball to his left but he couldn't arrest him momentum and ended up sliding over the ball
Arshdeep Singh to R Tripathi, FOUR, full and wide, Tripathi grounds his back knee and carves it up and over backward point. Beautiful shot

Arshdeep Singh to R Tripathi, FOUR, that's gone through Shami's hands at short third man. Poor effort. Length ball outside off, the angle induced the error from Tripathi as he drove away from the body. Went quickly off the outside edge to Shami's left, should've been comfortably stopped
Murugan Ashwin to R Tripathi, FOUR, uses the pace superbly. Murugan was mostly flat through the over, so Tripathi anticipated a similar trajectory, stayed back to the ball and then dabbed it fine
Shami to Samson, FOUR, it's been helped away quite fine from Samson, capitalizing superbly on just a bit of misdirection from Shami who strayed ever so slightly on middle and leg

Shami to Samson, FOUR, now this is class batting. He's chopped a ball - that was on off stump - and sent it really fine into the third man boundary. What makes it an even better shot is that it was the off-cutter from Shami, so it's not as if he had a lot of pace to work with
Rashid Khan to Raina, FOUR, risky shot and he gets a boundary! Expects the googly and jumps deep inside the crease, plays the cut at the last instant and the edge flies wide of Warner at slip
Shankar to Raina, FOUR, streaky! A full throttle cross bat swing against a length delivery and Raina sends a huge chunk of top-edge on that, one bounce and over the ropes at third man
Sandeep Sharma to Rayudu, FOUR, slower ball again but Rayudu has second guessed Sandeep Sharma there. Waited deep inside the crease and pounced on the width to flay it behind backward point
Bhuvneshwar to Rayudu, FOUR, slower ball outside off, there was enough width for Rayudu to free his arms and he does so by slapping this through backward point

Bhuvneshwar to Watson, FOUR, that shall release some pressure. Watson throws his hands at a wide-ish delivery as a thick outside edge is induced. It flies over Warner at slip and races away to the third man boundary. First one of the night for CSK!

Khaleel Ahmed to du Plessis, FOUR, Faf breaks the shackles! Stays put in the crease and lifts the length delivery right over the bowler's head. Can't keep a fielder there and that's a four for the South African, his first one

Sandeep Sharma to du Plessis, FOUR, CSK are either scoring in boundaries or not at all. This one was a loosener on the pads and du Plessis clips it past Khaleel at short fine leg. Although the pacer puts in a dive, he finds it difficult to get his hand to it, all the way to the fence she goes

Sandeep Sharma to Watson, FOUR, that shall give him some confidence. A booster! This was an overpitched delivery by Sandy and Watto caresses it through extra-cover. Beats Williamson who was stationed inside the circle and sends it away to the boundary

Khaleel Ahmed to du Plessis, FOUR, shouldn't have given him the third over. Khaleel is become a touch predictable now. Overcompensates by going too full outside off, du Plessis creams it through covers for an elegant boundary

Nadeem to Watson, FOUR, both batsmen are dealing in boundaries now. They've got a hang of the wicket. Watson backs away and slices the shortish delivery past the fielder at point, four runs for the Aussie international
Rashid Khan to Watson, FOUR, welcome into the attack, Mr Rashid. Watson goes down on his knee and sweeps the floated delivery with all his might. So much power in that shot, four more for CSK

Chahar to Bairstow, FOUR, the timing off the very first ball, it's like he's turned up after an hour's batting in the nets. Fuller than a length on middle and leg, some shape for Chahar but Bairstow whips it with such class through square leg
SN Thakur to Bairstow, FOUR, full ball on off, drilled into the pitch and bounces over Thakur's head before racing away to the ropes

SN Thakur to Warner, FOUR, right off the toe-end from Warner as he slashes at a wide length ball. Balloons over backward point, and beats a stiff effort from Tahir at third man as he couldn't bend down enough to cut it off
Karn Sharma to Hooda, FOUR, proper slice. He steps down, steps away and makes the length right into his slot to carve it away with a lot of bottom hand -- into that one-shot distance now ..
Chahar to Warner, FOUR, he's waited on this slower ball, and then just chipped it back over Chahar's head. Superb from Warner, first to watch it like a hawk and then to have the composure
Chahar to Warner, FOUR, short and wide, it's met with a punishing slap over extra cover. Deserved the treatment it got, really poor delivery
SN Thakur to Warner, FOUR, awful from Thakur. Just bonus runs. Full toss outside off, Warner simply lays his bat on it and finds the gap through extra cover
SN Thakur to Warner, FOUR, short of length outside off, Warner steps to the leg-side to add to the width that was on offer and carves it over extra cover. SRH have raced to 44 in four overs
Tahir to Warner, FOUR, kneels down and slog sweeps it behind square for a four! That was spilling down and has been helped on its way
Tahir to Warner, FOUR, this pocket-sized dynamite is exploding and taking CSK down to the smithereens here. Reverse swept over backward point for a four. He is in a hurry
Tahir to Warner, FOUR, the entire repertoire of shots is out there! The exhibition mode is on. Tossed up delivery and was driven into the covers for a four
Chahar to Warner, FOUR, Chahar's stocks are on a free fall. Short, slow, Warner gets into position and pulls it over short fine leg for a one bounce four

Chahar to Warner, FOUR, and that is fifty for Warner! He has wasted no time today to get going. 45th Fifty plus score for Warner. Flat-batted it down the ground and got it over mid-on for a four. On a track where batters have struggled for timing, he has looked in supreme touch
Jadeja to Bairstow, FOUR, charges out, goes through with the shot and gets it over the bowler's head for a one bounce four
Hardik Pandya to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, too short, too wide, carved away between point and cover point for a four. Got the room and got the boundary to get off the mark
Hardik Pandya to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, strays on to the pads from over the wicket and has been tickled away fine for a four. DC will take these
Rahul Chahar to Dhawan, FOUR, fetches it from outside off and has swept it past square leg for a four. More of a hacked sweep to get it past the fielder
Rahul Chahar to Dhawan, FOUR, takes it from the sticks and gets it between short fine and square leg for a four. More off the inner half of the bat but that was enough

Malinga to Axar, FOUR, and another ventilator-shot - the kind that just about keeps a chase alive. It's another slower-wide combo, but Axar's not getting fooled (any longer). Throws his bat out and slices it away over extra cover
Malinga to Mishra, leg byes, FOUR, loses radar. Well down leg, and Mishra gets a tickle off his pads, under Quinton's rather lazy dive as well
Malinga to Dhawan, FOUR, hangs back on that slower and wide ball to slam it off the front foot. Didn't preempt and got the gap on the off-side for a four

Malinga to Dhawan, FOUR, picks the bones out of that dead meat of a slower ball! Charges out, gets hold of the length and goes through with the lofted hit to send it packing through the covers. Was aerial and landed a few times before the fence

Jayant Yadav to Dhawan, FOUR, oh superb shot. Drifting in on leg stump, and Dhawan just whips it over midwicket. It was too full from Jayant, and so he was right to the pitch of it. Didn't have to worry about playing against the turn

Rabada to Rohit, FOUR, classy from Rohit. Displaying pure elegance. Half-volley from Rabada at 149.4kph, immense bat-speed from Rohit as he props forward and times the drive sublimely through extra cover. Just rocketed away to the fence
Mishra to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, gets as low as possible and scoops the full ball to the left of the keeper, timed it well and the pace on the ball took care of the rest
Rabada to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, slower ball bouncer and SKY had just ample time to pick that off the back foot, he arches slightly and ramps it over the keeper with a touch of delicacy
Rabada to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, that's a gimme from Rabada! 144ks slipping down the leg-side, KP helps it on its away with a fine tickle off his pads to the fine leg fence
Chris Morris to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, fuller, wider, squeezed, four! Bowls it quick and full, the quicker hands of the batter come into play and squirt the ball past point for a four. Much needed one

K Paul to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, does he have the hands of an artisan? Because that was crafty. Length delivery at the sticks, Krunal Pandya creates room and just opens the bat face at the last moment to run it down past the short third fielder
K Paul to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, walloped! The latex-laden iron wrists come into play and whip the ball away between long-on and deep mid for a four

Chris Morris to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, misses the mark again and overcompensates with a full toss. That was helped on its way over the short fine fielder. Hardik hasn't been missing anything though. Anything in his range has been disappearing

Rabada to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, length delivery just outside off and has been whipped from there. Difficult shot to call but was a hybrid of the helicopter that his brother had played a few balls back. Bisected the gap between deep square and deep mid
Rabada to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, throws his bat at a length delivery and gets it past the man at point for a four. MI are running away with the show here

Chris Morris to Rohit, FOUR, 8000 runs in T20s for Rohit, reaches the milestone in a streaky fashion. Pitched up just outside off, Rohit throws his bat hard seeking for a swing downtown, gets a thick inside edge which misses the stumps and runs away to the fine leg fence

Chris Morris to de Kock, FOUR, Morris misses his mark and de Kock dispatches it duly to the fence. Hurls in a low full toss just outside off, de Kock strides out and drills it - skews it off the bottom part but enough to beat mid-off

Ishant to Rohit, FOUR, doesn't get it where he intended, however still collects a boundary. Back of a length delivery, holds up a touch on the pitch and Rohit is through his pull short early. Ends up trimming it off the cue-end past mid-off

Mishra to de Kock, FOUR, picks the gap does Quinton de Kock, it was full and in his zone - he goes down on one knee and hammers it over mid-wicket to ping it in the gap between long-on and deep square. Smart batting!
Steyn to Narine, leg byes, FOUR, inswinger on middle and leg, Narine hops and gets a fine tickle on the thigh pad and Steyn's pace takes care of the rest
Navdeep Saini to Narine, FOUR, clears his front leg and thrashes the pitched up delivery past the non-striker. Brute power from Narine!
Siraj to Nitish Rana, FOUR, this short ball sits up nicely outside off and Rana takes full toll of it, maintains solid base and swat-pulls it in the gap through mid-wicket
Chahal to Nitish Rana, FOUR, short ball on leg, Rana goes down on his knee and hacks it over square leg
Chahal to Nitish Rana, FOUR, goes the other way round! Changes grips and goes for the reverse hit, ends up getting a top-edge that flies over short third man. Four more for the left hander
Stoinis to Nitish Rana, FOUR, short and punished! Width on offer outside off, Rana plays a upper cut and sends this loosener to the boundary at deep point. Still no six in this innings

Chahal to Nitish Rana, FOUR, Rana keeps getting those boundaries! KKR need a few more of these. Was a loopy legbreak down the leg side and the left hander sweeps it past the fielder at short fine leg, getting a move on. Slowly but surely

Navdeep Saini to A Russell, FOUR, square-cut! Short in length outside off, Russell makes room and absolutely powers it past the man at point. That went to the boundary ropes before any of the fielders could blink their eye
Navdeep Saini to Nitish Rana, FOUR, boundaries flowing from both ends now! Rana goes deep in his crease and bludgeons the length delivery past the man at long-on. Good connection there!
Siraj to A Russell, FOUR, hammered! Russell pounces on the width on offer and slams it past point. His front foot was in the air like a flamingo when he connected this one

Steyn to Nitish Rana, FOUR, 18 runs of Steyn's final over! KKR need 43 off the remaining two. Full in length outside off, Rana pounces on the opportunity once again and thumps it over the infield at extra cover. That almost went the distance. Dre Russ back on strike
Steyn to Narine, FOUR, makes room, creates his own width and smashes the length delivery through covers. Simple cricket!
Steyn to Narine, FOUR, connects this time and although it hasn't met the middle, Narine's muscled it in the gap between mid-on and mid-wicket to send it racing along to the turf
Steyn to Narine, FOUR, gets a hint of width outside off, Narine throws the kitchen sink and the top-edge flies to the third man fence in a giffy, no chance for the fielder in the deep
Steyn to Shubman Gill, FOUR, stands tall and slaps a 137ks good length delivery past Virat Kohli at mid-off, played it with a flat bat and managed to pierce the gap between mid-off and extra cover
Siraj to Nitish Rana, FOUR, errs in length a fraction and Rana is onto it in a flash. Sees the ball dip right in his arc (fuller length) and thumps the drive square over backward point

Siraj to Nitish Rana, FOUR, lovely shot by Rana! Pitched on a full length outside off, Rana eyes the covers boundary and lifts this one over the infield. No fielders in the deep and that shall be four runs for the left hander

Siraj to Uthappa, FOUR, there you go! Uthappa breaks the string of dots with a sublime boundary. Makes a hint of room, stays leg-side of the full delivery and clobbers it through extra cover with ease

Narine to Moeen Ali, FOUR, that's fortuitous for Ali. Narine fires it in, Ali was setting up for a wild slog and goes hard. It cuts him for room and the batsman gets a thick inside edge which shaves the leg-stump and runs away to the fine leg fence

Kuldeep Yadav to Moeen Ali, FOUR, finesse followed by power. So smart from Ali, saw the quicker ball and stays rooted to the crease. Uses the pace and opens his bat face to guide it in the pocket between backward point and short third man

Prasidh to Kohli, FOUR, leading edge and it balloons over short third man. Got to feel for the bowler, set him up really well. Good length delivery, seaming in and just straightens off the pitch. Kohli was aiming for an across-the-hoick and lost his shape. Thick edge and gets away fortunately as it soars over the fielder's head before rolling away to the fence
Prasidh to Moeen Ali, FOUR, another edge and another four. Shortish and moved away just enough, Ali swings his bat and gets an outside edge which loops over the keeper
Kuldeep Yadav to Moeen Ali, FOUR, hammered past long-off. Flighted outside off, Ali lowers his stance and reaches out to smack it in the gap. Even Dre Russ can't stop that
Kuldeep Yadav to Moeen Ali, FOUR, wow! Ali is full flow here. Kuldeep is not learning. Pitches it up in the slot, Ali keeps a solid base and dumps it straight down the ground
Gurney to Kohli, FOUR, swivel-pulled past short fine leg. Off-pace delivery from Gurney, too short and down leg. Kohli pulls it hard and places it in the gap
Gurney to Kohli, FOUR, squeezes the drive in the gap between cover and point. Wide yorker from Gurney, Kohli gets his bat down quickly and times it superbly to pick up his second boundary of the over

Prasidh to Kohli, FOUR, shot of the innings so far. Flamboyance from Kohli. Krishna corrects his length and wafts it full outside off. Kohli bends low, chases it and drives it off the meat through extra cover. It just zoomed away to the fence in a jiffy

Prasidh to Stoinis, FOUR, it doesn't matter for Stoinis. He joins the party as well. Walks across his stumps, waits deep and absolutely spanks it wide of long-off, who gives up the chase. Another massive over, 19 off it

Gurney to Stoinis, FOUR, Kuldeep is having a forgettable outing. Slower short ball, Stoinis pivots back and pulls it uppishly. Lands in front of Kuldeep at deep square leg, who perhaps gets caught in two-minds. Doesn't attempt a catch and neither does he gets his body in the line. It sprang up and loops over his head to the fence

Gurney to Kohli, FOUR, the moment has arrived. Hundred for Kohli. His first this season and look at him go. Leaps up, roars in delight and brandishes his bat. Even the Kolkata crowd are going bonkers. Special knock from the Indian captain. Shuffles across his stumps and whiplashes it through mid-wicket. Kuldeep's miserable day continues as he fails to stop the ball near the fence

Prasidh to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, ah, you don't nail yorkers better -- 144kph on the base of off. Parthiv desperately jams his bat down, somehow getting an inside tickle past his stumps, and there's nothing fine leg's running dive can do to stop it either

Prasidh to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, gets away. Krishna bangs it short again outside off, which Patel throws his hands out to - more in getting out of this non-self-imposed shell - and slaps it powerfully over point. It also helps his cause that it is the tiny Piyush Chawa fielding there
Narine to Kohli, FOUR, hard pull, straight to deep mid-wicket. Yea, simple, single. But no, Gill messes up, bending low a little too casually and letting the ball slip through

Prasidh to Kohli, FOUR, 143.8kph. And Kohli's being given a real workout here -- this time undoing him on a flick across the line, only for the genuine leading edge flying away through an empty slip cordon

Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, FOUR, loopy dip, but Kohli's just too smart. He runs down, maybe yorking himself in the process, but why bother when you have bottom-hands as good as these .. drills it straight down
Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, FOUR, more flight, this time drifting wide outside off. Kohli moves the other way, piling on the overcook to carve it away through sweeper

D Kulkarni to de Kock, FOUR, fifty for de Kock. Second against Rajasthan this season. Can this be a match winning one? He knew fine leg was square, so he walked across his stumps and scooped the slower delivery to the vacant fine leg fence

Binny to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, he must be relieved. Binny tries a leg-cutter and ends up bowling a full toss, Suryakumar takes a step out to get under it and slams it straight back, one bounce and over the ropes

Unadkat to Cutting, FOUR, nicely done! Cutting's off the mark with a boundary. That was all about precision. A length delivery angled across him and the Australian all-rounder guides it through the gap at point and short third man. Couldn't have placed it any better

Jofra Archer to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, first one of the innings for Pandya! Makes the most out of the pace on this ball. Shuffles in his crease and flicks the ball over backward square leg. No fielders in the deep and that shall be a boundary for Hardik

Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, edged away to the fence! Angled across the batsman outside off, Pandya throws his bat at it and gets an outside edge past Samson. Although the keeper dived, he couldn't quite reach there. Can't keep a slip either with just 10 balls to go

Shreyas Gopal to Rohit, FOUR, top-edge and four, pushed through quicker and sliding down leg, Rohit was down on his knees as he swept, off the top-edge and went wide of the fielder in the circle at short fine
D Kulkarni to de Kock, FOUR, cracking shot, tad too full from Dhawal, de Kock takes a step forward and then drills it back at the bowler, too pacy though and Dhawal has no chance in stopping it
D Kulkarni to de Kock, FOUR, lovely, tad too short and wide of off, de Kock came down the track, made room as he did so and cracked it square past cover-point for a boundary

D Kulkarni to de Kock, FOUR, hat-trick of boundaries, Dhawal tried to follow de Kock as he came down the track, too short though and it's helped off the pads - over short fine and rolls away to the ropes
Jofra Archer to de Kock, FOUR, cracking shot, too full and too wide of off, de Kock gets well forward and drills it over cover, couple of bounces and over the ropes

Unadkat to Suryakumar Yadav, leg byes, FOUR, this is poor bowling from Unadkat, might not go against him, but it's still a boundary against the team. Too full and on Suryakumar's pads, he was looking to flick and missed, brushed the pads and beat the diving keeper
Binny to de Kock, FOUR, that's a poor ball to end the over, short and on de Kock's pads, he gets inside the line and pulls it fine - past Archer's dive at short fine

Hardik Pandya to Samson, FOUR, Sanju wasting no time, gets going with a first-ball boundary. Latches on to the length delivery and pulls it through mid-wicket without much hassle, beats the sprinter in the deep quite convincingly

Hardik Pandya to Samson, FOUR, two in two for Samson! Uses the pace on this short of a length delivery and glides it past the fielder at short third man. The dive by the man inside the ring wasn't able to stop the ball from making it to the fence
Krunal Pandya to Samson, FOUR, Samson taking on the Pandya brothers. Makes room for himself and lofts the tossed up delivery straight over the bowler's head, four more for the youngster
Krunal Pandya to Samson, FOUR, beautiful shot! Goes inside-out and times this fullish delivery over extra cover. Was timed so neatly that it almost went the distance

Krunal Pandya to Riyan Parag, FOUR, promising start here from Riyan Parag. A couple of boundaries already. This is flat at the stumps, and he's down on one knee to put the slog-sweep away through deep midwicket

Hardik Pandya to Riyan Parag, FOUR, yup, getting cheeky isn't a bad way of breaking the shackles. Pandya gets a touch predictable with one good length too many, and Parag shuffles quickly, realizes fine leg is inside the circle and scoops it away over him
Hardik Pandya to Riyan Parag, FOUR, more leg-lined, but Parag's quick to make room this time, and his outside edge is thick and hard enough in the wafty drive to run away through the empty slip
Malinga to Riyan Parag, FOUR, so now some feet as well. This kid's putting up a show here, stepping away from the line, getting under the good length to go inside-out over extra cover

Bumrah to Smith, FOUR, wow. So damn neat. A very tight cramping back of a length stuff, which Smith waits, and waits on, lets it get really close to him before opening up his bat face and guiding it perfectly behind point, and toying around with the angle for third man to cut off either
Hardik Pandya to Smith, FOUR, the horrors of a short-wide combo. Smith arches back, throws his hands out and smashes a cut wide of backward point's left reach

Malinga to Binny, FOUR, aand it doesn't EVER mater where your fielders are when the ball is a very friendly full toss drifting down leg. Binny tries to sweep, getting a tickle somewhere off something to run away really fine .. and we thought 160 was too many!

Krunal Pandya to Samson, FOUR, 15 runs of Krunal's first over! Rajasthan couldn't have asked for a better start. Another floated delivery around off, that doesn't spin much. Samson moves to an extent and creams it through the gap at covers yet again. Three boundaries in the over and the Royals are off to a flier

Malinga to Samson, byes, FOUR, de Kock apologizes as he makes a mess of it. Should have been stopped by him, but instead it's four byes. The boundaries are leaking and Royals wouldn't mind it. Samson was looking to guide the slower delivery through third man but got beaten due to the lack of pace. The keeper couldn't gather it cleanly as he parried it away to the fence in the process

Rahul Chahar to Rahane, FOUR, welcome into the attack Mr. Chahar! A short legbreak with width on offer, Rahane eyes lit up on seeing that and he chops it through the gap at point and short third man, sublime
Rahul Chahar to Rahane, FOUR, the leg spinner has been put under pressure right away! Rahane goes down on his knee and sweeps the tossed up delivery over square leg, four more

Rahul Chahar to Samson, FOUR, has been an exhibition of finesse by Samson so far... It's not about power always. A floated delivery down the leg side and it's been lapped down to the fine leg boundary by Sanju. He's moved on to 26 off 11 balls
Malinga to Smith, FOUR, lashes the cut between backward point and short third man. Short and wide from Malinga, and this time it was a normal pace delivery. Smith used that pace and carved it away

Malinga to Smith, FOUR, short of length outside off, punched through backward point. With this field - no protection deep on the off-side - there's no room to offer any width which Malinga has done a couple of times already
Markande to Smith, FOUR, short ball outside off, Smith capitalizes. He drags the pull in the gap between long-on and deep midwicket to ease the pressure

Markande to Riyan Parag, FOUR, short again from Markande, and Parag doesn't need to get his eye in to dispatch it. He rocks back and thwacks it wide of deep midwicket. Not the follow-up MI needed after that Chahar over
Sam Curran to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, sits up nicely in the slot. Shaw continues with his really high backlift, lofting a whack straight down the ground
Sam Curran to Dhawan, FOUR, 124.3kph, massive slip down leg. And Dhawan couldn't have asked for it easier, going through his full-blooded pick-up-and-swipe shot behind square

Viljoen to Dhawan, FOUR, Delhi inching closer to the target! Dhawan is looking unstoppable, just like he was against KKR. Latches on to the short ball and swivel-pulls this one through backward square leg, beats the sprinter in the deep quite comfortably

Sam Curran to Pant, FOUR, misfield by Gayle and that shall be the first boundary of the innings for Pant. Was a slower short ball down the leg side and Pant helped it to short fine leg where Gayle got his hands to it and parried it away to the fine leg fence

Sam Curran to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, Curran looks disappointed as Iyer ends the over with a boundary. Makes room for himself and slices the length delivery over short third man. There were two fielders stationed there but both were inside the circle. Toying with the field is Iyer at the moment. Just 36 needed off 5 overs

Viljoen to Ingram, FOUR, safe shot by Ingram as he eyes the vacant deep mid-wicket boundary. A short ball around off, the southpaw stands tall and slogs it over mid-wicket. One bounce and over the fence for as Ingram gets his first boundary

Viljoen to Ingram, FOUR, that's an excellent shot by Ingram. Was a yorker outside off and the South African squeezes it past the man at short third man. Gayle had no chance to even react as the ball raced past him and rushed into the fence

Viljoen to Ingram, FOUR, Ingram is finding the gaps in the field like a boss. A short ball at the hips and it's been dragged through deep square leg by the southpaw, second boundary of the over. He hasn't taken any risks either

Viljoen to Ingram, FOUR, another cracking shot to end the over. Backs away, makes room and crunches the overpitched delivery through cover-point for his third boundary of the over. The required run is down to 5 now

Sam Curran to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, Shreyas Iyer hits the winning runs - it's a boundary! Sixth win of the season for the Delhi Capitals as their captain sends this one away to the deep mid-wicket fence with a fantastic pull shot. Nerves of steel by the young skipper towards the closing stages. DC beat KXIP by 5 wickets
Shami to Dhawan, FOUR, and Dhawan and his cover drives. Shami floates it full, gives out width as well. Sliced, powerfully, and over extra cover's leap from within the circle
Viljoen to Dhawan, FOUR, lucky edge. Dhawan charges down to open up a cut over the off-side, but the bounce gets big on him, and the outside splice is good enough to fly over the slip cordon

Viljoen to Dhawan, FOUR, nothing lucky here, it's a proper crunch. Viljoen goes shorter, but ends up dishing out a half tracker, which Dhawan can upper-cut now, and there being no third man helps his cause as well
Harpreet Brar to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, that's superbly played. Waits on the ball and back-cuts it through backward point
Harpreet Brar to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, back of a length, spinning away from off, Iyer steps back and punches it through the covers
Ashwin to Dhawan, FOUR, short ball at the stumps, real stinker to start his spell. Dhawan rocks back and smashes the pull through midwicket

Ashwin to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, no slip in place and this outside edge has run away for four. Grip and turn with the carrom ball for Ashwin, enough to find Iyer's outside edge and also enough to keep rolling into the ropes
Murugan Ashwin to Dhawan, FOUR, he's fetched this googly from outside leg stump and reverse-swept it through backward point. Incredible shot

Lamichhane to Rahul, FOUR, it's all one-handed from KL and he's getting the runs as well, flighted delivery outside off, he bent down low, used the bottom hand and then swept it over square leg for a boundary

Lamichhane to Ashwin, FOUR, lovely shot! Dropped short and Ashwin is quick to latch onto it, transfered his weight back and pulled it over the mid-wicket fielder, placement was perfect from the skipper

Mishra to Mandeep, FOUR, horrible bowling and that is putting it mildly. Rank long hop outside off and this time Mandeep does not miss out, he waits and holds his shape to slap it over extra cover, one bounce and over the ropes
Axar to Harpreet Brar, FOUR, well, well. Smashes his first IPL runs -- getting a juicy short-wide one to crash into, slapping it through extra cover
Rabada to Ashwin, FOUR, lots of clubbing in this. A 117.1kph slower cutter tried, digging it short, which Ashwin goes right behind to in mowing it very agriculturally into cow corner
Ishant to Harpreet Brar, FOUR, 139.8kph, corrects his overdose of wides with a shorter, but wide one nevertheless. Brar carves, uppishly, over extra cover
Ishant to Gayle, FOUR, neatly done, Ishant took some pace off the ball and angled it across the left-hander, Gayle waited on it, played it with an open face and ran it past short third man
Lamichhane to Gayle, FOUR, they're looking to attack Lamichhane, too short and too straight from the leg-spinner, Gayle rocks back and pulls it behind square on the on-side for a boundary

Lamichhane to Gayle, FOUR, belted, Lamichhane got a hand onto it, but such was the fierceness of the shot - he could only get a hand onto it - tossed up on middle, Gayle pressed forward and drilled it back at the bowler, will go down as a half-chance
Lamichhane to Gayle, FOUR, too full and sliding down leg, Gayle bends half-way down and sweeps it fine - Ishant, at short fine dived over the ball and lets another boundary through
Lamichhane to Gayle, FOUR, 16 from the over, Lamichhane dropped this one short and well outside off, Gayle rocked back and punched it hard - into the gap wide of cover-point, no need to run for those

Rabada to Miller, FOUR, streaky and four, on a good length and from round the wicket, Miller was late in getting his bat down, squirted off the inside edge and past short fine, runs away to the ropes in a hurry
Ishant to Gayle, FOUR, cracking shot, short of a length and well outside off, the slower ball from Ishant, punched off the back-foot and to the right of Shaw at cover-point

Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, that is not the place to bowl to Lynn or for that matter any batsman. Short and outside off, Lynn had the width and he slaps it hard through the packed off-side field. No need to run for that

Bhuvneshwar to Narine, FOUR, help yourself delivery and Narine does just that. In an attempt to go short, Bhuvi slips one on the hips, Narine with one leg up in the air pulls it past the man at short fine. Good start for KKR, 10 off the first over

Nadeem to Chris Lynn, FOUR, poor start from Nadeem. Half tracker and Lynn does not miss out, he plays the back foot punch past extra cover and the timing takes care of the rest. He relied on timing rather than power

Sandeep Sharma to Chris Lynn, FOUR, much needed boundary for KKR! Lynn latches on to the short ball and swivel-pulls it into the gap at deep mid-wicket. The ball drops just in front of the boundary cushions, such sweet was the timing

Bhuvneshwar to Rinku Singh, FOUR, Rinku finally connects one. A wide delivery that was angled across the left hander who punches it past the fielder at cover. The fielder in the deep was way too square in order to cut this down

Khaleel Ahmed to Chris Lynn, FOUR, another miscue but it won't matter. Lynn brings up his 9th fifty in IPL. Another slower cutter slanting away from the right-hander, Lynn throws the kitchen sink and gets a thick outside edge which flies over backward point and into the square third man fence
Rashid Khan to Chawla, FOUR, picks the legbreak, jumps back inside the crease and clobbers the pull over square leg. In the gap and that's a boundary

Khaleel Ahmed to Narine, FOUR, need to get the short delivery higher, Narine is waiting for these, clears his front leg and pulls it over mid-wicket, once more just managed to clear the fielder on the edge of the circle

Khaleel Ahmed to Narine, FOUR, Narine is already winning the mental battle. Khaleel goes for the yorker and misses it, the low full toss outside off and Narine spoons it over the off-side field, the fast outfield does the rest

Sandeep Sharma to Nitish Rana, FOUR, shot! Fuller and outside off, Rana leans forward and creams the drive past cover-point, Nadeem ran behind the ball and only managed to escort it to the fence. The dive never came

Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, FOUR, cheeky! That is what you get with Karthik. On a length and outside off, Karthik opens the bat face at the last second and runs it fine, beating third man in the deep comfortably

Yarra Prithviraj to Bairstow, FOUR, Cariappa has denied Yarra Prithviraj his maiden wicket in IPL. Short and wide outside off, Bairstow frees his arms and slashes hard, it goes flat and straight into the hands of KC Cariappa at deep point who lets it slips through his fingers and to make matters worse, it has gone over the boundary ropes
Narine to Warner, FOUR, slapped down the ground! That is a four..waited on it and slammed it over the bowler's head
Chawla to Bairstow, FOUR, gets his bat down on a shortish ball at the last moment and places it well past the man at short third fielder for a four
Yarra Prithviraj to Bairstow, FOUR, short ball on the stumps, Bairstow swivels and powers the pull in the gap through mid-wicket, no need to run for those
Gurney to Warner, FOUR, sets himself up for a slower delivery and clobbers the off-cutter over the fielder at extra cover, excellent timing and placement from Warner
Chawla to Bairstow, FOUR, slightly full outside off, Bairstow gets down on one knee and slogsweeps it over mid-wicket. Easy!
Cariappa to Warner, FOUR, similar ball into the pads, this time he just helps it away through the gap between short fine and backward square
A Russell to Bairstow, FOUR, short of length at the hip, such a loosener at 126kph, and Bairstow punishes it with a thumping pull to the long leg boundary
Chawla to Bairstow, FOUR, drifting down leg, so Bairstow doesn't have to worry about the leg-before. He goes down on the back knee and sweeps hard, sending it fine of short fine leg
Cariappa to Bairstow, FOUR, spinning away outside off, had been pushed through the air much quicker. Bairstow sits back in the crease, anticipating it, and dabs it cunningly past the keeper
Steyn to Watson, FOUR, drops the length short and allows Watson to stand back and pull it away to deep square leg. Pivoted on his back leg to power the ball away
U Yadav to Rayudu, FOUR, steps out, makes some room and slaps this short ball over mid-off. In this partnership, he might now start to be the aggressor to keep the rate in control

Navdeep Saini to Dhoni, FOUR, flies off the outside edge past short third man, no chance for the fielder who was inside the ring. He just threw his hands at the slightest amount of width that Saini had provided
U Yadav to Dhoni, FOUR, he goes short first ball and Dhoni dispatches him through square leg. Oh those nerves, watch those nerves RCB

U Yadav to du Plessis, leg byes, FOUR, terrible delivery! That's Umesh for you. Two ends of the spectrum can be seen. Was well down leg and clipped the pads off the attempted heave to run away to the fine leg fence

Steyn to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, luck's written all over that delivery. A peach of an inswinger from Steyn, bowled at 139ks and nearly cut Jadhav into half. Was caught poking around the fifth stump channel and the inside edge flies wide of PP to his left

U Yadav to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, just a flick of the wrists, nothing less nothing more! Sees the ball angle into his pads and unveiled those whippy wrists on the flick did Kedar Jadhav, all the way through mid-wicket...

U Yadav to Dhoni, FOUR, streaky! Would have been out had there been a backward point, wasn't to be. Dhoni gets a full ball outside off and he fishes at it sans any feet, sliced it off the thick outside edge and it flies square past non-existent point
Navdeep Saini to Rayudu, FOUR, short ball outside off, Rayudu had some extra time to adjust as it was around the 130ks, he arches back and ramps it over non-existent short third

Negi to Dhoni, FOUR, Dhoni's so good at playing smart cricket shots and this is one of them. Sees the ball slide down leg and paddles it in a flash past the keeper, played it late but found the middle which is what matters the most
Stoinis to Dhoni, FOUR, short ball down the leg-side, Dhoni swivels and powers the pull in the gap behind square on the leg-side, no need to run for those

Chahar to Kohli, FOUR, Kohli is off and running. Chahar gets a bit greedy. Tries to swing it from middle-stump and in the process gives Kohli a freebie, flicked away uppishly over the square leg umpire

Dwayne Bravo to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, Patel ends the over with a boundary and moves closer to his fifty. Gets a full toss and the southpaw makes sure to chip it over the infield at covers. No fielders in the deep and that's an easy four

Dwayne Bravo to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, RCB fans give Parthiv a standing ovation as the opener gets to his fifty with a boundary. Waits for the slower delivery and whips it through the gap at mid-wicket to send the ball away to the fence. Has been a crucial knock but he needs to get a move on
Tahir to Moeen Ali, FOUR, tickled away fine as that was the quicker ball. Has run away to the fence for a four
SN Thakur to Moeen Ali, FOUR, bangs the ball short and has been pulled away! There was no one at deep mid and it was a four

Chahar to Moeen Ali, FOUR, right up there! Brilliant delivery and equally well played. Opened the face of the blade and dug it out to squeeze the ball past the dive of the man at short third for a four. RCB need more of these
Dwayne Bravo to Moeen Ali, FOUR, with the point and cover point in, the fuller ball was a bad idea. Moeen Ali got his bat down and slammed it over point for a four. The wrists of steel came into play
Dwayne Bravo to Moeen Ali, FOUR, steered! Four! past short third man that one. Fuller and wider one, Moeen Ali maintained his balance to squeeze it past short third
Chahar to Kohli, FOUR, streaky! Not where he intended but he won't mind it. Runs down the wicket and swings through the line, the outswinger takes the outside edge and flies over short third man

SN Thakur to de Villiers, FOUR, AB is away. They need a move on and who better than de Villiers to rely on. Not a bad delivery by any means. Back of a length delivery and de Villiers thumps it over mid-on, one bounce and over the ropes

SN Thakur to de Villiers, FOUR, Thakur has lost his line in the last 10 balls or so. Strays on the pads and that is easy pickings, de Villiers flicks it in front of square and Tahir's dive was nowhere close to the ball

SN Thakur to de Villiers, FOUR, 16 runs to end the powerplay. Thakur tries to follow the backing away de Villiers with a full delivery, but ends up bowling it in the slot, pumped right back over and the ball bounces just inside the fence

Dwayne Bravo to Akshdeep Nath, FOUR, lovely shot! Right out of the coaching manual. Nothing much wrong with the delivery. Fuller and outside off, Nath leans forward and creams the drive past mid-off. Thakur can only fetch it from the fence

D Kulkarni to Dhawan, FOUR, just look how quick the outfield is. This wasn't middled whatsoever but the pace makes it easier for Dhawan. Gets heaves across the line and gets it off the inside half of his bat, beats the fielder at short mid-wicket initially and finds the boundary thereafter
Riyan Parag to Pant, FOUR, sliding in on leg stump, Pant picks the line early, bends his back knee and swings it backward of square
Riyan Parag to Pant, FOUR, short ball on middle stump, Pant smacks the pull through square leg. Smith just throws his head back after another poor delivery

Shreyas Gopal to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, this is such a fantastic shot. He was beaten in length after stepping out, as Gopal pulled it well back. But Shaw remains undeterred, going through with the cover drive and creaming it to the fence

Unadkat to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, Shaw has found the gap to perfection. There was a man at fine leg and at deep mid-wicket but Prithvi Shaw pulls it right between the two fielders. The timing was also good enough and it races to the fence

D Kulkarni to Pant, FOUR, excellent from Pant, he knows Kulkarni is one of the weaker bowler in this Royals attack and he wants to target him. The pace of Kulkarni allows Pant to go down on his kness and he half-sweeps-half-whips it over fine leg for a boundary

Unadkat to Pant, FOUR, Pant tumbles but Pant connects and gets a boundary. Things only Pant can do! He gets inside the line of the ball, goes down on his knees and almost paddles it over short fine for a boundary
Shreyas Gopal to Pant, FOUR, fuller and on the stumps, Pant pumps it straight down the ground for a boundary. That went to the fence like a tracer bullet
Shreyas Gopal to Pant, no ball, FOUR, Pant has dispatched it for a boundary. It is a No-ball too, it was a full-toss above the waist height, Pant pumps it wide of fine leg for a boundary. Free-hit!

D Kulkarni to Rutherford, FOUR, that has raced to the fence in some micro seconds. It was in the slot for Rutherford, on that fuller length. He clears his leg and powers it with utter disdain, wide of deep cover for a boundary. The young man loved it too, he punches the air in delight

Unadkat to Dhawan, FOUR, another sublime shot by Shikhar! Puts on his dancing shoes and bludgeons the shortish delivery through mid-on. The fielder was very square, hence this was always heading to the fence

Shreyas Gopal to Dhawan, FOUR, he loves to bat on these kind of tracks, doesn't he? Walks down the wicket and lifts it over the bowler's head for four more. There was a fielder at long-on but this just manages to beat his sprint
Shreyas Gopal to Dhawan, FOUR, Gopal struggling against the left hander! Dhawan goes down on his knee and lifts the tossed up delivery over square leg for four runs this time around
Jofra Archer to Dhawan, FOUR, some lovely wristwork from Dhawan. Length ball at the stumps, picks it away through midwicket with great force off the wrists
D Kulkarni to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, short of length at the body, Shaw's arms don't have the space to move freely, but he manages enough power through the swing to heave this over midwicket
D Kulkarni to Dhawan, FOUR, walks across the stumps, receives a full toss and paddles it past short fine leg
D Kulkarni to Dhawan, FOUR, swats the off-cutter through midwicket for four more. He's looking in ominous touch. Just sits up so beautifully on this pitch for Dhawan to have a biff
Riyan Parag to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, short ball from Parag which is almost nonchalantly dispatched through midwicket. Way too easy
Shreyas Gopal to Dhawan, FOUR, short googly outside off, really ordinary stuff, and Dhawan isn't in the mood to let them get away. Smashes the pull wide of deep midwicket

Ishant to Rahane, FOUR, Rahane at his sublime best! Not all that full but a hint of width and he trusts the surface by driving on the up. Relied on timing and placed it through the crowded off-side cordon. Raced away past point in a flash

Rabada to Rahane, FOUR, crisply struck! Another delightful shot from Rahane. Overpitched and he is well forward to this one, times the straight drive with aplomb to send it racing past the right of mid-off
Mishra to Smith, FOUR, typical Steven Smith! All wristy. Ambles down the pitch and uses those whippy wrists to time and place the flick in the gap wide of long-on
Mishra to Smith, FOUR, stays inside the crease this time, uncorks his wrists and flays the cut in the gap behind point
Rutherford to Smith, FOUR, poor delivery from Rutherford! Bowls a slower ball but he's dished it on Smith's pads, tickled away past short fine. Easy!

Rutherford to Smith, FOUR, this is batting practice for Steven Smith. He had all the time in the world to smash this slower length ball outside off and smash it he does. Clears his front leg and clobbers it wide of the fielder at long-on
Rutherford to Smith, FOUR, make that three in a row! Too full and Smith slices the drive behind point

Chris Morris to Rahane, FOUR, that's just a check shot and Rahane timed that to perfection. Waits for the pitched up delivery to arrive and crunches it with a straight bat face, no heavy backlift but it still flies over the man at mid-off
Ishant to Stokes, FOUR, comes dancing down the pitch and punch-drives the full delivery to the left of mid-off, Stokes batting with full freedom and he has got the license to do that

Ishant to Rahane, FOUR, timed! That's what you get with class players like Rahane. Just stands his ground, waits for the fullish delivery to arrive and chips the drive over cover with an air of confidence. All the way...
Chris Morris to Rahane, FOUR, full toss around the knee roll, Rahane stays still and flicks it over the square leg umpire. No need to run for those...

Rabada to Binny, FOUR, not a great day for Rabada in the field. Since that run-out of Samson, nothing has gone his way. Even this was a false shot but the end result is a boundary. Nothing's working for the speedster. Drags back the length on his delivery and Binny ends up top-edging it over the keeper's head as he hacks across the line

Chris Morris to Binny, FOUR, boundary to end the over but Morris wouldn't mind - concedes only 8 runs in it. This was in the slot and Binny heaves it into the vacant region at cow-corner. The fielder was perhaps inside the circle and that shall be four more for the all-rounder
Rabada to Riyan Parag, FOUR, that's a full toss on the pads and Riyan Parag whips it past the man at fine leg who had no chance to stop this. He was a touch too fine in order to cut this down

Axar to Rahane, FOUR, whipped over the infield! Clever batting from Rahane, got one tossed up and he didn't go hard at this one. Just used his wrists and ensured that he got it over mid-wicket as there was nobody in the deep. Makes terrific contact and reaps the reward. He's looking good tonight

Ishant to Smith, FOUR, just past a diving Rabada! Was always difficult for him to take this but made a heroic effort nevertheless. Pitched by Ishant and Smith went for loft down the ground. Got it straight but Rabada from mid-on sensed it and moved swiftly to his left before diving mid-air. Past him and to the fence

Axar to Rahane, FOUR, Ishant won't want to watch this, his drop has started to cost heavily already. Flatter one from Axar and Rahane gets across to sweep this well over short fine leg. Clean strike and more runs

Rabada to Rahane, FOUR, Rahane is in overdrive in this Powerplay. Raining boundaries at the moment. Rabada spills one on the pads and that's criminal with fine leg up. Rahane just gets a tickle on it and sends it racing past that fielder to the fence in no time

Chris Morris to Rahane, FOUR, fist pump from Rahane as he gets to his fifty! Seems determined to make a statement tonight and to be honest, it's been his best knock in ages. Fractionally short and he dispatches the pull over mid-wicket. There is a man in the deep but Jinks has placed it wider. He is flowing freely at the moment, needs to bat through from RR's POV

Chris Morris to Smith, FOUR, brilliant placement! There is a fine leg and deep mid-wicket in place but Smith has bisected them beautifully. Gets on the pads and he duly flicks it through square leg. Called for two but such is the timing that it leaves the deep fielders with no chance of getting to it
Mishra to Smith, FOUR, excellent placement from Smith! Uses his feet, gets closer to the pitch of the delivery and whiplashes it over mid-wicket, right in the gap between the fielders in the deep
