Axar to Rahane, FOUR, Rahane unleashing class! Skips out of his crease and plays a gorgeous inside out drive over extra cover with sublime timing
Axar to Rahane, FOUR, Rahane is looking unstoppable at the moment! Picks the arm-ball, settles on one knee and paddles it fine of the fielder at short fine
Sandeep Sharma to Watson, FOUR, short of length outside off, guides it with an open face between backward point and short third man
Sandeep Sharma to Watson, FOUR, great crack of the bat as Watson crunched this flat-batted swipe wide of deep midwicket. Sandeep's slower ball was short in length and sat up
Rashid Khan to Rayudu, FOUR, smashed away! A trifle too short from Rashid and Rayudu picked the length early. Swivelled and pulled it hard, bisecting deep mid-wicket and long-on perfectly

Rashid Khan to Watson, FOUR, smacked away by Watson! Got down on his knees and swept this hard in front of square through the leg-side. Sandeep got across with a slide but couldn't palm it away properly

Bhuvneshwar to Watson, FOUR, he's in autopilot mode now, Watson! Gets to 8000 T20 runs! Not a bad ball, almost the perfect wide yorker from Bhuvneshwar but Watson is in the zone now. Waits deep in the crease and opens the bat face late. Bisects short third man and backward point easily

Bhuvneshwar to Watson, FOUR, deft once again! Watson wants to finish this in a hurry. Slightly shorter this time, not much room but he plays is late with an open face. Gets it wide of Bairstow and short third man had no chance

Rashid Khan to Watson, FOUR, 15 off the over! Watson is motoring towards yet another IPL century! Too short from Rashid and the Aussie sits back to pull this away through backward square leg. Short fine leg is the only man there

Bhuvneshwar to Raina, FOUR, Raina gets off the mark with a glorious off-drive. Gets hold of the overpitched delivery, presents the full face of his willow and creams it past the fielder at mid-off. Great shot to open his account
Shakib to Watson, FOUR, that shall give him some confidence! Tad full in length around middle and leg, Watson goes down on his knee and sweeps it uppishly over square leg. Almost went the distance

Khaleel Ahmed to Watson, FOUR, length ball outside off, Watson plants his foot back in the crease and hoists it over extra cover. Extraordinary shot, generating all that power from the bottom hand. Vijay Shankar's diving effort in the deep not enough
Sandeep Sharma to Raina, FOUR, short balls have had a history of troubling Raina, true, but not at 118kph. Muscles this pull well in front of square
Sandeep Sharma to Raina, FOUR, slower length ball on leg stump, too easy for Raina who is well aware of short fine leg's presence inside the ring. Just whips it past the man

Sandeep Sharma to Raina, FOUR, this isn't intentional, but it's useful. Length ball outside off, Raina had charged down looking to biff no matter what. So it doesn't matter to him that the ball's far away. He throws his hands at it, and ends up slicing it off the outside half over short third man

Sandeep Sharma to Raina, FOUR, fourth boundary of the over, third one in a row. The shackles have been broken. Slower ball on middle, Raina swipes agriculturally and gets enough off the inside half to impart the legs to roll into the square leg boundary

Rashid Khan to Watson, FOUR, Rashid jumps away from the path of this bullet-drive from Watson. He had made the mistake of overpitching, but he wasn't going to make the mistake of risking himself once Watson drilled it back. Smartly so

Rashid Khan to Raina, FOUR, short ball outside off, seemed like an intentional dab from Raina, although Warner wasn't far from getting a hand at slip. With the pace of Rashid, this absolutely flew off Raina's bat
Rashid Khan to Raina, byes, FOUR, goes right through Raina, but bounces over the stumps. That's beaten everyone. An absolute ripper from Rashid

Harbhajan to Manish Pandey, FOUR, intent from Manish Pandey straightaway, much better from the Karnataka lad. It was a flighted delivery and was spinning back into Manish, he plunges forward and lofts it straight down the ground for a boundary
Dwayne Bravo to Manish Pandey, FOUR, Pandey is absolutely belting it today! Sees the slower full ball dip outside off and times the slap-drive to perfection, raced away to the deep cover fence

Dwayne Bravo to Manish Pandey, FOUR, one of Manish Pandey's best IPL innings this, brings up his fifty in 25 balls. Picks the slower ball early, times his swivel and pulls it past the diving left hand of short fine
Jadeja to Manish Pandey, FOUR, he's in overdrive is Manish Pandey! Jumps out of his crease, shows no signs of fear and pumps Jadeja straight down the ground for a one-bounce boundary

Dwayne Bravo to Shankar, FOUR, another fine shot by Shankar! Looks in sublime touch. Reaches out for the overpitched delivery wide ball and chips it over cover-point. There were two fielders inside the circle and this ball cleared them by some distance

Chahar to Shankar, FOUR, in the slot and Shankar drags it over the infield at mid-wicket. There were two fielders in the deep but this was placed right into the gap as he heaved the length ball across

Chahar to Warner, FOUR, you cannot miss your length by an inch against Warner. It was marginally short and was directed on the body, Warner gets in an excellent position and times the pull shot brilliantly. It goes over square leg and races to the fence

Chahar to Warner, FOUR, that's a tennis forehand, Roger would have been proud of that. It was a good length delivery and was just wide of off, nothing wrong with the delivery. But Warner flat-bats it wide of the bowler and the timing was so good that it canters to the fence

Chahar to Manish Pandey, FOUR, smashed! It as full and was on the stumps, Manish Pandey pumps it down the ground, Chahar did well to get his head out of the way. It runs along the carpet for another boundary

Harbhajan to Manish Pandey, FOUR, flighted delivery down the leg-side, Manish Pandey goes deep in the crease and tucks it wide of the leg-slip, it beats short fine and will reach the boundary too. Pandey is on fire!

Harbhajan to Manish Pandey, FOUR, Dhoni shouts Na na na from behind as it was a short one, it was wide of off too. Manish Pandey rocks back and cuts it wide of short third. Another boundary for Pandey!

Jadeja to Warner, FOUR, dispatches the first delivery of Jadeja for a boundary. It was wide of off, Warner plunges forward and tonks it wide of deep mid-wicket for a boundary. It spilts the gap to perfection
Southee to Gayle, FOUR, Gayle is underway! Fullish ball outside off, Gayle reaches out and throws the kicthen sink. Sliced over point and the Universe Boss collects his first boundary

Southee to Gayle, FOUR, nicely done! Not a shot that you'd normally assocciate with Gayle. Short of a length ball outside off and the lefty used the bowler's pace to guide it through backward point and short third man
Southee to Gayle, FOUR, 14 off the opening over! Southee continues to have a terrible IPL. A wide half-volley outside off and Gayle flays it over backward point. Third boundary for Gayle!
U Yadav to Rahul, FOUR, another bad ball! Slants in a back of a length delivery at 137kph, straighter line as well. Rahul, with one leg off ground, controls the pull through backward square leg
U Yadav to Rahul, FOUR, horror ball! An overpitched delivery on the pads - almost pleading the batsman to punish. And, KL doesn't miss out. Flicks it handsomely behind square on the leg-side
Navdeep Saini to Pooran, FOUR, Pooran looks in his elements today. It was a slower one on the stumps, Pooran picks it up early, delays his bat swing and smashes it over cover for a boundary

Southee to Miller, FOUR, Miller welcomes Southee with a four. It was a good length delivery on the stumps, Miller wanted to cut it wide of backward point, gets an outside edge and it races fine of third man for a boundray
Southee to Miller, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Miller. It was a slower one on the stumps, Miller picks it up early and powers the pull shot wide of deep mid-wicket for another four

Navdeep Saini to Gayle, FOUR, Gayle greets the new bowler with a boundary. Shortish ball at 139.7kph, Gayle stays back in the crease and pulls it straight of mid-on. He got it almost off the toe end, but that's more than enough to run away for a boundary
Navdeep Saini to Rahul, FOUR, shot! Class written all over it. A short of length ball at 145.1kph, Rahul gets on top of it and punches it superbly through the covers, beating a diving Chahal
Navdeep Saini to Rahul, FOUR, Saini over-corrects. He doles out a half-volley at 146.4kph outside off. Rahul gets forward and plays the lofted off-drive over extra cover
U Yadav to Rahul, FOUR, wow! Those wrists. Full ball on leg - a hit-me delivery and Rahul whips it over mid-wicket
Southee to Agarwal, FOUR, stylish from Mayank Agarwal, whipping a length ball round his front pad. Nice bent front knee there, as he picked it away from off stump to the long leg boundary
Southee to Agarwal, FOUR, if the last one was Agarwal's brilliance, this one is Southee's mediocrity. Strays on leg stump and is glanced fine for four
Chahal to Rahul, FOUR, now he waits on the inevitable short ball and latches onto it. Cut away through the gap at point
Navdeep Saini to Agarwal, FOUR, that's been absolutely lambasted through extra cover. Back of a length outside off, Agarwal slaps it red, leaves a vapour trail enroute to the boundary

Navdeep Saini to Rahul, FOUR, good length ball outside off, tentative footwork from Rahul. But it doesn't cost him. Instead, he benefits. The loose poke results in an outside edge which runs away fine to the third man boundary

Stoinis to Agarwal, FOUR, short of length at the body, Agarwal's eyes aren't on the ball all the way through, but he's controlled the pull nicely behind square. And the timing is brilliant, even though he's checked the shot
Chahal to Agarwal, FOUR, short ball on off stump, which to be fair isn't that short as Agarwal's made it out to be. He collapses his back leg to get low and swats it wide of long-on
Rajpoot to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, 135ks hint of width outside off and Parthiv lashes on it with a fierce cut through point. RCB and Parthiv Patel off the mark in style
Rajpoot to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, 137ks, keep that coming says Parthiv Patel...leans onto his front foot and hammers the pitched up delivery straight back over his skipper
Shami to Kohli, FOUR, adding insult to injury. This one sits up outside off on a good length and Kohli doesn't need any second invitation, holds his pose and crunches it wide of cover-point
Shami to Kohli, FOUR, make that two in a row! This one's slightly wide of extra cover but Kohli has timed the punch-drive to perfection
Shami to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, a gimme on the pads, Parthiv Patel gets inside the line and helps it away to the fine leg fence, Shami's pace takes care of the rest
Rajpoot to de Villiers, FOUR, can't bowl short at 135.2ks to de Villiers, he rocks back and nails the pull over mid-wicket. Couple of bounces and into the fence. RCB will hope this can get AB going

Viljoen to de Villiers, FOUR, that's a freebie from Viljoen! A low full toss at 139.7kph on the pads, de Villiers flicks it fine and the ball reaches the fence in a jiffy. The boundary brings up AB's fifty!
Viljoen to Stoinis, FOUR, full toss and Stoinis has flicked it away through backward square leg. RCB nearing 200!
Viljoen to Stoinis, FOUR, high full toss - just below waist - and sliding down leg. Stoinis helps it on its way to the fine leg fence
Rajpoot to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, one bounce and over the ropes! Parthiv Patel picks the length early, swivels and bullies the pull shot over square leg umpire, fine leg had no chance
Rajpoot to de Villiers, FOUR, 142ks sits up nicely outside off, AB thrashes it with a cross bat swing past the diving left hand of mid-wicket
Shami to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, juicy length delivery outside off, Parthiv had plenty of time and he takes full toll of it, lifts the drive over mid-off with an air of nonchalance
Shami to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, full toss outside off, Parthiv leans back a touch and slices the drive behind point. The height on that seemed a bit touch-and-go but guess the umpire got it right
Shami to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, Parthiv is belting it to all corners. Poor bowling from Shami, gives plenty of width on offer outside off and that's been smashed over cover in a jiffy

Murugan Ashwin to Moeen Ali, FOUR, off the mark with a boundary, although a streaky one. Legbreak outside off, Moeen seeks to drive and feeds a thick outside edge which flies fine past the fielder at short third
Aaron to Nitish Rana, leg byes, FOUR, drifts one on the pads and Nitish Rana fails to put bat on the tickle. The ball brushes the thigh pad and beats the diving keeper to run away to fine leg

Thomas to Nitish Rana, FOUR, uppish, but in the gap. Thomas offers width on this short of length delivery and Nitish Rana doesn't go hard at it. Stays back in the crease and dabs it aerially through the gap between backward point and cover-point. He used the bowler's pace (143.4kph) to good effect

Shreyas Gopal to Karthik, FOUR, cheeky! KKR need a kick on and who better than their skipper. Karthik waits for the leg-break and he opens the bat face at the last second, the ball races past the diving short third man fielder

Shreyas Gopal to Karthik, FOUR, sloppy! Binny has just gifted three runs. Nothing but a nudge to long-on and he came racing in to stop the second, the batsmen were never going to take it, overruns the ball and allows it to trickle into the fence
Shreyas Gopal to Karthik, FOUR, Karthik getting the momentum for KKR. A low dipping full toss outside off, Karthik creams the drive past extra cover and long-off had no chance to get across

Aaron to Karthik, FOUR, finishes his spell with a boundary. But that still doesn't spoil his figures - 4-1-20-2. Aaron stopped and caught his hamstring and then went back to rebowl this final ball. A bit of a niggle might have hampered his line and length - short and outside off, Karthik slaps the cut square and it races off the turf to beat sweeper cover

Unadkat to Brathwaite, FOUR, nicely played. Unadkat deceived Brathwaite with a slower ball, but the latter adjusts well to roll his wrist and flick it fine past the fielder at 45. Good start to the over

Unadkat to Karthik, FOUR, with all the power hitters back in the hut, the onus falls on Karthik to get KKR to a good score. He waits for the slower delivery and back cuts it behind point - bisecting short third man and backward point expertly

Unadkat to Karthik, FOUR, Rahane almost pulls off a stunner. Slower short of length delivery and Karthik takes it on, the pull goes in front of square and Rahane covered a lot of ground from deep mid-wicket, dives full length to his right and gets both hands, but the ball pops out once he hit the surface and rolls into the ad cushions. He might have hurt himself there

Unadkat to Karthik, FOUR, one bounce and over the ropes. Karthik needs to keep going for the final four balls. Unadkat missed the yorker and Karthik was up for it, deep in the crease and whipping it with a lot of bottom hand to cow corner

Thomas to Shubman Gill, FOUR, good shot! Used the bowler's pace and Gill collects his first boundary. A short-and-wide ball at 145.6kph, Gill hops and scythes it behind backward point. No chance for the third man fielder to even get close to it

Thomas to Nitish Rana, FOUR, Nitish Rana gets into an awkward position, but manages to collect a boundary. A short ball that climbs at the batter, but the line was leg-stump. Rana, despite not being in a great position, managed to get a glove on it. Raced away to the fine leg fence
Aaron to Shubman Gill, FOUR, put away! A short-and-wide delivery at 150kph, Gill stands tall in his crease and cuts it superbly behind backward point. Reaches the fence in a jiffy
Riyan Parag to Nitish Rana, FOUR, a poor ball! Riyan Parag darts a rank half-tracker outside off, cut hard wide of backward point. Easily put away
Shreyas Gopal to Narine, FOUR, edged and four! Another away-turner and Narine cut hard from the crease. Gets a fat edge that eludes first slip and runs away to third man for a boundary

Brathwaite to Rahane, FOUR, up and over! Rahane is away and so are the Royals. It was on a fuller length and was wide of off, Rahane plunges forward and lofts it over cover. He gets enough bat on it to clear the in-field and once it lands, it races towards the fence

Prasidh to Rahane, FOUR, clears the in-field with ease. This is fearless cricket from Rahane. It was missing from his game when he was the skipper. It was in the slot for him on a fuller length and he hoicks it over mid-on for another four

Yarra Prithviraj to Riyan Parag, FOUR, he has whipped it away magnificently well. Gee! This man can bat. Yarra Prithviraj misses the yorker, it ends up being in the slot for Riyan Parag and he uses his wrists to smash it wide of long-on
Brathwaite to Riyan Parag, FOUR, thick top-edge on the pull from Parag, loops over the keeper's head and bounces once before crossing the ropes

A Russell to Riyan Parag, FOUR, premeditates this. He walks across the stumps for the scoop. His determination enables him to adjust to the length, which is slightly shorter than what he hopes for, but nevertheless, he's able to paddle it away past short fine leg
A Russell to Shreyas Gopal, FOUR, sizzling drive through extra cover, punishing this overpitched delivery from Russell. RR are still in this while this pair's around

Nitish Rana to Shreyas Gopal, FOUR, short ball outside off, a response to Gopal's charge off the previous ball you'd think. And Gopal's expecting it. He waits on the back foot and slaps it through backward point
Nitish Rana to Shreyas Gopal, FOUR, short ball again, this time much straighter, and so Gopal pulls it hard through square leg for four more

Nitish Rana to Shreyas Gopal, FOUR, this is brilliant from Gopal, again proving his value and ability with the bat. Such a terrific cricket shot. Flighted up outside off, he stretches onto the ball and creams the drive through extra cover. Superb timing to beat long-off
Prasidh to Jofra Archer, FOUR, short of length at the body, Archer looked like he was expecting it. He thumps the pull well in front of square
Narine to Riyan Parag, FOUR, shuffles across to a ball that's straying on leg stump and helps it fine for four. What an over this is turning out to be for RR

Prasidh to Riyan Parag, FOUR, that's raced off the inside edge into the fine leg boundary. Nothing anyone could've done about it. Length ball homing in on off, Parag swings off his feet and sees his luck smiling on him

Prasidh to Jofra Archer, FOUR, flies off the outside edge over short third man! Full ball outside off, Archer swings for the rafters, only just reaching it with the toe-end and slicing it into the boundary

A Russell to Rahane, FOUR, brilliant from Rahane! Class written all over it. It was on a good length and was just wide of off, Rahane waits for it to arrive and opens the face of the bat at the very last moment. He found the gap between backward point and cover fielder to perfection

Yarra Prithviraj to Rahane, FOUR, nothing much wrong with this delivery but Rahane is in magnificent touch now. He identifies the length early, gets in a good position and smashes it wide of deep mid-wicket for a boundary

Yarra Prithviraj to Rahane, FOUR, this is excellent from Rahane. He is giving the treatment to the young man. There was just a little bit of width on this delivery, Rahane opens the face of the bat at the very last moment, made brilliant use of his wrists and guides it wide of backward point for another four

Chawla to Stokes, FOUR, that's edged and four. Stokes needs a little bit of luck to change his fortune. He drives down the wrong line, it clipped his outside edge and it went wide of first slip for a boundary
Yarra Prithviraj to Stokes, FOUR, that's the Stokes we know. He backs away, creates room and thumps this over mid-off for a boundary. No stopping that!

Malinga to Watson, FOUR, missed out on his century by 4 runs in the previous game and here's a boundary two nights later. Short of a length outside off and Watto punches it firmly through the gap at covers. Lewis goes for the chase, puts in a dive near the fence as well but the momentum takes it away to the fence
Malinga to Watson, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Watson. Short ball down the leg side and Watson glances it past the fielder at short fine leg, off to a rocket start

Hardik Pandya to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, and Dwayne Bravo takes full toll of the free-hit. Slower ball from a back of a length, Bravo hangs back, stays leg-side of the ball and throws his bat at it to carve it over short third man
Rahul Chahar to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, Chahar pulls his length back and Bravo has taken advantage of that. Sees it, rocks back and swivels to pull it through the gap between deep mid-wicket and long-on

Malinga to Vijay, FOUR, that wasn't a well timed shot by Vijay will take it. Short ball outside off, slow in place and Vijay cuts it over point. That was in the air and as he played it over the infield, he managed to beat the fielders
Hardik Pandya to Vijay, FOUR, elegance personified! On the pads and Vijay clips it with nonchalance over backward square leg. His best looking shot of the innings so far

Bumrah to Vijay, FOUR, uppishly pulled in front of deep backward square where Krunal Pandya charges in for the catch. Tough to say whether it carried, probably didn't, and because all his efforts were directed at going for the catch, he's not able to save the boundary

Chahar to Rohit, FOUR, Rohit starts off in a stellar fashion. It was full and was curving away from Rohit, he waits for the ball to deviate and guides it wide of cover for a boundary. He doesn't try to hit it too hard. Sweet timing!

Santner to Rohit, FOUR, touch quicker and Santner also gives width outside off, Rohit stays low and plays the square drive really late, the timing was such that the fielder from sweeper couldn't get across to stop that
Dwayne Bravo to Rohit, FOUR, cheeky! Bravo goes short and outside off, Rohit stands up and elevates it above the 'keeper. He just used the pace on the ball and pocketed a boundary
Tahir to Rohit, FOUR, Rohit looks at the base of his bat. A rank long hop and he cue-ends the pull towards deep mid-wicket, Shorey runs around the rope and dives over the ball. Poor effort from him

Tahir to Rohit, FOUR, Shorey again can't get there. Quicker and attacking the stumps, Rohit heaves it to cow corner - right between deep mid-wicket and long-on, Shorey runs to his left this time and can't stop the boundary

Chahar to Pollard, FOUR, first one of the innings for Pollard. Finally gets one right. Wasn't middled though! Short of a length delivery that kept a touch low, KP swung hard at it and got an inside edge that rolled past the man at short fine leg. The fielder in the deep was very square too, hence he couldn't quite get there

Dwayne Bravo to Pollard, FOUR, that's hammered! Right into the slot and the big arms take over. KP gets underneath it and smashes it over the bowler's head. Luckily there was some elevation, else Bravo's head could have been in trouble

Dwayne Bravo to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, that's a short-arm jab. A full toss on off and Pandya's strong bottom hand does all the talking. Short-arm jabs over Pollard who was ducking for cover. Pressure back on Bravo!

Chahar to de Kock, FOUR, 10 off 2 in this over. Chahar has been belted for the first time in powerplay. He is clearly not used to it. And his response will be interesting to see. It was touch fuller of good length, de Kock picks up the length early and drives it like a boss. It beats cover and races to the fence

Chahar to Lewis, FOUR, Lewis has controlled that shot brilliantly and it will fetch him four. It was slower down the leg-side, Lewis picks it up early, waits for it to arrive, gets on top of it and half-pulls it wide of fine leg for a boundary

Chahar to Lewis, FOUR, edged and four! Streaky but Lewis would take it. It was on a good length and was wide of off, Lewis wanted to drive it away from the body. He plays down the wrong line and inside edge takes it wide of stumps and into the fence
Chahar to Rohit, FOUR, four to finish the over. He has placed it brilliantly. It was short and was on the body, Rohit swivels and pulls it wide of short fine for a boundary

Tahir to Lewis, FOUR, and again.. But not as well timed as the previous one. Flighted on a fullish length, Lewis lofts it straight back over Tahir and the ball bounces just inside the rope before beating the long-on fielder

Bhuvneshwar to Rahane, FOUR, pinged off the middle! Rahane starting from where he left off in his previous game in Jaipur. Waits for the length delivery to swing in and presents full face of the bat and massages the drive through extra cover. Sheer timing!!

Shakib to Smith, FOUR, this time he goes much wider of long-on for a boundary. Nice use of the feet which takes him close enough to the ball that he can confidently whip his wrists against the turn. Good start from Smith

S Kaul to Samson, FOUR, just look at the timing and placement on that shot! Making batting look so effortless. Kaul continues to leak boundaries. Goes wide this time around and Samson slices it past the fielder at point. The fielder in the deep sprinted across to his left but couldn't stop it from finding the fence

S Kaul to Samson, FOUR, another sublime shot! Tad short in length and Samson picks it with nonchalance over square leg. Again there was a fielder charging towards his right in the deep but the placement was just so perfect and the dive had no effect in the end result

Khaleel Ahmed to Smith, FOUR, easy pickings! Short ball and down the leg side, around the hip and all Smith had to do is get some bat on it. Glances it very fine and the fielder in the deep was way too square to cut this down

Khaleel Ahmed to Samson, FOUR, stand and deliver! Everyone's admiring the shot including the bowler. Tad short in length and Samson bludgeons it over mid-wicket. Almost went the distance such was the timing

Khaleel Ahmed to Smith, FOUR, 50-run stand up for the third wicket but Samson has done majority of the scoring! Smith had flicked it to fine leg where Kaul slides to stop the ball. When he releases the ball to throw it, the fielder is in contact with the ropes. Nothing going SRH's way, nothing!

Shakib to Samson, FOUR, Samson hits the winning boundary! Treks back and drags the short ball into the gap at cow corner. No fielders in the deep and Rajasthan Royals beat Sunrisers Hyderabad by 7 wickets to spice up the points table
Bhuvneshwar to Rahane, FOUR, gets a full delivery on the stumps, Rahane picks the field change (long-on moved to mid-on for this delivery) and whips it with flair over the ring on the leg-side
Bhuvneshwar to Rahane, FOUR, looks to follow Rahane and spills a half-volley on the pads, Rahane brings his bottom hand into play by whipping it powerfully wide of the fielder at deep square
Khaleel Ahmed to Rahane, FOUR, makes room to open up the off-side, slashes hard and gets lucky with a thick top-edge that flies over short third man
S Kaul to Livingstone, FOUR, short of length around off, Livingstone pulls it gleefully past short fine leg. Nothing ball from Siddarth Kaul
S Kaul to Livingstone, FOUR, back of a length on middle, Livingstone clears the front leg and mows it over mid-on. He's taken a liking to Kaul
Rashid Khan to Livingstone, FOUR, rocks back to this short ball and thumps it through square leg. Rollicking entry into the season from Livingstone

Shakib to Livingstone, FOUR, hammers it down the ground. Brute power from Livingstone, who was nowhere near the pitch of it after stepping out. But the slowness of the surface allowed him to adjust before he brought the sledgehammer down and smashed it

Thomas to Williamson, FOUR, Rajasthan having a torrid time in the field. Aaron now concedes a boundary. Fraction short and outside off, Williamson backs cuts it to third man and Aaron lets it escape right through his legs. That is now 10 runs given away for free
Binny to Manish Pandey, FOUR, overpitched delivery at 124.6kph, Manish Pandey hammers it straight down the ground after walking down the tarck. It went between the umpire and Warner
Shreyas Gopal to Manish Pandey, FOUR, shot! Brilliant use of the crease. It was the quick ball - 113.4kph - Manish Pandey made room and lifted it inside-out over extra cover for a one-bounce four

Aaron to Bhuvneshwar, byes, FOUR, bowls the slower short ball on the stumps, Bhuvi misses on the ramp and a hint of deviation after pitching meant Samson couldn't control the pace despite the dive to his left
Aaron to Rashid Khan, FOUR, very full delivery outside off, Rashid set himself inside the crease and cleared his front leg while doing so, just pumped it over extra cover with disdain
Aaron to Williamson, FOUR, Williamson at his best. Pitched up outside off, no movement and Williamson creams the square drive past the diving cover-point fielder. No chance of stopping that
Shreyas Gopal to Manish Pandey, FOUR, this is a shot of a man in confidence. He picked the wrong 'un that was a tad overpitched and lofted it straight of mid-off, superb way to open your account

Unadkat to Manish Pandey, FOUR, Pandey already looks in his element. Slower short of length delivery and Pandey picked the length so early, short-arm jabs the pull over mid-wicket and it almost went the distance
Thomas to Manish Pandey, FOUR, Pandey hitting through the off-side tells you he is in form. Short and just outside off, Pandey makes his own room and slaps it through the crowded off-side field

Shreyas Gopal to Manish Pandey, FOUR, nicely done. Gopal errs on the shorter side and Pandey threads the gap behind point with a delicate cut shot. He played it late and that enabled him to bisect backward point and short third man

Shreyas Gopal to Manish Pandey, FOUR, Pandey is winning this battle against his state mate. Once again he picks the length so early, swivels deep in the crease and pulls to deep mid-wicket, beating the fielder comfortably to his right

Riyan Parag to Manish Pandey, FOUR, Manish Pandey goes downtown! Riyan Parag slightly overpitches and the Karnataka lad takes full toll of it. Right in the slot and Pandey thumps it over the bowler's head
Riyan Parag to Manish Pandey, FOUR, fifty partnership! Parag over-corrects and bowls this too short, easy pickings for Manish Pandey. Pulled away through mid-wicket for yet another boundary
U Yadav to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan opens his account in style. Just one sighter required for the lefty. Umesh went a tad full, Dhawan shimmied down the track and flayed it over cover-point. Raced away

Washington Sundar to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, positive stroke! He doesn't want the spinner to settle in here. Gives the charge by coming down the track, wasn't anyhwere close to the pitch of the ball, but with a big swing of the bat he smashed it over the bowler's head for a one-bounce four
Washington Sundar to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, back-to-back fours! A quick non-turner wide of off, Shaw stays back in the crease and scythes it hard and wide of backward point

Stoinis to Dhawan, FOUR, ohh! Shikhar, you cheeky, cheeky fellow. He shuffles well wide of off, Stoinis bowls it in his area. And it was on a fuller length, the length and line was ideal for Dhawan to scoop it over short fine for a boundary

Washington Sundar to Pant, FOUR, you cannot bowl short to Pant, you just cannot. Washington Sundar does the mistake and gets belted for a boundary. He picked up the length early crouched low and powers the pull shot wide of deep mid-wicket for a boundary

Navdeep Saini to Ingram, FOUR, belted! This time he connects and boy doesn't he pack a punch. Good length ball outside off, Ingram shuffles across and pumps it straight back over Saini, one bounce and over the ropes
U Yadav to Axar, FOUR, freebie and Axar helps himself to a boundary. Short and around hip height, he swivels and pulls it over short fine. Just used the pace of Umesh to fetch a one bounce four

U Yadav to Axar, FOUR, 16 runs off the over and just what Delhi wanted. Umesh goes for the off-cutter, but he bowls it short and outside off, Axar slaps the punch through extra cover and Dube has no chance running across from sweeper cover

Navdeep Saini to Rutherford, byes, FOUR, high full toss outside off and Rutherford can't put bat on it. Poor Parthiv Patel has no chance as the ball bounces in front of him and races away to the fence. Rutherford asks for a possible no-ball but gets nothing from the umpires. It was around waist high and might have been given on another day

Navdeep Saini to Rutherford, FOUR, edged and four! This is where Saini needs to learn. He bowls a pacy yorker outside off and Rutherford squirts an outside edge past Parthiv Patel. He has to take pace off on this slower surface

Navdeep Saini to Axar, FOUR, these runs will be hurting Bangalore. Saini is just spearing them in and missing the yorkers, another full toss and Axar looks to heave it to the leg-side, the leading edge balloons over short third man

Chahal to Dhawan, FOUR, bad ball and rightly put away by Dhawan. A drag down by Chahal and the line is down leg, Dhawan moves off-side, gets low and helps it on its way with a pull over short fine leg
Chahal to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, now Prithvi Shaw gets into the act. Chahal overpitches, Shaw gets down on a knee and flogs it over mid-on. Clean strike for a one-bounce four. 15 runs off the over!

U Yadav to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, that's a trademark Prithvi Shaw shot! Not a bad ball from Umesh Yadav, he bowled a length delivery around off. Shaw stayed put in his crease and punched it fiercely through point. Got it off the meat of the bat

U Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, cross-seam ball - shortish and wide outside off. Shreyas Iyer, like Shaw, goes for the cut. But, fortunately for him, the ball went through the vacant slip region. The skipper gets off the mark in a streaky manner

Navdeep Saini to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, 50 up for Delhi! A brilliant shot from the skipper. A fullish ball at 140.9kph, Shreyas Iyer stayed in his crease and brought his down at the right time to knock it through the gap between mid-on and mid-wicket. Superb timing

U Yadav to Dhawan, FOUR, hammered! Fuller ball at 143.6kph, Dhawan dances down the track and biffs it down the ground - finding the gap between the umpire and Shreyas Iyer. There's no one to stop that
Navdeep Saini to Dhawan, FOUR, another short of length delivery, it was at comfortable hip-height for Dhawan who gets in a good position and dispatches it wide of deep square leg for a boundary
Ishant to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, swings one way the ball goes completely in the opposite direction. Parthiv wanted to hack to the leg-side but the thick outside edge flies over and wide of Pant

Ishant to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, much more like it. That is his strength. Anything slightly full and outside off, Parthiv just frees his arms and lofts it straight back over the bowler, one bounce and over the rope

Mishra to Stoinis, FOUR, chants of 'RCB, RCB' as soon as Stoinis thumps this one down the ground. Reaches out for the tossed up delivery and lofts it straight over the bowler's head for a clean boundary

Ishant to Gurkeerat Singh, FOUR, boundary to start proceedings in the final phase of the match. Positive intent by Gurkeerat Singh. Eyes the deep square leg fence and drags the short ball away nicely. The fielder inside the circle was a touch too square and the fielder in the deep was very fine, right into the gap and that shall be four runs

Ishant to Gurkeerat Singh, FOUR, fortune favours the brave, they say. Back of a length delivery around off, Gurkeerat is a touch early as he swings across the line but the top-edge is enough to fetch him four more, with the fielder inside the circle at third man, this was bound to happen
Lamichhane to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, Lamichhane is welcomed with a boundary to the attack. The googly lands outside leg and Parthiv swings it away over square leg, just bounces inside the rope
Lamichhane to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, he's just toyed with the bowler. The fielder was moved squarer after the first boundary but this time Parthiv goes straighter with his whip, another one bounce four

Lamichhane to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, this is the best of the lot. Googly around leg-stump, Parthiv flicks it against the spin to deep mid-wicket. He played it all along the ground and still managed to beat the fielder

Rabada to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, geez! That is some shot. Pitched up outside off, Parthiv doesn't move his feet much but just drives through the line, the weight going back and the hands moving towards the ball. Nobody moved in the field as the ball rocketed past mid-off

Rabada to Kohli, FOUR, Kohli joins in. It was only a matter of time. This is a top shot. Good length ball around off, Kohli drives on the rise and over Parthiv at the other end. He almost cleaned him up

Ishant to Kohli, FOUR, this is what pressure does - a fumble from Rabada and he concedes three extra runs to Kohli - on a good length and at the stumps, Kohli nudged it in front of mid-on and charged across for a quick single - so did Rabada and he took his eyes off the ball, slipped underneath and rolled away to the fence

Rabada to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, cracking shot, change of pace from Rabada, it was the slower ball, but it was well wide of off, Parthiv leant forward and cracked the drive wide of mid-off, no need to run for those

Barinder to Shubman Gill, FOUR, brilliant start for the young Shubman Gill and KKR. It was on a fuller length and was on the stumps, Shubman Gill uses his wrists to perfection and flicks it wide of mid-wicket for a boundary. Outfield is lighting quick!

Barinder to Shubman Gill, FOUR, wow! This man, whatta talent. Nothing wrong with the delivery, it was on a length and around off, Shubman Gill jumps in the crease a touch, waits for it to arrive and punches it in the most amazing fashion for a boundary through cover

Bumrah to Shubman Gill, FOUR, lovely, but that was a bad misfield from the man at cover - on a good length and well outside off, Shubman leant into the drive and found cover - who let the ball go through

Rahul Chahar to A Russell, FOUR, was it a chance? Lewis charged forward, nearly got down, dived forward and got a hand - but the ball was always dropping in front of him - can't get his body behind either and concedes a boundary
Malinga to Shubman Gill, FOUR, drilled, length ball outside off and Shubman drilled it back at the bowler - was a chance but Malinga had little time to react, raced away across the fast outfield
Malinga to Shubman Gill, FOUR, too full and too straight from Malinga, on Shubman's pads and his neat little flick is good to get past the diving short fine fielder

Malinga to A Russell, FOUR, slapped, on a good length and well outside off, Russell threw his bat at that, off the toe-end and races past third man - who was inside the ring. Even Malinga is leaking runs

Hardik Pandya to A Russell, FOUR, cheeky and four, banged in short and wide as Russell was backing away - he waits on the ball and then ramps it over short third man, almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes

Bumrah to Karthik, FOUR, slower ball at 118.7kph, but Karthik picked that. It was shorter in length and the skipper had ample time to pick his spot. Stayed back and pummelled the pull over mid-wicket for a one-bounce four

Bumrah to A Russell, FOUR, 145.2kph, in-slanting short of length delivery, Russell moves leg-side and pulls hard. Didn't quite get it off the middle, but that's the power of this man. Races away to the deep mid-wicket fence in a jiffy
Malinga to A Russell, FOUR, 131.2kph, full and wide of off, Malinga misses his yorker though. Loads of width and Russell got down on a knee to batter it through the covers

Malinga to A Russell, FOUR, ah! You gotta feel for the bowler here. A yorker length ball wide of off and Russell threw the kitchen sink at it. Gets a big under edge that hits the ground and lobs over the keeper's head

Krunal Pandya to Chris Lynn, FOUR, Chris Lynn finally dispatches one against Krunal Pandya. It was a very full delivery and was on the stumps, Chris Lynn backs away and squeezes the drive wide of cover for a boundary
Krunal Pandya to Chris Lynn, FOUR, enough bat on it to clear the man at short fine. Chris Lynn goes down on his knees on that delivery on the stumps and slog sweeps it over short fine for a boundary
Bumrah to Chris Lynn, FOUR, Chris Lynn swings and swings hard at it. He wanted to drive it through cover, it hits the inside half of the blade and goes wide of square leg for a boundary

Malinga to Shubman Gill, FOUR, errs in line this time and Shubman Gill won't spare him. He gets in a good position and times his nudge to perfection. The outfield at Eden is a highway and it will run away for a boundary through fine leg

Malinga to Chris Lynn, FOUR, four to finish the over. And partnership between the pair is 50 now. It was a back of a length delivery around off, Chris Lynn waits for it to arrive and tonks it really hard over mid-off for a boundary
Rahul Chahar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, makes room, creates the room for himself and smashes it wide of mid-off for a boundary
Krunal Pandya to Chris Lynn, FOUR, he is hitting it really well. Again, moves away, creates room and clobbers it wide of long-off. Pollard ran to his left but fails to get there
Barinder to Chris Lynn, FOUR, he's in some mood tonight - tad too full and well wide of off, Lynn gets underneath it and then scoops it over extra-cover, one bounce and over the ropes
Barinder to Chris Lynn, FOUR, hammered, he's having a ball tonight, length ball at the stumps, Lynn clears his left leg and shovels it wide of long-on, no need to run for those
Warrier to Rohit, FOUR, Rohit gets off the mark with a boundary! Opens his bat-face at the last moment and steers this away-swinging length ball wide of the slip fielder. Neatly done

Warrier to Rohit, FOUR, nine runs off the opening over! A harmless short ball on leg-stump line, rises up to the hip and that's easy pickings for the Mumbai captain. Rohit plays a one-legged pull shot over backward square leg for a one-bounce four
Narine to Rohit, FOUR, once again, Rohit steps out of his crease, this time he manages to get under it and club it over wide mid-on for a boundary
Narine to Pollard, FOUR, this is the battle to watch out for. Off-break drifts on the legs and Pollard picks it away effortlessly in front of square on the leg-side, just bounced inside the rope

Gurney to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, wide full toss outside off and it's been sliced over cover-point. What a knock this is proving to be. If KKR had Russell, MI got Pandya. Two of the cleanest strikers of the cricket ball playing this match

Narine to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, full in length by Narina and Hardik Pandya hacks it into the gap at deep mid-wicket. The ball is just sailing all over the park, the fielders are going to have a neck-ache by the end of this innings
Chawla to Hardik Pandya, byes, FOUR, fires this one at 120ks around off and beats both the batsman and the wicket-keeper. Frustration creeping in and that delivery by Chawla says it all
Chawla to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, floated outside off and Hardik has chipped it over covers for four runs, runs are leaking as Pandya brothers are having some fun out in the middle

Chawla to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, hammered! Things going worse for Chawla who has now conceded 48 runs. Another floated delivery outside off and Hardik slams it through the gap at covers. Hardik's looking unstoppable

Narine to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, Hardik is in some pain but he's keeping the scoreboard ticking. Smacking 'em all over! Goes down on his knee and bludgeons it right over the bowler's head for a boundary
Gurney to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, into his 90s is Hardik! Full in length outside off and Hardik chips it over covers for four more. Amazing display of batting by Pandya

Gurney to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, just can't bowl straight to Suryakumar. The slower delivery drifts with the round the wicket angle, flicked away with a lot of bottom hand in front of square, beating the fielder in the deep comfortably
Gurney to Lewis, FOUR, full delivery and Lewis picked the bones out of that. It was in the slot and Lewis lofted it through the line ovr extra cover, couple of bounces and into the rope

A Russell to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, sloppy from Chawla. Russell will not be a happy man. It was a brilliant over until this misfield. Back of a length outside off, Suryakumar steers it to third man and Chawla is all over the place with his dive, the ball just escapes past him
Chawla to Pollard, FOUR, googly but on the shorter length, Pollard does not go hell for leather, slides on the back foot and crunches it square on the off-side, no chance for a diving sweeper cover

Khaleel Ahmed to Gayle, FOUR, Gayle opens his account with a boundary. That was no where close to the middle of his bat though, it came off the cue end. A length delivery outside off, Gayle goes hard at the first ball he faces and as a courtesy of the power on that shot gets a four through square third man, that was in the air for a while but well over the fielder inside the circle

Bhuvneshwar to Rahul, FOUR, quite an edgy start for the Kings. Rahul goes for an expensive drive against an outswinger and gets a thick outside edge. The ball flies over Guptill at wide slip and races away to the fence. Both batsmen have scored a boundaries but they haven't been convincing ones
Khaleel Ahmed to Pooran, FOUR, smashed! This is an excellent shot. On a length and on the stumps, Pooran uses a straight bat and tonks it straight down the ground. It rockets to the fence

Khaleel Ahmed to Pooran, FOUR, another boundary from Pooran. He is putting on a show here for Punjab. It was a slower one and was wide of off, Pooran goes down on his knees and sweeps it through fine leg for a boundary. Great connection!
Rashid Khan to Miller, FOUR, freebie and Miller puts it away. Need to make this into a big over now. Long hop and Miller had ample time to pick his spot, rocked back and pulled it in front of square
Bhuvneshwar to Rahul, FOUR, knuckle ball and Rahul smokes it over extra cover. He made room and generated enough power to take it over Williamson, the ball bounced just inside the rope
Khaleel Ahmed to Simran Singh, FOUR, slower delivery combined with width, Simran flays it behind point and bisected the fielders expertly
Sandeep Sharma to Agarwal, FOUR, deft touch! On the pads and Agarwal clips it past the fielder at short fine leg. The fielder in the deep was very square in order to cut this down

Sandeep Sharma to Rahul, FOUR, all about class! Down on his knee early and picks the slower delivery over fine leg for a boundary. Was the slower delivery and Rahul played the lap shot to perfecion. Almost got a six as the ball hit the cushions on a boundary

Abhishek Sharma to Agarwal, FOUR, Rashid lost in the lights there. And he has allowed it to go for a boundary. Agarwal rocks back and thumps it straight to sweeper cover. Rashid should have stopped it on the bounce but instead he lets it go and gifts a boundary to Kings

Sandeep Sharma to Rahul, FOUR, Rahul is flowing like a river. He is timing the ball so very well. But the required rate demands more out of this. It was a slower one on the stumps, Rahul flicks it handsomely, beats fine leg and it races to the fence

Arshdeep Singh to Warner, FOUR, erratic and Warner puts it away this time. Arshdeep strayed on the pads once more with this pacy inswinger, the southpaw just had to get bat on it and he tickled it past the keeper. Fine leg was quite squarer and had no chance

Arshdeep Singh to Warner, FOUR, this is poor bowling from Arshdeep after a good start. Once again errs in line, feeds it down leg and Warner takes full toll of this inswinger. Fine is up in the ring and this is clipped fine enough. All too easy

Murugan Ashwin to Manish Pandey, FOUR, delicate hands from Pandey. Ashwin pulls his length and feeds him with width outside off, Pandey goes deep in his crease and opens his bat face at the last moment to place it in the gap past point. The timing is flawless and the sweeper in the deep had no chance

Shami to Warner, FOUR, fifty for Warner. It's most likely his last game for the season and he wants to finish on a high. Shorter and wobbled away just outside off, Warner waited deep and slashed at it, thick outside edge runs away to the third man fence. SRH dug-out up on their feet and Warner acknowledges them with a raise of the bat

Mujeeb to Warner, FOUR, There's the trademark switch-hit from Warner. Flighted full just outside off, Warner changes his stance and lifts it over short third man. He was itching to play this shot for a while, does so now..

Arshdeep Singh to Warner, FOUR, well, the plan was good from Arshdeep, but the execution part went wrong. Swerving in, tried for the yorker but missed by a few inches. Ends up as a low full toss on the pads for Warner, who gets across and flicks it past Gayle at short fine leg. Cricket can be cruel sometimes, ain't it?

Arshdeep Singh to Manish Pandey, FOUR, this is poor from the youngster. Nah, nah, not where you bowl with fine leg inside the ring. Went for the bouncer, but didn't quite hit his target. Pandey gets on top of it and pulls it over short fine leg for a boundary

Mujeeb to Williamson, FOUR, what has Gayle done there? He's kicked that ball away to the boundary. Went for the chase from short third man and ends up kicking it away to the fence. Williamson went hard at this one as the thick outside edge flew over the fielders at short third and backward point

Arshdeep Singh to Abhishek Sharma, FOUR, that's a crispy drive by Abhishek Sharma! An overpitched delivery outside off and the southpaw creams it through extra cover. Miller in the deep sprinted across and although he put in a dive, he couldn't quite stop the ball, four runs for the young batsman

Arshdeep Singh to Saha, FOUR, heaved over mid-wicket! Looked ungainly from Saha but he's managed to clear the infield with ease. Was a length ball, picked from outside off and lobbed with a heave across the line

Arshdeep Singh to Saha, byes, FOUR, bonus runs! It's an IPL debut for Simran Singh and this won't do much to his confidence, that's for sure. Was a slower ball from Arshdeep and Saha wanted to hoick across the line. Got beaten by the lack of pace and it went on the bounce to Simran Singh who just couldn't cover the line as it sneaked past him to the fence. Don't want to be gifting easy runs to the opposition, not in such high-pressure games
Mujeeb to Warner, FOUR, Warner is having fun! Slower and fuller, he just shuffles a bit and slog sweeps merrily over backward square leg. Clean strike and it races away to the fence

Mujeeb to Warner, FOUR, this is superb batting! He's toying with the field, Warner. Makes a bit of room to the loopy off break and goes with the turn on this chip over extra cover. Another clean connection and the boundaries continue to rain here in Hyderabad

Mujeeb to Saha, FOUR, fastest fifty partnership in IPL 2019! SRH are on rampage here! Saha joins in the fun with a lovely paddle sweep, the line was too straight from Mujeeb and it was helped away quite fine. Well wide of short fine leg who could do nothing
Shami to Saha, FOUR, sublime from Saha! He's looking in great touch tonight, isn't he? Too full from Shami and it's been drop kicked over wide mid-on. Supple stuff and easily over the infield

Ashwin to Manish Pandey, FOUR, superb shot! Pandey is in some form and this shot is a reflection of it. Ashwin went wide of the crease to cut off room but Pandey backed away a touch to drive this inside out through extra cover. Bisected the deep fielders well

Aaron to de Villiers, FOUR, de Villiers is off the mark with a boundary. Streaky but he'll take it. Length delivery that gained some extra bounce, ABD flashes his bat and ends up getting a thick outside edge that beats short third man. Aaron can't believe his luck, got to feel for him

Aaron to de Villiers, FOUR, one bounce and over the ropes. 23 have come off the opening over. Went fuller, aimed at the stumps and de Villiers made room. Cleared his front leg and blasts it over cow corner. The fielder in the deep gave up the chase..
Shreyas Gopal to Kohli, FOUR, oh my word! He's hammered it past mid-off. What a hit. Gopal went quicker and fired it outside off, Kohli gets under it and drills it with ferocity down the ground
Riyan Parag to Gurkeerat Singh, FOUR, what happened there? Pushed through flatter down leg, Mann sinks low and is a bit early into the shot. Gets a top-edge which balloons away to the fine leg fence

Unadkat to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, he's been pushed down the order but Patel is off and running. Slower delivery from Unadkat, reared up a touch and Patel was through the pull early. Fat top-edge loops over short fine leg and trickles away to the boundary
Thomas to Negi, FOUR, edged and four! Handy boundary for Negi and RCB. Thomas bombarded it short, hustles Negi for pace as he hooks. Top-edge is found and it sails over Samson

U Yadav to Samson, FOUR, poor ball! The line is too straight, ends up bowling the length ball on the pads and that's easy pickings for any batter. Samson helps it on its way with a flick through the gap between short fine and backward square leg

Navdeep Saini to Livingstone, FOUR, skiddy and pacy back of a length delivery at 152.4kph, Livingstone sees that coming. Clears his front leg and heaves it hard and over mid-wicket. Couple of bounces and into the fence
Khejroliya to Samson, FOUR, edged and four! Away-angler at 136.4kph, Samson throws the kitchen sink and gets a thick outside edge that runs away through the gap between the keeper and short third man
Mishra to Raina, FOUR, just over Morris. Lands the wrong 'un outside leg, Raina is down on his knee to play the sweep, waits for the ball to turn across and helps it over a leaping Morris

J Suchith to Raina, FOUR, not where he intended but Raina will take the final result. He went down to play the slog sweep, but dragged it off the inner half of the bat to cow corner - bisecting deep mid-wicket and long-on

J Suchith to Raina, FOUR, fifty for Raina. It is his 50th fifty in all of T20 cricket. He gets there with a fabulous shot. Charges down the wicket, reached out for the delivery and pumped it over Suchith, couple of bounces and over the rope
Axar to Jadeja, FOUR, charges down and Axar makes him reach out by firing it outside off, Jadeja still goes through with the big hit and the outside edge flies away fine, beating Pant to his left

Chris Morris to Dhoni, FOUR, finds the gap this time. Not a lot wrong with this delivery, it was a slower one and was on the stumps. Dhoni picks it up early, swivels and pulls it wide of fine leg for a boundray. Sweet connection! First boundary for MS in this innings, this might get him going!

Chris Morris to Jadeja, FOUR, he is playing a cameo here, is Jaddu. It was an off-cutter, there was just a little bit room. Jadeja waits for it to arrive, opens the face of the blade at the last moment and guides it wide of short third man for a boundary. Exemplary placement!
Boult to Dhoni, FOUR, you cannot bowl short with fine leg up in the circle. Dhoni knows where the fielders are and he pulls it over fine leg. The connection was good enough and it runs for a boundary

Chris Morris to Dhoni, FOUR, not where Dhoni wanted it to go but he will take it with both hands at this stage of the innings. It was on a fuller length and was attacking the stumps, Dhoni swings his willow hard. He gets a thick inside edge and it beats short fine for a boundary

Chris Morris to Rayudu, FOUR, he doesn't want to get his eye in, does Rayudu. It was in the slot for Rayudu and he smashes it over deep mid-wicket. Not timed as well as he would have liked. So, it didn't go over the ropes but will fetch him a boundary

Boult to Dhoni, FOUR, check for a spark on the bat! Wow that was hit hard! Hard is an understatement of the highest order. It was a yorker on the stumps. Dhoni was standing deep in the crease, he gets under it and pumps it straight down the ground. It rockets to the fence!
Chris Morris to du Plessis, FOUR, low full-toss on leg-stump, easy pickings, just a deflection away towards the fine leg fence for four - CSK's first boundary comes after 26 balls
Chris Morris to Raina, FOUR, very full, very wide, 141.6km/h, Raina reaches out and opens the face, slices it away through the third man region for four
Axar to Raina, FOUR, skids through low, a tad short, Raina gets low and carves it away through the gap between cover point and backward point for four - bisected perfectly. Surgical precision
Axar to Raina, FOUR, fired on the leg-stump, Raina gets on his knee and plays the fall-over Kanhai sweep to the fine leg fence for four
J Suchith to Raina, FOUR, tossed up very full, in the slot, Raina reaches out and whip-drives it between extra cover and long-off for four
Chris Morris to Raina, FOUR, stand and deliver. Morris helped him with the perfect length, Raina cleared his front leg and thumped it straight back over Morris. He didn't even bother to run

Chris Morris to du Plessis, FOUR, hit-me delivery and du Plessis does not miss out. Slow, short and down leg, du Plessis swivels and helps it along the way to fine leg. Mishra was square and well in front of the rope, he had no chance of stopping that
Chahar to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, misses his length and misses his line too. It ends up being a half-volley on the pads, Prithvi Shaw flicks it wide of fine leg for a boundary
Chahar to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, down the leg-side and Shreyas Iyer clips it fine of fine leg for a boundary. Nice way to get off the mark!

Dwayne Bravo to Mishra, FOUR, rare boundary for Delhi. Loosener from Bravo, drifting it on the pads, Mishra shuffles across and whips it off his legs behind square. Splits the gap between deep square leg and fine leg to perfection
Chahar to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, width available on this delivery, Shreyas Iyer makes full use of the room and punches it wide of deep backward point for a boundary

Harbhajan to Dhawan, FOUR, finds the gap again. He has taken a liking to Bhajji. It was full and was wide of off, Dhawan plunges forward and creams it wide of cover. The placement was good as it beats the deep cover fielder into the fence
Chahar to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, short of length delivery close to off, Iyer arches back and ramps it over short third man. This is superb from Iyer who's got off to a flier
Harbhajan to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, short ball outside off, dispatched by Iyer who hasn't put a foot wrong so far. Camps back and cuts it through point. Harbhajan shakes his head in disappointment
Tahir to Pant, FOUR, Tahir overpitches outside off and Pant drills him through extra cover. That was fiercely struck, went to the boundary in a hurry
Dwayne Bravo to Axar, FOUR, squeezes out a wide yorker past backward point. That's superbly done from Axar Patel, first to reach out and then to guide it with an open bat-face

Bhuvneshwar to Rohit, FOUR, that's a horrible start for Thampi in this year's IPL. He gifts a boundary to Rohit who won't mind this at all. He opened the face of the bat for a single, Thampi was casual in getting down at third man. It goes through him for a boundary

Bhuvneshwar to Rohit, FOUR, when you can hit on the up in that manner than deduce it's a belter of a wicket to bat on. Rohit charges forward, transforms the length into a fuller one and just eases it through cover. The timing was stellar and it raced off the bat and reached the fence in some micro seconds!

Khaleel Ahmed to Rohit, FOUR, how easy does he make it look. Trademark of a class batsman! It was on a good length and was angling away from Rohit who leans into it and flays into the drive wide of cover like a boss. It beats the cover fielder and canters to the fence

Khaleel Ahmed to Rohit, FOUR, tell you what this is a batsman's paradise! Just a hint of room for Rohit, it was a slower one too. Rohit waits for it to arrive, adjusts his bat-swing brilliantly and guides it wide of backward point. This outfield = National highway and third man had no realistic chance of stopping that

Basil Thampi to de Kock, FOUR, muscled over mid-wicket and de Kock manages to find the gap. Didn't time it as he would've liked as it kicked off rapidly off the deck. de Kock got it high on the bat, enough to beat long-on

Basil Thampi to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, a boundary to cap off the over. 16 off it. Short and hint of width provided, Hardik exploits it by riding the bounce and spanks it crisply through extra cover. No long-off and Hardik collects four

Basil Thampi to de Kock, FOUR, attempted yorker length delivery, errs on the fuller side, de Kock backs away into the on-side and gets low to slice it away behind point for four - his 4th fifty for the Mumbai Indians this season, and he raises the bat to the dressing room. A good recovery from him after a slow start. Can he finish off with a flourish?
Rashid Khan to de Kock, FOUR, fired down leg, de Kock is late on the expansive fine sweep, gets some bat on it though, and gets it away to the fine leg fence for four

Khaleel Ahmed to Rohit, FOUR, another boundary to finish the over. Rohit is off to a flyer here. It was on a short of length and was wide of off, Rohit powers the pull shot wide of mid-on, Nabi puts in a valiant effort there by chasing it down. He puts in a dive too but his foot was touching the ropes when ball was in his contact and that will be signalled as a boundary

Bhuvneshwar to de Kock, FOUR, Bhuvneshwar strays on the pads and de Kock punishes. All de Kock had to do was to beat the short fine fiedler which he did with ease with the flick shot, and it raced to the fence

Bhuvneshwar to de Kock, FOUR, de Kock joins the party too. It was slower one a short of length, de Kock swivels, gets in a terrific posiition and thumps it wide of deep backward square leg for a boundary.

Khaleel Ahmed to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, shot mahn! Suryakumar Yadav has this unique way of pulling the ball. It was around the hip-height, Suryakumar Yadav swivels and powers the pull shot wide of short fine leg for a boundary
Khaleel Ahmed to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, class written all over it! It was on a good length and was wide of off, Suryakumar Yadav drives it like a boss, places it well and it runs along the carpet

Nabi to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, he has bisected the gap between long on and cow corner to perfection! It was an offie on the stumps, Suryakumar Yadav uses his bottom hand to good effect and whips it with the spin to the on-side for another boundary. He has started really well!

Basil Thampi to de Kock, FOUR, he has placed it to perfection! It was on a good length and was wide of off, de Kock opens the face of the bat at the very last moment and guides it in between backward point and third man for a four! His third of the innings!
Barinder to Saha, FOUR, whatta start! A wide half-volley, Saha leans into the square drive and caresses it behind point and wide of third man for four
Malinga to Guptill, FOUR, slings away with the arm, back of a length, a whippy cut attempted, toe-ended away wide of the 'keeper to the third man fence for four. Fortuitous.

Rahul Chahar to Manish Pandey, FOUR, the boundary releases all the pressure Chahar built up. Poor bit of work from Anukul Roy. It was on the shorter side and Pandey pulled it to deep square leg, Roy was late to spot the ball and by the time he did and put in the dive, it was too late

Krunal Pandya to Manish Pandey, FOUR, consecutive boundaries for Pandey. Once again the length is wrong - on the shorter side, Pandey makes room and slaps the cut in front of square, no chance for Sran coming across from sweeper cover
Malinga to Manish Pandey, FOUR, Manish Pandey responds in style; keeps his head still and smashes the straight drive past the non-striker, that was timed to perfection and no-one's gonna stop that
Bumrah to Nabi, FOUR, sits on the back foot this time, expects the length to be short and swivels into his pull in a flash. Placed it in the gap behind square and that's Nabi's first boundary

Malinga to Nabi, FOUR, slice of luck for Nabi and SRH. Malinga executes another yorker outside off and Nabi swung himself (quite literally) into that, managed to get a thick inside edge which flies past QDK to his left

Bumrah to Manish Pandey, FOUR, a rare bad ball from Bumrah and Manish Pandey takes full toll of it. On seeing Pandey shuffle forward, Bumrah loses his length and feeds a full toss at the body, Pandey knows where the gap is and he swats it for a one-bounce boundary over square leg

Bumrah to Manish Pandey, FOUR, Manish Pandey thinks it's a no-ball for height, but wasn't to be. A fair call from the umpire as it was clearly below waist. Full toss again, Pandey clears his front leg and hammers it in the gap between deep mid-wicket and deep square

Barinder to Saha, FOUR, short and wide, a slash at that, and just wide of a diving Rahul Chahar at backward point for four. Saha is away. The confidence reflects in his conviction of the shots and his footwork.
Barinder to Saha, FOUR, short of length delivery wide outside off, Saha clears his front-leg and drags it from outside off, clubs it away flat and wide of mid-off to the wide long-on fence for four
Bumrah to Saha, FOUR, fuller length delivery on middle, whipped away from the crease past mid-on to the long-on fence for four. Fantastic shot.

Bumrah to Saha, FOUR, short one outside off, pulled away with very little timing to deep mid-wicket for four as Pollard chases and tries to kick it back, but ends up being carried over the advertising board by the momentum. Hopefully, he hasn't hurt himself

Malinga to Manish Pandey, FOUR, confidence, I tell you is a very big thing in sport. First ball and Pandey has put it away for a boundary. Not a bad delivery - short of length angled at the body, Pandey elevated himself and pulled it past the diving mid-wicket fielder. The timing was spot on

Malinga to Manish Pandey, FOUR, this is poor bowling. Even the experienced Malinga feeling the heat. Sprays it down leg and all Pandey had to do was place it in the gap, tickled fine and the fielder at 45 had no chance

Rahul Chahar to Manish Pandey, FOUR, Pandey keeps dealing in boundaries. He waits for the leg-break to arrive and dabs it past Rohit at slip, placed it fine enough and beat Bumrah behind square on the off-side

Sam Curran to A Russell, FOUR, bangs the slower delivery into the surface, Russell waits and waits some more to play the flat-batted hit, strikes it square on the off-side and leaves sweeper with no chance

Ashwin to Shubman Gill, FOUR, another quick skidder outside off, sliced away to the third man boundary for four, bringing up another fifty for Gill as an opener - further accentuating the fact that bringing him in down low was always a bad idea
Shami to A Russell, FOUR, short and wide, this is poor stuff, Russell has a lot of time to rock back and slap it away through deep extra cover for four. Races away...
Tye to Shubman Gill, FOUR, short one at the body, and that's a torso-twisting whippull towards the deep midwicket boundary for four

Sam Curran to Karthik, FOUR, oh, it's a harsh game, cricket. An inch-perfect yorker length delivery outside off, angling in, Karthik did try to open the face and run it down, but gets a thin outside edge that just about beats the diving Pooran and runs away to the fence

Sam Curran to Karthik, FOUR, that's that, then! KKR live to fight another day, and as do KXIP, who need far too many results to go their way. An in-angler from round the wicket, and Karthik sways it away fine towards the long leg for four, to hand KKR a second consecutive win!

Shami to Shubman Gill, FOUR, that ball had no right to go to the fence. It was just touched by Shubman Gill on the whip but the timing was extraordinary and it raced off his blade. It beats the man at mid-on and canters to the fence

Arshdeep Singh to Chris Lynn, FOUR, this one surely hit the sweet spot. And it has reached the fence like a tracer-bullet! It was a slower one on a fuller length, Chris Lynn delays his bat swing and powers it wide of long-off for a boundary

Arshdeep Singh to Chris Lynn, FOUR, gee! That has been smashed. Chris Lynn looks in his elements today, ominous signs for Kings. It was on a fuller length, was in the slot for Chris Lynn. He gets under it and pumps it straight down the ground
Arshdeep Singh to Chris Lynn, FOUR, flurry of boundaries for Lynn. And KKR are off to a sensational start. It was a short of length on the pads, Chris Lynn pulls it wide of the keeper for a boundary
Ashwin to Chris Lynn, FOUR, edged and four! Lynn won't mind it. Ashwin starts with a carrom ball, Lynn makes room and swings through the line, the outside edge runs away fine to the third man fence

Tye to Shubman Gill, FOUR, poor start from Tye. He needs to be better than that. Back of a length and on the hips, Gill does nothing fancy, whips it with a strong bottom hand backward of square, no chance for the fielder in the deep

Tye to Chris Lynn, FOUR, yes, it is his night. Now an inside edge escapes past the stumps to reach the fence. Good length ball and Lynn backs away to swing across the line, the edge evades leg-stump and races to fine leg

Murugan Ashwin to Uthappa, FOUR, oh no! Rahul has let one go right through his legs. Drifting on the legs and Uthappa whips it powerfully to wide long-on, Rahul gets there but allows it to escape past him. That should get Uthappa going

Murugan Ashwin to Uthappa, FOUR, that is the Uthappa of old. Put the bowler under pressure and then toy with him. Ashwin went short with his length after being hit over his head, Uthappa waits and back cuts it behind point - bisecting backward point and short third man expertly

Sam Curran to Shubman Gill, FOUR, top shot! Nothing much wrong with the delivery. Cutter on a length, Gill stands tall and drives on the rise past mid-off, the timing he generated on the slower ball was just amazing
Warrier to Gayle, FOUR, way too full. Gayle opens up his bat face, laying into the width to slice it away through point. That's more the Chris ..

Warrier to Gayle, FOUR, 141.5kph. Another juicy overcook. Gayle has a big stride to it, making the half volley all the more fuller and holds all his shape to drill it through the covers. There may be three men there, but he's still finding the angles perfectly

Warrier to Mandeep, FOUR, smart cricket from Mandeep Singh! Sits deep inside for the slower ball and steers it with the finest of touches at the last minute in the gap between the keeper and short third
A Russell to Sam Curran, FOUR, full and in the zone outside off, Curran stands still and spanks the drive through extra cover, timing coupled with a hint of power on that
Narine to Sam Curran, FOUR, boundary to finish the over. It was on a fuller length and was wide of off, Sam Curran reaches for it and smokes it wide of long-on for a four. It raced off the bat!

A Russell to Sam Curran, FOUR, he is putting up a show, is Sam Curran! He gets cheeky this time, moves to the off-side, opens up the leg-side for himself and paddles it over short fine to collect a boundary

A Russell to Sam Curran, FOUR, now, he flaunts his power! Gee! He hit that hard. He is a short man but sure he has some muscles. It was in the slot, Sam Curran clears his leg, keeps his shape and pumps it down the ground for a boundary
Gurney to Sam Curran, FOUR, Curran-show at the PCA continues! Gurney misses the yorker this time, Sam Curran gets under it, makes room, keeps shape and powers it wide of long-off! Amazing bat speed!

Gurney to Sam Curran, FOUR, maiden IPL fifty for Curran. He punches the air in delight! We have found another 360 degree player! Whatta cameo this has been! He moves to the off-side, takes it on the full and paddles it fine of fine leg for another four

Warrier to Agarwal, FOUR, dishes out width outside off, and it's just too short as well. There may be a gully and a backward point, but Agarwal lines up really well, opening up and delaying his cut to bisect those two

Gurney to Sam Curran, FOUR, Sam Curran ends the innings in style. This has been the innings of highest quality from the southpaw. And he has powered his team to a formidable total! It was a full-toss on the stumps, Sam Curran shuffles to the off-side and smashes it wide of deep fine leg to end the innings with a four!

Warrier to Pooran, FOUR, 140.7kph. There's the crunch. Warrier gets a little too greedy, going short without a lot of pace and Pooran's ready for it, bringing out a short arm jab to smack it into cow corner
A Russell to Pooran, FOUR, 130kph, a long hop, and a lucky edge. Pooran tries swivelling on a pull intended through mid-wicket, but ends up with a toe-end, running through the slips - the empty slips
Chawla to Pooran, FOUR, another googly taken apart. Pooran is reading them perfectly, going really deep to this one and then timing his cut really well behind point
Chawla to Agarwal, FOUR, lures Agarwal with flight and bam! Agarwal had enough time to launch it and he absolutely thrashes it over the bowler

Aaron to Dhawan, leg byes, FOUR, help-yourself-with-a-boundary ball, although Dhawan didn't get any bat on it, still it's a boundary for DC. Did he try the slower ball? Could be.. however the line was poor. Slanted it down leg, Dhawan misses the glance and it goes off the pads, beats Samson and runs away to the fine leg fence
Aaron to Pant, FOUR, still short, and worse, wide too. Pant throws his hands out quickly to slice it away with a lot of power over backward point. Okay, he's officially in a hurry
Thomas to Dhawan, FOUR, width to Dhawan? Really? Is that a deathwish? It was short, plenty of width outside off. Dhawan reaches for it and slaps it up and over point

Thomas to Dhawan, FOUR, "Rewind and show me that once again," gushes Ian Bishop on air. Dhawan oozing class here. Innocous fuller length delivery outside off, Dhawan stretches across and times it off the meat. Didn't try to over-hit it and focussed more on placement and timing
Thomas to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, that's a loosener from Thomas. He's not finished it well as Shaw tucks in a four. Angled it down leg, fine was inside the ring and Shaw glances it past the man at 45

Ish Sodhi to Pant, FOUR, pressure-releasing over from Sodhi. After a great opening over where he picked up two wickets for no run, he leaks 17 in his second. Drags it too short, Pant was quick to pick the length as he pivots back and bashes it through extra cover. This outfield is very quick and there's no stopping those
Axar to Gowtham, FOUR, short and down the leg-side, Gowtham rocks back and powers it fine of fine leg for a boundary. Good connection!

Ishant to Riyan Parag, FOUR, Ishant is really struggling here. He is bowling all over the pitch. It was on a short of length and was down the leg-side, Riyan Parag holds his shape nicely and powers the pull shot wide of fine leg for a boundary

Ishant to Riyan Parag, FOUR, it is getting from bad to worse for Ishant. And finally, something to cheer for the Royals fans. It was a fuller length delivery on the stumps, Riyan Parag gets underneath it and pumps it wide of cover for a boundary

Ishant to Livingstone, FOUR, just short and wide of mid-on, Livingstone came charging down the track, doesn't get hold of the slog - off the toe-end and the ball lobbed in the air, to the left of mid-on who puts in a valiant dive, but can't reach it

Ishant to Lomror, FOUR, nicely done by Lomror, his first runs of #IPL2019 - a friendly back of a length delivery on his hips, he gets inside the line and clips it behind square on the on-side, past the diving short fine and races away to the fence

Ishant to Lomror, FOUR, cheeky and four, on a good length and in that channel outside off, Lomror leans across, opens the face of the bat at the last moment, uses the pace on the ball and runs it past the keeper

Mishra to Riyan Parag, FOUR, clubbed, tossed up well outside off, Parag bends down low, gets close to the ball and then swipes it wide of mid-wicket, bisected the gap between the two fielders in the deep perfectly

K Paul to Riyan Parag, FOUR, smashed, length ball outside off and Parag has drilled it. It was the slower ball and Parag spotted it - gets forward and drivs it back past the bowler, no chance for the man at mid-off

Bhuvneshwar to Kohli, FOUR, looks like go big or go home for RCB. That seems to be the philosophy for them. Kohli gets into business rightaway. Flashes his bat at this away-swinger, the bat face turns at the point of contact but he manages to clear the in-field on the off-side. Opens his account with a boundary

Khaleel Ahmed to Kohli, FOUR, drilled ferociously past mid-off. That should dent Ahmed's confidence. Pitches it up outside off, it's a tasty half-volley and Kohli gets into the act, hammering it past mid-off

Basil Thampi to Gurkeerat Singh, FOUR, well controlled pull shot from Gurkeerat Singh. And it will fetch him four. It was on a short of length and was around tummy height, Gurkeerat Singh gets in a good position and places the pull shot incredibly well. It beats fine leg for a boundary. He is complimenting Gurkeerat Singh pretty well!

Bhuvneshwar to Gurkeerat Singh, FOUR, fantastic touch-play from Gurkeerat Singh! This is the best I have seen him bat in the IPL. It was a good length delivery and there was a hint of room, Gurkeerat gets in a fabulous position and just eases it past backward point for a boundary. Stellar timing!
Rashid Khan to Hetmyer, FOUR, another boundary from Hetmyer. He is putting up a show here. It was a flighted delivery and was wide of off, Hetmyer lofts it wide of long-off for a boundary

Basil Thampi to Gurkeerat Singh, FOUR, one shot ball too many from Basil Thampi! This one lacked venom! It was around hip-height, Gurkeerat Singh gets in good position and he powers it wide of deep mid-wicket for a boundary!

Basil Thampi to Gurkeerat Singh, FOUR, Gurkeerat is playing a gem here! He isn't trying to hit too hard just relying on placement. And he is placing them really well. It was a slower one on a short of length, Gurkeerat Singh picks it up early, delays the bat swing and pulls it wide of fine leg for a boundary

Shankar to Gurkeerat Singh, FOUR, Gurkeerat welcomes Shankar with a boundary! It was a slower one on the stumps, Gurkeerat Singh whips it in between deep square leg and deep mid-wicket. He found the gap to perfection! The placement was the key their!

Shankar to Gurkeerat Singh, FOUR, fifty for Gurkeerat! This has been a sensational knock from the lad from Punjab! He raises his bat in delight! He waits for this delivery to arrive and places it wide of backward point. Again, placement was best aspect of the shot

Shankar to Gurkeerat Singh, FOUR, pulls and pulls well. Bhuvi gets a bad bounce at deep mid-wicket. And that will result in another boundary for Gurkeerat Singh. It is getting from bad to worse for SRH!
Nabi to U Yadav, FOUR, terrible delivery from Nabi! It was full and there was lot of room, Yadav chases it and pumps it wide of backward point for a boundary

Nabi to U Yadav, FOUR, boundary for Yadav. And he has finished off this match! RCB win by 4 wickets! Hugs in the RCB camp.
