Finally, something for RCB fans to cheer who have been truly incredible in this season. Kohli with a child-like jump in the dressing room! He has a wide smile on his face! Nabi was guilty of providing the width again and it was in the slot again, Yadav throws his bat at it and powers it wide of backward point for another boundary
Khaleel Ahmed to Hetmyer, FOUR, stamping of authority from Hetmyer. Ahmed gets predictable, bangs it short and it sits up wonderfully for Hetmyer. Rocks back and pummels it wide of mid-on

Khaleel Ahmed to Hetmyer, FOUR, follows violence with finesse. Nothing much wrong with the delivery from Ahmed, saw the batsman move to leg so kept it wider of off. But Hetmyer expertly flails his hands and uses the pace on offer to cream it in the gap at cover

Khaleel Ahmed to Gurkeerat Singh, FOUR, that's a quality stroke from Mann. Hint of width and he latches onto it in a flash. Riding the bounce and punching it with all grace and flair - threading the gap between cover-point and point

Nabi to Hetmyer, FOUR, spoils it, does Hetmyer. It was turning out to be a good over from Nabi. Goes for the quicker ball and messes it up, veering it down leg and Hetmyer glances it past the man at 45
Navdeep Saini to Guptill, FOUR, too short and too straight from Saini, on Guptill's pads and it's neatly flicked away towards fine leg, beats CdG - running across from long leg
Washington Sundar to Williamson, FOUR, lovely, a rare loose ball from Sundar, dragged short and wide of off, cracked square behind point and the ball runs away to the ropes
U Yadav to Williamson, FOUR, 134.7kph. He's right up tall to a delivery that's not really short, but then executes a perfect pick-up-swish through mid-wicket. Lots, lots of bottom hand
Navdeep Saini to Williamson, FOUR, goes funky. And gets edgy. Another usual walk across and then a sit to sweep, but the inside half of the bat gets it fine, really fine

Navdeep Saini to Nabi, FOUR, 147.8kph. And dispatched at almost double the speed. Nabi - cleverly - stays deep in the crease, manages to get under the full length and drill it to bisect extra cover and mid-on

U Yadav to Williamson, FOUR, oh it gets worse - a full toss now and wide outside off too - for Williamson to once again lift it over mid-off. Not quite off the middle, but even the mistime will do when you just aren't bowling to any plan
U Yadav to Williamson, FOUR, 143.2kph. Okay, well it CAN get worse. Williamson makes room now for a change, has his hands freed up to the wide full toss and slices it over extra cover
Navdeep Saini to Saha, FOUR, lovely, 19 from the over, fraction overpitched and wide of off, Saha throws his hands at it and drills the drive over cover, few bounces and over the ropes
U Yadav to Bhuvneshwar, FOUR, make it 28. And Umesh's gifted away the momentum, although with a really good ball here. Bumper, Bhuvi gets under pulls desperately, top-edges, over short fine leg. 175

Chahal to Saha, FOUR, top-edge and four, tossed up just outside off, Saha went down low on the sweep, didn't get on top of the bounce, but he knew there was no one in the deep, bounces a couple of times and rolls over the ropes
Chahal to Saha, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries, Chahal dragged his length back a fraction, Saha is quick to rock back and beats mid-wicket with the pull, pressure straightaway on Chahal
Chahal to Saha, FOUR, make it a hat-trick of boundaries, he's toying with Chahal, comes down the track, gets close to the ball and does enough to clear the leaping fielder at mid-off
Navdeep Saini to Guptill, FOUR, cracking shot, short of a length and just outside off, Guptill made room for himself and clattered it over cover, no one moved and that brings up SRH's 50
Khejroliya to Manish Pandey, FOUR, crisp, length ball and well outside off, Manish leans into the drive, plays it on the up and past the fielder at mid-off, nice way to get going

Harpreet Brar to Watson, FOUR, that should make him feel better. Brar errs in his line here - just outside off and Watson is quick to latch on, he moves back in the crease and caresses the punch through cover-point. All timing!

Shami to du Plessis, FOUR, gift from Shami and du Plessis accepts it gleefully. Good length ball on the pads, he leans forward and clips it neatly past the square leg umpire, the quick outfield does the rest

Murugan Ashwin to du Plessis, FOUR, du Plessis puts his dancing shoes on and lifts it over the bowler's head. Such clean hitting, holds his shape and earns a boundary. The key was he picked the length and met the pitch at the right time, then his fast hands taking over to execute the shot. It bounces just inside the ad cushions

Murugan Ashwin to du Plessis, FOUR, oh, that's sloppy from KL Rahul. School-boyish error as he fails to get his body behind the line and lets it through his legs. du Plessis shaved it towards long-on, KL Rahul moves across to his right and perhaps took his eyes off the ball completely. Don't even look at your skipper, KL..

Tye to Raina, FOUR, appaling from Tye. Splays it on leg-stump, Raina is clever as he moves inside the line and tucks it fine. Harpreet from fine leg was slightly squarer and despite his dive, the ball runs away to the fence

Murugan Ashwin to Raina, FOUR, bisects the gap on this occasion. Raina reaches his fifty, up goes the bat as well. Similar delivery from Ashwin, getting too predictable as Raina lines up and smashes it in the gap between deep mid-wicket and long-on
Murugan Ashwin to du Plessis, FOUR, he's changing his gears now. Runs down the track, takes this floater on the full and drills it straight down the ground

Tye to du Plessis, FOUR, bullied through extra cover. The intentions are clear from du Plessis. Knuckle ball, on a fuller length outside off. du Plessis sets a solid base and crunches it wide of long-off

Tye to du Plessis, FOUR, back-to-back fours. It's been raining boundaries in the last few overs. Tye digs it short, sits up emphatically for du Plessis as he nails the pull in front of square on the leg-side

Sam Curran to du Plessis, FOUR, shot! Just a mere push and the ball races away. Full and angled across off, du Plessis eases with a forward extension past the bowler and the timing takes care of the rest

Shami to du Plessis, FOUR, the pressure is released with a low full toss. Shami went for the yorker and did not get it right, du Plessis flicks it past the mid-wicket fielder and once it passes the inner ring, there is no stopping that
Sam Curran to du Plessis, FOUR, lovely shot! Good use of the feet. He left the crease and did not allow Curran to change his length, right in the slot and he creams the drive straight down the ground
Ashwin to Raina, FOUR, fraction short and Raina is quick to pounce on that, he rocks back and nails the pull in front of square, couple of bounces and into the fence
Ashwin to Raina, FOUR, neatly done! He waits and the ball was outside off, dabs it past Gayle at slip and the chasing fielder had no chance. Raced away..

Tye to du Plessis, FOUR, fabulous shot! Good length ball outside off, du Plessis stays his ground and lofts it handsomely over extra cover, just an extension of the arms and the connection was exquisite
Tye to Raina, FOUR, poor bowling. Offers width outside off and Raina places it expertly, he waits for the ball to arrive and steers it behind point - between short third man and backward point
Harbhajan to Gayle, FOUR, well this is no Chepauk .. Bhajji tries spinning one across from a leg-line, alas, it goes straight on for an easy flick right through square leg
Harbhajan to Agarwal, FOUR, flat one angled into middle and leg, Agarwal gets low and swats a sweep away to backward square leg for four
Dwayne Bravo to Pooran, FOUR, half-volley right in the slot, Pooran doesn't need to get forward just leans into it with the powerful forearms and thrashes it through deep extra cover for four
Jadeja to Pooran, FOUR, another one dropped short, Pooran gets his weight onto the backfoot and smokes the pull to the long-on fence for four
Tahir to Pooran, byes, FOUR, yorker length delivery, Pooran tries squeezing it away, nutmegs Dhoni to the long stop fence for four byes

Tahir to Sam Curran, FOUR, all over! Bittersweet win for KXIP at home to finish off the season, as they manage to avoid the wooden spoon - that was to be RCB's destiny this time. It's a very full ball that's swatted over mid-on to the boundary for four to seal a consolation win for KXIP
Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, the yorker goes wrong. Just an inch too full, just a degree too leg-sided and Rahul has easy pickings, flicking it perfectly behind square
Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, 115.9kph, it's a larget buffet. Chahar tries overcorrecting, goes short, on the hips and swats don't really get any easier - whacking it once again into fine leg

Harbhajan to Rahul, FOUR, full toss. Rahul's cleared out his front leg, laying into it with a fierce cover drive. Bravo - at mid-off - is right there, but he charges at it and his old back is really slow in bending down in time, misfields
Harbhajan to Rahul, FOUR, and now Harbhajan overcompensates with the drag down. Rahul rocks behind, pumping the pull over mid-wicket
Harbhajan to Rahul, FOUR, oops. Harbhajan and no-Chepauk is a turning into a nightmare. H continues to keep it short, and Rahul continues heaving them mercilessly into cow corner
Dwayne Bravo to Rahul, leg byes, FOUR, hmmm, slips into the thighs, and the thighs are good enough to nudge them away fine, certainly helps his cause when fine leg's inside the ring
Tahir to Gayle, FOUR, wide full toss. Gayle, thankfully, holds his shape, quietly relying on placing it through the cover gap. And the gap's good enough

Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, walking swat, utterly outrageous. Rahul - clearly with no respect - walks down the pitch and then rocks onto the front foot to pull it so damn neatly to bisect deep mid-wicket and long-on
Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, more grace, and rubbed in with more CSK misery. A very short arm drill, leaning back and generating a lot of power to pump it just in front of long-off's ropes

Bumrah to Uthappa, FOUR, needed, much needed. KKR will take them any which way. Backed away and created the room to get the bat swing, carved behind point and the pace Bumrah is enough to beat the third man fielder
Malinga to Chris Lynn, FOUR, smacked. Malinga's slower ball provides width for Lynn, frees his arms and throws his bat. Crashes it in the gap at cover. That sped off the bat in a jiffy

Bumrah to Chris Lynn, no ball, FOUR, slower ball goes all awry for Bumrah. Ends up as a waist-high full toss outside off, Lynn was making room and connects with the slash. Sending it over point and free-hit beckons for Lynn
Narine to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, off-break. Suryakumar too continues staying on the back foot, whipping it with a lot more intent, under short mid-wicket's dive
Narine to Rohit, FOUR, so very beautiful. And trust Rohit to come up with them time and again -- this time courtesy just a punch, splitting the two covers

Narine to Rohit, FOUR, drags it down, and fittingly as KKR's campaign has gone in 2019, Narine too bowls out with a long hop. Rohit goes back in, makes it look a lot worse and pummels it wide of long-on
Gurney to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, another overcook. This time Suryakumar's good enough to ensure he doesn't need a fielding blunder, does it with an on-drive, through a straighter long-on
Gurney to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, it's into the fun zone. Gurney gives out another short one well down leg and Surya heaves it further. A tickle would've done here, but no, he'll do a carnage
Prasidh to Rohit, FOUR, woah. Rohit > elegance. It's too full anyways and Sharma lays in with a stride getting to it in drilling a lofted drill straight into long-on
A Russell to Rohit, FOUR, delicate! Banged in on a back of a length, good bounce, Rohit gets low, steers it away fine towards the third man fence for four

A Russell to de Kock, FOUR, he persists with the short ball ploy, the slower one this time, de Kock shapes up for the pull, delays it beautifully, and clubs it over the in-field to the deep square leg boundary for four. QdK with an epiphany here!
Warrier to Rohit, FOUR, short and wide, Rohit flat-bats a pull over a frustrated, crimson Russell, to the long-on fence for four
Prasidh to Rohit, FOUR, short and wide, poor bowling, and a gorgeous punch in front of deep point for four

Prasidh to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, short one at the body, Suryakumar Yadav hasn't opened up his stance, finds himself in an awkward position, knows he'll be late on it, and goes for a blind hook - gets bat on it and deflects it away towards fine leg for four
Narine to Rohit, FOUR, fired down leg, Rohit steps across, laps it away with a fine sweep towards fine leg for four
Prasidh to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, fuller length delivery outside off, whipped away, dragging it from outside the off-stump with a Laxman-esque flourish for four
A Russell to Rohit, FOUR, short, not fast enough - @138.9km/h but a lot of pace lost on this dry wicket. Pulled away off the frontfoot for four through cow corner

Krunal Pandya to du Plessis, FOUR, just over a leaping Bumrah! Fortune for du Plessis who went hard on seeing the width but was never in control. Ended up slicing it towards short third man and Bumrah despite a great leap could barely get his fingertips on it. Phew!
Malinga to Rayudu, FOUR, nicely done by Rayudu, he pre-empted that Malinga was going to bowl full, bent down low, uses the pace on the ball and flicks it fine, no chance for the fielder at long leg

Hardik Pandya to Rayudu, FOUR, nicely played by Rayudu - he's taking the lead here, mid-off was inside the ring and Rayudu chanced his arm - length ball outside off, he didn't time it all that well, sliced it high and cleared the fielder in the ring, one bounce and over the ropes

Bumrah to Rayudu, FOUR, mind-reader Rayudu. Expected the slower delivery from Bumrah, so walks across his stumps and gets into a great position to smack the pull over square leg. Picked his spot and executed it to perfection
Jayant Yadav to Raina, FOUR, this time Raina gets the boundary! On the pads and he swings merrily over backward square leg. Lovely bat swing and it races away to the fence
Bumrah to Watson, FOUR, some respite for CSK as they get a much-needed boundary. Was a bit too straight from Bumrah and Watson helped it wide of short fine leg with a neat glance
Bumrah to Watson, FOUR, crunched away! Fractionally short from Bumrah and it's the trademark pull from Watson. Rocks back quickly and dispatches it over mid-wicket. Clean hit

Krunal Pandya to Vijay, FOUR, streaky runs but they all count! Flattish and turning away from around off, Vijay was squared up all ends up on the flick. Thick edge and it beat backward point, all the way to the fence

Krunal Pandya to Vijay, FOUR, this is superb batting from Vijay, attacking spin with positive strokeplay. Shuffles a bit early across the stumps and slog sweeps it cleanly over short fine leg. One bounce to the fence
Rahul Chahar to Vijay, FOUR, crisply struck by Vijay, got forward to this half volley and creamed the drive through extra cover. Pollard in the deep made an attempt but couldn't quite succeed

Chahar to Rohit, FOUR, glorious way to kick-start your innings. Outswinger from Chahar, too short and swinging away outside off. Rohit stands tall, hands following and creams it stylishly through extra cover. MI's captain is off and running

Chahar to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, Suryakumar flashes and flashes hard, nearly picked out the fielder at short third man but it's just out of reach of Tahir. It was short and plenty of width for the taking, Suryakumar obliged and ended up outside-edging it. Luckily, gets away as it just about beats Tahir's dive to his left and runs away to the boundary

Harbhajan to de Kock, FOUR, oh! This was fraught with danger. The quicker delivery from Harbhajan, gunning at the stumps and de Kock went deep for the cut. Manages to get his bat down in time and scythes it past backward point. That was a close call
Tahir to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, there's some helicopter in this one, piling on the low full toss and whipping it into cow corner
Tahir to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, more helicopter. A more-standing one here, staying up on the back foot and the power imparted on it is enough to whack it once again wide of long-on

Jadeja to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, lovely batting from Suryakumar Yadav. Jadeja gets slightly short, and he pounces on it. Right back in the crease, waits for the ball and dabs it past slip. Jadeja livid with himself, swings his hand wildly in frustration
Tahir to Ishan Kishan, 4 wides, that's just bonus runs. Down the leg-side, turning away further and even Dhoni fails to get across in time. Desperate effort from Harbhajan to save the boundary

Tahir to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, should I, shouldn't I.. while Harbhajan deliberates on the dive, the ball goes through. Another deft touch from Suryakumar, dabbing this flat leg-break fine of backward point

Jadeja to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, the outside edge flies between keeper and slip. Absolutely flew off the bat. Length ball ripping away from off, draws Yadav forward in defence and the turn is prodigious. Watson is slow to react, and when he does, it doesn't stick in the left hand
Tahir to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, drifting down leg, Hardik Pandya picks the line up quickly, gets down low and paddles it on its way
Chahar to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, walks across, gets underneath this back of a length delivery and scoops it fine. He's been different class tonight

Chahar to de Kock, FOUR, wonderful adjustment from de Kock. It was length outside off, de Kock sits low, rolls his wrists and laps it to the fine leg fence. Knew the fielder was squarer, so placed it beautifully

Chahar to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, loses radar. Yea, the overestimation of his swing - starting on the middle-stump line and expecting it to go across. But alas, it goes straight on, and Suryakumar makes it worse with his shuffle, tickling it off his thighs fine

Chahar to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, dropped. Yadav tries a cross-batted whack, but the ball sticks in, just doesn't come on. And Vijay - the mid-on guy - is a touch late in reacting, but does decently towards the end to stretch out, only for the ball to burst through the palms

Harbhajan to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, ah, ugly. Really, really bad-looking. Kishan - desperate to breach this pressure he's put on himself - runs down the pitch, hoicks big, hoping to go somewhere over cow corner, but only ends up with a thick leading edge, just past Watson leaping up at slip and managing to trickle under Bravo's diving attempts in the deep
Dwayne Bravo to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, 131.6kph, continues dishing out full pace and Yadav obliges with the elegant-est of cover drives, on the up,through both the dives of extra cover and mid-off

Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan is off and running. That is a super shot. Not much wrong with the delivery. Good length just outside off, Dhawan drives with minimal footwork and pierces the gap wide of cover. The timing was exquisite

Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, FOUR, overcorrects his line and is made to pay. On a length on leg-stump, Dhawan leans into the flick and strikes it square past the umpire, no chance for fine leg to get across and stop that
Basil Thampi to Munro, FOUR, jumps out, looks to slam it away into the on-side and gets a fine inside edge for the ball to whizz past the keeper to his right for a four. Streaky but much needed
Basil Thampi to Pant, FOUR, fuller and slower, thumped down the ground! That was blasted past the bowler. Basil Thampi had no chance. Have SRH made a mistake by giving it to Thampi?
Basil Thampi to Pant, FOUR, DC and Pant are bossing this chase now! KW has played his cards wrong tonight. Length ball on the pads and has been whipped away past the short fine leg fielder for a four

Khaleel Ahmed to K Paul, FOUR, Paul has done it! DC have pulled it off. They are through to qualifier 2. Short ball, Paul got hold of it and pulled it away, the ball evaded Shankar in the deep. A cliff-hanger and DC have held their nerves despite huffing and puffing a lot towards the end
Khaleel Ahmed to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, normal pace delivery and Khaleel is put away over mid-on. Back of a length and Shaw gets into a good position and pumps it over the fielder inside the ring

Khaleel Ahmed to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, this is even better. Khaleel has to correct his length quickly, short of length and Shaw had the pace to work with, rocks back and nails the pull in front of square, one bounce and over the ropes

Khaleel Ahmed to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, woah! That is smoked to the fence. Good length ball outside off, Shaw brings that high backlift into play and crunches the square drive past cover-point, no one moved in the off-side ring

Nabi to Dhawan, FOUR, that is a good shot. Nabi is disappointed but there was not much he could do. Drifting in from round the wicket, Dhawan fetches the reverse sweep from leg-stump and places it past the backward point fielder

Bhuvneshwar to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, Prithvi Shaw is looking in sublime touch. Just leans forward, presents full face of the bat and pings the push drive off the middle past the diving fielder at extra cover

Bhuvneshwar to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, this is sheer stand-and-deliver stuff! Gets a length ball outside off with a hint of extra bounce, Prithvi Shaw doesn't care one bit and thumps it over the mid-off fielder in a jiffy

Rashid Khan to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, picks the legbreak and pumps the drive over cover, excellent batting this from Prithvi Shaw. Making great use of the fielding restrictions and looking to pierce gaps as often

Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, don't want to jinx it but Shreyas Iyer is one of the best batters of spin bowling. Sees a hint of width on this legbreak and jumps on it in a flash, opens the bat face and nails the cut behind point

Boult to Saha, FOUR, beautifully struck! Hint of width from Boult and Saha lays into the back foot punch, square through the off-side. Finds the gap at point and it scooted away to the fence. Elegant shot!

Axar to Manish Pandey, FOUR, cracking shot, fraction too short and wide of off, Manish makes room, waits on it and then slices the cut past the reach of Munro at backward point - much needed boundary for the Sunrisers

Rutherford to Williamson, FOUR, cracking shot, a half-tracker from Rutherford, short and wide of off, Williamson makes room and clatters it wide of cover - the man in the deep is very square and has no chance

Ishant to Williamson, FOUR, poor cricket from Boult - he was never going to get to the ball, not with the angle he was running into - dived forward and then let the ball go past him, concedes a boundary. The slower ball from Ishant, rolled away fingers across the seam, Williamson picked it and then swung it behind square on the on-side for a boundary

Ishant to Nabi, FOUR, beautifully played, nice way to get your innings underway, back of a length and well wide of off, Nabi waited on it, used Ishant's pace and then chopped it late - behind square on the off-side and into the ropes

Axar to Nabi, FOUR, that's two delicate shots from Nabi for two boundaries. He waits for the ball to turn away, opens the bat face and runs it past short third man. The pace of Axar takes care of the rest

K Paul to Nabi, FOUR, smashed! Stand and deliver from Nabi. He literally stood there and admired the shot. Similar delivery to the previous one, but this time Nabi does not miss, he hammers it straight back over Paul and the ball almost went the distance

K Paul to Shankar, FOUR, very well played. Another short delivery and almost near the badge, Shankar is quickly into position and pulls it with a nice wrist roll backward of square leg. No chance for Dhawan in the deep

Boult to Shankar, FOUR, lovely shot! Shankar has used the angle of Boult to superb effect. Slanted across the right hander outside off, Shankar shuffles across and lofts it handsomely over extra cover, one bounce and over the ropes

Ishant to Guptill, FOUR, poor ball and Guptill punishes it! Sprayed on the pads, fuller as well and he just had to pick his spot. Watches it onto the bat and glances it very fine, beating short fine leg with ease

Ishant to Manish Pandey, FOUR, misfield allows a boundary! Ishant can't even complain because it's his skipper who is the culprit at mid-off. Pandey thumped the drive really well and Iyer wanted to attack the ball to have a shy at the bowler's end. Eventually missed it completely

Ishant to Manish Pandey, FOUR, top edge but it's nearly gone all the way! Cons of having pace! Good fiery bumper from Ishant and Pandey is clearly late on the pull. But he knew that fine leg was up and hence, there wasn't much risk on the stroke. Eventually fetches a boundary
K Paul to Watson, FOUR, short slower ball and Watson has smashed that over mid-wicket, Keemo Paul has been off colour unfortunately for DC on the big day
Axar to Rayudu, FOUR, round the wicket, angles it in, Rayudu was already setting up for this - dances down the track and lofts it inside out towards the deep extra cover fence for four
Boult to Dhoni, FOUR, the crowd go berserk! A poor delivery on the torso, on the leg-side, Dhoni just gives it some topspin and swivels on it to deflect it away to fine leg for four
K Paul to Rayudu, FOUR, erring in line, angling into the pads once again, tickled away fine towards the long leg fence for four
K Paul to Rayudu, FOUR, short and wide outside off, Rayudu carves it away with a massive flourish between short third man and backward point for four

Ishant to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR leg-byes, CSK are through to their 8th final in 10 editions they have played! A short one that's angling down leg, Dwayne Bravo whips it away off the backfoot (off the pads in fact) past a desperately-diving Pant towards the fine leg fence for four - and there are hugs in the changing room already. CSK are through to another final - surprise, surprise!
Boult to du Plessis, FOUR, too short perhaps and Faf powers it through mid-wicket with a crisp pull off the bottom hand, picked the length early and got onto his back foot in a hurry
Axar to du Plessis, FOUR, stands outside leg stump and thumps this in the gap between backward point and cover. Made room early and cuts the quicker delivery in the gap on the off-side

Ishant to du Plessis, FOUR, pulled away and Faf is looking to mae the most of the final over of the powerplay, back of a length delivery on the stumps, du Plessis waits and pulls behind square, the man in the deep is very square and it goes to his right
Ishant to du Plessis, FOUR, guided away uppishly and just wide of Munro at short third man, short of length again from Ishant, this time it's slightly outside off stump, Faf guides and gets four more
Ishant to du Plessis, FOUR, hat-trick of boundaries, short delivery on the stumps, du Plessis rocks back and pulls over mid-wicket, easy boundary, CSK well ahead now
Mishra to du Plessis, FOUR, oh excellent sweep shot, got low early with no one at deep square leg and absolutely smashed this shot from the middle of the bat to find the fence
K Paul to Watson, FOUR, low full toss on the leg stump, easily ball, Watson glances it fine and beats short fine leg

K Paul to du Plessis, FOUR, this is very unlucky for the bowler. He's actually beaten Faf with a back of a length delivery, inside edge onto pad, goes past Pant, Munro gives chase from short third, dives and pulls it back, probably he was in touch with the rope for a moment and it's been signalled four
Mishra to Watson, FOUR, nicely paddled away, no fine leg, so he was aware of the field and was in position early to help it on its way
Chahar to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, smashed! This is the length that Shaw enjoys a lot. Shorter from Chahar and it's been dispatched with a nonchalant pull through square leg
SN Thakur to Dhawan, FOUR, beautifully timed! Thakur searches for swing and in the process, overcooks this outside off. Stroked sweetly down the ground and beats the diving mid-off fielder with ease

SN Thakur to Dhawan, FOUR, this is a stunning shot! Wow! Another fuller one and this time, Dhawan was merely pushing it straight back past the bowler. Such amazing timing and the ball just rocketed away. Signs that this is a much better surface than the eliminator
SN Thakur to Dhawan, FOUR, pressure telling on Thakur and Dhawan is ruthless. Harmless short ball that's pulled away through square leg. 'Gabbar' seizing the momentum straightaway

Dwayne Bravo to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, cracking shot! Tad fuller around off, Iyer brings his bat down in a sweet flow and crunches his drive past the fielder at cover. There was a fielder in the deep to hunt it down but the timing was just about right

Tahir to Rutherford, leg byes, FOUR, CSK take a review against Rutherford! Imran Tahir looked excited but the impact looks just outside off, or probably umpire's call. Nope, wait. The impact was in line but the ball was bouncing over the stumps by some distance. Rutherford was trying to play a drive but got beaten for spin. The ball clips his pads and races away to the fence thereafter. The onfield call stays
Tahir to Pant, FOUR, controlled aggression from Rishabh Pant! Sits on one knee, picks the legbreak and sweeps it in the gap between deep square and deep mid-wicket
Chahar to Mishra, FOUR, gets across and picks Chahar off his pads over fine leg, clean swing of the bat and timed it to perfection
Jadeja to Ishant, FOUR, no spin on this, Ishant uses his long levers and muscles it to the left of long-on, Faf tried his best to get behind the ball but Ishant, perhaps, timed it too well
Chahar to Munro, FOUR, hammered! Clear intent from Munro as he gives the charge and forces this length ball past the bowler. Well wide of mid-on and it speeds away

Harbhajan to Munro, FOUR, 'hit me' ball from Harbhajan and Munro pummels it through the off-side. Slower, shorter and wider as well, gift for any batsman and it gets the treatment. Slapped through point

Harbhajan to Munro, FOUR, crashed away by Munro! Got a bit of width on this turning off break, the length allowed him to wait and he slapped it through cover-point. Sweeper is behind square on the off-side and had no chance
Harbhajan to Munro, FOUR, over the infield! Fuller this time and Munro wisely goes over cover. With the spin and the loft is clean. This stroke should give him confidence

Tahir to Pant, FOUR, there's never a dull moment when Pant is out there. Premeditates yet again and scoops the floated delivery towards fine leg. The fielder was no where close to cut this down, neither inside the circle nor outside it
McClenaghan to du Plessis, FOUR, that's overpitched and it's gone to the fence in a flash. Du Plessis leans across, right on top of it, before drilling it through the covers
Krunal Pandya to Watson, FOUR, way too full from Krunal, a half-volley really which Watson pulverizes through the covers. That's too easy, something MI can ill afford

Rahul Chahar to Watson, FOUR, oh Bumrah! Rahul Chahar will be livid with him. Bowled so well and he's let this go right through him for four. Would have been a single maximum. But Chahar's got to blame himself in the first place for bowling a freebie down the leg-side, Watto sweeps and gets it through short fine leg

Malinga to Watson, FOUR, 138.8kph. Keeps dishing out pace, keeps it wide outside off and Watson's edge will do just as well. There may have been a short third man, but the slice is such that it's very fine

Malinga to Watson, FOUR, oh, better. Malinga - with more pace - and with more in the slot. Wide, outside off, Watson moves away, sits down on a knee and carves it away into third man, almost all the way too

Malinga to Watson, FOUR, it's on loop. 15.3, 15.4 and 15.5, each one predictable perfectly -- all pace dealt out outside off, lots of width too and this time Watson picks out deep extra cover with that usual muscular slash

Bumrah to Jadeja, byes, FOUR, oh Quinton .. you may have heard of cups dropped, this is probably the cup misfielded. It was quick, really quick, and going well over the cut, and de Kock, in his quest to throw it quicker and stop the bye, ends up not collecting at all
Krunal Pandya to du Plessis, FOUR, steps outside the leg stump again, Krunal follows him again but he errs with his length this time. It's too full. Du Plessis lofts it over mid-on

Krunal Pandya to du Plessis, FOUR, completely unsettling the left-armer here. Backing away, making him change the lines. Krunal doesn't follow him this time, so instead, he gets cut through backward point
Malinga to Watson, FOUR, wasn't in control, Watson. Overpitched outside off, he went so hard on the drive that the poise was lost and his bat-face opened up - slicing it uppishly past backward point

Malinga to Watson, FOUR, finds the gap between backward point and short third man. These are mostly off-cutters from Malinga, which explains why third man is up. But this one has enough width on it, so Watson can manufacture the pace with his hands as he cuts

McClenaghan to Watson, FOUR, wowww! What an off-drive, the strike-rate is up and running again. Very brave from Ro to have mid-off in at this stage, but Watto made full use of this juicy full ball and powered it to the fence

Harbhajan to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, terrific catch from RJ - well, nearly, only he could have got to the ball, ran in a long way from deep mid-wicket, dived across to his left, went one-handed and got to the ball, but it kept going away and bounced past his outstretched hands. Nicely played by Suryakumar, knew that mid-wicket was wide and clipped it high and wide of that fielder - any other fielder and it was an easy boundary

Harbhajan to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, that has been muscled - Kishan making his intentions clear - fetched a well flighted delivery from outside off and heaved it wide of mid-wicket - the fielder at long-on can't get across in time

Jadeja to Pollard, FOUR, Chahar goes for the catch at deep cover and the ball bounces just in front of him to go away to the fence. That was sliced away powerfully and Chahar came charging in only to find the ball dropping right in front of him
Chahar to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, short ball, Hardik Pandya stays back and pulls it down to deep mid for a four. Was in the gap between deep mid and long-on. MI on a roll post the drop!

Dwayne Bravo to Pollard, FOUR, power, brute power! Full, outside off and slammed between deep cover and deep long-off for a four. Whatta shot!!! Pollard absolutely drilled that. Dwayne Bravo missed the wide yorker not by much

Dwayne Bravo to Pollard, FOUR, and Pollard signs off with a four! An angry Pollard walks off. That 'could have been wide ball' playing on his mind. Was fuller, missed the mark though, and Pollard butchered it between deep cover and long-off. Sped into the fence in a jiffy
Harbhajan to Rohit, FOUR, errs off the final ball - a flat one on the pads, Rohit is quick to pounce on it, shapes up to sweep, and nails it to the backward square leg fence for four

Dwayne Bravo to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, clubbed, nice way to start after the break, length delivery outside off, Kishan leant forward and lifted it high and over mid-on, almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes

Dwayne Bravo to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, nicely played, the loopy slower ball from Bravo, kept dipping onto the left-hander - Kishan was setting himself up for the pull, bends down low with the ball and then sweeps it behind square on the on-side - beat the man in the ring and raced away to the ropes
Boult to Watson, FOUR, fetch that! On a full length outside off, shaping away to an extent and Watson throws the kitchen sink at it. Smacks it over extra cover as he's off the mark with a boundary

Bumrah to Rayudu, FOUR, absolute smash back, tennis forehand. A walk, clearing the front leg and a swat downtown, with Bumrah getting a fingertip as he tries pulling his hand out of the way. Oh and also, a fifty -- and revenge for the 2019 WC is well and truly complete
Bumrah to du Plessis, FOUR, 144.5kph. Slight width, wth Faf backing away to snatch a lot more to slap this with lots of bottom-hand, past Rohit's dive at short cover
Pattinson to Jadeja, FOUR, filthy loose a line. Full, leg-lined and Jadeja just waits for it to get close before whipping it really fine
Pattinson to Jadeja, FOUR, nothing dicey here. Pattinson feeds him a high full toss outside off and Jadeja neatly opens his bat face to carve it backward of point

Krunal Pandya to Sam Curran, FOUR, there's nobody in the deep on the off-side, but Pandya for some reason still wants to bowl a half-tracker with lots of width. Curran won't complain, slicing it over cover, which is all he had to do
Bumrah to du Plessis, FOUR, sealed some more. Another poor delivery, slow, short, wide. Faf has all the time he needs, staying up tall and slicing over cover in the ring with nobody behind
Boult to du Plessis, FOUR, sliced over point. Boult goes round the wicket and dishes out a floaty lazy non-warmed-up delivery that's full, wide and worthy of a dispatch. Yep, over backward

Boult to du Plessis, FOUR, no fuss. Boult overcompensates with one that's short, into the body and gets swiped into deep mid-wicket. Again, no fuss, not even a celebration. Typical dad stuff, you're never happy, and that's exactly what this CSK are

Boult to du Plessis, FOUR, that shall release some nerves in the CSK camp. Pitched on a full length outside off, du Plessis reaches out for it by leaning ahead and creams it through extra cover as the ball races away in no time

Pattinson to Rayudu, FOUR, swinging like the pendulum of a clock already, this innings. Back of a length delivery outside off, width on offer and Rayudu has thumped it through cover-point with authority. No need to run for those
Boult to Rayudu, FOUR, quality shot! Typical Rayudu as he leans forward, converts the length into a slight full one and creams it through the gap on the off side. Looks batting look so effortless
Bumrah to Rayudu, no ball, FOUR, slashed away! Not that short, neither too full. Sets up for Rayudu who makes use of the slight width and flashes it over point. No ball. Free hit coming!

Rahul Chahar to du Plessis, FOUR, fantastic Faf! All about timing, this shot. Shimmies down the track and although the ball sticks into the surface - the class of du Plessis takes over. Goes inside out with a checked lofted drive and manages to beat Surya at long-off
Rahul Chahar to Rayudu, FOUR, not a great effort by Bumrah at short fine leg, he should have stopped this. Was down the leg side as Rayudu swept it past the man at short fine leg

Rahul Chahar to Rayudu, FOUR, back-to-back sloppy efforts. A tossed up delivery outside off and Rayudu chips it to deep cover where Boult makes a mess of it. Was charging in to avoid the batsmen from taking the second, and ends up gifting them a boundary. Rohit Sharma wouldn't be a happy skipper with those two boundaries..

Chahar to Rohit, FOUR, there is swing alright, but it's an absolute loosener. Sitting up from a back of a length outside off, gets whacked through covers. Rohit is underway in IPL 2020. Stood there in the crease and nonchalantly drove it on the back foot
Chahar to de Kock, FOUR, been a rusty start from Chahar, who now doles out a half-volley on the pads of de Kock. Gleefully flicked through midwicket, the timing is superb

Sam Curran to Rohit, FOUR, plenty of width outside off, the hard part for Rohit is to stretch out to meet it. So it's commendable that his timing is still so great as he smears it through backward point

Ngidi to Saurabh Tiwary, FOUR, shortish and Tiwary has pulled. This is a seriously good cameo from Tiwary. Came in at the fall of two big wickets, but kept the shots coming. This one's pulled over mid-wicket

Ngidi to Saurabh Tiwary, FOUR, oh Lungi! He's the old fit self that he is. The rhythm isn't there, the strides aren't intense. Full delivery, Tiwary charges and slaps wide of mid-off. Can't be bowling full with mid-off in
Sam Curran to Pattinson, FOUR, Pattinson powers this down the ground, no long-off so it runs off to the boundary. Sam Curran overpitched this one and got punished
Sam Curran to Pollard, FOUR, this is really poor bowling! Low full toss down leg, Pollard flicks, fine leg in, it's a sin to bowl there. Pollard calmly glances knowing the field and collects four

Ngidi to Pattinson, FOUR, oh Chahar! Dhoni won't be happy with that effort. Short of a length delivery on the stumps, Pattinson pullls through mid-wicket, what should have been maximum two is now four because Chahar didn't bend enough. The eternal fast bowler's problem! I know!
Chahar to de Kock, FOUR, slower ball at 119kph, sits up for de Kock from the middle of the pitch as he heaves through midwicket. Chahar's not been great here at the start
Ngidi to de Kock, FOUR, full in the slot for de Kock who pumps it over mid-off. Really taking the bowling on, although the bowling is really ordinary at this stage

Ngidi to de Kock, FOUR, four more for de Kock, although this has come off a perfectly decent delivery. Back of a length at the top of off, and it's been met with disdain from de Kock who clears his front leg and slogs it over mid-on. Almost went all the way
Ngidi to de Kock, FOUR, he's on an absolute roll. Succeeds with the scoop this time, something which he was trying earlier in the over. Walks across, gets a length ball and ramps it over short fine
Jadeja to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, beautiful from Suryakumar as he clears the front leg and lifts this delivery over extra cover. Great timing on it to beat long-off

Sam Curran to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, back of a length, cutting away across off. There should've been no room for Suryakumar here, but he's manufactured it for himself by stepping away. But even from his modified position, the width isn't quite there to free the arms. Still, he's able to scythe this through baclward point. Beats third man's diving effort
Jadeja to Saurabh Tiwary, FOUR, short enough and wide enough, slapped away for four through backward point. MI regaining momentum through these two again

Cottrell to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, edged and four, full and angling across the right-hander, Shaw saw the width and went hard on the drive, gets a thick edge that flies through the vacant slip region - a desperate dive from Sarfaraz near the third man rope, but he can only palm it to the ropes

Ravi Bishnoi to Pant, FOUR, 89.3kph, the googly spinning away across the left-hander outside off. Pant swings hard, balance out of sync and elicits a thick outside edge which flies through the vacant slip region. Bishnoi has his hands on his head.. lucky Pant

Ravi Bishnoi to Pant, FOUR, Pant gets into the act now. Bishnoi pitches it teasingly just outside off, Pant bends low and goes for a cross-batted down-town swing. Picks the gap at long-on and it's a boundary..

Jordan to Stoinis, FOUR, uff! How did Stoinis manage to get some bat on this? A fast low full toss, Stoinis gives everything at it and it brushes the inside edge, beats the man at short fine leg. Had he missed it, he would've caught plumb in front. KXIP knew how close it was.. sigh!

Cottrell to Stoinis, FOUR, bullied past mid-off. Stoinis is the designated finisher for DC and he's playing a gem here. Takes toll of this overpitched delivery outside off and places it perfectly in the gap

Cottrell to Stoinis, FOUR, back-to-back fours for Stoinis. This is a well-calculated shot. Just got inside the line of this slower ball and helped it over short fine leg's head disdainfully. Fantastic start to the 19th over for Delhi

Cottrell to Stoinis, FOUR, third boundary of the over and KL Rahul immediately walks up to have a chat with the bowler. A juicy low full toss outside off, Stoinis with fast hands hammers it powerfully square on the off-side and threads the gap

Jordan to Stoinis, FOUR, edged and four. DC and Stoinis won't mind how the runs come at this stage. Shortish outside off, Stoinis goes for the cut with horizontal bat and gets an outside edge which travels in a jiffy to the third man fence

Jordan to Stoinis, FOUR, four more to Stoinis! Jordan trusts his instincts and tries the yorker, misses it by a few inches and Stoinis, in this form, won't miss out. Whips it off his pads behind square and collects another boundary
Jordan to Stoinis, FOUR, hat-trick of fours here. Raining boundaries. Jordan shifts his line outside off, Stoinis with a bent knee reaches out and drills it over extra cover

Shami to Hetmyer, FOUR, cracking shot, too short from Shami, Hetmyer swivels across, doesn't bother to keep it down and pulls it over square leg, one bounce and over the ropes - a shot of real authority
Jordan to Pant, FOUR, short, wide and four, width on offer and Pant is all over it like a rash - gets on top of the bounce and clatters it square past backward point for a boundary

Gowtham to Pant, FOUR, this was coming - Pant can't be kept quiet any longer, bends down low and plays a pick-up sweep over backward square leg, almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes

Nortje to Agarwal, leg byes, FOUR, pace can be your ally sometimes and it can be your enemy too! Nortje bowls it at 146ks but spills it down leg and Agarwal manages to get some thingh pad as he misses the flick. Races away...
Nortje to Agarwal, FOUR, 142.9km/h, short and marginally wide, Agarwal can just hang back and carves that away to the deep backward point fence for four!
Nortje to Agarwal, FOUR, back of a length ball that skids a little lower than true, and Agarwal opens the face to steer it away to third man for four! A composed shot!
Mohit Sharma to Gowtham, FOUR, is this the over? Just a glimmer of width on that short one, and Gowtham hops, slaps it away through the gap to deep extra cover for four! Incredible shot!
Nortje to Agarwal, FOUR, backs away and clubs this one cross-batted to the long-off boundary for four! Good start for Agarwal here...

Nortje to Agarwal, FOUR, 110.4km/h slower one on a length with a bit of width, Agarwal waits on it and unleashes the wrists - runs his hands through the slap through sweeper cover for four as Axar fails to cut it off with a dive...
Rabada to Agarwal, FOUR, misses the length by a mere few inches, Agarwal gets under it and slams this straight down the ground for four! Incredible!

Rabada to Agarwal, FOUR, it's all happening for the Kings XI Punjab, a miscue, a steepling top-edge and Iyer off all people has made a mess of it. Could this be the pivotal moment of the game? Banged in short and Mayank got into a poor position on the pull, was cramped for room and all he managed was a thick leading edge over mid-wicket, went high and down towards the rope. Iyer came running across from the deep, did all the hard yards, got both hands and let it burst through - to add insult to injury, it rolled over the ropes

Stoinis to Agarwal, FOUR, scores level! This is his night! Backs away and picks this up from leg-stump, opens the face and flays this between perfectly through the gap in the extra cover region for four! A dive at the boundary, but that won't save the boundary...
Nortje to Rahul, FOUR, 141ks garnered with a hint of width, Rahul feasts on it with a smacking cut past the diving left hand of backward point
Nortje to Rahul, FOUR, 145ks short and moving away, Rahul opens the bat slightly and guides it to the left of Rabada at third man who half-stops, but eventually lets it sneak through his palms

Rabada to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, edged and it flies between keeper and slip! Sarfaraz pokes at this pacy good length delivery and the edge flies past the diving right hand of Pant. The slip was a little late to dive to his left, but its well past him before he could react
Stoinis to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, lack of pace but it's a half-volley outside off! Sarfaraz leans onto the front foot and spanks the drive wide of the sliding fielder (to his left) at mid-off

Sandeep Sharma to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, first signs of audacity. Keep them coming young man! Sandeep bowls the away swinger but it's a half tracker, Padikkal confidently chipped down the track and pulled over wide mid-on

Sandeep Sharma to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, with Bhuvi maintaining pressure, it's important Sandeep Sharma backs up but he's spraying the ball around looking for that perfect outswinger starting outside leg and ending off stump, this leg-side freebie flicked wide of short fine leg for four
T Natarajan to de Villiers, FOUR, 137.9kph, dishes out pace, dishes out width, dishes out room with that over the wicket angle. AB slices over sweeper, something he could've done in his sleep
Bhuvneshwar to de Villiers, FOUR, bang in the slog, at pace .. and AB's already crouches under as he waits and smokes this over cow corner
T Natarajan to de Villiers, FOUR, 122.5kph, swings through the line, clearing his front leg, plonking in front and then slamming it straight down. Sure, it was in the slot, but still, murderous ..
Bhuvneshwar to de Villiers, FOUR, wow. Just murder. Just AB things. Plonks in front, gives his arms the room to swing and then tonks this straight down, nearly all the way

Bhuvneshwar to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, horrible wide delivery, the freebies will come with time. Padikkal had to really reach out, all he did was just put bat on ball and find the middle, slapped wide of cover and it teases the fielders
T Natarajan to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, stylish swivel pull, more towards finding the gap wide of deep square leg. Shortish and on the leg stump, Padikkal creams that nicely again

T Natarajan to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, the overcorrection. Too full, in the slot and Padikkal is a high quality batsman who won't miss out on those. Natarajan went for swing but it didn't and he went to the deep cover boundary on the bounce
T Natarajan to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, he's a tall bloke and he's managing to pull not really short deliveries quite easily. Short of a length, Padikkal stays in the crease and lofts over mid-wicket

Mitchell Marsh to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, what's the point of bowl a full ball in the slot with a new ball if you are not a swing bowler? This just came so slowly, Padikkal said thank you very much and smoked it over the bowler's head. Oh RCB are loving this!
Rashid Khan to Finch, FOUR, too short and Finch did well to get under that and thump it over the leaping fielder at mid-wicket to take pressure off after those dots

Abhishek Sharma to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, in the airrrr, oh he's misjudged the catch. Rashid Khan, a fine fielder, the culprit there. But Padikkal deserves this bit of luck. Fifty on debut. What a start. Can't imagine Kohli's emotions right now. He would be really excited. Flighted delivery on the stumps, the slog-sweep behind square, Rashid attacked the bat as it was hit flat, but he realised it was going over, so put the brakes and tried to go back but slipped and the outstretched arm wasn't long enough. Kohli stands and applauds as Padikkal raises the bat

Steyn to Warner, FOUR, smokes this half-volley through extra cover to get the chase up and running. No great footwork, there didn't need to be as the hands are good enough for a delivery right in the slot
U Yadav to Bairstow, FOUR, this is filth. Juicy half-volley on the pads, flicked away past fine leg

Chahal to Bairstow, byes, FOUR, looked like the googly and Bairstow threw everything at it. Loses shape and fails to make contact, the ball sneaks past the inside edge and races past the keeper in a hurry

U Yadav to Bairstow, FOUR, that's brute power from Jonny Bairstow! Just stands tall and murders the short ball with a flat pull over mid-wicket, the fielder in the deep tries to dive but couldn't get anything on it

U Yadav to Bairstow, FOUR. DO NOT BOWL FULL TO Jonny Bairstow. NEVER! He just eases into the drive so casually and all he needed to do was pierce the gap which he did with supreme perfection, past the diving left hand of extra cover and the pace on the ball takes care of the rest
Steyn to Bairstow, FOUR, superb batting this from Bairstow! Waits for the full delivery to land and just opens the bat face at the last instant to send it between the keeper and short third. Deft!

Steyn to Priyam Garg, FOUR, short and there's just enough pace for Priyam Garg who belts the pull and the best part about this shot is: He made sure he picked the gap to perfection, right between deep square and deep mid-wicket

Chahal to Abhishek Sharma, FOUR, nice shot from Abhishek Sharma! Targets straight boundary and hits it with a neat lofty drive down the ground, picked the full delivery around off and lifted it with ease. That is a really crucial boundary. Kohli talking to Chahal about that ball, looks like he's telling Chahal that he should've been defensive. Because these are two young players at the crease, may find it difficult against Steyn. Four vital runs given away. Credit to Sharma for smoking it

Shivam Dube to Rashid Khan, FOUR, easy pickings for Rashid Khan! Gets plenty of width outside off and Rashid Khan throws the kitchen sink to smash the boundary ropes wide of the fielder at square third man

Steyn to Sandeep Sharma, FOUR, 141ks short and wide of off, Sandeep Sharma exposes his stumps and throws everything at it, gets a massive outside edge and it races down to the third man boundary in a jiffy
Steyn to Manish Pandey, FOUR, just a little full from Steyn, and Pandey has sussed out that there's little swing here. So he's not afraid to hit through the line as he lofts it over mid-on
U Yadav to Manish Pandey, FOUR, Umesh's struggles continue. Strays onto the pads and Pandey flicks it for four through midwicket. Timing is delightful with the ball racing away

U Yadav to Manish Pandey, FOUR, oh dear! The confidence is just not there. And with each delivery it gets worse. Low full toss on leg, Pandey helps himself to another boundary as he flicks past short fine

Navdeep Saini to Bairstow, FOUR, that's a Bairstow special. The short-arm pull.. the way he just picks length quickly and whips it so effortlessly with superb timing. Flies away over square leg. Don't think Saini did too much wrong here. Just slightly short maybe, but we're talking inches here

U Yadav to Bairstow, FOUR, when it's not going your way, these things also tend to happen. Full ball just outside off, Bairstow aims for the covers as he drives but it comes off a thick inside edge and runs past leg stump. Kohli applauds his bowler with a wry smile
Shreyas Gopal to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, flat one on the stumps, whip-driven straight down the ground for four. Finally, some runs in boundaries...
Shreyas Gopal to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, the shackles are showing signs of coming lose - reaches out and slices this marginally wide one square of the wicket for four...

Shreyas Gopal to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, a hat-trick of boundaries! Backs away into the on-side, and flays this inside out over the in-field to the deep extra cover boundary for four! CSK needed this - the activation energy for something exothermic to begin
Jofra Archer to du Plessis, FOUR, another slower one, leg-cutter, like Tendulkar predicted in his tweet, and Faf backs away to slap it away through the gap at to extra cover for four
Unadkat to Vijay, FOUR, there's the first boundary of the innings. Length ball on leg, Vijay whips it away fine enough to beat fine leg
Unadkat to Vijay, FOUR, Unadkat shifts his line over to off stump where Vijay is waiting after clearing his front leg. Just sets up brilliantly to smoke this flat-batted over mid-off

Shreyas Gopal to Vijay, FOUR, beats square leg this time. This was dragged down short on leg stump and Vijay had ample time as he rocked back for the pull. Didn't time it all that well, but well enough
Tom Curran to Watson, FOUR, there's four more. Back of a length outside off, Watson's aware that third man is in and he uses the pace to dab it past the fielder
Shreyas Gopal to Sam Curran, FOUR, it's short once more from Gopal and Curran shows how it's done. Belts the pull away over midwicket

Ngidi to Smith, FOUR, cheeky and four, Smith at his best, moved all around the crease - Ngidi saw it coming and went wide of off, but Smith still reaches out and then paddles it over short fine - think, only AB could have rivalled him for that shot
Ngidi to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, cracking shot, the shots are coming off today for the Royals, friendly length ball wide of off, Tewatia drives it on the up and over cover - no need to run for those

Sam Curran to Riyan Parag, FOUR, streaky and four, wide full-toss from Curran, Parag was shaping for the drive, opened the face of the bat and the edge flies behind square on the off-side for a boundary

Sam Curran to Tom Curran, FOUR, streaky and four, Tom must have faced Sam many a times at home - almost the perfect yorker, right at the base of off, Curran somehow jams his bat down and squeezes it past the diving short third man fielder for a boundary

Ngidi to Jofra Archer, no ball, SIX, four sixes on the trot - this is a stunning cameo from Archer - length ball at the stumps, Archer backs away and lifts it high and over long-off.. and the third umpire decides that the front-foot is just over, called as a no-ball

Chahar to Jaiswal, FOUR, first boundary for Jaiswal. Short of length delivery and he did not have much space to free his arms, but manages to pull it over mid-wicket and the fast outfield does the rest

Chahar to Smith, FOUR, another short ball and this time Smith puts it away. No height or venom on this, Smith is quickly into position and nails the pull over mid-wicket, couple of bounces and it races away

Sam Curran to Samson, FOUR, not sure he intended it to go that fine. Short of length with a bit of extra bounce, Samson steers it and the outside edge runs away fine - bisecting Dhoni and short third man

Chahar to Smith, FOUR, poor bowling from Chahar. He has been all over the shop. Straying down leg and that is not where you bowl to Smith, easy pickings for the Royals skipper as he glances it fine past the fielder at 45

Chawla to Smith, FOUR, good batting but poor bowling. Smith expected the fast short ball outside off, waited on it and carved it behind square on the off-side - right between backward point and short third man

Pollard to Morgan, FOUR, off-cutter, but short, wide (aka long hop). Morgan throws his hands out and carves it behind point. The fielder in the deep tries a sliding tackle, but no, UAE is no football fan
Boult to Russell, FOUR, 131.5kph, wide high full toss, full paced. Russell flays, gets it past cover's dive. Well, it doesn't get easier
Boult to Russell, FOUR, attempted: big smoke over extra cover. The result: a big fat outside edge over short third man. Russell and KKR couldn't care any less

Boult to Cummins, FOUR, slaps over mid-off. Well, well. It might be a very miniscule drop in the ocean remaining for Kolkata, but a smoke nevertheless. Backs away, and absolutely thumps this shorter delivery over mid-off
Boult to Shivam Mavi, FOUR, keeps the pull down, staying up on the bounce that doesn't get big and nailing it through square leg. Again, just a drop, one tiny drop ..
Boult to Shubman Gill, FOUR, that's a pie for Gill. Short, width and studded with pace on it outside off. Gill throws his bat and crunches it through the packed off-side field

Boult to Karthik, FOUR, nice, confident beginning for DK. Of course, Boult was generous there; hurling it too full and thereby overpitching it just outside off, Karthik didn't do anything fancy. Just leant forward, kept his head steady and drove it beautifully through extra cover

Pattinson to Karthik, FOUR, glorious shot from Karthik. He's come out with a positive intent. Sees the width, transfers his body weight across and slaps it wonderfully past cover. That just rocketed away to the fence in no time

Pollard to Karthik, FOUR, "Catch" was the cry from Pollard but Karthik has placed it just wide of Bumrah at short third man. Shorter outside off, Karthik went for the cut and flashed hard at it. Outside edge flies quickly and rolls through to the boundary

Rahul Chahar to Karthik, FOUR, Karthik is playing with a lot of freedom today. Floater just outside off, Karthik opens his stance and lofts it inside-out over extra cover. High percentage shot against spin.. brilliant!
Rahul Chahar to Nitish Rana, FOUR, second boundary of the over. Flatter from Chahar, Rana went low and executes the reverse sweep, hitting it over short third man's head
Krunal Pandya to Karthik, FOUR, sliced over point! Rifles it full and wide of off, Karthik reaches out and hits it uppishly in the gap

Krunal Pandya to Nitish Rana, FOUR, okay, KKR's engine has started to rev up. Both batsmen changing gears now. Krunal Pandya keeps bowling it wider, Rana got into a good position and also anticipated it to be on the shorter side. Slapped it ferociously past extra cover and it trickles to the boundary

Warrier to Rohit, FOUR, KKR have bowled a lot of short balls to Rohit today and most of them have disappeared. This was outside off and Rohit had the room to free his arms, slaps it over extra cover and the ball bounces just inside the rope

Cummins to Saurabh Tiwary, FOUR, not a good start. Back of a length angled across the left hander, Tiwary flat-bats without any timing straight past Cummins, with mid-on and mid-off inside the ring the ball races away to the fence

Cummins to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, lovely shot! Slower short of length delivery and Pandya pulls it in front of square, the best thing was he rolled his wrist to keep it in the gap and bisect the two fielders in the deep

Cummins to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, and again.. Cummins became predictable there. Pandya was waiting for the short of length stuff, he strikes this much better than the last one and it almost goes the distance

Shivam Mavi to Rohit, FOUR, well KKR bowlers have to go back to the drawing boards after this game and come up with a different plan to Rohit next time. Because the plan to bowl short hasn't worked today, this was off-pace but it didn't matter to Rohit who smacks it to the right of deep mid-wicket, just short of the boundary rope

Shivam Mavi to Pollard, FOUR, misses the yorker and it is a juicy full toss just below waist, Pollard picked his spot and it is deep mid-wicket. Not the best of connections and hence he picks up only a boundary

Warrier to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, inside edged! Short of a length delivery outside off, seams into the batsman and Suryakumar Yadav gets an inside edge as he flashes hard. Rockets past his stumps and races away to the fine leg fence in no time

Warrier to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, not impressive lines by Warrier. Straying on the pads and Suryakumar Yadav clips it through square leg as the impeccable timing sends the ball to the deep square leg boundary

Warrier to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, off the radar again. Width on offer as he bowls a length delivery. Suryakumar Yadav goes back in his crease and caresses it through the gap at covers for the third boundary of this over. Dealing in boundaries is Surya at the moment

Warrier to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, classic counterattack by Surya. This was a dropped catch at mid-wicket as Narine failed to reverse cup it, parrying it away to the fence. Warrier bowled an overpitched delivery on leg and the right hander flicks it uppishly for the fourth boundary of the over

Narine to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, whipped away! Floated on middle and leg, Suryakumar Yadav is on his front foot to heave this one towards the deep mid-wicket fence. Played that in the air, but more importantly in the gap

Narine to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, 50-run stand up for the second wicket. Short ball by Narine and Suryakumar Yadav lines up for it. Treks back in the crease and pulls it over mid-wicket. Having conceded two boundaries in the over, Narine opts for a deep mid-wicket immediately
Russell to Rohit, FOUR, Russell ain't happy with the fielder at fine leg. Was a short ball and Rohit it pulls it away as he beats the fielder in the deep
U Yadav to Rahul, FOUR, there's the loosener that spoils a good over - fuller length ball on the pads, clipped away to fine leg for four with just a tickle
Steyn to Rahul, FOUR, back of a length, doesn't quite hurry on from the surface, and that's all class from Rahul - opens the face and steers it away to the deep backward point fence for four
Steyn to Rahul, FOUR, slightly short, doesn't exactly rise, but width on offer - chopped off the attempted cut, over backward point and away to the boundary where Umesh Yadav dives in vain

Navdeep Saini to Rahul, leg byes, FOUR, poor delivery to start with. Rahul might not have got any bat on this length delivery down leg, but there is a big deflection off the pad to beat a diving Philippe

Navdeep Saini to Rahul, FOUR, top-edge and it runs away to the fence. Rahul was in no control there. Sharp bouncer around the left shoulder, Rahul was late on the hook and hence the edge, flies right over Philippe. He then practices playing the ramp instead of the hook

Navdeep Saini to Rahul, FOUR, and Saini errs in length. He goes full and Rahul is just too good there, extension of the arms and lofts it over extra cover, the ball has enough to trickle into the fence

Chahal to Rahul, FOUR, poor delivery and Rahul does not miss out. Drifts this leggie too far down leg and it is easy pickings for Rahul, he kneels down and sweeps it fine to the left of short fine leg
Navdeep Saini to Nair, FOUR, neatly done. The dipping slower delivery, Nair moves around in the crease, gets inside the line and crouches a bit to scoop it over short fine leg

Navdeep Saini to Rahul, FOUR, 116.8kph and Rahul is waiting for it. Saini has to mix it up. This one had width as well, Rahul throws his bat at the right time to bisect backward point and short third man

Steyn to Rahul, FOUR, hundred for Rahul. Fine innings from the Kings XI skipper. He has led from the front and has put his team ahead in this tie. Takes off his helmet and soaks in the applause from his team mates and owners. And does the "I don't hear anything" celebration that he does. Full delivery outside off, Rahul throws the kitchen sink and the outside edge flies over short third man

Steyn to Rahul, FOUR, he has had luck and this proves that today is his day. Good length ball around off, Rahul clears his front leg to have a heave to the on-side, the thick inside edge races past the the stumps

Shivam Dube to Nair, FOUR, Nair also gets into the act. Short and lacked venom, Nair gets inside the line and pulls it backward of square, he rolled his wrist to get the placement right and there was no stopping that

Shivam Dube to Rahul, FOUR, that's not a bad delivery but a fine shot. Dube spears in the wide yorker outside off, Rahul makes room and opens the bat face to slice the drive behind square on the off-side, no chance for the sweeper to get across
U Yadav to Agarwal, FOUR, this man in a different zone right now - charges down and flays this inside out over extra cover for four
U Yadav to Agarwal, FOUR, into the pads, half-volley, and that's clipped away with ease through deep mid-wicket for four! Nope, ain't no white ball gonna swing in the third over - as KP points out...
Navdeep Saini to Rahul, FOUR, half-volley, a rare one from Saini, and Rahul just has to step out as he crunches it through deep extra cover for four! Stunning shot!

Steyn to Agarwal, FOUR, a 135km/h bouncer from Steyn, but Agarwal has picked it up, rocks back and nails the pull to the deep mid-wicket boundary for four. Not the best timing on that, but he's got it away...
Navdeep Saini to Agarwal, FOUR, that's a terrible full-toss at a gentle 133.1km/h, and Agarwal lays into it, caressing it through the covers for four. Nobody moved...
Chahal to Rahul, FOUR, tossed up but drifting into the dangerous pad-line, and he's thrashed the sweep away to the backward square leg boundary for four

Washington Sundar to Rahul, FOUR, not too short, skidding through very close to the stumps, and that's chopped away off a crouch to the third man fence for four! That's through Dale Steyn at short third man, who's absolutely made a mess of this!
U Yadav to Pooran, FOUR, right in the slot, wide half-volley, and Pooran has just leant into a fabulous drive through the covers. Not even a dive in the infield can cut that off...
U Yadav to Rahul, FOUR, strays on the pads, and that's tickled away to the fine leg boundary for four! Yadav, Yadav, Yadav - you simply cannot do that...

Shami to Washington Sundar, FOUR, nice late guide to this short ball, third man dives to his right and palms it on the bounce as he can't get there. Oh is the right foot touching the rope as he recovered and try to flick it back? Yep, four!
Maxwell to Washington Sundar, FOUR, Washington Sundar flicks through mid-wicket, oh big gap there and Pooran fumbles trying to slide and stop the ball. Maxwell looks away
Murugan Ashwin to Navdeep Saini, FOUR, that's a nice hit over wide long-off, with the spin, off the front foot, decently timed. Oh the lofted inside-out drive is a great feeling!
Shami to Finch, FOUR, slow full toss and lofted over mid-on for the first four of the innings. That was a terrible delivery and Finch took advantage of it
Cottrell to de Villiers, FOUR, some room and de Villiers capitalises on it. Smashes it through the covers for a four. Got the room and pounced on it

Ravi Bishnoi to Finch, FOUR, too short, Finch pulls it down the ground over the mid-off fielder for a four. Shouts of catch were there but it was well away from the fielder. Even long-on tried to cut it off but couldn't
Ravi Bishnoi to de Villiers, FOUR, stays back, de Villiers pulls it behind square. That was once again short and punished by de Villiers

Ravi Bishnoi to de Villiers, FOUR, is it a four? Or has Cottrell managed to push it back into the playing area? Seems to be a four. Went really fine and the man at short fine leg gave it a good chase. ABD shows his deft side as well. He is off to a flier
Murugan Ashwin to Finch, FOUR, sweeps it fine and sweeps it well to get it away for a four. That was well down leg and Finch helped himself to a boundary by placing it to the fine leg fence

Murugan Ashwin to de Villiers, FOUR, floated up outside off and has been spanked past cover for a four. That was hit really hard and the man at deep cover despite trying his best just couldn't stop it
Avesh Khan to du Plessis, FOUR, neat hit that to this short of length delivery. Wristed that behind square at the last minute to pick up the backward square leg gap. No chance for the man at fine leg

Mishra to du Plessis, FOUR, in the airrr, and in the gap! Is this Faf's day? He hasn't timed everything as well as Sharjah or Abu Dhabi! This time he ran down the pitch and had a wild swing at the lofted drive, good from Mishy to push it outside off stump and force Faf to fetch that, leading edge actually and it flew between cover and point. Dhawan didn't cut the angle and was slow to take off, he assmued the man at cover would grab that

Avesh Khan to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, oh that is quite a flick shot off the back foot. Wasn't all that short to be honest, he flicked that off the kneeroll! My word! Somehow generated enough power to beat the deep mid-wicket fielder

Avesh Khan to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, in the airrrr and just over the leaping Nortje at mid-off. Jadhav jumped down the pitch and flat-batted that short of length delivery, hit it flat, Nortje is tall, tried his best there but it escaped.

Rabada to du Plessis, FOUR, that's an audacious pull shot from du Plessis to his countrymen. KG tried the slower delivery but dropped it short, Faf played the, aah let it come pull shot over the infield over mid-wicket

Rabada to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, now deft touch from Kedar, oh that's beaten third man near the fence. Faf was shouting run, run, run.. to Kedar, who was so confident and just jogging. He was right. Third man was wide and he couldn't cut it off. That's one problem of having pace up your sleeve, batsman sometimes use it to their advantage

Avesh Khan to Dhoni, FOUR, low full toss and he's lofted that with such calmness. No real rush to power that ball, just placed it perfectly back over the ump's head and no chance for the men in the deep
Avesh Khan to Dhoni, FOUR, oh no! Not there! Avesh Khan tried to nail the leg stump toe-crusher but bowled a low full toss down leg, Dhoni happily helps it away to fine leg for four
Rabada to Jadeja, FOUR, guided, in the air but in the gap between short third man and backward point. Jadeja used pace on that short of length delivery really well

Axar to Vijay, FOUR, this by no means looked convincing. Vijay backed away to open up the off-side field, Patel fired it within the stumps and Vijay was committed to go for it. Dragged it off the cue-end and hits it uppishly, just manages to clear mid-on and earns a boundary

Avesh Khan to Watson, FOUR, he's welcomed into the attack with a boundary. Went fuller just outside off, Watson goes hard and sort of squirted it off the inner half, miscued it airly and it flies past Rabada's dive at mid-on. No point chasing it as it scurries away to the fence

Nortje to du Plessis, FOUR, not too smart bowling from Nortje. Drifting onto du Plessis's pads, too easy for Faf as he just gets inside the line and tucks it past square leg. The timing is good enough to fetch him a four there

Chahar to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, yup, cover, punch, high-elbows, covers. Typically Shaw. Spots the back of a length early and rocks behind in his crease to not over-hit this crunch, perfectly through the point and extra cover gap
Chahar to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, pitched up this time with a bit of away swing. Shaw leans forward, and stays just as elegant -- drilling this cover drive with a louder crunch

Chawla to Dhawan, FOUR, pressure on the spinners as the openers are in complete control. Boundaries coming from both ends. Dhawan gets to the pitch of this delivery and whacks it over the bowler's head for four runs. Chawla is running out of ideas

Jadeja to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, Delhi have just lost a wicket, but that's not going to affect Shaw. He'll keep playing his shots. This was short and wide outside off, Prithvi goes deep in his crease and cuts it past the man at short third man, four more..

Jadeja to Pant, FOUR, typical Pant. Down on his knee in a flash as he picks the floated delivery to perfection. Enough elevation behind this scoop-like shot, with a lot more power behind. Almost went the distance at fine leg

Chahar to Pant, FOUR, impeccable timing behind this cover drive, and even Faf du Plessis can do nothing about it. Touch fuller outside off and it has been absolutely creamed through the huge gap on the off side

Sam Curran to Pant, FOUR, that was not needed. Dhoni wouldn't be happy with that. Pant had eased this one back to the bowler and Curran has a needless overthrow to give them four bonus runs. Would have been a dot ball, but he threw it down leg and Dhoni had no chance

Chahar to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, not an impressive delivery by Chahar. He has sprayed a full toss on the pads in his quest to attempt the yorker. Easy pickings for Shreyas Iyer was flicks it away to the deep square leg fence. That went flat and for a moment it seemed as if this will go the distance. Alas, it didn't

Hazlewood to Pant, FOUR, misfield by Kedar Jadhav at sweeper cover. This was absolutely smashed through the off side by Pant, but the fielder couldn't stop it in the deep. Dhoni applauds him for the effort though
Hazlewood to Pant, FOUR, and Pant is exactly doing that. On a length around off, Pant picks the length early and chips it over extra cover for a cracking four
Hazlewood to Pant, FOUR, smashed! In the slot outside off and Pant has thumped it right over the bowler's head, can't keep a fielder there, can you?

Hazlewood to Stoinis, FOUR, first-ball four for Stoinis. Shuffles in the crease, moves miles across the crease and drags the short ball from outside off and manages to get it past the man at short fine leg

Hazlewood to Stoinis, leg byes, FOUR, runs for Delhi! Fired outside off on a yorker length and Stoinis once again attempts a similar shot. This one comes off his pads and beats Dhoni as it races away to the boundary. Doesn't matter how these runs come, as long as they do..
Sam Curran to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, 130.1kph, ah, too easy. Leg-lined, leg-cutter and Shaw glances it into the totally empty backward square leg
Sam Curran to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, 120.7kph, goes airy. Curran feeds length, and Shaw goes full-hearted, committing to slicing this easily over mid-off
Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, slashed through the covers .. and Chahar, chasing it from sweeper just doesn't put in the dive, merely sticking his foot out. Oh dear ..
Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, picks the gap behind square, and nails. Opening his bat face and using the sheer pace that Chawla's dishing out all over to get it perfectly out there
Jadeja to Dhawan, FOUR .. and again. Jadeja feeds it in the slog, and Dhawan slog-sweeps, more into cow corner though
Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, top stuff. Chawla gets just that little fuller-than-good, and Shaw goes inside-out, without a lot of feet movement either, lofting it wide of long-off comfortably
Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, googly. But as if Shaw could care less, he's dancing down this time, making room for his arm and inside-outing it once again into that extra cover zone
Jadeja to Dhawan, FOUR, it's his turn to inside-out. Steps away, makes room and lofts one-bounced into extra cover's ropes
Bhuvneshwar to Shubman Gill, FOUR, lovely, not a great ball from Bhuvneshwar, floaty half-volley on the pads, Gill gets inside the line and whips it over square leg, the man in the deep has no chance
Rashid Khan to Shubman Gill, FOUR, breaks the shackles in style! Swung across the line for a four. That was in the arc for Shubman Gill to thwack it through the square leg region

T Natarajan to Shubman Gill, FOUR, short delivery outside off and has been cut away past point for a four. That was delightfully done. Fifty for the young man. Has been an excellent knock! He has played shots all around the ground and more importantly very judiciously
Rashid Khan to Morgan, FOUR, tossed up delivery and has been slog swept! That was floated up and Morgan knelt down to thwack it hard

T Natarajan to Morgan, FOUR, redemption for KKR! And that too without much hullabaloo. That was a full toss and Morgan powered it past the bowler for a four. Struck really hard by the southpaw to bring about their first win of the season!

Bhuvneshwar to Nitish Rana, FOUR, cracking shot, hint of width and those fast hands of Rana does the rest - stands tall and punches it in front of square on the off-side, past the dive at backward point and runs away to the ropes

Bhuvneshwar to Nitish Rana, FOUR, lovely, he's looking in excellent touch, Rana - back of a length and just outside off, not much width on offer, Rana still stands tall and punches it on the up, past the fielder at cover and runs away to the ropes

Khaleel Ahmed to Nitish Rana, FOUR, top-edge and four, no control over this pull from Rana, but he got enough bat to clear Saha and his gloves, banged in short and well wide of off, Rana was clearly late on the shot

Khaleel Ahmed to Nitish Rana, FOUR, sheer timing from Rana, back of a length and on the hips, he gets inside the line and clips it past square leg, the timing is sweet and the ball runs away to the boundary ropes
Khaleel Ahmed to Nitish Rana, FOUR, hat-trick of boundaries, short and wide of off, Rana gets on top of the bounce and cuts it up and over backward point - third man is fine and has no chance
