T Natarajan to Nitish Rana, FOUR, Rana can't do much wrong today, friendly full-toss from Natarajan, he leans forward, presents the full face of the bat and drives it back past the umpire - two fielders gave chase, but the ball beats them to the ropes

Khaleel Ahmed to Shubman Gill, FOUR, short, wide and four, the attempted slower ball from Khaleel, but it all went wrong - sat up to be smacked, Gill backed away and then thrashed it over cover for a boundary

Khaleel Ahmed to Shubman Gill, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries - Gill is batting beautifully, men inside the ring in the off-side and he's opening up that gap with subtle feet movements - backs away to a length ball and then cuts it behind square on the off-side for a boundary
Rashid Khan to Morgan, FOUR, nicely played, Morgan brings out the reverse sweep - bends down low and gets enough bat to clear short third man - was the leg-break and he played with the turn

Chakravarthy to Manish Pandey, FOUR, 101kph, Chakravarthy fires one in the blockhole outside off, Pandey reaches out to squeeze it away with a horizontal blade and gets a faint under edge. The ball goes through the legs of the keeper and runs away to the fence. Chakravarthy has his hands on his head

K Nagarkoti to Manish Pandey, FOUR, Nagarkoti slightly errs with his length and Pandey takes toll of it. Overpitched outside off at 139.5kph, the right-hander stays leg-side of the ball and batters it wide of mid-off. No need to run for those

Cummins to Manish Pandey, FOUR, just wide of mid-off! 135.4kph, shortish ball, Pandey wanted to flat bat it over mid-off. Got it off the top part of the bat and wasn't in control of his shot. Fortunately for him, it beat Narine to his right and the ball raced away to the long-off fence

Russell to W Saha, FOUR, in the air and Nagarkoti has misjudged it! He charged in from third man and over-ran, put in a desperate leap in the end, but the ball was out of his reach. Goes to the fence on the bounce. A leg-stump full toss and Saha got a big leading edge trying to flick it away. Streaky, but SRH won't mind

Shivam Mavi to Nabi, FOUR, slapped! A short of length delivery outside off at 138.1kph, Nabi clears his front leg and muscles the cross-batted shot through the covers. Not a muscle moved. Stand and deliver
Russell to Nabi, FOUR, 134.9kph, full toss on leg from round the wicket, Nabi flicks it away handsomely over square leg for a one-bounce four. Good start to the over for SRH
Narine to Warner, FOUR, muscled past mid-on. Narine dropping it a tad shorter, Warner takes full toll of it. Sits deep, twirls his wrists and places it perfectly in the gap..

Cummins to Warner, FOUR, there was a man at deep square leg but Warner still went for it and timed it properly. Got a hunch that a short ball was coming, quickly hung back and got on top of the bounce. Then employed some power and pulled it exactly where he wanted. To the right of deep square leg and it travels rapidly to the fence

Udana to de Kock, FOUR, in the air and just over. Expensive start for Udana, 14 off the first over. Full and curling away outside off, de Kock is in no control of the drive as he hits it uppishly and manages to get it over the leaping cover-point fielder

Chahal to Pollard, FOUR, chance? Nope, seems to have dropped just in front of Devdutt at long-off. A toe-ended swat from Pollard, dumps it to the left of Devdutt, who bolted to his left and went for the catch. But the ball dipped and unfortunately, he couldn't get his body behind the line as well. Four more to Pollard

Navdeep Saini to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, gotta feel for Saini. This was a yorker just outside off, Kishan waited and waited for it, opened his bat face and just guided it very fine at third man. Talk about placement and timing... wow

Zampa to Pollard, FOUR, that's bullied down the ground at long-off. My god! What power from Pollard. Zampa errs and bowls it in the slot for him. No chance for the fielder there, it just rocketed away to the fence in a jiffy

Udana to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, that's a freebie first up. Short and plenty of width on offer, Kishan tries his best to get on top of the bounce to play the cut, but flays it uppishly past the diving backward point fielder

Udana to Pollard, FOUR, IT's a TIE. The scores are level as Pollard pulls this to the fence at deep mid-wicket. Dug in short, Pollard stayed back and placed it perfectly. SUPER OVER to decide the winner. Elation in both camps. Kohli is relieved for the moment and smiles that they haven't come second. He walks off briskly to push for a Super Over win

Boult to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, that's a freebie for any batsman. Boult gets a bit greedy tries to swing it away from middle and leg, but the ball keeps going with the angle, Padikkal flicks it stylishly backward of square and the new cherry races away to the fence

Pattinson to Finch, FOUR, edged and four, clear intention from Finch, runs down the track, was done in the by slower ball, but he had a free swing at that, gets a fat edge that flies over the lone slip
Krunal Pandya to de Villiers, FOUR, oh that seemed effortless. Short and angling in, de Villiers was cramped on the pull, but lofted that over infield, the timing was good enough to clear long-on
Krunal Pandya to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, they have been trying to bowl wide of off to Padikkal and he smartly targets the cover region with a nice lofted hit, just bounced inside the line

Pollard to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, no pace on this length delivery, but enough width to free the arms. Past backward point and the cut shot heads to the boundary. Second fifty in three games for young Padikkal. The RCB dugout is so happy for him. AB pats him on the helmet
Pollard to de Villiers, FOUR, taking pace off is fine, but you can't bowl down leg with no fine leg. Easily helped away behind square for a boundary

Bumrah to de Villiers, FOUR, if you are bowling full and outside off stump it's got to be really wide. This is right in the slot as Bumrah misses the yorker, de Villiers gets into a great position to loft over cover

Bumrah to de Villiers, FOUR, Jas B isn't nailing those yorkers. Low full toss outside off stump, de Villiers lofts straight down the ground and any batsman need not hit such deliveries hard, just placed over the bowler

Bumrah to Shivam Dube, FOUR, smart, really smart from Dube. Seriously can't understand Bumrah bowling short and angling outside off stump with third man in, Dube just uses the pace offered and guides past the fielder inside

Pattinson to Finch, FOUR, cracking shot, Finch is on a mission - back of a length and well wide of off, he swivels across and pulls it in front of square on the on-side - one bounce and over the ropes
Rahul Chahar to Finch, FOUR, lovely, Chahar was trying to follow Finch as he backed away, but the length is far too short, pulled away with immense power over square leg for a boundary

Rahul Chahar to Finch, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Finch, this is excellent batting, fired short and down leg, he bends down low, uses the pace on the ball and laps it over short fine for a boundary

Rahul Chahar to Finch, FOUR, make it a hat-trick of boundaries - this is poor bowling from Chahar - dropped short and on off-stump, Finch made room and cracked it square on the off-side for yet another boundary

Bumrah to Devdutt Padikkal, leg byes, FOUR, poor line from Bumrah, short and on Padikkal's hips, he was looking to flick and missed, clipped the thigh-pad and beat the diving keeper - brings up the 50 for RCB

Bumrah to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, cracking shot, he isn't afraid of playing his shots - banged in short and at the stumps, Padikkal swivels across and pulls it over square leg, no one in the deep and it's another boundary
Krunal Pandya to Finch, FOUR, nicely played, loopy delivery wide of off, Finch gets a good stride forward and goes inside out over cover, almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes

Rahul Chahar to Finch, FOUR, nicely played, fifty for Finch, his first for RCB - tossed up quicker and sliding down leg, he bends half-way down and sweeps it behind square on the on-side for a boundary

Boult to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, this is smart batting. Looked like the short slower delivery on the leg stump, Padikkal gets inside the line, swivels and helps it away fine knowing fine leg is very square

T Natarajan to Pant, leg byes, FOUR, 135kph, high full toss, and as if that weren't enough, he's dished out a filthy line heading down leg as well. Pant whips, or rather gets a thick chunk of his thigh pad, and it comfortably goes past the keeper
Bhuvneshwar to Stoinis, FOUR, 122.6kph, back of a length, slow, but there's width, generous width. Stoinis stays on his back foot, and cuts away through point, beating third man comfortably

Bhuvneshwar to Pant, FOUR, 120.2kph, whacks it alright. Kumar once again loses his line on the change of pace, keeping it short and wide outside off. Pant - for a change - doesn't commit early, waiting on it to slap it through sweeper
Bhuvneshwar to Rabada, FOUR, 139.5kph, full toss. Rabada slices, has his bat turning in his palms, but still has enough in it to chip it over extra cover, and beat Rashid's sliding dive from sweeper

Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, FOUR, shot of the evening so far! A fuller length delivery that jagged back in a little, Dhawan charged out of his crease, gave himself some room and presented a straight bat in lifting it over the bowler's head. Balance and timing in sync and then he poses for the cameras too

T Natarajan to Dhawan, FOUR, chipped over mid-on. Dances out of his crease without any trace of worry, converts it into a fullish delivery and holds his shape nicely. Hits it through the line and enough wood on it to get it sail over the fielder's head

Khaleel Ahmed to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan knows Iyer is biding his time, so he has to attack. Spots an overpitched delivery outside off, transfers his weight quickly forward and bashes it past cover. It was on the rise but just wide of the fielder and off it trickles away to the boundary
Khaleel Ahmed to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, a junk from Ahmed and Iyer says thanks. Strays on the pads, Iyer gets inside the line and tucks it very fine

T Natarajan to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, quality shot from Iyer. Made that look so easy. Natarajan pitches it up just outside off, Iyer stomps forward and lofts it magnificently over mid-off. He's getting a move on now
Rashid Khan to Dhawan, FOUR, excellent execution of the sweep. Preempted, went down and predicted the bowler to pitch it on leg-stump. Swept it wide of short fine leg and Dhawan earns a boundary

Rabada to Warner, FOUR, nicely played, tad too full and at the stumps, Warner stays deep in the crease and then gets enough power on the lofted on-drive, clears mid-on with ease and bounces away to the ropes
Mishra to Bairstow, FOUR, cracking shot, dropped short and wide of off, Bairstow makes room and clatters the cut behind square on the off-side, no one moved

Axar to Bairstow, FOUR, brilliant placement! There is a long-on in place but Bairstow had got this well wide of that fielder who had no chance to cut it off. Bad ball from Axar though, too short and allowed Bairstow to sit back on the pull. He cleverly picked his spot

Mishra to Williamson, FOUR, chipped over a leaping extra cover! Williamson was a bit in two minds as he played this, almost as an afterthought but did well to clear the infield eventually. Was looped wider outside off, and Williamson didn't really get to the pitch but went through with the stroke. Picked his gap well

Nortje to Williamson, FOUR, terrific placement! Fine leg and deep mid-wicket are the fielders on the leg-side boundary, so KW decides to ping that gap. Shuffles across early and gets inside the line to pull this short delivery that didn't rise as much to trouble Williamson

Nortje to Williamson, FOUR, what a shot! Mid-off up, the length had to be a tad short but Williamson is ready for it. Stands tall and flat-bats this wide of mid-off. Lovely connection and it's raced away. Much-needed momentum for SRH

Stoinis to Williamson, FOUR, Williamson is unleashing himself! Full and outside off, not the slower ball and Williamson is across the stumps in a flash to play his typical pickup stroke. Dhawan at deep backward square leg tried to get across but couldn't

Stoinis to Williamson, FOUR, he is toying around with the field! Makes room this time and although it's a hard length from Stoinis, Williamson biffs it over mid-on. Not a meaty connection but enough to clear the infield. What a gem of a knock this is turning out to be from the Kiwi in his first outing of the season

Nortje to Abdul Samad, FOUR, top-edge but goes to the fence! Another attempted swipe across the line, this is short and pacy, and it's no surprise that young Samad is very late. Slices this way over the keeper and very fine down to third man fence. They all count

Nortje to Warner, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Warner - this was a streaky one though, short of a length and on off, he was hopping across on the pull, gets an inside edge onto the thigh-pad and it rolls away to the third man ropes
Mishra to Warner, FOUR, Warner sets himself up for the reverse sweep, gets a bottom edge and the ball runs fine, past Shaw at short third man and beats his chase to the ropes

Shreyas Gopal to Shubman Gill, FOUR, Archer is disappointed with himself. Overpitched flighted delivery and Gill drills the drive straight down the ground, Archer gets across from long-on and tries to stop it with one hand, the ball does not stick

Jofra Archer to Cummins, FOUR, first boundary conceded by Archer. 121.4kph back of a length delivery, Cummins had the width to work with and he times the pants off this backfoot punch, sweeper was not on the boundary line and he is not able to cut the angle as the ball races away to the fence

Tom Curran to Morgan, FOUR, Morgan is switching gears now. But he is aided by Curran here. Juicy full toss outside off, Morgan moves across and slaps it over extra cover, no chance for the sweeper cover

Rajpoot to K Nagarkoti, FOUR, that's poor planning by Rajpoot. With mid-off inside the ring he dishes out a half volley outside off, Nagarkoti just needs to clear the infield and he does that quite comfortably, well over Smith and the ball races away to the fence

Rajpoot to Narine, FOUR, four runs! Will he make them pay for that dropped catch? A back of length delivery by Rajpoot and Narine heaves it through mid-wicket as the fielder in the deep fails to stop it even after his dive, parrying it away to the boundary

Rajpoot to Shubman Gill, FOUR, short and punished! I mean it wasn't all that short, but Shubman Gill is quick to pick the length. Treks back in the crease does the opener and slams it through mid-wicket, that's four more! Rajpoot proving to be slightly expensive

Unadkat to Narine, FOUR, each and every run will hurt Uthappa. A short of a length delivery around off, Narine reaches out for it and punches it through covers as he beats the fielder's dive inside the ring

Tom Curran to Nitish Rana, FOUR, finally Nitish Rana gets off the mark. Was waiting for a loose delivery and he has latched onto it with both hands. Throws the kitchen sink at this short and wide ball and cuts it over backward point as the fielder in the deep couldn't do nothing about it

Shreyas Gopal to Shubman Gill, FOUR, a half-tracker by Shreyas Gopal and it has spoiled the over for him. Was proving to be quite economical till then. Gill rocks back in his crease and hammers the pull as it beats the sprinter at deep mid-wicket. Bowled well against Rana, but not so well against Gill
Shreyas Gopal to Shubman Gill, FOUR, such an artist! This was darted around middle and leg, Shubman Gill waits for it to arrive and heaves it into the huge gap at deep mid-wicket

Shreyas Gopal to Shubman Gill, FOUR, smashed down the ground! Shubman Gill into his 40s as he makes sure to make the bowler pay for pitching this one up. Played it straight as an arrow as the fielder at long-on couldn't get there
Rahul Tewatia to Nitish Rana, FOUR, Samson dives at deep point, but this kept curving away from him. Was a short ball again and Nitish Rana's square-cut fetched him four runs

Shreyas Gopal to Shubman Gill, FOUR, Archer is disappointed with himself. Overpitched flighted delivery and Gill drills the drive straight down the ground, Archer gets across from long-on and tries to stop it with one hand, the ball does not stick

Jofra Archer to Cummins, FOUR, first boundary conceded by Archer. 121.4kph back of a length delivery, Cummins had the width to work with and he times the pants off this backfoot punch, sweeper was not on the boundary line and he is not able to cut the angle as the ball races away to the fence

Tom Curran to Morgan, FOUR, Morgan is switching gears now. But he is aided by Curran here. Juicy full toss outside off, Morgan moves across and slaps it over extra cover, no chance for the sweeper cover

Rajpoot to K Nagarkoti, FOUR, that's poor planning by Rajpoot. With mid-off inside the ring he dishes out a half volley outside off, Nagarkoti just needs to clear the infield and he does that quite comfortably, well over Smith and the ball races away to the fence

Rajpoot to Narine, FOUR, four runs! Will he make them pay for that dropped catch? A back of length delivery by Rajpoot and Narine heaves it through mid-wicket as the fielder in the deep fails to stop it even after his dive, parrying it away to the boundary

Rajpoot to Shubman Gill, FOUR, short and punished! I mean it wasn't all that short, but Shubman Gill is quick to pick the length. Treks back in the crease does the opener and slams it through mid-wicket, that's four more! Rajpoot proving to be slightly expensive

Unadkat to Narine, FOUR, each and every run will hurt Uthappa. A short of a length delivery around off, Narine reaches out for it and punches it through covers as he beats the fielder's dive inside the ring

Tom Curran to Nitish Rana, FOUR, finally Nitish Rana gets off the mark. Was waiting for a loose delivery and he has latched onto it with both hands. Throws the kitchen sink at this short and wide ball and cuts it over backward point as the fielder in the deep couldn't do nothing about it

Shreyas Gopal to Shubman Gill, FOUR, a half-tracker by Shreyas Gopal and it has spoiled the over for him. Was proving to be quite economical till then. Gill rocks back in his crease and hammers the pull as it beats the sprinter at deep mid-wicket. Bowled well against Rana, but not so well against Gill
Shreyas Gopal to Shubman Gill, FOUR, such an artist! This was darted around middle and leg, Shubman Gill waits for it to arrive and heaves it into the huge gap at deep mid-wicket

Shreyas Gopal to Shubman Gill, FOUR, smashed down the ground! Shubman Gill into his 40s as he makes sure to make the bowler pay for pitching this one up. Played it straight as an arrow as the fielder at long-on couldn't get there
Rahul Tewatia to Nitish Rana, FOUR, Samson dives at deep point, but this kept curving away from him. Was a short ball again and Nitish Rana's square-cut fetched him four runs

Boult to Agarwal, FOUR, if the idea was to surprise Agarwal first ball with a short one, it hasn't worked. He's in position quickly, leaning back, hitting the pull over square leg. Did take the eyes off it eventually, but still got it crack off the middle

Boult to Rahul, FOUR, the short ball didn't work against Agarwal.. it almost did against Rahul. Hits him high on the bat as he pulls. No control as it flies to the left of Krunal but he can't get to it at long leg
Pattinson to Agarwal, FOUR, backs away, receives one that is pounded in on short of length and slaps it over cover. Some form these blokes are carrying, and the confidence is on show

Bumrah to Pooran, FOUR, harmless short of length delivery, sits up nicely, Pooran powers off the back foot over mid-wicket. He's keeping them in the game big time. Mumbai will want to hunt him down quickly
Boult to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, now that makes a lot of sense, third man is in, third man Sarfaraz plays the reverse slog and connects really well. Clears the infield and it's a boundary
Boult to Gowtham, FOUR, sliced with one hand, full and outside off stump, pace off, so Gowtham was deceived but he went through with the loft, clears short third man
Bumrah to Gowtham, FOUR, short delivery, Gowtham backs away and guides, gets it fine and over the keeper
Boult to Agarwal, FOUR, proper batting from a proper batsman. Short of length outside off, Agarwal waits long enough on it as he steers the ball fine to beat Hardik at deep backward point
Krunal Pandya to Pooran, FOUR, wide yorker outside off, runs away for four off the outside edge. One of the pitfalls with Krunal firing them in. No chance for short third man
Pattinson to Pooran, FOUR, what a response. Flays this through backward point. And it's not all that short either. But the width is there from Pattinson and Pooran jumps all over it
Shami to Rohit, FOUR, absolute overcook outside off. Sharma leans, drives, and creams it through the covers to help himself past 5000 IPL runs
Shami to Rohit, FOUR, now the back-footed punch, typically Rohit, standing on the bounce, arching behind and nailing this between point and cover

Neesham to Rohit, FOUR, fifty for the Mumbai skipper and he gets there with a boundary. 5000 runs earlier in the day, and now a good fifty-plus innings. Premeditates this one and scoops the full toss towards the fine leg fence. Almost cleared the boundary there
Neesham to Rohit, FOUR, time to roll! Full toss around off and it has been creamed past the diving man at extra cover, no stopping that
Neesham to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, no stopping that! Backs away, manufactures room and whacks the shortish delivery at he manages to beat the fielder at deep extra cover this time around

Neesham to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, Punjab leaking runs towards the closing stages. Their bowlers are running out of ideas. This was slightly wide outside off and Hardik Pandya slams it through deep extra cover for another scintillating boundary. Neesham stands there in disbelief
Shami to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, a short and wide ball with third man inside the ring? Hardik Pandya is not going to miss out on those as he plays an upper cut and finds the fence at square third man

Shami to Pollard, FOUR, that's an edge, but it won't matter. Was a really full ball around off, seaming away from Pollard who goes at it with hard hands. As the ball shapes away from him, it takes an outside edge and runs past the man at short third man
Shami to Pollard, FOUR, slammed! Goes deep in his crease and pulls the short ball to the deep mid-wicket fence with that meaty swing of his
Shami to Pollard, FOUR, 19 runs off the 19th over. A full toss to end the over as Pollard flicks it over square leg. The fielder was inside the ring, hence Polly will get four more
Cottrell to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, perfect cover drill -- big plonk in front, leaning through the line, still head, high elbows and the fullest of bat-faces in bisecting the two men out there
Cottrell to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, and the covers again. It wasn't all that full, and Yadav's going through with what's more a punch this time, and the rest is the same (2.4)

Cottrell to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, carved over cover, which Pooran chases and appears to have pulled back at the boundary. But no, he isn't all that good, for when his fingers are on the ball, his elbow's on the rope
Gowtham to Rohit, FOUR, jumps away, gives himself room and punches against the spin. That's not the fun part. The fun starts when this seeming push ends up splitting mid-off and extra cover. Wow
Gowtham to Rohit, FOUR, there's no point, literally. But Gowtham dishes out width off a shortened length and allows Sharma to go behind and cut it square
Neesham to Rohit, FOUR, leg-cutter. Seams away. Rohit gets squared, and edges it straight to first slip. Well, well. There's no first slip, and third man can't come around either

Ravi Bishnoi to Rohit, FOUR, delicately cut late. Cute. Bishnoi gives it some flight, but then gets it to dip short and wide allowing Sharma a rock behind and a carve between point and short third man

Abdul Samad to Dhoni, FOUR, stand and deliver! A tossed up delivery by Abdul Samad, goes a touch full and Dhoni slams it past the bowler. Abdul Samad hardly had any time to react, but believe me, had he got his hands to it, he could've been seriously injured. It was hit so hard!

T Natarajan to Jadeja, FOUR, and that shall release some pressure! T Natarajan in his quest for the yorker, bowls a low full toss and Jadeja makes full use of it. Times his flick to perfection and manages to find the fence at deep square leg

Rashid Khan to Dhoni, FOUR, and this time he has managed to beat that fielder, has MSD. Was a half-tracker by Rashid Khan and the CSK skipper has timed his pull and placed it into the gap at deep square leg
Bhuvneshwar to Jadeja, FOUR, edged, but safe! Short of a length on leg, Jadeja swings across the line and gets a under-edge that dips in front of Bairstow, beats his dive and finds the fence

Bhuvneshwar to Jadeja, FOUR, 50-run stand up for the fifth wicket! Bhuvneshwar immediately has a change in the field. Goes short and Jadeja makes sure to send it away to the fence. Hooks it over the fielder at short fine leg for four more..

Bhuvneshwar to Jadeja, FOUR, that's a hat-trick of boundaries. Spears a full ball down the leg side and Jadeja has glanced it away to the fine leg fence. Just had to get a faint tickle, which Jaddu managed to pull off..

T Natarajan to Jadeja, FOUR, dropped by Pandey! That was a tough chance, but you can expect Manish to take those. That's the standard he sets in the field. Was a full ball by Natarajan and Jadeja miscued his loft towards deep mid-off where he was put down. The ball was eventually parried away to the fence

Khaleel Ahmed to Dhoni, FOUR, "that's a terrible misfield," reckons Slater on air. Dhoni slogs the length ball towards deep mid-wicket where Samad charges in, takes his eyes off the ball as he tries to grab the ball, and makes complete mess of it..
Abdul Samad to Dhoni, FOUR, and the equation is down to 17 off 4 balls! A tossed up delivery by Abdul Samad and Dhoni has smashed it right past the bowler, it's four more..
T Natarajan to Rayudu, FOUR, Rayudu is up and away, low full-toss and he has whipped it past mid-wicket - the man at deep square leg has no chance - a boundary to break the shackles for CSK

Khaleel Ahmed to du Plessis, FOUR, smashed, CSK need to get going and du Plessis will start playing his shots - came down the track and drilled this short ball wide of cover - Warner gives chase, but he was always coming second best

Khaleel Ahmed to du Plessis, FOUR, cheeky and four, a pre-meditated paddle from du Plessis, got down low, waited on the ball and then scooped it over fine leg's head, the fielder was inside the ring and has no chance

T Natarajan to du Plessis, FOUR, clubbed, excellent use of the feet from du Plessis, waited until the ball left Natarajan's hand, shimmied down the track and then lifted it back over the umpire's head for a boundary

T Natarajan to du Plessis, FOUR, change of tactics from du Plessis - he's going to be the aggressor - came down the track, Natarajan responded by bowling short and wide - du Plessis uses his reach and thwacks it back over the umpire's head for another boundary
Chahar to Manish Pandey, FOUR, edged and four! Full away swinger and draws Manish Pandey into a drive away from the body, Pandey goes hard and the edge goes flying down to the third man fence

Sam Curran to Manish Pandey, FOUR, anything pitched up and Manish Pandey is not gonna let it go scot-free. Maintains solid base and crunches the loft over mid-off, Sam Curran's pace takes care of the rest
Chawla to Warner, FOUR, lovely placement from Warner! Gives himself a bit of room and sits on one knee to pull this short ball in the gap between deep mid-wicket and deep square
Chawla to Abhishek Sharma, FOUR, full and sliding down the leg-side, Abhishek uses the line to broom it fine past the keeper for an easy boundary

Jadeja to Abhishek Sharma, FOUR, nicely played - a little counter-punch from young Abhishek - bends down half-way, uses the pace on the ball and plays the reverse pull, behind square on the off-side for a boundary

Dwayne Bravo to Abhishek Sharma, FOUR, cracking shot, too full and too wide of off from Bravo, almost a half-volley length and Abhishek can get under it on the drive - has enough power to clear mid-off and rolls away to the ropes

SN Thakur to Priyam Garg, FOUR, lovely - Garg is making most of this opportunity to bat time - had a part in the run-out of KW, but that hasn't figured in his plan since - tad too short and he's very quick on the pull, swivels across, rolls his wrists and pulls it over square leg for a boundary

Sam Curran to Priyam Garg, FOUR, beautifully played, a touch of class from Garg - overpitched and well wide of off, he leant into the drive, opened the bat-face at the last moment and sliced the drive behind square on the off-side for a boundary

Sam Curran to Priyam Garg, no ball, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Garg - this is a no-ball for height as well - high full-toss outside off, Garg makes room and lifts it over backward point for a boundary

Sam Curran to Priyam Garg, FOUR, cute, Garg is taking Curran to the cleaners - another proper cricketing shot, back of a length and well wide of off, he waited on it, opened the bat face and ran it behind square on the off-side, third man was inside the ring and has no chance

Chahar to Abhishek Sharma, FOUR, chance and dropped - and it's by RJ of all people - length ball outside off and Sharma swiped it over square leg. RJ ran across to his left, got there with plenty of time, got both hands and then let the ball burst through - to add insult to injury, it dribbled over the ropes
Chahar to Priyam Garg, FOUR, top-edge and four, banged in short and just outside off, Garg was a tad late on the pull, the ball caught the fat top-edge and lobbed over MS for another boundary

Dwayne Bravo to Priyam Garg, FOUR, Garg continues to ooze class - knew that Bravo would be bowling a slower ball, went right across on the paddle sweep and clears backward square leg. MS isn't looking all that impressed
Chahar to Manish Pandey, FOUR, class from Manish Pandey! Sees the outswinger pitch in the fullish zone and shows the full face of the bat to silk a gorgeous straight drive past mid-off. Too good!!
Sam Curran to Manish Pandey, FOUR, Manish Pandey unleashing! Gets a full delivery in his zone and he clubs it straight back over the bowler's head for a delightful-looking boundary
Chahar to Manish Pandey, FOUR, 136ks length ball outside off, Pandey picks it up from wide of off and swats it over Bravo at mid-on, easy pickings for the batsman
SN Thakur to Warner, FOUR, half-volley on off-stump and Warner will not miss out. Unleashes those powerful bottom hand as he chips the loifted drive straight down the ground, straight as an arrow!!

SN Thakur to Williamson, FOUR, just needed one delivery to get his timing right and it's pure class flowing from the bat of Kane Williamson! Gets into superb position as he jumps on this full ball and creams the drive sweetly past the diving left hand of cover

Chawla to Warner, FOUR, a quicker one from Chawla and Warner makes use of the pace to reverse slap it past the diving left hand of Watson at backward point. Got great power behind the shot did the SRH skipper

Jofra Archer to Finch, FOUR, lifts this over the in-field on the off-side. Finch is off the mark with a four. This should ease his nerves a bit. Too short, too wide and Finch will not let this go scot-free. Rides the bounce and makes hay

Unadkat to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, bashed over mid-wicket. The shot of a man in prime form. Not all that short from Unadkat, but Padikkal quickly read the length, camped back and took heavy toll of it

Unadkat to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, deft! 108.7kph, slower ball around off, Padikkal spots it, waits for the ball and opens his bat-face at the last moment to guide it cheekily fine of the man at short third man. Third half-ton in four matches for Devdutt Padikkal! Brilliant
Riyan Parag to Kohli, FOUR, slapped over extra cover! That went like a bullet. Kohli shimmies down the pitch and Parag shortens his length. There's ample width and Kohli flayed it powerfully!

Jofra Archer to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, 142.6kph, short ball from Archer, it was on the stumps. But, Padikkal walks away towards the leg-side which allows his free arms and plays an aerial cut shot over backward point. A one-bounce four and Padikkal made it look so easy

Tom Curran to Kohli, FOUR, wow! A fullish ball at 133.8kph, Kohli shimmies down the pitch, converts it into a half-volley and drives it exquisitely straight of the mid-off fielder. With mid-off inside the circle, it wasn't a great idea to bowl full. Kohli took full toll of it

Tom Curran to Kohli, FOUR, 124.4kph, slow, short and wide. Kohli stands tall and throws his bat at it. Gets a fat top-edge that flies over the short third man fielder. Uthappa did run back and dived but to no avail

Tom Curran to Kohli, FOUR, 16 runs off the over! Kohli is in a hurry to finish this match. Another slower ball, shortish in length, Kohli gets behind the line by shuffling across and pulls it nicely over backward square leg
Tom Curran to de Villiers, FOUR, low full toss, de Villiers crouches a bit and batters it to the right of Jofra at mid-on. Runs away to the fence and RCB win by 8 wickets

Shreyas Gopal to Finch, FOUR, yes, he was right. It's indeed the googly but Gopal errs in length, getting it too short and following the batsman. Finch backed away too far but manages to hack it past square leg
Jofra Archer to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, that's a poor delivery from Archer. Easy pickings for Padikkal. Drifts it on the pads, Padikkal moves across and just helps it fine past the man at 45

Shreyas Gopal to Kohli, FOUR, Kohli's first boundary of IPL 2020! Whodathunk.. He's been having a lean patch and Gopal offered him a freebie. A rank long hop, Kohli had all the time in the world to shift his weight back and pummel it to the deep backward square leg boundary

Tom Curran to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, superb from Padikkal. Doesn't overhit this short ball, just waited for it and lifted his one leg to unleash a short-arm pull past the fielder at short fine leg. Bread and butter for him.. too leg-sidish from Curran, needs to shift his line to outside off
Tom Curran to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, brute force. Nipping away outside off, plenty of room to free his arms and Padikkal seizes.. slapping it over extra cover with enviable timing!

Tom Curran to Kohli, FOUR, that's clumsy from the fielder at extra cover. This should've been stopped. I guess Lomror is the culprit, Smith ain't happy. A fuller length delivery just outside off, Kohli just sublimely drives it crisply and sends it to extra cover where Lomror couldn't get his body in-line and fumbles. It scurries away to the boundary

Rahul Tewatia to Kohli, FOUR, wow! Those magical wrists of Kohli coming into play. Went back upon seeing this darter on leg, just swatted it across the line through square leg and pierces the gap to perfection

Udana to Buttler, FOUR, loose ball and Buttler has put it away. On the pads, shortish and Buttler walks down to tuck it away easily wide of short fine leg who was a bit off the mark too. VK isn't amused with that

Udana to Smith, FOUR, this is poor from Udana. He's getting the slow nature of the deck to assist him but instead of bowling tigher, feeds a boundary ball. Fed on the pads with fine leg up, Smith isn't missing out. Shuffles across and glances it wide of that fielder in the ring

Washington Sundar to Buttler, FOUR, third boundary of the innings and all have been to the same area - fine leg. Quicker one from Sundar, probably put off a bit by Buttler's initial walk down the pitch and it's fed on the pads. Swept away past short fine leg

Zampa to Riyan Parag, FOUR, finally connects one! A tossed up delivery on middle and leg, Riyan Parag waits for it to arrive and powers is past Zampa. Straight as an arrow as this one races away to the fence in double quick time..

Navdeep Saini to Jofra Archer, FOUR, french-cut by Jofra Archer as he swings hard and gets an inside edge on the full toss. The fielder at fine leg was inside the ring, hence this was an easy boundary

Udana to Buttler, FOUR, can't bowl short to Buttler at this pace, Udana! Gonna get punished for sure. This is a harmless half-tracker on leg stump, Buttler sits back and pulls this away through mid-wicket. Didn't middle it all that well, still got it to the fence
Udana to Samson, FOUR, how is that for a start? Gentle half-volley from Udana alright but look at that execution from Samson. Just leans into the drive and caresses the drive wide of mid-off. Class!

Zampa to Uthappa, FOUR, brilliant effort by Gurkeerat at long-on! Raced across to his left and dived full-length but couldn't do much. Seemed like a mishit from Uthappa initially, went hard on the halfvolley from Zampa but did well to go dead straight down the ground. One bounce into the ad hoardings

Navdeep Saini to Lomror, FOUR, this is great awareness from Lomror. Saw mid-off was up and wanted to get this past the fielder. Backed away for the flat-batted stroke and although he didn't get a big chunk of this, still had enough to beat the diving fielder in the circle

Cummins to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, full pitched at the stumps, Shaw - with his high backlift - punches it sweetly over mid-on. With his flourish as it is, if the timing is good, he doesn't need to worry about clearing the infield
Shivam Mavi to Dhawan, FOUR, short ball angling across, Dhawan cuts from underneath it and gets it over short third man
Chakravarthy to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, edged and four. Flighted outside off, Shaw drives and the ball flies off the outside edge, runs away fine and Rana had no chance catching up with it

Chakravarthy to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, and a boundary to finish.. Chakravarthy does not want to pitch it on a length, so he errs on the shorter side, Iyer is waiting for it and flays the cut behind square - bisecting backward point and short third man

Cummins to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, shot! Cummins tries the same full wide delivery to Iyer but ends up conceding the boundary. This was right in the slot for the Delhi skipper, uses his reach and lifts it handsomely over extra cover, one bounce and over the ropes

Shivam Mavi to Pant, FOUR, Cummins was straighter at mid-off but Pant still manage to beat him. Full delivery outside off, Pant swings through the line past Iyer and Cummins had no chance of getting across

Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, oh no! Cummins has made a mess of it. Meanwhile, Iyer reaches his fastest IPL fifty. He has to bat through and ensure his side get the total they need. Full delivery on middle and leg, Iyer flicks it uppishly to wide long-on, the ball lands just in front of Cummins and he ends up overrunning the ball.
Shivam Mavi to Pant, FOUR, smashed! 141.2kph short of length delivery outside off, Pant sets himself up nicely and slaps it hard over extra cover, goes flat and almost all the way

Shivam Mavi to Pant, FOUR, not sure he intended that to go there but he won't mind it. Full delivery around off, Pant aims to drive it through extra cover, but the bat face turns and the ball ends up in front of square on the leg-side - splitting deep mid-wicket and long-on

Cummins to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, oh no! Even good deliveries are going for runs. Sloppy bit of work from Narine. Cummins nails it in the blockhole, Iyer shuffles across and gets his bat down in the nick of time, squeezes it to short fine and Narine ends up diving over the ball. Cummins is not impressed with the effort

Cummins to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, hammered! He is putting on a show here. Keeps moving around in the crease, makes room as the ball is delivered and drives it with his weight on the back leg, pierces the gap between extra cover and mid-off
Russell to Pant, FOUR, that's poor planning. He goes short with square leg and fine leg inside the ring, even the mistimed pull from Pant races away to the fence

Russell to Pant, FOUR, Pant looks at the base of his bat. He knows that it didn't come off the middle. Full toss outside off and Pant swings it away in front of square on the leg-side, wide of the long-on fielder

Chakravarthy to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, first ball has disappeared to the fence. He dragged the length back and Iyer waited for it on the backfoot, muscles the pull in front of square on the leg-side - right between deep mid-wicket and long-on

Cummins to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, Cummins hits 151kph as he pounds it in on short of length, and is pulled over midwicket. Shaw didn't quite get hold of it though. Definitely a little rushed for pace. But enough meat on it
Chakravarthy to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan barely has a followthrough on this cover-drive, but the timing is sublime. Smears it over cover. Chakravarthy went too full there
Chakravarthy to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, Shaw seems like he's picking him. Or maybe it's just premeditated. Backs away to a length ball, it turns away from him and he cuts through cover
Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, driven hard enough to burst through Mavi's hands. Races away to the boundary. It wasn't an obvious drive-ball so to say, but it might as well be over here.
Nortje to Narine, byes, FOUR, 138.7kph, sharp bumper first up, Narine is beaten - courtesy pacy and bounce. He is in no control to pull and misses it comfortably. Fies over the keeper's leap too
Stoinis to Nitish Rana, FOUR, slow, short, sitting up outside off. Rana finally finds a gap, rocking behind and slaps it backward of point
Nortje to Cummins, FOUR, genuinely squared up outside edge -- but Cummins manages to keep some control and drop his wrists to guide it past the keeper
Rabada to Morgan, FOUR, there's no long-off, and Rabada dishes out a full toss, aka, juicy freebie, deservedly sliced over mid-off
Stoinis to R Tripathi, FOUR, one-handed, outside-edge, and third man's inside the ring to be causing problems. Stoinis goes full and wide outside off, but Tripathi throws his bat out, ah, well ..

Rabada to R Tripathi, FOUR, another yorker goes wrong -- this one the other way in the form of a half volley that Tripathi hammers downtown, with mid-off in the circle. This is a joke, an unfunny joke
Stoinis to R Tripathi, FOUR, over point. Tripathi's one-kneed, staying under the low full toss and nailing it over. Now, now
Nortje to Shubman Gill, FOUR, 145kph, full and outside off, Gill lifts it over mid-off. Used the bowler's pace to his advantage. A couple of bounces and into the fence. Good start to the over for KKR

Stoinis to Shubman Gill, FOUR, authoritative shot! Short ball, not much venom, Gill stands tall and pulls it through backward square leg. The man in the deep didn't have much distance to cover, but the ball bulleted away
Harshal Patel to Nitish Rana, FOUR, fuller ball outside off, Rana clears his front leg for a big hoick, gets a fat outside edge that goes fine of short third man and runs away to the third man fence
Harshal Patel to Nitish Rana, FOUR, four more! 118.8kph, slow and full, Rana slightly looks to squeeze it out and gets another outside edge that beats a diving Pant to his left

Ashwin to Nitish Rana, FOUR, 93.7kph, quick, short and wide. Nitish Rana takes heavy toll of it. Treks back in his crease and uses the bowler's pace and width to his advantage, Cut fiercely square of the wicket on the off-side

Rabada to Russell, FOUR, 125.1kph, Rabada resorts to a slower ball from a shortened length. Russell clears his front leg and swings his bat hard to hammer it over vacant straight mid-on. One bounce and into the fence. The long-on fielder didn't even bother to move

S Kaul to de Kock, FOUR, cheeky and four, short of a length and angling across the left-hander, de Kock moves right across, uses the pace on the ball and paddles it fine, past the keeper and runs away to the ropes

Sandeep Sharma to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, Manish hasn't had a great day in the field - fuller length delivery and well wide of off, Hardik sliced the drive wide of cover. Manish got across to his left at long-on and then went one-handed on the stop - can't stop it cleanly and the ball hit the ropes

T Natarajan to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, nicely played, Natarajan missed his yorker by an inch, but that's enough for Hardik - opens the face of the bat and slices the drive over backward point for a boundary
S Kaul to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, Krunal is finishing in some style - low full-toss at the stumps, he gets under it and drilled it back past the bowler, the fielder at long-on has no chance

S Kaul to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, hat-trick of boundaries, low full-toss outside off, Krunal stayed deep inside the crease and scythed the drive wide of extra-cover. no wonder, he looks absolutely chuffed
S Kaul to de Kock, FOUR, poor start from Kaul. First ball and he sprays it down leg, de Kock does not miss out, he clips it backward of square leg and the ball races across the turf

S Kaul to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, there is still a bit of movement. Outswinger outside off and Yadav plays it with the swing, lifts it over the infield on the off-side and almost collects half a dozen, just bounced inside

S Kaul to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, fabulous shot! Kaul is going for plenty here. Should Warner have persisted with Sandeep? This was a back of a length delivery, Yadav stands tall and punches it elegantly through extra cover

S Kaul to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, fourth boundary of the over. Kaul is all over the place. He overcorrects the length and offers a half volley, Yadav drives it straight of mid-on and the timing takes care of the rest

Sandeep Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, Yadav is dealing in boundaries at the moment. All his runs have come in fours. Swinging down leg, Yadav flicks it backward of square and beats the fielder in the deep comfortably

T Natarajan to de Kock, FOUR, no timing on that but it still beats the fielder to the fence. Full delivery and de Kock tries to force it straight down the ground, gets it off the inner half and the ball races past mid-on

S Kaul to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, Kaul is having a horror time. This is the fifth boundary he has conceded in seven balls. A full toss just below the waist, Yadav helps it along the way past short fine

S Kaul to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, make that six fours in ten balls. He is just feeding it right in the slot. Overpitched delivery outside off, Yadav decides to go up and over, lofts it over extra cover with the full face of the bat

Rashid Khan to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, "catch it" shouted Bairstow but it was nowhere close to the fielder. The wrong 'un is leg-lined, Kishan goes down on his knee and nails the sweep over the square leg umpire, no chance for the long leg

Abdul Samad to de Kock, FOUR, de Kock is finally getting into his groove. This was fraction short and he was quick to pick the length, rocks back and pulls it in front of square - bisecting long-on and deep mid-wicket
Pattinson to Bairstow, FOUR, absolutely smashed! Bairstow premeditates the length and charges down the track, holds his shape and nails the pull over mid-wicket. Total nonchalance

Pattinson to Bairstow, FOUR, Pattinson is losing his radar a bit here and probably, confused with his lengths too. Goes very full but it's on the pads, Bairstow gets a tickle on it. More of the inside half and it beats de Kock down the leg-side

Krunal Pandya to Warner, FOUR, Pandya goes for the yorker, misses his length by an inch or two and Warner takes heavy toll of it. The skipper gets under it and lofts it over the bowler's head for a one-bounce four

Boult to Warner, FOUR, 110.8kph, slow, short and wide. Warner backs away and slaps it fiercely over extra cover. Couple of bounces and into the fence. Still a good over for Mumbai as they managed to nip out KW

Bumrah to Abdul Samad, FOUR, four to end the over! 142.7kph, very full and wide of off, Samad shuffles across and superbly slices it over backward point. Pattinson runs to his right in the deep, but puts in a lousy effort to stop that. Bumrah wears a cheeky smile on his face, sure he didn't like it

Boult to Manish Pandey, FOUR, he's getting into the act straightaway. Perhaps a slower ball again from Boult, this is fuller though and Pandey waits for it, before dispatching it straight down the ground
Boult to Manish Pandey, FOUR, probably another slower ball but this is a fraction short and sits up for Pandey who pulls this over mid-wicket. Picks his spot and gets a boundary

Bumrah to Warner, FOUR, first time that Warner has tried to time the ball and he gets rewarded instantly. Short and angling across him, he just uses Bumrah's pace to steer it between short third man and backward point

Bumrah to Warner, FOUR, and again! Much better from Warner, not so from Bumrah. Short again and allows the left-hander to free his arms. Punches this on the up and splits the gap at cover. This should get the SRH skipper going

Bumrah to Manish Pandey, FOUR, how about that for timing? Geez! A fairly good delivery from Bumrah, angles this on a good length and Pandey just pushes it with a straight bat past the bowler. Just a gentle-looking push but it speeds across the turf to the fence in no time. Wow!! Shot of the day?

Pollard to Manish Pandey, FOUR, Hardik puts down a dolly! The catching in this IPL hasn't been good at all. This is another instance of a superb fielder spilling an easy chance. Was short and wide, bowled cleverly by Pollard and Pandey tried to upper-cut it. Doesn't get the distance and Hardik at sweeper overruns the ball. What's worse, it's gone to the fence. He has his sunglasses on so no excuse of the sun in the eyes either

Pattinson to Warner, FOUR, this is excellent batting! Not that bad a ball from Pattinson, on a good length around off stump but Warner backs away early to make room. And then uses the pace to steer it between short third man and backward point
Cottrell to Watson, FOUR, 134.2kph, strays on the hips. Okay, this should help Watson, it better help Watson, with free runs off a fine leg-glance
Cottrell to Watson, FOUR, that's more Watto-like. A big forward plonk, leaning under the length and lofting this punch over mid-on
Jordan to Watson, FOUR, strays on the hip and Watson picks it away wide of short fine leg. Jordan isn't very pleased by the effort. Basically there was no effort
Jordan to Watson, FOUR, oh that's vintage Watson. Reaches fifty by planting his foot down to a length ball and crashing it through extra cover. Comforting sight for the dugout
Ravi Bishnoi to Watson, FOUR, overpitches outside off, Watson muscles the drive wide of long-off. Doing it in a canter
Harpreet Brar to du Plessis, FOUR, Punjab aren't going to turn this around with these deliveries. Short at the stumps, Faf crunches the pull between long-on and midwicket
Ravi Bishnoi to Watson, FOUR, spoils a good over by pitching it too full. It's a blistering drive through extra cover from Watson
Jordan to du Plessis, FOUR, full toss outside off, Faf flays it over point. Now the highest partnership for CSK in IPL
Jordan to du Plessis, FOUR, yorker outside off, runs away fine past short third man. Faf reached out to it and got it right off the toe-end. What a miserable return for Jordan this is turning to be
Shami to du Plessis, FOUR, low full toss outside off, driven through extra cover. The sweeper gives up. It's a 10-wicket hammering
Cottrell to Watson, FOUR, it's in the slot, it's in Watson's arc, and he makes sure he plonks in front and smokes this downtown, and makes sure he makes it look seriously brutal
Harpreet Brar to Watson, FOUR, overpitches. There's no one straight down in the deep, and Watson easily gets under this one to go over, typically
Shami to du Plessis, FOUR, there's an entirely empty deep mid-wicket, so Faf walks across his stumps and tucks this uppishly with a lot of bottom hand into that area. Just timing, checked timing
Jordan to du Plessis, FOUR, neatly ramped. A cutter from Jordan, which Faf's spotted early, shuffling big time and sitting under to scoop it over the keeper
Jordan to du Plessis, FOUR, again, not off the middle, but he's managed enough chunk on this inside-halved-pull between mid-wicket and mid-on
Jordan to du Plessis, FOUR, overcompensates with width this time. Now, now. Faf slices, over and wide of short third man with nobody behind

Jordan to du Plessis, FOUR .. and CSK have officially arrived. 19 off this over, with a forehand smash down the ground. He made room, made sure he was on top of the the in-angling short one and muscled it wide of mid-on. It's Jordan's birthday, and this is the equivalent of birthday bumps ..
Ravi Bishnoi to du Plessis, FOUR, punishes the short ball and pulls hard through square leg. Motoring along is du Plessis
Harpreet Brar to Watson, FOUR, Watson steps across and paddle-scoops this off the stumps. Long chase for Cottrell running across from long leg. Puts in a big dive but to no avail
Harpreet Brar to Watson, FOUR, this won't help. This won't help Punjab at all. Swept straight to Shami at short fine leg, but he doesn't even get a hand on it. Right through the legs.
Harpreet Brar to du Plessis, FOUR, advances down, gets beside the ball, lofts it over extra cover. Lovely batting

Ravi Bishnoi to Watson, FOUR, almost got himself in trouble looking to pull a ball that wasn't very short. It skids through off a length, headed towards middle and leg. But Watson manages to get it off a thick under-edge, which then beats Shami at short fine

Sam Curran to Rahul, FOUR, there's a sweeper cover in place, but he can't do nothing about it. Full and wide outside off and Rahul creams it past the fielder with impeccable timing and incredible placement

Dwayne Bravo to Rahul, FOUR, an edge and that has fetched him a boundary. Was a slower delivery outside off and Rahul got an outside edge on his drive. The fielder at third man tried his best to stop it with a dive, but he couldn't really do it
Jadeja to Pooran, FOUR, slams over extra cover. Shuffles across early, which Jadeja sees and goes wider .. and gets carved over
SN Thakur to Rahul, FOUR, the tap's opened. Thakur tries going wider and fuller, but Rahul still finds a way to get under it and slice over extra cover
SN Thakur to Rahul, FOUR, delicate now -- lining up, opening his bat face and bisecting backward point and short third man. yep, he's officially found his gear box
Dwayne Bravo to Maxwell, FOUR, okay, it's tennis now. Maxwell's already standing in a very-open stance, swatting this short-wide delivery like a forehand smash over mid-off
SN Thakur to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, remember 2015? Yea, it's that Sarfaraz -- sitting down, staying under the low full-paced full toss to discoop it over the keeper

SN Thakur to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, wide yorker, and really nothing wrong with this. There was a deep third man and a backward point as well. But still, Sarfaraz's found a way to angle his bat out and squeeze it extremely fine
Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, lovely cut! Back of a length outside off, width on offer and Rahul plays a fine square cut as the ball races away through the backward point region for four runs

Sam Curran to Agarwal, FOUR, Agarwal is riding his luck. Slightly up outside off, this one seams away from the batsman who flays at it and gets an outside edge that flies over short third man. Fleming's reaction in the balcony depicts how desperate CSK are for a win..

Sam Curran to Rahul, FOUR, just the kind of over Punjab needed to get going. 12 runs off it as Rahul square drives the slightly full ball through point and manages to beat the sprinter in the deep. Rahul knocked over Curran at the other end as his eyes were on the ball. The little guy is on the floor..
Chahar to Agarwal, FOUR, smashed! Full length delivery outside off and Mayank absoutely belts it over covers as he finds the boundary once again. Went flat and almost cleared the boundary on the full
SN Thakur to Agarwal, FOUR, Agarwal welcomes Thakur with a boundary. A front foot pull shot by Agarwal as the bowler goes slightly short. That's the kind of form these openers are in
Dwayne Bravo to Rahul, FOUR, short and punished! Width on offer outside off, Rahul opens the bat face and cuts it past the diving fielder at point. Can see a few Punjab flags in the stands

Udana to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, 123.7kph, harmless short of length ball. Shaw doesn't need second invitations to put it away. The right-hander stands tall, fetches it from outside off and pulls it fiercely in front of square on the leg-side. Off the mark with a boundary

Udana to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, slower ball, full on leg and middle, Shaw picks it and brings his wrists into play. Flicked away through the gap between mid-wicket and mid-on. Second boundary of the over
Udana to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, make that three! Poor stuff from Udana. He shortens his length and strays it on leg, wristily tucked away through backward square leg. 14 runs off the over

Chahal to Pant, FOUR, Pant will take on Chahal even with the long boundaries. Flighted outside off, Pant is down on his knee and launches the slog sweep over mid-wicket, since it is a big side of the ground, the ball bounces inside the rope

Moeen Ali to Stoinis, FOUR, the extra deliveries cost him a boundary. 15 off the over and a much needed one for Delhi. This was also quicker but right in the slot, Stoinis smacks it straight down the ground for a one bounce four

Navdeep Saini to Stoinis, FOUR, Stoinis is on fire here. Remember he is playing against his old franchise. Length delivery and Stoinis swings through the line, not off the middle but goes straight and collects a one bounce four

Navdeep Saini to Stoinis, FOUR, just over the fielder. Saini proving to be expensive today, already gone for 29 in 11 balls. He goes for the wide yorker, Stoinis lines up by going down on his knee, slices it over backward point and just over the fielder

Siraj to Stoinis, FOUR, dipping full delivery around off, Stoinis moves across, waits for the ball to arrive and then drills it hard past extra cover. No chance for the sweeper to get across and stop it

Navdeep Saini to Stoinis, FOUR, Stoinis is picking his gaps for fun here. The full delivery isn't working for him, stays deep in the crease and manages to whip it away to deep mid-wicket, Padikkal has no chance this time

Navdeep Saini to Pant, FOUR, superb, sensible batting. Saini is all over the shop. Slower delivery down leg, Pant moves inside the line and helps it along the way past short fine, no chance for Finch or the fielder getting across from deep square leg

Udana to Pant, FOUR, miscued but it was in the gap. Slower delivery outside off, Pant is through the shot a bit early and ends up slicing it over extra cover, the ball has enough to beat a chasing Finch from long-off

Siraj to Stoinis, FOUR, fifty for Stoinis. That's his second of the season and it has been a brutal innings. Apart from the first ball, it was a decent over from Siraj. He went full and wide outside off, Stoinis moves across and whips it in front of square. The shot was on as fine leg and square leg were inside the ring. He raises his bat and soaks in the applause of his team mates

Navdeep Saini to Dhawan, FOUR, a gift first up from Saini and Dhawan gleefully accepts it. A wide, half-volley outside off at 139.9kph, Dhawan throws his arms and flays the drive through the covers. Sped away to the fence
Chahal to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, that's a freebie from Chahal. A flat leggie at 89.4kph, on the shorter side too. Shaw clears his front leg and slaps it through the covers. Authoritative shot
Chahal to Dhawan, FOUR, Delhi have decided to go after RCB's best bowler. Leg-stump line, Dhawan crouches and slog-sweeps it over backward square leg for a one-bounce four

Washington Sundar to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, Washington Sundar concedes his first boundary of the match. Shaw shuffles and gets low to slog-sweep. Gets a top edge against this leg-stump line ball. Flies over the keeper and runs away very fine to the fence

Siraj to Dhawan, FOUR, that's a hit-me delivery. Siraj shortens his length and there's not much pace or bounce to threaten the batter. Dhawan gets into a strong position and pummels the pull in front of square on the leg-side

Siraj to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, Siraj welcomes Iyer with a gift by doling out a leg-stump half-volley at 140kph. The skipper, who is in great form, gets off the mark with an easy flick off his pads through backward square leg
Nortje to Finch, FOUR, cracking shot by Finch to greet Nortje. Short of a length outside off, Finch reaches out for it and slams it through the gap at cover-point for a boundary
Harshal Patel to Washington Sundar, FOUR, 123.8kph, just a punch. First ball, eh. High elbows, standing up on the length delivery and stroking away through the line, through the covers
Rabada to Washington Sundar, FOUR, 142kph, short, wide and Sundar uses all of it in a jumpy upper-cut, behind point, in front of third man
Rabada to Washington Sundar, FOUR, 141.8kph, pitches it up in the slot .. and Sundar drills it straight down, lofting it over Rabada's head
Nortje to Siraj, FOUR, very low full toss, marginally outside off. But Siraj after backing away manages to stick his bat out and somehow connect to get it really fine past backward point

Harshal Patel to Navdeep Saini, FOUR, boom. With 24 runs needed per ball, Saini's managed one-sixth, but it's a night time one-sixth. Backing away, getting under Patel's full one and swinging downtown

Axar to Kohli, FOUR, he announced his return to form in the previous game, and here's another superb shot. Gets off the mark on the first ball of the innings as he creams the floated delivery through covers with sublime timing

Harshal Patel to Kohli, FOUR, easy pickings for Kohli! This was speared down the leg side by Harshal Patel and the skipper flicks it past the man at short fine leg with nonchalance. 9000 runs in T20 cricket for Kohli, informs Sunny G on air..

Harshal Patel to de Villiers, FOUR, that was in the air for a while, but just eluded the man at mid-off. This delivery was pitched up by Harshal Patel and AB played a gentle chip. Almost got deceived due to the slower one, but luckily he played it with a straight bat to get it past the fielder stationed at mid-off
Nortje to de Villiers, FOUR, short in length around off, de Villiers treks back in his crease and slams it over extra cover for a boundary
Ashwin to Moeen Ali, FOUR, swept away! Down on his knee as he sweeps the loopy delivery past the man at deep square leg for four runs

Rajpoot to de Kock, FOUR, lovely, a friendly half-volley outside off and de Kock is off and running with a boundary, leans into the drive and places it straight of mid-off, the fielder didn't have a chance

Rajpoot to Rohit, FOUR, lovely, poor line and length from Rajpoot, can't offer width with third man inside the ring - Rohit waits on the ball, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and guides it behind square on the off-side for a boundary

Shreyas Gopal to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, fabulous shot! It was the wrong 'un and Suryakumar picked it, he went down on his knee and swept it with the spin backward of square, giving no chance for the fielder in the deep

Shreyas Gopal to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, that's another excellent shot. A inside out loft off the backfoot. This was fraction short and Suryakumar forced it over the cover fielder, he had enough power to beat the sweeper

Tom Curran to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, neatly done! Fifty for Suryakumar. First of the season for him. He has looked good in the last few games but has been run-out in a couple of them. Today he has not thrown it away. Coming to the ball: Slower delivery and Suryakumar waited for it, steered it so well that he bisected Buttler and short third man
Jofra Archer to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, stand and deliver! Mid-off was inside the ring. Archer offers width on the back of a length and Hardik flat-bats it straight past the fielder at mid-off

Jofra Archer to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, good improvisation there from Suryakumar. Mumbai needed a boundary to make it a good over. He moves inside the line, gets under the back of a length delivery and helps it over short fine

Tom Curran to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, full toss outside off and though Hardik didn't get it off the middle, he gets it into the gap - sliced over extra cover and Gopal cannot chase it down. He immediately asks for a drier pair of gloves..

Tom Curran to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, 19 off the over.. That's the big one Mumbai wanted. Curran goes for the slower back of a length stuff, Suryakumar walks across, gets inside the line and laps it over short fine leg

Jofra Archer to Hardik Pandya, no ball, byes, FOUR, oh my! That must have slipped out of Archer's hand. High full toss right at Hardik's head, he does well to duck under it. The ball bounces just in front of Buttler and escapes past him. Archer immediately had his hands up apologetically

Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, that's brilliant cricket. Suryakumar moved across early and Rajpoot followed him with a full toss, but the batsman adjusted and scooped it over short fine, one bounce and over the ropes

Rajpoot to Rohit, FOUR, cracking shot, Rajpoot is proving to be expensive - back of a length and wide of off, Rohit waits on it and then cuts it late, beats the sliding effort of the fielder running across to his left from deep point

Rajpoot to de Kock, FOUR, cheeky and four, change of pace from Rajpoot, the slower ball angling across the left-hander, de Kock shuffles across, gets inside the line and helps it on its way over short fine for another boundary

Jofra Archer to de Kock, FOUR, a big effort from Rajpoot at fine leg, but that would have been the catch of the season had he held it - length ball down leg and de Kock whipped it violently towards fine leg - The ball was travelling and Ankit ran across to his left - put in the dive, but the ball was always going away from him

Tom Curran to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, nicely played, too straight from Curran, Suryakumar shuffles across, gets inside the line and picks the gap wide of mid-on with the on-drive, no need to run for those

Shreyas Gopal to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, beautifully played, the leg-spinner from Shreyas, drifted wide of off, Suryakumar leans forward, opens the face of the bat and lifts it inside out over cover for a boundary
Kartik Tyagi to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, short, wide and four, a bad ball from Tyagi at 133 kmph, Suryakumar had to reach out as he steered the cut over backward point, one bounce and over the ropes

Kartik Tyagi to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, cheeky and four, this was the shot that had him against trouble against RCB, but he's played it well here - short of a length at 137 kmph, some extra bounce and Suryakumar made sure he got on top of it, chops it past the keeper and into the third an ropes

Kartik Tyagi to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, edged and four, three boundaries and three dots in the over - the length was wide once again, Suryakumar threw the kitchen sink on the drive, gets a thick edge that flies through the vacant slip cordon
Boult to Smith, FOUR, what wrists from Smith as he whips this through square leg. Back of a length around off, shovels it with the bottom hand, hurries to the fence
Pollard to Buttler, FOUR, another slower one, and Buttler waits again to let it reach, carting it over the on-side for four! Buttler on fire!
Pattinson to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, full and wide, no feet to go towards it, just gets under it and lifts it away towards long-off for four

Pollard to Tom Curran, FOUR, full and wide, Tom Curran gets under it and slices high towards the cover region, Krunal comes in from wide long-off to dive and cut it off, but he's touching the boundary as he does that - boundary it is...
Pollard to Jofra Archer, FOUR, all kinds of zig-zag, that run-up, a slower, wide length ball, Jofra Archer delays the shot and then just cross-bats a slap to long-off for four
Bumrah to Jofra Archer, FOUR, slams a length ball between mid-wicket and long-on for four! Just mows this away without a care in the world!

Bumrah to Jofra Archer, FOUR, another one that doesn't really have width, a short one, but even though he's cramped for room, he's picked up the length quick enough to hit the middle with the pull and club it away towards long-on for four
Boult to Buttler, FOUR, strays it wide outside off with the angle going across, Buttler slaps it through point
Bumrah to Buttler, FOUR, full on middle, strong wrists from Buttler as he drives past mid-on

Boult to Buttler, FOUR, back of a length delivery across off, Buttler opens the face on it to guide it past Pollard at short third man. If nothing else, it's a good chance for Buttler to play himself into some form. Or is it too early to write them off?
Pattinson to Lomror, FOUR, more conviction in this from Lomror. Short and wide, puts the cut away through cover-point
Chahar to R Tripathi, FOUR, 134.3kph, into the feet again. It's less worse, meaning Tripathi can tickle, and gets it really fine
SN Thakur to Morgan, FOUR, crunched off the middle! Full pitcher in the zone outside off and Morgan just leans into the drive while slotting it in the gap through extra cover, raced away!
Chahar to Tripathi, FOUR, too easy! Drifting down leg on a length and all Tripathi had to do help it on its way, he sits on one knee and scoops it fine of the keeper to his left
Dwayne Bravo to Tripathi, FOUR, a real smash-me outside off. Short and wide of off, Tripathi gets on his tippy toes and flays it with brute power over backward point

SN Thakur to Cummins, FOUR, Pat Cummins would have grown up playing such shots and the length was ideal. Short at 138ks and right in the slot for him, powers the pull and gets it in the gap between long-on and deep mid-wicket

Sam Curran to Karthik, FOUR, dropped! A relatively easy chance by Jadeja's standards. DK muscles the pull and it was hit flat to the right of the fielder at deep mid-wicket, Jaddu got there quickly but the momentum was always taking him to his right and he seemed to have lost the trajectory momentarily as he tried to take it in front of his face. Sneaks through his fingers and travels to the fence
Chahar to Shubman Gill, FOUR, ah, stunning. Chahar looks to bang it in short, but Gill's standing taller, with a lofted pull, over mid-wicket

Chahar to R Tripathi, FOUR, hoicked agriculturally, against the line, and despite the miscue, he's gotten it over the leg-side infield. Thakur chases, slides, flicks it back, and his knee has just brushed the boundary while a finger's still on the ball

Chahar to R Tripathi, FOUR, 130kph, another bouncer gets punished. Chahar clearly doesn't have the pace to trouble, but this delivery's a little higher, but still, the shortness of it allows Tripathi the time to get inside the line, swivel and hook it really fine. It also helps that fine leg's inside the ring
Sam Curran to R Tripathi, FOUR, 127.2kph, on the pads, but instead of just flicking it away, Tripathi makes sure he crouches and makes it more of a sweep off his legs
Sam Curran to R Tripathi, FOUR, overpitched. Tripathi connects with his swing this time, getting under this and lofting this over mid-off. This is how you celebrate promotions ..
SN Thakur to Nitish Rana, FOUR, 140kph .. and Rana flashes hard. Full, wide and a thick outside edge on Rana's slap, but there's no slip, and third man's rather square

Dwayne Bravo to R Tripathi, FOUR, 132.5kph, juicy this. Short, wide, and it's Bravo's birthday, but for some reason, he's the one giving out gifts here. Tripathi thrashes a square cut, over point, and has a fifty. Yea, that's how you seal spots and kill debates
Dwayne Bravo to Narine, FOUR, overcooks it now at full pace. Narine opens his bat face and squeezes this between point and short third
Chahar to R Tripathi, FOUR, 134.3kph, into the feet again. It's less worse, meaning Tripathi can tickle, and gets it really fine
SN Thakur to Morgan, FOUR, crunched off the middle! Full pitcher in the zone outside off and Morgan just leans into the drive while slotting it in the gap through extra cover, raced away!
Chahar to Tripathi, FOUR, too easy! Drifting down leg on a length and all Tripathi had to do help it on its way, he sits on one knee and scoops it fine of the keeper to his left
Dwayne Bravo to Tripathi, FOUR, a real smash-me outside off. Short and wide of off, Tripathi gets on his tippy toes and flays it with brute power over backward point

SN Thakur to Cummins, FOUR, Pat Cummins would have grown up playing such shots and the length was ideal. Short at 138ks and right in the slot for him, powers the pull and gets it in the gap between long-on and deep mid-wicket

Sam Curran to Karthik, FOUR, dropped! A relatively easy chance by Jadeja's standards. DK muscles the pull and it was hit flat to the right of the fielder at deep mid-wicket, Jaddu got there quickly but the momentum was always taking him to his right and he seemed to have lost the trajectory momentarily as he tried to take it in front of his face. Sneaks through his fingers and travels to the fence
Chahar to Shubman Gill, FOUR, ah, stunning. Chahar looks to bang it in short, but Gill's standing taller, with a lofted pull, over mid-wicket

Chahar to R Tripathi, FOUR, hoicked agriculturally, against the line, and despite the miscue, he's gotten it over the leg-side infield. Thakur chases, slides, flicks it back, and his knee has just brushed the boundary while a finger's still on the ball

Chahar to R Tripathi, FOUR, 130kph, another bouncer gets punished. Chahar clearly doesn't have the pace to trouble, but this delivery's a little higher, but still, the shortness of it allows Tripathi the time to get inside the line, swivel and hook it really fine. It also helps that fine leg's inside the ring
Sam Curran to R Tripathi, FOUR, 127.2kph, on the pads, but instead of just flicking it away, Tripathi makes sure he crouches and makes it more of a sweep off his legs
Sam Curran to R Tripathi, FOUR, overpitched. Tripathi connects with his swing this time, getting under this and lofting this over mid-off. This is how you celebrate promotions ..
SN Thakur to Nitish Rana, FOUR, 140kph .. and Rana flashes hard. Full, wide and a thick outside edge on Rana's slap, but there's no slip, and third man's rather square

Dwayne Bravo to R Tripathi, FOUR, 132.5kph, juicy this. Short, wide, and it's Bravo's birthday, but for some reason, he's the one giving out gifts here. Tripathi thrashes a square cut, over point, and has a fifty. Yea, that's how you seal spots and kill debates
Dwayne Bravo to Narine, FOUR, overcooks it now at full pace. Narine opens his bat face and squeezes this between point and short third

Sandeep Sharma to Agarwal, FOUR, that's a lovely shot by Mayank! That's the kind of form he is in. Pitched up outside off and the right hander plays a gentle punch to pierce the field at covers, it's a rollicking boundary and the first one of the night for Punjab
T Natarajan to Pooran, FOUR, that's a gift! All Pooran had to do was get some willow on it. A full toss on the pads at 137.1kph, Pooran flicks it fine of the man at 45. Easily done

Khaleel Ahmed to Pooran, FOUR, falls short of the man in the deep. Off-speed short ball, Pooran swivel-pulls and isn't quite control of his shot. Samad comes in from deep backward square leg and dives forward. The ball bounces in front of him and goes past him for a boundary

Khaleel Ahmed to Pooran, FOUR, superb batting! Nothing much wrong with the ball. A wide-ish yorker at 135.1kph, Pooran opens his bat-face at the last moment to squirt it fine of the man at short third man. Just a hint of width and Pooran used the bowler's pace to his advantage

Sandeep Sharma to Ravi Bishnoi, FOUR, another off-speed ball, full and on the stumps at 123.3kph from wide of the crease. Bishnoi clears his front leg and hoists it over the bowler's head for a one-bounce four

T Natarajan to Simran Singh, FOUR, a helicopter flick by Simran Singh! Overpitched delivery by Natarajan, it's right in the slot and the batsman does a Dhoni there. Flicks it and clears the man at mid-wicket quite comfortably
Khaleel Ahmed to Simran Singh, FOUR, aggression written all over that shot! Pitched up outside off, Simran Singh brings his bat down in a jiffy and lofts it over the leaping man at mid-off
Khaleel Ahmed to Pooran, FOUR, creamed through covers by Pooran! Half-volley to greet the batsman as the southpaw nails his drive through perfection, right into the gap and he's off the mark in style

Abdul Samad to Pooran, FOUR, smashed! Abhishek was at the receiving end a couple of overs back, it's Samad now. Touch fuller outside off, Pooran throws the kitchen sink and bludgeons it past the man at wide long-off, beating his dive near the fence

Cottrell to Warner, FOUR, up and over! Haven't seen Warner be aggressive this early in this season but this shot perhaps shows a change in mindset. Slight fuller from Cottrell and it's lofted straight back over his head. Clean connection and gets the result

Cottrell to Warner, FOUR, educated edge if you want to call it that way but Warner gets another boundary. Hung back to the shorter length with an open bat face. Got it off the outer half, just wide of slip and races away to the third man fence

Mujeeb to Bairstow, FOUR, too full from Mujeeb, infact it ends up as a low full toss and Bairstow drives it elegantly through the covers. Probably looked for that in-swinging delivery but couldn't land it

Maxwell to Bairstow, FOUR, terrific effort from Mandeep. But the ball slips out and rolls into the rope. Flatter and outside off, Bairstow had the width and he slapped it to wide long-off, Mandeep ran across and put in a full length dive, got one hand to it but the ball did not stlick

Shami to Bairstow, FOUR, this time the low full toss gets the treatment. Bairstow made a bit of room so that he could have a free swing of his arms, pumps it straight of mid-off and the ball rockets to the fence

Ravi Bishnoi to Abdul Samad, FOUR, dropped! Pooran has put one down. Samad charges down, gets a bit too close to the flighted delivery and lofts it to long-off, Pooran runs to his left and goes with his hands over his head, never in a position to take it and what's more he allows it to roll into the rope

Arshdeep Singh to Abhishek Sharma, FOUR, banged in halfway down and Arshdeep does not have the pace to trouble the batsman, it sits up nicely for Sharma and he nails the pull in front of square, wide of long-on and though Pooran had just a few yards to cover, he was not able to stop that

Shami to Williamson, FOUR, that's a gift and Williamson is too good a player to miss out. Full toss outside off, Williamson does nothing fancy, just uses the pace on the ball and lofts it over extra cover. It was a safe shot with mid-off inside the ring

Shami to Warner, FOUR, doesn't miss out this time! Short again from Shami, this sits up nicely for Warner who crunches the pull over mid-wicket. Aerial but well over the infield and it races away to the fence

Cottrell to Bairstow, FOUR, poor ball, asking to be hit and Bairstow obliges. Not exactly a half-volley but plenty of width and it's sliced away over cover-point. Intentionally done by Bairstow and picks up a boundary
